title: Not really a public beach.
review: There is a nice walkway adjacent to the beach with very few seats....I don't think the residents wish to encourage visitors to hang around.

title: So so place
review: Don't expect too much from this place! Expensive restaurants. Several stores try to sell tour, excursion, etc.

title: A little Rough
review: You have to find passages to the beach which is not an easy task.

title: Lovely and relaxing
review: No cafe so take your own - was a drinks vendor

title: This is not a beach. It's a paradise.
review: Nature, sea birds, fish, fishermen, pier, what else?

title: Poetry in Pyjamas
review: Visited the botanical garden in the morning and found it v interesting. Lots of plants and trees ...obviously... but also fish and turtles in ponds. Lots of butterflies. Free entry. Came back in the evening for poetry event, Fun place

title: Very beautiful calm beach
review: Easy access o beach. Soft sand, not crowded, friendly people. We were there in February and it was quiet

title: An Immigrant (Cuban & Others) Experience!
review: Go, there are many good things to experience there!

title: Wow
review: We cruised around this Island and was told about all the celebrities that live there.  This place can only be accessed by boat or by helicopter check it out yourself. Great shops and restaurants.

title: Bad service
review: The free trolley service seems to be a great idea but in reality, it does not operate that well. There is a schedule but based on the frequency I can probably reach my destination at that time by walking instead. It also does not seem like they ride completely on schedule because we were waiting at the station at the time when it should have arrived but it did not. About 10 minutes later there was one that just drove past the station and on it it said out of service. That happened to us a couple of times and since we did not spend that many days in Miami we decided to walk or use other kinds of transportations to get where we wanted

title: Great Zoo in Miami
review: After visiting the Everglades, I was so inspired about nature that I decided to spend rest of my day in Miami Zoo. This was a great choice because so many terrific animals in very nice surroundings and good restaurant to eat lunch.

title: Sometimes a little scary and over-crowded...
review: I love the convenience of this being a free means of transportation around the city on its different routes, but some of the characters (by no means not everyone) on here are a little...interesting.  I've also been on the Biscayne route several times where the trolley is so over-crowded that you have no room to move at all.  That's a safety concern I have about it, but thankfully I haven't experienced that too often, as the public buses and ride shares seem to be a more popular way of getting around.

title: Very nice and good organization!!!
review: Great place to see the best art in town. good value for the price plus very god logistic in all Art Basel's vents. Will come back this year again.

title: Great selection of Britto artwork!
review: Didn't realize a place like this existed until I stumbled upon it!  They have a great variety of Britto's works of art.  The employees there are knowledgeable and helpful. If you are a fan of Britto, you want to stop in!

title: Wow
review: We stopped in on our evening walk on Lincoln Road. I love the place. I saw some originals that I would love to buy - just too many digits in the price. But I did buy a small souvenir. You must visit.

title: Love this place!
review: Its a family business which adds that loving home feel to it. The owner Hernan was very kind and made a calligraphy bookmark with my name on. A beautiful souvenir I've kept with me throughout the years. Recently found out they moved and have an office in the Biltmore Hotel where they offer handmade paper invitations, i've yet to visit but am planning to in the weeks to come.

title: Great beach, no lounge chairs to be had.
review: Great beach trail and well maintained. Do bring a towel and your own chair. The beach hotels will not allow you to use or rent a lounge chair. No lifeguards on duty.

title: Fabolous
review: Excellent mall and always big discount! Plenty of stores inside and a big food court! I really recommend it!

title: Really enjoyed it
review: Small museum conveniently located in Miami Beach's Art Deco district. Beautiful building with good collection of furniture and appliances from early 1900's.  The Julius Klinger exhibit with advertising graphics from early 1900's was fantastic.

title: Best day of my life! I met Limbani :)
review: Omega from Sri Lanka!

title: It depends what you want
review: There are tonnes of shops, but it seems to be more like an outlet mall than a 'normal' mall, yet it didn't have the offers/range of an outlet place so we found it a bit confused. I was surprised that there was no Sephora too - but it was foolish of me to assume. Lots of eatery options and shops, but its worth looking up what you'd be interested in. It may not have been for us, but the lady at reception at our hotel said people often visited there for days, so it clearly appeals to many others!

title: Attractive, fun, magical
review: Very cool setup. Lots of nice activities, for both kids and adults alike. Last year was amazing, this year should be double the incredible.

title: Is not as good as a few years ago
review: I prefer Red Dot in MidTown, we bought tickets right there day of show.

title: These people are thieves
review: Do not spend your money with these people.

title: Wow
review: Definitely once in a lifetime experience getting to pet baby lions. Went for the 2hour tour. Got to see some amazing animals closer than any zoo I've been

title: A Must Do!
review: My only recommendation to them would be to keep an eye on the restrooms (hubby said the men's room had no toilet paper or paper towels) and they really should make people use the hand sanitizer before handling the animals so the animals stay safe and healthy.  The bottle of Purell in the gazebo was empty.  Other than that, I have no complaints and enjoyed our visit to the ZWF.  I hope they can keep up their work with the animals and thank them for their efforts and allowing visitors to have such wonderful, hands-on encounters!

title: Julius Klinger is a must-see
review: There is also a very good exhibition of prewar domestic appliances including a 1930s digital clock.

title: Nice beach whether you're staying at a hotel or not
review: There's no food to buy or bathrooms to use on the beach itself that I could see, but you are able to walk into one of the many hotels on Collins and eat in the hotel restaurants, which then would give you access to food and restroom facilities.

title: Cool Stop Off Lincoln
review: Cool stop to make when walking Lincoln. A quick way to view some Miami artwork and escape the outdoor heat. A little bit for everyone in a variety of price ranges.

title: FREE plus WIFI on-board!
review: The Miami trolley is amazing!  First off it's FREE public transport - other cities take note - FREE!  There's FREE WIFI on-board which is very useful.  Also there's a fantastic FREE mobile app, giving you real-time location of the trolleys, plus their routes and schedules.  Parking is expensive in Miami - do away with the expensive & grief and take the trolley, it's fab!

title: Miami bus tour including Little Havana
review: Worth every penny, on time schedules! Polite and friendly staff..seen  highlights of city and had boat tour included...only downfall which was annoying is the staff begging for tips...on the microphone, cheering at every tip deposited in their jar! Not necessary we know we should tip, it may have annoyed people enough ton NOT tip!

title: Might not be leaving the beach for...
review: Surrounded by construction as of February 2018 which detracted from overall ambiance.  Not a very scenic walk to get there.  Free entry a plus.  May not be worth leaving the beach for.

title: Modish market area
review: Realism, modern, fashionable, well time and innovative art. Overall are always good figurative painters, the innovations in and out every square inch. Near by Museum.

title: Charming street!
review: However readers be aware! Just like Ocean Drive , the restaurants are a tourist trap! They will look busy and full of customers but the prices are super high and the food quality is super low!

title: Nice place to find a nice restaurant
review: Crowded at night with a huge variety of nice restaurants. Just walk around and enter a pleasant place or reserve in advance to avoid waiting time!

title: A great way to get from place to place for free
review: There are many metromover stations throughout the downtown Miami area but it still may not be convenient depending on where you are. The good thig is that it's free and quick.

title: Easy
review: One of the best ways to travel in downtown Miami! You avoid traffic, parking fees and overall expenses with this public transportation.

title: Great, free way to get around.
review: Easy to use, free and safe at night. Two different loops make getting around easy. We used it after dinner at Bubba Gumps to get back to hotel at Hampton Suites by Hilton on Brickell.

title: Beautiful Tropical Flowers
review: I like to buy postcards to use in my scrapbooks.  However, I really enjoyed my day there and I left with a lot of great pictures.

title: Lovely Florida attraction!
review: Don’t miss the butterfly garden. Beautiful! It is always relaxing and educational to visit the gardens. My teen loves to photograph the fauna and flora!

title: Beautiful gardens, lovely engaging volunteers
review: I've been to Fairchild Tropical Botanic Garden twice now.  There is always something new to admire.  This is a relaxing oasis.  The butterfly garden is not to be missed.

title: Rare plants, Hummingbirds, and butterflies
review: The Botanic garden was nice. There is a lush shaded rainforest area with water flowing through the area that is relaxing. The butterfly house was amazing, so many beautiful varieties of butterflies everywhere! Also there was an adorable hummingbird in the enclosure. Just through the butterfly garden were some rare and interesting plants. One complaint was that there were people working there on golf carts who drive at a fast pace down walkways occupied by guests, I think I had to move out of the way 3 times.

title: An amazing garden
review: We enjoyed our visit very much, first we took the tour with the trolley and the guide who was very knowledgeable and then we walked around. We stayed there for over 4 hours. We had lunch at the health café were the food was healthy and tasty and good and reasonably priced. We recommend it to all nature lovers. Butterflies pavilion is great too. Parking is free. Entrance is $18 for senior and $25 regulars

title: Fast and Free way to get around Downtown Miami/Brickell
review: The Metromover is convenient, fast and free, and I never seem to wait more than 5 minutes (9 am to 8 pm is my usual experience).  All of the stations I've been to have either escalators or an elevator or both.  A few of the elevators smell of urine at times so caution when entering (stairs/escalators avoid this!!!)

title: Free and easy
review: First time user, return trip. Worked perfectly. Never waited more than a few minutes. Bit crowded, but for a few stops, what the heck. And it's free.

title: Shop till you drop!
review: Here you can find almost anything you want that a mall can offer.  You can also have dessert and coffee. You can dine or entertain your children. It is a nice place to have an outing as a family.

title: Every store you could ever want
review: We did not have much time to spend here before our flight out but this is a great mall. Every store you could ever want with what looks to be great resturants as well. This place is huge. There are also some outlet stores as well. Great way to spend a rainy day or if you love to shop this is the place to be.

title: Shopping
review: Excellent location to buy good merchandise at very reasonable prices. And a large variety of places to eat.

title: Shopping
review: A good place to go shopping not too expensive in some everything in here is a good quality a known trade marks

title: Awesome experience
review: I've never been to such a big mall so I only covered 75% of the ground floor as I only had four hours. Wonderful options. Didn't know that there were so many Spanish speaking persons living in Miami. Most of the store personnel were Spanish speaking....that was awesome! I would definitely visit again to cover the rest of the mall.

title: Party of 12
review: We ate at Tapas and Tintos twice! Very friendly staff. Fun people. The Seafood and Meat Paella!!! Oh and the Sangria!

title: Nice for dining
review: It´s a nice change from the noise on busier streets like Lincoln Rd. or Ocean dr., this pedestrian street full of restaurants is a good alternative if you don´t want to listen to the traffic. Some recepcionists are a bit annoying whilst trying to convince you to choose theire place, and prices are maybe a bit high but i recommend it anyway.

title: Great place for dinner
review: Española Way is a small street with quite some lovely and good restaurants. It looks very nice in the evenings with all the lights and the music, and the few restaurants I have been at served great food!

title: High level shopping
review: Love the shops around this place, if you have the chance to be there on friday night, you will be so lucky to have great live music.  The food? try Estefan Kitchen, love it

title: Nice High-End Shopping Experience
review: If you are looking for beautiful merchandise, this is the place to be.  Everything is available from clothing to art to lighting, flooring and furniture.

title: Miami Design District
review: //Mats Samaras, Stockholm, Sweden

title: Great Find!
review: Found this District by accident and fell in love with it. Great shops and places to eat. Great afternoon walk around.

title: Loved it!
review: I went there on a Saturday afternoon and I was so glad I did. Took a little while to find since there is construction going on but you just look at a map or ask people. Again by bus, bus drivers if English speaking are helpful! Park is beautiful, Koi -fishes- ponds, plants and a very sweet man in the gift shop. Overall I loved it!

title: A GEM in a small space - and FREE
review: Wonderful short break into an informative oasis with friendly staff.  Perfect for a short, calming, break from everything else in South Beach. While you do hear construction noise in the background it does not drown out the sounds of nature that call the gardens home.  The staff that mingle around a helpful, as is the free audio tour you can take by calling on your cell, the number listed on each info plaque.  There is a ton of great seating throughout the garden to sit and enjoy the space.  Our only regret is that we didn't bring good books to stay a while longer in this peaceful oasis.  The garden is well designed, fitting in a huge number of different plant examples and creating many different gardens that feel separate but flow flawlessly together.

title: Spoilt by noisy construction work
review: Garden is quite small, but well laid out and tended. Lots of interesting plants and beautiful butterflies . Unfortunately there is a major construction of the massive new convention centre going on right alongside which was very noisy and spoilt what should have been a tranquil spot.

title: A good work- in- progress.
review: A brilliant conversion in 2011 from a humdrum city park into a botanical garden. Has a great future when more interpretive signage and more unusual plantings are added, and when the massive construction job next door is completed. Will certainly benefit urban workers/dwellers but may not be worth a trip from the beach, due to small size (2.6 acres). Congratulations to the visionaries and volunteers involved here.

title: Really fun strip!
review: Everything else you've probably read about Little Havana is true. The blocks bet. 13 and 17 ave are the core and if you go slow you get to see some authentic culture, great ice cream, nice galleries. We also detoured to Wynwood to take in some more art galleries, but tourists beware. Not only are many of them closed (some moving to Little Haiti), we found this to be the case throughout Miami beach - galleries show up as "Open Now" online, but are not. Call ahead. Back to Little Havana - if I had had more time, I'd have spent the day asking the guys in the parks to teach me dominos!

title: Miami Culinary Tours
review: Had a great tour with Robyn. Very informative and fun. She added a lot of personal touches. Best part was the BAll and Chain bar.

title: Nice to see
review: This is a place you have to see when you visit Miami.      It is not that big as some people say but you have to enjoy the "Havana" atmosphere when you pass by the local bars and listen to their music.

title: A happening
review: Lot's of tourists & locals fill the streets of this trendy neighborhood.  Colorful people & colorful shops we feel as though we have left Florida for a time.  Good salsa music & dancing, delicious Cuban food & happy hour drink specials make Little Havana a real happening.  There is street metered parking, the tourist bus passes through as does the trolly.  .  We get start walking west along 8th street from Domino Park.

title: very good way to get to cruise port
review: We walked 2 blocks to the trolley from the hotel and caught the free trolley to the cruise port.  The ship was only a 4 minute walk from the trolley.

title: Fantastic free bus service
review: I would highly recommend using this service when staying on South Beach Miami.

title: ANOTHER EXCELLENT WAY OF TRANSPORTATION IN MIAMI
review: If you want to reduce your walking time, the Trolley is a good solution, and free. Now you can move not only within down town but several blocks out of down town.You can also combine the Trolley with the Metro as most of the Trolley has stops in most of the metro stations. Besides, the chauffeurs are very nice people !!!

title: Excellent way to travel
review: Free regular travel covering all of Miami Beach. Well informed drivers and many pick up spots. Three separate routes

title: A Must for Britto fans
review: This gallery is beautiful, there are pieces you won't find somewhere else. Britto is an icon in modern art and this is the place where you have to buy stuff, everywhere else is more expensive.

title: Great little art shop
review: I love Britto, but it's too expensive for me. This shop/museum was open to walk through and see all the brightly colored artwork. I didn't buy anything, but it was fun to look. Not sure Id' bring small children in here, since the pieces are so expensive.

title: Cool stuff
review: Fun colorful paintings, prints and sculpture. Reminds me of Peter Max. Great gallery to educate the young kids. A must to see while shopping on Lincoln Rd

title: Britto Art Gallery
review: If you like bright colors and creativity, you will LOVE Britto Central!  They have some of the best talented sales professionals who will guide you through the gallery and tell you the history behind each piece of art. They are very friendly and informative about everything in the gallery. Whether you are in the market to purchase a piece of art or just want to browse around and enjoy the beautiful artwork, you will definitely enjoy your visit!

title: It's a perfect beach for family and friends
review: This is not South Beach.   It is not a "beautiful people" beach. It is for normal people.  It is absolutely gorgeous with a fabulous walking path and great sand and palm trees.

title: Still beautiful
review: Bal Harbour is still a beautiful place to visit.  The beach, the shops, the restaurants.  yet take note, it is not for the budget concious.  Nothing in or around the Bal Harbour area will be inexpensive.

title: Perfect Miami beach for chilling
review: Tropical stretches of beautiful sandy beach, palm trees and water perfect for swimming..especially midweek. Families on the weekends but still able to find quiet spots...can walk for miles along the shoreline. At the northernmost tip of the island of Miami Beach, well worth spending a low key afternoon swimming.  On weekends lots of boaters partying offshore especially on the Intracoastal side of Haulover Beach, just north and visible from Bal Harbour beach. Don't miss the views from the fishing pier very popular with locals.  Lifeguards but no food concessions and limited inconvenient toilet facilities..so plan accordingly. Parking can also be scarce on weekends. If you are looking for South Beach buzz and hype, this is NOT for you.

title: butler on the beach - oh, YES!
AWESOME Museum
review: I took my mother and he history of thus museum us amazing. The man who housed his art collection here, and the art from past history is. A must See!!! Cheap entertainment. Friday evening was free.

title: brilliant. A lovely surprise
review: Everything worked here. The building is a delight and the price of entry reasonable. The permanent collection was full of fascinating items and the special exhibition of Julius Klinger posters a delight and a revelation. He died in a concentration camp- a great talent snuffed out. The scale is quite modest but the quality makes up for it. Go.

title: Exceptional
review: I’m don’t have a huge attention span. This had me from start to finish gripped into the story. From floor to floor each exhibit had clearly been carefully curated to tell a story. A powerful and compelling story that no matter your age you’ll be able to connect to. Great way to spend an hour or two whilst here in Miami.

title: Superb collection for design buffs
review: In the heart of the Art Deco district, this museum offers a trip in the machine age. Comprehensive and not too long, you will see design icons such as the Bluebird radio. Temporary exibits are also very well presented. We saw one about a important designer Julius Linger, impressive. A must for design lovers!

title: Very Interesting Place to visit
review: I recommend paying attention to the route because it's not easy to find the place

title: Baby jaguar
review: Unbelieveable!!! An amazing experience and the staff is so nice!! Got to meet hold and play with their new baby jaguar! Highly recommend

title: Very nice
review: Staff is very friendly and the service is fast.

title: Great food, super quick service
review: We brought our group of 8 here before boarding a plane to go home after a cruise. Our hotel desk clerk suggested it when I told him we were looking for a family friendly sports bar. We were not disappointed. The service was quick and prompt and the food was delicious. I highly recommend the mahi mahi fingers (appetizers) and hot wings. The atmosphere was laid back and friendly with lots of tv's as well as a pool table and games to keep the kids occupied while waiting for the food. The best part was how prompt and quickly the food came out. Very impressed and highly recommend.

title: Tacos and wings
review: Stopped in here because it was within walking distance from our hotel. Great atmosphere, delicious food and drinks. Had the wings and tacos. No complaints with either. Would definitely go again.

title: Good food, terrible service
review: The burgers and fries were very good but the service was terrible. Waited for over ten minutes for anyone to approach our table. Went to the bar to order drinks and that finally prompted someone to notice us. Would have left but only other options were McDonalds and IHOP.

title: Lunch the night before a cruise
review: Lunch was great. The wings were as advertised. We had a burger and it was very good. Enjoyed a local microbrew. Service was decent but nothing special. Food was well worth it. I would go back again

title: Contemporary art from around the globe
review: And some of it quite good.  Very civilized venue and well-attended.There is much to do and see and savor.

title: Art Basel Highlights Creativity
review: Returning to Art Basel for the third year reminds me that art can be cutting edge, fun and eye opening. The best venues are Art Miami and Context in Midtown and Aqua in South Beach as well as Pulse. For neighborhood atmosphere , food and music Wynwood is the destination. Nighttime is an amazing time to feel the pulse of Art Basel in Wynwood. People watching brings a fashion parade. Coming back next year. Would not miss it!

title: Everyone Complains And Still Everyone Goes
review: Just watch your wallet - it will suddenly be lighter due to that box they are preparing to ship your purchases home.

title: Handicapped Unfriendly!
review: I have given this event a 1, because a 0 was unavailable.  Although my nephew and I were eagerly anticipating seeing the Night Garden at Fairchild Gardens, we were greatly disappointed.  We went Thursday night, December 6, 2018.  I walk with a walker, and I found that the way the event was designed was totally unacceptable for the handicapped.  The event planners designed the walkway over grass that had holes in it.  It was impossible to see the holes because of the poor lighting, making it impossible to navigate with a walker.  We had to leave without seeing hardly anything of the Night Garden.  Please be advised that this event was not designed by Fairchild Gardens, even though it was held there.  Fairchild Gardens has plenty of walkways that are handicapped accessible, but Night Garden did not use these.  Exiting the Gardens was even difficult by car because of the horrible lighting.

title: Beautiful tropical garden
review: This garden covers many acres with winding paths through different plant collections. I always find a visit very relaxing.  Don't miss the grotto or the butterfly exhibit.

title: Save your money and go somewhere else.
review: I was so excited to visit the Night Garden with my family, and we were all willing to pay the hefty price tag of $30/person expecting it to be a cool experience. It was not worth it. There was mud everywhere. It was packed (why reserve specific time slots online?). I feel terrible wasting $125 for my family and I and that’s the honest truth.

title: What an amazing collection of tropical plants!
review: This was our first visit to these gardens and they were very nice.  Some of the plants are huge and when you stand next to them you think you are in a Sci-Fi movie!  There are paths with signage and a variety of plants and ponds to view.  Excellent photo opportunities.  We also attended their night time light show; very interesting.

title: Do not visit the night garden!
review: Also this event was advertised as as holiday event and it has nothing to do with the holidays.  No music, lights, Nothing. So don't go expecting any holiday festivities.

title: Trip from south beach Miami
review: Great days shopping. Plenty of options for food. Great value in shops. Only about $30 in uber from south beach

title: You would need the full day here.Plenty of shops.
review: Yes was here recently and enjoyed the day.Plenty of bargains.Lots of restaurants.The zones in the mall are done by colour which is  quite simple to follow. .the bus runs from some of the hotels and it also goes from the airport.

title: Wow 😲
review: I was thrilled we went there as the previous day we went to Aventura Mall & we didn’t like it.  This is the kinda malls i like with lots of eatery & lots of factory outlets not to mention Burlington as well as Ross inside the mall. A lot of bargains, not sure whether it is  because of the 4th july sales or not. Worth going.

title: Mall lovers' dream
review: This is an awesome outlet mall.  It is full of people (I can't imagine what it's like during high season), and lively.  There are restaurants surrounding it, and a food court inside.  If you don't know, Spanish is the predominant language in Miami, and doubly (if that is possible) for this mall.  But everyone also speaks English.  I love malls and this one did not disappoint.  Clean, lively, and it felt safe.

title: Pleasant Surprise---Large Portions
review: Decided to eat here as it was part of the Ramada hotel. Pub setting........with a nice menu and large portions of tasty food. Thumbs Up to this restaurant.

title: Good food and good service
review: This venue is walking distance from Comfort Suites, they have food and alcohol at reasonable prices, so no need to pay expensive taxi fares unless you want to eat in a fancy restaurant.

title: Great Establishment
review: You can't go wrong if your hungry or thirsty. The atmosphere is friendly with an incredible staff. Food is wonderful and filling. If you show up during the day ask for the barmaid Christine, great personality. A+++++ all the way. Stop on in you can't go wrong

title: Great place to visit.
review: We were staying at the Miami Springs Holiday Inn Express and decided to walk over for lunch and some drinks.   Very nice atmosphere, friendly staff and great food.

title: Drinks!
review: Good food and very nice selection of beers and cocktails. Located close enough to our hotel to walk so was perfect in food and location.

title: So cool!
review: We loved taking the metromover. It's so easy to get around in the centre of Miami! I hope more cities gets inspired by this.

title: Fun and practical!
review: The brickel area is always congested with trafic, and it takes a long time to do a little distance. The metro mover is very practical and allow to enjoy the view of Miami with the sea and its architecture.

title: Easy and FREE Downtown Miami transportation
review: Highly recommend the downtown Metromover service for easy and FREE trips from your downtown hotel. We visited Bayside Marketplace, Brickell, the Riverwalk, and you can even get to the airport if you connect to the Metrorail at Government station. Security was always present and the cars seemed well maintained and clean.

title: Stop and Go!
review: It is a great option in the downtown area since parking is always a problem. The only reason I give 3 Stars is because every time it stops, it takes too long... Other than that is a wonderful way to commute.

title: Free transport in central Miami
review: Easy-to-follow maps in every carriage & station.  The latter also show where to change to bus & train options.  Security guards in several stations.

title: Wonderful restaurants
review: We enjoyed this area also.  Such a very different feel to this area compared to Ocean drive. Quieter during the day, but lively at night with it's many choice of restaurants.

title: No big deal!
review: This is DEFINITELY NOT a “destination”. This is one section of a street that is quite picturesque but otherwise nothing special. There are lots of mediocre restaurants and tourist shops. If you are nearby you might as well stop here but would not go out of my way to visit.

title: Expensive
review: The night life is good and is very buzzy but it’s very expensive. $19 for a glass of white wine! 3 of us ate here had 3 beers 2 wines and a coke plus 3 main meals and it came to $210!! Go just to see it but don’t eat it’s wayyyyyyy to expensive. The food is average as well it’s nothing special.

title: Great for dinner options
review: Come at night for the best time on this very small, but quaint street. I come here to have a nice Italian meal. Christmas time is nice with all the lights too

title: Lively
review: We just passed by Espanola way around 10pm, and we really enjoyed the environment, especially the live music.

title: Great Design Architecture~
review: many beautiful buildings here and although we didn't shop here, looking around brands like Gucci, Hermes, Rick Owens and so on is really cool :)

title: Good atmosphere
review: Steak ok

title: Take out
review: Nice place for watching sports while you are not in the city. Food is really good. Especially it's spicy wings! I loved it.

title: Good food
review: Nice dinner when we arrived in Miami.  We was seated right away. Nice servers.  Short walk from our hotel. Walking right next to traffic was eye opening but do-able.

title: Sports night
review: Good bar plenty of ale to choose from good selection of food from the menu staff very helpful and quick to serve.

title: great chicken wings!
review: My husband and I, love the chicken wings at Tom's NFL. They also have a lot of beer and craft beer selections.

title: ART, CONCERT AND FOOD
review: vibrant environment to enjoy excellent concerts and art exhibitions.  Specially Wynwood area with different artists and galleries , as well as, excellent restaurants.

title: Love this area of Miami
review: Many nice restaurants and eateries through out the area.

title: Must must must
review: Celine is the best, then Hermès but the I tire neighborhood is a real blast!

title: Newest part of MIAMI is a winner
review: The design district is Miami’s newest ‘neighborhood’ and not just for Gucci & Prada, MULTIPLE AWESOME food options all around and free Salsa  concerts weekends

title: Unexpected highlight
review: We wandered through the botanical gardens after brunch Sunday morning. The space is beautiful and well designed; very tranquil in the middle of an otherwise urban area.  The best part is free admission, definitely worth a walk through if you're in the area.

title: Extraordinary!
review: Beautiful gardens! Well-kept! Nicely labeled! Interesting and unique varieties of species from all over the world. Gaylord in the gift shop is a gem! He knows EVERYTHING about the gardens and is so gracious and personable and fun and enthusiastic and knowledgable and generous with his time! Wish we could have taken a tour with him. Wonderful brochure/map to follow along. Lovely oasis in the busy city to spend a couple of hours on a glorious day! Will definitely return! And.......admission is FREE! Amazing!

title: Pretty but crowded!
review: The wait was so long when we went... I recommend going early or on a weekday. It is very nice, but not as relaxing as it could have been.

title: A little piece of magic
review: A small, sweet, peaceful botantial gardens that is fairly near the convention center.    Lovely place to walk around for 1/2 hour and enjoy the tropical flora.  Or have a picnic. They host public events from time to time as well.  Check their website's on line calendar.  It is very near the Holocaust Memorial so it is easy to visit both together.

title: Wonderful place to enjoy nature and relax!
review: Well kept with a much appreciated mix of shade and sun; Benches and seats are sprinkled throughout!  The garden is not large but the winding paths make it feel expansive. Partially hidden garden features lure you around the bend.  The newly added Pine Rockland Demo Garden was my favorite!  The restroom and drinking fountain were clean and centrally located within the garden.

title: Must go
review: First time to this area of Miami, so glad I went. Place is hopping at night lots of action going on. Walk the streets and stop anywhere for food, drinks and music.  Good fun,!

title: Have to go
review: Dominos Park - do it for 5 minutes or the afternoon.

title: Little Havana
review: Totally exceeded my expectations.  For some unknown reason I envisioned it to be run down and dirty and was pleasantly surprised in the beauty and its cleanliness.  Loved the street art in the area.

title: Great restaurant/bar within walking distance of the Sleep Inn.
review: This restaurant is a little bit of a walk from the Sleep Inn, but we enjoyed it so much.  On Super Bowl Sunday it was packed so we ordered carry out and ate in the motel (6 of us).  The food was great, but we realized when we got back to the motel that they had forgotten one person's order, so back my husband went.  They were so apologetic, replaced the missing order with a fresh order, and did not charge for it because of the inconvenience. So both food and service were outstanding!

title: A regular visitor
review: Food, service, atmosphere are great!  Friendly people.  I will continue to make this a regular dinner and lunch place.

title: great place, nice atmosphere
review: We went there a couple of times for a late bite as we stayed in an hotel close by. Staff is very nice and atmosphere is great. Can be a bit noisy in the front but much less noisy in a booth in the back. Food is simple and good , beer is chilly . What else do you need!

title: Good food
review: We eat every day this time good food and good service  i love there onionsoup and clam chowder awesome chicken wings well i eat most on there menu delicious

title: Dinner & Lunch
review: Would recommend this place and would definitely go back when next in Miami

title: Great
review: If you have some extra time while visiting Miami I would suggest making a stop here. Some of the best coffee and food in South Florida. Get a Cuban coffee! You will not be disappointed.

title: Loved it!
review: We enjoyed visiting Little Havana and actually went back for a quick drop in to grab some souvenirs. We stopped in many of the coffee cigar shops. The food was great and the atmosphere was fun. Both trips we went were during the day.

title: Free trolley rides around Miami Beach!
review: The trolley was great to take to other parts of Miami Beach, locals also use it for their transportation so it gets crowded but it's worth using.

title: Convenient
review: There was a stop on both sides of the road at the hotel that we stayed at. We were able to take the trolley almost everywhere that we went. Some of the drivers drove a little erratic at times, but we always got where we needed to go - and the price is great! You can't beat free....

title: Fantastic Free Service
review: The trolleys could get quite full, but what a fantastic free service.

title: It's FREE!!!
review: This was SUCH a great find!  One of the staff persons at our hotel recommended that we visit Bayside Market and told us about the MetroMover shuttle!  How refreshing to find this cute little shuttle that offers multiple locations for pick up and dropff for FREE!  I come from a city/state where you have to pay for EVERYTHING!! this was great! Very quaint and just what we needed.

title: Good people in this world
review: Company

title: Great artist-do visit.
review: We found the Romero Britto gallery by accident, we were shown round as we really enjoyed his work. He also does pieces for cruise ships and I found gifts in the airport by him too.

title: love it !!
review: just love it ,I wanted to buy everything! colorful art perfect to decorate any room ,any office.i got a lot of souvenirs and accents for my office.

title: Love Britto's work, Very Happy Themes
review: Romero Britto has come a long way with his art. While some say it is commercial, I like the way it makes me feel. His subjects are lively, happy and upbeat.

title: Garish empty nonsense
review: This is not a gallery per se, just a bright and garish take on nothingness made shiny.  This does not even wink the Real Miami arts scene, not worth waking past.

title: Perfect for what we wanted
review: My wife was concerned about walking there from the hotel and said she would not walk it alone, but there were no issues and it was not a problem.

title: It is a local jewel
review: I went with my friend who has lived in MIA for 20 years and never before here, we both loved it, great food, lots of TV's, service could improve, servers spend a long time talking to the regulars, but in general it is very nice place, and not to forget, decent prices too.

title: Great place for Sunday football
review: while staying overnight in Miami

title: NFL Sunday
review: I use Ubereats for the time and I order from this place the Chicken Wings and Fries was the best and I will order again

title: Good But...
review: The restraunt is good with many tvs and entertainment but, the food was not so good and the service was decent.

title: We were there today and if you like Britto it is good
review: I am not a fan of his art although it is very interesting. For Britto fans, this would be heaven. If you are on Lincoln Road already, don't miss it.

title: nice
review: great weather and service, very clean and pretty a must go!! dont miss out we stayed at the st regis bal harbour that might have changed things

title: Bal Harbour Beach
review: Great Beach avoid oct and Nov as the Jelly Fish arrive, but clean and tidy with a nice pahtway along the beach for those early morning strolls

title: Nice beach lots of sand
review: but the hotel pool is perfect for relaxing, eating and drinking.

title: Beautiful and clean!
review: Awesome beach.  We stayed at the Sea View on the ocean.  The hotel was ok (they are upgrading currently to go green).  But the property is amazing.  The beach is cleaned every morning.  I only saw one cigarette butt on the beach.  Very, very clean.  White sand.  Turquoise blue water.  Ahhh!

title: White sand, clear skies, blue ocean
review: There is Nothing not to like here. The staff will set up your chairs, an umbrella, and bring cocktails and food right to you. Lovely!!

title: Fabulous Gem of a Museum
review: This collection of art and objects was truly delightful.  We especially enjoyed the presentation of the poster art of Julius Klinger who lived mostly in Vienna and Berlin prior to WWII.

title: Loved it!
review: What a fun evening! Took advantage of the free Friday evening (6-9pm). This included a guided tour of the permanent exhibit by Shoshanna, one of curators, who was informative without being preachy. A great evening!

title: Unique, historical, artistic
review: You can walk or take the Miami Beach free Trolley to The Wolfsonian from almost any hotel in Miami Beach.

title: Always worth a visit
review: We return to the Wolfsonian annually when we visit Miami Beach.  The exhibits are engaging for viewers of all ages.  It's a remarkable collection.  We had the privilege of attending a presentation on a local architect, which was top rate.  The gift shop is filled with playful and sophisticated items for all ages.  Lots of fun.

title: Best day ever!
review: This was the best day in my entire life! I loved every single second of it! The tour was super cool and our tour guide gave us a lot of information on the animals and how they take care of them. The best part was the feline encounter and playing with the cutest tiger cubs ever!!! If I could rate this place 100/100 I would! I highly recommend the general wildlife experience and one of the animal encounters, it’s so worth it!

title: We were treated like family
review: My friend and I came while we were visiting Miami and had a fantastic time! Annabelle answered all of our questions and was very informative. We got to hear inside stories about the animals.  Mario is an incredible guy and runs a well-maintained facility where the animals are adored and cared for very well. We had an experience of a lifetime!

title: Great Airport Location
review: If you find yourself having to stay at the airport in Miami give this place a try!

title: Lunch
review: Three blocks from Comfort Suites where I stayed, so I walked down for lunch and a beer.  Bar food, friendly staff.

title: A lot of Beer Choices and Decent Reasonable priced food near Airport Hotels
review: If you are staying at Days Inn North, Ramada, Clarion, or the Comfort Suites Airport, it is only a block or 2 walk. Don't settle for order in pizza if you have the time to visit this restaurant.

title: Food and a beer on an overnight stay
review: Been to Tom's once a year for the past three years while passing though Mia. We stop by for a beer and some food. They have great beers to select from and some great specials. The food is OK but nothing to write home about. The burgers are really good. Had a chicken parm sandwich that was the strangest version I've ever ate. Never again on that one. They say their wings are favorites but they're not really that good to this phoenix guy. The beer selection is really good and not overpriced. The service can be slow. It was the last time we were there but it was packed with locals and travelers like us.

title: Great Bar
review: Staying one night in Comfort Suites and decided to give this place a try.  Very close and the food was good - basic pub meals but very tasty and a reasonable price.  Service was good too.  Don't normally eat chicken wings but tried some there - wished I had ordered more.   House wine was $4.50 a glass and very drinkable. Good atmosphere.

title: awesome experience
review: We barely stayed 2 minutes in the enclosure with the 2 sloths, we were not able to touch them as they were pretty aggressive as they were hungry and not fed yet by the person in charge. We paid a lot for nothing. it was the same as seeing then through the fence. I will go back but for a different animal .

title: Customer service needs improvement.
review: The place is very well kept and the animals seem very well taken care of. You can see animals up close including lagers; tigers, lions etc.  however our experience was not up to par with the high cost of the experience. We paid close to 300 hundred dollars for our party of four for a total of one hour tour. We get there and the registration process is very disorganized. So much so that they delay our group and ask us to join a group that had already started 15 minutes prior. When I complained that I had missed a quarter of our tour due to no fault of our own, one of the office workers said we would have to come back another day to do a full tour. What kind of service is that. Luckily the nice young lady giving the tour decided to restart the tour for us and take us to see what we had missed.  Overall the experience felt rushed and the service was not up to par with the high price we paid.

title: Great Time for Art lovers!
review: Great gathering of galleries from all over displaying immensely talented artists. Be prepared to walk a lot. The convention center is huge.

title: Must Attend for Collectors and Artists
review: Wonderful and diverse collections of art. Galleries from across the globe in attendance. Purchase, appreciate and feel inspired. I loved this event and will be back. A helpful tip: parking is a pain - use Uber.

title: it is better end better organised each year
review: this years opening was much less crowded than the previous year.the galleries are well chosen and you could walk around and see all the art very well

title: Get a one day pass with design miami access
review: Paid for a weekend pass but really only needed a day pass. I was able to do the convention center and design miami in one day.

title: Inspiring Arts Festival
review: Art Basel was a delight!! Came the last few days and wasn't overcrowded. There was plenty to see and I even had the chance to visit Design Miami. Wonderful even with tremendous variety.

title: Awesome food and cheap prices!
review: We stayed at a nearby hotel and there isn't alot in that areaso we stumbled into this sports bar, def not a five star area or place and I found it chilly inside but its your basic sports bar with great food and cheap drinks, what more can you ask for!  Prob the nicest place in that area lol.  We ended up eating there twice and both times had exceptional food!  My compliments to the cooks I was very impressed!

title: Mr M had a decent meal
review: I ordered the cobb salad which was a large salad and my wife ordered the skirt steak.  She enjoyed her steak and my salad was okay.  I would go back but order something different.

title: Food was ok
review: ended up at Tom's after ordering pizza and never receiving it after a 2 1/2 hour wait. Food was ok, service was slow even if the place was not full. we were told prior to ordering that it would be slow, but customer that arrived over an hour after we did got their food before we did. Price of beer made up for the wait. Would try the place again

title: Nice sports bar
review: Nice clean sports bar. Good food. Recommend. Lots of tv's. Only had drinks but food others ordered looked good. Will go back.

title: Top 10 Sports Bar in Miami
review: When I travel I always go here. Great Food, Fantastic service and TV's galore with every sport I need. MUST SEE !!

title: Good food
review: Short walking distance from Miami International North Comfort Suites hotel. Food was very good for a sports bar. Decent enough menu for being the type of place it was. Large portions. Numerous television screens displaying a variety of sports.

title: Great food and bar scene
review: Liked food a lot!! Onion soup excellent. Fresh salads. Good boiled shrimp and the typical black beans and rice completed my meal. One waiter was surly. Must have been tired. Rest of staff accomodating. Locals hang out there in numbers.

title: GREAT SPOT TO EAT!!!!
review: This restaurant / sports bar is two blocks down from the Comfort Suites Miami (where we stayed).  The food was great for a sports bar...and they have a wide variety to choose from including bar-be-que ribs!!!

title: Nice Pub
review: Lots of beer on tap and nice menu for snacks and meals. I can imagine it be a big party place on sporting days.

title: "Great place"
review: Try it, you can't miss with this place.

title: Beautiful setting, plants, and butterfly garden
review: We arrived in time for a little tram tour of the grounds, with the guide pointing out interesting plants, including the fact that there are 2,000 species of palms in the world. We saw a big alligator resting on one of the lake shores and really enjoyed the lovely butterflies in their garden. There were many dedicated and knowledgeable volunteers who answered lots of questions. The isit gave us a greater appreciation of botanical gardens.

title: OMG
review: This place is horrible!!!!! We waited over and hour for wings and when they came out they were cold. The manager never came out to apologize and they brought the food out cold!!!! I have not had service this bad in a LONG time! I would never comes here again. I should have known when you pull up to a sports bar on a Saturday night and the game is on and there is NOBODY there. Smh! I hope this helps somebody before they go through this.....

title: Good food with excellent service
review: Walked here from nearby hotel. Friendly and excellent service. Many people there and all were enjoying the ambiance and good food. Reasonable prices, too.

title: Nice bar and grill
review: We walked here from a nearby hotel and took a chance that it would be a good place for dinner--and it most definitely was! We ordered wings for an appetizer and were very satisfied with them. My husband had a burger and I had pasta. Service was friendly and would recommend.

title: you call that food?
review: Terrible food, warm, weak drinks. RUDE inexperienced staff! Dirty bathroom. Tuna melt consisted of toasted bread, cold cheese and cold tuna.  $9.00 for a strawberry drink that was raspberry, warm and contained very little alcohol

title: great place.
review: this place had great food and atmosphere. fast service, really friendly. they had a really nice selection also.

title: Terrible
review: This is one of the worst things I’ve ever done in my life. I go every year to look at Christmas lights. There wasn’t even any lights. We weren’t proud. There were huge lines. It wasn’t worth the wait or the money.

title: Night Garden is not good
review: The park was a very nice and pretty environment. The Night Garden was not something we enjoyed. Firstly, one of the staff members said out loud that they have over 1,000 people coming at the time. There were SO many people, and the staff didn’t do that good of a job managing the tons of people. Staff were advising us not to go on one of the main exhibits until later because of too many people clogging it. Why? That’s really not right. The staff were unable to create a single file line of everyone who wanted to go on this attraction. When entering the beginning of Night Garden, you see small Christmas-flower-lights on the ground. When walking in, of course they were pretty, but we expected much more. We assumed that what we were seeing was just the introduction and barely part of the whole thing. It ended up being the best thing we saw all evening. There were very few Christmas lights, and for the most part, the ones there were you could see driving from house to house in neighborhoods without paying so much money. It was insanely overpriced for what you are getting. One of the exhibits was literally large sculptures of dandelions.

title: Beautiful South Florida day in lush gardens and surrounded flittering butterflies
review: Now with teenagers and no tram ride we were still impressed with the beautiful gardens, the scenic water/lake views, Chihuly art, sculptures, the cafe food selection and especially the butterfly garden. Exciting for all ages. We saw a hummingbird inside the butterfly enclosure and a crocodile in ther lake.

title: 16 of us had a magical night at Night Garden
review: This review is for the Night Garden event. I love Fairchild.  I googled “family friendly New Years Eve” and happened upon The Night Garden. We bought 16 tickets and then I saw negative reviews and was nervous. This was one of the best NYE events we have attended in a long time. The garden was lit up, there were fairies, talking rocks, a talking tree, snow, DJ and fireworks. We loved it. I had read people who had concerns about accessibility but I saw 6 or 7 people in wheelchairs and they were able to get around the entire event. We each had small flashlights to help with dark corners but didn’t have any trouble navigating even with a stroller.  The food truck prices were a little steep but for $15 my Spain burger included fries and was DELICIOUS.  There were adult beverages. Plenty to see and my 2 y.o. granddaughter and the other kids enjoyed themselves. At the end of the night one of our group lost his keys but Steve, Tito, Andrew and Kevin stayed with us until they were found. True gentleman and a great event. So happy I didn’t let the negative reviews scare us away.

title: Dolphin Mall
review: You can compare this Mall to sawgrass mills, got the same feeling when I visited this place. Huge place with all the shops you could wish for, also offers a good foodcourt and The cheesecake factory!

title: Lots of things to do and lots to see
review: It was nice to have outlet malls with really affordable prices in addition to the other shopping options. Really big mall that offers a lot of facilities including a locker which was really  effective due to the amount of bags ....but one downside is the amount of people who drag you over to their kiosk and try to get you to  buy something...but other than that it has a lot of different food options and overall is a good place to shop

title: WEEKEND GETAWAY
review: One of the most beautiful malls in Florida.There are lots of stores to visit and shop at and it's in a good location.

title: Best ,most varied mall
review: In the center of Doral, a city within Miami-dade, is this mall, right off the Turnpike exit NW 12 St . Many top restaurants: Cheesecake factory, Texas de Brazil, PF Changs and several small , many flagships stores : Ross, Marshalls, Nike, Newman Marcus, Bloomingdales, Calvin Klein, Burlington , etc as well as many kiosks. You will find what you are looking for. There’s also a state of the art Bowling alley and top rated Movie theater . Valet parking, taxi station as well. There are 8 entrances into the mall from the parking lots and a hotel conveniently located about 300 feet, Courtyard Marriott .

title: Slow but Useful
review: Great way to get Down Town and to the Financial District.

title: It is nice and free
review: It is nice and free, you may also go to your destinations around the city. Clean and pleasant, operating all day!

title: Great way to go
review: Once you figure out which of the three systems u need to be on a great way to get around and it’s free Mr Trump Kuantan’s have heard about that part of the deal given that it operates on 3 Louis it can confuse you when u get back in the ground

title: Hopping Place
review: Good chicken wings & nachos. Waitress was polite & accommodating. Service was prompt ,wait for food was not long.  Loud & noisy, but that's what you expect at a Sports Bar.

title: It´s free!
review: I used MetroMover for the first time. It is very convenient and it has 2 routes, For me it was really nice as one of the stations is 2 blocks from my hotel and the Bayside Mall.

title: nice option for moving around in the tourist area
review: We used this service almost exclusively during a recent trip to Miami.  The connection between our hotel in Brickell and the tourist area in downtown was a snap.  The train also has a stop at the Brickell Center Mall which is really great as well.

title: Utterly charming
review: Charming street down in South Beach which is geared for pedestrians with shops, cafes and restaurants. At night it is lit lovely.

title: short, picturesque pedestrian street
review: Lined with restaurants and shops.  Paved in cobblestones.  No cars. A pleasant place to stroll or to have a meal.

title: House of Paella one of my favorite restaurants here
review: Pedestrian mall similar to Lincoln Street mall, lined with restaurants and retail shops. House of Paella is basically at the end and had outstanding sangria and salad with peeled shrimp. They also put on a free flamenco demo (2 women) on the street. Great entertainment and food.

title: Side alley
review: A pedestian side stree between 15-14 streets from Collins to Washington it is nice it has a lot of restaurants manly Cuban Italian and Spanish it is good for breakfast brunch lunch and dinner

title: Lovely little stroll w outdoor cafes, Spanish theme
review: It’s just one little block but it’s a lovely departure from bustling Washington Avenue that features a few quaint shops and Latin eateries w outdoor seating. It’s fairly lively on weekends yet not like Ocean Drive lively so it’s a bit more relaxing.

title: One of my favorittes
review: One   my favorite spots in  Miami an ideal escape from the busy ad crazy miami city. one of the best moments of my stay

title: My creative side come alive!
review: I love the design district, so many interesting things to see and explore! Visiting here always brings out my creative side!

title: The need more lounging and shaded areas
review: The Design District has gone through a metamorphosis. Almost every luxury brand of the LVMH group is here, the buildings have been architecturally transformed and are beautiful But the shopping at the Bal Harbour Shoppes still feels more luxurious even tho they have taken many of the boutiques from that location. Its a lot of concrete but there needs to be more green space, sitting space some large fountains with sitting and relaxing. Honestly its a bunch of luxury boutiques. Every luxury watch manufacturer except if you want the best selection of Richard Mille you need to go to Brickell City Center and ask for Alanna. She is truly the best. Its a good place to visit and the new La Roch from New Orleans is fun, but again the food at Casa Tua is better.

title: High end mall in beautiful Miami
review: I popped in here to look around and they have every high-end designer you can think of. The shopping area has lots of valet and also self serve parking.

title: Great reno of a formerly-abandoned area
review: Not an easy place to shop. Better to know what you want and where you're going. It's more like a village of stores than a shopping mall. It still feels like it's in the process of development as many spaces are yet to be occupied. Everything from Hermes to lesser-known brands and individually-owned design/concept stores. We had the names and locations of the places on our must-see list and then enjoyed discovering other interesting vendors. When it's hot or raining it would not be a comfortable ahopping trip as all businesses are accessed from the open streetscapes. Congrats on the urban redevelopment and the revitalization of a depressed neighborhood.

title: Beautiful Place to hid from heat
review: If you love plants, you will love this place. At first we didn t see the place because the convention center is being repaired and hids it but our wonderful guide from our antique car city tour told us about it. We were very thankful because this is a beautiful park with tons of plants you do not see so commonly. I guess the great weather in Miami favors plants that we do not see in Europe. Must Do!!!!

title: Paradise
review: Very pleasant way to kill an hours or so. Many beautiful plants and ponds. Our favorite was the bee hive in the gazebo copula.

title: beautiful!!!
review: This place is beautiful,  for a person that love plant, flowers and just a time to relax and enjoy a peaceful time in a gardens. Gardens has couple of statues, and artifacts which are beautiful to see. Have to paid for parking meters, no fee to use or entrance.

title: Visit! Paradise with lots of unique features
review: Do visit. It's right next to the Holocaust Memorial as well.

title: Beautiful  shadow oasis inside the hot city
review: Love it from the first visit!

title: Little Havana
review: Visit for a taste of old and young Havana culture in the heart of Miami. These 10 city streets are filled with cafes, restaurants, bars, nightclubs, very festive atmosphere specially at night fridays/Saturday. Some cigars stores have cigars making demostrasion. If you like flamenco dancing check out casa panza. There are also a few Cuban cultures art stores and exsevision.

title: Nice to see if you have the time
review: Nice to see but not a must see on a short trip. Enjoyed watching Cuban cigars being rolled and strolling down the street and hearing live music being played in the cafes. Souvenirs are mostly not handmade nor native Cuban so slightly disappointed. Not a large area so can definitely see walk and go.

title: well worth the trip
review: We spent 4 hours on a food tour of Little Havana. I recommend doing a guided tour to learn about everything and then come back a second time and enjoy the area. A must see is the ball and chain bar. They play music all day and all night.  Lots of history and also go to Domino park. If you cannot go to Cuba this is a place to get the feel of the people.

title: Food Havana feel recreated
review: It’s quite authentic as the people are real and live here and try to recreate a slice of home. Good fun.

title: Dont expect much
review: This is more of an "area" of the City rather than a contiguous neighborhood.  Similar to NOLITA in NYC dont expect much.  You will not really even know you are in the area unless you happen see that on a map.  Now actual Havana is another story completely.  Ignore this area in Miami and go to Habana instead.

title: Free
review: Great way to get around, free ride, sometimes very crowded.  Wait time vary between rides, but rides are quick.  Use the app to calculate times of trollies.

title: Wonderful!
review: We just arrived off a cruise ship and couldn't find the trolley stop...looked for ever, getting hot and bothered. Then, saw a trolley just coming along, no where near the stop and the man who helps you cross the road stopped the trolley for us and we were able to get on...in the middle of the cruise area ! How lovely was that. Brilliant!

title: Great way to get around
review: What a great way to get around the city and its free!  We only waited a few minutes for a tram.  We were originally going to take a taxi back to our hotel but then saw this free tram, can’t beat that!

title: Great free way to get around
review: We were in Coconut Grove without a car. Used the trolley several times to get around town. Then used the Brickell line to make a connection with the Little Havana route to spend the day touring there. Great, free, service. Not a long wait between trolleys. Clean and air conditioned. Most drivers didn’t know a lot of English, but were helpful with information about the routes.

title: Free ride
review: Also there are trolley just for the south beach loop, middle loop and the north beach loop.

title: cute little gallery
review: We stopped in the gallery because a friend had raved about it.  It was interesting to see so many Britto pieces, because I really knew very little about his work.  The staff seemed more helpful and friendly than I was expecting based on other reviews.  The line of Britta-themed Disney characters really caught my son's eye.  Although we didn't make a purchase, I'm glad we stopped in to see what all the fuss was about.

title: Love it!!!!
review: Excellent selection - fun and inviting ..... always makes you smile. Great place to find gifts to take home.

title: Unique but of course Expensive!
review: It is a good store that is well located for window shopping.

title: An Art Shop
review: We looked at the art...lots of paintings for sale but a very distinctive art that is not my style.  Kids seem to love it.

title: Free expo and a must see
review: I really enjoy to visit the exposition of Britto, it is open from 9 to 8pm (but double check the open hours).

title: Wonderfully clean beach
review: The beach is clean and well kept. Several restaurants within walking distance. Great walking paths. Would love to go back.

title: Nice Boardwalk
review: Not much of a beach, but a very nice boardwalk from the St. Regis (at 96th) south beyond what will be the new home of the Four Seasons. One path for pets, and another pet free parallel path. Enjoy.

title: Beautiful Beach
review: The beach is very close to the hotel, with in waking distance if you are health. You will see beautiful views in your way there and also little charming shops.

title: Family Trip to St. Regis
review: The hotel staff was not helpful at all. They did not do anything to make you feel like you or your family were special. The pool staff was amazing.

title: Best museum in town
review: This is a fascinating place if you like art deco.  I haven't been to the art deco museum on Ocean Drive at the tourist center, but it didn't look that interesting.  This is the real thing, a great museum; come on a rainy day.

title: Magnificent Collection of Art Deco Objects!
review: This Museum, is one of the most comprehensive collections of art deco, in Miami, or elsewhere! Located in a former Bekins Storage building, the ambiance is set! A South Beach Must- See!!

title: PRETTY COOL ART
review: Came here with a college class and the art and sculptures were pretty cool! The tour was awesome and informative, they had a collection with art of old political campaigns and that was interesting! Check it out to do something different!

title: Small but very interesting.
review: I was not expecting too much as I thought this was a propaganda museum - which it is, but not in your face.  It makes you think about what propaganda was at the time and how they got their message across.  All posters were very well thought out and artistic.  Very nicely done.  (The security people do not seem to be overly interested though.)  Nice quiet change from the beach and restaurant scene.

title: Magnificent WOW
review: For anyone who appreciates art in all of its form. It is worth the visit and the have a very nice sundry shop and cafeteria with great gifts and literature. Free admission included in the resort fee of the hotel we stayed at.

title: Speaking of luzury living and service!!!
review: As a realtor I would highly recommend to purchase a home here either a condo or one of a villa. Golf course, tennis, SPA, schools , 5 restaurants, grocery store to name a few of their true luxury amenities. You cant describe the security work managed! Well done! If it is in your price range , definitely a must to own. There is a ferry that connects you with Miami , it runs every 15 min , well organized!

title: Not something "to do" in Miami unless you  live there,  are staying at hotel or are a guest. Is not tourist attraction
review: Lovely quiet  lush island  just off South Beach - access by ferry. Worth a visit  if invited! Good beach bar, several private beaches, decent golf course, good  3 mile walk all around the  island.

title: Interesting!
review: It can be reached only by boot or helicopter and only the rich and famous live there.

title: Rich
review: All the rich and famous live here. It was nice to see from the boat tour. Worth a visit and the sunshine us of course glorious!

title: one of Miami's island
review: You need to take the ferry to go there. There are a few buildings and houses. It is not really interesting, except if you want to see where a few personalities have lived.

title: Money, Money, Money
review: I honestly think all they care out is the money. Booked a 2 hour tour. We were rushed through in under a hour. The animals are beautiful but all they seem to care about is how many people they can push through there in a day. I had emailed them three times about it with no response. It's really unfortunate because I was really looking forward to a great time.

title: Personalized, educational once in a lifetime experience
review: If I lived closer I would 100% come back to do this experience multiple times, and if I had the money I would 1000% do the personalized tour instead of the group one!

title: There is nothing for you to do if you arrive early and other caveats
review: Overall we had a wonderful experience, with some caveats. We made the mistake of arriving an hour before our reservation thinking we could walk around or amuse ourselves in some way prior to the scheduled tour.  Unfortunately, we were told we could not walk around unaccompanied, so had to look at walls for an hour.  I also thought I had purchased a wildlife encounter with big cats via Groupon but learned that all interactive tours are separate from the two hour general tour.  Still, I was thrilled when we made it to the animal interation area where we handled reptiles, a hedhog and let a couple of small monkeys climb on us. The animals are in rather small cages so it was easy to see them up close. An otter even played with me by throwing a shrimp my way.  I threw it back to her and she tossed it back.  Then the otter gave up when I threw it back again, probably thinking I was too dumb of an animal not to want to eat the delicious shrimp she was trying to share. LOL.

title: TRIP TO THE ZOO
review: An amazing experience to be so close to the animals - BUT extraordinarily expensive for such a short time and not be able to pet

title: Special Wildlife Encounter
review: Absolutely amazing experience! The staff was very personable and put their best effort into making these encounters special and worth the money. They were very good with handling the animals, and you could definitely see that the animals are very loved and well taken care of. We did the special wildlife encounter, where we were able to hold and play with a variety of animals, including snakes, primates, anteaters, owls, baby chimpanzees, feline cubs, etc. It was an experience my family and I will never forget and I definitely recommend!

title: This was AMAZING!  Can't say enough good about the selection of Art
review: We ended up in Miami and did not know about Art Basel until we got there.  This was such a great event- there was so very much to see and so much to do.  We walked and looked and loved for about 12 hours straight.  The art blew our minds- from high end art, to street art, the old cars to Music.  I would recommend this event to anyone who loves culture!

title: Beautiful Art Work From Around The World
review: This was the highlight of our family vacation. I wanted to take my kids to see something new a break away from the usual and 8 hours later after walking around and seeing all the beautiful displays we all had a great time. Very family friendly and we liked that we were able to be so close up to these wonderful pieces of art.

title: Must See for Modern Art Lover
review: I am not a modern art lover but I did enjoy this show.  It was much larger than I expected.  There were some interesting exhibits like the spagetti room and live performance art walking around.  We saw no price tags so I assume if you have to ask that one can assume you can't afford the piece.  We were fortunate enough to have VIP tickets so we got it quickly and enjoyed the amenities of a VIP lounge and outdoor garden when we needed a break.

title: worldwide
review: this is a world renowned festival.  i usually do the design district annex because traffic is heavy during the event. you'll see famous art by famous artists and probably some famous people too.

title: Art Basel week is one big excuse for parties
review: If it's all about art you can better go to Mastricht in the Netherlands, for the annual TEFAF.  This is all about art not parties.

title: Beautiful gardens to visit on a blue sky day
review: Loved my visit here. Its 25 dollars to get in which isn't cheap but I felt it was well worth it. They have a tram that you can take around the tropical gardens with a guide who gives you lots of information about the history of the place and the various tropical plants there. The tours depart every hour on the hour. Our guide was fantastic! He spoke with a lovely Southern Accent and made sure everybody enjoyed the tour. We even saw a crocodile swimming in the lake whilst we were riding round. This place is just beautiful and a great place to take photos. I also spent some time in the butterfly enclosure where the lovely lady let me hold a gorgeous butterfly and gave us some really interesting information on them. The butterfly place is a must see as there are so many different butterflies all in one place. I would recommend this place to anyone in the area as I really enjoyed my time here and all the staff I encountered were nice also. They have good food and drink facilities onsite and clean well maintained toilets. I will recommend this place to colleagues, family and friends.

title: Night Garden Event
review: Amazing experience.  It was a beautiful display. There was alot of traffic to get into the event. The valet was a joke. We had to oay to park our own vehicle.

title: Fairchild Tropical Gardens - Gardens Nights
review: Fairchild Tropical Gardens - Garden Nights open nightly in December by appointment. Walk thru Garden lit with lights and lasers, fairies and talking trees. Valet parking recommended.

title: Never biked, just golfed
review: Don't expect much, just a way to play 9 holes with your friends who probably happen to be bad golfers too. For under $30 for 9 and a cart, you can't go wrong.

title: Not just the Mango Festival - Fairchild is a year round attraction.
review: Loved walking around the grounds.  It's like a section of preserved Miami land.  Amazing setting, you have to see it at least once, preferably annually!

title: Brand new air-conditioned baseball/softball facility with great equipment!
review: Very clean and well-maintained with knowledgeable staff and instructors.  Cool technology like Coaches Eye, Motus and Zepp.

title: Bright Voices
review: This group are true professionals with panache and gusto.  This was my first concert and I plan on returning as often as I can!

title: In Need of Care
review: Though I do appreciate and admire every park, natural area, and green space in Dade County, unfortunately not a lot of care has been put into Modello Wayside Park. It is very similar to nearby Seminole Wayside Park in that it doesn't even have a parking lot or official entrance. You have to literally pull off US1 and jump the curb to park under the trees themselves. Residents that live nearby can however walk there. Just like Seminole Wayside Park, there are shaded areas for picnicking, but also trash in need of removal and homeless folks lurking about. There were also no restrooms, so the trees themselves must serve this purpose.

title: If you need a book for your airplane ride this is a good stop
review: This book store in the Miami airport is a great place to find a book if you "packed" yours in the bag that you checked.  Yep, that's what I did.  They have a good selection of best sellers and "old faithful authors ".  I just hate paying the full price but if your desperate this place is great.

title: Early Christmas present
review: Got there a little close to show time and had to race in from parking. Sat in the balcony and couldn't see very well but who cares as you only need to close your eyes to be transported by the most beautiful voices. Clear as a bell. Lovely performance. This was their Christmas show.  Also the conductor kept the audience entertained between songs. Recommend.

title: Rooster Walk
review: Along Calle Ocho in Little Havana, you can find decorative Roosters. They were put on the street in 2002 as part of "Rooster Walk" project by artists in the Little Havana neighborhood. One of the them was the late Cuban sculptor Tony Lopez.

title: Really great gallery with very fun events
review: If you are interested in Miami's art scene and want to see the product of many of Miami's most talented artists, definitely check out Yo Space.

title: Architectural Landmark. Not sure why is not on Tripadvisor
review: Since acquiring the historic Bacardi complex in 2012, YoungArts has been working to transform the Campus into a lively, multidisciplinary cultural center while preserving its beloved structures, which were granted a historic designation by the City of Miami Preservation Board in October 2009."

title: Payment of extra luggage
review: Vaitingtime for payment of extra luggage 30 min. Inflexible American style service when needed to move out of the box it is impossible.....

title: "Art-Broken" show  is worth on being visited....
review: Exhibition  has a great curatorial level ,  offers a  a variety of contemporary art styles through works by high quality artists , it pretends  not only  to entertain visually but to engage intellectually.

title: Horrible customer service
review: The low rating is for the customer service. The staff here is very rude and unprofessional. The prices range from $6 and up to store pieces of luggage. They accept credit cards and require photo identification to leave bags. They also take a photo of you when you drop off and pick up the luggage for security reasons. The baggage check is called communitiel baggage and is located near the terminal E security checkpoint on the second level.

title: Never disappoints
review: The Cisneros for natural N is a must for art lovers visiting Miami.  It always exhibits interesting Latin American artists In their spectacular space. Staff is always available to guide you through the grouch the work.

title: Nice place for talented teens
review: People working there are very nice, and I hope I can submit my writing work in at somepoint in time :)

title: Yo Space Gallery
review: The decor is vibrant colors, you would think you are in Little Haiti, and you are. Parking is easy, the facility is large , clean, and with lots of colorful artwork. Their are some artist on location that are happy to explain their work.

title: Great place for a peaceful stroll
review: My second visit and this time I took my wife so she could enjoy the beauty of the gardens. We walked around the central lake and through the butterfly enclosure and rare plants area. All were excellent.

title: Big mall with lots of restaurants with live performances.
review: It’s a huge indoor outlet mall with lots of food choices. The restaurants at the back have live performances that people can dance to. It is packed no matter what time of day it is.

title: Big!
