review: A huge mall full of lots of different shops. Don’t expect massive discounts tho, we checked prices online & lots of items were similar priced in the UK or from amazon. There are a few outlet/discount stores in the mall which were really good value including Levi’s which was a lot cheaper than in the UK. Now the UK has discount malls/outlet stores, there aren’t the huge discounts to be had that there once were - it’s worth a visit tho.

title: terrible experience
review: PLEASE BE CAREFULL  THERE ARE THIFS :( it was very fast :(

title: Good time
review: Great Mall to visit with family or tourist. Mall has everything from good popular name brands to even stores with great product and selection. The atmosphere and vibe is very good it has everything for all ages Movie theaters 2 different one to bowling top Restaurants of your choice, bars and a David Buster for kids and family to enjoy. This mall has a  Bass Pro shop for fishing and even a RV & boats to buy. There’s a hotel near by and other restaurants and places to go as well near by

title: Nice outlet
review: It’s a nice outlet with great discounts. It has most of the brands that I’m looking, not far from the city.

title: Quick an deasy
review: Free way to get around town. Once we figured out the system we were good to go. Fast and easy and no lines, wait, etc. Would use again.

title: Very nice and free transportation
review: We used the Metromover between various locations in Miami. The trains are convenient and free. They make frequent stops at all the places you might want to go in downtown Miami.

title: Wow
review: . what a great idea and easy way to get around town, my son's first time and he thought figuring out our route was fun

title: FREE
review: What can I say this is a great way to  get around the city centre and a little bit  further and it's free. There's three loops, one around the city center, one heading south,  and one heading north.

title: Easy
review: A cheap & easy way to get around for free. A big bravo to the city of Miami who not only  caters to the very rich tourists but to the ordinary tourists too. Very easy to get around & fast

title: Noisy funny and lightning street
review: Watch the pictures of one of the Italian proposal x dining

title: Crazy Busy !!
review: Nice pedestrian way - mostly restaurants - when in South Beach great to walk along here at night ....

title: It is fun to walk down the street, love the atmosphere.
review: I went to espanola way at night, and had dinner at Italian restaurant, it was really fun, even if you just walk down. There are lots of restaurants both sides, the street is filled with lots of energy.  I never see this kind of street. It's worth to walk there.

title: Good walk and great architecture
review: We were to the Espanola Way in the morning, therefore it was quite calm and with very few people. Not even all the restaurants/cafes were open. Anyway, for a family with children, this was the right  time of the year. It was a nice walk, an opportunity to take a look at the interesting architecture and a relaxed time. We didnæt spend more than 15 minutes there, walking to the one end and walk back. Take a look if you are around.

title: The Street with the Awesome Ambiance
review: Worth at least one visit for an out-of-this-world feeling.

title: Nice atmospere
review: Loved the art work, happy hours at nearby restaurant,  food was amazing at  Wynwood walls restaurant.  Walk around the area and enjoy the views, art galleries everywhere.. We enjoyed our visit.

title: Fashion district
review: Great place to visit and maybe shop. There are bars and restaurants in this area so you may plan the whole afternoon here.

title: Beautiful shops and arty stuff
review: Very nice (expensive) shops in an artistic scenery. Lonely Planet combines this district as " Wynwood and the art district", BUT: the design district is 10 blocks away from Wynwood and needs another taxi drive!

title: Not overly impressed - but great environment
review: Very impressive architecture - but I’m not a fan of modern art.  The atmosphere is calming and the shops highly expensive!  That said, the art is worth the hour walking around.

title: Nice for short stop
review: I was not a big shopper hence trip to mall or shopping area was not high on my list, however it was a nice drive around and walk around to look at the artwork around the building. The place was clean and relaxing.

title: NICE PLACE TO VISIT
review: Breathe, reflect, write, and get inspired in the heart of Miami Beach. Escape the chaos, traffic and crazy drivers and come here where you can find your inner self and peace.

title: Don’t try walking here with the construction
review: Confusing and difficult to get to with all the construction. In terms of the garden itself, I’m sure it’s a good event space & the convention center is right nearby, but not that great of a botanical garden. More of a nice place to have a wedding or business event.

title: Relaxing Respite in the middle of a busy, touristy area
review: Adjacent to the entrance is the Holocaust Memorial also worth a visit.

title: Lush escape from the city
review: I recommend combining this with a trip to the Holocaust Memorial, as the two attractions are right next to each other. You can park in the same lot for both. If you go to both, plan 2 hours total for your trip. If the construction is still happening by the convention center, be prepared to drive around to find something. Also, the walk there may be tricky based on which sidewalks are closed.

title: Lovely and Lush
review: Although not a large garden it’s full of great plant and tree species. We loved discovering the lively and very healthy bee hive atop the gazebo as well as the koi pond obviously well tended. The whole experience was topped off by the fabulous gift shop clerk whose vibrant personality made us want to steal him away for the afternoon. A must see!

title: Great Place to Spend the Afternoon
review: This area was recommended to us by our hotel.  It was worth it for sure.  It was fun to walk around, get some awesome food, Cuban coffee, and listen to Cuban music.  It was a lot of fun and great little shops.  A lot to see.  Check it out.

title: Great area to explore.
review: Everyone was very friendly, many don't speak English.  We loved walking around and just taking in the culture.

title: Interesting place to visit
review: Our city tour took us to little Havana historic district. We stopped there for a the shoppes. Their selling point was the cigar industry and their Cuban coffee. They gave us a little taste of Cuban coffee when we stopped by the cigar store. Very good and strong coffee for sure. It’s an interesting district to visit. Just be careful walking down the street; there was some panhandlers around.

title: Nice place to eat and shop
review: We came here for shopping (in general shopping is poor in Miami). But we also had nice national food... the place is dirty but tolerable.

title: Love Little Havana
review: The best area in Miami. It’s got everthing, music, drinks, restaurants,dancing and dominoes.  We stayed at the LifeHouse hotel on SW 9th Street just around the corner from the famous Ball and Chain.

title: Awesome service..
review: We had a great time exploring Miami using this free service- Miami trolley.. it was easy to access with kids and had many stops near tourist attractions.

title: Wonderful 'free of charge' way to get round
review: The service also appears to operate from 6am to 12am Monday to Saturday, and from 8am to 12am on Sunday, so really does provide a first class and comprehensive service

title: Free air conditioned transport with WiFi??? Wow!!!!
review: You can go all over Miami Beach middle and south on this great trolley. Drivers are nice and helpful, and cars are clean and cute. Occasionally almost too cold, but that's why I pack something with sleeves every where I go. Trolley stops every couple of blocks and stops are well marked. An app displays the cars in real time and Google maps tells you when they are coming in the transit directions.

title: Free Transportation
review: This was a pretty good deal for getting around Miami for free.  The only issue I had was that it really wasn't clear where the stops were on the website maps so you had to keep an eye out for the sign boards.  It also wasn't clear where multiple lines stopped at the same stop.  According to the map, the Coral Way one should have had several stops with the Biscayne by the Bayfront Park area but I couldn't find a sign that had Coral Way on it.  So I never did get on that line but the Biscayne and Brickell took me where I needed to go.

title: Great trollies!
review: First class way to travel for free in Miami Beach.

title: Modern Art
review: The artist Britto make some of the finest articles. The store is full of the pieces signed by the artis.

title: totally love Britto
review: We love Britto's art and accessories.  A few years ago we bought a piece of Britto handluggage...and people always ask..where did you get that?  Or they smile and point...Britto is happy art...So we purchased another hand luggage...and some Disney ceramic statues to add to our collection we already have by Britto.  We were very excited to see Britto's art gallery and the fun shop....A very large selection of many articles...which all bring a smile to our faces. and throughout Miami Beach we saw statues By Britto...gorgeous, large statues...an accomplished artist! And fun shops!  Don't miss!

title: Happy fun art
review: Britto's pop art has taken the world by storm. Not only the gallery, but his work it's fun, colorful, giving you the idea of happiness. I love it!

title: Pretty little store (there are 2) to see a masters work; but it's still "pop" culture to me
review: Like most people, we love bright, shiny things.  Britto makes them in all (mostly prime) colors and shapes.  A great visit, but I have no need to own one. Found lots of Britto souvenirs at ALL the tourist shops...down to $10 from $10,000.

title: bal harbor hotel
review: best place to go nice and comfy great service nice view across nice shopping mall food and attractions in the area

title: When you want a five star holiday in Miami
review: For a high quality beach holiday away from the craziness of south beach - this is the place. Safe and five star area.  Bal Harbour shoppes are luxury mecca.  Highly recommend

title: Collins Avenue Miami
review: If in Miami don't forget to go here,one long avenue with beautiful white sandy beaches no wonder many stars live here, beautiful shops and restaurants.

title: Quiet, Relaxing and Enjoyable
review: Great place to visit for a low key solo, friend or family quick get away or extended stay. Great location. Easily accessible to Miami, Hollywood and Ft. Lauderdale by car.

title: Nice beach!
review: A very nice beach, with a lot of high-class restaurants and hotels.  Quite a clean beach, also in the publich sector of it.

title: Captivating
review: This small museum has an interesting collection of diverse objects (more than 100.000), and the cool part is that the exhibits change from time to time, meaning you can visit more than once. This time we saw one exhibit on Russian posters that was very interesting.

title: Funky, smartly arranged museum with well curated exhibits
review: This is a quirky museum based on a personal collection that has been well expanded. If you're a fan of early 20th-century design, it's a very pleasurable diversion from some of the noisier, flashier parts of South Beach.

title: What a place
review: We were delighted to realize that our hotel provided free admission to the Wolfsonian. we walked accross and we were surprised at houw gorgeous this place is. great exhibits and programing, you would never believe how marvelous this place is. I really enjoyed the visit... By the way, they have a great coffee shop with the best cappucino, great ministore too. Awesome!

title: Closed on Wednesday
review: Website does not list hours.  Drove an hour to go and closed on Wednesdays.  Really disappointed we could not go.

title: Unique
review: This museum is difficult to describe because it has a collection of such a variety of quirky eye candy.

title: Great homes
review: We love archecture and this project has plenty of it, all seems fairly new but very stylish and there are some lavish places

title: Wow!
review: A must see during a visit to Miami. Lifestyles of the rich and famous could have been conceived here.

title: Fisher isn't what it used to be
review: no service, hard to get to , not a friendly resort. they used to be good but not anymore. would not recommend or return.

title: Not for your average society by far
review: I love Fisher Island but let's face it, for most people they are only going to see the outside of Fisher Island. In order to go on Fisher Island ( Billionaire's Row ) you better be Oprah, Beyonce, Madonna or part of their entourage. I have had the privilege of staying on Fisher Island and NOTHING on that ISLAND IS CHEAP!!  To book a room is about $600.00 a night or more, and you cannot get there by car. You have to  Ferry or have a private Helicopter.

title: Amazing
review: Houses are beautiful if you can manage to find yourself a reason to make your way there it is worth it just amazing

title: In LOVE with LAMBINI!!
review: Yesterday my husband and I had one of the greatest experiences ever when we visited the Miami Zoological Foundation.  The general tour was fascinating; the tour guide got us up close with the animals and explained things about them in great detail.  He took his time talking and answering questions and never rushed.  Afterwards we had the opportunity to hold some of the small animals.  But the pinnacle of the experience was my one on one encounter with LAMBINI!! I have always wanted to interact with a chimp and the reality of this encounter was better than I could ever imagine.  Thanks so much to the caring and professional staff at the foundation.  Lambini is a part of me now and he has given me sweet memories that will never be forgotten!!

title: Did the 2 hour tour and the baby tiger toir
review: It was amazing. Our tour guide is very knowledgeable, energetic. You can feel his passion about wildlife. Highly recommended his tour. The set up of the place is more like a refuge. They know the history of every animal staying there. It is not like a zoo and not commercial.

title: ZWF Wildlife Presentation & Tiger Cub Encounter
review: If given the chance, I will return to ZWF and do a few more encounters!

title: An incredible experience... a MUST do!
review: It is WELL worth the money. Leave the Miami beaches for half a day - you won't regret it!

title: So much fun!!
review: We were hesitant to come at first because the price seemed so high, but this place was so amazing and worth it.  My 14 and 12 year olds loved the animals and it was so fun to interact with some of them.  This is an experience unlike other zoos.  The tour guide we had was so great.

title: Really liked this place
review: Came here with my husband we had a pretty good time watching artwork.  Only part I didn't like was it took us almost an hour to find parking

title: Too high falutin'
review: I've been to Art Basel twice and have found it to be a disappointing experience both times. Workers in the booths tend to talk only to people they judge to be able to purchase their products. This, unfortunately, does not always work out for them. I was seriously interested in a piece of art, but the people staffing the both wold not give me the time of day. HOWEVER, there are many, many art shows that run concurrent with Art Basel, and the whole scene is fun. Also DO NOT miss the graffiti art everywhere in Wynwood! New every year. Even more fun to wander around a few days before Art Basel opens and watch the outdoor artists at work!

title: A fun show
review: I can only compare this show to the Armory Show in NYC. This is similar but being in Miami in Dec is a great time. This is a busy week in Miami and hotel prices will increase for this time period so be sure to book well in advance.

title: Art Basel Miami
review: Art lovers of the world come to Art Basel Miami. Amazing, curious and interesting pieces on display. I was inspired on so many levels. I met awesome artists and art lovers. I can't wait to go back. Even if you do not like art. Something here will grab your attention. Miami does a superb job at hosting.

title: The best event in Miami.
review: This event happens the first week of december and its the best week in Miami.  Full of millionaires ready to buy art and party the nights away.  By far the best week to be in Miami !!!

title: Great mural made from recycled windshields
review: It is easily found to the right of the TD bank. Quite a few buses are on this route, but once in Little Havana, this is a pleasant stroll on Calle Ocho. Other attractions nearby include the Santa Barbara catholic church, a short walk north, and the many monuments on the Cuban Memorial Boulevard, a short walk west.

title: A forgotten area of Little Havana
review: This is a great place to stroll and learn about Cuban history, although it is in a "forgotten" area of Little Havana.

title: Worth a visit while in the Design District
review: This is yet another of Miami's private museums. The collection of examples of abstract expressionism is small, yet significant representing artists from around the world.  They change exhibits one time a year, so it's well worth an annual visit if you live in Miami, or to be included on your itinerary if you are visiting the area.

title: Great Art gallery
review: Located inside the Wynwood walls. A large gallery with huge walls to display large works of art. They had a one person show with amazing art.

title: The best known church in Little Havana
review: Another Catholic Church nearby is the Saint Barbara Church on SW 6th Street, and a sculpture of Mary holding her baby, may be viewed in the Cuban Memorial Boulevard Park.

title: Cuban Memorial Plaza
review: The Cuban Memorial Park is a memorial to  those who fought for Cuban independence. It’s a green area with an eternal flame to memorialize the heroes

title: Gigantic succulent nursery
review: Worth a stop to view the endless tables of gorgeous well priced cacti and succulents.  Unfortunately they are unlabeled and the not staff do not help you. (Would be 5 stars if they were). Also great selection of pots

title: Guess what I forgot?
review: It is annoying when you get away on the trip to find you forgot something - the hair brush. Not a problem. Found the best selection of brushes to choose from. Happy with sales assistant’s service. Would come here to replace my brushes when needed.

title: Great sculpture of St Barbara
review: If you walk south to the Cuban Memorial Boulevard Park, another catholic related sculpture will be seen, this time it is Mary holding her child. If you continue south, and turn left on SW 13th Street, the Peter and Paul Catholic Church may be viewed.

title: Forget the Convention Center!!!!
review: lie: I know him! But he’s amazing and he’s one of a hundred artists you can see at Spectrum!

title: Community Park
review: I had driven past Armbrister Park hundreds of times on my way to Coconut Grove, but was unaware of it's name and had never set foot in it, as is the same for many Miami residents. it is conveniently located just off US1 on Grand Avenue. This is an average park which has a large football field, a shaded playground and basketball courts in the back. Nothing overly impressive. I did not observe any wildlife in this park, not even a bird. It is however located in an area of Coconut Grove with the most poverty and crime, so this free activity center is a good alternative to the streets for many youths. Knowing the crime level of this area, be aware of your surroundings, and do not leave anything of value in your car, as break ins are common in this area. As tourists don't often visit this area due to the slums and crime, it is one of the few areas of Coconut Grove that thankfully has free parking. The corrupt and greedy City has metered basically all the rest.

title: Gone to the Dogs
review: Perrine Wayside Park is very similar to the nearby Veterans Wayside Park in that it has a crater like lake in the center shaded by trees and is surrounded by limestone cliffs. Parking and admission are free. When I was little, I used to fish at this park and children came to play. Now due to the pressure of a small minority of dog owners, the park has been converted into a dog park and with it many changes. There are now prison-like metal gates enclosing the park, including a separate gated area for smaller dogs. Most disturbing are the following reasons how this park has been destroyed following it's conversion to a dog park: The once clear water is now a thick, algae filled pea soup green. This algae bloom is surely due to the large amount of nitrogenous dog waste making it's way into the lake: from swimming dogs relieving themselves in the water, as well as storm run-off from the grass. The water most likely contains high levels of fecal coliform bacteria as well, and those who let their dogs swim should be cautious, especially around children. This stagnant water is no doubt a breeding ground for mosquitoes as well, which impacts all of the surrounding neighborhoods. I saw what appeared to be a water circulator in the center of the lake but it wasn't making a difference. The aquatic plants which once grew on the shoreline sadly now appear to have been torn to shreds by the dogs. Fishing is no longer allowed as you don't want to hook a dogfish. As you walk the trails you can smell the dog waste in the garbage pails. In the past the park was teeming with wildlife including waterfowl and other birds. Most of them sadly appear to have met their fate from canines or been scared off. Now all I saw was a few brown anole lizards, turtles, and some small mosquito fish (which may have been added to control the mosquito larvae)  When I visited today there were no dogs present, so most visitors are doubtful to even see that much wildlife. Unfortunately many stubborn dog owners still want to convert the nearby Veteran's Wayside Park into a dog park as well. Hopefully the city can learn from what happened to Perrine Wayside Park and won't make the same mistake twice.

title: Cute little neighborhood park
review: Love this little park close to my house - nice little walking path and dogs are allowed and poop bags are provided.  So far it's been well maintained and has sufficient shade and trees to provide some relief in the hot sun.   It's small but great for exercising before or after dinner.  Dogs must stay on a leash

title: Great place to walk before dinner!
review: Came here to walk last night before dinner as within one mile from my house.  Great little local park and the people you meet on the walking trail are friendly and say hi.  Nice little local facility, recommended.

title: Love this dog park
review: This is a beautiful park to visit with your dogs. I like to keep mine on a leash and simply walk them around the area. It is quite scenic and pretty. I would never let me dog in the water though.

title: Disgusting!
review: Don't bother calling the County because it won't do any good.

title: Kick A$$ Place to Knock Out Your Stress
review: Fernando and his team kick butt at what they do -- getting your mind, body and fitness right. Nothing better than punching and kicking a bag after a stressful day at work.

title: OK Park
review: Flagler Grove Park is one of the newer parks in Dade County. Not an overly impressive park, but every park is important for the local community. There is a medium sized field that can be used for soccer or other recreational activities, and a small covered playground. I didn't sight any wildlife, but the weather was bad the day we visited and it began to pour hard. It is conveniently located close to US1 and within walking distance of residential neighborhoods.

title: Excellent gallery in Wynwood!!!
review: Robert Fontaine Gallery is a true gem in the Wynwood art district.  The work selection is outstanding.  Robert has great taste when it comes to choosing the artists he represents.  If you are in the area dont hesitate to go in.  You wont be disappointed!!!

title: The Worst Museum Experience Ever-Horrible
review: The exhibit was open, the permanent exhibit was closed at the Museum of art! The guard I dealt with was rude when I asked a question. Her behavior was horrible.. There was no customers in this place and 8 guards watching us like we were going to steal the garbage they had on exhibit. Avoid this place, There was no one in museum store, no place to eat. I hope the curator is reading this, I've been going to museum for 30 years and this was the worst experience.

title: Wanted it all
review: Will definitely be keeping an eye on what's here in the future .......

title: It is an interesting place to visit.
review: I never knew there were so many different types of palm trees!  Ride the tram first then walk back to get a better look at what interests you.  Don’t miss the butterfly exhibit, it is very interesting.

title: Christmas Village a la Miami!
review: The holiday village at Bayfront Park is full of wonderful gems. I was able to check off my Christmas list, while browsing the cute stores that displayed everything from hand-made purses made of wood, toys, jewelry and pashminas. I was amazed at the caliber of items available in the village. Vendors from Portugal, Italy, Turkey and even Bethlehem displayed their products, and I made a serious dent in my wallet, but I'm almost done with my Christmas shopping. I also loved the food. I ate a delicious lobster roll, and because I RSVP'd online at bayfrontholidayvillage.com, I got a free Christmas Makers Shaker at the Makers Mark Bar! Speaking of bars, they have the North Pole Beach Club, which is a great place to sit back and watch the boats go by while sipping a Peppermint Mojito. I had quite a few of those, while my nieces rented rollerskates at Bayskate to skate around the 50 ft. Christmas Tree. That tree is unlike any I've seen in Miami. It's animated, and several times a night, they lower the lights and rev up the music and put on an LED Christmas tree show. It's amazing. I also enjoyed nibbling on caramel apples at Ricky's Arepas and by the end of the night, we bought some hot chocolate and churros to people watch. This is a wonderful place to get into the spirit and enjoy Miami weather. It runs all the way through Christmas day, so we plan to be back again and again.

title: Wonderful garden and butterfly habitat
review: We like walking and what better place to do it than this beautiful garden in Coral Gables.  They seemed to specialize in orchids and there were some beautiful displays.  The tropical rain forest is very lush.  The butterfly habitat was really great with some spectacular one flying all around you.  You can even have one sit on your arm for pictures.  Altogether, a lovely day.

title: Shows you gorgeous greenery
review: Fairchild Tropical Botanical Gardens is a local treasure.  Decades of superb community leadership have resulted in a vastly improved facility and world-class destination.  Special events are worth it, too.

title: Lovely time with butterflies
review: Sure, you can walk among the lovely vegetation and small lakes, but the butterfly enclosure will entrance you. So, so many butterflies, many as big as my hand, all fluttering around or nibbling food.

title: Beautiful visit
review: We visited on a beautiful Tuesday in January. The grounds and foliage were exquisite. The butterfly garden was amazing. The staff in the butterfly garden shared so much information. I’d definitely return! It’s a must-see!

title: Okay Park
review: Colonial Drive Park is located just to the North of Colonial Drive Elementary school. As it is surrounded by low income minority neighborhoods, it is a good place to go for free recreation. There are tennis and basketball courts, 2 activity buildings, a football field, a water splash area available for rentals, and 2 baseball fields. The Larger baseball field was all fenced off due to high levels of toxic contamination found in the soil, like many other parks in the area. There is a walking/bike path which goes around the park. There is a tiny area of preserved natural pine rockland habitat with native plants  on the West side of the park which the walking/bike path goes through. Not a lot of wildlife was observed: just a hawk, anole lizard, and a grackle. Unfortunately the natural area has been littered with garbage, and does't appear to have been cleaned  up in a long time. Also be careful of the tires on your bike or car as there was broken green glass everywhere. Apparently those who use the park as a drinking spot, prefer Heineken. Illegal drinking at this park shouldn't be a surprise, as there were no park staff or security anywhere to be seen. Parking and admission is free.

title: The most recognisable monument in Little Havana
review: In the months that followed, the political intrigue of denials and prisoner negotiations was a daily feature, but ended in the prisoners being sent back to Miami in exchange for US$53m in food and medicinal supplies.  Most of the Brigade returned to this area which became known as Little Havana. This was a pivotal moment in history, as after the failed invasion, the Cuban Government embraced the Soviet regime, and this led to the "Cuban Missile crisis" the following year which was one of the highest points of the cold war. A short walk south of this monument , is a sculpture of Nestor Izquierdo, who was a senior figure in the brigade. The Bay of Pigs Museum and Library is a short walk east to 1821 SW 9th Street, and provides additional information on the conflict.

title: Last Call Neiman Marcus
review: Berta Carral

title: Simple but very elevating
review: This is a simple Russian Orthodox Church. The most important thing in a Church is the priest and the priest here is extraordinary.

title: Best shopping option
review: Dolphin is my first choice for shopping in Miami. Not o my because it has outlet stores but also because it’s not as huge as other Miami malls. However it still has everything you need

title: The place to buy anything
review: Very large mall with a circular design with something for everyone. Variety of stores and eating places including counter and table service.

title: Small but Unique Park
review: Rock Ridge Park is located right off 117th Ave in West Miami, surrounded by suburban development. Though not a large park, it it differs from most. It gets it's name due to the fact that the park is filled with boulder sized coral rocks scattered about like a field of meteorites, some weighing hundreds of pounds. Though it does make the landscape more interesting, parents do however have to keep a closer eye on their kids, as they can easily crack their heads open on these massive rocks, or break a bone if they fall/slip while rock climbing. There is a walking path which is shaded by beautiful palm trees. There is a playground, but no bathroom facilities. Parking and entrance is free.

title: Farmers market
review: The Wynwood farmers market is a small area of food trucks and kiosks dorm the block from the walls. We tried a coconut smoothie.

title: Good entrance to the Wynwood Walls
review: A smaller market with fresh food and drinks as well as crafts, clothes, and other items it is a nice entrance if you are making your way to the walls to look at the artistry.

title: Very Small, Great Nachos
review: One of the vendors was making fresh nachos, with three meat choices and vegetarian options.  We got a sample and they were hot and delicious.  The market could grow more and branch out into selling more fresh food options, like vegetables and fruit, but it's a nice place to go in the mornings on the weekend.

title: Lots of good things
review: Got exhausted after 3 hours,need to go back.

title: Has everything you need
review: The Mall has numerous stores with anything you're looking for so it's the ideal mall for shopping, eating etc

title: Best way to navigate downtown!
review: Very clean, found pax very helpful, fast and easy to board. We had taken the metro rail and then we switched to the mover to avoid parking and walking all over. Best decision.

title: Best wat to get around downtown
review: The metromover connects with metrorail in Miami.  It’s an easy transition from one to the other.  I highly recommend it

title: Awesome investment in Miami
review: Miami is so progressive and an example to other major US metropolises.

title: Free Service
review: I took the free service from First Street Station to Fifth Street  Station in Brickell City Center to enjoy walking and dining in that area of Miami.

title: Metro in sky
review: The metromover is the best choice to discover Miami downtown easily and cheapest price because it’s free ! Different stop in the city, 3 lines, 3 loops! The quality of metromover is ok but not perfect .. I’ll still recommend.

title: Wonderful atmosphere
review: The outside dining its terrific no matter what you order.  The people are so friendly, tourists and local alike.  Very quaint area.

title: Great place to visit and eat!
review: Lots of restaurant choices and beautiful atmosphere at night. Open road with string lights. We are at two different restaurants and both were fabulous.

title: Great place to eat
review: The whole street is lined with restaurants just south of Lincoln road. Mostly Spanish variety but there are others. Park close by and walk there. There are restaurants, ta

title: Best area for restaurants
review: Lots of choice of restaurants in Espanola way, Cuban, Italian, Mexican, Spanish, etc. We dined here several times and quality of food was excellent. Very friendly. Would recommend.

title: Great atmosphere
review: Highly recomended!

title: Nicely designed Design District
review: If you like art, high end shopping, nice dining and/or urban design that is geared toward pedestrians, it's a lovely way to spend a few hours. We parked at the city garage (think it was 38th street) and spent about 5 hours going to museums and galleries (ICA, the de la Cruz foundation and a very informative and attractive gallery exhibit regarding fashion impacts on environment ), window shopping and then having early dinner at Mandolin Aegean Bistro (also reviewed that). While you don't have to go to the museums to see art as it's incorporated in the district via large scale murals, interesting buildings and unexpected artistic touches on trees and in alleys, you should because they do Not charge admission. Worthwhile to check out.

title: Shopping
review: Nice area to stroll around and do some shopping, the area is very walkable.  Nice shops galore.  Walkable area.

title: Area to stroll around
review: Design district has plenty of interesting building to see. However it seems to become more and more of a shopping area since all the high end luxury brands seem to have their store on area.

title: Impressive collection of high end shops
review: The Miami Design District is a neighborhood that mainly features a number of very high end clothing and jewelry brands. The collection of stores is impressive and the area is easy to navigate. It's fun to just walk around the area, but if high end shops aren't your thing, then this won't be of interest.

title: Walking around
review: It is located close to Wynwood. You may consider visiting it first and then hitting Wynwood.

title: nice place to visit
review: although only a small place I had a nice time visiting here , plenty of nice flora & fauna on display , a few animals as well and the added bonus of a free drink and a banana

title: Excellent Gardens - and Free!!!!
review: I am a sucker for nice gardens and have a “green thumb” or at least try really hard outside!  The gardens are well laid out - easy to traverse and have a nice combo of color.  During our visit the butterflies were busy and it was a nice way to spend an hour.  We also met the gardens director who stopped and greeted us and actually took some time to explain some of the features to us.  Very classy.  Strongly recommend this stop for others touring.

title: It's Ok
review: We landed there by error. We were looking for the Tropical Botanical of Coral Gables. Interesting but it doesn't take long to go around. Obviously just an area to unload and relax  if you are attending an event at the Convention center across the street. Probably not worth making the trip just for that. The attendant at the Nature center shop was extremely friendly and fun. I believe his name was Gaylord.

title: Botanical Oasis
review: Will visit every time I am in area (on working dyas)

title: Lovely garden to walk round
review: Lovely way to spend an hour in the sun chilling out here and an oasis of calm.

title: Worth the Experience, Tourists: Watch your bill
review: Enjoy!!

title: Cuban Culture
review: Worth a visit if your are in Miami to try the amazing food and some of the local cigar factories.  A good area to walk around a try different bars and restaurants, or just a Cuban coffee.

title: Trip to Little Havana
review: We were scheduled to go to Cuba on a cruise, but that got derailed. We spent one afternoon in Little Havana and had a great time. It’s a fun and friendly area. Great way to experience a different culture. We had a great time. I recommend taking a tour if you can.

title: Must Visit!!!
review: Little Havana is a neighborhood in Miami, Florida, USA, named after Havana the capital of Cuba, and yes – it is as vibrant as it sounds #WorldTraveler #BouskErZ #FloridaDiaries #MiamiFood #LittleHavana #FoodBlogger #CubanInfluence #eatdrinkandtravelwithsagar

title: Definitely worth a visit if you have a few days in Miami
review: Yes, it's a little rough around the edges but if you have some common sense and be nice to people, be respectful you will be jst fine. It's a wonderful experience in my opinion

title: Excellent
review: Excellent way to get around on Miami beach area the price is  free and the drivers are pleasant. They have 3 different routes so make sure you take the correct one.

title: Great way to get around!
review: Very nice the city provides a free transportation for everyone to get around! There are so many trolleys, no need to wait more than five minutes!

title: Free Ride
review: It took Miami to offer a free Trolley service.  You jump on and off when you want to go anywhere up and down Biscayne Blvd.  Very safe.  The Trolley stops are well marked in the same area as the buss stops.  It's a must

title: Great way to see Miami
review: Great way to get around the city tour guides on board who explain where you are who lives there etc well worth the price

title: Free transoportation to and from your cruise, can it be any better?
review: And it was free! Thank you city of Miami! :-)

title: Love Romero Britto
review: Visited the Britto Central store and the Romero Britto Art Gallery both on Lincoln Rd. Very colorful, vibrant and original pieces of art on display. His designs are so unique they are worthy of a visit and you can purchase small pieces from his collection for less than $250.

title: Simply Fabulous!
review: From the moment you walk in to Britto Central, you will smile.  The art is whimsical and uplifting.  The staff are very nice and know every piece.  As with all art, you'll either love it or you won't, but it's a great gallery and must-see if visiting Miami Beach.

title: Amazing and Creative Artist
review: Britto is one of my favorite artists and his gallery did not dissapoint. His creativity and fun spirit shine through his works of art and he brings a smile to my face everytime I see his work. The staff at the gallery were very friendly and helpful and shared several stories about the works of art. Great place to go if you want to smile!!

title: Positive point to check out
review: I love this artist since my first travel to Brasil. His art is a little bit childish, but very positive.

title: The best option for running or biking
review: I went for a couple of runnings during my 3 day stayed in St Regis and was really awesome. Its quite, have a route were you can easily run for 5 to 8 miles. The beach is clean and nice.

title: good for walking, but soon in shadow
review: a nice destination to stroll or jogg on the beach, but with the many high rise buildings on the beach, very early in complete shadow. So more for early birds and jetlagged Europeans than those who are looking for a late afternoon stroll on the beach.

title: Loved it
review: Great for couples. The bathroom, the shower was to die for. I washed my hair just because. The patio view late at night is so romantic. Nice spot for boo baby. Great breeze. I could live there if the price was reasonable,

title: Very ritzy
review: Nice area of Florida but not for the budget conscious!!!  Shopping, dining and lodging are all quite expensive.

title: really nice walking path
review: If you're into jogging, runnning, pushing a carriage -  the path right by the beach is a great place. There are trees for shade, and some benches for when you need a bit of relaxation. The wide expanse of white beach with lots of umbreallas from the various hotels is a very pleasant way to spend the day.

title: The best of industrial art.
review: After visiting several museums in Miami we took a stroll here. What a cool building in such a cool area. The permanent exhibit is very nice, displaying the art of industry. From toasters to vacuums, to furniture, you will like what you see and learn from these exhibits. Pay the fee support the arts, and get some culture on South beach.

title: An interesting place to visit
review: This museum is right on Washington Avenue and is a good place to visit if you are in the area.   It focused on industrial art with some really unusual exhibits to view.  Plenty of 20th culture here to appreciate and absorb.

title: Outstanding Museum: Would gladly visit again, for the 4th time.
review: This is my favorite museum ever. It can be visited in a couple of hours, has a small permanent collection on display (most of it is in storage) and proposes great temporary exhibits. They mostly pertain to early 20th Century design, art, architecture and communications.

title: "That was it?"
review: This should be one of the best museums in the country. Instead it's an enormous letdown.

title: Interesting
review: The entry fee of $12 dollars seemed on the high side for such a limited exhibit. But, the money is going In the right direction.

title: Okay
review: Interesting houses of the rich and famous. Ian not too into that sort of thing, but we took a boat ride that was informative and nicely done.

title: WISH WE COULD SEE IT
review: We always wanted to see this location. When we arrived we were turned away at the ferry station. I was told residents only.

title: See it on a river cruise
review: I saw this while doing a river cruise of Biscayne Bay. It was great seeing all the luxurious properties on this island.

title: Perfect for the ultra rich:}
review: private island for the super rich, I have been on a few occasions, you must go by ferry and invitation comes by every 30 mins (imagine forgetting something when your home from shopping) the island itself is amazing and first class all the way, Its like living in a 5 star resort 24/7, however the mosquitoes population outnumbers residents in the state!I guess you just 'cant have it all'

title: Amazing place
review: Only accessible by private boat or ferry, this barrier island is a wonder to behold! Simply beautiful and the homes are amazing~

title: General Tour & Tiger Cub Photo with Rajah
review: Overall, I think it was worth the money and I was glad to give money to such a great organization.

title: Great Family Adventure.  General Tour and Tiger Experience with older son.
review: Our family has visited many zoos all over the country.  We chose to visit this zoo because it is different.  The purpose of this zoo is to give visitors a personal experience and knowledge of the animals so they appreciate the need for zoos and conservation efforts.  It was a great experience.  Our guide, Chris, was very knowledgible  and interacted with the animals and members of the tour.  All, including our children with disabilities, were included in the interactions with animals.  As a combined celebration of my older son's adoption day anniversary and 16th birthday and great school year, we participated in a tiger cub interaction/photo session, a dream come true for him.  We were allowed interaction with the tiger cubs and as many photos as we wanted.  The cubs were allowed to play and be themselves and seemed to enjoy the session.  They were very considerate of our family with children with special needs.  Thank you for a great day and helping to make dreams come true!!  And thank you for raising awareness of the true function of zoos and importance of conservation and species survival.

title: One of the coolest experiences of my life (chimp encounter).
review: Thanks to ZWF for having such great staff and showing me the time of my life. I haven't stopped smiling since I got home.

title: 0% Customer Service
review: Young kids are running the show with zero customer service. It saddens me to leave this bad review because this place has so much potential. We paid and made a reservation for Father’s Day to take a special tour that included some interactions. It ended up being a rainy day. We requested to forgo the tour part since it was raining and just do the interactions. The staff insisted it wasn’t possible to forgo the tour part. Yet, the tour part wasn’t an option because of the rain. The staff would not go forward with just the interaction section of our tour. They ended running Father’s Day for our family of six. This place needs to work on their customer service skills. My family has visited a dozen times because the interaction with the animals is great. It’s a place we used to love. They have lost us as customers until there is change with its customer service.

title: Tiger Cub Encounter
review: My life is complete. It’s not often they have Tiger cubs and to see them, NOT sedated, is a beautiful thing. I respect how they keep their animals.

title: Art Art Art
review: The Best Art Fair in the World:. Art Basel is not only an art fair its a destination, a happening, a cultural event, a party and a show. More private planes arrive in Miami during Art Basel then the entire rest of the year together. If you like art this is a must.

title: best show in Miami beach  . do not miss it
review: best show in Miami beach  . do not miss itFor me the large representation of classic post 1960 artists like Andy Warhol, Barbara Kruger, Robert Mangold, Kenny Sharf and Basquiat is necessary bounty, but the inclusion of very good and slightly bizarre contemporary artists like Kehinde Wiley, and Paul MCarthy is what keeps me going back.

title: Art Basel, the best art fair in the world
review: There are a lot of art fairs in the world but I think that Art Basel in Miami Beach is the best one. The crowd is the international one with really incredible people coming annually from all over in the world. The art galleries are the most famous and international ones. The art is absolutely wonderful. You can look for Picasso or Dali as well as for young artist and new entries. But the best of this fair is that being in Florida in December, while in US or Europe is winter, in South Florida you can go to the beach in the morning, to the fair and related events all the day long and then you can have an incredible night of fine dining in hundreds fantastic places in town and then you can enjoy the metropolitan nightlife of Miami and Miami Beach till very late. Be prepared to a tour de force about the incredible amount of events, openings, cocktails and parties for the insiders from all over the world.

title: Impossible to miss this event !
review: I love this event ! You have so many things to do and see during this week, expositions in all the city. Everywhere you go, something happen, even restaurants, on the streets, parks ..... Amazing !

title: First ever in Miami
review: Nestled in the Art permeated area of Wynwood, this is definitely a must stop!

title: The passion for Haitian culture is evident.
review: I had an excellent time at the Haitian Heritage Museum! Upon arrival, I was greeted by one of the founders of the museum, Serge. He was very friendly and welcoming. He educated me on the history of the museum, and why it was created. In doing so, he also gave me a brief history of Haitians in Miami, Little Haiti, and, the country of Haiti itself. The passion Serge and his team have for Haiti, Haitians, and Haitian culture is highly evident in their carefully curated pieces on display. Their current physical location is temporary until they are able to build a permanent site. With that in mind, the pieces on display can be viewed as a "sneak peek" of what is to come once they move to their permanent site. I would highly recommend a visit here for anyone who likes art, history, Haitian culture, or looking for an experience off the beaten path.

title: TITAN's USA Coast to Coast Tour
review: The itinerary, though 4 weeks long, was fascinating and extremely well paced.  Even my 89-year-old husband kept pace and loved every minute.  Our tour director, Joan Williams, was so well informed and shared her knowledge with us in a most interesting way that we can declare her our best tour director ever, which is quite a compliment coming from people who travel frequently and to all parts of the world.  And when we had problems at the airport before our departure, the entire Titan's support team jumped into action and made it possible for us to travel.  A big thank you to all of you.  You all deserve full marks!

title: Welcoming
review: I don't think I'd the catholic guild talking when I say that this place truly feels like home. I've been looking for a catholic church that is not too rigid while in mass and that you feel the warm from people. This is the place. Not sure if the difference is because is close to the university but even the priests know how to connect with the people with their homilies. This was the 4th church I've visited in the Miami area... finally I found "my church". Hope they dioceses doesn't rotate the priests. They truly know how to deliver the messages  from the Bible in today's world. Great place.

title: Good surprise
review: Take a break from shopping. In the middle of Lincoln Rd Mall, you'll have a good surprise entering into ArtCenter/South Florida. Since you can appreciate contemporary visual art at artists' studios, you experience a different way to visit an art exhibition. Sometimes artists are working, so you can see them in their own environment. And it's free!

title: Woodlawn on 117 Ave & 116 St.
review: I am completely disappointed in the service received upon my fathers death. The initial “planning meeting” was fine and the employees were sensitive to our needs. I guess that’s only to make the blow of what you are spending more tolerable. The money necessary to pay for the costs of burying your loved one is immediate. Make no mistake about that! The viewing wasn’t awful, they just forgot to put the water bottles  that was included as part of the package. After the burial, it took 12 weeks to get a sketch, yes, just a sketch, on what would be placed on the marker. It’s been more than 6 weeks since reviewing a piece of paper with a sketch on it. After countless calls and texts, my fathers grave sight has yet to have a marker identifying where he’s at. I do not recommend Caballero Woodlawn. I have learned a lot in this process and the stress factor was unnecessary when dealing with a loss of a loved one!

title: Excellent local theater for a good laugh
review: Support the local artist and have a fun night. Quaint theater family run, very professional and highly talented artists.

title: El Diamante de mi Fantasma (theater comedy)
review: OMG! this play was so much fun. It's on it's 3 week and only runs for 4 weeks. You have to go see it! The play is in Spanish.

title: soccer field!
review: This park has a huger soccer field with consection stand. Small playground area for the kids and small walking trail around the soccer field. There a couple of pavilion available.

title: Best Thrift Store in Miami
review: I would give 5 stars for the amazing things you can find for very reasonable prices but although the place is enormous, it is always teeming with voracious bargain hunters who may not always be the most polite. I'll brave the crowds any day and I do - quite often. If you are into thrifting and are visiting Miami, this is the place. I have found antiques, vintage everything, records, art, you name it. They just recently started accepting credit cards which makes it a lot easier. The lines are LONG but there are about a dozen cashiers who are all very nice.

title: A Hidden Gem
review: Though this nature preserve has been open to the public for decades, most in Dade County are unaware of it's existence. Surrounded by development like an island of foliage, this preserve contains a number of natural habitats: Pine Rocklands, Tropical Hardwood Hammocks, and Freshwater Wetlands. I was expecting to be through the whole preserve in a matter of minutes, but 30 minutes later I was still hiking the shaded trails. Just when you think you've reached the end, the trails continue to more habitats. It is hard to believe that you are surrounded by civilization, as just a few feet into the preserve, you can almost imagine being deep in the Florida Everglades. In addition to the trails, there is a lake on the West side which has a plentiful population of aquatic plants on it's shoreline including pond apples and cattails. I saw a variety of wildlife while exploring the preserve for less than an hour including: gray squirrel, brown & bark anole lizards, anhinga, spiny box spider, mockingbird, skipper butterfly, bull ant, and mosquito fish. Though admission is free and open to the public, nearby parking is at paid meters. I will definitely keep returning.

title: Greta musical performances by a community symphonic band!
review: GMSB members are adults who volunteer their time and talents to the Band.  The purpose is to provide the Miami area with a first-class musical aggregation and to provide opportunity for musical expression in an organized concert band.  The Band performs publicly on a regular basis at various indoor and outdoor locations, giving the residents of the area an opportunity to hear the beauty and diversity of the symphonic band repertoire." (quoting their Website)

title: OK little shop
review: Not much really to speak of. But if you need a last minute item before your flight, this isn't a bad little spot.

title: Beautiful spot. Informative tour
review: The shark valley tram tour is worth the money. It is very informative and the tour ranger was very enthusiastic. We saw a lot of wildlife and great views from the tower.

title: Ok visit
place: Museum of Art and Design at Miami Dade College
review: Entrance is not free as I'd thought. It cost over 11.00 per person. There wasn't much to see and we couldn't go to the top floor. We could only explore 2 floors. IMO, the price isn't worth it. My daughter and I were disappointed.

title: Impressive artwork by Cuban Artist on Brickell Avenue Bridge
review: Great 53 foot column artwork on the Bridge that many pass without even looking. It was installed in 1995. The artist,  Manuel Carbonell, was a noted Cuban born artist and died in Miami at age 93. The column depicts natural and cultural scenes that were derived from Carbonell's understanding of native Tequesta Indians. Slow down and take a look next time you are there.

title: Simple memorial plaza
review: The plaza and memorial is dedicated in memory of a group of Cuban refugees who were attempted escape from Cuba via boat and were subsequently attacked and drowned by Fidel Castro's forces on May 13, 1994.  It's interesting to see the memorial mural with the map of Cuban and ship, however, it is very simple and you can take it all in relatively quickly. Worth seeing if you have a particular interest in Cuban history, but I wouldn't recommend a trip out of the way for the average tourist.

title: Plus Points, If You Can Find This!
review: An interesting monument located along a drawbridge to go from the heart of “historic” downtown to the trendy Brickell area.

title: Impressive pillar
review: If you are by the Brickell drawbridge you can't miss the pillar. It is 53 ft High and was constructed by a Cuban artist. It is worth taking the time to check out if you are in this downtown area.

title: Museum Tour
place: Museum of Art and Design at Miami Dade College
review: The displays of art and design is very good.  Need to allow time to look, reflect and read about the artist and art...

title: Incredible ecosystem
review: My husband and I drove the I41 from Miami to Marco Island and stopped at the Visitor Centre. The drive was easy and picturesque. Two lanes most of the time. Good signage. Not really knowing what to expect we are so glad we stopped. We took the 2hr covered tram ride to the observation walkway (45 mins there and then back) The cost ($19 for seniors plus $30 entrance fee) was higher than we expected but at least the money goes towards maintaining the park! The visitor centre has a small shop, water fountain and basic but clean restrooms. The guide and tram driver were very well informed and provided interesting commentary whilst pointing out the wildlife and stoping to allow visitors to take photographs. Recommend sitting on the non driver side on the way to the walkway and on the drivers side on the way back to get the best views. We saw baby alligators, an alligator nest, 4 adult alligators, turtles, dragonflies, tilapia fish and a variety of birds including egrets and herons. We had about 20 mins at the observation centre which is easy to access and has clean restrooms.  No mosquitoes! The tram driver had cold bottled water on board for sale ($1). If you are are not sure whether to visit such a unique ecosystem - I would say do!

title: Average Visitors Center
review: The NPS visitors center was decent, and nothing special.  Had the routine items for sale. I was disappointed they did not have stickers for Passport books. They had stamps, so we did not totally strike out. If you go the Shark Valley,  you will have to go into the Visitors Center to buy Tram tickets. Overall it was nice, and clean. Bathroom were also kept up, so no issues there.

title: Okay visitors centre, could use a little more
review: You go to Shark Valley to walk among the rivers rather than to see the visitor's centre. It's okay, there's a shop and some information about the animals, but it's not really an attraction in itself.

title: Fun Entertainment for any Age Group
review: Music performed is outstanding and a great variety of music.  Muscianship of the band is very above average and for the price of a ticket you will love it and it will contribute to keeping music "live",

title: Music Everyone Will Enjoy!
review: The Greater Miami Symphonic Band performs concerts throughout the year providing a variety of high quality music.  Concert selections range from favorite marching band pieces to show tunes and popular songs.  Conductors and soloists are outstanding. Several concerts include well done original compositions with the composer present, sometimes conducting.  Tickets are very reasonable, and the band may be heard in Gusman Hall on the University of Miami campus, Pinecrest Gardens and at the Biltmore Hotel on the Fourth of July.

title: What a great place for a walk in nature.
review: Enjoy yourself and take a walk in nature.

title: Wow! Such Deals!!
review: We all loved shopping at Red, White and Blue. The thrift store is super organized even by colors! They had a 50% off sale the day we shopped. Great bargains.

title: Large open-space park with playground Equipment.
review: Many of the walls are covered with murals painted by local artists.

title: Childfree
review: We all had a great time at this small theater. Been here many times and the plays are good!

title: Loved looking through this studio
review: We wandered into the studio at night, and were thrilled to see the magnificant artists that work here. If you're into art, definately check this place out. The mosaic floor is tres cool.

title: Awesome Studios
review: There are 2 buildings to check out.  Some of the artists were there in there studios while I went through.

title: Very nice art!
review: Overall a nice place to check out if you're an art lover.

title: Fr Ayala.
review: Fr Ayala. Excellent homily.  If you haven't been attending mass On a regular basis I suggest you give Fr Ayala a try.  May make you a regular.

title: Catholic
review: Catholic Church catering to University of Miami family.  Plenty of activities for students and young professionals.  It is a comfortable and welcoming parish with a plethora of mass times.

title: Excellent Catholic Church - Non-pretentious and in excellent location
review: This is an old established Catholic Church which is unpretentious and if what you want is to pray or attend service it is excellent. It is not a typical beautiful church but it is warm and well attended by University of Miami students as it is the closest church to campus. Parishioners are very nice. There is parking available but it can get full very quickly and have to park around the neighborhood. Check day and times for services.

title: "Miami See It Like A" Native Classic Poster
review: I had a poster that needed to be repaired and framed. The company was professional, fast, and the quality was great. Thanks for a job well done.

title: What a pleasant surprise!
review: Admittedly I am a lover of Haitian Art, so I was a little prejudiced before I made the visit. Instead of paintings, there was a fabulous exhibit of photography by Marc Baptiste. It was also good fortune that the curator of the museum Evelyn was there to take us from photograph to photograph. She was so passionate, informative, and inspiring that I knew right then and there I was in the right place at the right time. As a special bonus, the discussion of art extrapolated into a discussion that was art unto itself.

title: Very disappointing
review: Haiti surely has a rich heritage in art and (even more so) handicraft. However, you don't find any of that here. This is a museum without artifacts. The exhibits are just some walls posted with texts and pictures about Haitian history. A bit like pages torn out of history textbook meant for elementary school . You would probably get more out of reading about Haiti on Wikipedia. A meaningless kind of museum, a waste of money that could be spent much better, whether on Haiti or in the Haitian communities in the US. Sadly, an example of Haiti at it's worst. The (nice and friendly) staff seemed to well appreciate the nonsense of this museum: Nobody turned up until ½ hour after official opening hours.

title: Great Gallery!
review: San Paul Gallery is a must-see for artists, photographers, painters, musicians, and art appreciators.  A friend and I were at the airport hotel and looking for fun things to do in the area and came upon this charming gallery. We were absolutely delighted!  The music, the art, the general ambiance, was electric!  The staff was courteous and eager to answer questions about the exhibit.  If you're in the Wynwood area be sure to visit the gallery walk held every second Saturday of the month; I assure you there's something for everyone -art lovers and creative-types alike- you won't be disappointed!

title: Charming
review: The San Paul Gallery is in Miami's art district near the Wynwood Walk. It is charming with some great pieces of art and worth a stop in as you are strolling around the art district.

title: REPEAT AS OFTEN AS YOU CAN!
review: This is our 2nd visit, and I am sure no two visits are the same as seasonal changes provide a different experience every time!!  The butterfly garden is magical!  The orchids are glorious.  What a labor of love from all the volunteers who work tirelessly to keep the property immaculate, and all the plants trimmed/shaped/pruned so something is always in bloom.   Even if it is hot out, you can be in and out of shaded areas.  Also they offer benches in areas AND a tram/cart to get you around. And water stations!!  THANK YOU

title: Fairchild Tropical Botanic Garden
review: Fabulous place to tour for hours. Wish I had brought the grandkids. Lucked out with perfect weather, but even in summer, this would have been worth the visit. The butterfly exhibit was astonishing, as as the Madagascar garden. The grounds are meticulously attended to, the volunteers - mostly older people - friendly and well-informed - and the experience eye opening for this guy who is usually not a botanic garden enthusiast.

title: Thanks
review: Went to the orchid show today. We meet Norma Craig, a volunteer. She gave us so much information and so many to go to places to go, I don’t think we’ll every finish our bucket list. Thanks for the patience and the background information she provided. I love self empowered women.

title: Beautiful Tropical Garden !
review: Beautiful Tropical Garden. The butterfly house is a must. Many palms species, there is a specimen african baobab of over 70 years old and even a nice exhibit of the dry forest forest of Madagascar ! The electric car tour free is interresting as you get a lot of information from the guide.

title: One of my happy places
review: I go to Fairchild Tropical Gardens whenever I need a little respite from the world ( I’m a member). It is a beautiful place to walk and enjoy the sun, fauna, butterflies , iguanas and lizards. I would highly recommend a visit - it will restore your soul!

title: Excellent location, and the care is improving.
review: This park has excellent location, over 10 acres of park land. The jogging trail needs quite a bit of repair and updates. The playground needs to be well cleaned with pressure hoses. The baseball field, the soccer field and basketball courts are very good.

title: Recreation Surrounded by Nature
review: This park is a perfect balance of recreation and nature. There is a playground, community center, tennis courts, basketball courts, and an activity field for soccer/baseball surrounded on all sides by an endangered pine rockland forest. There are is also a nature/jogging trail through the pine forest. As I hiked I observed a variety of wildlife including butterflies (including a rare Florida Atala), brown anole lizards, dragonflies, moths, and a spider. Parking and admission are free.

title: Vishnu Stone Sculpture By mogul Interior
review: Vishnu is the Protector of the Universe.This is a very unique and wonderful reverse carving black stone vishnu statue. Vishnu has one head and four arms.In his hands he holds a discus, mace,couch-shell and one hand here rests on the lap, with upturned open palm. And vishnu sitting on serpent.His face is always clam and peaceful. His claws are dug into a snakes body and his beak is about to grasp a snakes head. He wears a crown on his head.Bedecked with precious jewelry adorns on his chest and his wrist.Vishnu in a protection posture.

title: walking park
review: This park is near the water, beautiful to see the boat dock. The park is about 1-2 miles around. No fee for entrance, fee to park.

title: Impressive sales
review: Great beach and cruise wear from name brand designers. We were able to get 2 Tommy Bahama shirts at 50% off and a Tommy Bahama dress at 70% off.

title: One of the Largest
review: Palmetto Bay Park is one of the largest areas of green space in all of the City of Palmetto Bay. It is conveniently located just off US1 and is within walking distance of many neighborhoods. Visiting on a late Monday afternoon there were plenty of people of all ages and races enjoying the park. There are biking/jogging trails, outdoor exercise equipment, soccer, football & baseball fields, a playground, and wide areas of grass and trees. The baseball fields have netting over the bleachers to protect spectators from home run balls. The wildlife I observed over the 1 hour I was present at the park consisted of mostly birds and included: white ibis, mocking birds, blue jays, grackles, and others. The East side of the park was well maintained and had green freshly mowed grass. Unfortunately the far West side of the park does not appear to be routinely maintained as it had a lot of lumpy, sick looking brown grass filled with weeds and trash especially in the Southwest corner. The grass was also long in this West side area and the middle of the field was used as a dumping ground for old metal soccer goals, many of which were lying in rusty heaps on the ground. Besides these eyesores the only other aspect of the park which wasn't cheery, was the Miami Children's Hospital Outpatient Center built on the Northwest side of the park. The park's bike path even goes right up to the hospital's back door. On the positive side, at least the kids inside the hospital can look out the windows to see a park, and maybe play games in the park before or after a medical appointment. There are beautiful shady Poinciana trees lining the jogging trail, perfect for picnicking under. There was also a variety of other flowering and even fruiting plants (mangoes, coco plums) Parking and admission are free.This was my first visit, and I will keep returning.

title: Great vibrant church - perfect for all ages and great for kids
review: I recently visited the Miami Vineyard as I had an unchurched friend that I wanted to take there to see if it might be the kind of church she would like to attend.  The Vineyard is large and offers four services at the weekend (on both Saturdays and Sundays) as well as social events, coffee before and after the service, lots of activities and is especially good for families.   The music is loud and vibrant, with lots of singers and musicians on the stage;  the pastor's sermon had multiple points and I would say has the kind of content that you can apply to your life right away, however, I would not say that it was theologically deep so it's a perfect place for seekers, new believers and younger families although there was a smattering of people over 55 in the congregation the night we went.  Very approachable, very casual (jeans and shorts) and very multi media friendly.

title: Fresh, new theater in Miami --- In English and Spanish!
review: If you want to get a sense of the local culture in Miami, Microtheater Miami is an interesting way to do it on a night out!

title: Biggest Bonsai Collection
review: In the Northern part of Redland is Miami Tropical Bonsai.  It is a bonsai farm basically. From newer plants to ones that are decades old, this place has the largest collection you'll likely ever see and most of it is for sale.

title: Quiet, peaceful
place: Castellow Hammock Preserve and Nature Center
review: It was locked when I got there even though the website listed it as open that time and day. Someone did answer the phone when I called and said I could park on the outside and walk in, also someone came to unlock it about 15 minutes later and I was able to park inside. There was nothing wrong with the restrooms and though no naturalist or volunteer was on site, I did get the trail guide and the trail is easy enough to follow if you navigate carefully over the roots and coral rock. This is a well known park among bird and butterfly watchers so happy that birds and butterflys have some natural habitat in the area. I recommend combining a trip there with other nearby sites if you are interested in the South Florida ecosystem.

title: Very good location
review: Its all worth taking the way out to the airport

title: Great Brewery in Doral! Come have a few pints
review: Beat Culture is a great addition to the Miami Beer scene. They have lots planned and from what you can already see and taste, they will not disappoint.

title: Surprisingly Good Beer and Grub
review: While staying overnight at the Days Inn in Doral, near the airport, we stopped in their lounge to check it out.  We were surprised to see it had a brewery and a good one at that.  We decided to eat lunch here while waiting for our room to be ready and we totally enjoyed ourselves.  The beer was really good and they make one heck of a grilled cheese sandwich too. The menu is limited but if you like "comfort food" there are some selections you might enjoy.  I recommend the smashed avocado with chips  for an appetizer to share.  Portions are good and everything was really tasty.  We came back later that night for a drink in the bar and the place was hopping with lots of great energy.  Friendly people and good beer at reasonable prices.  It's a winner!

title: Hidden Natural Florida
place: Castellow Hammock Preserve and Nature Center
review: I had not visited this preserve in a long time, and was eager to see if it has changed. Parking and admission were free. At the front entrance there are fields for recreation as well as a butterfly garden, and a small 1 room nature center. From the outside you may expect that the nature trail is short, but I was pleasantly surprised when I was still hiking an hour later. Be very careful not to get lost while hiking and always keep an eye out for the orange paint markings on the trees to help navigate your way out as the main trail sometimes disappears and other non-marked trails split off. I followed the paint markings on the trees and still ended up going in a circle at one point before I noticed familiar surroundings. Hiking boots are best as much of the trail is touch terrain of tree roots and jagged rock. There are is also a deep solution hole that you don't want to fall into. It is amazing to think that this escape from civilization is surrounded on all sides by farms and plant nurseries. As I walked through the ancient forest I could almost imagine encountering Native Americans or the Blair Witch. We observed a lot of wildlife during the 1 hour hiking the preserve including: zebra longwing and sulfur butterflies, mockingbirds, mourning doves, grackles, red bellied woodpecker, brown & bark anole lizards, gray squirrel, cottontail rabbit, golden silk spiders, pearl spiders, tree snails, ground snails, and unfortunately lots of mosquitoes. We will return.

title: Local Natural Park
place: Castellow Hammock Preserve and Nature Center
review: I'm not one for negative reviews but this park is best enjoyed by very local folks since there's not enough there for a long distance trek. The butterfly garden is all but non-existent and the hiking trail is closed off so it isn't a 1/2 mile as advertised. I didn't see many picnic tables but the rest rooms and meeting room was decent.  Not much to see but a fair amount of open area for family activities.

title: Go for the Hummingbirds -- come back for the marvelous experience.
place: Castellow Hammock Preserve and Nature Center
review: We visited to see a couple of rare hummingbirds that normally are not seen in the Eastern United States.  The Buff-bellied and Rufous Hummingbirds were super, but our greatest memory of the visit was the amazing staff.  A young woman named Laura who works at at the park, came out when she noticed that we were in the butterfly garden.  She displayed an understanding of the special avian visitors in her park that I have never seen anywhere in the world.  She knew the personalities of the birds, their habits, exact movements, and precise locations.  Because of her warm, knowledgable, and expert assistance, we got great looks at all three species of hummingbirds that were there that day.  A truly memorable visit.

title: Awesome
place: Castellow Hammock Preserve and Nature Center
review: This place is...simply awesome. Our meetup group hiked there after visiting a fruit festival (Redland Summer Fruit Festival) in the area, and I must say, this place was simply delightful! The hike is not very long, but it is mighty interesting - full of curves and green limestone, which makes it quite the exotic little treat. The hike will take about 20 or so minutes - please wear proper hiking shoes and enough mosquito repellent. Since there are many curves and limestone rock, you must be careful to note where you step. There are some frogs/toads hopping away, so watch that you do not step on them! In one area, there is even a sinkhole enveloped by an enormous tree. Very spooky and picturesque. I would definitely go back to this little gem. The vegetation/forestry reminded me of being back home in CT, which was a very nice reminder. Go hike!

title: Relaxed/Cool nightclub/bar
review: Good nightclub/bar, it is way bigger inside than you think. Its a good place to hang out with friends with a dance floor and pool table and good drinks

title: Small spot but good music on certain nights
review: Small spot but good music on certain nights, pool table in the back and some couches to lounge while you hear some beats.

title: This club is awesome!
review: The music is always phenomenal at this place! The dance floor is a little tight n the bar is always super crowded but they do have sexy waitresses to take care of you.  This is a great place with a chilled mixed crowd. Cover charges depend on the nights you go buts it worth it if you want somewhere cool to vibe in!

title: Anoraak
review: Drinking stella beer for 9$ now. Music sounds good so far

title: Amazing party
review: Was there by french a guide book (Le Routard) recommandation, looking for underground club, with normal people enjoying nice music, and not a fake boring place as all tourist goes in SoBe. I had an amazing night time. Was by change a live show by famous DJ from Island GusGus. I even didn't know about them, but get in love of this music after the first set! Ambiance was crazy, everyone dancing and a real friendly ambiance. I meet some cool people and enjoyed my evening with them till 6am. Will for sure come again on my next stop to Miami.

title: Always fun!
review: We saw 3 plays and were great!

title: prayer time.
review: Big but homie, nice place if you need a place for prayer.  Modern twist on a traditional religious fervor.

title: Nice Sound System and Sarah Packiam is Great!
review: Definitely will see her again.  The sound system is studio quality which was real nice even in a packed house.

title: Hip, cool, crazy place
review: I felt this was NYC in Miami.  Hip, cool, crazy place.  Packed.  Good music but a bit too heavy.

title: Velvet and Red
review: I took a star away because there is a CORNBALL velvet rope , red carpet and bouncer charging a fee outside. LOL Cracked me UP. My bf happened to know the bouncer (really? A bouncer outside a spot that wants to be speakeasy?) and we didn't pay. Otherwise we wouldn't have gone in on principal. I mean-I don't pay to get in bars at home(Brooklyn). I'm gonna pay in Miami? Don't think so.

title: Hip
review: Super hip site for live music. The bar is unmarked, and the doorman is great. Inside is like a hipster living room with bands, on the floor, an arm's length away. Seek this gem out

title: Nice place to spend time with kids and family
