Since security doesn't allow outside liquids in, people in front of us were passing out from dehydration, in which we had to take care of the people ourselves. Incredibly poor oversight. With as many police officers and security guards around, it was pathetic that no one was around to help when we needed someone. Seems like everyone who worked there (including the police officers) were too busy talking to eachother.

title: First visit
review: Super fun weekend, the line up for the main stage was great both Friday and Sunday. If you're thinking about going I'm just going to let you know the line just to get in is going to take you almost an hour. The festival was a lot of fun and already booking for next year.

title: Wonderfully eclectic
review: What a wonderful and fascinating little shop to wander through, so may bright colorful art objects you can't help but smile.

title: just beautiul
review: this little gallery is just amazing. mariano the artist is rom argentina, an amazing person an artist, is a gallery that you have to stop by

title: Great Fun
review: Lots of fun pieces. The artwork is fun & full of life!  It is playful & inviting. I look forward to seeing more

title: Viewed from the bus
review: It made me smile and feel excited about my week stay in SOBE. I wasn't able to take a photo since we were moving quickly but I will always remember this colorful welcome sign!

title: Kodak Moment
review: Get your camera ready as you drive by! A great photo to start your memories with!  Don't miss it!  I wish they had a place you could pull over and really get a great pic!

title: Great photo op!
review: Your visit to Miami Beach wouldn’t be complete without a picture of this large Welcome to Miami Beach colored mural.

title: Nice
review: This is a wonderful way to great tourists who are arriving at the beach from the seaport or airports

title: Beautiful, clean, calm, relaxing, delicious
review: Food was delicious, great choices of wine, atmosphere impecable!

title: Fabulous Arts Center
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: This was our second visit to an event at the Arsht Center.  We saw "Four: The Vivaldi Project" a collaborative work between Decadancetheatre a hip  hop dance company and Nu Deco Ensemble a contemporary orchestra.  Amazing work that brought down the house.

title: Costly Outing
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: We are season ticket holders and Valet Park for all events and we have not had any issues until Saturdays event.   They were rushing us (we know why now) and we normally go around the car to make sure everything is in order but we did not this time.  Apparently one of the valets backed into another car or a post and damaged my rear bumper to the tune of $2,000+.   Remedies are non-existent at best.   Make sure not to allow them to rush you so you go around the vehicle before you leave the premises and note any damages.

title: Carnival Studio Theater - fun "Off Broadway" venue!
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: A very fun and special evening - and very different than the "big theater" night out.

title: Great Venue
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Beautiful performing arts Center , centrally located on Biscayne Blvd just north of downtown. Comprised of the Ziff Opera , Knight concert Hall and the Carnival Theater.

title: Sound system
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Unless you are seated in the front rows, poor sound. The best seats in the house are in the Pit, or rows A to C.

title: Check This Area Out!
review: Unusual area, places to eat, interesting stores, amazing plants.  We wanted to eat at the restaurant but we were too early and it wasn't open yet.  (next time!).  Calm garden with beautiful trees and plants.  Not huge, but definitely worth a visit.

title: Getting to know Miami as local
review: Very nice place. Family oriented. Lots of small peculiar boutiques with interesting merchandise. Very clean. Valet parking although we found parking in the street-meter parking. I would go again if I am around the area.

title: Great Service at Visitor Center in Lincoln Road
place: Miami Beach Latin Chamber of Commerce
review: We had a great experience when visiting Miami Beach in June,this city is not only beautiful, it has has excellent service. Don't miss the Visitor Center at Lincoln Road,  their welcome and assistance was the best! The people who work there know what they are recommending. They offer free maps, guides and gave us excellent tips and plans on what to do and see, with road map directions and all. We plan to return and see them again. Head out to discover Miami after you visit them!

title: Get Info Here
place: Miami Beach Latin Chamber of Commerce
review: Visit the Latin Chamber of Commerce to get info on what is happening and where to go in Miami Beach.  Friendly, informative staff will assist you with any question you may have regarding this beautiful city.

title: Available help
place: Miami Beach Latin Chamber of Commerce
review: We went by mistake to find out about maps of Miami, and found out that it was all in reference of employment and business yet, the staff was friendly and extended themselves to give us advice and maps for the area

title: Great place to network your business!
place: Miami Beach Latin Chamber of Commerce
review: Excellent variety of business people and a hub for networking your business for years!

title: Beautiful gallery and artwork: Snotty, rude staff
review: I was the only person in the gallery yet none of the (3) staff  members would acknowledge or even look at me. I asked for a price on the big white snow leopard (beautiful). The sales girl was yacking loudly on her  cellphone right next to me. She told me she was busy on the phone and asked: "Do you have problem with that" in a tough,confrontational manner. It always amazes me how companies can spend a fortune on a great product and showroom then allow rude staff to run the clients off. Oh well........if you want to be insulted, stop in.

title: Shock awe-  Fabulous collection
review: My husband and I visited the National Geographic Gallery on a whim.  We were dazzled a the collection.  Brilliant photos of an amazing array of animals, breathtaking wildlife and lovely landscapes.  It was a wonderful surprise to find a gallery of such high quality photographs among boutiques and restaurants in a vacation corner of Florida..  I could not pull myself together to inform the curator of my delight as I gushed like a moron,..  The positions and the lighting were well executed.   This was a highlight of our trip to Lauderdale.

title: Beautiful Theatre
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: This was my first time experiencing the Adrienne Arsht Center as I bought tickets to see the Lion King Live. The theatre to my surprise was grand and extremely beautiful. The orchestra seating was amazing,I had an awesome view and the seats were comfortable. It was definitely worth spending the extra cash on!

title: Beautiful place but can not hear very well
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Concessions amble but very expensive

title: Great venue
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: This place is beautiful and impressive. This is the second time I have attended an event her and couldn’t be happier.  The seats offer great views and the acoustics amazing.

title: Fantastic venue for music
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Beautiful venue to experience a full orchestra. We had tier 2, side,  left seats, last row, and had a fantastic view of the whole stage. The acoustics are excellent. In fact, you can even hear the people on stage speak to the audience without a microphone. Any show in this venue would be worthwhile to see. No obstructions, no echo.

title: ¡FUÁCATA!
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Went to see our friend play last night.  We were in the carnival theater in the arsht center.  Great little theater.  Great lighting and sound.  All good seats.  Show was great.  This show was general seating.  Don't know if all the plays in that venue are general but if it is then get there early.  They also have a bar with some food which you can bring in.

title: Free Tour!
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Overall great experience; tour is free, informative and a great way to pass an hour in this beautiful complex!

title: Miami at its best
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: This is our first winter in Miami, and we've been thrilled by what a fantastic city it is, and particularly the rich and diverse cultural offerings the city has to offer, especially at the fantastic Arsht Center.  We've attended symphonies, jazz performances, ballet, modern dance, and theatre, and they have been every bit the caliber of what we've found in Manhattan, a very Lincoln Center experience. The venue is superb, the seats are comfortable, and they all have wonderful views, even the seats in the upper tier, which we got for most performances we attended. Tickets aren't cheap, but they're cheaper than Manhattan, and we were NEVER disappointed.

title: Miami City Ballet Program 4
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Season Ticket Holders. Will be back!!!

title: Great experience!
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: I came here with a Canadian friend for a matinee performance of Come from Away, which is a fantastic play and musical. Thoroughly enjoyed it.  We parked across the street in the lot, for $15.  This was my second time visiting this venue and like my first visit, it was freezing cold so I would recommend that you bring a sweater or cardigan. I had no trouble hearing the sound, which I thought was good, and the seats were comfortable. We had orchestra seats and felt it was good value for money. All the staff are very nice, and we thoroughly enjoyed coming here. Highly recommended for any performances.

title: MISO Opening Night - October 2019
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Fully realizing that Miami is not Vienna, Berlin, London or Milan and that Conductor Marturet is par for the course, but he is no Karajan or Bernstein, the 7th was flat and with lots of mistakes. Dudamel would have done a much better job. This performance was like attending an opening night at the National Gallery of Art in DC (which I have done numerous times) and finding Rembrandt and Romero Britto in the same exhibition. Unforgivable. Marturet bringing together this quasi-Cuban upbeat music and the genius of Beethoven is as Frankensteinian an approach as they come. His audience, clearly, was equally ignorant about the mix and spent their evening applauding EACH MOVEMENT. Something that I had neither seen nor heard in 40 years. Even Marturet noticed and simply laughed at it by telling the audience “applaud whenever you feel like it.” It should have been a clear message, but instead it fueled the abysmal ignorance of the audience. Marturet, cognizant of his gargantuan mistake of mixing the two genres, had a minimal presence of mind of recognizing…and I quote “I know that many of you will ask yourselves what is Cuban music doing with Beethoven…what can I say, it’s Miami!” And with that, he confirmed the irrefutable truth about this Gobi Desert of classical culture: Gloria and Emilio Estefan are the highest exponent of music in this town. Sad, but true, my friends. Sad but true.

title: Ultra veteran says don’t go
review: Ohh don’t get me started on the getting out! What a nightmare. I left the festival at 1:30 and got to my home at 5. My suggestion is take an Uber to the shuttle and then get in any bus to get out of Key Biscayne. Just get out and call an Uber there. Also, leave around 12:30ish or earlier so you’re not missing out on everything but you don’t get stuck in that hell hole of traffic

title: Exceeded Expectations
review: SO this was my first Ultra experience, took the ferry, so no issues with transportation like others have had. I found it simply amazing. Incredible engineering, effects and artist installations....but i am not 20 either...soooo, my take is different than a "typical" festival attendee. Research and being prepared made it all the ultimate adventure. Simple fabulous....to me.

title: Music: A Transportation: F  Staff: D
review: New venue seemed great, but getting 60-80k people on and off an island is a challenge, and unfortunately they failed.  End of night one, After being told no less than 5 different things, from no busses, you need to walk, to go down there, nope, go back up there, it took 3 hours to finally get on a bus.  Ultra 5K was born.  People walking home on the bridge.  They admitted the first night was a failure and they pledged to fix it for night 2... well it was a little more organized, people walked again, seeing if they could improve on their 5K time... but we only got back to hotel 10 minutes earlier than night before.  Not wanting to repeat for a third time, we opted to leave early the last night.  Still a challenge to find a bus, I guess because they didn’t expect people to leave at 9...?  Artists/DJ’s were great.  A little sound bleed from the proximity of the stages, but inside it was great.  I literally didn’t want to leave.  I won’t be back while it’s at this venue, I just don’t see how they can logistically get so many people out after it’s over.  Too bad.

title: Terrible organisation.
review: For an event going for at least 6 years, the organisation and assistance is pathetic. Being a ticket holder your behaviour was pathetic.

title: Ultra is AWESOME - Except for 1 thing - so take this with you LADIES!
review: Ultra Music Festival is a super fun week to be in Miami – there are tons of events going on all over the place. Miami is not too hot but still great beach weather! The festival itself is over the top with setups, all the stages, sound and the backdrop of Miami is EPIC!!! The one HORRIBLE thing about this festival are the bathrooms… and so here is the solution!! If you are a FEMALE and you are going to Ultra – MAKE SURE that you take disposable pee funnels with you! They fit in a pocket, you just pop them open and stand to pee. You don’t even mind how bad the portapotty is because you don’t get near any contaminated surfaces! I LOVE the SaniGirl ones which are disposable, practical, easy to use and 100% recyclable/eco-friendly (sanigirl.com)  Having these with you will make a huge difference – stay clean/happy/fresh & enjoy the MUSIC! Ultra is TOP!!

title: Bad Address
review: Correct to 1745 N Bayshore Dr, Miami, FL 33132

title: The best outdoor park in Miami
review: The best outdoor park in Miami. And the best location of course. The water front park is beyond beautiful. Every imaginable sport and activity is available. Must visit.

title: Exercise for yourself, your children, your dogs
review: I would not venture here after dark.

title: Downtown Tennis in Miami
review: For tennis lessons check out nearby Backhand City to reserve a class. They have Private and Group Tennis Lessons for adults including: White Falcon, Terminator, Accelerator and LiveBall classes.

title: Beautiful venue
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Right off I-95 but parking is $15. Four levels of balconies. They have large screen that is helpful. Excellent sound system. Food is expensive, including water!

title: Easy to arrive hard to leave!
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Wonderful shows and events in a top of the line venue. Safe and secure. Had prepaid parking in Lot C. Not hard to find. Getting out was a somewhat difficult. No one guiding the exit of traffic so it took some time to get out. But right on to the highway from there!

title: Spooky symphony
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Incredible talent and a movie screen to follow for kids!!! You cant go to the bathroom and come back in while playing...fyi

title: Comedy show
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: We were excited to get tickets for the Louis CK comedy show here at the  center last week.... our seats wound up being on the fourth level. What I want to say is the acoustics are so bad if you're on that fourth level especially towards the rear of the auditoriumyou should not waste your money. It is so difficult to hear anything. Perhaps if you watching a ballet and don't have to hear someone talking it wouldn't be so bad. I am so disappointed that a magnificent building like theArsht center has such terrible acoustics.

title: A bit on the expensive side but a beautiful place
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Beautiful architecture, great service but the drinks and food sold there are way too expensive! Also for the musical that we watched (Dirty Dancing) the volume was good during the songs but a bit low to understand the speeches from the third tier where we had our seats.

title: Favorite park in Miami
review: It’s a great place to read, stretch, jog, people watch, & soak in views.

title: Most Unique Tropical Botanic Garden...And More!!!
review: The Thursday nights and Moonlight Tour and Lecture via tram tour, star gazing, and yoga in the arts center courtyard just starting in November promise to be great experiences and special  treats.  But no matter when you go for the first time, book a tram tour with one of their knowledgeable and exciting guides.  You will be back!

title: One of many great Malls in Miami
review: Large variety of Shops here. The mall is in a circular shape which makes visiting everywhere easy. It takes approx one afternoon to visit everywhere here.

title: Amazing shopping
review: This was cool

title: Good stores and wide variety
review: Has a lot of good restaurants and great movie theater

title: Great mall
review: At the time i was there was a bit crowded but hey... its black friday. Actually was saturday

title: Mall
review: The Dolphin Mall in Miami is a big mall. We had to return something at boutique store. We saw it that was located in this mall so we decided to do some shopping here too. It’s a nice big mall with a lot of stores, and eateries.

title: Best mode of transportation in Miami
review: Miami has one of the worst traffic in the US, specially in the Brickell and downtown area....it.s deadly in the am and pm, specially on  weekends...parking is expensive, but we haveci METROMOVER that can move you from Brickell/coral way area to the PAMM and FROST MUSEUM and the MIAMI HEAT GAMES in a few minutes with a few stops...and its. FREE...PEOPLE RIDE IT AND ENJOY IT...IT.S HEAVEN ON RAILS!

title: Best way to see Miami (Downtown) from above.
review: Great way to get around Miami (Downtown). Very clean. Everything automatic no Mertomover drivers. And for free.

title: Great transportation.
review: Downtown is this a free transportation. Very safe and you avoid the trafic on the streets.  So great to go with it.

title: Way Slow
review: Had to ride this tram to the rental car center in MIA. I had to walk from the H terminal to this thing. I actually went out side thinking I would catch a bus to the rental car center since I happened to catch a wall with “Peoplemover” on it and an arrow. I didn’t know what a Peoplemover was. So I followed the arrow but nothing said exactly where to go. As I was outside noticing there was no Peoplemover I looked up online how to get to the rental car center. Finally, some actual directions, but it said I have to walk a quarter mile just to get on this thing. So I started my hike. Of the 5 or so moving walkways on the way to the Peoplemover at least 2 were not working. The walk area beside the moving walkways can accommodate 2 people walking side by side so you end up getting stuck behind first time travelers walking like they are the only people traveling. Once on the Peoplemover it’s a 1.5 mile ride of shaking and banging around. I had to grab onto a handrail several times just to keep from falling down. Next time I’ll just take Uber.

title: Beautiful facility
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Modern, elegant, and impressive. Incredible architecture. A large hall. Parking can be painful. $20 for a morning function. Once inside, this is a "wow" experience.

title: 10th Anniversary Gala Concert was Spectacular
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: If you are in Miami, and have the opportunity to attend a performance here (opera, ballet, music, Broadway Show, etc.), do not hestiate..GO!

title: Great location- parking service is terrible
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Went to see Cabaret this month and while I love the theater- the parking is just ridiculous.  Besides having to pay the 25.00 valet fee i had to wait more than 30 minutes for my car, which by the way, i could clearly see parked across the street.  i was one of the first few people to turn in my valet ticket.  Why pay this high cost? park elsewhere and save yourself the frustration.

title: If you have never visited the Adrianne Arsht Center - you should.
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: We have been to the celebration of the Adrianne Arsht Center with Family and Friends and had a amazing time. This Center has a beautiful program for any age. And if you look out also prices that are affordable. This is a great get away.

title: Evening Out
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Enjoyed a spectacular musical play.  The seats were great. Had a fabulous view of the stage. Looking forward to the next outing. Had a wonderful time.  Would invite more friends to come along.

title: Free transportation in downtown? Unheard of!
review: I didn’t believe there was free transportation in downtown. It really is! The mover is self driving and there is no driver. Surprisedly, it is well maintained inside and not dirty in the mover. The stations are outdoors and clean and easy to navigate. Occasionally you will see a homeless sitting on the steps of the station entrance. The service was pretty fast ~5 mins and there is a timer in each station. Also lets you know which train’s destination so you don’t take the wrong loop. Miami is great for free transportation infrastructure!

title: A must go in Miami Beach
review: Nice outside restaurants of different types. Very old style houses, great athmosphere. Easy to reach from Ocean drive.

title: Wow-great food choices
review: Great find-wonderful restuarants-had Cuban one night and Italian with home made pasta the next.  Food is outrageous and reasonable priced.  This was a great find and we really enjoyed the atmosphere and food.  Don't miss it.

title: Epicurious
review: We stumbled on to Espagnola Way while walking around looking for the Art Deco District.  We had passed a couple of buildings that had Art Deco elements but we were still searching.  Then we found Espanola Way and were pleasantly surprised by the pedestrian way, the restaurants, the liveliness of the street.  We settled in for an Italien dinner and had a great time.

title: Quaint blocks packed with restaurants
review: We walked the couple of blocks or so of this area & it was nice but we didn’t stop to eat. Had we been hungry there would have several places we would have wanted to try. It seems like the kind of destination that gets more lively as the day wears on. Note that the surrounding area is not as quaint if you’re walking & you may encounter some interesting people & shops.

title: Noisy and crowded
review: With so many eateries in SoBe I would choose somewhere else to go. Lots to pick from and nice that it is pedestrian only but you will get many restaurant hawkers hawking to you to come in to their establishment.

title: All new design district
review: It is a new experience with upscale shopping and some interesting architecture and even a parking structure that is worth going to

title: Fancy!
review: Thank you and see you next time!!

title: Calling all art & fashion lovers!
review: If you love art, design, fashion and/or architecture, this is the place for you! Surrounding the beautifully built luxury shops are incredible art installations and a number or restaurants to choose from!

title: BEAUTIFUL PLACE TO VISIT ESPECIALLY AT NIGHT
review: The Design District is full of restaurants and high end shops.   You have to try "Estefan's Kitchen".  Excellent cuban food.  It is owned by Gloria and Emilio Estefan, famous Cuban signer.   They have music and people get up to dance.  Best Mojito!!!  You can walk all around the Miami Design District.  There is ample parking on the sides, you have to pay for it of course, or you can valet.   The place is always full with people walking.  Very safe place to walk at night as well.  Highly recommend this place if you are visiting Miami.

title: Cutting edge stylish
review: Miami design district is your go to for the “finer side” of art, design,  retail shops and dining. Tasteful Attentions  to detail encompass every aspect of the area.

title: Flower and native plant
review: It is a good place to give your camera to take photography of the bloom plant ! It’s free but the gratuity is an opportunity to grow the space !!

title: Take a picnic here
review: I hope to return again, but next time with a backgammon board and full picnic set to spend the whole day!

title: Knight Concert Hall is a first-rate venue for live classical music
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: This review is only for the Knight Concert Hall, which is just a part of the Adrienne Arsht Performing Arts Center in downtown Miami.  This is a beautiful new concert hall with excellent acoustics.  Went to hear the Cleveland Orchestra perform live.  I've been to numerous concert halls in New York, Washington, Chicago, and Cleveland.  The Knight Concert Hall is on par with the best of them.  Also, good wine and sandwiches for sale at reasonable prices.  If you love classical music, you can't go wrong here.

title: Behind the scenes - a tour of the facilities
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: On Monday's at noon a free guided tour is available of the facilities.  The tour lasted approximately an hour.  It took us through the three facilities where performances take place.  You come away with a background of the facility, an appreciation of the design and the desire to take in a performance in each of the venues.

title: Beautiful place
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Can here for a contert and had great seat. Holds a lot of people but it looked like everyone had a pretty good view. Seats comfortable. Reasonable size bathrooms so you don't wait all night.

title: Miami has a Scala, too!
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: My wife and I went to see Norma at the Adrienne Arsht Center and it was awesome! Miami has its own Scala and it is beautiful. Everything there breaths beauty and elegance. Everybody who works there was extremely polite and kind. The performance was flawless and the players who performed were second to no one. What a talent! It was a night to remember and I highly recommend this place to all who wants to soothe their souls with beauty, class, and talent.

title: An exciting building
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: I must say that after the Q and A, the only washrooms available for a large crowd of women was off from the cafe. Really? Two stalls only? They had said the main restrooms were being cleaned. We were not impressed.

title: Beautiful little place
review: It's free to enter but you can donate to help keep the gardens going.

title: Skip Ocean Drive and Relax
review: Are you lost and fed up with all of the D grade tourists wandering ocean drive? his is one of the jewels of Miami Beach. No crack dealears over in this area, enjoy.

title: Over rated
review: We went on our own. The place is over rated and not worth the time to go. We had a mojito and it was not good at all but expensive.

title: Nice area but full of tourists
review: Nice area that indeed looks like Havana will lots of small shops, restaurants, and people in the street. Nice atmosphere but sometimes too many tourists!

title: Excellent
review: I really enjoyed my day spent wandering around the shops, getting the odd coffee and alcoholic beverage, smoking cigars and enjoying the atmosphere.

title: Incredible tour through Miami Culinary Tours
review: We had the chance to go on a food tour in Little Havana and we absolutely fell in love with this little neighborhood. It was such a blast to explore the eateries and bars. While you can totally explore on your own, we recommend going with Miami Culinary Tours. There are some hidden gems here that you may miss on your own.

title: Loved our stroll in Little Havana
review: My wife and I enjoyed some great Cuban coffee and conversation.  We also got a tip for a great Cuban restaurant in the area!

title: Fun way to travel
review: A quaint old-fashioned free means of travel around downtown Miami & other places. Wooden seats with air conditioned trolleys, it's an interesting to go around town. Somewhat slow but nevertheless a great experience. I found every one of the drivers friendly and accommodative.

title: Good option for getting around downtown
review: I wish I’d have researched this transportation option more before we visited Miami. You can download an app, which provides trolley locations and next stops. Sadly we had no mobile data and WiFi around the area was hit and miss. That said the trolleys were a great option to get around without the need for a car, bonus being they’re completely free,

title: Lovely transport
review: The trolley is a free way of public transport in Miami. It has lot of lines, we can easily reach our destination.

title: Free trolley to get around downtown
review: We were able to pick up a trolley at cruise ship terminal G and take it to downtown Miami.  It was free and very convenient for a day in port.  Once we figured out the various routes, we were able to use it (and the metro mover) to see all of downtown.  You can download the app to to see where all of the trolleys are at any point in time.  Great system.

title: The Great Sandoval!!
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: The fantastic Arturo Sandoval's concert (with his friends Albita and Willie Chirino) shows the Cuban side of Miami, in an amazing location!!

title: The Arsht Center for the performing Arts
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: I have been to the Center many times and has always been a fabulous experience.  It is a beautiful venue that brings many well known artists and Broadway shows, it also has restaurants and hotels near the venue. Highly recommended to all!

title: Beautiful venue, unprofessional staff.
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: You have a world class venue that needs to be run as so. My tickets to see The Barber of Seville are going up for sale on StubHub and I will fly in the New York and go to the Beacon Theater to see my music rather than flying to Miami to hear the ushers.

title: Our jewel in Miami
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Our performing arts center is amazing.  It has two different big theaters for opera, ballet, musicals and an intimate black box theater that is just perfect.  The acoustics here are exceptional and the programming is varied and accessible.  I only have one gripe with the Arsht, and that is their bars.  They have the worse barstenders and their drinks are so but so miniscule that they are smaller than the little bottles you get in the planes and at prices that are simply ridiculous.  I was there Saturday and I have always complained about the pours and the bartenders, but after this one time, they lost me.  I will not order any more drinks there -- not worth the aggravation, and I must say we go to the Arsht for concerts, musicals and love their black box.  They need to improve their drinks!!!!

title: We saw the barber of Seville
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Great place for Opera, had a blast. The place is very well maintained and clean. People are respectful and organizers are great people and very helpful.

title: If you have time to spare this is...
review: If you have time to spare this is a great adventure to get a picture or even where you might like to spend more time. Cheap and the kids loved it....

title: Great art work!
review: My husband and I love Britto's work, and we really enjoyed visiting the studio.  We almost bought a print, but we decided to wait. We are collectors of his work so the store offered us a great deal that included a frame, shipping, and a coffee table book.

title: Britto Store
review: Im not a Britto fan, but my friend really likes his art, so in we went. The store itself is really nicely layed out, the art very colourful and surprisingly, there were things I loved and could afford.  Nice surprise stop on Lincoln Rd.

title: Beautiful art and great staff
review: You need to have a Britto for your collection.  The stuff has amazing color and is just cool.  Staff is very nice and very helpful.

title: Colourful and eclectic
review: Return trip and spent an hour there looking and enjoyed. Bought a limited edition and having sent as a gift, so nothing for us this time but will be back as everyone should have a Britto in there house. The service was excellent and knowledgeable and helped us through the purchase. Great stop and always fun

title: Great art and artist bit be careful
review: Brazilian artist Britto began his lucrative and illustrious career right here in Miami Beach and this is his flagship studio. But I could tell (in my opinion) that some of the artwork was inked or colored by others as it didn’t match some of the older work in the store. The colors, however, were bright and playful, reflecting his heritage.

title: Birthday celebration
review: There was algae along the shore. It would have been nice if the city would have removed the algae to allow the beach to be more enjoyable. Although we couldn’t go into the water the sun was out which made for a beautiful day.

title: Super nice beach
review: This Bal Harbour Beach is not that crowded, because it is located within the hotels and private condos.

title: Clean and calm
review: There were a few people on the beach. Beach service only for hotels by the beach. Water was warm. There is a walking path next to the beach

title: Don't miss the Beach Art Path
review: Apparently, the city of  Bal Harbour is now hosting art exhibits on the path which skirts be beach from 99th to 102nd Streets.  This makes a lovely walk in the morning or late afternoon, when the sun is not as strong. The exhibit we saw, up til October 20, 2018, is of individuals in Albania with very informative labels.  I think my husband and I were the only walkers looking at the exhibit - that's actually why we trekked out to Bal Harbour.  The walk and the exhibit are really worthwhile.

title: Worth a visit once (for locals)
review: I've lived in MB for 8 years and have been a couple of times. I went recently. I'm not crazy about art but there are some cool things in it. Maybe a decent spot to take a date.

title: Flamenco Show - March 13, 2015
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Bought tickets for the show to go with our elderly parents.  Although the show was amazing!  The Knight Concert Hall was not nor were the ushers.  I have attended numerous performances at the Knight Concert Hall and the Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts.  When we arrived we went to find our seats the usher directed us to a totally different set of seats on the odd number side - we then had to interrupt other guest and finally made our way to our seats.  The air conditioned did not even feel as it was on it was so warm and uncomfortable through out the entire showing we tried to tell someone no one seemed to care.  Then before the show was over there was a fire alarm.  We could not hear what was going on it took more than 5 minutes to turn on the lights (thankfully it was just an alarm and not an actual fire) it would have been complete disaster!  We never go to finish the show (again no one cared the only words out of the ushers mouths were sorry it was almost over anyway!  What??) That last performance is like the grand finale its the one you came to see.  We then made our way after a long walk down the stairs to the valet which was even more of a disaster.  They were not allowing people to sit inside.  There is not many places to sit outside so my poor mother had to stand which is very hard for her and the employees just don't care - rude, rude and more rude.  You pay to go out for a nice evening and end up asking yourself why did you bother - paying your money for an event where no one seems to care if you enjoyed yourself nor were they accommodating to your needs - DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY GOING TO AN EVENT HERE!!

title: Wicked play
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Went here today to see Wicked. We sat towards the back of the orchestra section and had aisle seats. However, they did not have a walkway on the other end so there was only the one way in to get to the seats so we had to get up a lot to let people in and out. A bottle of water was $4.00 but they also had water fountains to quench your thirst. We pre paid for parking in lot C and so thankful we did easy in and out. The seats are old and not as comfortable as you would expect for sitting for a play that's 2 hours and 45 minutes long. Well staffed and helpful employees.

title: Wicked!
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: First time visiting this beautiful center for the performing arts and thought it was fantastic. My only disappointment was in the lack of places to eat on site, or near by for that matter. Arrived with ample time (2+ hours) and still was not able to eat at any of the restaurants in here. Play was wonderful and seating was comfortable! Valet parking service I must say is the best I have ever seen! Can't wait to come back!

title: Wicked
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: Awesome theatre venue, great staff, loved valet parking option UNTIL it was time to leave and retrive vehicle. It was not the staff's fault but patrons were obnoxious. Had never encountered such rude people at theatre any where else on east coast.

title: An amazing Opera House in Miami!
place: Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County
review: I discovered the "Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts" when leaving another Miami's icon: the "Pérez Art Museum"! Bingo! The signs were outlining the American première of the acclaimed "Ballet Nacional de España", bringing to Florida its newest masterpiece - "Sorolla". It was November 2014. I just made a quick stop at the ticket office and got the chance to attend a magnificent performance. "Sorolla" stages dance traditions, pulsating music and fantastic costumes that bring to life the many colorful regions of Spain. Attending it in Miami - the capital city of Hispano-America - added a special meaning to the occasion!  The "Ziff Ballet Opera House" stands among the best ones in the world. Modern, efficient and very beautiful. No problems or complaints about parking, ushers, catering or sound! We had a perfect and remarkable evening. While visiting Miami, please do check "Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts" agenda and indulge yourself to unforgettable spectacles. Enjoy!

title: Small, but interesting
review: At the very least, stop in and see The Wrestler. He's in the lobby so you can see him without paying the entry fee.

title: Very unique and eclectic museum dedicated to Art Deco.
review: If you are a fan of the Art Deco style so prevalent in South Beach this is the best museum maybe in the world to see examples. Everything from home appliances to furniture to paintings to scupture to rental;es, it is all here on three floors of what used to be a moving and storage warehouse. Allow at least 2 hours. And do not miss the gift shop. Unique ArtDeco and Florida gifts, books and decorations.

title: A Great Art Deco Museum in the heart of Miami Beach
review: I wasn't sure what to expect but the museum was great. Lots of great art deco pieces! I also loved the gift shop - it's small but has some nice unique gifts and souvenirs.

title: Great exhibit
review: Great collection and narrative for Art Deco design.  Definitely worth a stop!  The gift shop is full of books and gift items, including great selection for children.

title: unbelievably beautiful venue for a wedding
review: Everything picture perfect and elegant, absolutely stunning and wonderful attention to service. would not have changed a thing.

title: Great place to dine!
review: Porto Cervo - Italian food- relaxed feeling, casual dress, love everything about Fisher Island! A must to visit!

title: Beautiful place to stay or relax
review: What a wonderful gem in Miami. great for a day of relaxation even if you're staying on the beach and even better if you can find a way to stay there on vacation.

title: Biscayne  bay boat tours
review: Great boat tour around  islands with millionaire mansions of famous people. Our boat  played the singers songs as the boatnpassed the mansions!  Will Smith's welcome to miami and Frank Sinatra's New York New York!  Lots more but don'the want spoil your surprise.

title: A world apart, do not miss it!!!
review: It mis an experience you cannot miss

title: ZWF’S WILDLIFE PRESENTATION PACKAGE WAS AMAZING!
review: the ZWF’S WILDLIFE PRESENTATION package. Honestly, it was AMAZING and more then I expected! I was lucky to have a small group and an amazing tour guide! Roger, our tour guide, was fantastic and knew a lot of information about the animals and place! This was worth every penny, and I recommend it to everyone! Gaby, the young women who helped set us up was absolutely fantastic as well! My favorite part was the presentation as we got to see and interact with many amazing animals but my favorite was the lion cub! Overall, it was amazing and i will defiantly be heading back to ZWF!

title: Hat Trick For ZWF
review: If you are contemplating a visit here, do yourself a favour and go. It is an experience of a lifetime. We still talk of our previous two visits here years ago. The memories you make here will last forever.

title: This place is just truly amazing!!!!!
review: Everything at this place is just amazing!!! Super sweet people, very clean and virtuous all around!! Limbani is just amazing!!! I highly suggest if you are looking for the greatest experience of your life you should go visit this place!!!! Just truly astonishing!!! A+++++++++

title: This place should be #1 thing to do if you are in Miami... hands down
review: I will never be able to express how amazing today was but will try... my man mate and I flew down here to meet limbani and have a sloth encounter and it blew away my expectations and was worth every cent! The staff there was so friendly and knowledgeable and did NOT make you feel like a number or rushed. They let you take pictures and video and truly made this day the best day of my life!! The sloths wouldn’t come out but we still got to feed them and the zoo keeper answers all our questions and knew so much about them! What an experience!! If you love chimpanzees as I do you will fall in love with Limbani as soon as you look into his eyes and he interacts with you! His handler was amazing and you can see the bond they have and he again made me feel comfortable and was so friendly!! The interaction I was able to have with Limbani was one in a million and I truly can’t thank the staff enough!! Make sure you buy the picture packet and don’t forget to tip them they are amazing and I am so glad there is a place like this, if I lived in Florida I would be here all the time and try all of the encounters! Spend the money go do this it is truly a wonderful off the charts experience!! Yes I am  a person real feel free to email me if you had any questions !! **note this is NOT the professional photos one taken with my phone**

title: Meeting Limbani ♥️
review: It was always a dream of mine to interact with a Chimp, and not only I accomplished that but Limbani is very special.

title: Best time for Arts and parties in Miami
review: ONLY IN MIAMI

title: Very suitable suitable
review: In this place I have attended several conferences and events, I like it when they do it here, since it is prepared for all kinds of events, it is comfortable and offers good services.

title: Artsy
review: As an art lover in Miami this is a must place to go, to have an insight of what its like to be an artist.

title: No Longer the Exciting Venue?!?
review: Art Basel- Miami was a force to be reckoned with!!! Now this venue , once the place for innovative, provacative art, socializing in this realm, has turned to a mad rush to see whatever you can, you meet no one, as that who is now in attendance, the parties, yawn! Where did it go wrong?!

title: Not anywhere as good as it was,
review: Yes it is still worth the trip to Miami. Yes the number of paintings is overwhelming. Yes it is certainly a “happening” but having gone the last 9 years last year and the year before were very disappointing. Why? When we used to go almost all the paintings and illustrations were “manned” by the artists. We (myself and the teens I took) were able to meet the artists, discuss the paintings and ask questions. The last two years there were almost no artists: all the spaces were fronted by gallery owners. They did not welcome any question but: how much. They did not want to bother with enthusiastic and very polite teenagers. That was issue one. Issue two: I was always thrilled to see the Picasso’s, Lichtenstein’s, Modigliani’s among the newer art pieces. A few years ago I was stunned by the beauty of a Magritte dove. The kids were thrilled to recognize Chuck Close paintings and Duane Hanson sculptures. None this year. And the biggest disappointment: the general downgrading of quality. I asked my son, who is an artist, aliguoriart.com, what happened? He said that Art Basel is only about selling now and the cost for younger artists at the Convention Center is prohibitive. SO if you want to see great art at reasonable admission fee: go to the neighborhood shows and galleries near the Convention Center. That’s where the really good art is to be found; best show and gallery: Spectrum Gallery in Miami. It’s really too bad about Art Basel used to be fabulous.

title: Amazing exhibits. Reason I came to Miami
review: What a great museum. They not only have some of the most friendly and helpful staff like Valentina and Sabrina, but they have well organized exhibits! We came for Queer Miami, but were pleasantly surprised at the level of design and thought that went into the permanent exhibits.

title: EXTREMELY HELPFUL!
review: Needless to say I loaded up with helpful brochures of everything that interested me and left feeling excited and inspired to check out my new city.  I'm grateful for the Visitor's Center and for Pauline for guiding me!

title: Visitors center
review: I heard about Visit Miami Beach Visitors Center and was able to call ahead before my trip and get some first hand tips and help.

title: Refreshing beer
review: Passed by while walking thru wynwood checking out the art. This brewery has a large variety of beers for all tastes. The staff is extremely helpful and quick. Highly recommended especially on a hot day in Miami.

title: very good place to dance
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: very good place to dance and music and really well et les gens son vraiment bien les gens danse boive

title: Soak in the Cuban culture here
review: Interesting insight into the Cuban culture, highly recommended!

title: This museum offers a quick view of  the history of Miami.
review: It was a nice visit, but it does not deserve a second one. I expected more info about Miami during the beginnings of this city,

title: Social history comes to life
review: Miami has a rich history, but people make history, not relics. If found the emphasis on social history to be quite fascinating. Miami was a boom city of the 20th century, it has grown from a swamp to be a metropolis of  5 million people in 100 years. Miami is said to be the capital of Latin America, it has people from all over South America and the Caribbean. We spent a whole day at the museum. We are not Americans, but it was time well spent.

title: Helpful and informatative
review: I found the LGBT visitor center to be a good source of information on the area. Plenty of maps, and brochures. The fellow working the desk was friendly and helpful as he gave pointers to area attractions. I loved the gentle irony of the fact the our welcome center was the first office you see as you enter the justice center tower. How far we have come.

title: Chill Experience
review: This was one of my favorite parts of my trip. If you want to get away from the South Beach experience, a short drive will take you to an area full of art and this brewery. Sitting down and having a flight at Concrete was the best way to unwind after a crazy day on the beach. It was so relaxing and the beer was not bad either. The patio is a nice place to enjoy the breeze and sip local brew. I will return when I am in the city again.

title: SOBE IS LOVE
review: It’s perfect for selfie!

title: Sobe is love
review: Sobe is love is a must see landmark filled with a message of love, community and unity! Great architecture and design as well- the people behind the project are as passionate as the message behind it!

title: Great play The Tin Woman
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: We were a party of 6 and saw the tin woman play. Let me start off by saying that this was our first time coming here. A member of our party randomly bought tickets to this play not knowing anything. Most of us did not want to go but we decided to "bite the bullet". Not knowing if there was a dress code, we called and asked and were told that business casual is fine. When we arrived we were noticing a lot of older people. (That did not bother us) we were seated in the upstairs theater which was a bit small but this allowed us to feel closer to the actors. We were in the second row so we really saw every move the actors made. The play was good and the actors were very good. At first, the play seemed boring but I started to get more interested in the story. Overall, it was our first time and we had fun . It was something different for us to do.

title: One spectacular experience!
review: You can easily spend a few hours here, and they will be well spent. This is possibly the best kept secret in town!

title: Worth a visit
review: Interesting museum with two building locations focusing on both the history and culture of South Florida. Reasonable admissions fee and a variety of engaging content areas.

title: Great to Avoid Traffic
review: We took the Metrorail from Dadeland to the Airport.  It took about an hour from parking to get into the airport.  The ride is smooth and quick, fare is not bad at all.  Delays on the line caused us to have to switch lines, and have a slight delay, but they got us there!  Other passengers told us sometimes reliability could be a problem but that is not the norm.

title: GREAT BALLET
review: We had the chance to enjoy one of their performance, it was awesome from the beginning to the end, great choreography and dancers.

title: Great beers
review: We visited here after Wynwood Walls. They have a good range of their own beers. We tried a few different types and enjoyed them all. Many people were trying flights to sample more of the beers. The staff were knowledgeable and friendly. Spotlessly clean restrooms too.

title: Cool fun spot with decent beer selection
review: Stopped here to sample a few beers. Very impressive attractive setting, helpful friendly staff. Nice selection of beers. Would definitely come here again.

title: Must visit
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Well I have never been to Cuba, but I hope that’s how it would look like :) Cubaocho was a wonderful place: great vibe, local life music and delicious food and mojito made in a way I never had it before. Also, beautiful paintings and art all over - really the best place to spend your money for a night out !

title: my neighborhood theater
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: great director theater is a landmark in the city of Coral Gables which is known as The City Beautiful. the architecture is art deco and the viewing is supperb with great acoustics

title: Spot for locals, not much for tourist
review: Me and my family went to this spot following the recommendations on many tourist guide, website etc. The street where this park is located is quite interesting such as the cigar shop, the ice-cream shops... but the park itself is not. All we've seen were just a bunch of seniors playing domino, we don't even feel interesting to get in....

title: NICE but
review: nice building and area, the only thing I dont like and feel secure was that homelless was seating all arround full of bag and I didnt feel confortable at all

title: good option to meet and view the city
review: the metro rail is fine and safe the outer train which links you is like riding in a new York city train, unpredictable and keep your eyes open. they have law or security guarding from skipping fare but they have no education and are a holes when asked questions. facts.

title: Surprisingly good
review: Long time ago I went to a Miami Ballet and it was very amateur and kind of funny/sad. Now days they are serious group and I warmly recommend their program.

title: fantastic ballet
review: Miami city ballet ranks just behind New York, which makes it world class and you can see it here.

title: WONDERFUL!
review: The Miami City Ballet is arguably one of the very best ballet companies in the United States.  In addition to their main performances at the Arscht Center for the Performing Arts, they also present informal programs at the school in Miami Beach.  Don't miss seeing the wonderful company!

title: A Lot of Fun - Great Craft Beer!
review: I have been to Concrete Beach several times. I think this is the best craft beer brewery win Wynwood. The beers and selection are great! The prices are reasonable. The place is fun! Do a flight or two. You won't be disappointed.

title: Great evening with our dog
review: Such a fun brewery! Awesome beer!!! Yet the Havana lager for an smooth easy drinking beer...ordered tacos from a place close by. The bartenders are amazing! Brought over our golden retriever water right away & were so nice. They don’t have food but your welcome to bring in food. Don’t miss out on this brewery.

title: Great beers and a fun atmosphere
review: Really enjoyed this place.   In the heart of Wynwood and one of three breweries on the same street.   Stopped by to try it out the other day.   We were early so had the place to ourselves.   Large indoor and outdoor social area and a great variety of local quality craft beers.   The beertender was great and helped us choose our flights and the Bouvalay was a real treat.   The store prices for their Stiltsville and Havana lager are higher than Total Wine or Target but they have some other finds you cannot get retail elsewhere.   The rose and the bouvalay are unique and superb.

title: Great to see the players and the domino's
review: As mentioned previously in the tour of Little Havana ti is great to see the old folks playing domino's and chess. it is also good to walk around the street and look at the shops.

title: Learn lots, see lots, enjoy lots
review: This is a history museum going through great transitions.  They have permanent exhibits which touch on many topics from the very hidden prehistory of the area to today's cultural diversity.  There are also changing and temporary exhibits.  The colorful folklife exhibits are well, colorful but lacking in people.  The changing history exhibit helps to expose many of the large collections in storage. If you've got kids, look for the free family days.  If you want to see some life added into the folklife area, look for artist in resident programs

title: Metrorail I use it everyday, Douglas Station, Government Center in the Morning and Coconut Grove Station in the evening.
review: I’ve seen people sleeping in the floor, there’s food left, paper bags, anytime of the day... it’s dirty!! The stations have elevators and escalators that constantly are broken. You need to keep security at the stations and in the trains. You bring new trains and it will be the same story... what a shame. How do you aspect people to give up cars and use public transportation in Dade County?

title: Dirty
review: Disgustingly dirty! AC was not working or cooling. Stale & bad smelling. A very unpleasant experience.

title: Love Midtown
review: Great to dinner during the week and perfect for shopping during the weekend.

title: Found it by accident
review: I jumped on a trolley near my hotel and rose until I came to midtown. A very cool vibe with a mix of furniture stores, art and restaurants. It was quiet and more calm than SoBe or Bayside. I highly recommend it.

title: A beautiful church!
review: A local and historical church, that has been well maintained! It is in downtown Miami, and has public parking in back and across the street. The inside of the church is very inviting.

title: Beautiful church but ultra-conservative
review: I am a practicing Catholic and had been all my life.  I normally gravitate towards the Jesuit churches due to their out of the box thinking and intelligent discourse.  After a few Sundays at Gesu, I left and will not be coming back.  This happened after the priest giving the sermon talked about how Yoga was the work of the devil.  This was the last of several sermons I had heard there and could not take it anymore.

title: Brewery with games!
review: Would return again

title: Very nice place!
review: The vibe, decor, location and building are amazing! Beers were very solid not A+ yet but this is only a 3 year old brewery with major upside!!! Would love to come back again!!!

title: Beer lovers delight
review: Bit tricky to find but worth a visit. The paddles were great: 13 different varieties. Wish they’d had some finger food though as we were starving

title: very nice experience at the actors playhouse
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: We love the fact that the plays setting is not so big and wherever you sit you can comfortably enjoy the show.  they have good actors and have good plays most of the time.

title: Community theatre Gem in Coral Gables
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: Went to see my sons' talented girlfriend play the Fairy God Mother in a production of Cinderella (so  yes,  I will be a biased reviewer).  Great community theatre with talented staff.

title: Best place we visited in miami
review: We really enjoyed the different exhibitions, something for everyone and we were lucky enough to be there on an event day so entry was free. Knowledgeable and super friendly guides.

title: Trains are always delayed.  Escalators always broken
review: They should call it Metro-Fail.  The Trains are always delayed.  During rush hour they are supposed to run every 5 minutes.  Well now they are running 12 mins which causes the trains to be excessively overcrowded.  Not to mention the AC sometimes does not work at all during this very hot summer.  Escalators or elevators always broken for weeks on end.  One thing they got right was the 34 Express Bus Routes.  Now they have a 34A & B which really helps you not drive and take the express.  Works very nicely, new hybrid buses.

title: one trick pony
review: The Metrorail inits own it's ok...only if it served a purpose. Let's be honest, if Miami had a public transportation system it would be the worst in any main city in the world!!....the bus service is unreliable, which you would have to take in order to reach one of the Metrorail stations. It is convenient only if you live within a block of a station and work within a block of another. Walking in Miami's heat and humidity is a torture.Miami has bar none the worst public transportation system of any major city I had visited.

title: Free !
review: Perfect to discover Downtown and Brickell. This metro rail is free ! Perfect to see all the Miami skyline and take great pictures .

title: Safe, clean and free
review: You can't beat this ride! It is an excellent way to see the city and the best part it is for free. You feel like you are in a Disney ride. (smiling)

title: Great way to get around
review: Great way to ride for free while in Downtown or Brickell. The cars are clean and are quite frequent.

title: Beautiful Catholic Church!
review: Gesu Catholic Church is a very old church located in downtown Miami. The church inside is beautiful, with very old frescos on the wall and woodwork, you will definitely appreciate the old architecture.  It's a hidden gem in the middle of the old downtown Miami area.

title: Stop on in
review: Very old church downtown that used to have a school attached. Defintely worth a visit if you are walking through downtown.

title: Fun brewery
review: This brewery has a fun vibe & good beer. Order the sampler so you can try 5 or 6. It’s located in the heart of Wynwood so easy to walk around so take it all in !

title: Great beer and patio
review: Best brewery in Wynwood due to great beers and nice indoor/outdoor space. Some bartenders were more attentive than others, but overall a good brewery.

title: Our favorite of several in the area
review: Neat place with a good indoor & patio area.  Nice beer selection, helpful bartenders, and even self-serve taps for filtered water.  Hip place in old industrial area.

title: Beer quality inversely proportional to the service
review: We went in the afternoon and tried four beers, after picking up all Wynwood we decided that this was the place to spend the night drinking beer, well, the worst decision, we were never served, despite my partner's wheelchair, when asked and the answer was really unpleasant, I suspect that they saw us very "Latino" even though our dollars were very American.

title: Fun, comfortable microbrewery
review: We wandered over to Concrete Beach Brewing after taking in some music and eats at the Wynwood Yard. There's some construction going on in front of it that made it a little harder to find, but once we were there, it was really cool inside. They had security out front doing ID checks, which I've never experienced at a microbrewery before; that kind of security felt more like a club. There's a bar and seating indoors and out. I ordered a "Mas Hops" IPA that was very good. Glad we stopped by.

title: More Interesting than Expected
review: The main exhibits are fun and interesting. Here is a picture of an Art Deco curling iron and a painted wall.

title: It could be better
review: I though it had more things but it's quite small for a city like Miami. Plus the vice director didn't help me when i wrote her about my researches.

title: Traveling to the airport
review: We were taking a friend to the airport, and decided it would be faster to take the Metro. It was a great decission! We took it at Dadeland Mall and goes to the airport, without changing from metro if you take the orange line.

title: Great orange line service to MIA
review: You can use this service to reach MIA including the rental car center. Miami traffic really does not favor driving during rush hours between 4 and 7PM.

title: Horrible
review: The Miami  Metrorail is public transportation. It runs from Palmetto station to Dadeland South and vice Versa.  It's a convenient way of transportation, if the passenger destination is close to the train station. It save you in gas and the stress of driving, however, the trains are old, dirty, unkept, constantly breaking down and running late. They charge $123.00 monthly for a monthly pass including parking. Once in a while they have the Express which run from Civic Center Station north to Palmetto Station and vice Versa.  Again, the condition of these trains need much improvement, pronto.

title: Dirty people hanging out & sleeping in seats
review: Feel Uncomfortable. STREET people hanging out. Dirty Cars, Not enough security enforcement. Service was SLOW and INTERMITTENT, CANNOT UNDERSTAND CONDUCTORS ON SPEAKERS.

title: Handy Transport in Miami
review: The Metrorail itself is very handy. It is clean, cheap and efficient, but the people who ride on it make for an ominous experience each time. There should be a better police presence. NO stations feel safe and once on the train you are effectively in an unmanned bubble with whoever else is travelling.

title: Miami's oldest Catholic church
review: One of my favorite in Miami, used to attend frequently when worked downtown. Always find serenity and peace within. It's one of the most beautiful in Miami as its a true place of worship and providing service to its flock. Many new churches have not accomplished this. The mural is beautiful, and depicts the diversity of the faithful.  It needs upkeep (requires money) but never fails to provide what one is seeking; spirituality.

title: A place which inspires you!
review: This is the oldest catholic church in Miami. The inside takes you back to another time and place. Beautiful marble statues, paintings all to help you focus on the eternal.

title: Oldest  chuch  in  Miami
review: The  church  is  historic  and built  before  Miami  became  a  city.  Elegant  inside  and  holds  Seats  about 300  people.  Great  pictures  of  the  Station  of the  Cross.  You  can  bring  your  own  candles  and  place  the  in  the stand  and  pray.  If  you  to  pray  for  someone,  you  can  put  their  name  in  a book.

title: Great spot & beer!
review: Really enjoyed this brewery, the space was great and the staff super friendly.  They were hosting a fundraising and adoption event for a local animal shelter when we visited, made the experience that much sweeter!

title: Fun for a drink
review: If you're looking for an industrial area to have a nice beer, this is a good place. We were late for the tour, so I would like to try that next time.

title: Too industrial. Needs food/restaurant
review: I had big expectations. The beer was good but felt too much instrumental, I was really looking for more artisan beer. Having said that, good number of options. The place desperately needs a restaurant or gastro pub as they currently just serve popcorn... the wynwood area is amazing.

title: Horrible service
review: I was standing at the bar for like 15mins ( on a weekday, when the bar isn't packed or anything ) and didn't get served. Not coming back.

title: Nice pint
review: Nice atmoshere , recommended

title: Great way to spend an afternoon and learn something about south Florida along the way
review: We spent a couple days in Miami getting ready to leave on a tour of Cuba and decided that we wanted to learn more about the history of the area.  This museum filled the bill.  They had a special multi-media exhibit on the airlift of children whose parents were sending them out of Cuba to the US in the early 60s and it provided really interesting background for our trip to Cuba a few days later.  We had a long and very informative discussion with a museum curator who answered some of our questions and offered additional insights.  Then, in a separate building, there is a very good exhibit on the history of settlement in the Miami region, from Indians through Spanish colonial times and into the 20th century as Americans flocked south for the sun and Latin Americans came north for political and economic opportunities.

title: Metromover - Another way of view of downtown Miami
review: We hopped on the free Metromover to get an overview of a portion of the downtown area. It was enjoyable...the price was right (free!!), and we got off within walking distance of our hotel.

title: Great way to get about
review: Walking distance from our hotel and a great and totally free way to get about downtown Miami and to get to Bayside where we always enjoy a prec ruise lunch.

title: Amazing trip to S. Miami
review: I did have a great connection.. walked up to to a waiting train and it  left within 3 minutes at the airport. This was 7PM on a Friday... about 25 minutes to S. Dadeland. Totally amazing.

title: Beat the traffic!
review: During rush hour this is the ONLY way to avoid the inevitable traffic jam. Jump on the rail from the airport and sail south or north as close as you can get to your destination--you might even catch an express if you  are lucky. At the end of the line or as close to your destination as you can and then take a local bus or just uber it from there!

title: Easy to get around
review: We used the Metrorail a couple of times during our trip to Miami. It was clean and air-conditioned. I give a 4 because we tried to do a one-way to the airport but that wasn't an option on the ticket machine--just reloading or buying a card.

title: Surprisingly Good
review: Logistics: HistoryMiami is on Flagler between NW 1st and 2nd.  A GPS is extremely useful, because the museum is bordered on two sides by both a river and an interstate highway; and on all sides by one-way streets.  Parking is available nearby in garages and lots, but their city-center rates are quite steep.  You can save a bundle by finding a parking spot on the street.  Even though you have to pay to street-park, that’s chump change compared to commercial parking venues. The commercial-lot deal-breaker for me was that the garage demanded that I tell them in advance how long I’d be parked—ergo, if I overestimated how long I’d spend in the museum, I’d be paying top dollar for a parking space I was no longer using, and if I underestimated, I’d have to skip some museum halls.  In fact, I would have underestimated, expecting to spend an hour or so, and actually spending all afternoon there, and racing through several halls as the museum was about to close.  The museum staff was happy to let us leave temporarily to reset the meter.   Obviously we weren’t the first visitors who’d needed to feed a meter.  On the other hand, if you do decide to park all day at a downtown commercial lot, you’ll be happy to learn that the US Bankruptcy Court is conveniently located just around the corner from the museum, should you unexpectedly need its services.  My estimated length of visit is more than 3 hours, based on you all being thoughtful adults; I don’t think small children would keep their interest in this museum for that long.

title: Two great current exhibits
review: If you are interested in street photography this current judged exhibit has some great images from photographers from around the world.  We didn't have time to go to the other half of the museum but will see it on our next trip.

title: I was disappointed that there was not more history
review: This museum adjacent to the public library in downtown Miami is located in 2 separate buildings on the same courtard.  One admission pridce covers both buildings, one of which is their permanent collection and the other houses changing exhibits.  While it is worthwhile to spend 90 minutes or so here, it left me wanting to know more about the early history and development before the 20th century.

title: Good Overview of the History of Miami
review: It was a pleasant way to spend the afternoon. There is lots of information provided about the origins of this area and the exploration (and exploitation) by Europeans by now often told. But there is much to learn about the how the area was settled afterwards and drove people to build their dreams on. some of the displays are a little corny but I assume that many schools spend some time visiting as a part of a day  trip.  At the end of the exhibition one can see that it is a great story warts and all. We did go to the Photography exhibit across the plaza and enjoyed it very much as well.  All staff were super friendly and knowledgeable. Worth a

title: Free!
review: Great way to get to a lot of the downtown attractions of Miami. Only problem is that you have to stand. Very few seats.

title: if you know where your going
review: This was a very inexpensive way to get to Miami.  The staff was very helpful with info for getting tickets.  The cars were clean enough.  The PA system needs improvement could not understand what the next stops were.  It is helpful to use smart phone or the website travel planner for direction.

title: Excellent Value
review: For only $5.15 you can travel all day on the Metrorail and buses, which allows you to go further afield than just Miami itself. Visit Coconut Grove or one of the shopping malls.

title: good bargain.
review: I use this train to get from the airport to Downtown Miami. It's a bargain at only $2.25 per person. The train cars need to be renovated though. They are old and dirty.

title: Miami Metrorail
review: The Miami Metrorail is a unique people mover in the downtown Miami section, because some of the paths cut through tall buildings. You will be elevated and gives you a different perspective of the downtown Miami scene.

title: Historical Museum Tour
review: Really enjoyed this historical museum. Bring the Family to learn all about Miami and South Florida. Interactive and very educational! Small but very interesting!

title: Great Museum but even better tours
review: As a history buff, I found this place to be excellent, well done and concise. Miami is such a different city in so many ways and this brings that to life. I was particularly enthused and impressed by the fabulous tours they offer on their schedule. Such things as a Miami Crime and Mayhem bus tour, a boat tour of Biscayne Bay and Stiltsville and a walking tour of the Miami Design District.  So far, I've only taken the walking tour of the Design District.  This was truly a gem!!  Done by a dedicated, professional, entertaining and knowledgeable guide. I can't recommend it highly enough.  The tour was priceless in that you would never have gotten that information together yourself. Thoroughly enjoyable!

title: Amazing Traveling Exhibit
review: I would suggest starting with the Cuban exhibit as there is a pile of stuff to see in the museum and it is also fairly emotional.

title: If you want to learn about Miami and South Florida
review: I am new to Miami, moved here last month, and wanted to learn as much as I can about my new home.  Books are great but this museum brings it all into focus from early times to the present day.  At this particular time, they have an incredibly moving special exhibition about Pedro Pan - 14,000 Cuban children were voluntarily given up by their parents to come live in American to escape the communist regime.  The largest movement of children refugees in history.  The even handed manner in which the exhibition was built, with no commentary on politics, made it all that more powerful.  Whether visiting or coming to live here, this needs to be on your list.  They also have great walking and water tours to places of interest in the area.

title: Pedro Pan
review: My daughter and I visited specifically to see Operation Pedro Pan - The Cuban Children's Exodus.  It was very moving.  The rest of the museum was nice but this particular exhibit was the highlight.

title: Rather efficient, and rather easy to navigate
review: I can easily recommend Metrorail for your transportation needs when visiting Miami.

title: lack of security very unreliable
review: dadeland stations, are poorly maintained and managed. lack of security makes this service dangerous sometimes, station elevators dont work to retrieve you vehicle

title: SCHEDULE IS HORRIBLE.
review: They don't really follow a schedule so dress comfortably to wait.

title: Extensive-Getting Dated
review: I really like the coverage and extent of the Miami Metrorail, especially that it connects to MIA and the MetroMover, MetroBuses and the TriRail!  Prices are excellent.  Drivers I met are great!  My only complaint is the complicated ticketing, inability to get qualified discount pricing from machines/no live ticket service at stations.  Miami, if you want to fix this, emulate Sydney, NSW, AUS metro ticketing!!

title: I took the Metrorail from the Airport
review: I had to return a rental car that I rented at the Orlando Airport to drive home to Miami. I realized that I would need someone to pick me up at the airport in the middle of rush hour or return it the next day forcing me to have to have that same person take me to my house to get my car.  So I decided to take the Metrorail.  I have tell you how convenient it was and how quickly I made it from the Airport to Dadeland South where my wife picked me up. I would recommend it to anyone especially in rush hour.

title: Beatles exhibit is awesome!
review: Check out the Beatles until January 18, 2015.  Great place to spend 2-3 hours!

title: Stayed most of the day
review: I must add that the staff were excellent especially the guy that took time to help us in the Beatles and photograph spaces.

title: Really nicely expanded museum - great docents - don't miss current Audubon
review: HistoryMiami has now expanded into the former site of the Miami Art Museum, and has two buildings.  They have wonderful artifacts and graphics depicting the colorful and dramatic history of Miami.  They currently have a display of the almost 500 original full size Audubon prints beautifully displayed.  And the docents are so helpful and knowledgeable.  This didn't used to be a "destination museum", but it is now!  We're going back.

title: Interesting historical background of Miami encompassing 12,000 years ago to present
review: The website does not drum up excitement but if you are going to come here review it for details of your tour.  http://www.historymiami.org/museum/

title: Excellent selection of Miami's history
review: My expectations were completely fulfilled. Excellent selection of key events of Miami's history. Very good photographs, funny memorabilia and quiet interesting remarks. There is also an excellent video about the early days of Miami. Don't miss it. I had been many times in Miami but I never visited this beautiful museum before.

title: Free, but there is a reaon for that..
