review: Station really difficult to find and access. Many "trains" only one car so quite crowded. Slow and not that frequent.

title: Horrible
review: The Miami  Metrorail is public transportation. It runs from Palmetto station to Dadeland South and vice Versa.  It's a convenient way of transportation, if the passenger destination is close to the train station. It save you in gas and the stress of driving, however, the trains are old, dirty, unkept, constantly breaking down and running late. They charge $123.00 monthly for a monthly pass including parking. Once in a while they have the Express which run from Civic Center Station north to Palmetto Station and vice Versa.  Again, the condition of these trains need much improvement, pronto.

title: Miami needs to improve its Metrorail service, plus extend its service to more areas.
review: The one really positive thing is that if you need to get to Miami International Airport, it is a fast, easy, and inexpensive way to get there--IF you live near one of the train stations, or have someone drop you off.  The Metrorail also now connects with the TriRail train, which you can take heading North.  The TriRail will take you to Fort Lauderdale/Hollywood International Airport.

title: Miami Metro Rail
review: The Miami Metro Rail will be a good idea to use at daytime while visiting Miami. Most of it is elevated from the ground and you will be able to see some of Miami's neighborhoods. It only Runs north/south. The great thing is it has a new line going to Miami International Airport. The fare is about $2.50 +- per person.

title: Never on time
review: Never on time, it skip the schedule, breaks frequently, stops in the middle between stations. Not good for commute unless you go with plenty of time.

title: Total overview of Miami's development, from Natives to the 90s
review: HistoryMiami is one of most well presented museums in S FL.  The main permanent exhibit chronicles the development of Miami from the times of the Native tribes, through colonialism, up to the modern develop as a city from Henry Flagler.  Very interesting and detailed information for each time period with mock exhibits, recreations, and photos and artifacts.  I was really moved sitting inside the Buena Vista street car with the segregation sign still posted inside.  If you are a Miami Dade resident, visit the near by Main Branch library and request a Museum Pass, there are several museum throughout the county that participate in this program which gives residents free entry and HistoryMiami is one.  A good visit for the general curious, history buffs, or any resident looking to learn more about the hometown.  Great job guys !

title: Visit this museum first
review: This museum gives a concise and interesting picture of the history of Miami, from prehistoric time to modern development. We spent a couple of hours working our way through the history and the centuries. We enjoyed the sections on piracy, the Spanish American War, the building of the railroad, and modern day. A museum staffer whose father came from Cuba on an innertube boat added a note of immediacy to the immigrant story. Seeing this museum early in your visit to the area will make the rest of the time here more interesting. The museum is located next to the main library, which is also a nice place to visit if you're a curious type.

title: Well worth a visit
review: For someone like me with a high level of interest in history, this place was like crack.

title: Nice, but very crowded with groups
review: We visited this museum today and found it difficult to go around in a chronological order because there were many groups from schools that we had to avoid to get close to the exhibits. The employee at the cashier told us that it is pretty much like that all week long. However, the exhibits and pannels were interesting.

title: Not that interesting
review: Right next to dade county library, I wasn't too impressed... A pretty classic museum that covers natural history from the foundations of original inhabitants of the region. Great if you're a grade schooler in the region... Not so interesting for an adult who was hoping to see a display of post Batista impact on Miami. $8 entry fee

title: A hidden GEM in downtown Miami
review: A beautiful Catholic Church in downtown Miami. After you enter its doors you are WOWed by its grandeur and European architecture and style. The church carries its charms of years gone by...the wooden confessionals, the art work, the statues of Jesus, Joseph and Mary, the gold trimming, the altar...Pastor Father Eddy is amazing as well. A devoted and spiritual man. If ever you are in the area of Downtown Miami - look up " El Gesu" you will be happily surprised as you walk in to the house of GOD.

title: Old and well preserved
review: Donated to the City of Miami in the 1800's this church has stood the test of time.  It is very well preserved and beautiful. Whether you want to attend services or just walk in and savor the beauty from times past, the church will welcome you. There are historical markers at the church that will add to the visit.  Located on the south east corner of NE 2nd street and 1st Avenue, it is very close to downtown Miami.  There is also a gelato spot directly across the street to enjoy after your visit.  Nearest Metro Mover stop is 1st Street Station just over a block away.

title: Interesting material, poorly organized
review: Overall, though, we were pretty happy.  As I said, we did learn a lot about Miami's history, which is the goal of the museum.  If you love history like I do, it's definitely worth a trip.

title: Nice museum for overview of Miami's history
review: A teacher who lives in the condo complex we were renting suggested a visit. We spent about 1 1/2 hours and enjoyed several parts very much. Would recommend for families and adult history buffs.

title: Sinatra Sings for You
review: I enjoyed the memorabilia- clothing and personal effects- supplied by the Sinatra family. The info includes a time line and photos of Frank through the years. Of course, there is plenty of his music available. Do catch the photojournalist, Tom Chapman's exhibit as well. Disturbing and powerful photos that will take you back to past horrors like Jonestown. See Sinatra afterwards to raise your spirits...

title: Love this
review: I loved the neighborhood friendly feel of this spot. The folks here were conversational with us sharing with us what they were doing and letting us take pics. It is a gathering spot for lovers of chess to play and hang out.

title: Enjoy the Domino Park, and take photos
review: Nice neighborhood, and people.  The Cubans are alive, and fun! You can see them in action, and the neighborhood is so exciting, music, stores, markets, art galleries, worth at least 2 hours...but you can see it in one or less, too.

title: Heart of Little Havana
review: Small park full of domino players for most of the day. This is the center of the Little Havana neighborhood and worth a look.

title: Only if you are down there anyway
review: I wouldn't go to little Havana just to see this very little park but if down there anyway stop and see the friendly people playing dominos, chess and card games even though lots of gauching tourists.

title: Cute and interesting!
review: This is a typical landmark of Little Havana, Miami that has to be visited! Walking around Calle 8 you will run into it. Also make sure you visit the Little Havan Welcome Center for details about what interests you have! Enjoy the Domino Park!

title: Beautiful Church
review: The services are always very nice. The building itself is really nice. The artwork inside is something special to see.

title: Great place to worship in the middle of lunch break
review: What an incredible place of worship in the middle of the bustling Downtown Miami tourist and corporate area.

title: Traditional Catholic Church
review: It's a beautiful old church in the center of Downtown Miami.  Mass is held several times a day in both English and Spanish.

title: Excellent exhibits!
review: We had some free time before our flight left on the day of our departure and were looking for something to do close to our hotel.  We visited the History Miami museum which was comprised of two buildings with separate exhibits.  The primary exhibit provided a great historical perspective of the area and how it developed over time,  They had one of the best collections of artifacts from sunken ships that I've ever seen and I've visited museums all up and down the NC/SC/GA coast line.  The second building housed more contemporary exhibits and an interesting exhibit about how sports helped shape the Miami area.  We spent much more time at the museum than we expected to and found it very interesting.  This would be a great rainy day activity or to fill a few hours before your departure flight.  Admission was reasonably priced at $10 per adult and the contemporary exhibit changes from time to time.  If you are a history buff or just want to learn more about Miami, you will enjoy this.

title: Opening Museum for Parker exhibit
review: This was for the opening exhibit for Alfred Parker work. It was very interesting and beautiful design and architecture of homes here in Miami. I really enjoyed seeing this exhibit it's a good exhibit to show for the whole family.

title: Wonderful Museum to Learn about South Florida Culture
review: OK, I am a bit prejudice because one of our former interns works here, but I have to say honestly that this is a well-done and informative museum with a Miami flare.  The rotating collections and special exhibitions are excellent, and there are lots of interactive activities for kids (of all ages) involving actually doing something with your hands, not just interacting with a computer screen.  Great for gaining a better understanding of this part of the US and its people and cultures.  Located right downtown and within walking distance of a lot of hotels, shops, cafes, etc. and the free People Mover train which is fun in and of itself to ride!

title: Worthwhile visit
review: We spent a morning here and learnt a lot about local history. Exhibits were very good, very informative, good explanations as to why and how things happened. Layout was very good. We did not spend much time in the temporary exhibits because we ran out of time but they seemed very good. The staff here were both pleasant and helpful.

title: Little Havana in a nutshell
review: If you are stopping through LH, give it a look. Won't take you long and you won't be able to play unless you know someone, but it's kind of cool to see. But again, it's very small.

title: Not welcoming or very interesting for visitors
review: Maximo Gomez Park has been featured on TV, in travel guides and so on.  I was very keen to see it.  But it is just a very small, crowded park with some people playing dominoes.  You can't participate and there isn't much else to do.  It is an interesting cultural spectacle, but seeing it in person didn't give me any new insight.  All you're going to do is walk by on Calle Ocho and think "oh yeah, that's dominoes park".  They you're going to walk on and have a coffee somewhere.  It's not an attraction in its own right and it's really not worth a trip just to see it.

title: What A Neat Place!
review: It's what I would call "culturally interesting."  It's a part of Little Havana and not out of your way if you are just strolling up and down S.W. 8th Street (Calle Ocho).

title: Just a Nice Place to Visit
review: We enjoyed talking to all the senior citizens that gather here to play board games. There are restrooms and drinking fountains available, too.

title: Fun to watch the intense domino-playing and some chess
review: We were fortunate to go during the Carnaval festival, where there was a tournament going on. The Mayor also showed up. One of the highlights of Calle Ocho, the main drag in Little Havana.

title: located in the cuban quarter
review: full of cuabn old biys playing board games and smoking cuban cigars.. worth a peek if you are in the area....

title: Igh!
review: Very disapointing; this place was closed at 8 pm by the time we got there,  it should be open later..

title: Interesting Place to Visit
review: A definite get together place for those who love to play dominoes.  Everyone there is like family.  Very enjoyable place.

title: Community
review: My family and I stopped off at Little Havana and walked around on our own, as no one came to take us from the Big Bus tours. The Domino Park was filled with people playing the game of dominoes. It was an awesome sight. It promoted a sense of community

title: playing domino
review: This famous park in in famous ijn calle 8. Local player are found playing dominoes. Park is located around many restaurant and store.no fee to enter.

title: Enjoyable!
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: I took my 3-year old daughter to see Cinderella. The place is very nice and well maintain.  The show was supposed to start at 2pm, but it didnt start until 2:30.  It will be nice if they could be on time especially when this type of performance is targetting young audience: children.

title: A pleasant evening's entertainment
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: This was our third visit to the Actor's Playhouse.  The production was well suited to a summer's evening - light, quickly paced, charming, with the hint of a message and a touching moment or two.  The dinner/theatre package that is available is an excellent choice.

title: Nice Theater and Shows
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: we have been members for many years.  We enjoy the productions and the look of the theater.  The staff is very friendly.  The only thing that could use improvement is the lobby bar, new items or a wider assortment would be nice.

title: Great selection of beers, good service and atmosphere
review: We tried a selection of beers which at first looked promising before I settled upon the Session IPA, having previously sampled the Havana and Lychee.  Staff were very pleasant and the place had a nice warm vibe to it.  Would recommend if you're visiting the Wynwood neighbourhood.

title: Good fun, good range of ales
review: A good fun craft beer brewery, one of several in the heart of Wynwood, serving an extensive range of ales. The beach-style theme includes a nice outside area, outsized games, and a fusball table. Good fun place, decent beers.

title: Beautiful
review: So beautiful. Loved the service.  Wish I was closer to go every week. Love the altar.  I have also attended a wedding here.  It was amazing.

title: I HAVE ATTENDED MASS AT THIS CHURCH MANY TIMES !!!
review: Before the Freedom Tower was converted into the Cuban Refugees Processing Center in the early 1960's, this church was the place all Cuban refugees would come to for help upon arrival in the United States. I volunteered here for several months unloading trucks with supplies to be distributed to the new arrivals. Of course I attended Mass here too. I remember there was a "homeless man" who would sing with such a wonderful voice that I would come to church just to listen to him. Many pleasant memories for me here.

title: Great Sunday Service
review: The church was two blocks away from where I was staying. This was fantastic. I could attend Sunday service. The priest was very nice and inspirational. The church (construction wise) is a beautiful building. After that I stopped by there to donate some objects I did not want to keep and bring back home. They were very grateful. It was a nice experience

title: Loved, loved the food!
review: Go to Black Brick restaurant NE 1st Avenue Midtown. It is an excellent Asian restaurant. It is not rated as yet. Go before the crowds discover it . Loved, loved the food. In the midtown area beside Salumeria 104 restaurant which is also good.

title: So many stores and places to eat
review: If you ever break your screen on your iPhone or iPad there is a cart right outside of target that fixed my I thought lost cause iphone 5 for 90 bucks in less than an hr while I shopped, cash only accepted though.

title: Fun, Young and Delicious
review: This place is great for lunch or dinner. Tons of variety from the best Italian in Miami, Brazilian upscale fast food, Sports bars, delicious Mexican food to the best soup & sandwiches in town. Stop and enjoy! Park in one of the garages and walk around before settling in on a great meal!

title: Not something you see every day
review: We enjoyed watching all the people playing dominoes and chess. These people definitely take their games seriously. I was surprised by the number of people playing. Definitely worth stopping by for a few minutes.

title: great experience
review: how wonderful to see people enjoying each other at chess and other thoughtful games instead of playing computer games!

title: Cuban culture at its best
review: Was driving around little Habana and stopped in to this historic site. There were a bunch of tables and a bunch of regulars sitting around and playing dominos. Was a nice afternoon hearing them speak and play.

title: Only in Miami thing
review: Dive right into Miami"s Cuban community. Little Havana has been revitalized and really happening. Dont get hit by a tourist bus. If you can , check out monthly Little Havana art walk...

title: Interesting to Visit
review: If you're in the neighborhood, this little corner park is worth a visit. There's a lot of character in this small, urban space. Lots of people gather here to play chess and dominoes, makes for an interesting 'bring your own' lunch spot. Grab something off Calle Ocho, eat while watching people play!

title: Best Bartending Anywhere
review: Sara is an awesome bartender. The bar is large and comfortable. The native beer is excellent. Try the IPA and when you want a beer desert, have the coffee con flan made with their coffee stout.

title: Good ales, nice place
review: One of several craft beer places in the heart of trendy Wynwood brewing draft ales on the premises, it gets busy outside so we sat inside, but still a good atmosphere. It has a good selection of draft craft beers, it's table service but there is a long bar if you just want to sit on a stool and sup.

title: If you only have time for one Wynwood Brewery
review: Would return – our favorite out of the Wynwood breweries

title: Best Brewery in Wynwood
review: I'd recommend the Belgian Gator Ale, but all brews are good.

title: Go now go often
review: We got a personal tour of the brewery then sat down for beers.  As we were enjoying, the owner brought over several other beers to taste. It was outstanding! The beer was great!

title: Confusing and bad!
review: We were there from out of town and trying to get to airport.  We tried to get on at Government center and it was a joke.  The sign said to take Orange line.  There was no Orange line!  The sign said it would be arriving in minutes and then the train got there and it was a green line train.  So we waited another 20 minutes cause that is when the marquee said it would be there.  Well it never showed up!  We waited over an hour and ended up leaving to get a taxi.  Almost missed our flight.  Way to go to Miami!

title: State of the Art Transportation
review: What an amazing way to move people around a city quickly. You travel in the sky with no driver and are whisked from one end of the city to the other. All cities should have these.

title: Best way to get to the airport!
review: Once I discovered this, I've never driven to the airport again! Why deal with Miami traffic, expensive parking, or pricey taxis?  For 2.50 the metrorail takes you right to MIA.

title: Quick Visit
review: If you're already downtown and have an hour to spare, this is a nice place to visit. Try to go on one of the frequent "fee free" days.

title: Civil War Reconstruction.
review: We traveled by Metro Rail to downtown Miami to History Miami for a  Seminar on the Civil War Reconstruction era. There were several speakers who  researchers  who had sturdied this era and had written several books. They gave the group present a well informed presentation. They broke for a intermission with drinks and a wonderful spread of goodies to eat. We resumes with a question &    answer session. They adjoined about 5PM. It was a well planned program. We are looking forward to the next event. Thank you.

title: Loved the place, a lot of history
review: Great place with a lot of visual history. Fun for the entire family and very interesting history about Miami.

title: Domino days
review: Just stop by and pick up on the local action. Get a snack, drink in the atmosphere. I saw this from the top of the bus tour and had to see more.

title: Old Folks playing Domino Park
review: My uncle used to play here decades ago.  Do not make a special trip to see this tiny park. If you go walking among 8th street then stop by.

title: These guys are serious.
review: It’s not worth making a special journey to see but if visiting Little Havana, spend a bit of time here.

title: Pure Cuban culture
review: Great place to watch local people interact with each other; plus its super close to lots of other Cuban American places of interest.  Lots of places close by for coffee and / or sweet pastries.

title: Beer tasting
review: Will come back again

title: Birthday Celebration
review: We’ll be back for the Brewery Tour.

title: Good beer, terrible service
review: The gripe that I have was the treatment I received from the two waiters.  I was there yesterday with a date.  We ordered the beer sampler with four small glasses, an additional sniffer of beer, and an appetizer which we consumed over a span of about 30-40 minutes.  Since we arrived their body language was indicative that we were not quite welcome.  At first, the waiter suggested I order some additional appetizers, which was fine.  While I said no, I thought at the moment I would stay a while and order more rounds and appetizers.  Then they were constantly stoppingl by to see if we wanted something more from the menu.  That would seem to the reader like good service, except that there was something in their harsh tone of voice, body language, and persistence that made their offerings and suggestions sound more like demands to us to pile more things to the tab.  After that first round, we knew it was time to leave.

title: Cool bar, good food and beer
review: We sat there all night. Cool indoor and outdoor seating. The Horchata Cream Ale (nitro) was by far the most delicious beer I have ever had. I had four and had to drag myself away. The pop up food was good- we had bun things, chips and salsa and burrito. Had veggie options.

title: Girls trip
review: This brewery is pretty cool! Love that you were able to sit outside and enjoy the nice weather! Great tasting beer as well!!

title: Facianting to See
review: I found this fascinating, watching the men play dominoes outside. Never saw anything like that before. The men welcomed us watching them and even allowed us to take photos.

title: Good to do on hot or rainy day
review: The museum is easy to find downtown and is a good way to spend a couple of hours learning the local history with well laid out exhibits. Sometimes history museums can be a bit bland, but that is not the case with this one. If you are going to see it, I think it is a good thing to do early on in the trip as many of the other sights and places you will see around Miami will be all the more interesting because you will be familiar with their history.

title: Wow!  Who knew!
review: Stopped here while on a tour of Little Havana.  I had no idea about the men playing dominoes and the history with it -

title: Interesting Little Park
review: Stopped here to view the domino players.  There were also a couple of chess games in progress.  The park allows domino playing by members only.  However, tourists are allowed to enter and watch the games.  It was an interesting glimpse into this leisure time activity for Little Havana residents.

title: Happy to see this kind of things
review: I like the old guys plays domino in the park, they enjoy and laugh when playing,  I'm happy to see that. you can try it if you are a domino player.

title: Discovering little Havana in Miami
review: Did not meet my expectations at all, place and streets are dirty, smelly. I visited during lunch time.

title: Excellent Venue, Good Productions
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: We've bee here for several plays and always enjoy it. This is a neighborhood theater with a much bigger feel--large auditorium, comfortable seats and good acoustics. Prices tend to be moderate and productions well above average--quite professional and enjoyable,.

title: Come see La Reina de Dominos
review: Grab a cafecito, put on a smile and watch the royalty of Dominoes play.

title: If they let you play
review: I"m not sure how easy it is to get into a game but we were able to watch them play.  It is a local hang out and a great place to people watch.

title: An experience that cannot be recreated!
review: Worth a visit!

title: nothing interesting
review: Nothing else to see. no parking in the area

title: Nice atraction
review: Here we enjoyed with my children watching old Cuban fellows playing Dominoes during day light. They are very happy old people proud of their culture. Please, walk around and also it is very safe.

title: Never a bad seat.
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: Okay, some shows are better than others.  We've been season ticket holders with friends for the past couple of years.  As a package with the neighborhood restaurants with plenty to choose from, we always have a great time.  Alone, the plays are either great or mediocre.  Still, we really enjoy the theater size and ambiance.

title: Always a winning performance for young and old!
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: Great performances and variety of plays for young and old alike! Have been many times over the past 16 years and my children have many fond memories as well! Their grandmother always bought season tickets when they were young and stayed after for them to collect autographs from the cast! The holiday performances are my favorites!

title: Great venue
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: Smaller intimate theatre for performances.  Always reasonable.  Near affordable parking. Check on line for performances.

title: Small theatre filled with talent
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: I went the first time to take my daughter for some acting classes.  The talent of the young teachers is amazing.  She enjoyed every weekly class and was eager for the next one.  They do quiet a few shows there very often and the reviews are always good.

title: Good beer selection
review: I’m from MN and I have been spoiled with are variety and quality of beers. When I travel especially in the south I have trouble finding a brewery that reminds me of home. I was really impressed with concrete Beach Brewery. They have a big variety of beers. Something for a hop head like myself to light ales. If you like beer I would differently stop in.

title: More than just a brewery
review: This is a great spot to hang out as well as a great brewery! They have great craft beers in new and interesting flavors. The vibe is relaxed and welcoming. Board games, dominos and other options to play while you enjoy the delicious crafts beers.

title: A world class ballet company
review: Center. In addition, they have 4 informal programs each year at the school. We have signed up for the upcoming 2012-13 season and can't wait for another year of fabulous dance.

title: Some culture
review: they do a great job and if you are their for a weekend - see if they are presenting something - well worth it

title: Beautiful and Breathtaking Church
review: Coincidently, we were there just a few minutes before that afternoon’s mass, so were able to experience a few minutes of it before leaving.  It was amazing.  Even the presence of the walls around us with the incense, made us feel more spiritual.  It’s something that you have to experience to understand.

title: Historic Site in the center of downtown Miami.
review: This is a beautiful historic site in the center of downtown Miami.  A visit to Gesu Catholic Church is certainly worth a visit whether you're Catholic or not.  The church offers daily morning masses in English and Spanish, as well as all other services.

title: Lovely
review: this church has images of saints and Jesus Christ old and beautiful. when i worked downtown i would attend mass on occasion

title: Beautiful retreat.
review: This is the oldest Catholic church in Miami.  In the middle of Down Town and offers you some quiet time.  Is worth visiting.

title: Beautiful Church
review: If you are visitng downtown Miami this is a wonderful peaceful stop.  just like a cathedral you would find in Europe.  Please be respectful, it is a place of worship.

title: PARKING LOT IS NOT SAFE!
review: My family and I stopped here to grab a bite and parked inside. We had just arrived from NY and had luggages inside the car. When we came back they were all gone! The security was absolutely not helpful and there are no cameras to document what happened!! What are they charging for again???

title: Great Place to walk
review: There was a fountain and great art in the center of it all. Great place to hangout if you are visiting someone who lives in the Midtown area

title: OK shopping...
review: This whole area is very young and I guess everything is catered to the young.

title: Nice place to shop bargains !!!
review: A lot of good price stores, at the same place, Marshalls, Target, Party City,Payless and others, that I didn't have time to go , but I will try to return . It is like an open mal, very clean and not so crowded, a nice place to shop bargains.

title: Nice
review: Its was Nice shopping their only the parking was a little tricky.  But its Nice and cozy.  I Will go there again for sure.

title: Really good food, beer and atmosphere!
review: Been at Veza 3 times and every time is a homerun :D Fantastic food, especially the chicken yakitori. A lot of good beer, and friendly ppl (both visitors and staff). Highly recommend ️

title: Love the food and place
review: Best food in Miami, the buns and burritos was amazing! And the beer lulo sour  also the people and atmosphere is good. There are a lot of board games avaliable, that is nice. Super cosy place!

title: Really nice!
review: My sister and I were looking for a place to take a rest and we found this really nice place that brew their own beer. Dark lager has a chocolate final taste :)

title: Edgy Wynwood
review: Great BrewPub. Incredible servers, with fantastic food. Dog friendly and great atmosphere. Enjoy the Wynwood atmosphere

title: Amazeballs!!!
review: Would reccomend.

title: Bob
review: This thing's a joke it's broken never on time no wonder nobody rides it. They should just tear it down and start from the beginning. Too expensive and not worth it.

title: great way to get around and it's free
review: Sure beats walking in our heat and humidity, quick and convenient in the downtown and Brickell area.

title: Metro Rail a joke
review: Miami dade metro rail is a damn joke. Never on time, non reliable, AC never works and non courties. It sucks that this is the only way of transportation to beat traffic but you are still late even trying to catch an earlier train. Even the new trains AC is garbage and they are never in route. Lucky if you get a new train vs an old one. Every stop it makes there is always a “we’ve stop momentarily” bullsh*t. Where is our tax payer money going to? Their pension plans, retirement, bonuses? How about a more reliable working metro rail. Piece of crap. Good luck for you travelers.

title: Horrible. From 1800's
review: No maintenance. Dirty . Disgusting

title: Worth an afternoon of your vaca
review: This was a great experience. A very comprehensive account and display of Southwest Florida. Children may not care for this one.

title: Excellent historical overview
review: We were very positively surprised. We hadn’t thought that southern Florida had a substantial history but it does, and this museum presents it perfectly. Well worth the $10 entry fee. There are 2 buildings. One is focused on the hurricane from 25 years ago. It’s the other one on the 10000 year history that is the better.

title: Ugly area in downtown.Shady people around
review: Don't go there is nothing inside good that is worth it.The area is one of the ugliest in downtown.It's not really a museum.This is typical for Miami.

title: Get a concise history of the city.
review: This is a veritable encyclopedia of the area, tracing the timeline from the indigenous population to contemporary benefactors who laid the foundation for the city.  A must-see for the curious.

title: Super cool
review: Loved watching the locals at game. You won't necessarily stay long, but fun to see. Go and take a look.

title: A small part of Little Havana
review: Then Little Havana awaits you.

title: Interesting game
review: It was interesting watching the senior playing dominoes and how they get into game.  A bit of watching the game then walked over to eat ice cream.

title: Very unique atmosphere
review: Great sight even for me who are quite familiar with Domino. It reminded me my grandfather who was addicted to the game. For children this is also a unique experience, and it was great to see some of the players asking my kids to paricipate and help them. Probably the best spot in little havana, as you really have the chance to be part of a local experience. 15 minutes shall be enough to have a feeling about it, but you can spend more. Highly recommended.

title: I love this theatre
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: I go regularly to the Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre, particularly on the Saturday matinees when they have theatre for the younger crowd. I take my grandchildren and they are always fascinated. It seems impossible that such young artists can perform so well. It is very entertaining and educative at the same time. I highly recommend this theatre.

title: Great Venue Performances
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: If you enjoy off-broadway plays this is very nice place to visit. Their new season is starting in October. prices range from $45-$55. The theater is not as large so you have a pretty good view from whenever you seat. Their is parking in the rear and you have plenty of restaurants you can choose to eat from before the show along Miracle Mile. The theater also shows kids plays and free movies on occasion.

title: Authentic old Theatre
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: Whilst living in Coral Gables we past this place and saw they were showing a late-night showing of Pink Floyd's "The Wall", so we went in. It's a lovely old place that has been kept in great condition, well worth a visit.

title: Awesome Performance
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: We took out Granddaughters to see Narnia. It was great. All the kids loved it. Super impressed with the young talent on the stage. Thank you

title: Evening out with the girls
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: What a cool spot to hang out and they had a live band we walked in on Sunday and it was popping, they play the best 'old school' Cuban music. They place gets super lively with tourist and locals. It is fantastic for people watching! The older Cuban ladies come all dressed up and have amazing dance moves. The staff was very friendly and the drinks are a bit on the expensive side but who cares you are on vacation.

title: AMAZING
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: If you are in Miami on vacation this is definately one of the best place to visit.  Not only does it have history, you can enjoy a cigar, have a cuba libre, and enjoy great dancing. The party starts on Thursday nights. The music is old havana, danzon, tangos, and many other great music. The drinks are fantastic. The energy is awsome. You can find people dancing in the sidewalks and just having a great time. Close to other restaurants, and the famous ice shop AZUCAR (Celia Cruz). They have flavors that will blow your mind.  The parking lot is a little difficult.There are meters in the street. Its a safe place to walk at night special Thursday, Friday and Saturdays when its the most packed. Cuba glory at its best. Bring your guanavera and your dancing feet.

title: Artistic excellence.
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Located in Little Havana. Has bars with amazing range of rums, music area (trombonist playing jazz) and an amazing art studio with many wonderful works to view. Outside on the walls and pillars there are further artworks. A MUST VISIT.

title: Unique place!
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: We walked on Calle Ocho and stop by this beautiful museum! Cubaocho ia very unique place to visit. We talked to Pedro about the place and we were impressed. Next time we going for the live music!

title: Sweet brewery
review: This brewery is really cool. The outdoor area is super nice and they have plenty of brews on tap. You can get glasses or flights. They had a sweet list of upcoming game nights and special events they had. Worth checking out for sure!!!!!

title: Great Spot with Good Beer
review: This is a really cool Brewery found in the Wynwood section of Miami. They have an indoor/outdoor bar and true to its name, it is made of concrete. They have a good beer selection that rotates and the staff is very nice. Most nights they have different food vendors to get food from. They have a bunch of games for patrons to use and I love how the display art from artists in the area. The even feature local artists work on their cans, which is awesome! It is a great place to meet up with friends or go to after seeing the Wynwood Walls. I highly recommend Concrete Beach if you are in the Wynwood area!

title: Delish!
review: At this point of the afternoon, after Wynwood Walls, two light lunches each, drinks, and more touring about the neighbourhood, we were full up but still a bit thirsty. So two of us shared the tasting rack of four sample beers for $10 (!!!! cheap for healthy pours!!) and experienced beer bliss. All four were very different, some were pretty high alcohol content and I felt distinctly 'happy' and glad we caught an Uber back to our accommodation,

title: Beautitious Ballerinas
review: First time my wife had ever visited a ballet. The Arsht Center was beathtakingly beautiful. and the 3 ballets which began the season( 2 choreographed by Balanchine , and one of these  to music by Tshiakovsky) were absolutely mesmerizing.  All of the performers nc from Corps de Ballet up thru the Principals, were spot on , and the synchrony, of both hand,and leg movements, were frankly unreal. When the final curtain fell, I was breathless. A must see

title: Worth Seeing
review: We were able to get tickets for the Open Barre event with Chita Rivera.  The Open Barre events are always worth going to.  The room is small, so it is more intimate and the seats are very close to the stage.  Any time you can see the Miami City Ballet is a treat, but the Open Barre events are even more so.

title: HORRIFIC EXPERIENCE- LEFT STRANDED IN MIAMI
review: I am sure the ballerinas and dancing would have been beautiful, however, the way in which the company handles itself is repulsive.

title: Seeing the Nutcracker in Miami
review: I would imagine that very few families that come to South Beach end up booking tickets to the Miami City Ballet.  In fact, it was a perfect day at the beach when we went to see the Nutcracker on Christmas Eve.  And we are happy that we did as it was a beautiful production by a very strong cast of dancers that kept our 10-year-old captivated for 2 hours.  I would love to see more performances by this company.

title: One of the few old Catholic churches in Miami.
review: This landmark located in downtown Miami is the oldest Catholic church in Miami.  It has recently been restored and the finished product is outstanding.  For tourists who like to visit churches, this one is a must.

title: A Treasure of Miami
review: We came across Gesu, since it was close to our Hotel. A beautiful old Church. School kids were in many pews this Saturday afternoon practicing for Communion. Monsignor had a great singing voice. Nestled among the streets and shops of old downtown.

title: A heavenly Daisy
review: A Beautiful small church located in downtown Miami, a peaceful oasis in the hustle and bustle of a busy downtown.

title: Delayed in Miami
review: Beautiful church. If your visiting Miami, its a must attend. The heritage, paintings, statues and stain glass are a must see. Service are scheduled in Spanish and English. The congregation is very welcoming. Unforgettable !!

title: Miami Land Mark
review: The neighbour around it is not secure, you must be on the lookout arriving & departing.

title: Really intersting even during the day!
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: This place seems to be a very interesting place to visit at night with live music, but even during the day you can enjoy the art, the furniture and the nice people working there! Stop by and have a nice refreshing drink!

title: Nice place, but didn't like the music
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Nice bar with a lot of local regulars. The walls are full of paintings and photos, and a lot of sculptures and artefacts are present as well. When we visited the bar hosted an open mic of sorts, and I have to say that the style didn't suit my taste at all.

title: Didn't Expect to Find An Art Museum in Little Havana
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: We happened to be walking SW 8th Street and saw this place and went in.  The Art was varied, interesting, and much was very beautiful.

title: Nice place for a Mojito
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: We arrived early with 2 children... we could enjoy the atmosphere, had a mojito (water for kids :) ). It’s really a great bar, that remember a little bit the “best” Havana bars

title: Piece of culture with a nice drink!
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Paintings, furniture you see are (most of them) for sale also.

title: Nice Scenery
review: This location is very quiet and calming.  We had the best shopping experience at the shops at Midtown Miami.  We will be back soon.

title: Very nice
review: I see midtown shaping into another south beach. Besides no free parking it's a great atmosphere a lot of shops and plenty of dining options. I'd rather be park on the street than in the garage but that's a preference I can't wait till everything surrounding is finished.

title: Great shops especially outlets
review: Midtown is quiet new area with great shops especially outlets. You will find there Guess outlet, Ross, Marshalls, Home Goods..and some few more. Also good places to eat or drink you will find there. Everything is open until late so even in the evening hours you can go for shopping and have a good dinner. I have been there for 3 months so I know the area and shops quiet well ;)

title: Great shopping mall
review: I went to the Midtown Miami shopping mall. It has a gread selection of shops. Target, Nordstrom rack, Marshalls and Guess factory shop. I did a great shopping on lower prices than on South beach. I recommend this place for lower price shopping.

title: Midtown Miami has it all
review: To sum it up, we had an excellent shopping experience and Midtown Miami.

title: Great spot for a date night
review: Veza Sur was a great spot for date night. Awesome vibe, good food and their beers were delicious, especially No Reservations IPA. The staff was very friendly, restrooms were kept clean, Jenga games galore, DJ played an array of music from old school to current day jams....the perfect venue for a perfect evening.

title: Super Star!!!!!!!
review: From Madison Wi

title: Vezasur Br. Wynwood
review: Nice place to stop for a drink and also for lunch. A lot of beers to taste! Games for children! Good stop!

title: I tried only the sour
review: Creative beer. I tried only the sour this time - two recipes. The Pim Pam Pom Pomegranate fresh light and a bit sweet. The Lulo Sour more dry, more sour. Both excellent in Miami humid heat.

title: The best of the Wynwood breweries
review: After sampling several beers at all the Wynwood area breweries, which are all good, have to give a slight edge to Veza Sur. The beers are just a bit more creative and better brewed. The environment is the most comfortable of them all and the service is excellent.

title: easy to use
review: delighted that we were able to take the Metrorail directly from the airport to our hotel,at a fraction of what a taxi would have cost

title: Awesome!!!
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Honestly it is great that this place exists. I love the atmosphere and the love that was put into designing and making this place. The people who work there are extremely welcoming and the drinks aren't bad. I'd say check it out.

title: fun, funky,  a must buy mojito location !
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Walk through the atrium to Guantanamera's Cigar/Coffee Cafe where samples of fresh coffee espresso drinks await if you ask, and a cigar to boot !  Would love to see this place at night bustling with people ! Will be back next year.

title: Interesting combination...museum/bar
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: I would like to come at a different time.  I went specifically to see the art.  There was a wide range of pieces.  I was shocked to see it displayed with little protection from guest, which it appears could be eating or drinking right beside it.  There was a bar, but I was never approached or offered anything.  Still, I think it's definitely worth coming in. There are things I wish I had asked about and hope to return next time I'm in town.  I came at an odd time.  No performances or goings on at that time. It's right in the heart of Calle Ocho, which at this particular spot seems to be receiving a decent number or tourists.

title: Party
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Wow what a great place!  The pace was amazing. The place has great art work, stain glass hanging lamps Tiffany style.  The bar uses old fashioned glass decanters to store the fruit juices for mix drinks.  The bartenders were super great the MOJITOS are to die for!  The live music was great they played all type of Latin "dance" music they have enough room to dance the night away.  I truly felt like I was transported to   Cuba a true experience if you down by Calle Ocho in Miami Florida. Stop by and experience the Cuban culture.

title: Best Rum Selection in Miami and quite a few other places around the World!!!!!
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: The late night partying is worth experiencing.

title: great riding around
review: used this twice and was good , plenty of trains running smoothly only issue I had was with the day pass I bought the readers struggle to read if they are loaded onto mobile phones but attendants are at hand to help out so all good

title: Frequent Service
review: A frequent service from the airport to enable you to access many areas of downtown Miami.  Carriages are quite old and could do with a facelift but a good service nevertheless.

title: Making the Airport accessable
review: Getting to an from airports is always a problem but the ease of getting from downton Miami to MIA using the Metrorail is great.  There isn't even a surcharge to go to the Airport like Chicago to ORD.  If you want to avoid taxi or limo fares this is great.

title: A must for any fan of history
review: If you are interested in history at all this museum is a must see. I really took the time to read the signs. For instance I did not know that by the time the US government got done forcing the Seminoles out of Florida into Oklahoma there were only 40 of them left. They fled into the Everglades where the government was unable to reach them. A very sad chapter of Florida history. This museum is not flashy or interactive but there are great stories and photographs here documenting important historical events. I enjoyed my visit immensely.

title: Interesting Museum with Fabulous Staff!
review: What an interesting museum.  It’s split into two buildings with multiple exhibits in each.  Most of the exhibits are artefacts focusing on Miami’s subcultures such as the biking community, LGBTQ, the Cuban community etc.  There’s also artefacts dating back to the 40-60s, which were used in Miami, as well as photography galleries.  The main exhibit is on the top floor of the second building which focuses on Florida’s history from the creation of the Everglades after the ice melted to the different Native American tribes which have lived there for hundreds to thousands of years.  On my way out, I asked the girl, Eliana, working the admissions desk a few questions about the area.  She was so insightful about the history of so many things!  She gave me recommendations for places to try unique Miamian foods and we actually ended up chatting for 2 hours!  She’s a credit to this museum!

title: Good overview of Miami history
review: Unfortunately we ran out of time to see the temporary exhibitions. The place was extremely quiet on our midweek visit. Many thanks to the friendly and informative lady on the reception desk.

title: sail away
review: This is where you see some serious domino playing. There's many people playing and interesting to watch.

title: Must See
review: There are nice clean public restrooms in the rear of the park.

title: Nice place
review: They were very friendly and did not really care about the tourists paying by.

title: Great place to socialize with the locals
review: Great place to watch all the domino games and the interactions with the locals.  Located right on the corner and easy to find!

title: Really local domino gamea
review: Great to see the traditional games played by the Cuban community. This place is a piece of real history.

title: The Cuban Rio Scenarium in Miami!
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: The Cuban Rio Scenarium in Miami! Very good ambiance, with great art work for sale, good band, good drinks. Excellent choice for a night out! I have loved it!!!!!

title: Ñoooo, Azucar!
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: The most important thing that you must do if nothing else is to order a mojito. It's by far the best mojito in the world. Not even in Cuba can they make a mojito this good. It's not full of sugar which is always a common mistake. Que Bòla hacere or better yet as Pitbull so eloquen likes to say... Dàle!

title: Very different but Excellent
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: The back area is delight too

title: Antiques, music, rum collection and a bar in one stop
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Well when you walk in it's an eclectic mix of antiques music and a bar.  Not sure how else to explain it buts it's a fun place to have a drink and soak in the neighborhood

title: Perfect place for a rest and for fun
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: We had the impression we really have found the best attraction of Little Havana, and we just did not want to go out!

title: Actors Playhouse
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: The Miracle Theatre production of 'Buyer and Cellar', stars Chris Crawford, he plays a host of famous people, including Oprah Winfrey, Bea Arthur, James Brolin, even Barbara Streisand. In the play Barbara Streisand turned the basement of her Malibu mansion into a shopping mall. An out of work actor takes the job as the sole employee of the mall.

title: An Amazing Night
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: It was a thrill night to spend sometime watching "MILLION DOLLAR QUARTET" which is a Tony® Award-winning Broadway musical inspired by the famous photo and phenomenal true story of the famed Sun Records Memphis Studio recording session by Sam Phillips that brought together rock ’n’ roll revere Elvis Presley, Johnny Cash, Jerry Lee Lewis and Carl Perkins  for the first and only time in their careers. The young actors who play the characters revive these great musicians with their talents and witty. The play is superb and if you get to see it from October the 19th through January 1 2017, you'll have a great time.

title: Million dollar quartet
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: Absolutely fantastic. You would swear Jerry Lee Lewis and Johnny Cash were on stage and nailed it!   Carl Perkins was great but i am not too familiar with his work. Elvis,what can i say about Elvis!  Close your eyes and Elvis WAS in the building!  The entire cast ROCKED!  Narrator  Sam Phillips, owner of Sun Records, fabulous!  I felt like i was seeing a  Broadway production.  At the end of the play you felt like u were at that jam session in Sun Records studio!

title: Exhilarating evening - Million Dollar Quartet
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: The Miracle Theater is a lovely, restored 1940's movie theater which has been divided into 2 floors. The original balcony is now a separate and quite intimate theater. This was the setting for Million Dollar Quartet. We felt as if we were in the midst of the action. It is a spirited musical about a jam session with Elvis Presley, Johnny Cash, Jerry Lee Lewis and Carl Perkins. The music is great and the energy is fantastic. The actor playing Johnny Cash sounded so like him, it was amazing! The antics by Jerry Lee Lewis while playing the piano were astounding! The acting was quite good, especially by the characters of Dyanne and Sam Phillips. My 20 something niece was sure that she was the youngest member of the audience by more than a decade, but this did not mean that the musical is only for those who grew up with this music. She loved it. As did I!  Million Dollar Quartet is currently playing through January 1. We got our tickets the morning of the performance.

title: A fantastic night!
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: What a great discovery. This places brings Cuba alive. They offer the largest selection of different rums in the world. Live music traditional and top class. Staff very friendly. Atmosphere is fantastic, Full of rhythm and dancing. Prices usual for Miami but well worth the visit.

title: Grown up time
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: I saw Cubaocho online but was enchanted when I got there. We loved the envirinment, music and vitality. I recimmend it ti all that go to Miami!

title: A rare and unique bar - one of the best in the world
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: I love and cherish this place. From the antique furniture that everyone is allowed to sit on to the amazing collection of Cuban art ranging from the 1850s to 1959, this bar is like no other in the world. Their rum collection is unrivaled and the staff always treats us with respect.

title: Great place for live music 🎶
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: The live band on Saturday nights was awesome! Traditional Cuba food is served so go eat, drink and dance all in one spot!

title: Rum Tasting and Pre-Revolution Artwork
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Very Authentic location, which is a must see in the Iconic Miami neighborhood of Little Havana.  The people were friendly and the place is a feast for the eyes, with numerous artworks reflecting the pre Communist days of Cuba.  The owner, if you meet him is a well of information and wit.  It has a great bar and feature live music, although I don't know the shedual.

title: walking down south beach ....
review: Walking in the heart of Miami Beach you can find this permanent art work that represents perfectly the "South Beach" mood in an amzing and colorful way, for sure it will become the City Brand in future.

title: A Must thing to do if you are in South Beach
review: Nice Concept and Nice Artwork for Miami.

title: The best place to take a picture in SoBe
review: It’s an amazing spot to take a souvenir picture in SoBe. Very impactful structure and stunning color. Pictures come out just perfect ! 100% recommended.

title: Interesting beer
review: A nice brewery in a sketchy area.  Make sure you go with friends.  The bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable.  Have a flight, so you can taste a variety of styles. They have snacks.  They usually have a good truck, and there are food places all around.

title: Loved it the first time, not so much second time
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: I visited this place with my fiancé a few months ago, we had an incredible time. We decided to go back again last week. We were bored. It was a Friday night and the place was dead. We know exactly why, the DJ absolutely stinks. People kept on coming in and out of the place, they would come, sit for a few minutes and then leave. Why? the music, its horrible. The DJ has no clue who his audience is, he plays music that is not what the visitors to that place want to hear. HELLO, CUBAOCHO? we go there to listen to Latin music, salsa, merengue, bachata. Instead, he plays stuff no one wants to hear or identifies with. I DJ back in the 80s when I was in college and the first lesson I learned is, "read your audience", play what they like, if they are dancing, keep playing that style, if they sit down, change it quickly. He does not get that. My advise to management is, get rid of the DJ and find someone that knows about who you are and who the people that visit you are, we are mature, professionals, We don't want to hear Pitt Bull all night, we want to hear Celia, Merengue, Salsa.....also, since the name is Cubaocho, you may want to suggest he researches what Cuban music is like. Also, the bar tenders leave a lot to be desired, the mojitos were inconsistent all night, the first one was LOADED with Rum, the second, it was a lemonade, the third, tasted like a rum and coke. Get professional bartenders and a professional DJ. The service was very good thought. We will return to see if anyone reads this post. There is a bar right up the street that was packed, Ball and Chain.....everyone was dancing and having a good time, everyone in Cubaocho seemed bored. Hey management, pay attention to your place or you wont survive. Its a cut throat business, you are not paying attention to it.

title: Great atmosphere and art works/ambience
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: This place is a cafe/bar and arts/performance center that you must see. It's filled with great artwork and the design of the space is very rich and elegant. Not sure about the food or coffee scene, as I was there at an off hour. But plan ahead to catch some musical performances and support great art in the otherwise gritty scene of Calle Ocho

title: What a Fabulous Night of Latin Music!
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: We were in Miami for 3 nights and had looked for a live club, but could not find anything online.  Happily, when we did our walking tour of Little Havana as part of our Big Bus package, our guide took us in here and said that we should come back for the live music.  We are so glad we did!  The Cuban exiles who make this corner of Miami home have such a "joie de vivre" and it was on display in full swing here and all over the streets of Little Havana.  Perhaps I am happy that this is not more widely advertised - it was crowded enough without ads!  We will be back!  A night to remember!

title: Pleasantly surprise by the atmosphere
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: This is a great place to go to listen to music and have some drinks.At the time we visited they have live Cuban music.The bar seems to be well stocked. You can seat outside if you want to grasp what Calle 8 is all about or in their courtyard or you can seat inside and admire the creative environment and the innumerable pieces of art to admire and enjoy. The place is fairly new and the concept is interesting. We didn't eat and I cannot testify to that part of the business.

title: great music
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: if any body would have told me that I would be partying in calle ocho to a rock band I would say they were nuts , this place is amazing the rum collection is worth checking out

title: Drop by Concrete Beach after visiting Wynwood
review: Decor, atmosphere, beer and nachos does not disappoint.

title: Beeeeeeer
review: This is a very stylish place with a fantastic selection of beer. The beer flights are a great way to sample a range of beer on offer. Beer and sunshine, what more do you need?!

title: Great hangout spot
review: Came with my friend to hang out and love the layout of the place.  Have alot of games to play and we ended up doing 4 flights of beer while playing dominoes.  Beers were decent but I would come back just to hang out and have a cold one.

title: Disappointing
review: This beatiful and traditional school seems not to care about visitors. Our previous emails were never responded and even after we were there, no visit was permitted. They had a few reasons, but not enough to dismiss a teenager who crossed the continent in order to have the experience.

title: Ballet espana
review: The hall is lovely and although large has excellent seating.  Both lodge and second and third tiers excellent.  The ballet espana was doing an integrative piece that was beautiful.  Stage is large for major numbers. Nice set up for drinks and snacks.  Good ventilation in hall. Location excellent and even walkable from city center hotels. Near arena for Heat and near park and bay..  Excellent venue.

title: Amazing show
review: i just wish they make the check in  process (ticketing) electronically as to avoid wasting time waiting in line to retrieve tickets for will call

title: Romeo and Juliette
review: But I do miss the Edward Villela touch!!

title: Think twice if you are a true ballet fan
review: This was the first ballet where I saw people actually putting their legs up onto the balcony railings during the performance. Of other annoying things worth noting are clapping every now and then when people just felt like it without taking no notice of music. The performance I came for was Nutcracker and even though there was an orchestra pit instead of orchestra there were 4 big amplifier placed. The performance itself was ok.

title: Gesu Catholic Church
review: Situated in downtown Miami, it is a historical Roman Catholic Church, with full service.  Great for residents and workers in the downtown area

title: Gesu Catholic Parochial School and Church.
review: I went to Gesu Catholic Parochial School and attended Mass there and made my 1st Communion. There will never be another Church that moves my heart like Gesu!

title: Italy in Miami
review: The oldest and most beautiful church in Miami.  This is a most see in your list of places when you travel to Miami.  This church has been added to the historical socitety.  This church has been in Miami since the late 1800's.  Actually reconstructed by Henry Flagler. If historical places  and churches are your thing, then I highly recommended this church.  Its like going to a cathedral in Italy, just built in Miami.  This used to be an old wood house back in the 1800's.  It was the first catholic school in Miami.back then. This church is not in a good area, Please visit only in the day time and if possible during the weekdays.  The church does open early and its open until 4pm.  There are masses during the week, sat. and Sunday.  This church is located the downtown Miami which has good places and bad places.  Always stick to the crowd when walking.  During the week there are lots of business people, police and protection.  Some places are open on saturday in this area while many are closed.  Sunday not a good idea to walk around this place since everything is closed.  No activities lots of homeless people.  Parking lot can be a problem, you must pay for it.  Better idea to go with someone that know the area.  Beautiful experience.

title: my kind of Catholic Church in Miami
review: Very old Church that is a history landmark for Cuban exiles from the 1950's and 60;s. plenty of space to observe Mass  comfortably, love the priest, meaningful sermons. A good sample of old Miami Architecture in downtown Miami

title: Amazing place and over the top mojitos
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: A must if you visit Miami or if you live here. The place is right in front of Dominos Park...how much more awesome can that get?

title: Vienes y encultase
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Phenomenal spot to absorb the true Miami,  no beaches, know spirits to fly by the knights of the souwt acera into wetchesta!-@bigtidepro across #TWRTHTRE #DominoPark +brianalbert

title: A very picturesque place!
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Very interesting place, very historic and picturesque. Easy public access and interesting to visit and watch its memorabilia.

title: The lost Art of the great Masters from Cuba
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Landmark gallery for Art by the great Cuban Masters. This art was thought to be destroyed by the Castro regimen and was recovered and is now displayed here and some pieces have traveled around the world for exhibition.

title: A gem at Calle Ocho
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: This has been renovated and they did a great job.  Lots of memorabilia, cozy and excellent music.  You can sit outside in the patio, inside at the bar or in one of the beautiful sofas or chairs.  A very nice place to spend an unforgettable evening, and don't forget to put on your "guayabera".  (Go next door and have the best ice cream in Miami)

title: beuatiful Church great temple for worshipping
review: Gesu is, I think one of the oldest churches in Miami and reminds me of European temples where it shows classical architecture of old churches. great place to feel connected with God and for Praying.

title: Gorrin Bros Hat Shop
review: We stopped in to check out the hats!  Not only did I leave with an amazing hat I wore to the boat show but Israel was so friendly and helpful with suggestions about restaurants and other attractions in the area!

title: Nice and new and fresh
review: Feels good to shop in the street away from the crowds. From Ross outlet to small boutiques and all kind of different restaurants

title: Great option solo or with friends
review: This mall was recommended to me on a very rainy day by the bellman at my hotel. However he got it wrong he told me that it was enclosed so it was a good option for the rain but it's actually not enclosed. In any case I'm glad I went. They have Ross, Nordstrom rack, and Marshall's and some other big box stores in addition to some boutiques. Great place to go have lunch or dinner. Lots of restaurant options in every price range.if you're staying at the Hyatt, Marriott or Doubletree that are all near each other there is a free trolley that takes you right to this location and will bring you back. I believe it runs until 11 PM.

title: Perfect place for shopping!
review: I love this place for two reasons: great vibes for shopping and awesome deals. There are great selections of restaurants to go to and stores that you want to visit - Marshals, Target and Ross. If you have time, stop by the Venetian spa! It's perfect for a me-time.

title: Nice spot!
review: This is a really cool place in Midtown. They have everything here, from shopping to eating. You could easily spent most of the day here. Nice place!

title: Fantastic location
review: I could have a great experience with interesting cocktails created with the beer!!!

title: Get Cafe Con Flan!
review: I’ve gone to Veza Sur a handful of times and I’ve always enjoyed it. They serve some great beers, but most notably is the Cafe Con Flan. I live out of town and literally crave them! They have both indoor and outdoor seating and were able to accommodate our large group most recently, even on a busy night. Great atmosphere as well. Definitely a place to go in Wynwood!

title: Cool Brewery in a Cool Neighborhood
review: In conclusion, if you want lively atmosphere, good beer and variety, and a spot reflecting the non-tourist Miami, Veza Sur is a fine starting point.

title: Wood brew
review: Best latin brews in wynwood. Make sure you stop by and taste miami. Atmosphere is vibin. Chill spot to hangout, drink, listen to the dj tear it up. Play boardgames. And nost important. EAT. THIER PERUVIAN FOOD TRUCK IS IMPECCABLE. you will not regret trying anything.

title: Good service and menu options
review: Good service and menu options. Is a brewery with nice selection  of beers and beer based cocktails. You can find here tipical bar table games to share and have a good time among friends and family

title: When is it open?
review: After an unhelpful visit at the nearby Art Deco "Welcome" Center, I suppose it was not our day to visit South Beach vistor centers.

title: Fascinating Place
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: This is a fascinating bar/art gallery with millions of dollars of Cuban art well worth seeing.  They have a nice courtyard as well.  They make a very good traditional mojito so this was a nice place to rest after exploring the neighborhood for several hours.  Service, however, was pretty slow.

title: Nice Cuban-style environment
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Waiters are friendly, appetisers are good and great spot to appreciate a bit of Cuban culture. Good place to smoke a cigar and enjoy few hours of chatting with friends. Recommended.

title: Calle Ocho Monster Food Fest.
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: If you havn't beeen , you most go..It's a Cuba & Latin Street Party..Onle one in the World..Right hear in Miami..Ask anyone, where is Cuba Ocho..you won't be sorry

title: This is a place we all admire so much
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Joy, excellent Cuban music, friendly people, a bar with original drinks. The service is best of all!

title: AMAZING!!!
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: If you are cuban,have cuban family members or just want to be transported to the Amazing Cuba before the Castro Regimen took over;this is the place for you. The mojitos are divine,it was a pleasure to speak with the owner,his story is mind blowing.I liked the place so much,that the presentation for my most recent book was held there,PERFECT,PERFECT,PERFECT!!!!! So what are you waiting for,just GO!@!!!

title: Great Stop for LGBT
review: WHile in South Beach, stopped here to get the "low down" on the LGBT community in the area. Most welcome and helpful.

title: Add this to your to do list. It's worth a visit.
review: It's been a while since I was at the Visitor Centre. If you're staying in Miami Beach and want to find out more about the LGBT culture and history of the area - as well as what to do today - you should pop in. The centre is across the street from Twist, so you already know how easy it is to find.

title: Warm and friendly place to get local and tourist info
review: They have it all here. A great place to stop for community magazines, organization info, what to do and where to go in South Beach and beyond. Definitely a must-stop-by.

title: Small network, easy to use and it's FREE!
review: Great way to see some of Miami Beach area.  Its' free and very easy to use.  It's not a big Metrorail system, but It was great for taking the weight off your feet for awhile.  Great for small children.  Get's busy during peak times.

title: Great free tour of Downtown Miami
review: The metro rail is cheap and eliminates the need for a car.It is easy to buy a pass and for just under $6 a day you can travel from the airport or Hialeah all they way to Dadeland. It connects to the MetroMover which is free and it takes you on a beautiful tour through downtown Miami. It also has free WiFi.

title: Free Ride
review: Cheapest way to see the entire city - FREE

title: We have new trains - but things are always delayed
review: The trains are now coming as they should - instead of every 12 minutes - they now come every 5 mins during rush hour.  After rush hour (about 10:00 a.m.) all the vagrants seems to ride the trains - some are aggressive - some are on drugs - sleeping on the trains - asking for money.  As to the airport - I would not recommend taking the trains - to or from the airport -again - too unreliable and homeless/criminals preying on tourists.  Please be careful - sadly - Miami needs to revamp its transportation system.  The buses are no better - only during rush hour are they sort of reliable - after that - the vagrants come out.  As to wi-fi service onboard?  Good luck with that.  I gave up trying to connect years ago - I just use my mobile service.

title: Blessing for people of Miami
review: used few times for going to Downtown Courthouse .. wooow was so easy and money saving . made my work easy and saved tons of $$. will recomed to all

title: Part of Art Basel
review: HistoryMiami is a great Museum that provides the foundation of the creation of Miami.  Parking at the Miami-Dade Cultural Center Parking Garage at (50 NW 2nd Avenue) is a flat $5 if validated at HistoryMiami.   I saw Frank Sinatra in 2016 but now there is an exhibit which is part of the Art Basel event.   While some exhibits are permanent I found different items on the 3 different times that I visited.   They change the exhibits often.  Enjoy the photos.

title: A hidden gem in downtown Miami.
review: This two-bujilding museum covers the colorful and interesting history of Miami very well.  I expected to spend a half hour here and was instead so fascinated that I lingered for two hours.  The location -- right next to the Government Center MetroRail and MetroMover stations -- could not be more convenient.   The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful.  Give it a try for "something different" in Miami.

title: Great Museum
review: I wish there was a gift shop, maybe there was but I didn't see it.

title: A great night!
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: We were here for the Latin Jazz Violin Festival and it was an unforgetable night. The customer service, both over the phone and at the place, was fantastic. My fiance' plays the violin so we were very furtune to see such a great show on Saturday night with Federico Britos and Nicole Yarling. We truly enjoyed the night and such great talent. Waiting for next year festival.....

title: Amazing Place
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: We accidentally missed the bus back and had to wait 30 minutes for the next one and so stumbled across this place for a beer.  They gave us lovely authentic Cuban beer and we chatted with lots of the locals.  The place itself was beautiful, decked out with really expensive, interesting  paintings and furniture and even some of Frank Sinatra’s furniture. They had a little courtyard in the middle with a little fountain also. We were advised they had excellent dance nights here, and music nights and was a shame we didn’t get to go to one. The lady behind the bar was really friendly and all together this place was one of the highlights of my stay in Miami.  Needless to say we missed the next 4 buses before leaving to get one of the last buses   (by the way the photo above that someone has posted is not the same place)

title: Beautiful but Clueless
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: If you have a Groupon,  beware.  If you're going to eat, you might consider eating elsewhere, and if you're into wine, just know they are not.  Our red wine was warmer than a Miami summer day.

title: Time Machine!
review: Seeing Domino Park was like going back in time via a Time Machine!  To watch these people play and strategize was a real eye opener into a culture past - and present. I really appreciated this stop - maybe you will too.

title: A Fun Local Activity for People That are 55 and Up
review: On a tour I learned about the strict rules that are in place for this activity to be available for the local seniors who are age 55 and up. I am glad it is run with respect, and is available for the local people to meet and spend time together doing something they enjoy. :-)

title: Need to visit
review: I stood watching the old foggies play and enjoy the day away. You have to be at least 55 to play. You’d probably have to have connections before you can play. All the seats a full.

title: Fun and free to watch
review: Walking to this square one can enjoy the sights and sounds of these domino enthusuasts.  Alas all the signage is in Spanish; we did not understand much, but it was fun to watch.

title: Finally an awesome theater!!
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: Parking is always painful in the big city of Miami.  There is a paid garage near the area where the rates are reasonable.

title: Wonderfully talented performers
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: Cute venue, small and intimate.  For the price, the technical glitch with the microphone on the lead female was unfortunate.  "Once" was a great love tragedy and the music was great.

title: Once More with Feeling!
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: This is the second time I have been to this theatre and it seems to get better each time. The musical Once was playing at this historic theatre on the Miracle Mile in Coral Gables. Parking is easily accessible behind the theatre. Lots of restaurants and shops around to keep you occupied until curtain time. The seats were comfortable and I don't think there is a bad line of view in the house. The production we saw was top notch and had me tapping my toe. All around it was a great night out.

title: Million Dollar Quartet
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: The show was amazing. Fabulous. 2 hours of pure fun. The jam session at the end was the best and very uplifting that everybody on their feet. But especially especially especially Jerry Lee Lewis he got his on her feet plus he was humorous and put a lot of humor into the shower. Jerry Lee Lewis was my favorite

title: Outstanding Show!!!!
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: Amazing cast, really good and entertaining. The fact it was in a smaller theater made it better, seeing  them up close and never miss a thing. Highly recommend, loved it.

title: Weekly thang
review: The museum is a highlight for any visit. I feel fortunate to have it in my backyard!

title: A Must See!
review: Admission is free and parking is available in several lots and garages close to the museum.

title: Very good for kids any age. Best if you take all-young kids or all-older kids.
review: Me and my wife went with our 2 kids (a 5 yr old girl and 12 yr old boy) and 2 of their cousins (6 yr old girl and 10 yr old boy).
