The little girls got bored if we started to watch one of the many educational videos, so the older boys could not suck up all the great info that the Museum has to offer. But overall the experience was great. We got there at almost 3pm and we had to run on the laste exhibits. Try getting there sooner and with already lunch in your belly (we had had already lunch when we got there). Highly recomended. Oh, one other thing. We were expecting a indoors museum so my wife and I went in pants. Better off in shorts and light clothing. Exhibits are under AC but a lot of things (and all connecting corridors, stairs and elevator) are not. So no pants are required.

title: Everyone should Go
review: We went to the Frost Museum with another couple,  we were there for hours.  We missed so much of the Museum that we are going back.  Lots to see and do. We sort of got mesmerized by the aquarium part of the museum.  The planetarium was wonderful also.  Not sure how we missed 3 floors of other exhibits but we did.  Very interesting place.  We took the Brightline down to Miami and then the people mover to the museum.  Best time

title: Glad I went, but won't go back.
review: My family took me for the first time, for Mother's Day 2018.  I was so'ooooo excited because I have never been and wanted to go since it opened.  Well.... I came, I saw, I was happy I went, but I won't being going back.  It was boring.  There are three things to see there that are cool, but nothing else.

title: Surprising
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: I saw this was a museum and performing arts centre and I was waiting for my husband to finish a cigar so I thought I would open the doors and check it out, and it was a bar!!  I was completely surprised.  It is really well set out, I loved it.  The drinks were great as well.  I would certainly recommend going here.

title: A relaxing view at history
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: This is the property that was owned by the brother who created Viscaya.  It is a much more relaxed comfy home.  Don't miss the wine cellar and the bakery.  It is also a wonderful place to get a view of the sunrise.  Look for the Seafood Feast when it comes around.

title: Rumba y son de corazón
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Just amazing, live music great cocktails, nice latín environment, a little piece of cuba in Miami, the minutos are great

title: Cubaocho
place: Cubaocho Museum and Performing Arts Center
review: Cubaocho is a bar with Cuban history and music. It is a unique spot in Little Havana. Grab a drink, cigar and enjoy the music.

title: Landmark for the area
review: The area is a great place to begin the Miami Beach adventure.

title: sail away
review: A pleasant area for a stroll and take in some of the buildings and gardens. Interesting architecture.

title: It is it's title!
review: SOBE is love!  Washington St. is a wonderful pedestrian way to watch the dog walking training classes where the dogs are taken into the shops and on the elevators and even have bowls of water put out for them by some shop owners as they and their trainers enjoy lunch at one of the many restaurants along the way.  People watching is undescribable so keep your eyes opened!

title: No Longer there!!!
review: If it is then I must be blind but I went there 3 times, walked the entire area, searched online for news of the new location but NOTHING. all bus stops are called "Sobe" but its not there! I was soo looking forward to this even if it is just a sign but the meaning of why it was made means a lot to me. I CANNOT BELIEVE THIS!

title: Confirmed- installation removed.
review: Hope it makes its way back soon!

title: Beautiful parking garage - excellent location and access
review: Architecturally the most extravagant parking garage you'll ever park your car. Excellent location on Lincoln and Alton road across from the movie theaters.

title: Amazing architecture and the home of many great events and parties
review: Amazing architecture and the home of many great events and parties.This is the place to book your exclusive event.They also have yoga classes and many high end restaurants and shops in the area

title: Lovely exhibits
review: The Frost does not have a huge selection, but what they do have is well presented in a lovely setting. The Australian women modern Aboriginal art is particularly appealing. While there, don't fail to look at the outdoor art which is quite spectacular.

title: Science or art museum?
review: I do agree with the comment about the very expensive parking. You are really forced to use the onsite garage. We were there 3.5 hours and our fee was $20.

title: Fun time
review: A lot oriented towards little kids but overall still a really awesome time. Buy tickets in advance so you can see a planetarium show. It was the best part.

title: First time visit
review: Went to the Frost yesterday with my daughter for the first time since purchasing the family membership. It is beautiful!!! There is a big marine/aquatic presence plus space and body health science. The museum opening had big expectations for Miami resident and it does not disappoint. The building is modern and the exhibits are beautifully done.  I did not do the planetarium this time around but will do it next visit.

title: Mwah
review: Very little to see. Done in less then 30 minutes. I was not very impressed. Its far from town.not much of a museum.

title: Absolute worth seeing
review: If you go to Lincoln road mall then walk few blocks further and you can see this great building. Must visit if in area.

title: Striking and Unusual
review: The building was referenced on the Tour buses, as well as on the Duck Tour that we took. It has become a landmark and quite a tourist attraction for photographers. It is beautifully lit up at night, and worth a visit, at least once.

title: Nice
review: This building is a unique architectural phenom on Lincoln Rd. The restaurant and the vistas from the roof are unique.

title: Great Beer, Great Ambiance
review: Loved this place! A very casual environment where you can stop and have a beer while checking out all the murals in the Wynwood district. I tried several beers and like them all.

title: Great find
review: Strongly recommended for when you've had enough art and need a decent brew (or two)!

title: Our favourite in Wynwood
review: We loved this brewery previously and after visiting some others this time, this is definitely our favourite.  The beers are great and the staff are so friendly.  There's a lovely chilled out atmosphere.  Love the merchandise too, our selection of tshirts is growing.

title: Best brewery in Wynwood
review: A beer show in Philadelphia said this was the best brewery in the Miami area.  It's a block away from J. Wakefield and Veza Sur, and after visiting all three, Concrete Beach was my favorite.  There was a greater variety of styles of beer, and the sours & fruit beers were better and more flavorful.

title: Great dance and welcome
review: Store open , area clean , people smiling.

title: You don’t have to love ballet to love Miami City Ballet
review: I recently saw Miami City Ballet perform and it confirmed everything I’ve read about the company, and performances I’ve seen in the past of it and other companies. This is one of the great companies in the world. They dance the ballets of the great  choreographer Georges Balanchine better than any other company around as well more modern choreographers like Justin Peck. They possess energy, talent, wit and offer a fresh look at some of the great classics. If you are in Miami between October and March make sure you get tickets to see this company perform! If you’re not a ballet lover now, you’ll be one by the end of the evening.

title: Miami City Ballet's The Nutcracker
review: Miami City Ballet is one of our city’s greatest and most beloved treasures. In its more than 30 years, it has emerged to become one of the leading dance companies in the United States. Each and every performance by Miami City Ballet that I have attended, has been beautifully and flawlessly executed. Although I have enjoyed many of the ballets in its repertoire, I’m noting the production of George Balanchine’s The Nutcracker which they performed at the Ziff Ballet Opera House at The Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts this past December. As this was a new production with updated costumes and set designs by the famous team of Isabel and Ruben Toledo, I had secured front row seats where I could view the performance, the artistry, the costumes and the orchestra from my enviable vantage point. I hoped that the redesign would live up to the buzz that had surrounded it for months. Miami City Ballet didn’t disappoint, and the great reveal was worth the wait. As much as I loved the previous version, which I had seen several times, this new production was stellar, gorgeous and glorious. The costumes, which invoked the tropical colors of South Florida, featured intricate designs, updated silhouettes and moved beautifully on the dancers. Large new sets made for grandeur and fantasyland on the stage. Special effects enhanced the backdrop and made the opening snow scene and the soaring Christmas tree particularly enchanting and memorable. Most important, the dancers were effervescent, exuberant and a joy to watch. Even the program was special with whimsical and lovely illustrations by Ruben Toledo. My favorite scene: Arabian Coffee in her beautiful jewel-toned costume, her languid and sinuous movements combined spectacular jumps! The enthusiasm of the orchestra in unison with the artistry of the dancers made for a phenomenal and magical performance. Continued success and well-deserved applause Miami City Ballet!

title: Fantastic
review: I recently visit Miami.When I was in the downtown I saw Ballet building.I booked the ticket and I attend the show.The play was Nutcracker.The perfoormance of the dancers was excllent.I love the show.I suggest this place for families to enjoy the great performance espically Nutcracker and I hope see Swan Lake in Miami soon.100 % worth visit.

title: Lovely art museum on FIU Campus
review: With a combination of touring exhibits, a permant collection of art and some student shows, the Frost is a sophisticated art gallery on the campus of Florida International University. Admission is free and parking on campus is accessible. The Frost has a diverse collection and is definely worth a drive to the suburbs.

title: A minimal collection with good exhibits
review: FIU's art museum is worth a trip in itself to take in their small permanent collection and constantly rotating exhibits of emerging artists.  It not big, easily managed in under an hour, and with free admission, there is no reason to miss it.  Worth the trip

title: Cartografias del Agua (Maps of Water) by Rufina Santana
review: A beautiful building that showcases artists connected with the University. Rufina Santana is teaching about the connection of Art and Hispanic History between Europe and the Americas. The museum has a collection of her work that shows the importance of water in history. A rare opportunity to see her work in the USA.

title: Subpar customer service
review: I bought a $100 gift certificate for a hard-working paralegal who loves the ballet and wanted to take her daughters to see it. She lost the gift certificate and didn't tell me until much later. I contacted the MCB to ask about reissuing the gift certificate and learned that it was only valid for the 2018-2019 season, and so it was too late. I also asked about any kind of discount for future tickets in the event that they could not reissue the gift certificate which was clearly unused, and they offered NOTHING. Pretty disappointed in their customer service, and certainly will never purchase a gift certificate from them in the future.

title: Beautiful Church
review: Went to the service for Palm Sunday here but it was in Spanish.  There is a listing on the website about the offerings for the masses.

title: A beautiful and historic church.  A must visit for the faithful.
review: Gesu Catholic Church in the heart of downtown Miami is the oldest church in Miami. Mass is held weekday's at 12 Noon and it is a wonderful way to step into the past of old Miami and follow your faith.

title: This is historical and architectural jewel in downtown Miami
review: Many people coming to Miami just see the flashy things that tourists tend to visit ( most worth enjoying), but people might miss this historical and architectural jewel in downtown Miami. This a place of beauty and contemplation in the middle of all the activities. It has been beautifully restored under the Pastor Alvarez. There are relatively few great, preserved buildings in Miami, being so relatively young as a city. This is one of them.

title: Amen
review: I'm so blessed that they never closed it, I first went back in 1988 and is one of the most original beautiful church left to see visit and admired

title: Historic Church in the middle of downtown.
review: This old church is right in the midst of some older buildings downtown. It is has some interesting history and Parking is available on the street and a lot behind the church. The lot is free if attending mass. This an active Catholic Community with a very friendly and welcoming parish. Stop by for mass when you are in town.

title: Trip to midtown
review: imagine my surprise at discovering this place. Being crew of a ship to find stores like Target, Marshall, etc in close proximity to one another and bigger than downtown Miami was a treat along with some interesting food stops. It was also pleasingly less crowded than downtown Miami.

title: Nice shopping centre
review: This is a nice shopping centre that is very modern and clean with a very good selection of shops.  We particularly liked Target.  Lots of nice looking restaurants as well.

title: The Shops
review: There is not much going on at Midtown shops except if you want to go to Target, Marshall's or Ross. There are other smaller shops to go to though. Home Goods is another place to go to or the Sporting Goods. But other than that, there's not a lot of interesting stores to go too. However it is good for those on a budget. There are some high-rise condos nearby, and there is a great public park nearby, two to be exact. Its close to Downtown and close to Miami Beach and Miami International Airport.

title: convenient and easy access
review: Have fun shopping !

title: Great any day
review: Sin duda volveré porque me gusta probar lugares nuevos y no los he probado todos, nos vemos la próxima vez.

title: Great food and beer
review: The highlight of our visit was the food from the food truck, absolutely delicious.  The beers were great too but the staff weren't friendly.

title: A pleasant surprise for nationally owned "local themed" craft brewery
review: Stopped by last weekend and really enjoyed this place.   It definitely has a South American/Latin American vibe, not purely a Cuban vibe as many places in Miami.   The beers were all really good and reflected the flavors of the region.   Outstanding was the lulo (naranjilla) beer which was amazing.   We did the flights of 5 oz pours and they give you free samples of other beers if you ask.   Lots of other tropical flavors and all were very smoothly blended.   We sat at the bar and were there around 1 pm and the place began to fill up (inside and also outside patio) around 2.   They have numerous food specials (Peruvian and Argentine/Churrasco seem to be the main ones) but we didn't eat.   Parking is on the street pay by phone parking.   They also have a "rewards" club that earns you discounts pretty quickly.   Will definitely go back.   I was reticent to go here due to the AB InBev (Anhauser Busch) ownership but found it to be authentically local.

title: Great atmosphere, beers, food
review: Specializing in Brazilian style beers, my favorite at Veza Sur was Arroz Con Mango which is the first, and so far only, pepper beer I've ever liked.

title: Loved it great staff
review: Great beer selection staff were lovely!!! Highly recommend! We were in Miami for 8 nights came here twice! Wynwood area in general is a great scene. Food cart is delicious too!

title: Brewery
review: Veza Sur Brewing co. In Wynwood was a good stop after visiting the walls. We got a table and sat at a couch outside. It was a nice area to rehab and try some ipo beers. One of our favorites was the caffe con flan—a coffee beer with sweet flan foam on top.

title: Friendly staff
review: My partner and I stopped. Y the center during our trip to Miami. The man at the desk gave us some useful information about the area and suggestions on places to see.

title: Staff is nice
review: This was a great stop. If you have the time i highly reccomend stopping by. They have a lot of information about LGBT in the community.

title: Great staff, if
review: The staff is great and very helpful, for any visitor, not just LGBT!  The problem we have found several times is that there open hours are bad.

title: Need better hours but has lots of info
review: Well I am sure I'm not the first to say, they need to be open more hours. The first time we went they weren't open. But the 2nd time made it worth it as we got lots of info as to the local bars for LGBT. Also just good to know that something like this is here. You don't need to be gay to go in, they will have helpful info for you no matter who you are.

title: Helpful Center
review: The staff here were quite helpful and they have some good handouts.  Note the limited hours.  In a nice building in the center of town so easy to walk to.

title: MIAMI DADE TRANSIT: HELL ON WHEELS IF YOU WILL!!!
review: To Say The Least I Will Never Be Partaking In The "hop On", "hop Off" Shenanigans Of Miami-dade Transit Any More As My Time Is Precious And I Would Advise You Of The Same As I Know Your Time Is Just As Precious! Thank You!

title: Good way to commute
review: I did not take the metro a lot but liked the fact that it is fast and clean. The only issue I had was the frequency, I guess it was 10 minutes between 2 trains.

title: Its Free....use it!
review: The MetroRail is something that should be used. Its free and while it doesn't cover all of downtown Miami, you can save a lot of walking by getting around with this system and saving the roads.

title: A great way to get around Miami.
review: The rails are getting rather old, but pretty dependable.  The price is very reasonable and seats are generally available, timing generally reliable and great views when "zipping" through Miami-Dade.   The train is available for South, North and West exploration, including downtown Miami.   Also goes to the Miami International airport.   Overall very good.

title: From Airport to Greyhound
review: Miami's Metrorail as any other light rail transit system delivers speedy delivery of passengers to their destination whether it be to the downtown core or to the Greyhound or Amtrak terminals a few blocks away.

title: Nice outdoor mall area
review: Nice shopping / dining area to walk around.  Lots of shops, numerous choices for lunch/ dinner.  Easy to get to.

title: Nice outdoor mall
review: Nice outdoor mall with ample parking near by. Many high end stores. Several restaurants. Quiet area of town with less traffic. Good place to browse and shop.

title: Beautiful Outdoor Mall
review: Stopped by for a quick visit to the Pandora store.  Very pretty outdoor mall, very upscale.  Didn't have time to shop much but would definitely go back if I had a chance.  Pandora store was nice and the staff was very helpful and friendly.

title: An Attractive Outdoor Mall.
review: An upscale mall. Many high-end shops & restaurants. Some beautiful statues/figures in the inside gardens. Stores like Nordstorm, Neiman Marcus & others. Pleasant surroundings. Nice place to walk & browse around.

title: Coral gables
review: 很多很棒的商店，热闹的氛围，几家不错的餐厅。大量付费停车场和街边停车位。 Namebrand商店，如Nordstrom，Neiman Marcus，Gucci，香蕉共和国等。 都是大牌店 如果卖折扣款不建议来这里.

title: Helpful on a Sunday, when most resources were closed.
review: On a recent visit to Miami Beach we dropped in to the Visitors Center, on a Sunday (!), for some much needed guidance on attractions nearby. With Stephanie Gale's knowledgeable and cheerful advice we were soon on the right track.

title: Very Informative and Helpful
review: They even have a pretty Blue Metal Flamingo displayed there – a remnant of an art exhibit in the city from the previous year. Recommend a stop if you are in the area.

title: Welcome
review: The Miami Visitors Center has information, brochures and maid to get you ready for your vacation. They can tell you the latest events

title: Fascinating but shocking history of Miami
review: One part that shocked me was the photographic exhibition on the first floor of the second building, a very graphic image of a human corpse with head and limbs cut off! This along with some other photographs make this section unsuitable for children.

title: Well Worth A Visit
review: We were there for the Miami Pop Festival photo exhibit, which was interesting and well presented about the festival that paved the way for Woodstock.

title: Great place, very interesting. many exhibits, ton of history
review: Great place, very interesting. many exhibits, ton of history.  Free with many city walking tours.  Also free first weekend of the month with a Bank America card.  The validate parking to a flat $5.

title: Wonderful museum downtown Miami
review: Great exhibits that are always changing. Call ahead to ask about local tours of the area.  Next door to the Public library and Metro mover.  Parking is easy as there is a garage attached to the building.  Great place to start to explore downtown.

title: Just a true place of culture
review: Very small, not much there, but it is a living piece of Cuban/American history.  See it, take a couple pictures, walk along the entire street, worth spending a couple hours on this street and eating along the way.

title: Interesting peek at old time Miami
review: Never a dull or quiet moment.  Enjoy watching as older cubans enjoy playing a game of dominos as they recount stories of days gone bye

title: Visit it if you are in the area
review: Duration: less than 20 minutes.

title: Domino Park
review: Domino Park in Little Havana is a busy little area where locals gather to play dominoes. There is a welcome center booth there to get some brochures and info.

title: Something for everyone
review: From high end to the basic mall stores - Merrick Park has it all.  With Nordstroms & Neimans as anchors - a scattering of the best stores are here.

title: Beautiful upscale shopping
review: A really beautiful upscale, 3-level outdoor mall with nice landscaping and water features.  A great place to spend a few hours.  I don't get the whole road going through the middle of the thing, it makes it awkward and not pedestrian friendly, but other than that it is amazingly well-done.

title: High end outdoor mall
review: Visited recently on vacation and was pleasantly surprised. It’s a gorgeous, high end outdoor mall with plenty of places to eat. Nice service in every store I went into.

title: Beautiful outdoor shopping center
review: We really enjoyed spending a couple of hours here. It is definitely one of the most beautiful shopping centers that I have been to. Shop selection is not big, but there is something for every pocket!

title: Great Miami-style fancy location
review: Parking is not difficult and the place felt very safe.

title: really neat.
review: Enjoyed watching the culture, learning about the history and trying to understand the game. Locals are great.

title: Memphis
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: Theather is clean and staff is friendly.

title: Memphis
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: Theater was older but nice and seats comfortable. We watched Memphis which was enjoyable.

title: I felt on Broadway!
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: went to see Evita while on vacation in Florida and to my surprise the cast, the show was up to same standars as of the Broadway shows in New York City. Will definitely come back

title: I was so impressed!
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: I was here a few months ago to see 'Murder for Two' and I was beyond blown away by the quality of this two-man show.  The theater is small and intimate and the show I saw was top-notch!  If I lived closer, I'd see every show they offer here.  Really loved it!

title: Ring of fire
place: Actors Playhouse at the Miracle Theatre
review: The story of Johnny Cash. If you like country music youll love this production. Actors playhouse never dissapoints!

title: Loved it.
review: We were there in June and absolutely loved it. Great museum, great activity for families especially on rainy summer days.

title: Very Nice!
review: I recommend it to everyone, and it’s definitely a MUST when you visit Miami

title: Good time with family
review: Great place to visit with kids. Lots of interactive art and very educational for young kids (and adults well). The planetarium at this place was amazing and was worth experience.

title: Intimate art museum
review: Nice art museum that you can see in about 1 hour. Terrific exhibitions on LBGTQ art as well as photos of old Miami Beach. Very pleasant receptionist. FREE.

title: LBGT art (at the moment)
review: Enjoyed the experience, and the fact that someone curated an exhibit basically of and by (though not necessarily 'for', anyone can benefit from a view) the community.  Striking architectural space.  Make certain you want to see what's exhibited at the moment - interior photos posted here were not the collection presently on view.  Parking is hard to figure out - there is a paid lot with visitor spots, but getting into it is not (!) intuitive.  Sadly the desk clerk did not bother to explain that there's a lot more to see on site than just the art museum itself, and I left without realizing that - bummer, and a little annoying in retrospect / but I had other stops that day, so OK.

title: Lots of great stores
review: A few restaurants, but not many.  Lots if name brand department stores. Beautiful outdoor mall.  Worth visiting.

title: Great outdoor shopping venue
review: Beautiful, calm, spacious and an elegant shopping spot.  It also includes pretty tasteful restaurants.  Great for kids.  Good retail stores.  It doesn't feel like a normal retail space, this one is special.

title: Excellent Outdoor Mall
review: The Shops at Merrick Park is one of the most beautiful outdoor shopping malls I have visited. Great variety of stores. Beautiful park area. Nice variety of restaurants. Loved our shopping experience there.

title: Pleasant Alternative to the Mall
review: Merrick Park is a beautiful place to visit.  Whether shopping, dining, or relaxing - there is something to keep everyone happy. The grounds are beautiful and meticulously maintained.  There's room to sprawl out on the lawn and play with the kids, or sit in the shade and enjoy a treat from one of the vendors during the weekend pop up farmer's market. Will definitely be back.

title: Good shopping
review: It's has good shopping with variety of stores. The food and restaurants I am not a fan off. The parking is always easy

title: Free admission and  interesting art exhibit!
review: We went there an hour before they close so not many people were there. I find the art exhibits interesting and some quite familiar.

title: Great place. Free.
review: Great place. Free. Several different small exhibitions. Some very interesting, some less so, depending on your tastes. But you can easily spend a hour there.

title: Delightful Saturday Afternoon
review: We decided to spend Saturday in the Wynwood and the Design District and included the Institute of Contemporary Art in our visit.  What a terrific adventure to see so many thoughtfully and artfully curated exhibits! The museum space itself in very impressive, and an "easy on your feet"  environment ... a much more enjoyable experience than the Perez! Great place to include on any itinerary to Miami!

title: Would it go back
review: I have been to many art galleries previously but this one was particularly stark, the staff were very uninterested and made you feel very uncomfortable.

title: Great space, not so great exhibits (when I visited)
review: I assume this review is conditional - depending on what's showing you may enjoy this much more.  Unbfortunately when I came the artists showing were mostly the worst sort of contemporary:  "here is my concept of cultural pain, as told through used building supplies and paper products"  "This empty plastic bottle signifies the ecnomic and environmental degredation to which we are all forced to submit by" … whom exactly.  And really, haven't we seen the colored neon tubes before?  Galleries are still displaying this?  Might have been the day, might have been the indifferent staff, might have been the scowling security who float through looking both bored and vaguely hostile....  However, all of this is FREE, the building itself is worth seeing (from an interior perspective it really is good ), you're next door to the de la Cruz which is much better and landed in the design district which itself is worth a wander - so it's all good in the end.

title: Sunny Shopping & Dining @ Merrick Park
review: All the brands you want with great dining options are gathered in this 3 story 'private' and intimate outdoor shopping mall in Coral Gables. Ample parking. $$$

title: very nice area
review: Lovely shops, nice restaurants in beautiful surroundings. There are many stores including, Gucci, Nordstroms and Burberry.

title: Miami Shopping Tour
review: This is a wonderful outdoor, high-end mall with premium stores.  Lovely to spend the afternoon strolling in a cool day in Miami.  Outdoor cafes and restaurants offer a variety of options for dining; however, we were unable to decide on one.  We shopped at Victoria's Secret, Sephora, & Vineyard Vines.  There were no crowds or lines anywhere and we found parking to be easy.  Great experience.   We will be visit again.

title: Beautiful, outdoor shopping and dining!
review: Great shops and great food in a beautiful outdoor setting. In beautiful Coral Gables! Spend a few hours or spend a day. High end movie theater with food and drinks is the perfect ending to a day of shopping and dining!

title: Shops at Merrick Park
review: The Shops at Merrick Park is another beautiful open mall in Miami / Coral Gables area. It is a more high-end place. Centrally located, nice open space environment. You must pay for parking. Some good restaurants there as well.

title: Nice visit
review: If you are heading to Design District - visit ICA as well. Museum is fully free - it isn't very big but their parking garage is worth the visit just by itself.

title: A profound Art experience
review: This museum is located in an eclectic neighborhood which is worth visiting. There is no fee for this special experience. I suggest taking the 45 minute tour unless you are familiar with the artists. The excellent guide enabled me to appreciate the art and the artists. Some of the art was experiential. I found the experience to be profound.

title: Miami Art Scene's newest museum
review: Free admission for the public, Norman Braman's gift to the community. A first quality new museum  with a fine collection and excellent contemporary artist shows.Next door is the de la Cruz Collection of Latin American Art. Best of all you can wander around the new Design District, with it's dozens of all new and architecturally wonderful designer stores, with art and sculpture all around. There are tours and guide books available for the neighborhood. A recent Miami redone neighborhood, well worth a visit. Near Wynwood also.

title: Disappointed
review: They have a very nice sculpture garden without much sculptures. The museum is 3 floors with spare exhibits and those are bazaar.

title: Not impressed
review: The party itself is not that bad. But if you are travelling alone and decide to get in you won't have a nice experience. You will have to spend 100$ at the bar minimum which is okay but if you don't have a reserved table there's no way to leave your bags anywhere and you have no sunbeds or a table to seat. It's probably a place for rich people so if you are just a regular person and want to have some fun I suggest you to stay away. They don't offer good option for people travelling solo. And if they offer any options they didn't tell me about them because probably they thought I wasn't rich enough to afford a table by myself.

title: Shopping in style!
review: And parking is on site and not expensive!

title: Outdoor Splendor
review: This is a beautiful place to window shop, have spa services or eat at a variety of restaurants. Pay for parking lot always has plenty of room or very close to Metro Rail stop. Shops range from high end designer to chain stores. Lovely outdoor areas to sit and enjoy the Miami weather.

title: Wonderful Outdoor, Upscale Mall
review: We enjoyed all the shops at Merrick Park.  There is a Nordstroms and Neiman Marcus as well as many shops in between.  We were able to eat lunch at a very nice courtyard cafe.

title: Outdoor shopping and dining
review: This outdoor mall is perfectly nice with a variety of high end and midrange shops, plus a number of dining options.

title: Expensive!
review: Nice but really? If you're bored it's nice. 2 hour parking is 3 bucks unless you buy something  and get it stamped.  Loads of shops outside. Big name shops and small ones. 3 levels.

title: Amazing new space!
review: We went today and love it! It’s really amazing! Great space and great works! Very happy to be there today!

title: Great!!
review: Located on the renovated area of miami (design district), a great building with a lovely garden, with a really challenging exhibition of true contemporary art.. deserves a visit, really really worthy it.

title: Beautiful space, interesting exhibit
review: Our friends introduced us to the ICA about 2 weeks ago.  We were so impressed that we just took visiting family there.  As mentioned, there is no entrance fee.  The outdoor garden gallery is lovely and is a great way to begin.  We then proceeded to the top (third) floor and worked our way down.  We thoroughly enjoyed the current exhibit, The Everywhere Studio.  The gallery space itself is beautiful and is a great addition to the Miami Design District and the Miami art scene.

title: My timing was off
review: My visit coincided with major construction outside and a change in exhibits so I was only able to visit the ground floor and wasn’t able to fully appreciate the outside artwork to its fullest. I loved that it was free to enter the ICA and found the staff incredibly knowledgeable and friendly (because I wasn’t familiar with the artists). After going through the gallery, I really loved the Felix Gonzales-Torres work. It was so cool to interact with a piece of work that asked you to take a printed poster away with you! That was pretty amazing - especially when the De La Cruz Collection next door had another installation piece that asked you to take candy!!! Worth a pop in!

title: Art is in the eye of the beholder
review: Once you are done walk the new, trendy pedestrian shopping outdoor mall

title: Good on a sunny day.
review: A professionally managed batting cages business ia a.good proyect to bring in baseball fans and players to the park.  Come and enjoy.

title: Nice Upscale Mall
review: Nice upscale mall which can be reached by using the free Miami and Coral Gables Trolley system.  Plenty of shopping opportunities and nice places to eat..

title: Santa's isn't the only attraction here.
review: Right off the Palmetto, at the entrance of Westchester, lies Tropical Park. It has a bit of everything and really comes in clutch for those who love to exercise outside and for free! The parking here is free and there are plenty of different spots in the park where you could workout with friends or host a BBQ or a birthday party. My childhood was filled with some dope outdoor birthday parties at Tropical Park. They have the huts you can use with a charcoal grill and picnic tables...just beware of raccoons. There truly so much you can do here and I suggest entering a different way each time, whether through the main entrance on Bird Road or on Miller or any side streets that lead into the park. It will always give you a new perspective.

title: Huge park in South Miami with local floras
review: This park has a wide variety of sport areas including baseball , soccer, boating , bysicling, lots of picnick tables with adjacent bbq grills around the lakes and spread throughout the park.  There are two dog parks for small and large dogs with comfortable sitting next to the lake.   There are several building enclosures that can be reserved for parties or get toghether activities.

title: Great Outdoor Park
review: Great park for the whole family to enjoy. Many activities are available at the park, also plenty of open space to enjoy. Would recommend.

title: unforgetable
review: i love this place.i do not see my self living far from it in a future and if so i am never going to forget you my tropical park.

title: History but no freedom
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: This used to be the tallest building in Miami many decades ago and it was empty for many years. When the cuban boat lift ,in the 60s, the building was used to process all Cubans that were arriving escaping from Castro’s communism. It is now a museum donated to Miami Dade College by a group of cuban business men. The 1st floor is dedicated to the cuban migration. Very interesting but incomplete, as it only shows the beginning of the cuban struggle for freedom.

title: America's generosity
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: A good explanation of how America reached out to the Cubans who were oppressed under the Castro regime.  Interesting photos and feedback from that time.  Separate historical exhibition of times long ago with many artefacts and documents.

title: Great architecture
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: This building is so unique and it really stands out in downtown Miami.  There is a museum in it but we didn't have the time to visit.  I am sure the history of the Cuban arrivals is very interesting.

title: Intimate art space
review: This space located in the Design District is dedicated to contemporary artists. It is a small space, but it serves as a platform for new and established artists from Miami and the world. Great place to spend time alone, immerse yourself in the art world and best of all it is free.

title: Lovely contemporary art space
review: Free entry! The lady at the front desk was very helpful, providing not only information on the exhibits but other recommended places to visit in the district. When I went they had four exhibits, the Susan King exhibit was my favorite.

title: Little disappointing
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Attended here on a Wednesday, only opens at 1pm, $12 entrance fee for an adult. Pretty building with a large part to play in the Cuban culture & history in Miami, unfortunately I feel as though it was lacking in this area, I feel as though there is more money spent on the art installations and shows. I wanted to learn and see more with regards to the Cuban history.

title: Buildiing with 9 Lives or at least Several
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: This building started life as the Federal Customs House due to Miami's position as one of the main ports in the Southeast. It was used during the 1950's and 1960's as a backdrop for the Florida East Coast Railroads streamline passenger trains from the Northeast and Midwest, although not the actual Miami train station. Now this beautiful Beaux Arts tower has a new life as a Miami museum and exhibition hall with its new name, The Freedom Tower!

title: Just a Bunch of Expensive Restuarants
review: We stayed in the area for too long... 10 days.  Nothing special to do there except spend money in overpriced, crowded restaurants. Vizcaya Museum and Gardens was the highlight for  me. Found things to outside Coconut Grove in close proximity.

title: KILLING TIME ON THE MIRACLE MILE
review: In was a cold (48 degrees) in January and very windy.  I walked the length and saw a huge variety of shops and people. I liked the walk up Starbucks with the ordering window open to the street.  I believe this is the oldest (1924) Miracle Mile in the country.  It has the best restaurants of any such shopping area in the country.  A great place to see beautiful women (but South Beach is better) and to sit and people watch without buying a thing.  The shops and restaurants are uniformly expensive.  I do think they could use a little more updating.

title: Lovely place to shop, eat, drink and people watch
review: One of the first 'Miracle Mile's in the States this area is full of shops, restaurants bars and cafe's, all branching off Coral Way. There is plenty of parking available, I parked behind California Pizza Kitchen off Salzado Street where there is a two floor parking lot. Many places to recommend here but I enjoyed John Martins Irish pub (expensive beer though!), Tap 42 at Salzedo and Giralda, and Seasons 52 on Coral Way. Definitely a nice place to spend a few hours.

title: One of Miami's prettiest and most visited parks
review: Tropical park has been a place for family fun and sports for as long as I can remember. Thankfully the park has been well maintained and offers everything from places to picnic, sports, equestrian activities and more. A local park open for everyone.

title: Huge park!!
review: Running park, this park has it, running track, bench, trails, horses, bike rental, pavilion rental, tables first come first serve. No fee to enter.

title: Relaxing
review: I came here just to read the paper and eat lunch!  The park is clean and safe!  I even played a little Pokémon go!

title: Not good anymore
review: To many homeless living there and the pee and poop in front of you no matter what and the police can't do anything about it unless you take pictures of it happening..  Had to cancel our Christmas party there because of this.  When my kids were young we would go every Saturday and have picnics, rent bikes and paddle boats but now no way.  Went with the grand kids to check out the shelter that we rented for the party and this guy just pulled it out and pissed in front of us, the place stunk or urine and poop.  The administrator was very apologetic but we cancelled and went elsewhere.  Some of these people are sexual predators that have no where to go but they should not be in a park.

title: Great if you can avoid the idiot rangers
review: Was hassled by some uneducated park ranger about having a camera on a tripod. "Yoo filmin' you need a permanent".  Doesn't even know or pronounce the word 'permit' but is somehow in charge of my leisure time and activities. Only COMMERCIAL photography needs a permit, you know...equipment trailers...dollies...a group of actors or producers. Still the only word that sticks with these morons is 'photography'. I believe if she carried it any further it'd be a violation of my rights, so I recommend if you're approached to turn on your video and tape it and remain completely silent until they either escalate it or go away.  I remained silent and she vanished. There are some who will try to escalate it, as when I was assaulted on the public sidewalk at Watson Island by another low IQ guard. Stay cool, silent and get it all on tape! In case they call a cop you might want to use ACLU Blue so they can't snatch your phone and erase it.

title: So many wedding dress shops !
review: We found several nice places to eat near our hotel (Colonnade) but Miracle Mile is nothing special really

title: Tuna Tartare was fresh and direct from the sea!!!
review: Ortanique on the Mile is a unique delicious gourmet dining experience. Cindy Hudson the award winning chef  creativity is in every plate on menu...It's creation of the Tuna Tartare is an absolute delight...as always  the  service is excellent.

title: A street
review: A long street with shops, bars, cafes, wide pavements, noisy cars, and a euphemistic name. Best avoided if you ask me.

title: Like his name say it
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Freedom tour is one of the symbol of Miami may visit it if someone  is interested on history, easy to get there.

title: It would have been nice if their website had been updated to let you know there is a Fee.
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: The outside of the building and the Lobby are spectacular!  You know the building is historic.  But, that's as far as we got.  The literature and info on the web says it's free to tour.....but it's not. So we wound up not going inside to tour.  The night of our bus tour , the building was illuminated by red light.   It is a different color every night....it's some sort of "secret" what color it will be each night.  I am rating it 2, because they should let tourists know in advance there is a fee  to tour the building, because all their stuff, including their pamphlet says it's free.

title: History Reminder!
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: This is Miami's Pier 21... It was the go to place for Cuban refugees and it was a beacon of hope and freedom. We did not go inside.

title: Beautiful Building
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: It is a short walk from Bayside Place.

title: Interesting history
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Standing in the large hall and imagin it filled with newspaper workers was fascinating.

title: Would be perfect if they ever complete the construction
review: We have stayed in the area a few times over the past few years and the sidewalk has been under construction every time.  Otherwise it has lots of great shops and restaurants and even with the construction it is easy to walk the area.

title: park
review: beautiful park, filled with lost of green space. very busy on the weekends. rent bikes and take a stroll

title: Big outdoor location in the middle of residential area
review: Big park where you can practice a variety of outdoor activities. It is located off exit SW 40 street in the Expressway 826 (palmetto Expressway). It is a good place to find activities year round and it also offers an open fresh market on Sundays from 9 to 1 PM.

title: Great Park
review: sunday morning you can bougth fresh products in a market open until early noon...i loved visit this place everytime....

title: Baby shower in the park
review: We were invited to a baby shower at Tropical park. This place was great. Plenty of parking, lots of shade, numerous shelters and convenient restrooms. We had a great time on our first visit to this location.

title: Oasis in Miami
review: On my most recent visit to Tropical Park I decided to do a review because I was both pleased and disappointed. The park is located in a fairly central part of Miami so access is pretty easy. Right off main roads and SR 826 it's no trouble getting there. First the good. You can jog, fish, go boating, play tennis, basketball, have picnics, just about anything you'd like. It's free to use so that's another good thing. There's also a snack bar with a really helpful and friendly staff. Now the bad. On this particular day I noticed tons of garbage where it didn't belong, as in a garbage can. The trash was lying next to the cans and nobody bothered to pick it up. At the basketball courts you had lots of young people playing and screaming every obscenity you can imagine. There were park employees right there and no one said a word to try and stop it. I'm certain that type of language isn't acceptable in any public park. Its still a nice place in the middle of a huge city but the employees should pay attention to the little things.

title: Afternoon Stroll
review: Miracle Mile is in the area of Coral Gables, and it’s the Main Street to walk and see lots of restaurants as well as some boutiques. You get a variety of different establishments, and with the changes made to the mile it is much more pedestrian friendly. Great place to come with the family and spend the afternoon walking around and enjoy the South Florida weather. Enjoy

title: Holidays!
review: So much to see and do on Miracle Mile aka Coral Way in Coral Gables. From restaurants, to gadget shops and wedding dress shopping to top salons and outdoor furniture Kettal to the US Post Office and everyone goes to Barnes and Noble. Try Hillstone for dinner and California Pizza for lunch! Great place to people watch. You can usually park behind Barnes and Noble and get your ticket stamped in B&N or park in the city lots around or get the pay by phone app and locate a spot on the side streets.

title: Nice area to walk around and shop or eat
review: Stores, cafeterias, art galleries, restaurants, bars, parks, nice views.  For about 5 blocks with the streets that run across each one of them there is plenty to see and enjoy here.  From smoothies to alcoholic drinks, from a burger or a spanish style empanada to a serious meal, be it Thai, Japanese, Mexican, Mediterranean, American, and more, there is a lot offering here. Once a month there is a fest when art galleries open their displays of masterpieces and offer wine and cheese to visitors.  During the end of year Holidays it is an area not to be missed.

title: Coral Gables
review: The architecture and history is interesting if your into that.

title: History and Beauty in one
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Historic landmark where Cuban refugees were processed; its part of the Miami culture and stands tall and proud. It makes a statement without saying a word. It's pure Miami and go inside and see the museum also

title: was the 1st tall building
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: was the 1st tall building a saw when I arrived from Cuba 30 years ago still looking   great, Tower is rich in history and photos of people through out time

title: cuban history!!!
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Great to see, I love to see when it change color for special occasion. Great Cuban history. If you able to go and see and enter it a must. No fee to enter.

title: A monument to the Cuban exile in the middle of down town
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: There people can enjoy different pieces of Cuban art, and historic documents.

title: Freedom tower
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: wonderful visit.Lots of information.History.Beautiful view of Miami.Close to Bayside.It is relaxing to go there .

title: Disappointing
review: We were so excited to go to Miracle Mile on our last trip to Miami. We lived in the area several years ago and this used to be one of them most exciting places to visit. Now, there are many bridal boutiques and restaurants. There are a couple of bookstores but nothing special. I would rather go to the beach or even to one of the many malls if I’m going to shop. Miracle mile seems to be a “has been”in place. How sad.

title: Nice for an evening stroll
review: Lots of interesting shops, bars and restaurants. Spanish/Mediterranean influence is evident in terms of the buildings and food and drink. We especially loved the ‘umbrella walkway’ just off the miracle mile.

title: Sunday Bbq
review: This park is awesome with a lot of picnic areas and a bike trail. I love to go on Sunday and have a picnic with my family. I highly recommend it to everyone.

title: Everything
review: everyone in miami knows about this park and everyone, adults and kids, have played on that hill. If you're from Miami, you know about this place. All around a great place for the kids to play on the playgrounds, or the hill, the fields, everything is amazing.

title: IT'S A PARK!!!
review: A car is a MUST!!! Must call in advance to reserve picnic or BBQ areas. It is a bring your own entertainment place. November -January-Christmas lighting amusement park with a charge.per person

title: A timeless park
review: I've been going to this park for as long as I can remember. They have basketball, tennis, and racquetball courts. There are lots of places to picnic, especially near one of the lakes they have in the park. It's also a great place to ride a bike (you can also rent family size bikes). A favorite is the hill where you'll find people flying kites, riding bikes, or just rolling down the hill.

title: Relaxing in the nature
review: This is more than just a park.  You can play sports, basketball, tennis, etc here, or you can take a long leisure cycle ride with your bicycle as the park is huge!!  Or you can just relax and have some family time BBQ and playing around in the grass.  There is also some lovely dams were you can feed the duck and fish.  This park has everything and more

title: Just "ok" for me..
review: Other than that.. just "ok"

title: Umbrella sky project!
review: Beautiful to walk all around, so many restaurants, stores, etc

title: Have You Been Lately?
review: I love Miracle Mile in Coral Gables. it is a great place to stroll around. There are many great eateries and shops. They have closed some of the nicer streets to automobile traffic. Giralda is a particularly pretty street. The Umbrella Sky Project is pretty cool!

title: Landmark
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: This building holds a special place in the hearts of Cuban Americans. It was one of the first structures that they saw when arriving by boat fro their homeland.

title: Historical site.
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: This is a historical site with a free museum inside showing the role this building had in the Cuban exodus forced by the communist take over of the island by the Castro dictatorship.

title: Cuba space in Miami
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: A building built in 1925 full of history, mainly for us Cubans. That building served as a refuge for many Cubans exiled from Cuba by Fidel Castro.

title: Historic Building
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: This building is very Historic.. It was built in 1925 as the Miami News Building. Then it was the processing location of the Cubans coming into the U.S.

title: Nice landmark
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: We were not able to go inside but enjoyed looking at it from outside. It was light up at night; really a beautiful sight.

title: Daisy is finally free.
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Historic Art Deco building located in Downtown Miami, originally the office of the Miami News when they move converted into a processing center for fleeing Cubans.

title: Great family park!
review: Used to live across Tropical Park for many years, and always enjoyed all that has to offer! Gym, basketball court, boating, swimming, jogging, bicycling and much more. Its really a pretty large park with many beautiful trees. Was just there with my sister for a long walk.

title: Very nice park!
review: Tropical Park is one of the few parks in Miami.  It is big and has lots of shelters where families gather to celebrate parties -- mostly birthday parties.  There is also an equestrian center as well as a few soccer and baseball fields AND a dog's park.  I believe that they now have the food trucks once a month as well as free concerts.  I truly enjoy walking the perimeter of the park which takes about 1 hour (walking at about 15 mins. per mile).  All and all Tropical Park is a very nice place to visit with family, friends including those friends with four legs!

title: Must visit for events
review: I have been here several times for Santa's Enchanted Forest and it is huge. Always fun and very inexpensive.

title: Walking
review: The park is clean and well taken care of. I walk there 5 times a week. I wish they complete the planting of trees around all of the walking areas.

title: Great place for walking, jogging, hanging with the family
review: Tropical Park is a fairly big park with tennis courts, Jazzercise, walking and biking trails, an equestrian center and more.  Always something going on here.  Nice green space in a very busy area.   I have also seen picnic tables/shelters for family events.  Some of the parking areas do flood in heavy rain but it's usually fairly easy to find parking.  Recommended for a place to take the whole family to exercise.

title: Historical part of Miami
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Right next to Airlines Arena, the first thing you will notice when you get off from metro-mover. Wish there were more spots like this in Miami! Looks awesome during the night.

title: Historic building
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Historic building (museum) in Downtown Miami. Is locate on Byscayne Boulevard. Over the way is AmericanAirlines area and Bayside MarketPlatze.

title: Step back in time into this historic building.. Now a great museum!
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: I've always thought that in order to understand a culture you must learn about the place and process. This building has so much history, especially being the first meeting point for many Cubans in America. The architecture is stunning, it's legacy and now the incorporation of art has added so much flavor to this iconic location.

title: Iconic building, not much to see
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Freedom tower is visible from a distance once you are in the area of Biscayne. Situated near AA arena, we saw this often as we were staying in the area. It symbolizes the history of Miami immigrants and served as a great landmark when we were walking in the area. However, like some of the other towers in US, there is not much to do here.

title: Neat area but don’t plan a day out of it
review: A lot of high end shops, mostly bridal. On the flip side, the restaurant choices were plentiful. After dark it has little guts everywhere making the stroll kind of romantic. Traffic and parking both suck so take an Uber if you can.

title: Just ok
review: go else where

title: Miracle Mile is not a miracle
review: Really not much to see. Walked back and forth, then we left. Do not recommend to spend time on this street.

title: Walk it, take it in, great people watching
review: If I didn’t know it I would think we were in Barcelona on Las Ramblas... everyone strolling and window shopping, a very European tradition is kept alive here. It’s great, I’m coming back..

title: The Closest to Nature for Westchester
review: There is so much to say about this little gem.  THough many may say this isn't the best park, this is the ONLY big, open space of land and nature we have around our area. With 275-acres of land, this park is almost always filled with kids, adults and teenagers. There is lots to do: you can lounge by the lake, walk, run or bike on the trails, take your kids out to play - tennis, baseball, soccer, football, and basketball. You can rent double or 4 seater bikes, enjoy the view of the sunset falling behind the trees, take your kids out to play at the playground, and there is plenty of space for hangouts and BBQ. There is a fairly big hill to stand on top of so you can overlook the park which is pretty neat. They have fit camps, and workout sessions. You can throw parties and have bounce houses and there is also a dog park.  There really is a lot to do for just about anyone. And how can I forget to mention the famous Santas Enchanted Forest! I have been coming to this park since I was old enough to walk, and it has never failed me.  It is a great place, good atmosphere, and there is always something to do, even if that means snapping some pics of the sunset.  It really is a gorgeous park.

title: Beautiful, Safe Park
review: I love Tropical Park. It is great to exercise in (run up the hill a few times) or to simply relax. There are many sports venues and a great dog park.

title: Excellent
review: I have been coming to Tropical Park for the past 40 years.  I have done many birthday parties and for work, every year we do our Epilepsy Walk in the spring.  The park is always clean and the park management and staff is very accommodating and friendly.  Chad is the absolute Best!  Thanks for always being amazing to work with. :-)

title: Beautiful view!
review: Perfect place to take an evening stroll before boarding a ship. Very nice marinas and parks with a beautiful view of the harbor.

title: Beautiful Neighborhood
review: One of Miami's most beautiful and interesting neighborhoods.  Lots of places to eat, drink and shop, good place to walk and view gardens.

title: love the grove
review: Definitely the coolest neighborhood in Miami check it out go to Greenstreet and relax under the trees with a drink and watch the people walk by

title: Great neighborhood
review: Coconut grove is a lovely neighborhood to walk around.  Lots of great restaurants, shops and lovely parks.  The marina is also lovely with some beautiful boats and we walked around for ages in the sunshine, a very relaxing way to spend an afternoon.

title: Best neighborhood in Miami yes one of them
review: It's definitely a very pleasant area , quiet , beautiful homes a lot of trees , trails to walk bike and run , marina and boat rental available. Cafés and great restaurants , with outdoor enjoyable sitting, nice fresh breeze in the morning great brunch options . If you are looking for a peaceful area to stay in Miami this is definitely a good option. It's close to downtown, 10 minutes key biscayne, and Miami Beach 20 minutes Driving . And away from the crowded streets . Perfect for biking . Great trail. The hammock park and marina beach it's really nice even more on weekdays .

title: Spacious park to relax, bird watch, stroll, play
review: This huge park offers an equestrian area, basketball court, baseball and softball fields, tennis, wide paved paths for walkers/joggers, cyclists, plenty of open land for picnics and 2 large pond areas. We strolled for 2 hours and never even reached all the areas of the park. What a wonderful place to get a way from the city.

title: Great area for a walk
review: The street was recently renovated.Now it has larger walking alleys, less cars,new restaurants openings.It's really beautiful.

title: Miracle Mile
review: Miracle Mile area has good restaurants.  One of my favorites is Lotus Garden - Thai Restaurant.  Stores are beginning to change but mostly bridal shops wish it had more variety and small boutiques.

title: It was worth the wait
review: For over a year, this has been a major construction zone. Holy cow, what a beautiful place it is now. Wide sideways, beautiful landscaping, fresh new lighting, and nice seating areas. It has truly become a destination in the city of Coral Gables. A big well done to all who took part in the transformation.

title: One of a kind!
review: When visiting Miami or for residents alike, Coral Gables famed Miracle Mile is a must visit.  From it's wonderful restautaurants, bridal shops, Award Winning Regional theater, amongst it's many other shops, Miracle Mile has a little bit for everyone.  You can simply walk down Miracle Mile to people watch or perhaps get a nice cup of coffee or go in to Barnes and Nobles to brouse or read, Miracle Mile has all that and more.  There are many festivals throughout the year that converts Miracle Mile into a Festival!  It truly is one of a kind!

title: Interesting
review: This was a very different experience and not reviewed very much. I found it very interesting as our tour guide told us all about the plants, their origin, what they are used for and you get to taste all the fruit, most of which is unfamiliar to you. It's also a very inexpensive park.

title: Oasis in the middle of the city
review: Tropical Park is a relaxing spot in the hustle of the city. Locals have birthday parties and picnics in the park. It the perfect set for such occasions with lakes and rolling hills. Its a must see when in Miami.

title: So much to do for everyone, even Fido!
review: When you have done it all and want a little outdoors, tropical park is perfect. They even have a designated dog park.

title: coconut tree
review: coconut tree all around big small larger and behind that nice villa this town it's like the one in desperate housewives loool nice to see nothing special to do

title: Neat place to drive or walk around
review: We waled around Coconut groce--some neat stores and a lot of restaurants. Then we got in out car and drove all around--great scenery, cool houses to look at. We just drove around for about 30 minutes and was a lot of fun.

title: Nice a calm neighbourghood
review: It’s a pitty that for the moment cocowalk is gone and is a construction site for the moment . The open air mall is gone and with that the graat happy hour in the open air bar

title: Cozy, boutique feeling: great end of afternoon place to visit
review: Was delighted to have visited this immaculate community with fantastic canopy covered streets and a very authentic, boutique experience. A great place to relax with ample choices of terraces, restaurants and great shopping. There are a few nice parks. Slow pace, beautiful homes niched in a unique canopy environment... a real pearl of a neighbourhood.

title: It was nice
review: This region is going thru a rebuilding in some spots. I beleive that when it gets finished it will return to the glory days. For now it is no longer one a regular neighborhood of Miami.

title: fun for family picnics or just for walking
review: A nice Park for a Sunday family picnic or just to go walking on week days.  It is a park to celebrate family events and to enjoy the outdoors.

title: Lovely Park!
review: Adorable green space in the heart of Miami, it offers lots of different activities such as baseball, tennis, soccer,  trails, and a lot more. There are many areas which will be heaven for your dogs just as much as for you!

title: Nice stroll
review: Great place to walk but right now lots of construction so not as pretty. Good shops and restaurants to explore

title: Waltzing on the mile
review: I love the specials and shops. Perfect combination of dining and shopping with almost all types of food and dessert places. Even beauty parlors and my favorite wedding shops...they are beautifying so traffic can get crazy during construction times... but the variety is worth it if you walk from a garage. Many garages... for cheap parking.

title: Over rated
review: Miracle mile in coral gables is a nice stroll if you are killing time.  There are some restaurants, coffee shops, salons a few bookstores, not much else.

title: Tropical Park
review: Tropical Park is a lush area with a lot of open green space, It has a lot of undesired Austrailian Pines. But it also has desirable live oaks and native trees and bushes. Its free, with clean facilities. A good place to take the family.

title: Bark Park is great
review: Tropical Park has been a great park for parties, running, softball, and now it has a beautiful, clean, dog park.  Lots of shade, well maintained, easy parking, nice breeze.

title: A park instiution
review: We have been going to tropical park since we were kids.  It is a nostalgic place for us since my parents and family celebrate all our outdoor festivities there.  It is still a great family park.

title: Not what it was 10 yrs ago
review: We returned expecting coco walk to be the nightlife happening spot it was 10 yrs ago and was very disappointed. Shops boarded up only a few restaurants left Cheesecake Factory gone. No longer worth the drive from South Beach.The Green St cafe was great though.

title: Don’t bother
review: Having read about the tree lined streets and lovely boutiques and eateries my sister and I were looking forward to escaping the tacky vibe of south beach and spent good money on an Uber to get to Coconut Grove. Breakfast was ok but rather spoiled by the endless stream of construction traffic. The few retail units that were occupied seemed unable to grasp the concept of actually opening their doors - they were supposed to open at 11am and by 11:20am most were still closed. Coconut Grove does not have any vibe at all. Waste of time. Don’t bother.

title: Family oriented great area!
review: I love this area, it has many green spaces, low buildings filled with families and local business. It is a Nice area and there are restaurants and one shopping center which is currently under renovation (Coco Walk shops). Totally relaxing neighborhood with some good hotels and plenty of Airb&b offers to stay well located.

title: Great shopping!
review: Must see when visiting Miami. Great shopping and restaurants.Great for strolling around in the evening.

title: Just another marina
review: We went there in Jan this year.  Since it was off season and during the week, there were not much to do in the area.  However, it was a nice quiet place to walk around and see different sailing boats..  There was a nice eatery in the area.  The food was reasonable priced and tasty.

title: Tropical Park
review: One of the Best parks in South Miami! Picnic, lakes, biking, ball fields and the official "Santa's Enchanted Forest" during the Holidays! Great Family Park.

title: Great spot
review: Went there to watch a kids baseball game. Parking was easy the grounds were well kept and the facilities were clean and properly serviced

title: A lot of hype but good for a stroll
review: Nice shops and building decor. Nothing much else to do. The Coral Gables Museum is a place to spend about half to one hour.

title: Nice change of pace.
review: The family enjoyed the walk up and down the boulevard. There is a massive project that is almost complete to upgrade the street and sidewalks. Very pleasant!  Nice shops, and excellent restaurants. We stopped in at Tarpon Bend, and had a sensational lunch. Superb seafood!  Look for the parking garages. Street parking is limited.

title: not quite miraculous, but worth a wander
review: broad side walks, shops and restaurants make the Miracle Mile a pleasant place to wander. Access to Down-town by free trolley

title: City Beauty
review: Miracle mile is going into a trasformation at this time ... The City Commission has approved a Sidewalk Cafe Plan for Miracle Mile and Giralda Plaza.

title: Large open park with beautiful lakes
review: I love all parks, but this one is on the top list. It offers so much space for any outdoor event you wish to do. Running, riding bicycle with the family, picnic areas, fishing, even boat padding. The only negative is you can't swim in the lakes. Other than that, it is a nice place to spend the afternoon. And if you don't want to jump off the grind, it offers free wifi too.

title: Very nice park
review: This park is free there is a lot to do, play with the kids football. But take water you'll need it. Again only bad thing is how hot it is there.

title: Our family park, we have been coming here for more than 30 yrs!
review: Off this park is where they hold the Santa's Enchanted Forrest every year very lovely too.

title: Splendid for outdoor activities
review: This is an amazing park to have meetings and parties with family and/or friends. We enjoy every time we visited it with large group of friends. You will always find a spot. You can run freely and deeply breathe and you will feel mind free, nature activities are always better than indoors. Actually I think this should be a must for every family because this is a way to put us in contact with healthy activities. Highly recommended!

title: nice views
review: sailboats, yachts, view of downtown, and gorgeous water. This is worth a couple of hours of serenity

title: Too much construction
review: We went around the art festival. That was the highlight of the area. Everything else was covered by scaffolding. Couldn't take pictures. Did see a few nice places to eat, but everything was packed. Parking was expensive if you don't get a meter.

title: One of the Best Kept secrets in Miami
review: Coconut Grove is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Miami.    It has great bayfront water views of Dinner Key and Biscayne Bay.    The Grove has become the best Foodie location in Miami.

title: Love this town
review: Since moving here, CG has been one of my favorite places to go. I love all the restaurants and the small town feel. It will be even nicer with all the improvements they are making. Be sure to go to the annual art festival in February. It's not to be missed.

title: Empty neighborhoods
review: We went there to see the neighborhood and do some shopping, but it was really empty and all shops are closed due to some heavy construction works.

title: fun for everyone
review: this is the place for entire family. You can even bring your pet. Have fun playing baseball, running, relaxing.

title: Very nice place to walk around and have good food
review: Good brunch in Cibo, Eating House

title: Shopping in all its glory
review: High end stores surrounded by high end bars and restaurants to make your shopping fun. High end cars parked all around you. Great experience

title: Nice street to stroll around and pick one of the many restaurants lining the whole mile.
review: Lots of outside cafes , restaurants, stores and a theater.  Very pleasant atmosphere, and with the unequivocal beauty of Coral Gables. There is a grand festival usually the first weekend in March called Carnival on the Mile with stages filled with all kinds of music , food stands and pure fun.

title: Under Construction
review: The city is doing a major improvement on the Miracle Mile so it was a little tough getting around. We were there late on a Sunday so there wasn't much pedestrian traffic and a lot of the shops were closed.  We were more restaurant shopping along the mile than merchandise shopping at that time.

title: Great Park
review: It was so nice to find such a large green space in the busy city!  This park has so much to offer - soccer, baseball, tennis, boxing, lakes, exercise trails, paddleboats and so much more. Thier bark parks were awesome - even had agility equipment for doggie exercises!

title: great park
review: Clean park, this park is huge. baseball , soccer area. I like the hill which you can run up and down.

title: This place is for the dogs!
review: If the gate was operational and if the park was opened at the time it was posted to be open, this would have received an Excellent rating from me and my 8 year old.

title: Just a bunch of playing fields surrounding a couple of ponds
review: I am a local resident and only visit when a league game is played there, or a private party is scheduled there.  If you're looking for recreational areas, there are a lot nicer places to visit in Miami.  How about Pinecrest Botanical Gardens, Fairchild Botanical Gardens, Deering Estate?( All within 20 minutes of Tropical Park)

title: Quiet place to stay if you want to be away from the city
review: I liked Coconut Grove because it was quiet but still had enough bars, boutique shops and restaurants.  It is a close drive to Miami Beach and Downtown.  It was decorated lovely for Christmas and felt like a safe place to walk around at night.  We stayed in the Mayfair Hotel, so we were right in the heart of the Grove.  The Cocowalk Mall is a strange place, with most of the shops closed down, not sure what is happening there, but the cinema is still open.  However, it's great for parking here and reasonable if you visit the Grove.

title: Nothing much
review: We had lots of expectation when we went to this place but there was hardly aything to see. It was deserted and most of the shops were closed in the evening. We are not what are the attractions in this place. Waste of time.

title: Upscale Construction
review: It is an upscale area for those looking for a change from SOBE, but there really is nothing here honestly. You can drive through on Main St and say you had done it as you head on to your next adventure.

title: Fun little place to visit
review: We showed up there on a random day out and did not have a specific destination in the area. We found some fun little shops and walked around for about an hour taking in the sites.

title: AETHETIC PLEASING
review: The coolest, highly classy vibe of MIAMI. Highly recommend checking it out. It also has a variety selection of asian cuisine which I always need. Very nice buildings give off a NYC vibe.

title: The Best City Park
review: I visit Tropical park various times a month.  They have so many activities from sports leagues (softball, baseball, football, soccer kickball) to agriculture and cattle shows.  They also have tennis, basketball, and raquetball courts.  Every December they host Santa's Enchanted Forest a Holiday amusement park.  This park is an amazing place to discover, with walking and biking trails to playgrounds for kids.  They even have Geocaches hidden throughout the park, which are treasures that are found using GPS.  Take a day, pack a picnic and share this place with your family.

title: Part of Miami Dade College now...
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: The building is part of the ever expanding Miami Dade college now. If you are visiting Miami and want to check it out get on the Metro-mover and take the Omni loop [the guard at government center will direct you to the proper mover]. The mover is free. Get off at the Freedom Tower stop. Often [not ever week] there is an exhibit in the building. Just go through the doors and ask the person inside. Tell them you are visiting the area. If there is something worth seeing they will let you know. If there is no one sitting at the desk just wander around. No one will get upset.

title: A quieter place to walk, dine or shop
review: This place is quieter than Miami Beach's boulevards. Lots of restaurant's of every price level. I recommend Hillston and Le Provenval. The Merrick Village Mall is near by. There is a theater on the mile and a independent movie. Plenty things to do. Happy hours on Thursday and Friday are great.

title: Shopping and restaurants
review: Nice place to still and have a meal. This is a upscale street. You can tell they are trying to make it the go to shopping place. It's not quite there for people out of the area that are use to upscale but maybe if you are from an area that doesn't have this type of area it might be worth it. Parking can be tricky. Just keep driving.

title: Not pleasant
review: generally a good place for restaurants and shops, coral gables has been constructing a more pedestrian friendly coral way and the construciton is horrible for traffic, foot and vehicular.  stay away for another 5 months or so. then, it should be fabulous

title: pleasant street
review: pleasant street to walk around, plenty of shops albetr mainly wedding attire, lots of restaurants too

title: Avoid it!!!
review: Miracle Mile has been remodeled since several months ago, and they are not close to finish it!! It takes forever to drive through, so avoid it (use other streets to get to Douglas Road, go to the crossing with Coral Way and cross to it. The construction ends at the end of Miracle Mile.

title: Rather Small Exhibit of the Cuban Refugee Story
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: The Freedom Tower is the only older style architecture in the area, and for that reason, it's worth a visit.
