Inside there is a small photo exhibit of the Cuban exiles in the 1960s, specially the children who arrived alone in the US via the Pedro Pan effort.  The exhibit is free.  There is paid parking lot behind the Freedom Tower on the next block.

title: Cuban Icon in Miami
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: This tower is located in down town Miami.  I did not enter inside, but the Hop On Hop Off Bus Tour Guide tell us about this building. It was used as processing center for incoming Cuban in 1960's. The tower looks unique among high rise building in the area.

title: Building was made for pictures
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: I recently was in Miami and whether eating at downtown restaurants or driving through downtown, this building provide great views.  It was made for pictures as well.  I wish we had had time to visit but even just the exterior is great to see.

title: History I was not aware of
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: I was not aware of Cuban children airlift and part Freedom tower played in it. Photos as well as artefacts are beautifully displayed in various halls. It is a place one has to visit to learn about the humanitarian mission played by USA.

title: Used to be very interesting, not as much, only toursit restaurants mostly, and some stores
review: If you like touristic restaurants this is the place....and some boutique stores.... It used to have many more.... Parking is pay by phone mostly...

title: Gorgeous Florida historical village by the sea! Free Coconut Grove Trolley.
review: Hop on the free Coconut Grove trolley and have lunch in the village in one of the oldest neighborhoods of Miami. Super charming, lots of restaurants and a marina to explore.

title: Great little town on the water just south of Miami
review: Since our grown children live in the area, this is a great little place to go out to dinner or breakfast.  The downtown is fairly small, but since it sits on the water, it's a really nice place to visit.  You can also head south on Old Cutler Road to see the large homes in the area.  And it has a long and tree covered bike lane that goes on for miles.

title: Gorgeous shopping and dining with historic areas
review: Gorgeous area to wander and shop and dine! Small downtown area where other shops and tiny coffee houses and tea spots. Parking is around the streets or in the garage nearby; lots to see and do, wear comfy shoes and have a cocktail outside, dine al fresco and shop and people watch.

title: Nice spot for overnight
review: We had just one night in Miami before a cruise, and picked the Sonesta hotel on the edge of Coconut Grove. Fun neighborhood for an evening stroll, outdoor music  and a couple of good breakfast spots. Strolled through the Barnacle after breakfast, nice little historic park.

title: Great spot to shop and dine
review: Miracle mile is great to explore/ many places to dine, whether for a quick coffee or a three course meal. It's easy to get around and there's lots of parking.

title: Freedom Tower - Miami
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Make sure to check them out as they are always hosting new exhibits.

title: An iconic Miami landmark which was once the highest landmark of the city
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Of historical importance and an iconic landmark in downtown Miami,over the last decade or more it has been dwarfed by high rise hotels and condominiums.its persona has changed as much as the exterior colors and remains a much photographed building,worth a closer look.

title: Great Experience
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: The views were exceptional, at the recommended , and the lines moved quickly.  102 floors to the top,I 5secon, that`s oors a meditthfloorvelprese three walthe elevator,tfilmirvelous startinmarvg wifilmpresentpresenionwastartingllrock it`s bustarro on, then the bthen farm land fofarmto the current  of sky scrastpescrapewhen you reach the top.  BEAUTIFUL! Definitey worth the visit for first timers or native New Yorkers.

title: Great building and museum
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Historical building in the city of Miami, very beautiful and with a lot of character. Inside the building there is a museum in which you can learn a lot about the Cuban immigration

title: After 46 years
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Words cannot express the emotion I felt walking in through these doors after 46 years .. The Freedom Tower which is now part of Miami Dade college was once the refugee center for Cuban exiles .. On July 7th , 1970 my family and I who just arrived from Cuba were taken here to process into the United States . As a seven year old girl I was frightened and lost and these amazing people made it all wonderful for us until our families came for us three days later . I will forever be grateful for the beautiful white patterned leather shoes I received .. Going I there with my best friend who was also celebrating her anniversary as well was the best ..

title: NOISY. CONGESTED. TERRIBLE AMBIANCE. CARS ALWAYS RIDING THEIR HORNS, RUNNING RED LIGHTS. BEEPING AT PEDESTRIANS. AWFUL
review: Peace.

title: Good to visit
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Good place to visit, to learn about the city, to take pictures, to eat around but it is very hot and humid during summer.

title: Take Visitors there (At night)
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Taking people to this area, and specially to the freedom tower at night makes the best pictures! Totally recommended.

title: Miami Landmark to see
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Freedom tower is a landmark and holds many memories of people who migrated to Miami in the 20th century.  The building holds different exhibitions throughout the year.

title: So much history!
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: If you love architecture and history, you'll love the Freedom Tower.  Located in Downtown Miami, it's easy to get to and well worth the trip!

title: Nice Old Landmark
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: There is not much to see, only a great beautiful salon, it had an exhibition when I went but that is it.

title: Another Beautiful Area of Miami
review: This area is worth a walk round. Some lovely cafes, restaurants and shops. Nice Harbour to take a stroll around. Not necessarily directly related to this area, but worth noting if you are not from the US. We parked in and dutifully paid by phone to park. On our return we had a parking penalty due to parking the wrong way up the road. This would not be a penalty in the UK and we were totally unaware that it was an issue here. It really ruined our visit.

title: Nice area to visit
review: This is a nice area to visit, lots of restaurants with friendly personnel, lots to do, go to a cinema, drink coffee at different places.

title: Not what I expected...
review: Considering the other reviews,  I was expecting a place where we could spend the afternoon,  have lunch,  and do some shopping.    This was true, but Coco walk was so small we did it all in 2 hours and still had time for a walk down by the marina.   Plenty of places to eat,  but I wouldn't recommend it for the shopping!

title: One of the best parts of Miami
review: This is one of the best parts of Miami. Central Coconut Grove has restaurant, shops, parks, historical houses. Just a nice place to park and walk around.  If you take Main Highway south you drive through tree covered streets with some of the nicest houses in Miami.  Always relaxing and interesting to visit.

title: Enjoyable art festival
review: Nice area and one can find the odd decent restaurant here as well. Not really a culinary destination but has good vibes. Spending few hours at the “art” festival is a decent diversion.

title: Presently going thru renovation Feb. 2018
review: Usually a nice place with upscale stores, mostly bridal shops and jewelry stores. A couple of good restaurants.

title: Carnival was good to walk through, nothing much there
review: Other than that, there isn’t a great deal other than loads of restaurants and shops. It’d not be my first stop on a Miami visit without an event.

title: Freedom Tower - Museum
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Great History, Well Kept...Beautiful place to learn about this meant to immigrants.  Right across from bayside with gorgeous views but best of all great interesting place to learn.

title: Inspirational
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Iconic building! This is where all immigrants were 'processed' during the influx of Cubans during the Missile Crisis, fantastic piece of American history.

title: What a story
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: We drove by this on our hop on hop off bus.  It is very nice looking and the story behind it is quite interesting.  Not sure if you can go inside but worth knowing about.

title: Short visit but loaded with history
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Great place to visit to find out a little about the Cuban emigrants. If you have a relative or you are an emigrant yourself, you will relate to so many of the stories there. Quite emotional. Free entrance.

title: Essential for Understanding Cuban-American Experience
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: This art deco building has served several purposes during its almost century of existence, but it is known as the Freedom Tower because many Cubans passed through it when escaping Cuba in the early 1960s.  The exhibit in the building provides a great overview of the Cuban-American experience in Miami.  There are also art exhibits with no connection to the building's history.  Plus, the building is pretty from a strictly architectural point of view.

title: Nice area
review: This is an area to go for good restaurants and a nice stroll.  Inexpensive parking nearby at Andalucía Avenue.

title: multi activities park
review: great outdoor fun for the family, any and all kinds of family activities, bike, roller skate, baseball, soccer, tennis, volleyball, etc

title: Important Part Of History
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: This where all Cuban immigrants were processed when they first came to Miami. Worth seeing, again you can see it on the Hop on Hop off bus and get off to wander around.

title: Interesting history, art and architecture
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: The Miami Dade College art collection is definitely worth a look as is the building and the murals on the first floor.  Must see the exhibit on the Cuban diaspora in the 1950s and 1960s.

title: Nice place
review: Beautiful place,, worth seeing. A must see location and nice development around the harbour. We had  nice time.

title: Not impressed
review: Or maybe I was just too tired or it was not sunny enough. Yes, It is a nice village like district with many cafes and some nice architecture. The marina with the boats and yachts are nice to look at and there is a lot of green. In general, tho, it did not strike me a something super special...

title: Nice place
review: It's a nice place to hangout, there's a fat Tuesdays and a pizza place that are really good. There's also a hookah bar in close proximity to the pizza place, although at times it can be very packed. I have visited on not so busy days and it's nicer to me because you have more room to walk or sit on the tables. I have gone during Halloween and it's fun however young kids should not go as it gets extremely crowded and there may be problematic teens and adults. Overall, it's a nice place to visit, nice area and stored to walk by. Coming at night is nice because they decorate with lights, especially in the holiday seasons

title: Coconut Grave
review: If you've got access to a time machine (or to Doc Brown's Delorean), set it for the 1970s (pre-Mayfair) and visit the Grove. Heck, even if you miscalculate and wind up in the early 80s (about the time of the Biscayne Baby night club), you'll enjoy yourself some. Now, its nothing more than a tourist trap. The last vestige of the vintage Grove, the waterfront Scotty's Landing bar and restaurant, is mostly a shadow of itself now, having been taken over by new corporate-minded owners. The Grove is gone, dead and buried in its grave.

title: Beautiful and Fun Area
review: Great place to stroll and go to parks and restaurants. Parking was available. I highly recommend a list here when in Miami.

title: The Freedom Tower. To the Cuban exile community this building is our "Statue of Liberty".
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: For many years this building was the "Cuban Refugee Center", this was the placed where Cuban political exiles came to be processed as they arrive in this line of LIBERTY. It served as processing center not only to be checked by doctors and other personal services but also provided information to the American government in other areas

title: Freedom Tower
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: An amazing place full of history, located in the heart of Miami city. You'll find there the real story of Cuban exile

title: remembering when we arrived from cuba
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Brought back memories of our arrival to Miami. Just held a warm spot. Glad to see they have kept for years.

title: Quite the boulevard!
review: The tropical setting with the gorgeous palm trees is stunning. It all makes for one terrific experience. Take a stroll along Giralda, one block north. A welcoming pedestrian mall.

title: Very nice area to walk around!
review: Very nice area south downtown Miami. Walk around the streets with lots of trees and nice houses, walk down to the harbour and marina for a drink, food or walk in the parks there, and enjoy a nice "city centre" with restaurants and other nice places.

title: Walk around
review: Little historic buildings . Shops , restaurants, movie theatre in the area. Nice to take a walk . A lot of construction going on in the area so looks like a bigger shopping Centre will be opening in the future. Paid parking available.

title: Quaint and lovely
review: We stayedc3 days in Coconut Grove. A great place to walk. No peacocks in Peacock Park but a nice stroll. Had a fantastic dinner at Jaguar!

title: Spend the day
review: Coconut Grove is a fun place to spend the day. Lots of small shops and outstanding restaurants. Presidents’ Day weekend it is home to one of the largest art shows of the year. Around 750,000 people over 3 days. Great artist and food as well. Big area set aside for kids, also bandshell with continuous entertainment.

title: Great Neighborhood
review: Coconut Grove is nice because it is just outside the heavy fringe of people traffic that Downtown Miami has.  It's a comfortable place to live a bit more laid back, nice grocery stores and a Home Depot when needed.  Close to Downtown Miami clubs, the Metro Rail, and Financial District.  Just has a laid back vibe, I love it there.

title: Love this area of Miami
review: When we come to Miami, we always spend some time in Coconut Grove.  The restaurants are good and it has some nice shopping.  It is a very safe area as well.

title: Lovely area
review: I am sure there must be many lovely homes but alot is behind walls or vegetation.  We couldn't see much from the bus.  There are some yards that have peacocks wandering around

title: Small hip Miami by the water
review: Coconut Grove has changed over the many years I've spent time there. Still the Annual Coconut Grove Arts Festival is a must do each winter season. Once a hip and hippy artist hangout area, then a more corporate yet still somewhat hip local. You really have to walk the area to appreciate it. On the north end by the waterfront you'll find the tranquil David Kennedy Park, the as you make your way south along Bayshore Drive you come to the classic Grove restaurant, Monty's Raw Bar next to the marina. It's a must to try specially at dusk to early evening. You can continue south and check out The Fresh Market store, they sell everything in a unique place. There's Dinner Key and the Miami City Commission building next to the waterfront. While some large condominiums dot the landscape, the road if full of palm trees and the the feel of the water. The road ends and turns into McFarlane Rd. right at the historic Coconut Women's Club and Peacock Park. When a block later, the road meets both Main Highway and Grand Avenue you'll find the commercial center of the Grove. The 2 large shopping malls, CocoWalk and Mayfair. Cocowalk is now being remodeled to a more modern looking place. It has features lots of restaurants and boutiques over the years. The more interior designed Mayfair was once a high-end mall, now is mostly a corporate office complex and a hotel. There are several hotels if you want to stay, from the high-end Ritz-Carlton, the Sonesta Coconut Grove, to the less expensive Miami 4 Star Hotel Waterfront Oasis home of the Mutiny, and the Courtyard and Residence Inn, both by Marriott. Both Malls have large parking garages. A walk down Main Highway and you'll get a small feel for what the Grove used to be, small boutiques, restaurants and lots of large shade trees. You can enjoy and outdoor cafe like Greenstreet Cafe or Taurus Bar a little further down. The Barnacle Historic State Park is in this area, a former Victorian estate and bayfront park. On this water side of Main Highway there are lots of small streets with the tropical feel of a small town. If you go a couple more blocks south you can check out the Plymouth Congregational Church and it's lovey stone facade. Some Private Schools are located in this end of the Highway, so avoid it during drop-off or pick-up times. Otherwise it makes for a great drive further south into Coral Gables and Old Cutler Road.

title: Loved returning to Coconut Grove!
review: The area is small, lovely and safe, on the ocean, with nice shops and good restaurants.  It's a great place to stroll around, particularly at night, when the temperature cools down a bit, and a good way to experience some of Miami's bounty.  Would love to spend more time there, but we've done long holiday weekends with friends, and it's been great.

title: Miracle Mile, excellent place to dinner & walk with friends
review: Last Friday I enjoyed a nice dinner and a walk along Miracle Mile; it was a pleasant and fun time because, after the renovations, the mile has resumed its natural beauty and pleasant atmosphere; visiting Miracle Mile is a very good option when you want to eat and walk through a classic and elegant place, with wide sidewalks, vibrant restaurants and bars, with shops whose well-decorated showcases catch the eye immediately.

title: The rennovation is complete, but we have vacancies on the mile
review: The rennovaton of Miracle Mile completed and some new shops have opened but we have several vacant storefronts now (rents higher?) on the mile.  The rennovation looks nice, but the Giralda Street rennovation may have taken away some restaurant traffic?

title: More like a block or two.
review: There’s not a lot to do.

title: Safe location, lots of dining options
review: Miracle Mile is located in Coral Gables, Florida. It is an outdoor (possibly mile long) strip that offer lots of dining options and shopping. The area is generally safe, but definitely well kept.  Street or garage parking is available. Street parking requires you to download the Paybyphone app to pay for parking.

title: Beautiful and Great Restaurants
review: In the heart of Coral Gables.  So much to do!

title: Great and amazing staff but not worth the hype
review: We were drawn to Artechouse by posts on social media. When we arrived, parking was very hard to find and a parking garage nearby charged a steep and hefty price. Once we made inside, there are only ten instillations spread out over a small and compact area. While the staff is amazing and very kind and helpful, the entire walkthrough lasted about 20 minutes. It simply isn’t worth the admission price, a $10 entrance fee is much more reasonable for the amount of entertainment provided.

title: Amazing Digital Art Gallery
review: I look forward to their future exhibits.

title: Art
review: This was a great interpretation of Art and a fun place to visit ... just wish it had more Exhibits as it was over too soon

title: Sparked an idea in my daughter
review: Well worth doing as a rainy day or a get out of the sun activity.

title: Must Visit!!!!
review: One of the three ARTECHOUSE exhibits (NYC, DC, Miami) - came here during Thanksgiving week and had the whole exhibit to myself which was absolutely incredible. Stunning digital immersive art with the most friendliest staff. Just come, you will Not be disappointed.

title: Miami's central large park
review: Tropical Park has a bit of everything for anyone looking for nature and sports activities. Have been here over the years for many company and family picnics, for little league baseball and adult softball games in one of the several lighted fields including for soccer. There are ball courts and many rentable shelters and the pine trees and other landscaping. There's a lake and a football stadium as well. Cross Country teams love to train using the little hill near the Miller Road south side. Visited recently to view my son playing a night softball game.

title: A Gem in south Miami
review: The place is awesome,, service by staff is great, clean and huge park. we had a christams pary in 2018 , 2017 2016 2015 2014 and so on . Thanks

title: Family place or not
review: Great place to do anything even a Market place on Saturday.  Kids parties, events biking any excessive or any events to plan

title: Best park in South Miami
review: This has to be my favorite park in South Miami. It is huge and has a lot to offer. From classes to the track... the equestrian center and famous "hill" it is a wonderful park. Tropical Park also hosts events such as adoption events and games.

title: Beautiful
review: Family oriented, clean, good for training,  the have different sports classes,bootcamps,  good for kids parties,family gathers,etc

title: I was put off by the price, but it was worth every penny!
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: I didn't think a two floor museum would hold my interest for 4 hours but it did! I had never heard of operation Peter Pan before so that in itself was worth the entrance fee. I manage programs for refugees and immigrants, so it was interesting to see what the refugees were given upon arrival. The museum was very educational and I highly recommend a visit there!

title: Geocaching bought us here!
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Well, a virtual cache based on the building.  This meant we got to appreciate some of the history of the building and have a look around.  We were not sure about the museum component as we wanted to do other things today.  So, might return, perhaps on a rainy day!  YMMV

title: Freedom Tower
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Although I didn't go to the art gallery in the Freedom Tower, I was able to appreciate the architecture from outside while taking a Big Bus tour across Miami. If you have an affinity for historical buildings, this one is great!

title: Beautiful tower
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: Freedom Tower is located just across the street from the American Airlines Arena, you can't miss it. I personally loved this tower, and it was lightened up pretty good.

title: A fun peak at History
place: Freedom Tower at Miami Dade College
review: The lobby and staircase are lovely.  It is a peak of what early Cuban exiles experienced upon arriving from Cuba

title: Nice People, Great Place & Fantastic Restaurants.
review: Coming to Miami? Stop by Coconut Grove and hang out with the locals! Stroll into CocoWalk for some shopping and even a bite. Then take a walk down to the local Peacock Park and check out the waterfront view of Biscayne Bay and it's mangroves. Always a delight to visit! GetSome!!

title: Enjoyable afternoon...
review: Fun place to walk through, window shop, and stop for a bite. Seems like it would be a fun place to live near...

title: Beautiful restaurants walking distance to our hotel!
review: We stayed with icoconutgrove.com short term rentals, it was an amazing deal, beautiful place and didn't have to go far to have a relaxing day full of fun. Went to Greenstreet Cafe for breakfast, walked off the carbs through the trees of Barnacle park... then casually strolled around town into some shops ( all walking distance ). Decided to spend the later afternoon at our rooftop pool, showered in our room got dolled up for the night and headed to Lulus for drinks and dinner. The day/night was surprisingly effortless and easy!

title: Fun view of Miami
review: Great place to see a variety of old  and new Miami.  Peacock Park and the Marina is always beautiful.  There is also the Barnacle House that is available for tours  Tons of great places to eat.  Drive south on Old Culter Drive to see some great older neighborhoods

title: Lovely place to visit
review: LOVE this area! Definitely a keeper! The atmosphere is so laid back and upscale. Very pet friendly too.

title: The Miracle Mile is a joke
review: Visited here on the way to Cuba. Walked the Miracle Mile looking for signs of life - failed to succeed. More bridal gown stores than I’ve ever seen in one place (what’s THAT about?!), lots of empty frontages disguised by posters, not a single store that you’d walk into. Do yourself a favour, just go to Plomo and get on the tequilas.

title: The new Miracle Mile
review: Miracle Mile has been one of the most respected addresses for shopping, dining and theater for over 50 years but like anything it needed a refresher and our city beautiful government went into action and they have transformed it and I would tell my readers while in Miami come and see the upgrades that has been done in the last few years.

title: Great Place for Food & Shopping
review: Since I was a kid have always enjoyed Miracle Mile in Coral Gables. There’s blocks of shopping, restaurants and bars. A bit pricey but there’s something for everyone. Must visit when in Miami.

title: The place to be in Coral Gables
review: Lots of shops, restaurants and hotels available. Light night activity as well. Only problem is you must pay for on street parking 24 hours, seven days per week.

title: Coral Gables...a must visit!
review: Great downtown to walk around and visit some of the many great restaurants and beautiful architecture.

title: Do not go here!
review: AVOID AT ALL COSTS! They discriminate!!! My husband and I went here on a Sunday afternoon, with maybe only 10 people in line, the bouncers completely ignored us. Two girls in front of us were told they wouldn't get in "dressed like that," because they both had on one piece bathing suits and should have worn a bikini with heels if they want to get in. The girls were so discouraged that they said "I guess we aren't hot enough to get in" and stepped out of line. This is disgusting that an establishment would make people feel insecure about how they look. Cover charge was $50 for girls and $100 for guys...not to mention they will charge your card $250 with a "holding" fee and will not be reimbursed to your account for days. This place is pretentious and they should be ashamed of themselves!

title: Do not go to the Hyde pool party if you are of colour
review: Plenty more pool parties of better quality in Miami!

title: I felt like I was discriminated against
review: I felt uncomfortable from the moment I walked in. The wait staff gave me dirty looks. I sat in the chairs along the poolside and no one helped me. I was there approximately an hour and no one asked if I needed a drink. The Waitresses avoided eye contact with me. It stinks because it's very nice aesthetically.

title: EXPENSIVE
review: I drank in my room and saved a lot money.

title: Fantastic First Visit
review: Don’t forget the sculpture garden because it is a quiet place where you can reminisce about the art you just witnessed.

title: A Beautiful Botanical Garden
review: We highly recommend this garden for its grandeur, beauty and all those amazing trees, plants and flowers. It was an Amazing day at the Fairchild. Thank YOU!

title: Dbcooperisalive gives this a 5 star review
review: We drove for 2 hours to see Fairchild Botanical Garden for our first time. We loved this incredible place. We spent the day here and came back to see the Nightgarden light show. We bought a family membership so we will be back. A great perk is with a member you get in for free or discounted at other participating botanical gardens in the National botanical garden network. Great day yesterday

title: Night garden is stunning
review: Look for the night garden fairy app before you go, it was well laid out with plenty of guides to help you along, the talking tree was especially funny.  Have you ever been to Avatar Land in animal kingdom, it is similar to that style of glowing gardens...

title: Visitors from up North are entranced!
review: Entering the tropical atmosphere is thrilling.  Northerners are so happy with the warmth and humidity.  So much to see. The tram ride is just great!  You always learn something new.  Always!   It’s on my Must Do list for my frozen pals.

title: Night garden was outstanding. The place is beautiful.
review: This is a must to see the beauty of the garden is a delight to the eyes. We were in the night garden and our party was very impressed. Would recommend this to everyone in the area or who are visiting.

title: Viktoria Rocks!!!
review: We went to the French and Famous night and enjoyed the live percussion with dj mixes and Champagne! Special thanks to our hostess with the mostess Viktoria who took care of us and made us feel chic and special! Great place in the evening on a beautiful Miami Beach night.

title: Outstanding bachelorette party
review: no easy to handle 12 mexican girls in a bachelor party, YOU ARE THE BEST

title: Victoria is the best!
review: Last week I had some family in town for Thanksgiving. Being from Miami I really wanted to impress them. I took them to Hyde beach and Victoria made sure that our day was a memorable experience. Her inviting smile made everyone in our party feel comfortable, and her suggestions for what we should order were on point. She is lovely and friendly, and her service was impeccable. I highly recommend Hyde beach- and if you go I hope you get Victoria as your server!

title: Excellent Experience at Pool Party; Jose is Great!
review: Jose and the rest of the Hyde team did an excellent job of encouraging a fun atmosphere while also controlling the chaos.  I will be back soon.

title: Pool Day
review: I visited this place Saturday 4th of July weekend. It's South Beach so be prepared to bring your check book, drinks are not cheap. This is a party place for sure. We order some Rose, bottle or Tito's and some wings. Service was good. Food was decent. I would recommend.

title: Wow. Stunning art
review: Not the nicest area to drive into but felt very safe and there are bus trips here from the hotel district. Wow, it's breathtakingly stunning graffiti art on old and derelict buildings and industrial installations such as cement works and warehouses. We paid to park in a parking lot for an hour thinking naively that was long enough. Advice- pay for 3 or 4 so you don't get wheelclamoed for overstaying paid time. There are cafes and restaurants and so much to see I wish we had had at least half a day there. It got very busy but we still managed to get lots of family photo shots. Don't miss out the shops on the street. I loved the plant shop particularly. Faces and designs in mosses and lichens on the walls. If you weren't flying home and could take them with you I would have bought someone a great birthday present. The coffee shop we went in was SO popular worth the coffee wait to use the toilet. A great find. Very highly recommended

title: Tranquility in the middle of the city
review: Really nice park with natural swimming pool with a good structure to spend the day. There are bathroom, shower, restaurant, parking lot, etc.

title: Great spot for kids!
review: Easy parking for the car, beautiful drive through the mangroves. Great little bay for the kids to swim. Lifeguard on duty. There was lots of seaweed there that day, but I understand they do clean it regularly.

title: Love This Park/Beach Lagoon & Marina
review: This is a beautiful location to take pics, on the lagoon with the breathtaking view of the Miami skyline in the background - too bad the Red Fish Grill was destroyed in Irma and probably wont reopen - it was a delicacy amongst restaurants in Miami, possibly the best ambience of them all. Its was 6 Star +

title: Nice small beach to go with kids
review: It used to look better as Hurricane Irma completely destroyed the are 2 years ago. But still a good place to go, specially with kids, as the area is very safe and there is just a few people swimming.

title: Matheson Hammock Park
review: Matheson Hammock Park has trail, picnic tables, facilities, on lagoon, lifeguard, parking. Miami skyline as backdrop, and near Fairchild tropical botanic gardens.

title: North Shore
review: North Shore Open Space Park is a beautiful area, has facilities, sand, parking,  maintained. Things to do in the area, restaurants, shops.

title: Unfortunately overrated party since other good options in South Beach
review: The Bottom Line - Overall....meh.  Unless you have a rich friend who wants to dump a few grand on a cabana, look for other fun beach spots with (slightly) less expensive drinks and better servers.  Crowd is just as pretty at the W.

title: Hyde
review: I'd suggest Hyde more for pool parties in the day (holler big rubber duck!) and if you wanted a chill laid back beach bar vibe.

title: Pool party perfection
review: Davis, Sana, Tania and Jimmy. Gave us THE best service. The DJ was great, the pool was nice and the birthday presentation was the most tasteful but flashy way I've ever seen to tell everyone in the area that someone is celebrating a birthday. Sana and Davis made sure our drinks were never empty and Tania made sure the presentation and poolside pillow were in the right place at the right time. Jimmy made us feel like our things were always secure even when we weren't paying attention. All around this is an awesome time well worth the money. If you're looking for a pool party on South Beach this is the place.

title: great party with promoter
review: the best pool party but use a promoter unless you want to be standing in the crowd of people for a few hours. Hyde beach promoter 1-850-228-1667.

title: Great staff, great crowd, great atmosphere
review: Aside from South Beach prices, this place is a great spot to hang out and get out of the house. Classy crowd, great staff, awesome atmosphere. Music is loud enough to enjoy but not too loud to have a conversation. Pool is beautiful too!

title: Nice Park
review: Was walking around and came across this park right along the beach. Restroom facilities. Picnic tables. BBQ grills to use. Exercise trail for fitness. Was here on a weekday and it wasn't very crowded and pretty quiet.

title: A beach in the south
review: Family oriented, this is probably one of the best alternatives if you’re in the south and you don’t want to drive all the way to South Beach or key biscayne . It has a small beach protected from the ocean, I love it

title: Family Time
review: Great place to walk with your family or just with your half. The sea breeze invite you to just contemplate this spectacular view. The bay was design for the little ones to swim, there are life saver. It is really a place for all ages.

title: Friday at Matheson Hammock Park
review: It was an idyllic day trip to Matheson Hammock Park! Located on a beautiful, nature park in Miami. It was quiet, relaxing at their small beach that has water coming in from the bay. At the shoreline, you can see some fish. Further in the water, it has grass which isn't my favorite, but the rest of this beach is perfect for sun bathing, reading a book, relaxing time with your spouse, or playing with your children. I use to bring my son here over 20 years when he was a toddler and I have fond memories.

title: Gorgeous Place and Gorgeous View
review: We took our kids to swim here decades ago, and still love to visit. The views of Downtown/Brickell, Key Biscayne, and South Beach from across the Bay are the best there is. When we take visitors at night, they literally gasp at the views. Can't wait for Redfish Grill to reopen.

title: Relax time
review: We went there on a Tuesday morning and there were few people in the beach, mostly families with babies (this place is very good for them indeed). It is a real nice place to relax, but unfortunately there was a part of the beach blocked for reform.

title: North Shore Open Space Park
review: North Shore Open Space Park is a quieter beach where you can find a stretch of sand and just relax without the crowds. There are lifeguards and restrooms.

title: RIP OFF
review: Bought tickets to their Avicii Hotel events, and the main performer Avicii did not even show up.  Hyde beach club's response you scanned you ticket so even tho we did not give you what you paid for there will be no full or partial refund.  Hey Hyde I WILL NEVER COME BACK YOU ARE THIEVES!  YOUR CLUB SUCKED TOO! What bad service to steal from people after not giving them what they paid for. JERKS!

title: Delicious Cocktails & Awesome Service
review: On Saturday, I spent my day at the Hyde Beach Club for a Bachelorette Party. The atmosphere was beautiful and had drinks at the hott trendy pool party that goes on at hotel. My drinks were all consistently perfected and Ricky my bartender was fabulous! He has a positive upbeat personality that kept me coming back for more. He was very busy but always attentive to my group of people. He made the party even better. We will definitely be coming back in a few months. Fantastic venue  !!

title: fun nice atmosphere
review: It is a really pretty well decorated lounge by the pool. Just don't expect to sit down unless you order bottle service. That will run you 500 and up. Drink are also expensive, 3 drinks 65.00. Not even fancy drinks just Vodka and soda. The music was great. We left because standing in high heels for hours hurts!

title: Spectacular Hyde by Dimitri
review: 2 pools, one quite and another one is more energetic. Great food and drinks selections, customer service is exceptional

title: Simply amazing!!
review: We have been to Hyde Beach for not only the pool parties but also dusk cockatils and partying at night. We have never been disappointed!!  Dave, the day server assistant, was so cool!  Super friendly and loved to talk!  Our day bed server Sandy was great!!  The hostess Jessica was so sweet!!  Super helpful! There was two other hostesses that worked during the day that were way stuck up really REALLY snotty.  Jessica was amazing!!  We will go back everytime we go to Miami!

title: Macy's
review: Associate Francisco in the men's shoe department was awesome He was super busy yet he help us completely with coupon and also suit cover for a suit.

title: great place
review: This is a very fun place to visit with a lot of activities for all ages. It is a bit expensive but overall very worth the cost.

title: Terrible parking, too loud, animals bothered
review: Hi I was super excited to bring my girlfriend to this event. Overall in theory it was pretty cool. Major issue is the parking, they’re charging $20 on top of the ticket price and there was no available parking, people illegally parked everywhere. Other issue is they were blasting music in random parts of the park and not in others it made no sense. Felt more like a child’s birthday party. Lastly some of the animals were still out and clearly upset from the darkness combined with loud music and kids yelling and people flashing lights in their faces for videos. Animals were clearly trying to hide in their enclosures and were pacing around. Pretty disappointed.

title: Luminosa
review: The lantern display is great! An opportunity to enjoy with friends and family. Jungle Island has really done an excellent job!

title: Great small beach for a quick swim
review: We have been here many times. It is a small beach with an inlet. Shallow water. you will see families having a picnic with small children or teaching them how to swim. It is a lovely spot near Fairchild Tropical Gardens and you can spend an hour or more under the shade of the trees. Very nice spot for a swim.

title: wonderful park
review: A beautiful park hidden in the grove. A really nice place to enjoy the beach or to go kayaking. Whatever the time of the day you go, it is gorgeons.

title: Secure, comfortable beach area
review: Definitely a family area! Cant wait to visit again some time.

title: Nice attraction for kids
review: It’s a lovely place to go if you have kids. But if you go in a group of adults it’s not worth it. You’ll get bored really fast.  Also keep in mind parking it’s 20 dollars per car. So per person 40 a couple will end up paying 100 dollars. So try to not go in many cars otherwise you’ll end up paying much more. My recommendation it’s to buy online you save money and also time. Again it’s an attraction to go with kids. Not as a couple or friends.

title: Relaxation
review: Good place to visit to relax in the breeze and enjoy a view of the Bay. We go to watch the wind surfers and to relax

title: Nice relaxing area but need improvement.
review: nice relaxing area but the "pool" does not look clean at all. bathrooms are not clean, great parking. i have a service dog for my husband and we were given a hard time becose of it.

title: Great place
review: My one MAJOR complaint was that we splurged and took the picture with the parrots on our arm. The parrot on my arm turned its head just as the picture was shot. I said something to the lady, and she brushed me away and said it was fine. I asked her to look, and she said it was fine. Sure enough when we went to pick up our picture, the parrot on my arm had it's head turned to the back. I bought the picture anyway, but was definitely annoyed. Was a great visit, but to be honest, not worth paying full price. We got discounted tickets, and enjoyed ourselves very much. However, I think it's a one time visit place :)

title: I love the solitude
review: I really enjoy walking or running up here after spending time in South Beach.  So disparately different, and yet the same beach.  Lovely spot for an early evening watching the sun low in the sky

title: Nice and to crowded
review: If the wheater is nice and you don't like to much crowd, than this is a good option to walk around and look for the bargains in one of the shops.

title: Wonderful experience
review: I went to jungle island for the light show exhibit they have going on every night from 5-10pm. And it was truly such a beautiful sight. I went with my friends and they all loved it as well. I would definitely recommend everyone to check this place out for an experience you do not want to miss.

title: Fun evening
review: We were in town only for the evening to leave for a cruise the next day.  I was scrolling the google map around our hotel and cruise port before we went for a fun dinner or something to do.  This is how I found jungle Island.  This was our favorite thing we have ever done in Miami. We got there early enough to see the bird show ( my husband loves birds) then we saw the Chinese acrobats. After that it was perfect darkness and weather to see all the lights.  This was so fun.

title: Camp Day - 10/25/2019
review: My kids loved the camp day. The organizer (Dana) answered all my questions and explained all the details pertinent to the food and drop off / pick up times. The activities we very well organized, they had an amazing, educational and fun time. They are looking forward to the next one. The only suggestion I have will be not to charge for parking, since we are only dropping off / picking up and it did not take any more than 5 minutes.

title: Nice little gem of a park
review: A very nice picnic spot for anyone.

title: A bit tired and needs some new stores
review: One good spot are the restaurants - good selection.

title: My hometown park in ruins😥
review: This is the happy place of my childhood. Even in Ruins it's got my whole entire heart. I do not recommend you take your families at this moment this covered by tape destroy building in boats. That we all I know you can still go out there and rent a kayak . Matheson hammocks will rebuild

title: A Very Old, Pretty Swimming Hole
review: My father used to bring me to Mathewson Hammock when I was a child, about 50 years ago!!!  I still go there.  It's very pretty. It could be cleaner and when the tide comes in and out it can be a little smelly.  But if you are a tourist, take a ride out there.  Very pretty spot.

title: Nice place to spend sometime enjoying the sunset
review: Matheson Hammock Park is an excellent place to come and enjoy the sunset. The best time to come is during the week, this way won't be so crowded and you'll enjoy it better. There are parking spots very close.

title: Rustic
review: Lots to see, and pretty basic in terms of infrastructure. You can get a good view of Miami, and Biscayne Bay. The palm trees are beautiful!

title: Luminosa was amazing!
review: The place was great! Only thing is I would have loved to buy something at the gift shop but the prices were outrageous!

title: Great relaxing beach
review: Relaxing, peaceful beach, great area for bbq and rentals for kite boarding and paddle boards on the weekends.

title: Rated R
review: Cool place for spending time in the sun.  Lots of people  It's right in the middle of all the action but don't bring the kids 'cause they'll get more than a tan here. Bathing suit optional

title: Fabulous shopping
review: This mall is fantastic, it is semi-open air and has a really good range of stores. We came in particular to Yankee Candle, where staff were really helpful, also went to several other stores including Abercrombie and Fitch where again the staff were excellent. Would certainly recommend for a good retail therapy resort, not huge but well considered stores. This is not an outlet mall so you are paying full retail prices, the service is reflected.

title: Nice place to visit
review: There is PF changs near by

title: Too expensive, poor quality of food and service
review: For 2 adults and 3 kids we paid approximately 150$ for the tickets, 60$ for a hot dog and 2 kids pizza and $20 for the parking. Honestly, it wasn't worth the expense.

title: Luminosa!
review: LOVE IT!! Me and my parents enjoy it very much... we didn't know this park, is very pretty and is totally recommended... thanks

title: Surprisingly cute
review: The last thing I was expecting was to find a beautiful "swimming pool " in the middle of the ocean surrendered by great vegetation and amazing views. Great facilities like restroom and changing area, pick nick area and Also next to the parking lot, water sport equipment for rent. This is a nice scale fir the traditional Miami Beach.

title: Lovely atoll with great views
review: Highlights of the park are the view of Miami skyline and the atoll. The atoll is a protected swimming hole which is great for kids because there are lots of things to see there including starfish and all kinds of sea critters. Lifeguards are on duty. Sand is quite hard. The atoll is also lovely to walk around. This is a good place to launch your kayak--also you can rent kayaks here. There is a dinner only restaurant, Red Fish Grill which is quite lovely but has mediocre expensive food. There is also a busy marina with stations for cleaning your fish. Large iguanas can always be seen hanging around the marina

title: Great place to visit for families or couples in love.
review: Whether you are there with one or many, Matheson Hammock has much to offer.   The Red Fish Grill is a lovely and delicious restaurant.  The beach area is small but has a great view of the bay and lots of beautiful boats speeding by.   There are also wooded areas great for picnicking and playing family/group games.  There is a very nice boat launch, but come early as the wait can be quite long.

title: lovely views
review: marvelous place to bring children...a nice lagoon for smaller ones to toddle in, the walks are lovely..and the added bonus of a fine dining seafood place nearby.

title: Pregnancy photoshoot. Spectacular park!!
review: Hi guys!! Flor here. It has been a while. I gave birth to twins recently. I am back though!! Ok, first this park. Had my pregnancy photoshoot at this location and I was IMPRESSED by its beauty. It is a breathtaking park. It has a small but nice beach and the vegetation is so lush, you will NOT believe you are in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Coral Gables!! The trees are its best feature, giving it a feel of a tropical forest. They made my pictures so dreamy!! See attached pics. It is perfect for picnicking and relaxing because sea breeze keeps it cool. It has a rental cabana for parties (perfect for baby showers), restaurants, and a nice long trail for bikes or just walking and enjoying nature. A must see if you visit Miami. Cars pay $5 during weekdays and $7 on weekends. Really worth it! LOVE IT

title: Dirty, animals uncared for
review: So much under construction, paths weren’t clean, animals looked dismal, poor condition overall. Do right by these animals, at the least. I don’t mind a dirty path if the animals are cared for better. Saw multiple birds dead in the flamingo pools...

title: Not worth it
review: Would not go back. Overpriced and my kids were bored. I was also bored. Monkeys also looked sad and bored. I would’ve walked out as soon as I walked in, but well i was already there and had paid.

title: Excellent for kids
review: Everything was extremely clean and talen care of, fun place and coourteous crew! Must visit if u hace small kids

title: Very Nice
review: Very nice park and beach with restrooms and jogging/walking path. I found this on one of my morning walks and really enjoyed the change of scenery on the path with the trees.

title: This place is AWESOME!
review: Having so much outdoor space this close to the beach that is both sunny in spots and shady in spots was incredible! We had a post-wedding BBQ here with friends who were married the day before. The pavilion was great and it has outdoor showers and bathrooms available. We spent the entire day here eating, playing games and soaking up the sun and sand before heading back home. It was very family friendly with lots of kids in the water and building sand castles. It was very different from the South Beach end.

title: Outdoor Shopping Mall
review: Hardly ever crowed with a movie theater inside. Outdoor shopping mall. Parking is usually always available and you have plenty of dining options on the outer parts of the mall.

title: Beautiful Waterfalls
review: great restaurants, amazing food...everything you want you can get at The Falls.

title: Beautiful Mall!
review: We visited this shopping place in January 2015.  This was on my birthday trip. Beautiful warm weather during winter.  We love it!  I bought a nice whiter sweater at one of shops there.  And we went to a movie there, too.  Fun!

title: A bit small
review: This is a smaller mall with a lot of class. It is themed around a tropical stream which is very attractive and calming. It has two large stores and a myriad of higher end smaller outlets and independent shops. It has several restaurants. One of my favorite is Friday's. It also has a cinema but unfortunately because it is an older mall the seating reflects this. No amphitheater like with the newer ones.

title: Good luxury shopping.
review: This mall is very nice. It has a theater, you walk around outdoors amidst ponds and waterfalls. It is more for the high-end shopper.

title: Beautiful peaceful setting
review: park is really worth seeing. They have nature trails through mangrove trees.It has a Pond and a Marina. You can sometimes see an alligator in the pond. It also has a very beautiful picnic area among the oak trees and at the very and there is a beach lagoon that is very peaceful and is very good for children as it has no waves.

title: Nature's Delight
review: Best place to watch the sunset away from the noise and crowds. The area is a hidden gem magically behind a huge park and surprisingly striking and full of life. The pictures tell it all.

title: Easy and quick getaway
review: If you are looking to get to the beach without the hassle of driving to Miami Beach, then Matheson is the place for you. You have tons of activities, from biking to kayaking and paddle board. You also have a atoll - pool where you can take the kiddies without the fear of them swimming out to the deep blue. Definitely family friendly.

title: Restful day with our feet in the sand
review: It was a tough week in the business, I was exhausted, tempted to go to Friday night happy hour. We went to the beach at matheson hammock instead and sat in our beach chairs watching the sunset. Better choice, calming choice. It's one of the best views in Miami.

title: Calm, beautifulo, relaxing!
review: I've been going to Matheson Hammock Park since 1954 when my family moved to South Miami.  Although there have been some changes, the Park has remained just as beautiful and relaxing now as it has always been.  Probably my favorite place in all of Miami area!

title: I LOVE THIS OPEN PARK RIGHT ON THE BEACH !!!
review: I have a niece who used to live just across the street from this park. We used to come here for picnics every time I visited. This is the way Miami Beach and other communities along the coast used to be when I lived in the area. I believe this might be the only open park space still available for public use at no charge. I hope it remains this way for many years to come.

title: Great place to visit
review: Relaxing beach; not crowded. Park is nice & shady, accessible bathrooms & outdoor shower, grills. Paid street parking $2/hr.

title: Homeless Rule!
review: Paid $350.00 to reserve a pavilion for a family gathering at the park. Arrived at the reserved pavilion only to discover it occupied by 5 homeless people. After explaining that we had reserved it, they reluctantly moved 15 feet to the next pavilion. As our younger members began to arrive they were introduced to the park by the cursing and fighting among the now 10 mentally ill homeless people in the next pavilion. During our barbecue the homeless sent a representative over to beg for food. About an hour later, two park maintenance men in a truck showed up. They warned us not to leave any valuables lying around because the homeless are known thieves. This made being close to the beach totally superfluous. It is obvious that those responsible for the park security have completely abdicated their responsibility for safety and security of legitimate users and renters. This is truly a horrible place to try and relax and enjoy the amenities.

title: LONG WALK
review: OMG! We never thought we would get back to the car! Its a long walk, and be sure to do it early in the morning or very late afternoon. Sea view is absolutlely fantastic! Dont miss it.

title: They said this is the best mall in Miami!
review: I love the water features! I love the relaxed pace. Most shopping centers/areas are teeming with so much activity that you can't enjoy it. It was a relaxing day for shopping.

title: Best option in South Miami
review: The Falls Shopping Center is one of my favorite malls in Miami, if you are going to be around the South.  It has all the stores you typically look look for and need, and even some stores which are sometimes difficult to find elsewhere, for example American Doll (which is huge, even with a place to have "coffee" with your daughter and her dolls), Abercrombie Kids, etc.  The mall is the outdoor type, so it is nice and pleasant to walk around, and has restaurants and a movie theater if you want to take a break.  Since it is not the typical "tourist" mall, it is not crowded and service is personalized.  It is also not as large as Dadeland Mall, so I find it easier to go with kids and walk around and not be afraid to get lost from your group.  You find plenty of parking space which is comfortable with your shopping bags and it only has one level so not to worry about stairs or elevators. Perfect!

title: A pretty setting, but shopping was ok.
review: We were here during the week and it was like a ghost town. The selection of stores is ok, but nothing new or different.

title: The Falls Shopping Center.
review: This is a mid-sized mall with a limited selection of stores. Not a good place to go when its raining

title: The La Hacienda Restaurant, The Falls Shooping Center, South Miami FL
review: The waiters are not that happy looking but they are attentive. Lunch for two: $18.oo

title: Clean park, nice environment, good atmosphere
review: Nice park to visit. Everything looks clean and the atmosphere is great. Good facilities to BBQ or just picnic. Nearby the beach what's make it a good combination to give the park a visit with the whole family

title: Great view, but not tourist friendly
review: It cost $7 to enter and they were all out of maps, so we had no idea where to find trails or whatever else might be available.  We did find the main parking area where there was a beach and a beautiful view of downtown Miami.

title: Laid back and family friendly
review: Perfect to bring kids to, great for walking and good biking areas. You get a beautiful view of the miami skyline and wind surfers from the parking lot.

title: Nice and quiet park
review: Lots of trails. Even had Hobbie kayaks and kite surfing for rent. Some areas allowed grilling and great for BBQ under a tree with the ocean view. There was a wedding at the the natural ocean pool. Beautiful place to go if you don't want to go in the water, not south beach ocean but white nice sand for tanning.

title: Lovely Park
review: Matheson Hammock Park is just delightful!  Lovely beach area with lifeguards and picnic tables all around.  You can visit the Red Fish Grill for a meal, or bring your own picnic like we did.  The kids explored on the rocks over-looking the water.  A must see!

title: Wonderful park with lots of options for fun
review: This is a great park that offers places to kayak, swim at a beach, walk along the bay and sit and enjoy the gorgeous views. We went to see the sunset.  Highly recommend this as a place to visit in Miami.  You can see the sunset from one side and then see the skyline of Miami from the other.

title: Great view
review: Take a walk down here and look back on the whole of Miami beach . Great to watch the ships as well . Easy to cycle there

title: North Shore Open Space Park
review: North Shore is a lovely, beautiful park.  It makes a difference to the South Beach. You do not find in North Shore skyscrapers, concrete boardwalk and crowd. You can choose what do you prefer.

title: Nice Beach
review: We are staying in the Keys, which don't have sandy beaches.  So we ventured up to Miami, and found this beach.  It is relatively quiet, and nearby parking is easy.  It has some seaweed, but that wasn't a big deal.  We had an enjoyable day,.

title: Friendly outdoor mall
review: This is a very friendly open mall. Spacious and lots of places to sit outside to have lunch/dinner or a coffee. Shops are for all family members. Including a Apple store which is not as busy as in Dadeland Mall.

title: nice outdoor shopping center
review: Many options from local to name brand stores.  Pleasant outdoor experience.  Nice food options also.  Lots of outdoor seating and several restaurants.

title: Outdoor shopping at its best!
review: This is my favorite outdoor shopping mall.  I love the waterfalls and how the river and pools run along the entire length of the mall.  Macy's and Bloomingdales are the anchor department stores.  There are many other stores in between, The Apple Store, American Girls, The Gap, Gymboree, Bath and Body Works, and much more.  There is also a movie theater and many restaurants for all budgets.  The lights at Christmas are spectacular.

title: Outdoor Mall With Typical Mall Stores
review: But the best time to visit in my opinion is at Christmas time when all the decorations and lights are up. The weather is better and not so humid as it is an open mall, but the crowds can be quite bad. I usually will go to the Bath and Body Works sales and that is about it. Sometimes I may browse in Hot Topic. Macys can have some good sales, but I rarely find anything worthwhile buying. I tend to visit every time I am back in town, but I wish there was more variety of stores.

title: Good for shopping, strolling, dining
review: This shopping center has smaller stores as well as the Macy's & Bloomingdales anchor stores. There's a nice size theater and plenty of dining available:  whether you want, pizza, crepes or icecream to fancier fare (Los Ranchos, Tuscan Grille, BJs Brewery) you will spend a pleasant afternoon strolling The Falls!

title: Nice and Chill
review: This place is great! not too many people but enough to keep you entertained. Beaches are sandy and shallow for the kids.

title: great option out of Miami Beach area
review: NOrth Shore is one of the best options when Miami Beach is full of tourist and you want to stay at Miami Beach Area, the park is very nice, is clean, and you can park on public parking.

title: a peaceful place to relax on a lazy afternoon
review: I spend many afternoon and morning after my bike ride A bit of sun wind and a snack at the local restaurant located at park

title: Quiet urban beach escape
review: Settle down, relax and take in a bit of "old Florida" at this wonderful park.  There were manatees when I was last there and the lagoon is wonderful for kids.

title: A beach alternative on the bay.
review: Please note that if this is your first time to area take time to enjoy drive in and out as it is surrounded by beautiful neighborhoods and landmarks. Enjoy !

title: My favorite spot in Miami to see the sunset
review: I strongly recommend it

title: Great Place to Sit but Not Much Else!
review: I was in Miami for a couple of days and decided to visit the Grove first, then made a pit stop at the Park.  I have not been here in years and is not as nice as I remember.  The pool area is small but fairly empty.  But for the hang gliding outside of the Park, there was not enough going on to keep me interested for long.  After just sitting for about 20 minutes, we left. Also, there is a charge for parking that I didn't recall before.

title: Bark Beach
review: On the weekends from 3-7 pm, pay $25 (non-resident) to take your dog to the beach.  You need the rabies dog tag for entry and pet must be on leash.  Take a blanket, towel and enjoy the beach with your 4 legged friend. Entry between 80th and 81st street on Collins Ave.  Check out the park website.

title: Calm, convenient beach
review: If you, like me found the crowded chaos of Miami Beach a turn off, check out this beautiful public beach with ease of parking and restrooms. This may be more crowded on weekends but for week day travelers it was a welcome respite. Located just north of 79th St. there is a parking lot across the street within easy walking distance. The parking machines will get a an unlimited time for $8. We couldn't even find a way to get out of our car the previous day (Sunday). Thjis beach is one used by the locals.

title: Beautiful & Quiet Beach
review: This beach was very quiet and clean.  It was a short walk from where I was staying, and there are also public restrooms if needed.  The water was calm and it was the perfect place to relax and soak up the sun!

title: Excellent mall to shop or just hang out and eat
review: Spacious and clean, real cool atmosphere with the water falls and the covered walls with Brito Brito's art makes it specially trendy.  I went with my family which includes teens and elderly and everyone had a great time.  Nobody was ready to go home.

title: My favourite mall
review: Macy's, Bloomingdale's, A&F as well as cinema and places to wat.

title: Excellent Shops
review: All  shopping experience for different pockets. Clean, very good eatery s, relax atmosphere and romantic landscaping.

title: Excellent shopping expirience!
review: The Falls has most of all the stores you need in an outdoor mall. The mall is nice and it's not so crowded, excellent for stress free shopping. The down side is that since is open air when the climate gets hot you feel it. Also when it rains really hard you are most likely to get a little bit sprinkled. But all in all is a great place to shop and hang out.

title: Open Air Shopping
review: The Falls Shopping Center has always been one of my favorite malls. It is an open air mall, which gets its name because many of the shops are centered around man-made ponds, streams, and waterfalls. These waterways were filled with bright koi fish when I was little, but have since been chlorinated. There is nice landscaping around these waterways as well. Often you will see ducks wander into the mall from the canal behind it to go for a swim in the chlorinated ponds. I hope they don't drink too much of the chlorinated water. It is a nice place to walk around and window shop, or just sit by the waterways and talk. Unlike the open air shops of Bal Harbour, Sunset Place, or Bayside where they greedily charge a fortune to park, parking is free at The Falls! It is however sometimes a nightmare to find parking on weekends. You may have to park at the far back of the mall (South Side). Another negative is the rudeness and unprofessionalism of the security guards. On more than one occasion myself and my friends have been stopped and/or harassed. Last year a security guard stopped us because he said it was suspicious that we were walking around and texting! Seriously? Many I have seen are very obese, and I have seen them use scooters just to get around. In my opinion the current ones should either be terminated, and/or required to take a mandatory class on customer service. I visited the Fresh Market on this visit and was surprised that the prices for some of the produce wasn't as bad as I'd heard. The Fresh Market is located on the same property and is fun just to browse even if you don't need any groceries. The market's interior is decorated like an old time country general store. I've brought many people to the Falls, who had never visited before, and despite the negatives, will keep coming back.

title: Same beach, not as crowded
review: Good place to go for sand, ocean, surf, swim, basic amenities and not as crowded.  However, if you want "the scene," head to South Beach.

title: Great local beach!
review: Clean beach, easy access.  Water is nice too!  Dog park nearby!!  Metered parking, bring change. Life guard on duty.

title: North shore park
review: A beautiful quiet and very large park on the beach parallel to the A1A between 63rd and 81st ( about). Great for strolling ,biking BBQ and pets.

title: Beautiful Views/ Disgusting Atoll
review: The hotel that we are staying in recommended the manmade atoll at Matheson Hammock Park as a great place to swim and see some exotic fish. With this in mind we wanted to make sure that we made time to visit while in Miami. This was a huge mistake. While the park did offer some pretty impressive views of the Miami skyline, the manmade atoll was disgusting. The water was black and smelled like raw sewage. The smell was heavy in the air and we couldn't even stay long to enjoy the views. Skip this attraction, at least for now.

title: "Worth a look"
review: I do not plan to go back because there was nothing there that would prompt me to visit the park again.

title: A sheer delight
review: You have got to make time to see this place, especially around dusk, when the colours are at their best.

title: Great Experience
review: This park is awesome. Family friendly. The beach is great, has its private, no animal encounters. Great for picnics too.

title: Miami
review: One of my favorite spots in Miami. Great for children of all ages, very family oriented, quite and a great place to enjoy with family and friends.

title: Best Kept Secret In Miami Beach
review: North Shore Open Space Park is really the beach and what a Beautiful uncrowded, even when its crowded beach is great. They call it a park because they have BBQ pit, and restrooms and some exercise stuff. The beautiful beach is six to ten feet away. Don't trust me the next time you are in Miami Beach you tell me!

title: Nice and quit beach
review: As nice as the south beach but less crowded. If you prefer busy beach go to the mid/south beach. Most restaurants are also at south beach.

title: I love this mall, it is so different even just to walk around
review: This is an open air mall with Macy's and Bloomingdale's as their main department stores.  They also have Williams-Sonoma and Crate and Barrel along with many other great stores for anything you might need to buy.  They have evening concerts on weekends and a lot of good restaurants.  The mall is surrounded by small waterfalls and during the holidays the decorations are beautiful.

title: Great place to shop and visit
review: It's also just a pretty outdoor mall and is a great place to stroll through with a date, especially at Christmas time.

title: The worst transportation connection ever experienced
review: Never again!

title: Easy shopping
review: They offer an excellent variety of stores to choose from.

title: Great Mall but watch out for thieves
review: This is an open air mall with Macy's and Bloomingdale's. They have the upmarket stores such as Pandora, Abercrombie and Hollister. As it is open air it is comfortable to shop in. Before we went we looked at all the reviews and decided that it was in a good area with security guards around the place. We decided to stop off on our way to the airport. We left our car for 40 minutes and when we returned it had been cleaned out. All of our suitcases had been pulled through the smashed drivers window. The car was less than 50m from Macys front door yet there was no vidoe footage as apparently according to the security guards there arent any video cameras there. I watched the security guards who ride around on bicycles but not through the carpark just around the perimeter of the shops. We met another customer there who had bought a TV and put it into his car at the same Mall when he came back the car had been broken into and the TV taken. He and we, were sure we had been watched as the windows in the cars were blacked out. this was not a one off incident in this Mall and they need to take security more seriously.

title: Nice outdoor Mall
review: The Falls is a great, nice, convenient, beautiful and big shopping mall!! You have to know that since it's an open kinda mall you have to go as comfortable as you can. They have in the middle of all the mall a beautiful water landscaping, so if your not into shopping you could just go sit and relax!! The only detail that was off for me and my family was the restaurants locations, They are all spread out and I couldn't find a food court....had to walk a lot to find a restaurant that for my taste was a little to expensive!! Don't get me wrong, food was great but when you go shopping sometimes you just want and need fast food because of your time!!

title: Great place to outdoor mall shop
review: Has big name stores like Macys and Nordstrom and also has regular stores like pandora and apple. it is nice for a mall because it is outdoor. there is a movie theater there as well.

title: Great shopping mall
review: Great place to spend time with someone. Amazing decorations. Has a lot of known stores like pandora, apple, Macy etc.

title: Don't go in the water
review: As a local, none of us ever go there.  Too many other places to get you're feet wet.  Please don't go in that water.

title: At the Atoll - nice & quiet
review: We have here twice during our visit. It's nice having a contained, quiet area for the kids to play. A beach within a beach. Water not too deep until you get far into the middle. The second day we were there the waves had stirred up so much of the muck that was at the bottom that the water looked murky and not as nice as the first day we went. My son did not mind! Nice palm trees offering shade. Restrooms right on site - and a changing area/outdoor shower near the parking lot.It's only a short walk from the parking lot to the Atoll. Recommended if you want a quiet place to relax on the sand near the water.

title: Great Quaint Beach...When you find it
review: After finally getting to the beach, it was beautiful. An actual beach within a beach that isn't crowded like South Beach. The atmosphere was really nice, chill, and laid back. A lot of little kids playing and just enjoying the beach, some people swimming. The floor (sand) inside of the water felt a bit sticky, but I believe that was to be expected. Other than the confusion of getting to the beach, it's a really great beach and the park seemed to have a lot of other activities as well. P.S. No beachwear permitted in Red Fish Grill...although it's next to the beach.

title: great views of miami
review: atoll beach, nice restaurant and picnic area, however cleanliness is lacking.  the kids are protected and the beach is lifeguarded. best aspect is the location, which affords a fantastic view of the sea, the palm trees and miami beach in the distance.

title: Beach area!!
review: Park does not have a biking/walking trail. The park does have roads that have access to beautiful beach, fishing area,and amazing forest area great for picture. Price for entrance $7.00

title: BEST VENUE FOR A CONCERT!
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: I also recommend you leave plenty of time to get there, especially if there are events going on in Miami Beach.  The traffic can get kind of crazy!

title: I love this place
review: Very well kept up mall. When we lived in the Miami are we used to shop here all the time. Even as a visitor we still shop there. The stores are more higher end so if your looking for budget shopping this place doesn't really have it.

title: visiting the Falls
review: Went by the Falls Shopping Center Mall to visit and drop off package for a relative of a friend of ours, who has a jewelry store located at the Falls, his store is called Mr. Fix It and is located near   Bloomingdale and a new store that is going in next to him called American Dream Girl. It's going to to a big store. We have not been to the Falls since we moved from there to Orlando area.  The Falls has changed and its even more beautiful and so many stores and places to eat and go to the movies.  We had a great visit and enjoyed walking around seeing the water fountains and flowers.

title: The Falls - open-air mall
review: The Falls is one of my favorite places to shop in Miami because it combines great shopping and restaurants with a pleasant outdoor shopping experience; this mall features top department stores and specialty stores. This mall has benches near an outdoor waterfall.

title: Good venue in terrific location
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: The Jackie Gleason theater (The Filmore) is a great venue and we go there regularly.  Saturday night, I was lucky enough to see Sting!  The theater is older, with not enough bathrooms for women (very very long lines)  but the acoustics are amazing.  Also great is the wide space between rows with comfortable seats.  We always like to arrive early and park at the 17th street garage.  While valet parking is available, it takes forever to get your car back.  We also like to walk on Lincoln Road (a few yards away) and have dinner at one of the many nice restaurants found there.  The traffic is horrendous but that South Beach...

title: A class experience
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Great location. Nice venue. A standard with locals, and hopefully you are lucky enough as a tourist to visit it. They have great shows, from varying styles.

title: Great place
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: This place has some great performers that come through here. Just be sure to have good seats and look up before you purchase your tickets. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

title: COZY VENUE
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Love this venue its a part of old south beach and all the seats are good seats since the venue is not huge.

title: Nice place
review: A nice beach and park, a place for bbq or picnic. Lots of people, but still nice and relaxing place.

title: Good park for boaters
review: This is mostly a miring park with a small swimming lagoon suitable for small children. There is a nice restaurant with a limited menu at night

title: Picturesque setting
review: Visited right before sunset, there were several engaged couples with their photographers taking photos, so you know it's a beauty. When I was a child and lived in Coral Gables this was a popular place to wade in the cove. Not sure how popular the swimming is now, since we were there in the winter. The pay booth was unattended when we arrived and it was a quiet location, perfect spot to take a walk, run, or bike ride, and enjoy the spectacular views of Miami and the bay. Go, enjoy a natural setting and unwind when you need a respite from the crowded Miami Beach glitz.

title: Great family park!
review: Beautiful scenery and wildlife, great safe swimming in a lagoon especially for kids, nice grass areas and beach.

title: Nice family water hole
review: Make sure you get there early so you can settle under the trees and get some shade.

title: great old time park
review: swim, sunbath, fish, watch the boat, bike, walk the sandbar, nature trails, picnic

title: Fabulous
review: Great outdoor space. Singles, couples & families can all have a wonderful time her. Wide, open space with lots to do. Well maintained,

title: David Cooperfield
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Jackie Gleason theater has always been a hot spot in Miami. i went to watch david cooperfield perform many years ago and also a few plays more recently. the place has it's years but has been very well maintained and taken care off. on the outside there's nothing to see but the inside matters

title: Love the venue! And I am a LOCAL!
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Great organization, ample room and strong AC! I saw Chelsey HAndler and many local school plays and such

title: Cigala concert
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: security was great

title: Great venue!
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Came here for an invite only concert that we won tickets for.  I loved the old time atmosphere.  Location is great and parking is easy since the convention center is on the same block.  There are pay to park lots and a large parking garage just a two minute walk away.

title: Best place for concert!
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
