review: I went to see Ghost on Nov. 3rd and it was my first time at The Fillmore! Great place with good acoustic and the staff super friendly, looking forward to go to see more artists.

title: Incredible Beach for the locals, sometimes has strong smells around
review: The locals know this beach is just as good if not better than South Beach.  Parking available, less hassle, and more urban connection to the beach and park.  Little park connected to beach pathways offers a outdoor circuit workout path, and places a bike path to tour on bikes.  Across the street is lots of restaurants, and one/two blocks away on Collins and Washington offers tons of restaurants, shops, drugs stores, etc.  The beach is awesome,  the ocean stays at 1-2 feet for 500 feet out to see.  You can swin to the first sand bar 200 feet into the water, and then stand and the water will be up to your knees.  Nice water, great sand, friendly people, not to crowded, lifeguards all around.   Sometimes there is a little bit of a smell maybe sewage maybe dog poop but it comes from the distance via air.  Since beach always has a little smell (since it is connected to the ocean which is a thriving arena of life and death) it is easy to get used to.  People are nice, had space there everyday including Sat (Dec time period).  And walking around the blocks near the park is super fun too.   Bring beach chairs, towels, sunscreen and it says no drinking but it is not strict and if you are cool and keep it discreet no one will say anything.  Enjoy!!!

title: Overpriced, little value
review: Park was rather small and the price tag did not match. Show was great, petting zoo was disappointing.

title: Great Atmosphere
review: When you don't need the crowds, this is the place to go to.  The open air shopping is very relaxing.  Good for the soul :)  There are places to eat, shop, watch a movie or just take a stroll.  Love this place!  Easy access parking.

title: Unique
review: The Falls Mall is a large shopping development built with all businesses facing and surrounding an open air courtyard . The court is a series of waterfalls, pools, fountains and landscaping. There are 90 - 100 businesses, including name retailers, several restaurants and a multiplex theater. Bloomingdale and Maces are the anchor stores. It is a pleasant place to take a stroll in an outdoor setting and away from the hustle and bustle zooming by on the streets just outside of the mall. If you want to shop, there are plenty of takers.

title: Nice outdoor mall!
review: This is a nice outdoor mall. Great to walk around and not congested. The stores are good but not great . The restaurants are pretty good but not exciting.  they are all chain  Restaurants. Definitely visit.

title: Great venue, terrible staff
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: The concert itself was amazing, the artist Khalid performed very well. The staff, however, was very rude. After the concert, I had a friend waiting in a long line to buy shirts. Having an aching back, I just wanted to sit down. In the span of about 20 minutes I was yelled at by 3 different people on the security staff. The 2nd person made me get up from the ground as if I was the reason they couldn't close even though there were at least 50 people in the line. I then waited at the side of the line and was berated by another man who demanded me to leave and when I explained that I had a friend waiting in the line, he insisted that I had to go into the crowded line with her, instead of just waiting near the door. Being in pain, I was already in a bad mood of sorts and these 3 rude people did not make the situation better.

title: LAUGHS AND LOSERS
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Attended the Bill Maher concert recently and was thoroughly entertained. While the surroundings in this old theater were quite dated, we enjoyed the show. The parking situation was an utter disaster. If you come to the Fillmore for an event, your best bet is to skip the valet parking and find a garage. The system they have is very disorganized and there was a lengthy wait after the show to get your car. All this for $25.00 plus a tip. Here's a tip, find parking elsewhere and probably find another venue to enjoy a concert in Miami.

title: Great place after all these years!
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Recently went to see Bill Maher and loved the show. We arrived early and parked on the street about 4 blocks away so parking was no problem. I was pleasantly surprised how well the theater has been kept up. Growing up in south Florida it's nice to visit a place that's still around! We would gladly visit again!

title: Great theater for music
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Don't get down to Miami Beach often, but  one of my favorite performers, Donald Fagen (of Steely Dan), was there, his only SoFL stop with his new, young solo band. Easy parking (municipal deck across the street), plenty of food and drink inside the theater--multiple bars. Had very good seats (Row H in the center orchestra) so we had no problem seeing/hearing. Can't speak for seats further back, but the place isn't that big so the sound must be decent throughout the venue. The show was outstanding!

title: Dita Von Teese Burlesque Revue
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: We attended the Fillmore theater for the Dita Von Teese Art of the Teese Burlesque Revue. Dita was very elegant and true to character and she fit perfectly at this theater. The show was phenomenal. We laughed and we were shocked and we were enthralled. The production, the lights, the sound everything was spot on. I removed a star for a few reasons. The first reason is due to the fact one small bottle of water cost me 6 dollars no questions asked. The second thing that I didn't really like was the seats are close together with no arm rests which makes for uncomfortable seating for two plus hours. The third thing that I didn't care for was parking. Valet parking is 25 dollars no ifs, ands, or buts. We rode to another street and parked in a garage for 1 dollar an hour which makes more sense to me. When you're paying over 200 +dollar for tickets who wants to pay an extra 25 for parking and 6 for a water.  We didn't have any of the concessions but they had several stations of food and alcohol. I wish they had a more healthy option to offer, but alas they didn't at this time. As far as the theater goes the theater itself is beautiful. It's Old Hollywood glam with its red walls and hanging chandeliers. I'd come back here and watch another live show because overall I liked the history of the theater and the beauty of it just heightens and transforms the entire experience!

title: RELAXED, PLENTIY OF BOTH SUN AND SHADE; MOSTLY LOCALS, (NOT TOURISTS)
review: The park, which consists of over 30 acres of wooded beachfront, offers a terrific mixture of activities ranging from traditional watersports and beach activities to BBQs, playgrounds, a fitness training course, bicycle/walking paths, and bike rentals.  Restaurants are conveniently nearby the southern boundary of the park at 79th Street and Ocean Terrace or Collins. The park is mostly used by local residents who live nearby (there aren't a lot of hotels in the area), and is sparsely used during workday hours. Convenient municipal surface parking lots are frequently located along Collins Avenue for the entire length of the Park. There are also many public bus stops too. Enjoy this urban nature preserve and the solitude it generally offers!

title: You feel very relaxed
review: I loved the ambiance so much! You feel very relaxed with the fresh airs and nice sand, lovely clear water. It's a perfect place for summer.

title: Nice venue
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Attended a concert here and was very pleased with the entire experience. Acoustics were good as well as lighting. No issues with entry or locating our seats. The staff was good and got everyone in efficiently. Lots of bar stations although pricing seemed on the higher end of the spectrum. Food options were decent. I would definitely attend another event at this location.

title: Excellent
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: The theater is amazing, beautifully decorated, large enough to hold a well sized gathering. Saw Phil Collins in March 2016 with a silent auction and was impressed. Much history and if given a chance to see a concert there it is a must see, with the backdrop of South Beach it is a great location to the area.

title: Friendly Staff, Good Theater
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Saw a show there recently. The floor was General Admission. I had a fast pass entry. They were still selling fast passes at the box office on the day of the show. The fast pass line started on the right side of the building. The first door on the right was for the VIP entry. The second door (further down) was the fast pass line. They didn't let us stand by that door until around 4pm because they were setting up the VIP line. We met the manager of the venue who was super nice. They did do a bag check once they open the door. We did not go into the theater right away. We were held in line on a ramp just outside the theater door. They gave us a token as we came through the door. You could trade it in for a free drink (beer, wine, soda or water). You also have a chance to use the restroom. When they finally opened the theater door, the manage walked everyone in slowly through the one door. He lead us down another ramp, but some impatient fans did not follow him and ran to another center entrance. The people at the front of the line following the manager still got to the barricade first.

title: The Fillmore nowadays
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: The famous Jackie Gleason Theater, which is now the Fillmore and Miami Beach Convention Center are located just two blocks west.  Artist Roy Lichtenstein’s Mermaid is located on the Fillmore’s lawn.  Along with Andy Warhol, Lichtenstein redefined the way we see art today.

title: Beautiful Theater !!
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: we went to the Jackie Gleason as our son's summer camp was having a performance there, WOW its been years since i was there, and no matter which seat you get, you have a great view of the stage, the interior of the theater is beautiful...

title: Off the beaten path
review: North Shore Open Space Park in Miami Beach is a lovely park a bit off the beaten path from the more popular beaches of South Beach, but certainly no less beautiful. True to its name, this is a beach without the concrete and skyscraper skyline that most of the other beaches have. There are picnic tables, trees, a dog park and ample parking.

title: A HIDDEN GEM!
review: Thirty (30+) plus acre tree park right on the beach (1/2 long beach) right in the urban heart of Miami Beach!

title: Very Nice
review: Very nice, clean shopping center! The water features were quite lovely! Every shop imaginable on the property. We only visited a couple to prepare for our cruise out of Miami...Columbia had a great sale on their PFGs!

title: very pleasant out door mall which is under cover
review: very pretty mall, surrounded by very pretty water features that are in the centre, so anyone wanting to just window shop, can sit and wait outside shops but in a very nice location...restaurants and a cinema complex here

title: Lovely outdoor mall
review: > Make sure you subscribe directly to shop email mailing lists, and any relevant clubs. A good example is Columbia, where they emailed me a 25% off voucher a few days after I joined their VIP club.

title: Outdoor mall that can be enjoyed in any weather
review: All walkways are covered and you can get from store to store without getting wet even in heavy rain. The mall offers the usual stores that you find in any other mall, but the general atmosphere and landscaping (water falls and fountains...) make this mall somewhat more attractive than most crowded indoor malls. None of the typical food courts to be found there, few restaurants only, did not try any so I cannot judge their quality.

title: Kool and the Gang Private Concert
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: With a group of 300, we rented The Fillmore for a private party featuring Kool and the Gang.  Great venue for food and drink.  We had tables and auditorium seating options.  Sound system is crazy good and great lighting.  We rented the facility on a Monday night.  An over-the-top experience!

title: Great place
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: The Fillmore is a terrific place to attend a concert which is the reason we were here.  The nightlines are terrific and there isn't a bad seat in the house!

title: Great venue for an intimate concert
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Located in a nice area of Miami Beach. Parking garage within 5 minute walk, Lincoln mall is also a 5 minute walk away.

title: Concert Venue
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: A wonderful place to see an intimate concert - the front of the stage is a standing room area and then there are seats behind and upstairs - really not a bad seat in the house!

title: Great concert hall for small events
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Great location a few blocks from Lincoln Road, a large municipal parking lot (not to be underestimated in Miami Beach), and reasonably priced concert tickets makes the Fillmore a great venue for small concerts.  Grab a drink and dinner prior to your event, walk a few blocks and enjoy the show.

title: VERY CHILL AND PEACEFUL!
review: I like this beach because you avoid the madness and crowds of South Beach, a perfect place to come to the beach and just relax! Perfect for families and they have grills you can use to BBQ and whip up a delicious lunch for family and friends!

title: Hate this place
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Every time I go there is this one security guard to the right who is super rude and doesn't let people pass between acts... even when theres about 40 feet of room in the pit. I normally just go to another person at that point and they let me in but the way he acts is very mean. He can easily say "no, sorry, can't let you through because I'm not supposed to" or something similar,  but he says slick comments and gives attitude. Not to mention the lines are huge for everything and the bathrooms are gross.

title: Great Theater
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: HAd a work event at the Jackie gleason theater and was outstanding.  Large venue that is great for shows

title: Review of the outside
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: This area is not safe at night.  The homeless flock to this area and there were a few people at the conference I was at nearby that were mugged when walking by.

title: Saw Kevin Hart here some time ago.
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: The place needs a bit of renovating. They had great drink specials, though it may have been associated with the act.

title: Iggy Pop's Post Pop Depression Tour
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: The Fillmore Theater is centrally located in South Beach and just a mile from the hotel where we were staying.  When we arrived around 9:00 pm, it was dark out and the building was lit up with lots of neon.  Despite the large number of people arriving at the same time for the show, we were able to enter the theater, go upstairs and find our seats without too much of a hassle.  The theater is attractive inside and the sound was great.  We stood up for the show as did the majority of the audience members.  When the show was over, we calmly streamed out of the theater and moved on to our next destination without much delay.

title: Ok
review: I recomend you visit here for short runnings, walk you dog or a very Light walking. Enjoy the beach here is not a Nice  option if you dont have a chair and umbrella, renting is not possible. Not much.

title: North beach, Mid beach, South Beach all good.
review: Miami's north beach (79th) is less crowded, cleaner and offers a community sense. Areas of mid-beach consist of luxury hotels. The beaches in this area of Miami beach are well kept and the water is warm. There are no street shops, or eateries or CVS's on the corner, just a marina for yachts. Many beaches in Millionaires Row are private, access to many beaches are through the hotels. Public access to beaches in this area is limited. The beaches of South Beach are famously known as Miami's Beach tourist attraction for it's art deco architecture, trending shops and eateries. The beaches are publicly accessible and the water is warm. The beaches are crowed according to the seasons, and well maintained. transportation is convenient from the airport to South Beach - you can take the public bus #150 for $2.25 to South Beach. South Beach has 3 free trollies with A,B & C schedules to transport over varies areas of South Beach..

title: Overpriced
review: Animals in very small cages. Very overpriced and small. I wouldnt recommend it. The food and drinks are not worth buyinh either.

title: Lights
review: Enjoyed walking around seeing the beautiful installations. So very very well done. Also enjoyed the bird show. Snacks and drinks are available. Worth the cost of admission.

title: SuperFlight
review: Everything was awesome. The superflight team and the overall experience! My daughter was very happy with her birthday present. Thank you for making the process so effortless.

title: Luminosa
review: Incredible visual experience for all ages. Definitely worth the visit. Parking on site is a bit expensive ($20), so maybe consider a ride share if you’re close enough. There’s also two acrobatic shows a night that are definitely worth seeing.

title: Visit to Luminosa
review: It was a beautiful , but I gave it a 3 instead of a 5 because when my 8 year old got to the section with rock walls and other kids attractions we could not buy him a wristband because they would only take cash. This should have been included or made very clear on website when I purchased the tickets. I had a sad little boy who could only watch other kids having fun. People dont usually carry cash these days. Also feel like parking should be free.

title: "Very nice shopping experience"
review: The place offers a great different shopping experience as it is an outdoor shopping mall allowing you to come out of the ordinary. A very good shop directory, standard prices and a great environment.

title: Relaxing mall to stroll and enjoy
review: Love to stroll around this open-air mall. Several great restaurants that have indoor and outdoor dining options. BLOOMIES at one end and Macy’s at the other with many varied shops in between and a multi-movie theater.

title: Wonderful day for the kids
review: My girlfriend and I decided Surprise our kids and nieces( all girls) for a holiday brunch outing at American girl store. The store is located in the Falls which was a delight to browse the shops, have a wonderful lunch and do some great shopping. The environment could not have been more pleasant, safer, and inviting for us all. The young and old.

title: Perfect time of year for The Falls
review: The Apple store was packed as always and there are other new stores open there too.  Lovely time eating and shopping and walking around looking at the lovely waterfalls etc.

title: A favorite for years...
review: The downside is the service personnel — both the Apple and ATT stores seem to have to tolerate untrained and arrogant employees that make shopping and warranty issue resolution impossible, unless you can shag a manager.

title: Love this venue but easy on the flashlights.
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: I've been here for a concert and now a comedy show. We love this old school smaller venue. More than enough bars so you're never waiting for a cocktail and a great selection of drinks. The downside is the ushers get a little crazy during the shows with their flashlights. I understand the strict rules with recording and pictures but when you're flashing a bright light in a dark room at a person, you're affecting a good 5 to 10 person radius around them and now ruining it for those who obey the cellphone rule. It gets a little out of hand. I was blinded probably three times during an hour and half show for somebody else's ignorance. Cool it ushers. You're acting like a rent a cop.

title: Lovingly restored Art Deco building, good acoustics, horrible sight lines
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Recently attended an acoustical concert here. Beautiful restoration of the theater.  Good thing the acoustics in the auditorium were so good, because we sure couldn't see the stage.  Purchased the best seats as soon as they became available, months in advance. Row N. Decent distance from the stage. HOWEVER, the floor in that area was all but flat and with the seating (folding chairs no less) tighter than most airline rows, we were smack up against the people in front of us.  Seats were not staggered so the lady in front of me with the straw hat obscured my view (thank you so much for not removing once you were inside). My husband had a 6'4" man in front of him.  Wish we had purchased the "cheap seats" further back as they were regular theater seats and the rows rose toward the back... much better to actually see what was happening on stage.  Dare I mention the guy two rows ahead of us with the Go-Pro camera videoing each and every song by raising his camera over his head, further blocking the view of everyone behind him?

title: What a sham!
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Don't waste your money buying a ticket to see a show here. My experience was terrible. My favorite comedian Bill Burr was performing here at the Gleason theatre and I jumped at the rare opportunity to finally see him live. While he was great, we paid $50+ per ticket and were sat on the floor level towards the back of the theatre. The mezzanine was above us and so the back half of the theatre is under a roof that is the upper mezzanine level. Thats fine, and they have speakers set in the ceiling part over us, but the speakers were not turned on. We asked them to turn the speakers on because at the back half of the floor seats, the sounds are really lost! TERRIBLE ACOUSTICS!!! I could barely here the comic! Meanwhile, for the ENTIRE show, ushers that looked like they were pulled from the streets were policing audience members one by one for cell phones, using their flashlights to call the attention of audience members sitting in the middle of the rows, so the light would be blinding everybody so they could yell out no cell phones DURING THE PERFORMANCE. Sorry but you're killing the magic when you do that and I will never pay to experience that again and strongly urge you to do the same. It was terrible, how are you going to leave a comedy show feeling pissed off? No. Wrong. Buh bye, Jackie Gleason theatre. I want my money back.

title: Check out a show
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Great venue to see all kinds of shows. The sound is usually really good and the venue is well kept and always a pleasure to visit.

title: It's named the Gleason Theater for a REASON!
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Best theater with so much performance history... I truly will lay down on the steps if the City of Miami Beach ever ever tries to tear this theater down.    If your under 30 and don't know who Jackie Gleason is youtube it.  Don't lose sight of GREATNESS

title: The worst venue ever
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Avoid going there

title: Concert
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: I wouldn’t let him ruin my night!!!!

title: No domestic beer? Are you kidding me?
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: They need to fire The Un-Anerican that made this moronic decision.

title: Great Russian Nutcracker
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: The Fillmore is a beautiful Miami Beach landmark, a very nice venue, a décor that's 1940's. Now, world class Russian artists with Nesting Dolls and Snow Maidens, perform great Russian Nutcracker.

title: Abysmal Venue - what a shocker!
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: So whilst I can tell you almost nothing about the ballet performance - apart from not having a live orchestra - I can tell you you that this was the most appalling waste of a half an hour of my family’s life! This includes getting there, parking attendant drama and leaving after 15 minutes!

title: Peaceful
review: This beach is a hidden gem. Hard to find but if you are lucky to find it, you'll have a good time. Plenty of free parking around, less crowded, clean and have a beautiful scenery.

title: Has shade
review: We went here specifically for the shade, after a couple of hours you want to have some shade to eat you meal. this was great.

title: On the beach
review: One of my favorite places to enjoy the water is North Shore beach in Miami. It’s not crowded and it’s a relaxing area to enjoy the day.

title: nice beach
review: nice beach - good swimming - walks - relaxing - water activties. close to restaurants, hotels etc. check it out.

title: The best place for families!
review: Amazing place for kids of all ages, including parents! Jungle island is so close to other touristic destinations in Miami, don't forget to include it on your list. We visited with family members from Europe, they enjoyed shows, parrots, flamingos and overall tropical vibe. Looking forward to be back!

title: Nice!
review: I visited during the evening to see the Chinese Lantern Festival with my family and friends and it was very beautiful!!

title: Excellent Presenttation Space
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: It took years to develop the right sound system and the shows are great. Take some time to enjoy their concerts and shows. I remember Gleason introducing Miami Beach to the United States from TV Land.

title: Valet parking nightmare
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Park 2 block away for $15

title: Miami Beach's best venue
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: The Fillmore at the Jackie Gleason is the best concert venue in Miami Beach. It has an amazing history as home of the iconic Jackie Gleason show. It is just the right size, has great acoustics, and is comfortable whether you stand in general admission or sit at a table or an assigned seat. They bring in the big names and the rising stars. I've seen many of my favorite bands and solo performers there and have yet to be disappointed. When you visit Miami Beach, see who's performing. You'll leave with a treasured memory.

title: Great World Art
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Thanks to this theater Miamians can watch great Music from all over the world. Valet parking is very good. Something you want in South Beach. The shows, as I mentioned are fantastic. Acoustics are good, seats are generally good.

title: The Jackie Gleason Theatre - One Classy South Beach Venue
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: From the moment one enters the vintage lobby of The Jackie Gleason Theatre, one recognizes this venue represented the class and charm of a bygone era. One cannot help but be stimulated by the color theme and decor - the gilded lilly of the past, preserved for the enjoyment of concert goers today. We first had the pleasure of seeing Janet Jackson in concert a couple years ago. From our mezzanine seating, the sound was excellent and the hall was filled to the brim with an energetic and youthful crowd. The staff were friendly and well-trained, assisting concert-goers to their assigned seats, then expertly expediting us from the venue once the concert ended. We've visited The Jackie Gleason several times since and continue to be impressed not only with the style of the place, but how well this seasoned venue treats its patrons.

title: Will I go?
review: Over the past two weeks I have been trying to book the Go Wilder VIP tour. Given the cost, I would have thought it would be a good idea to provide me with the details. I am now wondering if I should spend my money elsewhere as the impression is they don’t really care.

title: We loved it!!!
review: We loved the all the displays and the performances. Live music gave it a person and romantic touch for us. We’ll definitely do it again, and maybe bring the kids.

title: Amazing artwork of animals and fishlife on silk with night lighting
review: This is a must-see exhibit for locals or tourists at Miami Jungle.  If u  saw the night garden exhibit at Fairchild Tropical Garden and were amazed by it, then you'll be mesmorized by Luminosa.  The structures of animals and sea-life are exquisite, the work effort is jaw-dropping and the lighting display is inspiring, to say the least.  This exhibit ranks with a Chihully glass show.  We went last Wednesday and purchased discount tickets on Goldstar.  U can watch an acrobat show as well, i thought it was so-so.  I'm writing this review because i read other reviews that were overwhelmingly positive but one that said the exhibit was terrible because the writer saw "mice" at an outdoor tropical exhibit with numerous caged animals, ie birds, etc. How silly, what else would u expect to find there?  Note we didn't see one mouse, too bad ... don't miss this, it closes in early January.

title: Unlike most Shopping Malls
review: The Falls in south Miami-Dade is a different shopping experience. Unlike most Malls that are enclosed and air-conditioned, or strip shopping centers that are a parking lot and some store fronts, The Falls offers a unique tropical experience. Most of the store fronts front a lush landscape area with beautiful tropical flowering plants, water features with large rocks, some rushing cascades, wooden cross bridges and covered walkways. It's more like being in Hawaii or Fiji. The Mall features an array of boutiques and mid sized stores and a couple anchors, Macy's & Bloomindales, on each end. You can find everything from an Apple Store, American Girl, to a Gap and Brighton. There's a large movie-plex as well. If you're hungry there are a few theme restaurants both in and around the large parking area, like P.F. Chang, BJ's Brewhouse, Los Ranchos and Brio Italian. Some smaller places for a snack or treat, like Crepe Maker, a Churros spot or Starbucks. There's also a small parking garage. During the Holidays there's aways something for the kids, like the Easter Bunny or Santa. It's especially pleasant during the cooler days of a Miami Winter, or Spring, but if you dress appropriately, even a Summer day isn't all that bad with all the stores, restaurants or movie you can pop into.

title: Falling Waters
review: I watched the construction of this shopping center and must say that I was not disappointed in the tranquil setting of the numerous water falls that the name evoked.  Over the years, the number of waterfalls has diminished to make way for additional sotres but this is still a lovely place for strolling, dining and shopping.

title: Amazing mall
review: Dedicate 2-3 hours for full enjoyment

title: Really nice stores
review: Great hidden mall in Miami--bookended by Macys and Bloomingdales. Lots of nice stores in between--has covered parking. We found a great store selling columbian jewelry.

title: Awesomeness
review: This shopping center was so amazing. I spent all my life savings here. I bought 83 jackets and 37 pairs of sneakers. I can't afford rent anymore so I'm living in my grandma's house, but I had so many jackets and sneakers. I found out the other day that my grandma threw them out. But I will save up to buy a lot more!

title: Great venue
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Went to Umphreys Mchgee show at the Fillmore and was impressed how good the sound was.  This place is small enough to appreciate the music. Pricey drinks though!

title: Excellent Venue. It is big enough to hold enough people but still intimate
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: I went for a concert. The seating was pretty good and the sound was just hitting the spot. I enjoy the layout and sound. Good bartenders and easy to exit. They ran out of valet parking though. Only thing I'd say that wasn't great.

title: Miami Icon
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Great venue to watch high-liner shows in Miami Beach.  Contains the iconic Jackie Gleason Theater.  Madonna will be there in early 2020.

title: Where was she???
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Of what was a funny evening of various acts, Dita was the least seen and least interesting person there.

title: Brit Floyd
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: The hall was within walking distance of plenty of hotels.  Drinks were expensive but at any concert you'll find it the same.

title: Now branded the Fillmore
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: It was great as a venue, bars everywhere inside the venue, and snacks, as well as a VIP lounge and really good acoustics and sight lines.  Easy to get to from any hotel on South Beach!

title: Love this theater
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: A true classic. Small intimate and great sound. Saw a Queen tribute concert and the show was great very small crowd. Drinks were a little pricey, but bars were everywhere.

title: God Save The Queen Tribute Concert
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: The lead singer looked enough like Freddie to fill the role.  He sang, danced and acted the park very well.  A must see concert if you are a Queen fan.  Played one night at Miami Beach.  Audience sang, danced and rocked throughout the show.

title: Tori
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: Saw Tori Amos there. Excellent as always. I believe that I will go there for more concerts. And since I can not submit with out 50 characters or less I will type non sense. Sounds like fishing for compliments. LOL

title: VALET IS TERRIBLE...venue itself was amazing!
place: The Fillmore Miami Beach at the Jackie Gleason Theater
review: The theatre alone was excellent, the staff and security were so helpful and friendly. But when it came to valet parking, I wish I caught the name of the company they contract, I recommend you find cheaper parking down the street. We arrived about a half hour before doors opened for the show, handed off our vehicle to valet. Fast forward we left before the last song of the show to beat traffic. We were the first few people outside, handed our ticket to the valet guy and waited. We waited nearly an HOUR for our vehicle in the middle of a rain storm. As the crowd dwindled, hearing numerous people shout “where is my car?” then to have their vehicles come speeding in to the lot, we were the LAST people waiting. We noticed all of the valet employees hanging around their office, walked up to them and asked them what was going on. They didn’t give an excuse and mostly spoke Spanish. To add, giving us dirty looks while speaking to each other. Shortly after, an employee comes speeding with our car to the main entrance. By this time it was almost 1 AM and we were exhausted on our 4 hour drive back to Daytona. Extremely unprofessional. I don’t even know how you forget someone’s car when that is the whole purpose of your job. Save yourself the stress.

title: Shopping
review: Yes love the Dolphin mall 4 shopping i shop a lot good prices and all kind of stores and brand i will be back in a few weeks.

title: Its Black Friday Sale!!
review: A well planned shopping centre with great dining options especially in the food court.

title: Decent mall
review: Had only an afternoon spare and found this mall, great variety of shops and plenty parking easily accessible close to Doral and Airport.

title: Great stores!
review: There's also a bowling alley and a movie theater. You can easily spend the whole day there.

title: Highly Recommended Shopping Place!
review: Dolphin Mall has tons of things to do, whether you're here for shopping, dining, catching a movie, or bowling with friends. Certainly worth knowing and back again.

title: I enjoyed this free transportation and had no problems
review: Very impressed.  It's a little confusing going to an area toward the center of the system from the far end (like the Financial Center station), as because of the loops in the middle you sometimes don't come back the exact way you went out, but I figured it out, and appreciated Metromover!

title: 'Overway'
review: One of Miami's peculiarities is to have a combination of 2 unusual trains that make an attempt to relieve the city's awful traffic. Miami has the characteristic of having a morning rush hour car caravan to the East where most jobs are and an opposite return home caravan to the West where most residential areas are. This is where the 1st train called Metrorail starts its job. Leaving from the deepest South West suburbs, this elevated rail rapid transit system runs and have stops with parking lots around the whole city and people who hate getting into traffic jams, park their cars and take the train to their jobs mostly in downtown Miami. To complete the system, there is another smaller train called the Metromover that runs along an inner downtown circle near the coast, so it not unusual to see people take the Metrorail and then board the Metromover to get to their destination. Even though you're not going to work, these 2 trains offer any visitor a good, cheap and fast way to get to know beautiful Miami, connect with people and experience something new

title: Nice way to visit Down town Miami
review: Nice way to go around Down town Miami. Free Metro in Down town Miami. No driver and you go around and through the buildings.

title: Great way to get around
review: It’s clean, fast and easy to master. The best way to get around town. Park your car in one place and take the Peoplemover

title: Convenient transportation amenity with zero cost
review: Sometimes a little crowded but what can you do

title: Española Way
review: It’s not as big as I thought, only about 5 restaurants, 1 ice cream shop, 2 shops. We ate at Oh Mexico, and OMG the food was amazing!! We almost went back the next day! Service was great too.

title: great little road...
review: Nice walk to do in the evening, lot of great vibes and nice restaurants... I particularly love one from some guys from Rome, never knew Roman cuisine can be so delicious.

title: pretty stroll
review: lots of restaurants very pretty at night.along this walk with all the lights.  best restaurant is Havana 1957.

title: Beautiful Atmosphere
review: You feel like you are in Europe.  Lovely cafes and restaurants in a festive, well decorated street near the beach.

title: A nice latin alley
review: A colourful alley with lights and restaurants, you can have a coctail, a cigar or a tasty meal whatever you like. It is crowdy but feels cozy, more than the bar-restaurants at the South Miami Beach. Worths paying a visit!

title: Entertaininh
review: I live in Miami so every time someone comes to visit I take them here. Great restaurants, drinks and atmosphere.

title: Nice but it looks a little run down.
review: Too many souvenir stores. Not enough of anything else. A couple of good restaurants. Too many drink stands. A few bars.

title: Great margaritas/ five guys and hooters
review: For us, we grabbed cured our hangovers with five guys topped off with a margarita.

title: Multitude shops selling a lot of junk, picturesque.
review: There are many shops here, selling all sorts of junk. There are picturesque walks outside with lovely views over the bay. Handy location to start tours, eg. with the Big Bus Company.

title: really interesting walk through / stores most cannot afford
review: Came to see two contempary art museums and ended up spending an hour or two walking through the DD.  Parking is impossible on the street, but garages are cheap ($3 for 4 hours).  Neat place to wander - hard to believe it was once basically blight.  At the moment I'm on a budget, but even if I hadn't been, the clothing / fashion stores would not be on my list.  Fun to see, but it's clothing for g-d's sake; jeans should last 15 years and sneakers for 5, lol.  The art on the other hand, might have tempted me; just not this time.  Lots of visual interest though, touches of whimsy - and plenty of food.  A neat area for an afternoon.

title: Awesome Area
review: Many may view the area as solely for those who can indulge in luxuries.  I view it as Commerce as Art and very much worth the visit.

title: A Miami Interior Design & Architectural Must See During The Day
review: The Miami Design District is a must-see location. It's been recently renovated with luxury stores that have some of the best designs in the world. Be sure to go in Gucci and look for the parking garage. Make time to walk around to explore too.

title: People watching a real treat here
review: Watching people watch the "beautiful people" is fun. Also checking out the elegant clothes on display and the stunningly lavish shops where they are being displaye

title: VG
review: No trip to Miami would be complete without a visit to this interesting part of the city. There are markets and fine restaurants here as well.

title: Miami Botanical Garden is a nice green Oasis in Miami Beach.
review: In here you can se some animals around the park. But most plants and flowers, is a quiet place to relax and have a silent time with your self or family/friends.

title: Short Walk from Lincoln Drive  - a different side of South Beach
review: As a native of Miami/Miami Beach I was surprised to see signs for a botanical garden so close to home. It was a wonderful place to sit and have a quiet lunch or just relax from the sun and noise of South Beach.

title: I loved it!
review: This is a true gem for all who are into botanics. Must see location if youre visiting Miami Beach. Iam coming back!

title: Loveliness
review: I finally got to the Botanical Garden after learning about it on a previous Miami Beach stay. I like that there was no entry charge and its size is manageable for a brief visit. It's very peaceful and a wonderful respite from the building density and busy roads of the surrounding area. We especially enjoyed seeing the butterflies and the giant milkweed plant. It was delightful meeting garden staff, Gaylord and Michael, and loved their knowledge about the garden. Next time I hope to take the Saturday morning tour.

title: Little spot of paradise
review: Escape the crowds of South Beach and enjoy a spot of paradise.

title: Was a bit unwhelming...
review: Travelled to little Havana as part of our visit to Miami. Was left a bit disappointed as it was only a small area with several cigar shops and restaurants. Not much else to see. Would probably only spend 30 min here at the most

title: So so
review: We were not impressed with this area mostly designed as a tourist attraction. We were on our way to Havana so we didn't eat here or buy anything.

title: Little Havana
review: We did a self guided tasting tour of Little Havana. We are our way through the area with stops for drinks, lunch  and finished with cafe and pastries.

title: Nice place to have a meal
review: It is where the big bus changes from blue route to red route. We had a quick look around our first day and the next day after doing a boat trip we browsed the many shops and restaurants. Where we had our evening meal there which was reasonably priced

title: Pretty Typical
review: We spent a few nice hours here, touring the outer edges of the market, looking at the bay, the boats, the cruise ships, the birds and the manatees.   Inside is pretty typical middle-America mall stuff, but the walk to and fro,  and the open-air aspect on such a nice day,  made it most enjoyable.   The Starbucks there was delightful with lovely staff and great drinks.

title: Great shops
review: What a wonderful surprise. stayed across the street what an easy walk. great shops and food. right on the water. loved it

title: Visiting the day before your cruise?
review: This was a nice place to visit the day/evening before a cruise.  Plenty of dining, shopping, and activities to keep occupy your time!

title: Authentic Visit, nice place
review: Little Havana is an area where you can see a typical street with Cuban restaurants, shops and food stands in a Cuban style. there is also some steer art. 30-60 minutes are enough if you are not going to have lunch or dinner.

title: Fun location
review: Lots of shops selling artistry from locals.  Very nice jewelry, artwork, etc.  You can watch men roll cigars and there are several cigar shops.  Lots of places to choose to eat, incluing many bars that sell mojitos with a piece of sugarcane in it as a stirrer.  Really good!  Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area!

title: love it
review: it's free, and there are few circuits. some times you have to wait a little bit, but you can go all the collins Ave go and back.

title: Free trolley ride
review: Here in Miami Beach but not near the Art Deco district. Free trolley ride all day and takes about 15 minutes from Eden Roc hotel with the stop outside the Hotel to Lincoln Road. Drivers are great but especially Donna who had a crowd last night with traffic problems. Easy to get around on.

title: Lots of Animation shops and restaurants. recommended !
review: Very nice place near the Marina. lots of restaurants, shops and music. recommended to visit during the day or in the evening. central place to start your visit by bus or by boat.

title: A touristic way to get around
review: Not a bad way to got around Miami.

title: Best free way for travel in Miami Beach
review: It’s a relly good way for free to go around Miami Beach. There are more lines so you can reach every famous places from North to South. Get the app and you can see where is your trolley. The best driver is Donna on Collins Express, she’s a real nice entertainer, not just drive, do a sightseeing tour if you travel with her

title: Convenient but not reliable time-wise
review: We travelled from the cruise port to Vizcaya on this free trolley. There is even a sign saying "gratuities not allowed". So, very convenient but there could be a long wait, then two or more trolleys come at once. It is used a lot by locals, most Spanish-speaking. Wooden seats, not padded.

title: Fun artwork
review: We went by and the store was fun to shop in.  They had some extraordinary pieces (costly!) but some were whimsical and affordable

title: Love his art!
review: What a fun and amazing art gallery! I’ve always loved his use of colors and this place doesn’t disappoint. All mediums available to see and purchase. Loved the back wall with his past creations.

title: Pure Joy
review: My daughter has been a fan and wanted to come here for five years.  It is WELL worth the uber ride to come over and see the gallery. His story is inspirational to anyone- especially artists. (And their mothers.)

title: Britto Central
review: This is one of the many shops that you can find on Lincoln Road and this is one of the ones that caught my attention because it is like very Miami Beach

title: I LOVE Britto
review: I have been a big fan of Romero Britto for years. I started my collection on a Royal Caribbean ship and bought ‘The Royal Bear’. I have lots of small pieces now and have been a few times to Britto Central on Lincoln Road. I still get excited to visit. I am now the proud owner of two of his prints. The first I carried (framed) all the way on two flights back to Scotland and on our last visit my husband bought me ‘The Hug’ which was just too big to carry home so we brought back the print. My ambition is to meet Romero in person.

title: Pleasant Weather to visit
review: Nice to walk the ground. Shopping is ok but nothing special. The restaurants looked good.

title: Esquisite day at bayfront.
review: A scenic place, full of nice theme stores, and very good restaurants! The brilliantsun, nice international food, and stores to purchase a Jacket, trousers, nice signature shirts, golf clubs, watches, lenses, nice leather shoes, etc.

title: A place for shopping and entertaining
review: Have fun at Bayside..

title: A little bit of everything
review: There is a lot to do and see here. There was live music, food, shopping and more. It is really clean and decorated for Christmas. We really enjoyed walking around here.

title: Enjoyed the atmosphere, very cool place.
review: It was a neat place to visit. There is music and different little shops as well as some name brands. A lot of different places to eat and try new foods.

title: Wonderful tour and insight to history...
review: We would recommend this as a chance to learn something both historic and different.  YMMV

title: Guided Tour Jewish Miami Beach
review: We thoroughly enjoyed the tour of South Miami Beach old Jewish neighborhoods. Our guide, Howard Brayer, was very knowledgeable and entertaining. Look forward to attending the second part of the tour around the North Miami Beach area in the Fall.

title: Enlightening and educational
review: I recently moved to MiaBch and am trying to learn the history and culture of my new home. This tour was excellent and memorable. The guide, Howard, is thoroughly informed on the facts and brilliant in sharing the details. I highly recommend this tour.

title: On National Register of Historic Places
review: Just a short walk from the South Beach, it is restored from 2 synagogues. It has Art Deco features and the stained glass windows and copper dome are great for pics. There is a permanent collection of Jewish Life in Florida as well as rotation collections.

title: Half a day well spent
review: The museum has a well documented permanent exhibit of local history of Jewish presence, that they plan to improve, and rotating exhibits of great artists and open minded subjects, that take advantage of a well preserved double building of historical value. We took their tour around the neighborhood with Mike Gordon as guide. We learnt, enjoyed and recommend it.

title: when the hotels provide the chairs and towels...
review: nice beach, many hotels have their own staff there taking care of everything, beach was clean. didnt notice any lifeguards

title: A privilege to be here
review: Fantastic beach, peaceful and nice neighborhood, easy access, amazing people and very safe,  police always available and friendly

title: All High End
review: Yes this center has all the expected Luxury Brands and more . No cheap discount trash here. Some very good restaurants as well.would recommend for luxury shoppers.

title: Really nice beach but be aware of recent sewer situation
review: This is a really nice scenic beach, with several hotels like the Ritz and St Regis as well as a lot of upscale condos. The bay flows out and in from the Atlantic right by the Ritz. When we were there last week this section of the beach and right across on handover beach was closed due to massive sewer spill at another park on the bay. They claimed to have it fixed but beach was still closed Sunday and when we were tarpon fishing in canals across from Bal Harbour Saturday night we definitely got a whiff of a fresh sewage spill

title: Go and enjoy.
review: It is free on Friday evenings after 6 PM. I recommend arriving for 6PM so you can take the guided tour. The docent did a great job with giving a brief history of the museum, of the founder and some of the various pieces. It is only a 45-minute guided tour. I found it not only educational, but interesting. The building itself is historic and worth seeing.

title: Phenomenal! For Art Deco lovers...and those who are curious, open-minded, appreciate art, design, history, culture.
review: The Wolfsonian is not to be believed. One man’s eye, intellect, commitment  to explore, preserve, explain, share art and artifacts of mostly the 20th century. Social and art history that is beyond extraordinary. My new wish is to meet the man who created and assembled this collection. OMG...mind blowing. And one particular painting that brought tears. (I wasn’t allowed to photograph that painting...alas.)

title: Shopping
review: Great location food music and shopping what can I say people are great I went around 9pm just after checking in the hotel after my flight it was a nice spot and food was good

title: Shopping, eating and a view!
review: Yes, there are shops that you can see anywhere but there some nice local shops with fun things to buy. Local clothing, jewelry, and art. The Hard Rock Cafe is there along with other big names like Hooters and Bubba Gump. It is outdoors with lots of places for shade and drinks to listen to music. Overall, a nice place.

title: Meh - if you like the bus tour vibe.....
review: Shopping experience paying homage to Pete Seeger's song 'Little Boxes' - ticky-tacky.  Adjacent to Bayfront Park - the park itself is nice.  As well as a parking garage that wanted $20 flat fee - really??  If you're stuck in a hotel nearby and afraid to go out into the city, maybe.  You're with a crowd of teens or just want to act like one - overexcited, loud and 'dying for a drink', sure.  Otherwise, skip.

title: Great place
review: Love Bayside, this is a great place to spend your day. Take a boat trip, speed boat , or pleasure boat, lots of shops to browse. And loads of really good restaurants to eat in, or just take a drink,and enjoy the place.

title: very cool museum
review: I definitely recommend this museum. We did it in about an hour, but there are a few short films that we didn't watch completely and they would add time to your visit.

title: Sociological Judaism
review: 3) The museum is understandably focused on Miami Beach.  But aside from an excellent timeline near the entrance, there's almost nothing on Jews in Florida outside of the Miami area.  It could be called the Jewish Museum of Miami.

title: Great walking tour
review: We just did the Jewish Walking Tour of Miami Beach with Howard and had a great time. We learned a lot about Jewish history in Miami Beach and really enjoyed seeing the different architectural building styles. I highly recommend this tour for anyone who is interested in Jewish history in Miami Beach.

title: ENTERTAINING AND INFORMATIVE
review: The museum located in Downtown Miami Beach. It is an Old Synagogue in Miami Beach. It tells the story of the Jewish People in the State of Florida. It talks about everything from RESTRICTED DEEDS, NOT ALLOWING JEWS TO RENT, OR BUY PROPERTY to how the community came about.

title: Highly recommended!
review: I visited the museum with my partner for the first time and had a wonderful walking tour. It was very informative and interesting. Plus the museum had several great exhibits so that was fun as well. If you've got the time and want to learn about local Jewish history, I would definitely recommend visiting!

title: Shopping
review: Long indoor and outdoor shopping plaza with many restaurants on the water. There is live music and lots of bars. There is an option to go on a big pirate ship. I was met with a lot of friendly people there and I recommend going here for a day trip!

title: Very, very worthwhile
review: Came on this by accident - walking tour met in the building; I had not knowledge of the place.  Wow - what a treat.  Give yourself at least two hours; three would be better.  Encompassing a wide range of deco and streamline modern objects, appliances, furniture, posters, artifacts, etc., you really want to try and get inside the mind of the man behind all this.  I left at closing without time to chat up the gift store people who might have provided a clue, but the exhibits themselves are top notch.  Not crowded at all, plenty of time for photos - a few marred by glass cases obscuring what might otherwise have been left on full view, but then I suppose that creates security problems or high cost for smaller items.  Still a great collection, and a much better sampling than you find in major museums that just don't focus on this era.

title: A Gem
review: I really had to laugh at the reviews that said how they "didn't get it."  If they expected to see Old Masters paintings, they should try the Met, because they definitely came to the wrong place.

title: Small intimate museum, great find.
review: You always need to check out local museums when on vacation. You can get through this museum in an hour if you are quick. Great eclectic exhibits. There are 5 levels to walk through. The Hitler/nazi exhibit was very disturbing but interesting, then you have a whole level of cartoons. Everyone needs to spend time to expand their knowledge.

title: The super RIch Live here!
review: Saw this while on a boat tour in Miami. They have their own zip code and you can only get their by boat!

title: Nice place for the day
review: You can take your boat here or ferry in and rent a golf cart and check out this little island off of Miami Beach Marina

title: Lively music and great people watching!
review: Took a walk down by the Bayside and stumbled on this wonderful marketplace! There was a live band playing and people dancing and enjoying the gorgeous weather! Plenty of places to eat and shop!

title: Bayside marvelous
review: So much fun to go to when visiting Miami. Great atmosphere!!! Load music bunch of outdoor bars that serve frozen drinks. Right on water so u can walk around have a drink dance a little and shop. Also many fancier restaurants as well. You'll definitely have a fun time.

title: Great Bar at Bayside Marketplace in Miami
review: We stopped at Segafredo Zanetti’s for a drink.  Stayed for a while.    Eric and Edwin are really great bartenders.  Enjoyed watching them make specialty drinks and chatting.  We had a fantastic time.

title: Lunch and shopping
review: Plenty of restaurants with good food and good service. Victoria's Secret store iz AMAZING!!! Definitely recommend :)

title: Great place
review: This is a great place to go, lots of shops, food, music.. perfect if you're staying across the street at the hotels when you're waiting for a cruise.

title: Marvellous walking tour
review: Happened upon the museum online and today’s walking tour of south beach area and its Jewish history. Really excellent walking tour conducted by H. Many thanks

title: Excellent historical walking tour
review: Part of the museum was closed for repair. The video presentation in the museum was very good and worthwhile. I’d give the museum 4 stars but the walking tour deserves 5.

title: This was a delightful museum
review: Surprising the amount of fascinating information found here. I am not Jewish and found this educational and beautiful. The place is full of history most know nothing about. A real hidden treasure. A strong salute to the LBGT community as well

title: Take the historical walking tour of Miami Beach after visiting the museum
review: Spent part of our day visiting this historic former synagogue and learning about the Jewish history of Miami Beach.  We watched a video presentation, viewed the artifacts and pictures, and went on an excellent walking tour of the area learning about the people, their stories, and the architecture of the time.  Delightful presentation by our guide Howard who can answer all your questions.  Allow yourself at least an hour and a half for the walking tour itself.  The museum is self-guided and takes about 45 minutes.

title: More interesting if you’re Jewish!
review: I was in and out in 20 minutes, just before one of the many coach parties descended.

title: Beautiful island but not public
review: This place is beautiful. It's a real escape but the challenging part is finding a way to get access to it.

title: Bring Your Black Card!
review: Construction of Fisher Island began in 1919 when Carl G. Fisher, a land developer, purchased the property from businessman and real estate developer Dana A. Dorsey, southern Florida's first African-American millionaire.  It is the land of the rich and famous and the rich and anonymous.  The price to live here is beyond the grasp of most, however, the hotel is within budget with your Black Card.  Accessible only by ferry boat, it is an amazing place to  experience!

title: little heaven
review: Used to live there, I enjoyed how close to everything you can be but at the same time far away from traffic and noise. A little paradise in the middle of the city.

title: Very knowledgeable tour guide. Loved all the interactions with the animals!! Great place.
review: A group of friends, myself and two children went on a Sunday. We had a blast! We are definitely animal lovers and getting to pet the monkeys/ baby lion and other various animals was a life long dream! Thank you all for your knowledge and friendliness.

title: Great experience worth the money!
review: What an incredible experience! Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and accommodating to everyone. The tour was above and beyond what I expected, we were able to get so close to the animals. The interactive portion was perfect for our family. My step-daughter overcame her fear and touched a snake, seeing monkeys climb on my husbands head was hilarious and being able to touch a lion cub was a dream of mine since being a small child. I will definitely be going back for the feline encounter at some point.

title: Animal Encounters
review: The guides were knowledgeable and personable. The special wildlife encounter with all of the cubs and monkeys was well worth the money. The quaintness of the facility is perfect size for the animal interactions. I will definitely be a return customer.

title: Neat outdoor mall, but not for me
review: Neat outdoor mall with tons of shops and music. The sales clerks were friendly but pushy. The music was very nice - live music playing in the center of the mall.

title: Great place
review: Love this place...lots of boats trips to choose from, speed boats, sightseeing trips, even a pirate boat. Lots of restaurants, right on the waterfront...great shops to browse...a very good day out.

title: Best food court ever
review: Food court has varieties of buffet and line up restaurant and bars has plenty of cuisines from around the globe. Annoying tour package sellers though.

title: Huge market with a Caribbean and cuban ambiance.
review: The market is filled with souvenir shops, restaurants, boats and yachts. It's a good spot to visit when in Miami. So many tourists. It's a good place to hangout. The 45 minutes thriller speedboat ride is WOOOOW!

title: Jewish walking tour
review: The walking tour starts inside the museum, which always has excellent art shows in addition to history of Florida Jews who settled in Miami Beach, and walks about a 10 block rectangle indicating the background of particular buildings and the history of the Jews who developed them. Howard is a remarkable guide, concise and informative, with an excellent speaking style. He also brings copies of photos of the old timers who founded south beach and the original buildings that still stand today. Did you know the world famous restaurant joes stone crab was founded by joe Weiss and his wife? Or that Miami Beach wasn’t even incorporated until 1915 and at its height in the 1960’s Jews constituted over 60% of the population? We learned so much on the walking tour and at the museum. A definite must while in south beach.

title: Fabulous walking tour of Jewish Miami!
review: I highly recommend doing this walking tour! What a wonderful way to spend a Sunday morning. Howard's in-depth knowledge, love of history and friendly personality made for a great experience of walking back in time to learn how Jewish involvement in Miami evolved over the decades. A highlight of our trip!

title: Well Worth the Time
review: Not being a local, or even  Floridian, I wasn’t sure what to expect when my wife and I visited.  But my grandparents were snowbirds for more than a few years back in the day and so I was curious.  We spent several very interesting hours first with a great guided tour and then on our own.  The staff were friendly and informative and the displays beautifully organized.  Thanks to the folks that helped to memorialize the growth of a vital and vibrant Jewish presence!

title: An insight into discrimination
review: My sparse knowledge of Jews in FLorida propelled me to give the museum a go.   The film is a must see as it provides a good history of the discrimination of jews in Florida and highlights their influence on the state's development

title: Definitely worth a visit
review: This was a fantastic museum.  We had a guide named Linda who was so knowledgeable about all the exhibits.  She made it a wonderful experience with interesting stories of the extraordinary families that contributed to building of Miami.  It would not be the Miami of today without the investment and hard work of the Jewish immigrants who came to this land for a better future.   Strongly recommend that you take some time to visit this museum.  It will give you a better appreciation of Miami for sure!

title: Cruse tour
review: I enjoyed my boat ride with nonstop laughs the crew member was so funny and made sure everyone was able to get good pictures

title: Chimp Experience!
review: This was my first time at ZWF and it won't be my last. Limbani is so cute. He is an adorable 3 year old chimp. ZWF is awesome!

title: Absolutely amazing!
review: I highly recommend a visit, it is well worth it.

title: Huge exhibit
review: This show is stunning. It is too large to cover in one day. The vibe is international with galleries from all over the world and all sorts of modern art from sculpture to painting to film, etc. It is amazing to see what creative minds can produce.

title: Full spectrum art exhibit
review: Finally, scheduled to attend this festival after hearing about it for many years. I’m very happy I made it happen. I attended the Context and Spectrum shows on separate days. The vastness of the exhibits, and the fact that they are spread out across the city is impressive. It’s overwhelming in a good way. If you up to a lot of walking, you are in for a treat. I enjoyed speaking with the artists, and taking in some very interesting pieces. I also, spent a night enjoying some of many block parties occurring throughout the city. It was nice to see both locals and international folks really enjoying this event. I will definitely try to attend in future years.

title: Art Overload
review: I overloaded on art in and around the convention center.  Lots of traffic around the area, too, which sucks!  But once you get in, the art will calm you down.

title: Be Sure Not to Miss the Experience ...
review: This is a must do experience, most especially if you appreciate art and partying with artist ! I most especially enjoyed SCOPE and the PAMM. It’s simply an amazing time to be in Miami !!!

title: Beautiful Stores & Restaurants on Biscayne Bay
review: If you're looking for a beautiful seaside setting to shop and eat and listen to live music, this is the place to be in Miami.  It is touristic but locals go too.  You will also have an array of waterway tours to pick from to see Miami from the water.  I suggest the jet boats. Only slight drawback is that parking is a little expensive.

title: One of the best part of Miami.
review: Bayside Marketplace is an excellent place who wants to buy souvenir, clothes, or even Coconut drink! The place has a good vibe too. Most of the Boat Tours are depart from there. If you have some hours in Miami, definitely go there.

title: The heart of Miami lives in Bayside
review: No trip to Miami would be complete without a visit to Bayside Marketplace ~ The people, The music, The food all come to life here along its walkways and along its amazing water views! Parking is available and easily accessible. You can do a lot here or you can simply find a table and chair and do as little as you wish ~ whatever you decide ~ Experience what this delightful area has to offer and like us you'll be coming back time after time to relive it all over again!

title: Port worthy
review: This is a great spot to spend the day.  It has everything you could want, shopping, restaurants and bars.  This little port offers boat rides around the port and even to the Bahamas.

title: Amazing Walking Tour!
review: We went on a walking tour at the Jewish Museum of Florida on Thurs 10/25 led by Howard. It was so much fun and so informative! It was our first day of our trip to Miami Beach and it was great to walk around and get to know the neighborhood a bit better while learning so much about Jewish history. Howard is incredibly knowledgeable and has curated a comprehensive tour with historic images that correlate to each landmark. We got to explore the museum as well and visit the gift shop which has many beautiful things.

title: Outstanding Visit
review: Not only standing in an actual 1929 building with such a rich history was a remarkable experience, but the overall atmosphere made our outing even more relevant when a FIU docent volunteer so graciously walked us through the exhibits.  The visit was worthwhile in so many areas. It inspired us indeed!

title: Included walking tour of Jewish Miami.
review: Small but interesting with knowledgeable docent. Mayer Lansky stained glass window. Gift Shop, small free parking lot.

title: Walking Tour
review: Mark Gordon's walking tour of Jewish history in south beach was awesome. He is knowledgeable of Jewish life in the area as well as informed of the historic art deco architecture in the area. He provided a lively interactive experience. Not to be missed

title: Understand the history of Jews in miami
review: Great review of the the history culture and contributions he’s made to south Florida. Museum is house in home if earliest congregation in Miami and shows contributing individuals that were major factors in early South Florida real estate and business development

title: Amazing Market
review: We did the cruise and visited the market where we had a delicious lunch and bought some souvenirs. Too many shops and you are spoilt for choice. Very interesting.

title: A great time to visit Miami
review: There is more art than one person can see.  Multiple venues all around the city.  Scope is my favorite because you can see newer artists at more reasonable prices if you are looking to buy.

title: Small but perfectly formed
review: Greta place for lunch before getting the bus to the airport. Loads of food court to choose from , freshly prepared and reasonably priced.

title: Interesting place
review: You can find all kinds of souvenirs from Miami. Some good coffees. A place to sit down and listen to life musik. Also the tourist boats to see Miami by sea are around.

title: My monthly trip to Bayside
review: I live right across the street and I normally walk over about once a month. While the place needs to be updated a bit, it is a great neighborhood shopping place. Good food, nice atmosphere, with fishing and pleasure boats to take a ride on if you want to. The cigar store is really great and the owner is always a pleasure to visit with. He has cigars from all over...check this place out of you are a cigar smoker. You can then walk to Bayfront Park...the area is very nice and safe.

title: Great for tourists
review: Great restaurants and shops.  I took a trip on a boat and saw sights and stars houses.  Very nice and a good price for about a 2 hour tour.

title: Nothing special
review: Lots of open air junk stores and crumby restaurants, very disappointing and a waste of time, don’t waste your time.

title: An enlightening look at Jewish history in Florida
review: From the helpful and welcoming cashier to the docent giving an overview of the history of the development of the musuem, this was a most worthwhile visit.  Recommended to anyone interested in the influence of the Jewish community in south Florida.

title: Great Walking Tour Of Jewish South Beach
review: The museum regularly arranges Jewish Miami Beach walking tours.  The guide who runs the tours was absolutely great.  So knowledgeable both about the history of the Jews of Miami and also the architecture of South Beach.  We had a great time, learn't a lot and had a few surprises along the way about jewish Miami/Florida history.  You also get Museum entry with the ticket and there is a really good permanent exhibition there and some good visiting exhibitions.  I would really recommend the walking tour and the museum in general.

title: Suberb and unique tour
review: Our family was lucky enough to have Howard, as our guide. He was so knowledgeable and answered all of our questions. We spent a lovely Sunday afternoon with him, the food was great and the tour was even better. We loved learning about all the Jewish history in our own backyard that you couldn't read in a textbook. Such a pleasure to see the roots of Miami Beach by walking in front of it. Highly recommend this to everyone of all ages. Its truly a unique view of South Beach. The museum is also lovely, and worth a few hours of your time.

title: Terrific History Museum
review: We loved this museum, lots of personal stories of Jews in Florida, how the state and region developed, lots of memorabilia, in an old synagogue, art deco district.

title: Great tour of Jewish South Beach
review: I learned so much in this thoughtful tour, including history of the people, their businesses, and their social and religious life. Saw important Jewish landmarks. The guide, Howard, told us fascinating stories. Also enjoyed visiting the museum after. I highly recommend this tour!

title: Nice experience with the animals
review: Nice shows, good animators. Unfortunatelly the killer whale was closed and the entry is not cheap but we liked that. Our 1,5 year old sun liked the playground more than the showes

title: Good to spend  few hours
review: There's a good selection of shops and restaurants. The hop on hop off buses stop here so it's easy to get to. You can take a site seeing boat trip from here.  There are also boats offering fishing trips.

title: Pre Cruise Visit in Miami
review: My husband stayed overnight in Miami prior to sailing out on cruise vacation. The Bayside Market was fabulous! The food and the atmosphere was awesome! Some of the best Mojitos I have ever had!

title: Beautiful setting but OK shops.  Don't make a special trip!
review: Shopping wise way over hyped!  Usual beach ocean mall.  Spread out.  Clean with nice views and restaurants.  Most people were getting boats, tourists or picking up tours.  Beautiful setting and views.  Clean.  Quite quiet.  Do not make a special trip otherwise.  Free wifi did not work.  You get the infrequent 120 bus from South Beach or a taxi.

title: Excellent place to take your girlfriend to walk
review: Good restaurants and a nice view of the Miami Bayside. Many hotels are just few steps ahead, as well as many stores for shopping.

title: Busy touristy but fun
review: This is a different type of mall with embroidery and 3d pictures it is geared at the gift and tourist market. Its less geared towards “real” clothing and more the novelty market but that makes it a fun change from the other malls which are all the same.

title: Beautiful synagogue
review: This free attraction is a real gem. We spent an hour looking at the displays and liked the special exhibitions about Torah pointers and art works. There is a shop and small cafe. Friendly volunteers.

title: Wonderful Gem!
review: I highly recommend the Jewish Museum of Florida.

title: Fantastic place to learn about the role  and impact of Miami's Jewish Community
review: We had a wonderful visit to the Museum and on arrival were told that we would have a guide to take us round the exhibits. Jorge brought the whole place to life and punctuated the tour with fascinating insights and stories based on some of his own, and others experiences. The exhibits were well laid out and informative and the buildings - 2 ex-synagogues were superb with amazing stained glass windows (one donated by Meyer Lansky who used to be a member) and original art deco light fittings. This is a must visit attraction. A few days later we went on a walking tour led by Howard, of jewish Miami Beach. Howard did a great job and made it a really enjoyable tour which lasted about 2 hours.

title: Jewish walking tour
review: We had an absolutely amazing tour with Howard Mayer. He knew so much about Miami Beach’s connection to the Jewish community that started there up to today’s latest restraunteurs and real estate moguls. He was also very knowledgeable in the Art Deco architecture and filled us in on little details about this. It was fun being a tourist in my own home town. Now I love Miami Beach even more!!!

title: Colony Theater review
review: The Colony theater is a beautiful facility where I was able to watch several movie screenings. I was impressed by the comfortable seating and sound quality of the theater. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Overrated, very expensive beer, nice view
review: However, I do recommend the speed boat trip outside of the Miami coast line. it departs from bayside marketplace. Tickets can be bought online or on site.

title: Shopping and food, not much else
review: As a native of Baltimore, this place reminded me of Harborplace.  Shopping and restaurants, with some boat tours and that's about it.  Nothing here you can't find at any mall or open air shopping center.  Location is good.

title: Shopping
review: Rode are bikes to Bayside, lots of dining options. Multiple choices for boating tours to choose from. Plus shopping.

title: Stroll the afternoon away
review: Delightful small stores to wander in and out if. Open air area which makes it even more fun with smaller vendors outside with their delights. Easy, fun way to rest the Sunday afternoon.

title: Hard  rock cafe Miami Bayside
review: Best of all , the huge guitar Repositioned on the top Of the Hard Rock café, is something that give a magic touch to Miami Bay  Side Area making the place unique , a must to visit if you are in the city .

title: Penguin Encounter!🐧💙
review: Overall, it was a great time and we enjoyed the shows, penguin interaction, and exhibits

title: A good history of the Jews in Miami.
review: The guide was very knowledgeable and took time to explain to several non-Jewish visitors about the symbolism of Jewish house of worship.  No one felt rushed.  The tour took about 70 minutes and was well worth our time.

title: Bygone era of Jewish South Beach
review: The museum itself is small and limited in its displays, but nonetheless interesting and worth the time.

title: Jewish Museum of Florida
