review: Worthwhile visit for all religions and fsiths.

title: Don't forget who made the beach
place: Saint Francis de Sales Catholic Church
review: The title of this review is their motto and I love it.  Rarely have I found a more welcoming and relaxed community.  I am a newcomer to town and have already made a few friends from the congregation.  Love the down home and straightforward sermons.

title: Amateur hour
review: Most of the shows we have seen here have been like an Amateur Hour performance, low budget and low talent.  A French revue had 4 or 5 performers of dubitable quality.  An opera performance featured a motley chorus that was mostly offkey.  Of course, it's inexpensive, so I guess you get what you pay for.

title: We had a blast!
review: You can make reservations on line or at the ticket window.  The price of the Encounter includes the park entrance.  It is all well worth it.  A thrilling experience and a lot of fun.  A memory to last for many years.

title: Great location, not so great everything else.
review: If you are on the HOHO buses this is a close location for a quick bite to eat with a beautiful view.  Other than that, not worth making a special stop.

title: Chili's
review: We had a great time, our waitress was excellent and the food was great. We had so many drinks that I lost count and the bill was still reasonable.

title: Great Shopping
review: Great located, plenty of good options for shopping, open until late, variety of restaurants being one indoor brazilian upstairs amazing and at a worthy price. Perfect to spend all day here between walking, eating, drinking and shopping!

title: Not much there, park outside of the market
review: For the most part this is shopping with places to eat.  Nothing special about the shopping, we did eat there and it was good, nothing to make you return.  This is the location for numerous boat sight seeing tours.  You will pay to park, in the market garage it is $20 for 2 hours, at the city lots on the street $10 for 2 hours. Unless your taking a harbor boat tour skip it.

title: Great views but terrible restaurants and shops
review: If you come to Miami, I suppose you should go to Bayside marketplace.  Nice views of the bay, marina and port. However, the buildings are old and dirty.  Restaurants are very poor, drinks are watered down, foodcourt is dingy, shops are old and crappy.  If not for the views, I would give it a one star rating.  This is also the place to catch the hop on hop off buses and there are nice boat tours of the bay. City of Miami needs to close this down and upgrade everything

title: Dirty,abandoned place.Settings are in horrible state
review: In the following photos you can see the dirt

title: Walking Tour of South Beach
review: Starting inside the two beautifully preserved synagogues, we joined our knowledgeable guide Howard for the walking tour of South Beach. Howard definitely arrived prepared with historical photos and interesting facts spanning the development of this portion of South Beach.  Loved his presentation which included the 3 A's propelling the development of the area, people involved, buildings and of course, the color palettes that visually brought national attention to the Art Deco district. *If interested, he also offers this tour incorporating food.

title: Interesting place, knowledgeable staff
review: The reason I gave 4 stars is that the demo of the MONAD Studio 3D-printed objects, which is supposed to be music, was quite loud and disturbing at times, playing something one doubtedly calls music.

title: Small but mighty
review: In the permanent exhibit space, The Jewish Museum of Florida addresses the arrival of Jews to the state of Forida, primarily. It is presented in chronological order and helps to demonstrate the variety of reasons that they came to the state and the variety of backgrounds, as well. There is a fun "scavenger hunt" for children to complete and a prize for them upon completion.  It is not a particularly interactive Museum--lots to read and lots to see though.  Several artifacts related to Jewish holidays and traditions are present. There is a temporary exhibit space and appears to present items of interest that go beyond Florida. This is a rather small space. If you're a fast reader, you'll be done in an hour or so. You will have more interest in the subject matter if you are from Florida. But, nonetheless, it is an interesting venue for those with an interest in Judaica.  Nice little gift shop offers a variety of items.

title: Katryna is the best!!!
review: Visited last Sunday, service was excellent. Katryna absolutely murdered it. Best spot to hang out ever!!

title: Not at all what was advertised!!
review: When we arrived we really thought it was someone's house that was just fenced off with lots of overgrown vegetation! No parking lot, you just pull off the sides of the road! Keeping open minds we still were excited and wanted to experience the park after reading all the things to do at this park. The admissions office is literally a delopitated shed, ok still trying to be positive! Before purchasing our tickets we started asking about all the hands on experiences that they advertise and guess what, for various excuses not one of them was available!! Oh but we could still pay full price and go in, ummm no thank you!! Dont do it!!

title: Average a fun show (5) with poor service (1) for 3 stars
review: Someone (NOT Ticketmaster) lost my PAID "will call" order. If I hadn't brought my receipt, who knows whether they would have let me in!  As it was, I had to do some firm talking. Each live show may be handled on a case by case basis, so don't let that deter you. The actual show (Shlomo,The Soul Doctor) was so much fun!  The facility was comfortable and I liked the Art Deco styling. The theater is right on the Lincoln pedestrian mall, which is convenient for making an evening of it.

title: Extraordinary venue
review: One of the rare places in Miami dedicated to non commercial, artistic and simply good shows. They also hold few festivals every year.

title: I don't want you to know about this place
review: I love going to shows here and having great seats for good prices. I want to support the Colony but don't want more people to go because it's so special.

title: Day excursion
review: It was ok. The orca and dolphin show was great. The manatees were interesting and they had a great group of parrots.

title: Good for young kids
review: Good day at the Seaquarium - they are mostly about conservation and rescue so the shows aren't very exciting if you've been to Sea World.  Great military discount.  The sea lion show was the best of all the shows during the day.

title: Swim or Sink with the Dolphins?
review: For years swimming with the dolphins was on my bucket list. As a surprise for our grandsons I decided to book a swim. At $240 a head plus a mark up for my husband and son in law to watch it cost over $900. A bit steep but was willing to pay for the experience. The hairs on the back of my neck stood up when they told me we were going to do 'picture time'. Part of the 'experience' is wasted on them taking pictures to sell you at outrageous prices. And when I asked if my husband could stand behind us to get the pictures on our phone he was denied. For the price of $240 a head they should give you a free picture or allow your family member the same access to take your picture. Or get rid of the photographer completely. That is not why I was there. Ruined my experience.

title: Awesome Experience
review: What an amazing family experience during our visit to Miami from New Jersey! We enjoyed all the wildlife and shows! Grecia Z was an amazing staff member and went above and beyond to explain about the history of the park and how to navigate through the parks and shows! Thank you Grecia Z!

title: Dolphin Encounter/ Waste of Money
review: Took our big group with kids who were very excited to swim with dolphins. Not at  all what we expected. Rushed through our experience. Our trainer was not very friendly. Kids were disappointed. At one point during her ride on the dolphin,  one of the young girls was told  that if she if didn't get it right this time she wouldn't get to go at all! REALLY? That is why we came and what we paid for. I thought she might cry. I was able to talk her through it since her Mom was already at the other end. Unacceptable to talk to children like that. Help them figure it out. That is your job. My other problem with this encounter is that we didn't get to see our dolphins do any tricks like jump, wave, dance or anything. We got photos kissing and holding it's fin. Then swimming with it. Then while we looking at photos, I happened to look out and watch the group after us, and they were getting what seemed like to me the whole experience. The dolphins were interacting with them by jumping in the air, dancing, waving and splashing them. Wow what a total different encounter! Wish ours was like that. Our kids may have enjoyed it more. I feel like I wasted my money! Then I get inside to be gouged on photos. What a joke. I guess the worst part is when I asked to speak to a supervisor only to be told there wasn't one available? Huh? Ok that is weird. I did talk to someone who gave me a manager's email. Not sure what good that will do. I feel like you need to work on your whole dolphin encounter and your customer service. We had a group of 7. So we spent a lot of money to be disappointed. My daughter and I have done this before in Grand Cayman,  and it was superb compared to yours. I personally would never recommend this to anyone.

title: South Beach Jewish Walking/ Food Tour
review: I would recommend the varied tours run through the Jewish Museum.  Both the young teens and the grandparents had a great time.

title: FLORIDA JEWISH HISTORY
review: An excellent walk through the history of Jews and their influence on the growth of Florida. A  very worthwhile trip to South Beach.

title: A hidden jem. It's A restored Temple, museum and a cafe.
review: The cafe has great lunches. (see photo)

title: Awesome experience
review: Wharf has the best environment and hands down best service. I love it here! Great drinks awesome music and the coolest people come by here. I've always had a good time at this bar, and enjoyed the cocktails. But Hector was an awesome bartender that was really engaging and definitely made my night. Thank you!

title: Very Trendy Spot that's Friendly to Kids
review: It's a really cool place, but parking was difficult to find. But once you go there it's really a trendy little spot that you can take very instagram-worthy photos. Once I entered the guy there told me that kids can stay until 6; after that it's adults only. Nevertheless, it was a wonderful time, though my kids got a little bored because the table tennis tables were occupied as were the other lawn games. The food is delicious (albeit a little pricey) and they offer a good variety of food and drinks.

title: Fun & Educational
review: This is one of our favorite rehab/rescue in South Florida.  They provide a sanctuary for the animals, many of whom cannot be released back into the wild after rehabilitation.  Very clean. They are working on building larger habitats. The educational presentation is always a must see.

title: You can't hug a kangaroo anymore
review: You can't hug a kangaroo anymore they need to change sign main reason we went was for kangaroo interaction... the hurricanes has the place a lil messy but great place to go

title: Family fun
review: Me and my family had some time to  spend before heading to the airport for our flight back home after our cruise vacation so we decided to take our son to the Miami Seaquarium he just love the animal shows and overall a great experience we got to take a photo with a dolphin and made memories that will last a lifetime the staff was very nice and helpful  if you get too hot you can cool down in one of the gift shop areas or sit in one of the restaurants for lunch Overall great experience for young children and people of all ages they also had place to store our luggage as we take Uber and don’t drive so that was very helpful

title: Very good way to spend the day.
review: This place is a lot of fun and the animals do some amazing things. It is always great to see Flipper! The whale looks sad though. I do hate seeing any animal in captivity but the workers seem to really care about the animals.

title: Rained
review: Dolphin, killer whale and sea lion shows were excellent

title: Mostly average exhibits. Please read the entire review
review: No, I am not PETA and yes there were parts of the Seaquarium we enjoyed. I won't be back for the simple fact of the condition of the manatees, dolphins, and orca.

title: Very entertaining and lots of exploration
review: Lots of interaction with the animals and very recommended for any ages.  Great place and amazing people doing a fantastic job

title: Not what I expected but a nice visit
review: After spending about an hour there, I didn't think it was worth $18.

title: A reconstructed old sinagogue converted in a museum
review: It show the story of the jew in Miami. the first sinagogue and the life then and today. An exhibition of clothes was shown at present.

title: "Hot Couture"
review: a very interesting and colorful exhibit of the "indelible footprint" the Floridian Jews left on the garment industry

title: Educational
review: This museum clearly traces the history of the Jewish people in Florida and more specifically in Southern Florida. Housed as it is in two former synagogues is most appropriate.  While there, if available, include a walking tour with Howard Brayer which adds entire dimension to the experience.

title: Really Interesting
review: Really interesting museum.  Tells the story of Jews in S. Florida.  Surprisingly not what you would expect.  Great judaica store with some fun and unique items.  Also they do tours of Jewish South Beach and revolving exhibitions.

title: One stop shop till’ you drop!
review: Visited multiple times in our comings! The social atmosphere is heightened with good music, drinks, views, games(ping pong, bags, big jenga, etc.), food trucks, and beautiful people! The mobile bathroom facilities are even cleaner/nicer than other nearby areas, haha! I never want to leave on every visit!

title: Friends brunch
review: Amazing time. Love the $50 Moet bottles. Staff was great! Remember Lauren (hostess) especially she went out of her way to make us comfortable aka fan on a kinda hot day. Salty donuts onsite saved our life... ️️️️️

title: Loved it!
review: Tickets are very affordable. Great place to come to get closer interactions with animals than you would at the local zoo. The safari has a very unique variety of animals! Also the staff is very informative of all the animals shown during presentation.

title: Hidden Gem
review: We visited on Mother's Day.  Had the first "ITS tour" at 10am.  I was blown away!  Chris was our personal guide to the animals, he was full of information and helped us hold, touch pet tons of animals. We started with the wolves, they are so fabulous. I could not believe how sweet they were, and the large black male was so mischievous and funny.  Then we moved on to the pups. Energetic fur balls that snuggled and climbed in your lap.  They were adorable.  Then on to feed porcupine babies and pet them.  Then we fed hot dogs to the adolescent gators.  The power of those jaws!  Then we fed, rubbed and held a baby sloth.  Then we held a beautiful crested cockatoo.  She was very attentive and danced, kissed and fanned her head feathers all while sitting gently on our arms.  Then we fed goats, ponies and donkeys.  Then to the show!  Tarantulas, frogs, snakes, alligators, chinchillas, opossum, an adult sloth and a baby kangaroo rounded out the line up.  Best value for your money!  Schedule the ITS tour it is so worth every penny

title: awesome
review: this is an awesome place, you and your kids can interact with animals,feed them,and spend time with them,the shows are amazing,the staff is really nice.we hd a wonderful time.

title: Deplorable conditions for animals
review: I can not believe this place is allowed to be open let alone have animals. The condition of the cages and enclosures were deplorable. It looks as if they haven't been cleaned in months. I have been to many rehabilitation and sanctuaries for animals and I have never seen anything this bad. The water the alligators are in is completely green. Some of the other tanks for turtles and fish were also green and could barely see through it. One of the pigs had a huge soar on its leg which was bright red and full of bugs. Another donkey or pony had the same issue. I felt so bad for these animals. They were probably rescued or surrendered from bad living conditions and are forced to live in another disgraceful place. If they cannot properly care for the animals they should surrender them to a place that can.

title: Mixed place to visit
review: Would ultimately recommend this but your wallet won’t thank you - hence the none 5 star review

title: Fun and educational site
review: I came here for the first time when my son was 1 year. And here we are again. My son is 15 now and my daughter is 10. This place is not changed a lot. The show were so nice and giving a lot of informations about sea life. My kids enjoyed a lot.

title: Overpriced!
review: I'm not going to get into how sad is to see those highly intelligent mammals being forced to perform for us....yes, they are forced...they are not happy, specially the killer whale. What will also leave you sad is the prices you have to pay to see these "attractions", the food, the parking, the photo, everything is overpriced guys...you know better that this, avoid this place at all cost.

title: Day visit...
review: Visited this place in April 2019. Used Groupon. Would have been disappointed if I had to pay full prices. There are 4 shows lasting 10-20 minutes each. Fairly good. 2 of them being dolphin shows. The place definitely needs a facelift.  Food is pricey ($4 for a bottle of water; $28 for a cheese pizza pie). They do a good job laying out the schedule as soon as you walk in. You can be done with this place in 3-4 hours if you plan well. One time visit.

title: Good work being done here
review: Small park compared to some. Great shows ongoing. Good Flamingo exhibit - happy for that since the hurricane 1.5 years ago chased most away in the wild. They are doing good work here rehabilitating Manatees who have been injured in the wild. Fish tank has a barracuda that looks ferocious.

title: Know the animals first hand
review: This place is not a zoo, is more a farm where they love animals and make people love animals. it does not have a great infrastructure, it does not have great attractions but they really care for animals. Do not miss the exhibition when animal keepers explain all the animals and allow you to touch them and to take care of them. Finally, get to touch and pet the wolves and the kangaroo.

title: Fun place to hang out
review: This is not our first time at the Wharf. We go quite often on the weekends because it's a lot of fun. Different age groups are there and sometimes even their pets. We ordered Lobster Roll with Fries. It was very good. Our server was very attentive despite the big crowds.  Prices are reasonable. We had a good time.

title: Cool spot in Brickell
review: Cool place to go hangout with friends on the weekends. Very laid back and relaxing. We loved the music, great selection of food, and not to mention fantastic bay view. Came there with friends and our bartender Hector made some delicious drinks! Definitely a spot to visit when in Brickell.

title: Great service
review: Lovely, my family and I had such a great time. Mayte was our waitress and she was gave us such good service would definitely recommend

title: Definetly recommend
review: Great place, Mayte was a great server and gave us great recommendations about the place and the city, would definitely come back! Great work!

title: Unmistakably Cool
review: It seems to cater to all ages, though it is dominated by the young to be sure.  If you're looking for someplace unique to party, this is it.

title: Hands on animal and wolf encounter
review: This is our third trip to Safari  Edventure and let me say it gets better each time! My family members are animal lovers so this is a must do when they visit from New Jersey. The animals are loved by the caretakers and most are rescues that makes it more special. The show was both informative and fun. They are very knowledgeable and patient. This is the closest expierience that anyone can get to a sloth, kangaroo, etc. . The wolf encounter is always one of my favorite , but this visit was even more special. The Wolves had two litters of pups and the highlight was holding and snuggling with them. We fell in love with them. My family loved the expierence.  If you are on the fence about going go sooner than later while they pups are ready for handling..... if your like me wear sneakers. I will absolutely return........

title: Adorable adventure
review: Well being there twice, once with my lady and once with grand kids my lady and her daughter and son-in -law and enjoying both visits. It is a very rustic cute experience. The help are very knowledgeable and engaging. They teach you about different animals and even let you touch some during a introduction. It is a worth while place to visit

title: Such a fun unique experience
review: Went to safari edventure for the "in the scenes" tour with my sister whose favorite animal is the sloth. (So as you can imagine we were there specifically for the sloth. lol) they advised us upon arrival that sometimes the sloth doesn't feel like being held and hands on interaction isn't guaranteed but regardless we would be able to visit the sloth. Lauren was our tour guide and she was amazing! Super informative and friendly. But of course the sloth wasn't feeling it this morning. Glen, who I believe is the owner came to check on us and knowing that my sister loved sloths and was there specifically for him told us to come find him after our tour and if the sloth was feeling more friendly later he would bring us back to the sloth exhibit. So we went along with our tour, fed gators, emus, porcupine and had hands on interaction with wolves and their pups! So cool! After finishing our tour we were given livestock food to feed the goats and horses. So as we're feeding the animals Glen went out of his way to track us down because Merlin the sloth was feeling friendly! It was such an amazing experience but the customer service they provided (while respecting and loving their animals) was above and beyond. We definitely recommend this place and will be visiting again with friends.

title: Fun
review: This was a fun place to go! We used Groupon and at a discounted price of 29 per adult, we both felt it was a great and fair value as a few areas and most food venues were closed. We spent about 4.5 hours there and saw so much! The shows were educational and fun to watch. We both loved this experience and recommend it highly for at or about the price we paid. Plenty of cool mist cooling stations and opportunities to interact with animals. We agreed when we return to Miami, we would visit Miami Seaquarium again. Great place for kids too.

title: Miami Seaquarium needs resources
review: I won’t leave a scaling review but I did see that this aquarium needs resources to make improvements. The orca/dolphin show was kid-friendly & entertaining. I’m not sure that I should enjoy seeing all of this wildlife held captive outside of their natural habitats. My rating is more accurately captured between poor & average.

title: Nice place
review: Good place to spend 4-6 hours with your kids. Nice aquariums. Good shows. Place is a bit old, including the restaurants, etc...

title: Nice place
review: The seaquarium was very cute. We got our tickets on Groupon and did not purchase any extra experiences. We watched several programs and then just wandered around. Only one restaurant and 2 snack stands were open (I assume because it’s not peak season?) and the mangrove nature walk was under construction.

title: Overpriced ........
review: We visited the Seaquarium a few weeks ago with high expectations. The small childrens waterpark is a nice idea but the actual aquarium a disappointment. Dolphin and Killer whale show was ok but we have seen better. The aquariums were lack lustre and did not have a the variety or range of fish you would expect. Some major investment is needed to overall the displays. As a family we love normally love visiting places like this but would advise to save your money.

title: Awesome experience!
review: Wow We did the one hour tour and got to pet/kiss the wolves, hold wolf cubs, hold a sloth, feed emus, feed and pet porcupines, hold the 13 ft python, feed the alligators and learn about the animals and how they ended up in this educational facility.  There were so many animals there and the staff talked to us about each of them from the bunnies, to the tortoises to the birds, etc  The staff was friendly and knowledgeable.  The animals are all well taken care of.  Definitely worth going to!

title: You cannot go wrong
review: Safari Edventure was very enjoyable. One in our group of 4 were able to hold the sloth, a little disappointing but okay. Touched and fed the prehensile tailed porcupines, fed the alligators (awesome - the way they come up to get fed it almost, almost makes you forget you cannot pet them), Got in the pen with the arctic wolves and timber wolves and then there was the wolf cubs. The price for the private tour, you cannot go wrong compared to other experiences in the area that cost much more. I did want to feed the baby pigs, when I went to buy bottles at the ticket area I was told it was included in the tour, it never happened. A little disappointed, but the other edventures were excellent. We did not stay for the 'show', we only caught the end to see the kangaroo and the kids were able to pet her.

title: Easy by boat
review: Drinks aren't too crazy, the energy is refreshing, and they tie up and take care of your boat without charging too much.

title: Wonderful attraction dedicated to helping animals
review: I visited Safari Edventure today and was overly impressed! Let me start by saying, we did not have reservations for a private tour because it didn't seem necessary from the website.  However, when we arrived, we quickly realized that during this time of school vacation it would have been best.  The private tours were sold out.  However, I watched the entire team here scramble to make sure they accomodated everyone  possible that wanted a tour after the sell out!  That included my husband and I and we were so grateful! I read through all the negative reviews and all I can say is that people who do not believe in zoos will always have something to say.  I, however, see things differently.  I too asked where many of the animals came from and the response most often given was that someone ignorantly adopted the animal without a permit to do so or without realizing what they were getting into.  Yes, some were obtained from other facilities and others were born there but without facilities like Safari Edventure, the formerly mentioned animals may have no choice but to be put down by the state!  I am an avid animal lover and I thought these animals seemed very well cared for.  They seemed to enjoy the attention and love they get from the staff, looked healthy and well maintained.  We were able to pet wolves, foxes, feed alligators, porcupines, baby pigs and emus as well as hold an exotic bird and a sloth! The staff seemed to really love the animals and were well informed to educate us about all the animals on premise. The presentation given was wonderful and it even gave those who didn't want a private tour the opportunity to pet and hold different animals as well as obtain photos.  I have had many opportunities to visit zoos/aquariums for personal encounters and I thought this was very well done.  The fact that they are non-profit and trying to help animals in need makes me feel happy not sad like some of the other reviewers on this site.

title: Good experience overall but alarmingly small cages
review: However, I came away alarmed at the small sizes of many of the cages -  the cockatoos and macaws being possibly the worst - in ornamental, oval cages that were barely larger than themselves.  There were other animals (eg rabbits) who were just about able to lay down but not move around otherwise - certainly not hop or run.  And the wolves' enclosure is also pretty restrictive for such large animals.  It marred the experience and seems to contradict their whole ethos.  The cages may conform to standards (?) but I found it distressing to see such beautiful animals in such restrictive confinement.

title: Fun Animal Encounters
review: We visited based on the high ratings from Trip Advisor and were not disappointed! They have an interesting collection of mammals, reptiles and birds. The base cost is very reasonable (special tours are quite a bit extra) and the base price includes opportunities to hold or pet a number of animals. The place is relatively small and can be done in an hour if you are in a hurry, but their animal show takes over an hour - and is worth the time. The only reason for a 4 rating instead of a 5: a number of the enclosures are old and small and the animals cannot be very happy in them.

title: Not What it Used To Be. Save Your Money
review: I grew up going to the Seaquarium.. in its day it was a beautiful well maintained attraction with a reasonable entrance fee for the times. Now its an overpriced run down facility that needs some serious renovations. So disappointed to know how nice it used to be and could be again if they sank some money back into the place instead of just keeping all the profits. Drive north and go to SeaWorld. You wont be sorry

title: A wonderful experience and fun day out!
review: The Sea Aquarium is magnificent experience and be sure to come in the morning and stay all day too see the various shows and interactions that are on a continual schedule! It is a super fun day out!

title: Very Expensive Tickets and Facilities Were In Poor Condition!
review: It was a pricey ticket and we felt like we got ripped off only minutes after entering. It was poorly maintained and the shows were boring! The water in several exhibits was dirty looking and the whole facility was run down. We would not return to this facility and definitely would not recommend to anyone visiting the area.

title: The dolphins and sea lions
review: Don’t hope for much food from the restaurants. They cost quite a lot and expect to spend the entire day there especially when you are with children. Overall it was a nice experience and I won’t do it again.

title: Miami seaquarium
review: Very expensive, the place was build in 1955 and needs a total redo in my opinion. not worth the money the shows are mediocre and the food is so,so, not much to do. Swimming with the dolphin is probably the best thing to do. The penguins experience is also ok put not great. Go to Sea World Orlando instead.

title: Excellent place to visit!
review: My children and I did a "ITS" tour.  We went in with and pet the wolves, the porcupines, foxes, the sloths and several other animals.  The experience was one that my children will remember for ever... Not to mention that it was very reasonably priced compared to similar places.

title: So Much Fun!!!!
review: We took an "in the scenes" tour during a recent trip to Miami. It was 100000% worth it. Amazing to get to interact with so many animals and learn about how they came to the Safari Edventure. I cannot think of another place where you can hold a baby sloth and feed an alligator and still learn about wolf dog hybrids. Immensely entertaining to go for a few hours. Our tour guide, Chris I believe his name was, was great!

title: Nice chill scenic
review: Good spot right on the river for cocktails and food trucks. Nothing fancy but a nice crowd- fun during the day watching the boat go past....Gabriela was super awesome and made great cocktails! Cheers!

title: We loved it!
review: Where else can you hold an alligator and a sloth and touch so many different animals?  Hanging out with the wolves was also amazing. Our kids loved it too!

title: Great experience.
review: Well organized place with a large selection of animals. Feels well run. Presentations were excellent and very engaging. Definitely worth spending a few hours there.

title: Nice place
review: This place was very nice to visit and it's wonderful what they do for the animals- they're all rescued. Wide variety of animals and you can get up close to them and go in the wolf cage and pet them, they are very friendly. You can pay $5 more to hold a baby sloth- it's so cute! The animal show was good and employee Pedro very knowledgable and super friendly! Would recommend this place!

title: Fantastic experience
review: Did not expect this to be such a wonderful journey. Lots of interesting animals. The staffs are super friendly. The show is extremely fun and we touched and photoed all of them. Definitely recommend it!!!!!

title: A must with small children
review: We take our kids down during our annual Miami trip. The place is fantastic and there are so many activities to do there. A nice treat to get away from the “city” and spend some time in key Biscayne too

title: Sadly in need of renovations
review: Went with my niece and her boys after 25 years of not visiting.  Other than the Flipper show area, the Seaquarium is very run down. It is grossly overpriced for what you receive.  Most of the shops and places to eat were closed.  It would be sad for Miami to lose this attraction,  but cannot see myself returning.

title: not so bad
review: As a result we spent here about 6 hours.

title: exelent place!
review: we enjoyed it very much! all the shows were extremely interesting! its a exelent place to go with your family

title: Average facility and poorly maintained
review: I was expecting a better experience for a Seaquarium in one of the largest cities in the US.  The facility was poorly maintained and the exhibits were average at best.  I think Miami can do better!

title: Great little hidden treasure of South Florida
review: I've lived in South Florida for over 40 years and never knew about this little treasure. My in laws took us just recently and let me tell you. I felt like a little kid again. It's not a huge place, but it's a great place for up close interaction with wild animals. I had so much fun I forgot to take pictures. The two things I enjoyed the most was being able to actually get into a cage with 3 full breed wolves and it that was free to do. Being able to get that close and pet them was something that made me feel like a kid again. I've always loved wolves for some reason and there I was in there with 3 of them petting them. And also all of the other wonderful animals you can interact with.

title: great bar experience
review: What a great spot to hang out with friends :) They have different food trucks and different bars to hang out. My friends and I went to the inside bar and our bartender Hector worked like a jumbo jet, super fast :) and always friendly. Even though it was crazy busy he always checked on us and made sure we are good. I will be back soon for a drink and this amazing lobster sandwich :)

title: ONE OF MY FAVORITE PLACES IN THE WHOLE WORLD!
review: oh my goodness! I came here to visit after seeing some great reviews on tripadvisor and it was literally the best decision i have ever made! It was super affordable and super educational too! it's great for kids and families! the volunteers there are great and you can tell they love what they do! i loved being bale to hold the animals!! i have always wanted to hold a sloth and finally got to! and on top of that, i got to hangout with wolves, and hold other animals they had here! :D I recommend this to everyone !

title: Best Birthday EVER!!!
review: My best friend took me here for my birthday. She had said previously how amazing it was (she lives down there, but I live in Boca Raton, an hour away). We got there and saw a wonderful animal show/talk with the keepers. They let you hold and take pictures with them. Really informative and fun. We held a baby sloth <3 We loved seeing the bats. They were so sweet and beautiful. Got to pet wolves, and feed pigs, lemurs, etc :) Such a wonderful place. Please go and show your support or this place and how wonderful the keepers and animals are. It has beautiful plants ans statues as well. Great for photographers too.

title: An extraordinary place for a family weekend!
review: I visited this park with my family, including a kid and we fell in love with it! We were impressed by the extraordinary selection of animals, low prices, many opportunities for interaction with rare species, etc. It is obvious that the place is run by really devoted people, who love what they are doing. Greatly recommend to visit it!

title: A wonderful and Amazing experience for everybody!!!
review: An Amazing place to visit, I went with my Wife and my 2 kids (5 yro & 11 yro) the visit was very personal, the staff is really friendly and you were able see many exotic animals and interact with them like play with the Wolves, hold a big boa snake, hold a tarantula,  hold a baby alligator, and much more. Don't miss the show!!! Guys doing the show was great!! This was a great experience for my family and I.

title: Best thing to do in the Miami Area
review: We visited last july not really knowing what to expect. Upon arrival we were imediately greeted by very nice staff members and that experience continued at the counter where we bought our tickets. We were smart enough to forget our bug repellent, because who needs bug repellent in South Florida!, we didnt even have to ask the kind lady behind the desk who imediately offered that we could use hers. She did not have to do this but deciced to do so anyways. We bought regular admission tickets and extra tickets to pet a sloth. We then walked the 'trail' through the 'park' and absolutely loved every animal exhibition. It might seem like the animals are in relatively small areas but all the animals seemed happy and none showed any signs of sadness. Feeding the monkey-like creatures was our favourite part of the already amazing day. You can buy food for them for $0,25 from a machine next to the exibit. We then continued our walk and went to the wolve encounter where we met a great staff member, sadly i've forgotten his name. He was incredibly friendly and you could tell that his goal was to educate us about the animals. He sure did! Then we made our way to the animal show. This is something you must do if you go here, i will not spoil what you will see but it is incredibly educational and fun at the same time. Especially for children (arent we all?) You can purchase snacks and water from vending machines for about a buck. Highly suggest u bring a couple of dollars to do so if you plan on visiting during the warm days. At the end of the animal show we got to hold the sloths, we we're not rushed at all and given all the time we needed to enjoy this moment. A+ for the day. We will return!

title: Sea Trek is a must do
review: Thoroughly enjoyed my visit to the Miami Seaquarium. It certainly is not the same as it was when I went on a school field trip 45 years ago. And you just do the Seatrek. It was an awesome experience.

title: Wow!!
review: Great day at Miami Seaquarium

title: Really nice
review: It was really nice to see all the shows and the animals and have the opportunity to get in touch with them. Reserve at least 3 hours to see the whole place and watch the shows and even more if you want to get the animal encounters.

title: Not worth it
review: The place is still the same for 30 years when I went last, dirty and less shows than before. Not worth to pay $50

title: Dolphin encounter
review: I visit aquariums almost everywhere I go and wasn’t disappointed in Miami. Its made more as a zoo than aquarium so its a lot of walking but you can make a day out of it. They feature sealion shows, dolphin shows and several other entertainment options or you can just walk around and enjoy the exhibits. For extra charge you can do Dolphin or SeaLion encounter

title: Had such a great time.
review: I love this place because you can arrive by boat (it's so easy). Anyway, staff is great, cocktails are amazing and food trucks are super delicious!!!

title: We took a bus ride .
review: Around the city and was told a little history   about the place. It so interesting   and would erk to learn the history   about the very nice colored building.  Next time will come see ir.

title: Fantastic find!
review: It cost $18 per adult and $15 per child so it was a great experience without breaking the bank. Totally worth it. I’d go back in a heartbeat. Kids loved it.

title: Andrea!
review: Hosted an event at this venue, and Andrea was a very attentive and kind server. She is an example of the customer service we all expect. Moreover, I've been here a bunch of times and I love the day vibes. It's the definition of "Miami".

title: Okay it's good, but not that good!
review: I mean, in Miami it has always been like that. The "new cool place" is where you find everyone at. That's the Wharf now, but it could be anything tomorrow. It's a forever changing situation. I love to go on Fridays to enjoy a few beers while sitting next to the sea. But come on, there's like a million places to just do that in Miami! It's true, you can dance, there's an area for that and another one that seems more like a lounge to sit around and relax but under the stars! Biggest pros: the sea and the fact that you get to be outside.

title: Awesomeness
review: Can I say I have been going to this place for the past month. I wouldn't have it any other way. Hector Jimenez is absolutely amazing, he is the reason why we go. He is professional and actually knows what he is doing. I told him what I did t like and he said "I Got You" and came back with the most delicious cocktail. My favorite place. He not only has the best customer service I have encountered, he also cares and is never too busy to hear what the client wants. I will always go there because Hector not only offer you drinks, he offers an experience.

title: Loved This Place!
review: We were not bothered by bugs while were were there, but I can imagine that some days it's the kind of place you'd need bug spray. Also bring water.

title: Fun place
review: Overall, you will enjoy this place. It's very relaxing and is a great experience for the kiddos.

title: A Gem
review: A little known but fantastic attraction. Good for adults and kids of all ages. Well worth the admission fee. Plan on being there for at least 3 hours. Max. 5. Great hands on fun. The kids will have great stories to share with their friends.

title: Fabulous Find!
review: I sure did score when I found this tropical paradise down South! I wanted to do something different for my Father's birthday and he is an animal lover. This seemed like fun but we weren't sure how much time we could spend there, in the heat, so we reserved seats for a movie later in the afternoon... We almost missed the movie.... We had so much fun playing with all of the animals and feeding the ones we could, that we didn't want to leave!  We played with wolves, foxes, kangaroos, porcupines, birds, alligators, emus, mini horses and donkeys, turkeys, spiders, pigs and lemurs, just to name a few of the fascinating animals that this sanctuary has to offer. The tour guide we had was very knowledgeable and the animals welcomed the staff excitedly which says a lot to me.  I would recommend the ITS tour and playing with the wolves. Feeding the alligator was more of a man's sport but they were fascinated with it. The girls fed the emus and we loved it.

title: Amazing for  all ages !!!!
review: Imagine playing with a real timber wolf, or an Artic wolf. Think about your Christmas card picture with you holding a baby sloth. Watching piglets run around "oinking". Holding a tarantula and an alligator. Petting a skunk and know you won't come out STINKY!!!! Such a inexpensive, FUN day !!    ALL THESE ANIMALS ARE THERE !!

title: Great surprise!
review: It was great and everyone was having fun.

title: Visit
review: I thought it would have been bigger than it was. Got to see some of the animals you don't get to see otherwise. One area was down due to renovations.

title: Terrible
review: Half of the enclosures were closed/out of bounds which meant that you could hardly see any of the animals advertised. Most of the animals looked unhappy, especially the parrots; they were screeching and plucking, leaving large bald areas. Birds that are bored and anxious pluck their feathers and this is an obvious sign of mistreatment. The best exhibit we went to was the first one which was a touch pool with cleaner fish. The most interesting and you could interact with them. The dolphin show made us reconsider our actions in visiting the seaquarium. Animal cruelty? Do the dolphins like it? When you enter the park you are given a green sheet with show times on it which would be useful however they all started 5 minutes late and lasted a half the time they are supposed to. Considering we payed $50 each for our tickets we were quite disappointed by the standard of this park.

title: Dolphin Odyssey really a disappointment
review: Dolphin Odyssey is supposed to be about swimming with dolphins, right? Well, out of the whole session you really get to swim with the dolphin ONE time which is about 30 seconds. Dolphin takes you across the pool. The rest of it is dolphin interaction with not just you, dolphin and trainer . It’s you, trainer and whole bunch of other people. But what makes it the most disappointing of all is the whole thing is so commercialized. It’s not about you and your time with dolphin, it’s about making few perfect pictures of you so they can sell them to you for a hefty price. To me, i”d pay a lot more to just see my child in a water with the dolphin and trainer for 15 minutes of pure water time. Erase show effects, talking and all the tricks dolphins can do. We’ve seen the shows. Not happy. Not worth it

title: Disappointing
review: Was really expecting a better quality seaquarium out of Miami.  The holding tanks for the animals were far too small and some of them were so dirty... it was really sad. For as much as they overcharge to get in (in addition to the cost of parking) you would think they could provide better facilities for the animals.

title: Way Exceeded Our Expectations
review: Would I return to the Jewish Museum of Florida?  Yes and I will keep track of the next special exhibition.

title: Small museum with interesting exhibits
review: This tiny museum on the history of Jews especially in South Florida is only for people who want to learn more about this subject. I learned a lot and they had also had an exhibit about an American Jewish woman photographer and a beautiful exhibition of yads made of an amazing variety of material. A security guard wands visitors before the door is open.

title: The non superficial side of Miami
review: besides the point the Pianist were outstanding, this old and beautiful place in Lincoln Rd. is a must see if you visit Miami.

title: A really good experience for animal lovers!
review: This is what my wife wanted to do for her birthday and I'm glad that we had the experience. We booked the one hour personal tour and it was well worth the fee. Many birds including Amazons, Macaws, Cockatoos and Rheas and others were really entertaining. They also have foxes and many pigs. The horses, donkeys and goats were in a large enclosure that love to be fed. The Sloths and porcupines take food right from your hands. The big hit for my wife were the Wolves. A large male is really big and really sweet. He has other part wolves to keep him company. Whole Foods donate much of the fresh food for the animals. I thought that that was very cool. All in all a delightful experience. Most of the workers were volunteers who cared so much for this place and the animals. Safari Edventure needs donations as well as paying customers to stay viable. These animals come from people who can no longer take care of them and places like this are the places that make a difference.

title: Fantastic hands on Edvenrure
review: After the first visit, I had to bring family and friends. Found it to be very unique in their presentation and informative. The wolf expirience is fantastic.

title: Disturbing and Appalling Animal Visit
review: We are an animal loving family who has respect for the natural world and its creatures. We left upset we had contributed to this "facility". The cages, the grounds in general, the fenced in areas for the goats, donkeys, horses, the tanks for the turtles were so badly kept it was disgusting. It looked like a dump which even included an old swimming pool ladder just off to the side. The vegetation, grassy areas were overgrown. The enclosures themselves were the dingiest we have ever seen in any animal care facility. I read a comment from the owner, who responded to another visitor's post about how upset they were with the conditions, that this facility passes inspection from various agencies, and I find that hard to swallow.  We immediately wanted to start cleaning up habitats and  the grounds in general which would require a huge dumpster. It was hard to shake off that experience knowing those animals don't have the option to leave and find shelter in a much healthier, cleaner environment. If anyone who has the power to make change there reads this, please get help and clean that place up!

title: Memories Were Made!
review: We had the pleasure of taking the ITS tour with our knowledgeable guide, Carlos. The animals that are here were animals that were abandoned or hurt in the wild and needed a place to go. Carlos took us inside the different animal enclosures to feed and learn about each animal's story and about each animal species  We met and fed lemurs, monkeys, alligators, emus, bat-eared foxes, baby pigs, farm animals, and wolves.  Petting and feeding Arthur the sloth was a once in a lifetime opportunity!   We highly recommend Safari Edventures!

title: The host was hospitable and thoughtful
review: I've referred all of my friends at the University of Miami to get in touch with Lauren.

title: Great vibe, great concept
review: This bar/multi cuisine restaurant by the Miami river has a great vibe and it has a great concept. Trendy bar with good mojito variations, about 7-8 pop up restaurants with diverse cuisine. I really liked the place and I will come back

title: So much fun for all ages!
review: This place is incredible!! So much fun and great for all ages. My husband and I went here on a Sunday just to hang out and had such a fun time. They have 9 bars and a bunch of different food trucks. Definitely get the lobster roll from OG Ceviche abs Seafood. The best part about the day was the music and atmosphere. There were infant babies all the way up to 80 year olds there and literally everyone was enjoying themselves. It’s also pretty cheap for good and drinks are VERY cheap! We will be back!

title: Great Service
review: Oh, one more thing: Street parking is $3 an hour and make sure you don't go over because they ticket like crazy - the parking authority is constantly circling the area.

title: Only museum in the neighborhood
review: Went to this museum mainly because it was 2 blocks from hotel.  Not much to see so felt depressing not inspirational.

title: Interesting collection of information about Jews in Florida
review: Exhibit was well curated and the temporary exhibits were interesting as well.  There was a great video to watch about Jews in Florida/Miami area.  Definitely needed an hour and half to visit.

title: Great Experience!!!
review: Love taking my kids to spend summer time here... kids can learn a lot and have fun watching all the amazing shows they have a long the day... Also they can splash to calm the heat.. great wait to spent quality time with the family... My kids learn a lot about sea animals and their conservation... I really enjoy being here every time, dinning options are good and everybody is very friendly and helpful if you need something ... special thanks to the customer service representative Grecia and Ilsi.. if you have a problem you can always count with them... thanks so much!!

title: New experience at the Miami Seaquarium
review: I had the best experience ever at the Seaquarium! They have a new program called the shark and stingray interaction. Not only does this program have the coolest animals it has two great experts (Shannon and Mike)talking you through the interaction and telling you about the animals you’re having an interaction with. They know every animal by name and if you’re lucky you get to help train a shark(how cool is that!) I highly recommend this program! It’ll totally be worth it! ️️️️️

title: Heat stroke central
review: As far as an aquarium goes, this is nothing special. Typical aquarium shows and animals. Most of the “large” tanks are pretty small and I felt bad for the animals to be honest. They try to spin “oceanic conservation” as the theme to their shows but really they are making money by making wild animals do tricks. Forgetting the ethical aspect, this is Very Much an outside aquarium so you will be in the Miami blazing heat all day!!! Not even fans to create som drift/wind. So unless you don’t sweat or mind drenching sweat SKIP this place and go to dozens of indoor aquariums in the USA.

title: Decent little Theater in the Heart of the Beach
review: This is a lovely little theater in the heart of Miami Beach but other than having a retro look and feel to it there is nothing extraordinarily special about this place. It is a good spot to stop and take a few Photos of it.

title: Top Notch Theater
review: Very nice, small theater. Great vibe, comfortable seat, though not too wide. The bar is not really a bar, just a tiny counter. But there are plenty of bars on either side. We saw "The Golem of Havana", great venue for that show. The theater is part of Miami Beach history, before it was trendy.  I highly recommend going to a show there, easy parking, easy drinks and dinner. Fantastic people watching outside.

title: Nice cozy theater
review: Very nice!

title: THe Evils of History Continue On and On
review: Excellent! Haussman portrays the darkside of humanity that has prevailed for centuries.WHen evil people become empowered through inimidaton , violence, brutality and murder, the victims suffer, fear for their lives and try desperatel to escape if they can. From the early times of the Romans occupying Judea, torturing the citizenry  to the Midlle Ages with the Crusades to the Inquisition in Spain to Nazi Germany and on to Havana in the 50's, evil pervaded the lives of those seeking and obtaining power while good and innocent people were victimized and even killed., Will such horrible events ever stop being repeated?

title: WOLVES
review: I like to go on random adventures and this was definitely one of the better ones. To my surprise I was able to have close encounters with multiple animals you don't normally do at zoos like a sloth, opossum, and my favorite the wolf encounter. These people are doing a great job at educating people and conservation as well as rescue. For the price this place is under rated and a well hidden gem i the heart of homestead. Do you self a favor and go!

title: Good value, might be a little rustic for some but worth the drive.
review: My wife and I took three of our grandchildren ages 11,9 and 7.  I used them as the barometer for the fun index and they really enjoyed it.  You're allowed to roam free for as long as you wish on the grounds and they have periodic shows in the amphitheater where they highlight different animals that you're allowed to touch and carry.  The finale is getting in the wolf cages and being allowed to pet them.  Really a great experience for the kids.

title: Great place to visit!!
review: I brought my two daughters, ages 17 and 22 to the Safari Edventure. We had a very nice time visiting and thoroughly enjoyed the hands on experiences. Well worth the price of admission.  Pedro was a great guide and was so accommodating. We will visit this beautiful place again!

title: Don't do it
review: Bad value for the money and it is really yucky.  There are huge spider webs and tons of spiders EVERYWHERE.  We saw several rats running around as we were walking around the property.  The sloth was not to be found and no one would answer us as to why.  No kangaroos, no baby wolves.  We fed the donkey and horses, looked at some pigs and bunnies and other misc. small animals.  We went into the wolf cage which was a mistake and should not have done.  One of the other visitors still had a back pack on and one of the wolves attacked it trying to get it off of her and would not let go....it was very scary.

title: Very nice place to visit
review: Definitely a nice place to visit if you like animals and like to support animal organizations that are doing good things.

title: What a pretty church, what a warm congregation
place: Saint Francis de Sales Catholic Church
review: I stayed in SoBe over the recent Easter holiday and attended St. Francis for Palm Sunday, Holy  Thursday and Easter Sunday Masses.  The church is so pretty and clean and inviting.  The masses use a Spanish/English missal so everyone feels able to participate.  The music director did a wonderful job celebrating the season, and I loved hearing the Messiah play before Easter morning mass.

title: Friendly church, beautiful vigil
place: Saint Francis de Sales Catholic Church
review: We visited for the Easter vigil and the mass was done in English, Spanish, and Italian! How beautiful. We were made to feel very welcome and the music was beautiful.

title: Cute church
place: Saint Francis de Sales Catholic Church
review: There are weekend activities to support locals or homeless

title: Fun Times with Friends!
review: Cool Hangout place to meet & greet! Drinks are reasonable & finger food is acceptable! Great place to bring your boat too! GetSome!!

title: Fun place, great food
review: This place is really fun for family and friends. It has a lot of options for you to eat, like seafood, mexican food and hamburguers. It also has a great view of the river and a lot of options of drinks, beers, wines, etc.

title: Nice atmosphere
review: Now the good... very nice atmosphere. If you can get a seat right next to where the boats pull up, there’s  a nice ambience. The staff was very nice and friendly

title: Awesome 👍 Hangout Spot!!!
review: We had a great time socializing and drinking Veuve Clicquot Rose Champagne. The food option was satisfying, definitely one if my favorite spot to hang out.

title: Nice place to hangout
review: This was the first time I’d been to the wharf. It is definitely a great place to take pictures and aesthetically pleasing. Right on the water, and covered with turf. It felt like you were in a tropical garden without an urban area. They have a covered area and an open air area with umbrellas and string lights. It has a fun atmosphere. People were dressed up and down, some in bathing suits, but they do have a sign outside that says they can turn you away for not adhering to dress code (subject to their discretion). Plus side is there’s no entry fee. Typical to Miami, the drinks and food are definitely overpriced. Unless I was starving, I probably wouldn’t choose to eat there. This is not to say the food doesn’t look good, because it does, just pricey. If I went there just for food, that’s one thing, but food with drinks would easily be $50 in one trip. I got a beer for $7 and a strawberry mojito for $13. The mojito was very good. Didn’t seem like they skimped on alcohol, but it’s hard to say for sure. They offered the mojitos in a variety of flavors and they came with a piece of sugar cane which was a fun addition. I would definitely go back for a drink or two but this couldn’t be my regular spot or I’d be broke. Downside is you either have to valet for $15 or park somewhere down the street and pay about $3 an hour.

title: Excellent museum
review: What a wonderful museum outlining the history of the Jewish people in Miami. The presentations were extremely well done and informative. The building is beautiful  and the space is well utilized. We spent about two hours reading and taking in the displays. Worth the visit for anyone who loves to learn about history, culture, religion and traditions.

title: Walking tour
review: Howard Brayer gave us an excellent walking tour and we learned quite a bit. The museum itself was also very interesting and well organized.

title: Miami Seaquarium
review: Honestly a bit of a disappointment. Dolphins seem to be the only attraction. spent about 2-3 hrs moving around & watching various shows, good but not very impressive

title: Excellent experience with the Dolphins
review: We had an amazing experience with swimming with the dolphins! We got amazing photos that we will keep with us forever. My husband and I were on our honeymoon and basically got a private session with 4 dolphins. Melissa F. who was our trainer was just amazing! We couldn’t be happier. They truly care about the animals and make sure they are really happy and well taken care of. 100% worth it. Would highly recommend to everyone : )

title: Excellent experience
review: Maryland

title: Swimming with Melissa F and Rana
review: I was pleasantly surprised went I went to swim with the dolphins.  The experience was so enjoyable with the care and patience provided by Melissa F. and Rana.  Our group of cancer survivors relaxed and interacted with those wonderful animals for a funfilled day.

title: The Heart of South Beach
review: Saw The Elaborate Entrance Of Chad Deity on Feb. 10th and...wow! I'm so amazed by this theatre and it's in house theatre company. You rarely see theatre this good in South Florida. In fact, you never see it. The shows are of the best quality and never fail to move. The venue itself is beautiful. It's vintage are deco design and grandiose feel make you feel like you've been transported back to the 1930s'. I'll take this over the Arsht and Broward Performing Arts Center any day of the week!

title: Great theater!
review: We came to see “The Album”, great production, amazing actors, only VIP seating, very different setting. Everytime we come here they do something different. It id an old and small nice theater.

title: Small but perfect theatre size!
review: We went to see ‘Confessions of a Cocaine Cowboy’ and the play had lasted for around 2.5 hours. We really enjoyed our experience and is a conveniently located next to bars, stores, and restaurants nearby.

title: Art Deco at its best
review: Look and feel of the 1950ts and in the Lincoln Road area. Great old theater and well worth a stop off.

title: Lots of fun
review: We really enjoyed visiting this place. All the animals have been rescued or rehomed. We especially enjoyed the presentation given by a knowledgeable volunteer where we could hold or pet a python, tarantula, baby alligator, skunk and more. The one disappointment was that we could only pet the sloth while it slept in a box. Would have liked to hold it as in the pics. But had a good time and will go again.

title: Best wolf interaction ever !!
review: Safari Edventure did not disappoint. This was by far the most hands on experience we have ever had and to have that with wolves is incredible. Now, the experience is not a full day activity but for the $15.00 entrance fee (for Florida residents), the very informative interactive animal show (we held a boa, tarantula and alligator, pet a raccoon, sloth and possum) and all the animals that you see during your visit, it is worth every penny.  Also, it is a deserving donation made to a rescue that is helping out some pretty incredible animals.

title: Those poor animals, heartbreaking!
review: My youngest wants to be a vet when he is older so I try to find animal interaction opportunities for him whenever we travel.  He actually chose this activity out of the two I presented him with because of the wolf interaction.  We also got to hold a small alligator and a very large python during this visit which was pretty cool.  The animal interactions is what really attracts people to this place.  I will say that the guy who did the education piece was great!  However, the conditions are deplorable!  My heart broke for these poor animals kept in cages, some of which seemed to be falling apart.  As another reviewer stated, we also thought we had arrived to someone’s back yard with overgrown vegetation.  This place really just needs to be shut down.  I understand some amount of damage was done by a previous hurricane, but not likely enough to cause the conditions I witnessed today.

title: ITS Tour with Carlos
review: This was an amazing experience. We did the ITS tour with Carlos and it was worth every penny. Carlos was a wonderful guide. His love for the animals was heartwarming. You could see how much the animals  cared for him as well. I know this isn’t as modern as a typical zoo, but the intimacy and one on one interaction you get here is so much better. My husband and I fed foxes, lemurs, an alligator, emus, baby pigs, got to play with wolves, feed porcupines (insanely cute) and have up close time with the sloth (amazing life long dream). Carlos was super informative about everything and never made us feel rushed. After our tour we went the demonstration in the little amphitheater and we held a tarantula, baby gator, huge snake, petted and skunk and an opossum. The gentleman who did the presentation was smart and funny and we really had a great time doing that as well. Please don’t judge this place because if it’s out of the way location and somewhat ramshackle grounds. If it doesn’t smell prefect everywhere, remember there are animals EVERYWHERE and only a handful of people to get everything done. Instead of complaining about the appearance, donate to help them rebuild enclosures and continue to do the amazing work they do. I definitely recommend this experience for everyone. We will definitely be coming back with our family. ** ask for Carlos and tell him we said hi!

title: Lots of room for improvement here
review: If you can overlook the presentation of the cages, you will absolutely love this place.

title: Little Church in South Beach
place: Saint Francis de Sales Catholic Church
review: Always a pleasure to enter this little Catholic Church in Souht Beach. While all is wild and crazy outside, inside you find peace and inner joy. A gem of a place of worship with lots of history.

title: Nice church in South Beach
place: Saint Francis de Sales Catholic Church
review: We attended a Saturday mass here.  Beautiful, quaint church in South Beach within walking distance of many hotels on Ocean Drive near Lummus Park (it was roughly a mile from our hotel at 1400 Ocean Drive).

title: A very welcoming Catholic Church in South Beach
place: Saint Francis de Sales Catholic Church
review: Attended Easter Mass.  Great attendance at mass.  Get there early.  Monsignor Vaughan is a great speaker.  Highly recommend attending mass there.

title: Beautiful church for a wedding!
place: Saint Francis de Sales Catholic Church
review: This beautiful, intimate, old-spanish style chapel was just perfect to host our wedding. Everyone complimented the setting, service, and magical feeling felt while they witnessed our marital union. The church fills with sound and acoustics and it quickly became a heavenly choir singing the praises of our holy union. We loved this church for our wedding and could not have found a more elegant and intimate church in Miami, period.

title: Great Church in Miami Beach
place: Saint Francis de Sales Catholic Church
review: My daughter said at the end of the mass how she would like to get married at this church one day as she liked it there that much.  Time will tell, but next time we are in Miami Beach, I am going to carve time to go to mass at St Francis de Sales.

title: Cool place
review: They have some games to play with friends, great staff and many food options! I loved it..

title: Out of the house
review: We went to visit this place my wife and my granddaughter and it turns out that we liked it so much that we told the family and now everybody want to go

title: Amazing Vodka Celebration
review: We went here for the vodka celebration, lots of vodka stations which were awesome. The open air venue had great views and chilled vibe.

title: Sunday Funday
review: This is a great place for Food and fun. You will enjoy sampling food from different vendors while listening to music on the bay. There is a huge bar with a lot to drink. there is also an area for kids.

title: YOU’RE VERY PRETTY
review: I met one of the bartenders on Wednesday night, I kinda forget what her name was, she was very pretty.

title: Jewish walking tour with Howard B.
review: excellent tour! would highly recommend it to all interested in the development/history of jewish settlement and community in south beach/miami beach. Howard is an excellent guide, welcoming and engaged, and obviously passionate about doing tours, and knows his stuff. Thanks to Howard, too, for making it as easy as possible for me to participate even though i am handicapped and depend on a walker. The museum is a gem too -- not my first visit and a wonderful hub and landmark.

title: Fun day
review: Had visited this place over 20 years ago. Came back with our son, had a great time. Some facilities look like they have not been remodeled or touched since then, but overall we had a great time. The shows were great, and the weather was even better (no control over that). There’s a lot more food options now, not great, but will hold you up while you’re there!

title: I'm an embarrassed Florida resident!
review: We took our visiting out of state relatives to this place. What a colossal ripoff! Few animals. Lame shows. Many of the food kiosks closed. Do NOT waste your money.

title: Dolphin encounter
review: So incredible to encounter the dolphins in a way that you don't get to when seeing shows...

title: Clean, nice play areas for children, good animal shows.
review: There were a few play areas for the children which is probably the highlight. The shows that were open were very good and a perfect length for children. There was a lot of walking for the few animals. Way overpriced for what we saw.

title: Love this theater
review: Great venue. Friendly staff, amazing shows. Great location. Good vibes, Comfortable chairs = no brainer

title: World class theater in South Beach
review: There is not a time I travel to Miami without checking out the Colony. Productions are always world class and the surrounding areas make for an incredible night out full of culture and fun.

title: Cutural Getaways
review: Florida is not only beaches and malls. There are many options for people like me: art and culture lovers. The Colony Theater is one of these options. They present a very well-curated season with exceptional actors and contemporary stories. In the summer there are a variety of shows in Spanish, also of the highest level. In front of the theater, there is an excellent Italian café where you can dine before or after with an art deco fountain that makes my "cultural getaways" a plan that I always repeat.

title: The future of theater in an art deco setting
review: Who would imagine that South Beach (in Miami Beach) would be home to a theater company that is creating brand new plays that it produces as world premieres. I have seen over half a dozen plays and each one is a gem. The ideal night out on an authentic Art Deco setting. And you can enjoy the scene on Lincoln Road, which is full of energy and cool places to eat or drink. Definitely, check it out. It will be memorable.

title: Theatre
review: One of the best artistic experiences in Miami, hands down. Premium quality theatre specifically catered to the Miami community but telling universal, important stories.

title: Needs to be reported ASAP
review: Horrible horrible place- I wish i could give it zero stars. I honestly have no idea why this place has any positive reviews. I assume because it only cost $15 to get in and you can take pictures with animals. I was under the impression that this was a non profit and these animals were being rescued and helped. However, the animals at edventure safari are not being cared for properly AT ALL. Multiple wolves all kept in a small enclosure where they allow huge groups of people (including children) to go in and pet and photograph the WILD animals. The workers clearly are in no way animal experts nor did they know any information about these WILD wolves. One wolf didnt move the whole time and looked very malnourished and sick (they told me “oh hes just old”). The two year old wolf was trying to escape the whole time and deff needs a large space to run around. I wouldnt allow a small dog to be locked in this space much less multiple young wild wolves. Not to mention it is 100 degrees outside and many animals had no shelter. The aligators had no room to swim and all the cages were rusted,old and most covered in webs.Also many animals looked under fed and all had extremely dirty water. Many birds were missing most of their feathers. We didnt even look at all of the animals because after seeing the wolf enclosure I couldn’t bare to see anymore. I have been to other wolf sanctuaries in Florida and they all have acres of land for the animals to rome and live in packs. So i know there are much better places these wolves could go live. I also herd the “worker” saying they bred the wolves with dogs and sell the wolf dogs to people. These people are using these animals to bred and make money and do not care about their wellbeing. Someone needs to rescue these animals from this “rescue” ASAP.

title: Happy and relaxed Animals
review: We spent a whole day here and I must say people need to understand before judging this place. If you come here with a judgemental attitude then don't come at all. The animals here are rescued, rehabbed. Thanx to the lovely people here at the safari  that these little guys can finally escape the hell and hard life they came from. I always wanted to pet a wolf, and that came true while visiting here, the sloth and the possum are adorable as well. Big thanx to Carlos that explained us the story behind every enclosure, if you need more proof of how bad their life were before, they have lots of pictures you can go through. Thank you for taking care of them and keep doing what you do. Ya'll are amazing!

title: Such a great find!
review: We did the ITS tour, and it was excellent. Carlos was fantastic and very knowledgeable, and you can tell that the staff spend a lot of careful 1-on-1 time with each of the animals. That’s what sets it apart from a zoo, the animals seem genuinely cared about. So glad we made it here - highly recommended!

title: Visiting from the UK
review: There was a show at the auditorium that was amazing. The lady was informative, without being boring and we got to touch / hold a skunk, snake, alligator, bullfrog, lizard, sloth and go in with the wolves too. A great way to spend a few hours and I would highly recommend a visit here

title: BEST DAY EVER
review: The place is amazing the caretakers are doing a great job. This is a none profit organization and they take care of this animals . Is not a fancy place and is not the zoo is for endangered species and animals that people take home and when they grow they cant handle them any longer and other wise have to be put down. There was a show at the auditorium that was amazing. The lady was great knowing everything about the little creatures. My granddaughter was so happy to get to see all this animals and touch them. Skunk, alligator, bullfrog,snake, lizard, sloth. Then they take you in to see the wolves and touch them. Pretty friendly except Athena she was not having it. Love the place....

title: Beautiful church!
place: Saint Francis de Sales Catholic Church
review: I always like to check out the local church when i travel And this church was perfect for me to walk to Sunday morning.

title: Beautiful small church
place: Saint Francis de Sales Catholic Church
review: It was a quick uber ride from 1 hotel to an early mass.  The church is beautiful and the community was very welcoming to travelers.

title: Beautiful Church
place: Saint Francis de Sales Catholic Church
review: I attended daily Mass here very welcoming bi-lingual Mass the Church was beautiful inside and out the people were very friendly. this was walking distance from the beach and was in a lovely neighborhood. The Priest's homilies were very helpful.

title: Attended Saturday morning mass
place: Saint Francis de Sales Catholic Church
review: Positively beautiful!!!  Loved this church, the service and the people!!!! The mass times were perfect, parking was available. Just what we needed to start our week!

title: Beautiful Saturday Evening Mass
place: Saint Francis de Sales Catholic Church
review: Attended the 6:00pm Mass on a Saturday night.  You have the warm welcome at the door, and the feel of an old Franciscan mission.  Eclectic mix of people.  Beautiful cantor and personable priest.  Uber gets you right there, and you're less than 10 minutes from Espanola Way!

title: Not the Best
review: Theres also a BK opposite, a Subway and a large Vitamin shop

title: One of best stadiums I've been to
review: We went to the Dolphins vs Chargers game (Dolphins lost) When we arrived the car park as shown in the picture was full of pickup trucks and people had set up gazebos. It looked like a car boot sale with food and drink. A local fan explained this was the "Tail Gate Party" they arrived at family atmosphere, kids played games and everyone was friendly. The stadium was one of the best I have ever been to. Plenty of toilets no queues. Loads of food outlets, helpful staff. It is not a cheap day, tickets cost $50 dollars in the "Gods" to $500 plus. As the stadium is hosting the SuperBowl next year tickets will be between $5,000 50 over $20,000. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

title: Affordable shops
review: Weather was extremely hot and humid. I needed  cooler dresses and this was the place for purchases. Close by in South Beach and prices were reasonable. A nice variety was available and I purchased two dresses which I still wear. I went back a second time and had lunch in this district and bought more clothes.

title: Office Staff Dinner
review: We had made reservations for our staff dinner. When we arrived we were sat promptly and the hostess was friendly and accommodating to our needs. That was the highlight. The waiter came over and we attempted to order wine. The first two bottles of Pinot Noir we tried to order they had run out. Then we ordered a cab which they were also out of. Finally they brought us something that they had, not really what we wanted but that was the best of all other choices. Others had some drinks and they were average at best.
