As for the food, two orders were brought incorrectly and the time it took to get our entrees were about 45 minutes. I had to ask the waiter why so long, and could not answer. I would figure if the restaurant was full but it was half empty. Overall, terrible experience would not recommend returning here. Enjoy.

title: Game On!
review: I went at the Hard Rock Stadium to watch a football game, which team I was cheer for lose, but still had a great time. The Stadium provided a lot of security and guest service assistance, which I did not need but all around (Thank You). The pre-game shows and activities before the game was good. The seat location (Lower Level) was a good view for me and staff in the area was helpful, excited and happy.

title: Very nice to enjoy on Sundays with the family
review: Beside that it is very beautiful. It has different options to eat to go to movies, to shop (very expensive) and to meet with friends.

title: Amazing Miami open grounds, maybe good for football
review: Even though the primary event/events at Hard Rock are football games for the Miami Dolphins, the tennis tournament “The Miami Open” was GREAT!! The facilities were nice and you could get semi-close to the players. Only complaint is that there were few places for food so lines EXTREMELY long, but for a first year of a tournament and for a tennis tournament in general — great job!

title: No the Cleanest Beach, and Homeless Sleeping there.
review: Awesome sunrise, but the trash (mostly cigarette butts) to be fair they were doing a clean up. In one little strip there was 4 Homeless or maybe passed out on Spring Break.

title: Tour of the Frank Gehry New World Symphony Building
review: In addition to being architecturally beautiful, the history and purpose of the New World Symphony Orchestra and School is fascinating. They offer an outstanding professional education to a small, very elite group of musicians. However, the highlight was our tour leader, Dolly, who was both informative and extremely funny! We all laughed our way through the 45 minute tour, and I doubt any of us will ever forget Dolly. I know she does the Tuesday 4:00pm tour and believe she also does one midday on Fridays and Saturdays. If you're going to Miami, don't miss her!

title: My favorite shopping experience
review: This is a beautiful setting for shopping, dinning & movies. I visit frequently, my favorite Nordstrom store is there. This facility is open air, & has beautiful garden which is frequently used by families w small children who play around the fountain. There are several restaurants, some open air, around the garden, in a laid back casual environment. The restaurants are medium priced, the shops, some of well known designers, are expensive, the theater on the 3rd floor is very nice, it has casual dinning & the seats in the theater are recliners. Great place to spend an afternoon in Miami.

title: 8th Street
review: 'wonderful atmosphere.

title: Always interesting events take place here
review: Just went to Art Basel which is always an amazing fair. It is museum quality art under one roof. You see everything from Picasso's to installation art. I also look forward to the Boat Show and the Original Antique and Jewelry show here.

title: One of the best fun free things in Miami
review: This is a wonderful opportunity to listen to beautiful classical music while gazing up at the Miami night make it a point to come out and enjoy the Wallcast!!

title: world class
review: beautiful l frank Gehry concert hall; wonderful music including composers not always heard; an amazing symphony with Michael Tilson Thomas and guest conductors; free outdoor simulcasts wihere music lovers can listen under the stars with a picnic.  miamians are fortunate!

title: Pokemon Go hot Spot in a relaxing park
review: The kids wanted to go looking for Pokemon and we left for a walk.  we were going to a Pokemon gym and after fighting it they wanted to continue.  we noticed that the Soundscape park has several poke stops there.  When we arrived there were about 80 - 100 people there with the majority looking for Pokemon.  There was a few parents like me with middle school or younger kids, but the majority were late teens to 20's. Small groups and couples were the majority. The kids caught a lot of  Pokemon and there were multiple lures going.  The park has plenty of seating and the New World center is there.  If you want Pokemon this is a good stop or if you just want to relax.  A nice break from the hustle and bustle of Lincoln Road and only 1 short Block away.

title: Nice little contemporary art museum
review: At walking distance froof the m Ocean drive, this is perfect if the weather is not so good and you love contemporary art. 10$ entry fee per adult. A visit can take about 1h30 of your time, The park in front of the museum in very nice and is surrounded by other nice Art deco buildings. You can have a bite and relax in the interior space after your visit.

title: Beautiful photos with stunning colour
review: A welcome distraction on Lincoln Road from the usual cafes and shops. Great landscape photography in a lovely gallery.

title: EXPLENDID ARCHITECTURE!
review: I adored appreciating the shape of the gardens and its acoustics, besides its archicteture. Stay there as much as you can, enjoying as the fabulous details of the buildings.

title: 1st time in South Beach
review: Did not go in, building and grounds impressive and Wednesday evenings they show a film on the building for anyone to watch

title: Great place to hangout
review: You cannot miss the giant roosters. Good place to take a stroll and experience the local culture and cuisines. Try the local ice-cream shops.

title: Interesting Small Museum in Miami Beach
review: The Bass is an interesting small museum with very friendly staff. It has a mixed collection including some very nice 16th - 18th century paintings and other objects in a somewhat whimsical display setting. There were several large contemporary exhibits upstairs as well.

title: A great way of spending at least half a day with your kids in a "museum"
review: With a 2 and an 8 year old one, it isn't always easy to find something which "works" for both. As our son said at the end of the day: "It was really fun, in the beginning I wasn't sure but there was lot's of things I still was able to do!" That's our 8 year old one. I would suggest, the museum is perfect for kids until 5 - 6. But still, when 8 you will still find things to do. Except the playground, everything is indoor. Nothing really, where you child get's wet, so no need to bring extra clothing, even water proofed jackets are available for some of the activities. If you have been to the children museum in Vancouver, you will find this museum smaller but it is still big enough to spend 3 - 5 hours here. By than, your child is ready for a break. Lot's of interaction, learning by doing and hands on equipment. We all had fun and it was a great attraction. One thing you need to consider: 20 USD per person plus 1 USD per hour parking. There is a Subway attached as a "food" option but there are as well picnic areas outside, if you prefer to bring your own food. Enjoy and have fun.

title: Beautiful
review: This is a made of coral and is fed by spring water, cold but refreshing.It has a cafeteria. It is a great place to take the children,has nice white sand for them to play It is in Coral Gables that in itself is a very nice city.

title: Attended the ABC continuity forum
review: Attended  the ABC continuity forum and it was the first time I was in there! The place is beautiful. The stage was set for speakers like Adrianna Huffington and more and the catered lunch food was delicious.

title: Orange Bowl Catstrophe
review: If you read other reviews you will find the same. But there is no way to describe the level of disorganization and under disrespect for those who attends the event by whoever is in charge.

title: Closed for renovation but looking forward to the opening
review: I have seen some top notch exhibitions of important Art over the years. The last I remember was Picasso's sketches. Long before wonderful Art Basel Miami Beach was lucky to have this gem of a museum.

title: The msueum of art
review: The Bass Museum is a modern building built in 1960s and renovated from the inside out as a masterpiece. The museum has lots of the finest arts designed by world famous artists. There are classes where you can make your own art. You can request a tour guide or come here with your family, friends or even your school if you live in Miami.

title: PICTURE PERFECT
review: A huge Venetian style swimming pool made of coral. Worth visiting, swim, getting a tan or rent for a party.

title: Jr lifeguard Summer camp & tennis camp
review: A beautiful historic landscape in a beautiful city that is poorly serviced at best and horribly mismanaged.   The staff are the reason this review reflects a poor experience on what is such a special place.  Specifically those employees affiliated yo the summer camp programs.  The children attending are neglected and left to their own devise.   Be wary of the Jr. Lifeguard summer program and tennis splash camp.

title: Adorable!!!!
review: I just loved this place. Nice shops open air shopping, both high fashion brands and some others like anthropologie or j crew. Great dinni g options!!! Villagio great italian food!

title: Lovely views
review: The park's location is rich in history. The view of the bay and port is impressive. The park itself is not very green, with a lot of concrete and benches. There were a few homeless sleeping the day I walked the park, but I felt safe and unharrassed. Typical of a big city park. Free transportation is close....the Trolley and Metro.

title: Work in art
review: Worked an event there and it was pleasantly nice. With a few more adjustments that they are currently working on, I imagine they will reopen with a bang.

title: Seafood Festival
review: Overall, a wonderful day and I'll be going back for the next seafood festival.

title: Rip off
review: Honestly if you are a coral gables resident I can see how this place would be a great choice for you local pool but for someone who isn't a resident this place is way overpriced.  I would have gave it 3 stars but for the price.....got it a 1 star rating.  $50 for my daughter who is 7 my son who is 3 and me just for admission.  The amenities are ok.  Just a big pool with decent scenery.  The pool is run by a bunch of kids.   I think the oldest employee I saw there was maybe 28 and he seemed to be one of the head lifeguards.  Between my girlfriend her two kids, me and my two kids plus food we spent over $150.  Pretty  ridiculous.  Oh and don't get me started on the food line.  It took 30 minutes to get through the line of 7 kids in front of us.  Save your money and go to the Biltmore Hotel for a nice pool or CB Smith park for a great small water park.

title: Great performance space
review: Beautiful concert hall with young musicians and a diverse repertoire. There is 360 degree seating and projection walls.  It was a unique and entertaining way to see and hear classical music.

title: Great for walk and relax!
review: And if you want to shopping or eat something........Bayside is right next to it!

title: Pretty place
review: Nice place to chill out fir a while... good food good music not enoght bathrooms but nice and clean going back again

title: What a gem in the middle of South Beach
review: Her knowledge of Peter's work is second to known and she is such an asset to the gallery

title: Miami Beach or Miami B....??
review: So  as far as the title of this review goes, Miami Beach or Miami B...., well I will take Broward County.

title: Pretty cool
review: Lots of primates and wildlife.  Can get close to the animals and feed them.  If you want to get extra close and play with them/feed them/it'll cost you an extra $90 a person, which I thought was a little steep.  But still a good way to spend a morning or afternoon while in the area if you like this kind of thing.

title: Old South Florida
review: A trip back in time. Beautiful grounds and views of the bay. Best time to visit is during the annual Seafood Fest. Lots of activities and great local seafood. Always a good idea to have the DEET at the ready as the skeeders  can be brutal..

title: Inexpensive Park on the water
review: The Deering Estate is a quiet little park on the open water.  View the home of the Deering family, or walk through the park and enjoy the wildlife and beautiful palm trees.  They are only open from 10am to 4pm, but makes for a good weekend visit.  They offer events throughout the year to check out - live concerts, bird walks, kayak trips and etc.  A very enjoyable place to visit for a relaxing afternoon.

title: Beautiful landscape, grounds
review: I have visited often for the views of the outside grounds and also many events.  Building interiors not so interesting but outside (especially in the back) the grounds and view are breathtaking.  Event of Feb 14, 2017 though was totally disappointing.    Entertainers were NOT good.  From previous events I had expected a good show. Entertainers, sad to say, performed as if it was their first performance.  Music did not fit the occasion. Had high expectations, received poor entertainment. Definitely not up to The Deering Estate's reputation and past events.

title: Cool and Classic
review: We were in Miami/Coral Gables and killing a little time while waiting for a dinner reservation at the Biltmore. The Miracle Mile was packed so we went by the Venetian Pool. Really cool but a little expensive if you just want to walk around for a bit. That being said, it is quite the experience and I recommend it to anyone visiting the area. However, I would try to make a day of it as opposed to just a quick stroll around.

title: See the Building!
review: The new building is something to see even on the outside. Sometimes there is a free simulcast outside in the connected park area. A must see area near Lincoln road

title: Visitors and locals should all visit the New World Center
review: Visitors and locals should all visit the New World Center, home of the New World Symphony. An architectural wonder and state of the art facility with an impressive mission statement. Tours are offered on Tuesdays and Thursdays. They last for about 30 to 45 minutes for a small fee of $5 per person.

title: Great place to lay back have a few drinks.
review: Here at Merrick Park, there are many great restaurants like The Yard house. You will be able to enjoy Drinks, great food and Music. You also have a great deal of other restaurants around the area, and many shops to walk around after a few drinks.

title: Loving the new "Rock" to enjoy the Canes' games
review: As season ticket holders see have seen the transformation of..Joe Robie, Pro Player, Land Shark...lost count. Hope it stays as the Hard Rock for years to come. They have  greatly improved the seats, concessions & club level seats. The staff it s very friendly with everyone and helpful to guide folks around.

title: Need Cigars?
review: If you need cigars, or have a burning desire to watch older folks play dominoes, this is the place to go to. Otherwise, not much to see here as far as I could tell.

title: You Can Park Here
review: Bayfront Park is located adjacent to Downtown Miami abutting Bayside Marketplace. Quiet park with amazing views of the bay.

title: A Cultural Changeup
review: Nice but short immersion into the Cuban culture.  A proud people. Some nice ice cream and coffee shops as well as cigar specialty shops.

title: Tourist area for food and tours
review: A nice enough area and great for simple burger food, tourist tat, and getting all tour or two.  Not amazingly pretty park area but well looked after. Some good live music and dancing, and lots of buzz so nice to wonder along beside the water. Lots of restaurants and shops.

title: nothing worthy
review: gold???  Marino, and a super mini permanent exhibition ... i wonder why you call this a museum to my additional disappointment about my miami the bass museum was the top, well a visit is ok if you had enough of sunbathing ......

title: Always amazing during art Basel week
review: Always amazing things here. Be sure to go and see the great works and artists featured during the art Basel week. Or just after as the artwork stays for a whole

title: Kids fun
review: Kids can do everything they want here and have fun with games to play, rides, and children's activities. This is a great place to bring your children. Perfect for all ages too.

title: Best combination of fun and learning for kids!!!
review: My four-year old loved this museum... she went to every section twice. The concept of the museum combines learning with fun. The museum is divided into sections where kids can learn about their world : going to the grocery (they can their own shopping and checkout), the bank, different types of energy : solar, heat, water, ), the thomas and train exhibit, construction, under sea adventures, going on a boat. The most exciting thing is that whereas in a typical museum you just observe, in this museum there is a lot of activities involved for smaller children including drawing and crafts, touching, playing. The volounteers were also very helpful and pleasant. If you have a very curious child like mine, prepare to stay for hours there :).

title: Great place to keep your babies busy but lack of food.
review: Great place to go with your kids to keep them busy at least for 4-5 hours, you can easily spend here that much time. We used to visit with our son who is 2 years and 2 month and he was really happy and it was a lot of fun for him. The only one reason I give 4 stars to that place is there are no other place instead of Subway to feed your kids, I think it should be more variations of food, and Subway is not the healthy way to feed the toddlers.

title: Lots of fun
review: Really nice place for kids, we stayed there for like 4 hours, the kids were having fun all the time. Many educative toys, things to touch, to feel, to listen, music, books, sports. I just recommend to check if there will not be any school at the day. Schools have lots of kids which kind of monopolize the rooms, which is not so great. Specially in my case, where my kids don't speak english. Food is also something not very nice.

title: A great place for kids to explore their dreams!
review: Kids can play and explore all their soul's desires. It is certainly a must do with the kids. What a better way to get them even more excited about school! That alone is worth the trip!

title: A gem on the north end of South Beach
review: Contemporary exhibits in an older art deco building.  There was just enough to see without being overwhelmed.  The grounds featured sculpture as well. Paid $8. admission.

title: Lovely museum
review: Several very good temporary exhibits: I saw the Gold exhibit and the Peter Marino. Both were very impressive and informative. The setting is very attractive and the outdoor sculptures were great. So glad I visited.

title: Fresh look at contemporary
review: It's a nicely done small museum with nice park like grounds. The exhibit was well done  and enjoyable. Enjoyed the sculptures on the grounds out front also. Staff was a bit detached when selling us the ticket.

title: cool place to hang out
review: fun, and walk friendly which is rare in miami... water front seating area, where you can watch the boats and harbour and the miami cruises leave... lots of shops, restauarants and plenty of places to roam around the sea front..

title: Awesome place!
review: Located next to the Intercontinental Hotel, so it  it is convenient.  Lots of restaurants and great place to people watch.  It is very clean and has a great garden area.  Homeless people do sleep there at night, but no problems.

title: Nice park with good skyline views.!!
review: This park is primarily famous for events so you got to be prepared for parking nearby beforehand. You can visit this park anytime of the day to relax and njoy some really good views of miami downtown highrise n the bay .

title: Great street to walk, and watch all Cuban, and Latin American activities....
review: Enjoy the best Cuban Restaurants, cafes, music, stores, markets, art galleries, murals, cigars, whatever you are looking for, even a Domino Park.... and there are Festivals in this street, too.

title: A must if you are visiting Miami!!!
review: Calle Ocho takes you to a little bit of Cuba. From the cigar rollers to the music in the street. You can get souvenirs or grab a mojito or two at the Ball and Chains! Watch salsa dancers and maybe dance a little if you can move your hips lol.

title: If you really have nothing to do or if you wish to buy cheap gifts
review: If you have a few hours of nothing to do, this is a place where you can spend time walking on a street with dozens of cheap restaurants, cigar shops, a few turist traps. Not a very clean place. Old folks playing dominos or walking down the street. There is a Dollar Tree store where you can buy anything for a dollar. You can talk to people and find out about their lives back in Cuba if you are interested.

title: Great Stadium
review: Caught a Dolphin game on their home turn for the first time and it was great. We had seats on the corner of the end zone with a great view of the field. Plenty of food options in the stadium, but I didn't see much outside due to the residential area. Parking looked like a mess, but we Ubered in and out without much hassle. I hope to get back there soon.

title: Taylor Swift Reputation Tour
review: This was the best exit I've ever had out of a stadium after a concert. It took a quarter of the time it takes to get out of most stadiums after shows. I was really impressed!

title: What an experience
review: I watched he Miami Dolphins play the Raiders (28-20 to the fins). The stadium is so good. Staff so helpful and friendly and loads of food and drink to choose from. Amazing venue.

title: this sucks for college games
review: the way the stadium sets up for college is totally wrong they amplify the sound of music constantly and it takes away from the college experience for the fans , they forget we are not there to hear guns and roses or hip hop we want to hear the sounds of the bands the student the refs the mascot etc.. also the pricing for food and beverages is the same as the pro games, exp 5 dollars for bottle water is ridiculous 12 dollars or more for a beer is also sick not to mention the price of food

title: Worth a visit
review: If you are on a budget you can't buy anything here.  There are mostly expensive-high branded stores. But you have VS and others that you can get some good deals.  It is a beautiful open mall in a high class neighborhood

title: Shopping in the City Beautiful
review: A shoppers delight... a day at the Village Of Merrick Park will not be your typical shopping experience the beauty & surroundings will enhance your experience &  your tastebuds will thank you

title: Great place to shop
review: I go here whenever I am in Miami. It's beautiful and the stores are fabulous. Free parking in the garage if you get your ticket stamped.

title: Very pleasant place - a little bit hidden...
review: Hidden in a block of houses you are suddenly standing in an open more or less park surrounded be very nice and luxury boutiques (Tiffany, H.Stern, Diane v Furstenberg, Nordstrom, ....) and restaurants. Not all of the restaurants are high-priced. So even if you don't want to go shopping, just sit down and watch the scenery!

title: amazing!
review: my daughter and I caught an outside concert, everyone took chairs, towels and enjoyed a free concert.

title: Great events
review: Some great addition to South Beaches usual lack of cultural experience. Modern DJ's mix with classical music - very cool.

title: 2013 ABC Continuity Forum
review: I attended the 2013 ABC Continuity Forum at the New World Symphony building designed by Frank Gehry. What an amazing place with wonderful staff, beautiful views, and an amazing outdoor area. You should make your way over to this amazing center if you are in the area!

title: Beautiful setting!
review: The pool was created in 1923-24 from a coral rock quarry, where much of the original coral rock was used to border and accentuate the pool. It was part of the Grand Plan George Merrick had for the City of Coral Gables. I started going as a teenager and went back with my children years later. It is always a magical place to swim.

title: More than a pool!
review: It is truly an unforgettable experience!

title: Adorable but under construction
review: Got a decent peek at this.  It was great to see it without people there but did not get a full sense of its wonder.  So glad to see they have renovated it to keep it functional.  Truly lovely!

title: Recovery heaven
review: I came down to Coral Gables to visit my parents after my IRONMAN RACE in Haines city. Decided to relax and recover at Venetian pool. It was the perfect temperature to take a short swim to workout all my tight muscles. The water fall did wonders on my tense neck as I let the water massage my neck and back muscles. Just relaxing under the palm trees after my swim was wonderful. The little sand beach is a added bonus to this already unique pool. Not having chlorine in the pool was a plus! Can't wait for my next visit.  The price of admission can come down but otherwise it's a great spot to visit.

title: Rare, Beautiful Old Florida
review: This historic estate brings you right up on the bay with ocean breezes and gorgeous Royal Palms. Just when you can't take the claustrophobia of Coconut Grove another minute, drive down here for some fresh air and a taste of another era. The grounds are beautiful, the houses are nice to walk through. $12 per person for either self tour or guided tour (about an hour).

title: Small place, nice architecture
review: If touring you don't need more than an hour here, it does have nice architecture and landscape but it is not near anything and I would recommend Vizcaya Gardens prior. This is nice on the water as well but not as big or grand as Vizcaya.

title: You have to feed the monkeys
review: This place is expensive because they cater to and care for the monkey's here. Their enclosures are huge, and very fitting in regards to truly giving an animal a worthy captive life. For this, I can overlook the price. For many, what can only make it worth it is experiencing what I described above. Which was for both me (animal lover) and my husband (not so much) a truly fun and amazing experience. Don't forget to take video and pictures, especially if you have kids.

title: Great for our 11- and 15-year olds
review: I agree that it is expensive, but totally worth the visit. Do the guided hands-on feeding inside the rain forest. Extra money, but really worth it.

title: I was hesitant and I LOVED this place
review: I was hesitant to come here because I don't much care for zoos. I really didn't want to see a situation where animals were living in bad conditions. We went to ZooMiami last year and I absolutely hated it. But this place is small and family run. The primates get good attention and care and loads of free range space. The environment is similar to their natural habitats and all of them (except the oran and gorilla) get time to amble about in the acreage. The oran and gorilla, which I would usually hate to see in captivity, are there because they cannot live elsewhere with other apes or in the wild (the gorilla, King, had his teeth pulled out by a circus years ago). So this place operates as a sanctuary for the primates (and many birds) that cannot live elsewhere.

title: Hey, Hey We're the Monkeys!
review: Over the top caring staff made this trip worthwhile. We went at 3pm and made it to 3 of the shows. We have a service dog. The monkeys are threatened by dogs so they made arrangements for our dog to stay in the office while we visited. You can tell the staff loves working here and they care about the animals. Around 4pm is feeding time and we loved watching the tortoises and rhino iguana getting fed a big salad. You should bring quarters to buy sunflower seeds for monkeys who will pull up the chain operated dumb waiter with the seeds to eat. King is the silver backed gorilla who is very picky about his iced-tea and loves Ellen D see YouTube!

title: Art Basel Week
review: You must come with us to Art Basel Miami week at least once in your life.  The art is amazing, and you are the first of your friends to experience it, as New Yorkers usually have to wait until July for the Scope Art week.

title: Very hard to find parking
review: I work there for a little while and always had such a hard time to find parking. It  will literately make my morning miserable. I suggest if any one s heading there leave early, you'll need at least 30 minutes to loose driving around to find a decent parking space.

title: Nice Meeting Location
review: Easy to get too, nice open corridors, easy access to Lincoln Street for eating, what more could you want with the great weather?

title: Great venue on a large scale
review: Needs a little refurb to become more state of the art, but is great for major conferences and trade shows.

title: Peter Lik's Gallery
review: Beautiful and amazing gallery! Peter Lik's work is amazing, his photos will take you away to another place.  It is a gallery not to be missed.

title: Beautifull photos!!!
review: When we strolled down through Lincoln Road we noticed the pictures and couldnt resist going inside. We where greeted by an awsome guy that gave us a lesson on peter lik's history and showed us the way light affects the picture. If you're around please stop by. You wont regret it

title: Photos of one of the best photographers
review: It's a place you need to visit when you have the chance, it's overwhelming what one can do with talent and techniques and show places in this wonderful way.

title: Always visit when in Miami
review: Love Peter Lik's photography.  We have visited several of his galleries every time we are near one.  One day I will own one!

title: Expensive, plastic and simple experience
review: We spent 3,5 hours inside and that was enough. I would say this museum is not worth of money. But in rainy day it's one of expensive choices to spend day inside.

title: Good plan for families with kids
review: Off course this place is for families with littles children. Perfect for a rainy day in miami. Without beach it's a good option for kids

title: Wonderful place, but better for kids over 5. A bit pricey as adults pay full fare.
review: try to avoid the days they have school visit, because i had the experience and its a bit crazy! specially because the kids are bigger and as i had a small kid he was pushed and i had to keep an eye and talk to their scorts to pay attention.

title: Fun fun fun
review: Remote control boats, public store, emergency room, fire truck, cruise ship, and so much more.  If your kids need a break from the beach or high-end shopping this is the place.  Hours of things to do.

title: A fun day for everyone!
review: Cafeteria onsite. Easy parking. This museum it's huge and have too much for our children to enjoy!

title: What would you expect?
review: The infrastructure is great, but the content is laughable.  So small you can see everything in less than 15 min.

title: Closed untill october 2016...
review: walked to this museum only to find that it is  closed for renovation, the small park in front of it seems to be a new home for quite a few home less people sleeping under the trees...but there are a couple of sculptures in front .

title: Fantastic
review: The grounds are amazing, the building a treat and the art simply fantastic. Great job to the staff and to the city

title: I like it
review: Small museum with interesting exhibitions. Currently closed to get revamped until fall. Mummy. In South Beach across the W.

title: Do not miss when it opens again
review: My husband and I visited this museum before it closed .It really was a great experience to see this small special place.The show we saw was Peter Marino called One Way.The show explored the renowned American architects multifaceted relationship with art.Very created show.The rooms filled with interesting photos and art.One room was very special because it had Opera.We sat down and heard and saw opera singers on the walls.It was very special.When the museum opens again do not miss it.

title: so-so
review: I visited the place because I saw its pictures on a web. Honestly, nothing special in my opinionm but, there are a few spots from where you can take a few nice pictures.

title: Breathtaking Bayfront
review: Another beauty in the vibrant city that is Miami. This well kept park is stunning to walk through, relax and photograph. With many well known restaurants, bars and great night spots adjacent, it truly is a beautiful bay.

title: Pretty and clean public park by the water!
review: - Don't come expecting a signature landmark or a wow-worthy moment. It's a clean and pretty park that lots of locals spend time in.

title: Over-rated
review: Nothing special about the area and rather dirty. Usual fast food diners and a few Cuban cafes cum bars. There was an air of touristic hopefulness but without some serious product definition, the area is not worth the effort to visit.

title: 5 photos and goodbye
review: It certainly isn’t Cuba and the real Havana - it’s just a street with Hispanic names in Miami.

title: Fun to walk around
review: Fun walking area with tons of nice shops and restaurants.  What amazed me was the people working the area do not have I-got-to-sell attitude at all.  Very friendly and nice.   Nice row of mini studios will open new shops across the Ball and Chain.

title: Worth a look
review: We nipped here on the bus from downtown. Stayed about an hour and half. Fun vibes good place to grab a mojito and listen to some live music during the day but that's about it really.

title: Good food, dodgy neighbourhood
review: Apart from the two cuban food institutions located in this street (Versailles and La Carreta) there seemed to be nothing special in the area.  I'd keep away unless you are craving for cuban food.

title: Fantastic venue for home or away fans
review: I’d recommend a trip to any NFL game at this amazing stadium.

title: Pretty Good Stadium For Its Age.
review: Arrived at the G cash parking lot at about $10:30 by taking the Turnpike down from Lauderdale. Parking is $40. but if you have a Sunpass the fee is only $25 charged to the Sunpass. Very easy getting in and tail gating was going strong in the very hot parking lot. Decided to head in 11:30 ish. There are  2 roads in between the parking lot and the stadium which caused minor delays getting to the other side of the road. Why there aren't pedestrian bridges are tunnels to ease the vehicle and people traffic is kinda stupid. Once at the NorthEast Gate things went smooth. The bag checks were smooth and fast. The actual ticket takers are turnstile machines with code readers.  All the levels have escalators to make the trip up easy. Once up on the 300 Level there was a spacious breezy deck due to the recent  rehab job.   Sitting in Section 218 was great and the whole stadium appeared to have great sight lines.  Overall  I thought the place was great. Now the minuses. There are not nearly enough monitors in the areas under the stands. The lines at the concessions and restrooms were pretty long. It also seems that a lot of the locals buy the cheapest tickets they can and then sit in better seats until the valid ticket holder show ups. This is very annoying and reminds me of a game of musical chairs. Finally, I'll mention  that they sell the souvenir cup for soda with unlimited refills, just like Tampa.

title: Pre-buy parking
review: If attending a Dolphins game, you should drive to the stadium a day before to buy a parking ticket, cause it's about half the price (25 $) than on gameday (40 $).

title: Love it, Fins Up!
review: My goodness, the Dolphins sure do know how to put on a football game.  Nothing compares, it's a total party and everyone is cool and laid back.

title: Lions bs Dolphins
review: Stadium was great. Too a lift in and had to make a short walk. Problem and I do mean BS the directions to ride share are confusing and not correct. Police stop Uber and lift drivers for the benefit of cabs. Who takes a cab anymore really. Had to walk at least a mile to get access to a lift. What a away to wreck a good day we had at the game. Simply stated worst experience ever getting out of a stadium!

title: Beautiful open space mall.
review: Plenty of stores and restaurants as said, mostly upscale, but not snobbish like Bal Harbor. This is one of my favorite areas in Miami and of course my wife could spend a whole day in and out the stores..:)

title: Good Ambient
review: The price was fair.

title: Good variety of eateries
review: A bit inland if you're a tourist on the beach, but worth the drive for a chance of pace.  Great eateries and shopping plus parking (not free) available.  For us locals its a great family, or date night get away.

title: Favorite shopping spot
review: Merrick Park has become my favorite place in town. I come here very often with my family. It's a lovely outdoor mall with fantastic shops.

title: Great shopping experience.
review: The village is beautiful, very well kept and clean. There's also a good variety of shopping/eating places. The Christmas tree lighting ceremony is a must. Thanks

title: A true cultural asset for Miami
review: The New World Symphony is a pre-professional training orchestra for young musicians, overseen and led since its founding by Michael Tilson Thomas. It is THE premiere such orchestra in America. But providing the young musicians a living stipend and free housing, and by providing the highest level of training and performance experience, the New World Symphony attracts the finest young musicians in American graduating from conservatories. The orchestra plays almost at the level of a great professional orchestra, and with an enthusiasm and emotinal involvement that can surpass professional orchestras. An all Tchaikovky concert heard on February 1, 2014, featuring the "Pathetique" Symphony, was a thrilling experience. Anyone who loves symphonic music, and who wants to experience the future of classical music in America, should see and hear this orchestra - particularly in their wonderful new hall.

title: A pearl in the middle of the chaos of SoBe
review: totally recommend, specially to take kids to appreciate music.

title: Tour of the NW Symphony building
review: Very interesting to learn the history of this group and see the inside of this magnificent building designed by Frank Gehry.  This is a gem in South Beach.  Tours are only offered on Saturdays and Tuesdays.

title: Wallcast concert floored us!
review: Terrific weather, hotel towels as seating, and some of the greatest FREE music we've heard - Mozart and Vivaldi under the stars.  If you're visiting South Beach, check the calendar to see if they're doing this when you're in town.

title: Stay home :(
review: We thought this place had some amenities or activities to justify a $50 admission (1 adult, 2 kids.) It was a cold pool with many camp kids and no alcohol ... horrible combination!! The scenery was pretty and the rocks were cool, but my community pool has that.  The best part was the pretty drive through coral gables. Worst part: the cost and concession stand that was so slow and unprepared that I needed a beer  to tolerate ... oh wait ....

title: Excellent pool and waterfalls
review: Absolutely beautiful pool. Loved the waterfalls. This pool fills early so get there early. At capacity a sign is hung up that the pool is full and you cannot enter. We looked through the fence to see it. Wished we could of swam there. An it expensive but on vacation worth it.

title: Too late to swim
review: Once the pool reaches capacity, it is closed. I appreciate the safety concerns for the guests. This is a beautiful pool built reminiscent of Venice with waterfalls and made to transport you away. It is beautifully landscaped and well supervised. The lines were long and it is a little pricey for a swim ($25-$35).

title: BESTpool ever!
review: Haven't been in years since I no longer live in S.Florida. I grew up going to this pool, it is the best one I've ever been too. Beaches, cliffs, caves, picnic area and snack bar. Everything you need to have a great day at the pool. It doesn't even look like a pool, looks like an exotic lagoon..if you've never been, you need to check it out!

title: Afternoon of Leisure
review: Spent several afternoons at the Deering Estate.  Great place to tour the houses, spend the afternoon by the water drinking wine and snacks.  Great view of the ocean, historic house and enjoyable surroundings.  Don't miss the annual Seafood Festival and Jazz under the stars-great events.

title: Manatees and More
review: This is a wonderful place to hike, see beautiful historic buildings and see Manatees in a man-made inlet.  Have a wonderful time exploring the estate grounds.

title: Beautiful tourist spot in coral gables
review: Nice picture spot full of history. A gem in Miami. Fantastic home and surrounding estate is worth a few hours of exploration. A must do in Miami.

title: Poor man's Vizcaya
review: One of the most interesting features was the basement wine cellar that was behind a bank vault door.  The 4000 bottle wine cellar was flooded by a hurricane in 1945, and the value door remained sealed shut for many years. The combination was finally broken in 1985 by a safecracker who was brought in.

title: Cute monkeys not worth the money
review: Very small jungle but the monkeys are very cute. It's overpriced for the facility and space not worth the admission fees. The baby monkeys are adorable though
It's out in the middle of no where.

title: Feeding monkeys raisins is almost worth the price of admission
review: It is so much fun watching these monkeys drop dishes at you from above, asking for food. Put a few raisins in the dish and they eagerly pull the chain up, eat them, drop it back down, and shake it at you if you stop paying attention to them. They can't be fooled, though; put a non-food item in there and they won't touch it. There are some informative exhibits as well, such as King, the gorilla who loves to watch "Frozen," and the feeding in which tons of monkeys come out and go into the water to retrieve hard boiled eggs, etc. Admission is steep, though, and the park is rather far off the beaten path.

title: Monkeys, monkeys, and more monkeys
review: Loads of fun,you are in the cage, monkeys are running around loose all around you. You can feed them.

title: Great time for the family
review: Great place to get up close and personal with some very cool Monkey's.  My boys, 2 and 4 had a blast feeding the monkey's and running around the vast park.  The exhibits were great and the educational shows were actually fun.  You get to look around at your own pace and really just enjoy the animals in their habitat.  It's a great family adventure and I'd recommend it to anyone who wants to experience something outside of your prototypical zoo.

title: Art Basel
review: One of the great art events of the world is held at this venue every December turning into one of the great museums of in the world. It's lacking some of the facilities other centers have.

title: Miami Beach Convention Center
review: The location might be a little far from the airport, but that makes it nearer the Ocean. It is very big with many food spots, bathrooms and rest areas. The center takes on the show it is hosting, as the Boat show with it's outside and water, or the Automobile show. It's a good venue.

title: Art Basel - What else can you say
review: The convention center is getting a bit long in the tooth, and could use some more restrooms. On the other hand, we were there for the Art, not the convention center. The CC is close enough to lots of hotels, big and small that you can walk, which is very nice.

title: International Motorcycle Show
review: I rate it 4 out of 5 because parking is not as good as it could be

title: 80's Convention Center
review: TIP: Walk 3 blocks to Lincoln Ave for lunch.

title: LOVED it
review: Great gallery - we stumbled upon it while we were walking on Lincoln Road. LOVE it - his work is absolutely stunning!  A very nice little detour

title: A definite stop on Lincoln Road!
review: Beautiful landscape photo gallery on Lincoln Road-- definitely worth a stop as you stroll by. A great place to loose yourself in every photograph. Peter is truly an amazing photographer, bringing light and depth to every scene from deserts to ocean views to deep wooded forests. This is definitely one place on Lincoln not to miss!

title: AMAZING PHOTOGRAPHS
review: We went to get out of the heat (95 degrees) and we found this beautiful gallery with amazing photographs exhibiting the wonders of the world.  Worth stopping into the gallery, even in cool weather!

title: High End Photography
review: alone or with family it is a great getaway.

title: Meh
review: Although the photos are spectacular, this wouldnt be a place for art lovers, as the presentation is a bit over-stating things.

title: Amazing place for kids!
review: My family had a blast here!  We could have stayed here for hours.  We came on a week day so it was full of school groups until lunch time.

title: Awesome way to spend the day!
review: Visited with my three kids, we all loved it! So much to see and do, and very reasonable priced. Great way to spend the day in Miami!

title: An Absolut Great Place!!!
review: Great place and Great price specially if you live in Miami or you are with someone that lives in Miami you will have your resident discount. My daughter enjoyed this place very much we walked every inch of it. She loved to fish, ride the fire truck and loved the supermarket and specially enjoyed being the cashier. Even us the adults enjoyed the place.  I highly recommend this place if you are planning to go to Miami with your children.

title: 3 and 4 year old
review: I would have given 5 star if it wasent for the stiff price 80 dollars for 2 kids and to adults. The kids loved it and we stayed for 5 hours.

title: Very interactive- Must go to!
review: This museum is great in that it teaches kids about different professions and is very hands on with allowing them to explore the functions these professions do. It is almost a play ground within a museum. They have a small restaurant and gift shop, but the food is okay. Would eat elsewhere. Great activity for a hot day in Miami!

title: Interesting if you haven't been to big museums before
review: This museum is worth an hour or so of your time.  Experienced museum goers may be bored.  There isn't that much available to view, a lot of the art is local artisans.

title: Under Renovation in 2016
review: Located at 23rd Street and Collins Ave....

title: closed till fall
review: the Bass Museum, one go the centers of contemporary arts and the well known Art Basel-Miami, is being enlarged for the moments. Go for it anyway, and have a nice walk around the Collins Park where the Museum is situated. You'll find there a whole bunche of nice

title: Great little museum.
review: This is a fun place for Art Deco fans to visit. They have some nice collections and the museum is small enough that you have time to see it and still get to the beach.

title: Relaxing and cool
review: So yeah spend some time here to relax cool down, and take in a sun set or two.

title: Beautiful views
review: Just wanted some alone time and this was a great spot to people watch and still be within earshot of the music in the mall.

title: Downtown Park
review: I liked everything about this park, it’s downtown along the bay near hotels, the metro mover stops, Bayside Market place and has lovely bay views - there’s a balance of concrete and green space to enjoy for joggers and walkers, the bay water views were relaxing and calming for me personally - park benches are scattered through and I thought the palm trees were a nice touch, we didn’t use the restrooms but they are there, small but great use of space.

title: Nice Walk with a little History
review: This was our first place to visit when we arrived in Miami. It was a short walk from our hotel. The scenery was good with the river walk or the bay walk. We learned a lot about the founders of Miami and would recommend it as the market and bus is all in the same area.

title: Yep.  Tick.  Done.
review: Like so many of these places, worth a stop off on a sight-seeing bus but not worth the money or effort of a special trip.

title: Tamiami Trail
review: This is the oldest road in Miami. It is also called the Tamiami Trail. It is full of retro shops, and it’s just a fun drive.

title: People Either Get It, Or They Don’t...
review: Don’t be mislead... Take a TOUR and see for yourself why Calle Ocho is arguably the beating cultural heart of the City of Miami...!

title: This neighborhood is so much fun!
review: This turned out to be one of my favorite parts of my Miami Beach Vacation. It is filled with a lot of art, color, music and wonderful places to eat. I think the people here are very friendly and interesting. I wish I had time to visit in the evening because I'm sure it would have been even more lively but during the day, I still had a wonderful time.

title: Little Havana....
review: Now if you want a little of that Cuban culture feel with the food and the music and the shops, definitely go to Calle Ocho.  There is also a Domino Park where people sit at and play Dominos or chess in the day and have tournaments..of course there are Cuban cigar stores.  Night life is abundant and the music is loud and fun and people are in the streets and there is no place to park if you get there too late..it gets crowded at night on the weekend !  So I would definitely go out and explore in the day and maybe come back at night for a different flavor!

title: Lions v. Dolphins
review: Nice stadium.  We had access to the bars at ground level that we highly recommend.  One word of caution.  If you do not want to bake in the hot southern Florida sun, buy your seats on the Dolphins side of the field.

title: Stadium is very nice and easy to get around in.
review: If you are going get a parking pass ahead of time and it is simple once you are in to find a spot. The stadium is very nice with plenty of bathrooms and food places. It's not cheap but it's comparable to other stadiums as well. The seats are all good just be ready for the sun! The club level is good and you can usually find someone willing to part with their upgraded tickets to allow you to get up there.

title: Bills at Dolphins game
review: If you are sensitive to heat be aware that the sun blazes on the visitors side- the stadium provides lightweight sun shields which are definitely helpful. One of my friends on the other side snuck a pic of me melting and using it to cover my head (not its intended use ).

title: Bills vs Dolphins
review: Very well organized stadium, not the newest but very comfortable, Very nice people helping you find your way.

title: Great Stadium, but hard to get out
review: I surprised my wife for our anniversary, after our cruise, with tickets to watch her favorite football team, the Patriots vs the Dolphins.  The game was played at the Hard Rock Stadium.  It is a great venue, but the employees there need more training in location of there amenities.  We were looking for the "main" Dolphins store to purchase souvenirs.  The problem with that is we asked several employees how to get to it and were given the wrong location several times and a couple of employees did not know where it was located.  After doing a lap around the stadium and checking some of the smaller team shops, finally we found a younger Male employee who knew how to get to the main store.  After purchasing our souvenirs we proceeded to "TRY" and leave the stadium and make our way back to our hotel.  Again we asked employees where to go to catch a ride.  We were informed it is a 20mins walk to the end of the stadium in the "ride share" area.  We walked to this area then after talking to other spectators and finally being informed by an employee that we had to walk down the street and make a left turn as only taxis were allowed access to this location.  We started walking with other spectators to this location. After getting to this location and seeing that it was also blocked off by police/security.  Security officer told us we needed to walk farther just past an underpass then cross the street and wait by a school.  So now 1 hour after leaving the stadium and waiting and walking, we arrived at the school and saw at least 50 other people waiting for rides Lyft or Uber. Both companies increased their rates by up to 150%, very nice of them!!!  The first driver we called did not speak English very well, so after calling him several times and not being able to communicate with him, he decided not to show up because he could not find the pick up point.  This happened to several other people.  We had to call for another driver.  It is now dark out and this is not the best/safest area to be waiting.  A couple of guys came up to us and offered to drive us back to our hotel, we politely declined as they were not in a vehicle at the time.  A taxi driver offered to drive us for $100, over 3x times the cost of a Lyft or Uber.  Our driver finally showed up and we made it back to our hotel over 3 hours after the game had ended.  What should have been a fun experience was ruined by employees who need more training, the need for a "marked" and "designated" area for Lyft/Uber rides and ride share companies not raising prices by 150%.  Will not being going back to this stadium any time soon.  In hindsight, it might have been a better idea to drive to the game and pay the $33 parking fee, at least we would be in a vehicle and not waiting in a seedy neighborhood that is not well lite and hard to find for ride share drivers.  Would have taken pictures to submit, but I was on my phone...

title: Great place to shop
review: What a treat!  Nice town feeling with great shops. Very convenient. The place has loads of clothing store stores and restaurants. The only down side is you have to pay for parking.

title: Nice place to shop and dine
review: and stores as Neiman Marcus, William Sonoma. Life music on the outdoor garden.

title: Upscale Shopping
review: Village of Merrick Park opened in 2002 with Neiman Marcus, Nordstrom, and a glittering collection of upscale, luxury retailers, fine restaurants and numerous international brands who chose to open their flagship stores here because of Miami’s diverse residential population and international tourist shoppers who embrace globally known brands. At Merrick Park you can find Flagship stores from Brazil, Argentina, Turkey, Spain, Chile, Colombia, Italy and France.

title: Shopping and More
review: Village of Merrick Park is an outdoor mall with upscale shopping and mainstream stores too. It's home to many restaurants, gyms, spas, etc. The only mall that my husband will accompany me to.  But one of it's best features is the architecture and landscaping  nestled in the beautiful landmark city of Coral Gables.

title: New World Symphony
review: Absolutely amazing place to visit.  Just the architecture alone is amazing.  Didn't get to see a concert, but can imagine it would make Lincoln Center jealous.

title: Enjoy a Wall Concert under the palms.
review: Wonderful concerts by members of America's graduate school of orchestral music. A beautiful building and innovation in concerts large and small. Inside with perfect acoustics or out with a picnic supper.

title: New World Symphony Visit
review: The NWS is a fantastic organization which is making a statement to promote classical music as an attractive offering to more than just the traditional listener.  Our family traveled from Chicago to Miami Beach to hear the concert featuring the 4 winners of the annual concerto competition.  We sat outside with 1000 others for the Saturday night concert broadcast on a 100 ft high wall.  It was obvious that people came to meet and visit with others as well as hear great classical music. The same program was performed the next day inside the 700 seat facility.  The sound is crisp, and there is seating on all 4 sides of the orchestra.  The NWS is in the heart of Miami Beach, easy to get to, and worth a visit!

title: Christmas Symphony
review: What a wonderful experience! The seating was great, the sound amazing and the Orchestra was on fire! I would definately do this again!

title: Outdoor WallScape concerts
review: Free tickets for indoor concerts but free outdoor concerts are great and they also have evening outdoor free movies.  Just pick your performance carefully, as this is ultra modern music most of the time.

title: Amazing and Beautiful Swimming Pool
review: A great place to spend the day. Beautiful swimming pool with caves and cataracts. Pool attendant are good and attentive. Lunch can improve quality.

title: WOW, like no other place in the world...
review: This is an incredible place; from a coral rock quarry to a beautiful landmark.  This is a once in a life time experience where you have a swimming pool filled daily with spring water from an underground aquifer.  Go and take pictures like you will never again, ever find again...by the waterfall, in the tower, on the bridge...WOW.  Go and enjoy.

title: This is not a tourist attraction, it's a public swimming pool
review: What I pictured this to be after reading several different write ups about this and what this really is are two totally different things. While it is a beautiful pool, it is a public swimming pool.  It's a shame its not the natural swimming pool that you think it is. Instead you smell chlorine immediately and see a snack bar. A big disappointment.

title: Run club
review: The place indeed it is beautiful. Unfortunately it was FULL of mosquitoes!! Even though I sprayed I was attacked so bad I had to call the event organizer to have someone pick me up. I have at least 100 bites! It was horrible. I asked if they spray for mosquitoes and I was told NO. I would like to know the reason for a place this beautiful were so many people visit it's not sprayed for mosquitoes. I am currently taking Benadryl every 6 hours and applying cortizone. It was horrible.

title: Beautiful
review: Would recommend for all types of families and all ages. Although mosquitoes really bother, it's a great place to experience natural Miami

title: Wonderful Property
review: Parking wasn't a big deal as we parked virtually across from the entrance and it was on a Sunday.afternoon.

title: Nice place to visit
review: We are member here and simply love to visit. Great place to take a walk and watch the manatees frolic. The two houses are lovely. Many events throughout the year.

title: Place to relax
review: Deering Estate is great place to visit and learn about area history. Take the tour of Stone House, Richmond Cottage and my favorite Natural Area Tour. There are tables to use, bring your picnic basket and enjoy the great view of the Biscayne bay.

title: Great fun place!
review: First we enjoyed going through the tunnels and feeding the monkeys in the little dishes on chains.  The monkeys would lower the dishes for you and you would drop (cheap) treats in them and they would pull them up, eat the food and drop it again.  The shows were very informative and fun.  We chose the VIP experience and got to go into the jungle and feed the monkey squirrels and one other type.  The monkey squirrels would climb on your arms and take the food out of your hands.  So much fun.  It was $90 (which included admission) and well worth it!  The assistants from the jungle were very helpful!!!

title: great place but people should know they have lots of mosquitos!
review: place was great if your into animals and birds but remember to wear your OFF was eaten alive by mosquitos and ran up front with my wife to get cutter for body animals well kept and beautiful

title: EPIC!  If you love monkeys you have to come here!
review: I love this place and if you like monkeys you have to check it out!!

title: Worth the visit!
review: This place was just great, we loved it!  We went in early April, no bugs at all.  We were thrilled with the monkey experience, the monkeys are well fed and seem quite happy.  I felt a little sad for the gorilla, he had a tough life prior to arriving at Monkey Jungle, but he has a very nice and large area to roam, and he gets to watch TV whenever he wants!  I recommend this place to any monkey lovers, its great!  I would plan 2 to 3 hours there, it's a small privately owed park in the outskirks of the city.

title: Best thing we've ever done!
review: We are big animal lovers and so we telephoned and booked for the same day on to the rainforest tour which $89.95 per adult. We absolutely loved it! I have never had the opportunity to be so close to monkeys. We had squirrel monkeys jumping on us the whole time - kids would love it. The rest of the the Jungle showed other types of monkeys and birds - all really well looked after. Every animal sanctuary/zoo should have the same set up as Monkey Jungle. The staff are doing a fantastic job - keep up the good work!

title: Absolutely the best location for a Convention Center.
review: If you are planing to attend an expo or event at Miami Beach Convention Center you are lucky. The center is 2-5 min walking for Lincoln Rd, where you have shops, restaurants and etc. You are also walking distance form many hotels. Itself Miami Beach Convention Center managed really well, and they try to get best venues to Miami Beach.

title: Art Show
review: I came here for an art show and really enjoyed the layout and feel that was accomplished. There are many ongoing events for different interests.

title: AARP National Convention 2015
review: Pleasantly surprised to find a completely renovated structure with all the amenities.  Exhibit halls are gigantic.  There are Ballrooms and numerous meeting rooms of all sizes.  The foyers are large and excellent for registration and information.  There is well designed bus loading/unloading area by one entrance for out of town attendees staying at local hotels.  If time permits across the street from the MBCC is a must see Biological Park.  The only down side is there are no signs for parking lot entrance.

title: Great Venue & Attractions
review: Great venue terrific staff and close to attractions and nightlife if MB. Enjoy!

title: Perfect venue!
review: I attended the AARP Life @50+ event from May 14 - May 16, 2015.  The Convention Center was large enough to handle the many diverse activities, from packing food for needy senior, to small intimate meals, to the huge conference and the awesome concerts.

title: We all wished we could take pictures like this on our iPhones
review: Peter's photography was just amazing. I was surprised by the quality and depth of his work. It was a great decision to pop in and get out of the humidity while strolling Lincoln Road.

title: Stimulating visit
review: Walking around Lincoln Road and wandering in to this Gallery.  It was like entering a feelgood outdoor spa.  Peter Lik's art jumps out at you, it speaks to your inner peace.  This sounds strange, but the world is so stressful, that to say I felt really different when I came in to the gallery.  Bottom line is I ended up buying 2 great 5 pack gift boxes for a great price.  Was able to give 8 clients one Peter Lik art piece and kept two for myself.  I plan to return soon and buy a larger piece for my home.

title: Magnificient
review: Not matter how many times I go to Lincoln Road, I must walk in this gallery. Peter Lik's photography is breath taking, When I look into the pictures is like I am drawn to be right there at that moment,. Don't miss the opportunity to see and perhaps buy.

title: Worth A Visit for Sure
review: Not sure how to review this...by the art or the Gallery itself.  Peter Lik's work is impressive and displayed well.   The gallery is neat and clean.  Ample help if you have a question.  it's just that the Gallery itself didn't keep my attention and make me want to stay.  Example..I was in Key West a few weeks ago with my family.  Pter Lik was also in a gallery down there.  The gallery's lighting, the display methods etc were so inviting that my family had to drag me out......On Lincoln Rd, I appreciated it but didn't feel a bond to keep me inside.   Still worth a look to see world class photography.

title: Fabulous Photography
review: We always love visiting Peter's galleries.  His photography  is absolutely amazing and the staff at the gallery are excellent also.

title: Excellent museum esp to beat the heat
review: My 6 year old loved this museum and even my teen remarked on how cool it was for little kids.  So many different areas for them to explore and play dress up.  Lived the interactive ocean screen, the fishing, and fire truck the most

title: Overpriced and underenjoyed
review: How much? I hadn't misheard. It was more than $100 for my family of four to enter this most disappointing of museums. Sure, the kids had some fun drawing animals and scanning them onto a big screen. And they enjoyed the remote-controlled boats. But the animatronic dinosaurs were amateurish and the overall experience falls well short of justifying the price. Instead of wasting time and money here, I'd go to the Rainforest Cafe at the Sawgrass Mills mall: they have better animatronics, friendly staff and they'll even throw in a delightful meal - all for less than the Miami Children's Museum.

title: Kids don't get tired of it!
review: We've been there multiple times and kids always want to go again. Very hands-on and entertaining. Short, though...

title: Place to go on a rainy vacation day!
review: On a day of thunder storms, this is the perfect vacation spot for families with children or grandchildren. Yes, you get a military discount! The children just love the multiple experiences they are exposed to and the adults enjoy their happiness.

title: Museum packed with interactive exhibits let down only by having no food options than a subway
review: The only let down was the lack of food options - only a subway onsite. We then left with tired and hungry children in urgent search of somewhere to get food in a city we didn't know!

title: Culture for free
review: I went to visit the museum 4 years ago and i like to do it at least once a year when friends wants to visit Miami.

title: Look very interesting.
review: I wasn't able to go in due to my crew was ready to eat after walking all day. I plan to return and have been trying to visit online unsuccessful so far.

title: Nice spot
review: The museum itself is beautiful but like anything cultural in Miami there are rarely good exhibitions.

title: Great for Cruise ship travelers
review: Bayfront Park is an ideal location for people going on a cruise. It has shops and restaurants, in order to occupy your time while waiting to cruise.  It is located across the street from the Holiday Inn.

title: Lunch
review: Fun and busy area.   Some good restaurants along the water with outside dining.  We ate at sharkeys and really enjoyed it.

title: Very Relaxing
review: A great place to relax and watch the ships and boats. A huge Christmas tree in the park. Not overly crowded.

title: Very nice
review: I went there for Pitbull's concert. A nice place to walk, practice some sports and watch the ships. The sad part is that it's full of homeless people, make it look some dangerous.

title: Fun in the sum
review: Take a break from the usual tourist attractions and enjoy the sun near or under the palms.  Be sure to apply protection from the sun!

title: Explore the history of Miami!
review: Don't go on your own or you'll miss a lot of cool places and interesting history of this area. I highly recommend a tour. But if you want just to walk around and get some of the Latin flavors (both in the food and in the shops), you'll have a nice time. Make sure that you stop by Domino Park.

title: Culture Culture
review: Calle Ocho is an exceptional place.  It is full of fun, characters, food, music, etc.  You can fine antique shops, Cuban Tabacco shops, note to mention restaurants. All types, cuban, Mexico, Colombian, etc.  There is an ice cream please call Azucar which is fantastic.  There are so many flavors that is hard to choose from.  You can find awsome entertainment in every corner.  YOu can find people sometimes dancing in the sidewalk from the cuban music coming from the restaurant.  There is a Goodwill in 8st between 12th and 9th Ave. that even though is used clothing and many good stuff it is worth the visit.  There are many brand name shoes and cloth for a very cheap price.  Worth the visit.  The dominos park is wonderful, there is nothing like little old people playing dominos.  It is a safe place to go at night.  You need to pay for parking.  Try to park in a lighted place just because there are some homeless sometimes walking around and they might be a little scary.  But nothing to worry about.  It is called litle havana because of all the Cuban that live there and the culture.  Enjoy a piece of Cuba in Miami

title: Calle 8: The New Midtown?
review: This could be the start of something big for this working class neighborhood West of Brickell that is already showing the first signs of gentrification.

title: Don't Blink
review: Almost missed this point if interest.  Small strip of small specialty stores with a nice Art Deco style.  Was hoping to be able to experience more of "Cuba". Perhaps during festival time,  it in a daily basis a quick drive through is all you need

title: Like being in Havana!!
review: It was an interesting few hours spent walking around Little Havana. Went into a bar, Cuba Ocho, for a mojito and beer-so cute. Ate at a Cuban restaurant. It was fun to browse the shops and visit Domino Park. Great to visit for something different.

title: we had a good time in this facility
review: We attended the 2018 Orange Bowl game. Parking was easy with excellent access for handicapped. The stadium itself is modern and seating areas are covered and offer good views. Concessions are varied and prices not too extreme (we pay more at Redskins games FEDEX field)

title: Orange bowl
review: A Great stadium to watch a football game, the seats were chair type and good views. They had a lot of good restaurants inside stadium.

title: Nice & Relaxing!
review: Easy access in and out of the Orange Bowl. Vendors and restrooms well located, great parking and plenty of folks available to help. The only ding was having to go pick up the parking pass at an out of the way location and it did not make it clear when ordering, had to call to find out. Otherwise, great experience!

title: The Stadium
review: The sound system, the seats, and the prices we got were great. I'm definitely going back and I hope I can take my kids to so they can enjoy because this time I only took my daughter.

title: Nice..
review: It is very popular for lunch time, you can see people being happy. Many working mates tables and friends tables.

title: Great stroll
review: Village of Merrick has everything you need!The best stores like Neiman Marcus beautiful boutiques and much more. The best restaurants. Beautiful sitting areas. At Christmas its stunning. All year round a must see  if you come  to Miami. A,classy experience beautiful people. Can't miss with this place.

title: Great place for dinning
review: Very pleasant with family, easy way to enjoy the day.

title: Something for Everyone
review: I love just walking around Merrick Park. The weekends always bring a lot of families and kids playing in the open areas. The shopping is wonderful as well. A good mix of high end and average priced stores. Also a good variety of men and women's stores. They are pet friendly in the grass areas so it is a good place to walk my dog. We frequently visit Yardhouse as well. Great location with a lot to do.

title: Great place to shop!!
review: It's the best place in coral gables to shop! You get everything you need from clothes to shoes to whatever you wish for. It also has Designer outlets, Neman Marcus, northstrom  and lulu lemon. When you are done shopping you can choose from different cuisines to eat from and for desert nothing beats Godiva ice cream. I also got my hair done from blo bar which turned out amazing. And if you live near by then why not join the gym or soul cycle classes there. It's a one stop destination for everything you need!

title: Near Lincoln.......
review: A huge forecourt, where you can sit and eat or drink after a long walk or swim. Its close to Lincoln St, so a volley of food outlets to experience.

title: Beautiful space
review: The bar is covenant and the staff is attentive.

title: Great Talent - Amazing Facility
review: There is not a bad seat, and the performances are wallcast in the adjacent SoundScape Park at no cost!  Enjoy.

title: Crowded. Clean?
review: Very nice setting but usually too crowded for comfort in the summer, so much that it does not feel clean.

title: To go or not to go...is it worth it?
review: After years, and years living in Miami, I finally went to the Venetian pool 10 years ago with my daughter's school. Few people from my area had ever been there. And we are all "locals"!!!! Beautiful, refreshing (specially on hot Miami days). You can google it and all the info is there, and it's true. Very clean, transparent spring water. Children have a great time, and so do adults. It gets crowded and I understand that at a certain point they don't allow anyone in. So arrive early, and choose a patch of grass to lay your towel. Is like you travel in time, to the 50s...or something like it. You can buy food there or take your cooler. Very different! Very Miami, and it's not the beach!

title: Beautiful, relaxing pool
review: We enjoyed our visit to the Venetian Pool.  The pool itself is very cool - especially the waterfalls and caves.  It would be a fun activity for a family.  It can be a bit pricey, and chairs are extra.  They have a shaded picnic area, so to make the price worthwhile, come for the whole day.

title: Classic part of Coral Gables
review: My parents went there as children, and enjoyed as cool swim on a hot Summer day.  It was closed recently for renovations and cooler temperatures.  Uniquely, the water is replaced daily, avoiding chlorination.

title: Equinox Sunrise Photograph
review: The equinox sunrise is a fantastic opportunity to photograph the sunrise from the boat dock. At the equinox, the sun rises directly in the middle of the boat harbor with the majestic palm trees equidistant on either sides. Jessica, the tour guide, provides relevant commentary and banter with the visitors making for a very pleasant morning.

title: BEAUTIFUL!!!
review: Totally awesome! Despite the recent damage by Hurricane Irma the Deering Estates clean up and recovery was fast. The Estate was beautiful. The ocean view is a must to see. So much history to see and learn.

title: STUNNING View!
review: The best part of Deering Estate, in our opinion is the view...positively STUNNING.  Ours was somewhat blocked due to a wedding that was being held during hours - it had to be rescheduled due to a tropical storm the previous day.  I wish we could have had the full impact of the view from the estate. There was also a lot of standing water.  The house was beautiful, and the tour informative.  The tour only included the bottom on the home, although we were free to roam the second story.

title: this is way out of town
review: An old house in nice setting on the water; was here for a wedding.  outdoor wedding reception in early October is a certifiably bad idea -- heat and bugs led to early exodus.  Some interesting architectural elements, but not worth the trip from downtown.

title: Awesome place to see and learn about the estate and his philanthropists owner
review: Absolutely recomendable for families and private events. I would go again this month to have the tour visit.

title: where monkey business is a pleasure
review: Off the beaten path, this is a great adventure. Just the setting alone...a mini rain-forest sanctuary away from the bustle of Miami, is worth the visit. A little pricey, but a unique experience for kids and adults alike. For a rare treat, splurge for the $89 rain forest adventure, where you are part of the environment instead of looking through a cage at it, and miniature spider monkeys feed right from your hands. Our guide there was patient, friendly, and informative. Some of the jungle's residents are displaced former pets and circus rescues. It's good to know such a nice place is now home for them.

title: feeding the monkeys
review: The squirrel monkeys were very adorable and they were fun to feed.  They jump on your hands and take the food that they like.

title: Monkey jungle
review: They should be able to roam free  with the monkeys .

title: What a wonderful home for the monkey's
review: Overall, we had a wonderful time and are so thankful for the jungle to save the animals.

title: Great time!!!
review: Had such a great time here with family and friends.  Price was very reasonable and got to interact with the monkeys!!!  will defiantly be coming back.

title: Miami Beach Convention Center Needs to Come down!
review: Worked many a show there. Place looks terrible. Parking is expensive. The choice of food available for product shows is terrible. They need to take it down and put up a state of the art center so Miami can attract the big shows, like the Consumer Electronics Show and the Houseware Show. Vegas and Chicago, mostly Vegas gets the big one. Miami is sophisticated enough now to attract world visitors and is the gateway to South Americal

title: Business Meeting
review: Experienced Miami Beach Convention Center during Art Basel last year and it was an overall good experience. Staff members are very kind and helpfull. Always ready for a convention time!

title: Good Site for Convention
review: The food service is terrible. For example, $9 for a "pizza" from Papa John's that is essentially a slice. Also, there are no tables or even chairs near the food service near the entry doors and the staff are clueless as to where there are chairs and tables [there are actually]. Many people were sitting on the floor to eat because they couldn't find the tables. Management is at fault for not training their staff.  Take a walk - there are many local casual restaurants nearby including Lincoln Road.

title: Will need more than a day to cover Basel
review: Was here for Art Basel. Get a map. This place is huge and confusing but had everything a convention center should have to offer.

title: Plan on being early
review: The convention center is nice but like most of Miami and Miami Beach, parking is impossible and expensive when you find it, and if you screw up and don't understand the complicated parking restrictions they tow your car.  Hotels and resturants are expensive in the area. I would rather go to Ft Lauderdale or Orlando convention centers where the patrons are remembered in the convention center use.

title: Great work, no service
review: Love the photos, we have 3 right now. No one greeted us when we came in or acknowledged our presence.

title: A global trip in 10 min
