review: If you ever forget how beautiful the planet where we live is ... just stop for 10 minutes at the gallery and you will be reminded. Of course you will also be frustrated not to be able to walk with one picture under your arm to put in our imaginary mansion...but it is worth it.

title: Great images but buyer beware
review: Liked the images but a little concerned about the price structure having read the NY Times article. Worth a look and listen to the staff as they go through their pitch.

title: Go see for yourself...amazing!
review: We always visit a Peter Lik Gallery when given the chance.  His work is clearly genius and a must is you love travel and photography.  Staff greeted us kindly even though we were just looking.  Thanks for that!

title: Gorgeous!
review: So. Much. Talent. Seriously, these photographs were gorgeous. Our friends took us in here before dinner and it was lovely. Everything was stunning- the photographs, presentation... I would love to own some of these pieces.

title: Funny and nice place to learn
review: We were a big group of children visiting the museum. Such a nice place for children. My son really enjoyed the music area.

title: Not deserved
review: Miami does not deserve a second class museum for kids.  Everything in the place seems like second hand or not interesting. I will not recommend to go there with your children.

title: Awesome Kids Museum
review: So much to do at Miami Children's Museum. Lots of hands on things. My kids love the Publix displays as well as the cruise ship section! Subway to have lunch inside

title: Ver ya good for smaller children
review: This is very nice place to take younger children. They have a variety of attractions and I found it quite educational.

title: Eclectic art museum
review: Interesting small museum was very modern works of art. Terrific place for a cocktail party and reception. It was hard to hear the docent due to the noise. Worth a short visit.

title: Looking Better than Ever after the Expansion
review: The Bass Museum has a good core of traditional art. Now it's expanded galleries are showing a HOT contemporary artist: Hugo Rondinone and there are also two other contemporary shows, so you have a switch here, whereby the museum is effectively entering an important phase of developing exhibitions in the Contemporary art field, check out their website for the latest. Last Year I saw an exhibition on Peter Marino that was awesome as well. A must see if you are in Miami!

title: Not my thing
review: If you already think you want to go there - then is probably a good place to visit. If you are unsure if you want to spend 1-2 hours looking at “art” then you are probably looking for some reassurance but you won’t get it here. I would rather have spent the time on the beach.

title: Mika's movies are the real blockbusters!
review: Hint: Check out Mika’s interviews on Youtube. Helped a lot in decoding her videos.

title: Bayfront
review: We walked around this pretty park and stayed for the sunset. The area is green and relaxing but homeless people are sprawled on the grass or laying on benches with their belongings.

title: What’s New!
review: Every time I visit Miami for the boat show, I find myself transmitting through the park for food or transportation.  And every time, there’s a great activity to enjoy.  Dog show, musicians, artists, or just interesting people... it’s a great Miami treasure!

title: Nice place to relax and look what is going on around on the beach
review: Bayfront Park is a nice and calm area with palms around were you can relax and have a look on the beach. It is only a short distance from the area were you can chill around look on people and shops, enjoy drinks and meals. Whatever you want. And then The Bayfront Park with the nice beach area!!!!

title: Get out and exercise
review: It is a great place to get out and go for a walk. There are plenty of things to see and people to watch. It is a wonderful place to work off some calories and feel good about your self.

title: Great park.
review: Avoid going when Ultra Music Festival is schedule, because it takes place at the park itself.

title: Very goot!
review: Very nice good location near all the things that are fun and things. Nice looking. Warm water. Muy bien!

title: Very Cuban
review: A lovely area of town that is great in the daytime, it might be different at night ... you can walk from Bayside but it takes about half an hour.. the area is very Cuban so you do not feel you are in America. even the McDonalds menu is in Spanish. Cool place

title: Short trip but worth it. Could have spent more time here exploring.
review: Smile and talk with the locals in Little Havana on Calle Ocho. You might be surprised what you find out.

title: Fun street with lots to see and do
review: Fun place to visit, lots of local eateries, shops and cigar rolling - a great flavour of Cuba. Local music, dancing and a fun vibe in the evening.

title: Amazing experience
review: First of all the atmosphere was super! Great people, good beer, friendliness all the way through. There was not a boring minute of the NFL game. I should also mention that the parking (although rather expensive) was super with very easy exit in and out.

title: Hard Rock
review: Great food!  Great sight lines.  Great video boards.

title: Always a great experience
review: I get back for a soccer game, This venue always have a good service and organized entrance and good stores

title: Great stadium
review: Its a nice stadium that hosts lots of games and events. But its far away from the city. You will need a car or uber but it will be expensive one. Its at around 30 minutes on the highway.

title: One of the nicest stadiums I've ever seen
review: Great upgrades have made this stadium world class. It is definitely the way to go to watch a game or see a concert. Go Dolphins!

title: Relaxing and great
review: Scenic and relaxing. All luxury stores are located here. Love to walk around this mall. Great restaurants as well. Godiva is here and I love to go get their soft serve.

title: Great shopping
review: Beautiful mall. On Sundays they have the farmers market going on. Great shopping for what ever you are looking for. Love the Nordstrom there. Great places to eat also.

title: Beautiful little outdoor mall
review: Took a lovely walk through a pretty neighborhood during our stay at the Biltmore and found this shopping mall. This is only about a mile and a half away. Lots of nice shops, great layout, and fun restaurants. Spent lots and of time in the cute Lilly store and Vineyard Vines!

title: Enjoying life...Miami style !
review: and enjoy life...Miami style !

title: Nice shops and restaurants.
review: It's a convenient upscale mall in Coral Gables, close to the airport and the US1. I specially enjoyed certain stores like Nordstrom, Neiman Marcus, Anthropologie and Peek. Most restaurants are good. Mariposa in Neiman Marcus is wonderful. If you are in the area...this mall it's a must.

title: Excellent concert
review: Watch an outdoor concert. It was amazing everyone was on the lawn in their beach chairs in the evening, it was awesome

title: Free concerts in the park, top music & community spirit
review: The free outdoor concerts are live-streamed onto the wall of the Symphony Hall. The New World Symphony members are fantastic, the program was musically inventive and interspersed with video clips of the talented players, and conducted by MTT (Michael Tilson Thomas). Don't miss it!

title: Amazing and so organised!
review: The crew at new symphony really tried! Great outdoor musical concert for the evening. One of the must sees!

title: This is a Beach alternative to take your family for an extended picnic and pool activities....
review: Great larger pool set up as a smaller hand made lake in natural surroundings. Worth a visit, but it is costly if besides its entrance fee you plan on having food and drinks there. The activity is limited to sitting or having a swim at a larger pool. It seems you can bring in your own food and drinks, so this is maybe something to consider when visiting in particular if you visit with family members not to overburden your wallet.

title: Fun with the family
review: This place is awesome! One bad thing you can’t take small children due to something with the water. Which is understandable! But it’s an experience

title: Spectacular trip in time!
review: The Venetian Pool is a wonderful place to transport yourself in time to one of the spectacular attractions in the city Beautiful of Coral Gables. The water is on the cold side. But your body adjusts quickly to the  water temperature. It’s a place to enjoy with family and friends. Don’t forget to visit the cave at the pool and take plenty of pictures to show your family and friends. Pictures will bring back memories of your visit to this special place that I am sure you will want to return.

title: Unreasonably Pricey
review: I expected a more historical setting for this pool at this price. It is basically like hotel theme pools in Las Vegas or Caribbean All inclusive resort. I don't see a reason why this exist in the first place. In Miami everyone has an access to a pool or the beach. So I wonder who comes here.... tourists. I understand the need to maintain and salary for lifeguards, that's where the price comes from. But this should not be on tourists wish list. Yet, there is a lot of people here. Good marketing.

title: AMAZING
review: I highly recommend this beautiful pool. I know there are environmental concerns about the pool because it is drained and filled completely every night. I’m not sure if those concerns are warranted or not. What I can say, is that this pool is an experience not to be missed! Beautiful in every way. The caves are the best part hands down!

title: Super interesting
review: Lots of history beginning thousands of years ago.  Interesting houses, great view.  Highlight was Elliot's tour of the property.  Since there were only 2 of us on the tour he offered a golf cart ride that could cover more territory.  He gave a great tour of the history, geology, hydrology (water is everything), and flora.

title: Beautiful Area
review: Beautiful grounds and interesting house. There are two different tours included in entrance fee. Be sure to ask about both. No food available to purchase so either bring food or eat before arriving if planning to go on both tours. House is sparsely furnished.

title: not much to see
review: We visited this site after touring the nearby Fairchild Tropical Garden. We were underwhelmed and were expecting more, since it was so highly rated at both TripAdvisor and in the AAA Tour Book. We missed the property tour, which might have helped us enjoy it more, but to us there wasn't much to see here. The beautiful stone house was only sparsely furnished, and the adjacent cottage can be toured in 15 minutes (we did not wait for the house tour). We did not walk the grounds too far but did enjoy the rocking chairs on the cottage porch. The view to the bay and pier was inviting but was quite far to walk, so we skipped that; our view of the expansive lawn area was marred by large trash cans set up every 50 feet or so (in advance of an upcoming concert, I believe). Overall, we were not terribly impressed with this site and finished our visit in about an hour.

title: ghost tour
review: i went here for the ghost tour at night. it was scary and atmospheric. the estate is nice too for a day tour.

title: Great concerts in a lovely setting!
review: Check out the Deering Estate schedule of activities. Concerts both inside or outside in the gardens are lovely and specially romantic. But not cheap.

title: If You Love Monkeys, You Have To Go Here
review: We visited this zoo for monkeys over 20 years ago and the place is still the same. It's a little pricey but well worth it if you love primates. There's a large selection of apes and birds on display. Many of the monkeys run free while you walk through a fenced in path through the property. The monkeys come out and you can feed them. Be warned that if you go in the summer, it is HOT as you are outside the entire time. There are a few scheduled "shows" throughout the day were various staff members do informative presentations. Definitely recommend.

title: The best monkey place ever!
review: I wasn't sure what to expect when we visited other than seeing monkeys. We bought monkey food as we paid for the visit and as we went thru the walkways little bowls on chains kept being dropped down the walkway area by all the little monkeys! They wanted their treats! We would put some sunflower seeds or raisins in the bowl and the monkeys would pull the bowl up by the chain. Was so much fun seeing them get the food out then drop the bowl for more treats! I highly recommend visiting this place. I could've stayed there all day watching them. Superb visit!!

title: A hidden gem!
review: Don’t be afraid to ask the staff questions. They are incredibly patient and will answer anything. They will not be a party to letting you steal an adorable spider monkey and putting it in your oversized purse brought specifically for that reason, but other than that, they ROCK.

title: Cute hidden spot
review: Spend a few hours here, watch the shows, see the monkeys living their lives as close to their wild selves as possible, pulling up their bowls with the treats you give them. They also have a silverback, an elderly gentleman with his own habits and his own dvd player (you can't see that though). Also a few reptiles and birds inhabit the area. Charming little place.

title: I love this placr
review: Highly recommend . This is my second visit. The place is awesome. You get to walk through several caged in trails and be visited by hundreds of monkeys along with special areas with gibbons and the sort. The coolest part is being able to feed them. I had a better time doing this than my grandchildren. Fantastic must see place if you are in south Florida. 3 thumbs up.

title: Nice Facility
review: The facility is well maintained, plenty of parking and a good size for smaller national shows.

title: Nice
review: I've been to plenty conventions here and I find it clean well organized and easily accessible. Parking is also right across the street

title: The most worst place.
review: Very old place ,smiling bad. Nothing interesting to see. The most worst center what I see in my life.

title: old and ugly
review: the building and facilities are very old, ugly, this place should be demolished complete, the once propoused Rem Koolhaas's design was way nice for this place, so in general , mediocre place and facility, it is a shame since the location.

title: Nice Trade Show Venue
review: I have attended the JIS Jewelry show each of the past 5 years.  This is a very nice, clean venue for a show.  Close location to hotels , restaurants and beach.

title: Another great gallery
review: While on Lincoln Rd amongst all the shops is a quiet calling to stop in to this gallery and admire the talented photography of this artist. Breathtaking landscapes, seascapes with artistic flair. Very impressive.

title: WOW
review: You could stare at these photos and walk in this gallery for hours and there are little viewing rooms. The sales people are so knowlegable and seem to truly love their jobs.

title: Great Art
review: Peter Lik's gallery is amazing. Anyone that visits South Beach should make the time to stroll down Lincoln Rd to see his works. You will be in awe. So many to view and no matter when you go back you will always find something new to be amazed by.

title: I would pay to see art like this
review: Like a mini art museum except it is all amazing photos by Peter Lik and you can buy them if you win the lottery. We have stopped in here each time we are in town. You could spend 5 minutes in here or 30minutes , depending on how long you stare at his photos. Not a huge space at all but very well laid out.

title: Great way to keep kids entertained for hours while learning.
review: Great way to keep the kiddos entertained. They will spend hours playing and learning. Many different areas. Really liked it.

title: Not a museum and far too expensive
review: Cleanest Subway restaurant we've seen so far. After 11 am classes of local schools arrive.

title: Fun museum
review: The museum can be pricy with a large family. Since I am a teacher I get in for free but have to pay for my kids. They love going and I love that they change themes often. We have gone when it was Thomas the train and the dinosaurs. I suggest you bring you own food or go out to eat since they only have subs for lunch.

title: Nice intereactive center
review: Nice inter active center. Avoid week ends of special holidays because of crowds. You can easily spend 3 hours or more.

title: Good place
review: The place is great and a lot of different things to do. Worth a visit. Minuses : felt like several things closed or not working. Also not the biggest place so gets pretty cramped even on a Monday which should not the be busiest day.

title: Quirky modern art
review: Pascale Marthine Tayou's eggs were wonderfully juxtaposed with traditional images. And Ugo Rondinone's room full of clowns was fabulous (though apparently some people are unnerved by clowns). It is well worth a visit but can be difficult to find as it is not well signposted.

title: Contemporary art in a historic building, recently revivified.
review: The exhibits in the Bass, mostly temporary, are exciting and stimulating.  It is easy to find, and worth a visit.

title: Truly enjoyed this fascinating gem
review: What a giant of a cozy museum! I enjoyed every nook and cranny of The Bass. I would call it funky, fun, and meaningful. Make sure Trisha is there and ask her to explain the exhibit where she is - not a docent - but a security guard with volumes of knowledge. I wish I lived in the area so I could return when the exhibits change. (Don’t miss the video installations, they are truly funky.)

title: A small museum focused on contemporary art.
review: Since reopening, the Bass has focused on contemporary art, sometimes placed in contrast to the old masters of the original collection. The museum is small, but If you enjoy the avant-garde, it is worth a visit.

title: A lovely park to spend an afternoon in
review: Bayfront Park is a lovely place to spend a few hours. It's peaceful, has a great sculpture park and plenty of seats to take a break from the heat.

title: Fun Youthful place
review: Amazing views and entertainment. Love the location. It is near great restaurants and shops. Super youthful and energetic!

title: What a view!
review: This was close to our hotel and we walked allover it.  The views of the harbor are incredible!  Relaxing

title: Shop and hacve fun by the water
review: Our favourite fun is to take a boat and take a tour  of beautiful )and celebs= homes around Miami.

title: Relaxing or happening - however you want it
review: It's a nice place to hang out with friends for drinks and relax. Also, fun and relaxing to spend time with family. A short walk to the Bay front plaza to do shopping or enjoy live music or just have a couple of drinks.

title: Cool park in front of the symphony building
review: There are many trees for shade and walking paths and some really interesting structures holding bouganvilla for shade.

title: One of the best things about Miami Beach!
review: Gorgeously landscaped public park adjoining New World Symphony. They have Wallcasts of the symphony concerts all season long. Bring a blanket, a picnic and get there early for best seats. They also have free movies on Wednesday nights and various other collaborations throughout the year. Look online and search "Soundscape Park" for updated details. If something is going on while you're in town, don't miss it.

title: Small park, bougainvillea
review: Just a small park but with beatiful flowers bougainvillea. Quite quiet though. Outdoor movies every wednesday at 8pm. It's free.

title: The former home of the Miami Beach acro yoga
review: Why is it called soundscape park? It is because of it being right beside New World Symphony Center. Here you can hear the music coming from the concert. It is once where the old Miami Beach acro yoga jam used to be located  for more than two years.

title: a piece of Cuba on SW 8 Street
review: this was a sleepy little street back in the day, but is now bustling with tourists on a daily basis...great little restaurants, great music which can be heard everywhere, cigar makers here and there....

title: A taste of Cuba in the US
review: Stopped down here again recently to check out the cigar shops, domino park and do some shopping/sight seeing. Calle Ocho is a very long street. We were in the area of Little Havana between SW14th Ave and SW 17th Ave. Live music on the street and some good food/bars. A little crowded (Saturday).

title: Gret food and shiooing
review: Interesting area with gret food, and lots of shopping. We took a local food tour and had a great time with our guide. He was very thourogh

title: Don't miss this taste of Cuba
review: As we didn't have much time to explore since Orlando was a 4 hour drive back from Miami, but it was definitely a worthwhile walk after eating that delicious ice cream from Azucar.  You can totally smell the fresh Cuban cigars and love the music and dancers in the streets,  Makes you feel as if you are right in Cuba.

title: More than a street
review: Calle Ocho is, literally, Eighth Street, the nexus of Cuban culture in Miami. There are many Cuban and Latin neighborhoods in the city, but Eighth Street, extending from near downtown Miami 40 blocks west to LeJeune Road, is famous for its seemingly endless stretch of Cuban restaurants, bars, nightclubs, cigar shops and more. There are varied cuisines along the street these days, but some of the city's most famous (though not necessarily the best) Cuban restaurants are here, notably the heavily mirrored and highly over-rated Versailles. One of the city's best bars, Ball & Chain, is here, and the terrific Northern Thai hole-in-the-wall restaurants Lung Yai Thai Tapas as well. It's a varied neighborhood these days, and great fun to drive. Keep in mind that from Coral Gables to downtown, it is one way running West to East.

title: Miami Open Tennis
review: The overall experience was good. Parking was $25 in advance. We got there early so there we got as close as possible to the entrance. The security check point moved pretty quickly. Each person could bring in up to 1 liter of water. I saw people with all kinds of non-alcoholic drinks in their bags. They even let people bring in food which I thought was not prohibited. It actually is a good thing since the food options could use some improvement. Not very many healthy food options. The food and beverages were very expensive. The temporary seating looked to be much more spacious and comfortable than the permanent stadium seats. The only good thing about the permanent 300 level seat is they are protected from the elements. The Grandstand and side course are the way to go during the first weekend and watch the stadium matches on the big screen. You definitely want to be in the 100 or 200 sections.

title: It is an amazing stadium
review: The best seats are in the middle of the field so you can see everywhere of the field and the best time to go is summer but the clothing wear is more expensive online than in the stadium so I would recommend to get the items in the stadium rather than get them online

title: Miami Open
review: If not the field packed with the wold top players I would totally regret coming there. In compare to other top tennis tournaments in the U.S. like Indian Wells, US Open or Cincinnati, Miami Open is far behind.

title: Miami Tennis Open
review: Went here last weekend for the Miami Open, and I’ve never experienced such awful customer service! The two older women in blue dresses giving wrist bands for the club seats, were absolutely awful. I lost my phone in the restroom, and instead of being helpful they were rude and gave us zero customer service. I will never return to this venue, no matter what event it is!

title: Great Tennis Venue
review: Can’t wait to come back and watch more tennis.

title: Luxury and nice to see
review: If you like this review please click the button below to keep them coming !!

title: Beautiful upscale shopping center
review: I get the feeling this has kind of overtaken Coral Gables Miracle Miles for shopping at least, not sure about restaurants. Beautiful shopping center with plentiful parking, large courtyards, and fountains. Very pleasant center to shop, go window shopping, relax with a cup of tea or grab a bite to eat.

title: Very Nice Outdoor Mall - Great Shops - Great Opportunity to Enjoy The Outdoors
review: This mall is very clean and beautiful.  The grounds have beautiful landscaping, plenty of seating areas, and are very well kept. Nice stores, mid-range to upscale.  Several restaurants, and a movie theater.  A great place to spend a few hours.

title: Easy strolls.
review: Plenty of reasonable interior parking space. Easy strolls and window shopping. Large and varied beautifully-kept grounds, Spectacular Christmas season.

title: A shopping experience
review: This is a very nice place with a lot of stores as well as restaurants. Parking is relatively easy except for weekends. There are many clothing stores as well as stores for household goods. Very relaxed atmosphere

title: This is amazing!
review: Sit under the stars, with swaying palm trees and a light tropical breeze while listening to a first class orchestra playing wonderful classical music and all this is free.  New World Symphony, a training fellowship for extremely talented musicians, has created a park outside the symphony hall with fantastic acoustics and up close visuals of the musicians and orchestra.  Bring a picnic, wine and friends, but get there well before performance time to insure you get a space on the lawn.  If you enjoy classical music under the stars, you can't miss this!

title: Outdoor concerts
review: Love to sit in the park with a snack or wine and watch the wall at of the New World Symphony with the hundreds of other music lovers

title: Outdoor free entertainment.
review: Weekly movies in their front yard park free.  symphony on wall in park also sometimes.  They call it Wallcast at the New World Symphony.

title: NIce getaway in Miami
review: A little warning - there are caves to swim into where the water is not as deep as in the rest of the pool. The roof in the caves is very sharp which my son got to experience. He got a bad cut in the head wonted crumbling our visit significantly. Big plus to the nice lifeguards who took care of him in a very good way.

title: Desperate - not worth it
review: That all said, the staff were all friendly.

title: Beautiful piece of history!
review: We have lived in Florida for almost 30 years and this has been on my bucket list. Finally got to go and it was beautiful. We got there at about 2:30, knowing that they only let a certain number of people in every day. It was crowded but we were able to find our own little niche in the pool to hang out in and have some space. Beautiful water! Very refreshing and clean. At about 3:30, they announced they had reached capacity for the day and would not be letting anyone else in. This was nice because, as people were leaving, it became less crowded. $20 per person is a little pricey but it was a really nice way to cool down and experience a spring-fed pool.

title: It's not so fun that is look
review: It is old; there is not enough space even when the pool is not full of the people to put towel somewhere, except in the dirty sand which is an imitation of the beach and where is not shade. Deck chairs are old and charged separately in particular if you are lucky to find them, there is no shade sufficient. Is smaller than it looks in the photos. Not going to this place you will not miss anything. Wast of time.

title: Relaxing by the Pool
review: Lovely day spent relaxing by the Venetian Pool. Got here early to get a choice lounge chair location in the shade. Very touristy for a city pool, but not too crowded because school is in session.

title: Estate home museum
review: Bring a paper towel roll and baby wipes for clean ups. For messy finger foods but well worth it.

title: An afternoon to remember at the Deering Estate
review: I very highly recommend a visit ti this espectacular property

title: Back in Time
review: Enjoy your history.

title: Beautiful history
review: Visiting Deering Estates is a great way to learn about history and enjoy a beautiful view. The property is located on the water. The water view is spectacular. It’s a great place for picnics and photos.

title: Paradise on Earth would look like this
review: Thanks to these two wealthy and far-sighted brothers, a part of historical, natural Florida that is all but lost throughout the state, has been preserved into the 21st century so that we might see how the other half lived when Florida was wilderness.

title: Monkey Jungle - Rainforest Adventure Tour
review: The Rainforest Adventure Tour at Monkey Jungle this past weekend with visiting relatives was the highlight of their visit! Well worth the extra cash to tour the rainforest and hand-feed the squirrel monkeys!  They are so adorable!  This experience was literally ALL we talked about the entire 5-day visit!  Our tour guide Bay Lee (sorry if mis-spelled!) was AWESOME!

title: What a great adventure
review: We have been to Monkey Jungle several times and each time is an adventure.   We have always done the Rainforest adventure tour but this one was the best.   Ed, who was our guide was great.  the squirrel monkeys were everywhere when it came time to feed them.  Male, females with babies attached.   It was outstanding. If you think the cost is high for the rainforest tour. When you are done you will say "money well spent"   There are not a lot of places that are around where you get a one on one adventure with the animals but this one is exceptional. The whole staff was friendly and informative.   A pleasure to go and we will be back again.

title: You get to feed the monkeys
review: It's a long way from Downtown about 10 miles from the Zoo. You are in the cage and the monkeys are over and around you. $30 a person. free parking, you will buy monkey food. Plan an hour it's not that big but it's pretty much all shaded.

title: Fun and adventurous time
review: We got there when they opened. Made all the shows. Buy the monkey food. It is cool to watch the monkeys pull up the chain to get the food in the little cup. You can't touch then. We didn't do the Rain Forest Adventure. We stayed approx. 2-3 hours. A little disappointed in the gift shop. Wanted to buy my granddaughter a t shirt 2T and my grandson a 4T. Informed a new stock was coming soon. Enjoyed the atmosphere, monkeys, the staff. Everyone was professional,knowledgeable and nice.

title: Feeding monkeys
review: This place is a great to spend a few hours there.  The monkeys are so smart. They have bowls that you put the food in and they will pull the chains up to get the food.  They are in the open and you are in a cage tunnel.

title: Auto Show
review: The Miami Beach Convention Center has enough room in side you could fit a foot ball stadium inside.Bath rooms are well lite and maintained.The staff ways help full in getting directions correct.Parking is all ways ample.Close to shops and restaurants that you can go to after any event.Near the beach for a nice moon lite stroll.

title: Miami Beach International Antique Show
review: Appr. 1000 Exhibitors and stands! Billions of USD value! Museal pieces! Old watches, jewelliers, furnitures, gold, silver, diamonds from every part of the world! Many pieces several thousands of years old!  It is not possible to see everything, even of You visit the show 2-3 days! I believe this event is the greatest antique show of the world.

title: Scheduled to be torn down.
review: We are all very excited about plans for a new convention center. The old one has seen better days. Fortunately the security is better than it used to be but the facility is dated.

title: Drab, sprawling place without many amenities
review: This convention center doesn't have many amenities (bathrooms, food options), and signage is not very good for such a big place.  It's a necessary evil if you have to participate in a convention here.  Just know it's not going to be one of the better ones.  There used to be a great restaurant across the street, Oo-lite, but it closed in 2015, so the food options in the immediate area are not as good as they used to be.

title: Fantastic Photography!
review: Peter Lik's photography is magical and each piece takes you on a different journey.  The gallery is well spaced and easy to navigate.  To my mind, it was more like a museum than a gallery.  I'm still dreaming about the aspens, my favorite pieces.

title: Great Gallery
review: This is one of my favorite places to stop in when strolling on Lincoln Road. The photography is just stunning.

title: Interesting art work
review: Pop in at this Gallery to view some wonderful art work and pieces for sale.  Lighting within is great to view pieces

title: Whats there not to "Lik" about?
review: Sister of the Lik gallery of Key West. The visitor gets an eyeful of stupendous color and scope. I particularly liked the more demure works of a forest in the north contrasting with Lik's exuberant photos of urban gems and the great mountains. A heavy concentration on natural beauty and huge dimensions. If you don't have quite the budget there are smaller formats for thoughtful gifts in the hundreds of dollars range. The ambiance in Miami Beach is museum-like, free to stroll around and admire.

title: I love (and want) everything in here
review: Some of the prices for these photographs might be surprising, but the quality and beauty is so good that it's worth it.

title: Shop til you drop
review: My husband and I had to get out of there before we spent all of our money. Just about every designer you could think of. Loved it make sure you bring lots of money to shop! Also great 4th go July sales!

title: Great for children’s experience
review: Great museum for children, full of activities for the babies. My daughter loved it and made many friends

title: Worth the trip!  Rain or shine.
review: This was a Top 10 from what we’ve seen in the U.S.  Great job Miami!

title: Hours of fun for the kids.
review: Enjoy!!

title: great for kids
review: Went her with my family, great time for anyone looking to spend few hours with family, plenty of area to explore, The building and activity area were the best for me. The museum offer senior discount and discount for 2 years or younger. Plenty of fun for kids.

title: Neat fun packed little museum for kids
review: This musesum has activities for children of all ages. My kids are 5 and 8 and they both had a blast. they offer a FL resident discount so its very affordable. We spent about 5 hours there and really got to enjoy everything. All of the exhibits arw interactive and even the adults can enjoy a few. I would highly this place for a day of family fun.

title: The Bass
review: A small museum so you definitely do it in an hour.  Interesting contemporary artists were on exhibition.  Some older works mixed in with modem works.

title: Delightful and thought provoking...but TINY!
review: That said, the museum was quite delightful with a mix of video, sculpture, and mixed media installations.  I most appreciated the Asian shopkeeper videos and my wife the clown sculptures - though I'm sure the exhibits change. So long as you understand that this is a 60-90 minute experience you'll be happy. Oh...and that if you are used to MoMA the Bass's 'cafe' and 'store' are proportioned accordingly.

title: Modern art
review: Modern art isn’t everyones idea of art and within the nomenclature there are many types. At the Bass it was fairly radical off-the-wall static and video art. The building and small park are also very nice and we enjoyed it

title: Modern Contemporary
review: This museum did not wow me. However, the staff was very friendly and it's a beautiful museum (aesthetically). When I visited there was an exhibit with a room full of full-size clowns sitting on the floor. It was very  creepy. I'm guessing that was what the artist intended?

title: Small Museum but Packs a Big Punch
review: A few blocks from the crazy South Beach is this little art oasis. When I visited, only the first floor was open, but the exhibitions I saw were simply fantastic. I was blown away with how well it was curated. The museum itself is beautiful and a great facility overall. Any art lover must make a stop here during their trip.

title: A Tourist Place.
review: Many Restaurants by the Bay, and Shopps, plus small specialty booths runs throught.  You may dine, take a boat ride to the Islands of the Rich and Famous, or just relax with Music Bands, usually Caribbean beat playing at night, while people dance (free) around the Stage near the Water. Use comfortable sport cloth and shoes, relax, nice ambiance mostly tourist.   .

title: Hot in August
review: Got off the metromover at this stop and walked through park to the water.  Once you get to the water there are some benchs with some much needed shade and a breeze

title: Have a break and admire the bikinis
review: Bayside Park is on Miami Beach, it's a great place to take a break and watch the surf. You can admire the beach, but you will probably admire the bikini girls, for which the beach is famous, more. Places to have a drink or a meal abound.

title: Always a great place to chill
review: Always a great place to be, to just sit around and watch the ships go by, or to grab some light snack, even to enjoy a chilled beer in the evening.

title: Nice place to visit see the beach and nearby shopping district
review: It’s Miami beach, it’s clean well maintained and looked after. Not that busy or overcrowded, just nice to stroll around and admire all thats nearby.

title: Oasis in the midst of bustling centre
review: One street away from Lincoln road that is ever so bustling, this uniquely designed park is on Washington Av but can be a very relaxing and cool place. Situated next to New World Symphony Centre, the garden can provide access to the music concert that's happening inside. If you are looking for a place to rest your feet after all the shopping nearby, head to this place.

title: Breathtaking place
review: If you are a photo lover, visit this park. It has an amazing design mixed with beautiful flowers. Snap it all!

title: Great Addition to Miami Beach
review: This wonderfully designed park contiguous to Miami Beach offers a bit of quiet enjoyment in the midst of Miami Beach.  Check the local schedules as there are often outdoor events here.

title: Needs one of these in every city
review: Found out about this place online and that every Tuesday they show a free outdoor movie on a huge screen. Clearly it helps if the weather is good and it was perfect when we went. They also give out free popcorn although we didn't like this very much - cant complain as its all free. Take some snacks, take a towel or something to lie or sit on and chill. There's ice cream within a 10 min walk and restaurants nearby for after. Great night out that doesn't have to cost a penny.

title: Interesting, but small
review: I did not stop--I thought this was someone's private garden.  Did not realize that this is a tourist attraction.

title: Miami Must-see
review: This is a wonderful little Cuban street you'll come across on any tour of the city. Great place to walk around, buy cigars, get some cuban coffee, take a picture with one of the roosters, etc. Highly recommend!

title: A graet place to visit. This was in 2013 NOT 2018
review: Nice area and friendly people. We found a great restaurant there, named Mama Rosa. SO nice staff/owners

title: Main Street in Little Havana
review: Plenty of on street parking for $1.75 an hour up to a maximum of 3 hours.

title: Amazing  experience!
review: Miami is a great place to experience Latin culture! It's a must to visit Little Havana and Ball and Chains! Try freshly made cigars and just walk the night away with beautiful people and nice and warm weather.

title: An Easy Walk and full of life
review: By all means, include this walk in your Miami plans. If you like authentic Cuban vibes, enjoy the cigar culture, you have to visit. There are some touristy areas, but for the most part, this is a great place to hang out, have some Cuban eats -- especially the coffee -- and hang out and smoke some well made cigars. Be advised, you still cannot get Cuban cigars, but those that are sold are very good.

title: Miami Open 2019
review: Make sure you have easy walking shoes. Please do not bring a purse or backpack, it is not aloud.Only plastic  bags aloud, and available for free at the designated trailer outside on the parking lot. No costs.

title: Miami Open Was So Much Better in Key Biscayne
review: Overall a very dissapointing experience that left us longing for Key Biscayne.

title: Miami Open 2018 vs 2019
review: Organizers should consider if a four sided stadium could be temporarily be created on the grounds outside the stadium, but would have to forego the luxury seats offered this year.

title: New venue for Miami Open Tennis tournament
review: We attended 3 days of the Miami Open at this facility & it was awesome. The venue was easy to get around & a very pleasant place to attend this great tournament.

title: Great.
review: I have no issue recommending a visit to the Hard Rock. Great place to see a game or show. Easy to get to and get out of.

title: Beautiful, peaceful shopping center.
review: The stores have great, current merchandise.

title: Nice shoping and restaurants
review: The mall is nicely outlayed in a sort of outdoors tipe of mall; nice shops and beautifull people. Plenty of restaurants to choose from

title: A great upscale addition to the Coral Gables shopiing scene
review: Love to shop at the department stores as well as smaller shops. The mall does a great job at Christmas and there is good restaurant variety.

title: Shopping made easy
review: Merrick park is a low ke, comfortable shopping experience. With anchor stores Nordstrom and Nieman the mall has everything you could need.

title: Unique site to have a picnic while enjoying awesome music
review: This is a Unique site to have a picnic while enjoying awesome music performed by the New World Symphony Orchestra. The sound system is amazing and on the Wallcast you can see, not only great performances but commentaries and interviews made to the director and musicians.

title: Great Vevue
review: The outdoor concert plaza and projection space is simply brilliant.

title: Wallcast a must
review: Bring your lawn chairs and enjoy a free night of music and picnicking.  There are only 800 seats in the concert hall, but that was great as well.  I liked the community feel of the wallcast.

title: Picture perfect place
review: Staff was friendly and there was a lifeguard on duty. Dressing room and restroom were clean and well-kept. There was also a little bar where you could buy icecream, snacks and drinks.

title: Gorgeous Venetian Pool in Coral Gables
review: This pool is such a fabulous find! Complete with palm trees and picnic area, very family oriented and lovely old black and white photographs adorning the entrance area. A fabulous place for a cool swim and great place to take photos.

title: Gorgeous pool, great for families
review: My 3yo son could not stop talking about how much he loved the Venetian Pool! We spent an entire Sunday here and despite having to pay the tourist tax we felt it was well worth the price of admission. Bring your own lunch and snacks to avoid the lines and mediocre food in the cafe. Just beautiful and refreshingly cool water.

title: Worth stopping by for
review: This pool is a beautiful sight to behold. Pricing to go for a swim is somewhat exaggerated but I assume this is needed for maintenance and for keeping the place from getting swarmed with tourists. Parking can be challengeing.

title: Great place for nice and peaceful relaxing :)
review: Beautiful, peaceful, not much expensive.. On weekends it can be busier, but you can still find a place to enjoy and relax. The only thing that I didn't like was a coffee shop (they didn't have nor milk nor cream for the coffee).

title: Just spectacular- a lot of nature and one hell of a prohibition cellar
review: Walked around the grounds and loved seeing so much green in miami- hard to find. By the water so very relaxing. Fascinating history of the place and Mr. Deering. Local history is hard to find in Miami. Also took a tour of the prohibition cellar and it is one of a kind. To think it was constructed and used as a liquor (Mostly) wine cellar during the prohibition. Very well kept and looking forward to a wine tasting they have coming up in November.

title: Beauty of nature close to the concrete jungle.
review: If you have been to Viscaya make sure to visit to see a quiet piece of paradise.  While standing near the harbor there is only a view of green and no concrete or condos in view.

title: CANOE TRIP WAS AMAZING!
review: Aimee love what they do and it shows.

title: Superb photo opportunity.
review: Photographing the Fall Equinox at the Deering Estate is an event local photographers always look forward.  This and many other events are hosted by Jessica who does a wonderful job of hosting monthly events at Deering.  She always makes sure that the sun rises in exactly the right position very year for the Equinox!!!  You can also photography sunrises monthly at the estate..check the site for dates.  I have am so thankful that Jessica is willing to give of her time so we participate in this event.  I have been photographing this and other sunrises at the Estate for years..Every sunrise is different and beautiful. So thankful we have this opportunity.

title: Not As Impressive
review: If you have been to Viscaya, you may want to pass on the Deering Estate. When approaching via US1, traffic can be very madding just north of the estate. Once there, the main focus are two medium sized houses with a large boat basin with a view to Biscayne Bay. Picnic tables are available to enjoy the views with your self supplied snack or lunch.  One of the artist studios had an open sign, but the doors were pad locked. I didn’’t find any large landscaped gardens.

title: Great for bike riding and cooling down!
review: There is a bike rack very near the Collins Pk area, so you can have a great time riding.  I find it a better space to lay under a tree for shade and relax.  It's not as touristy as other areas, like near the strip, so you'll have relative peace and quiet to rest on the grass.  I don't remember seeing any dogs so you won't have to worry about any surprises underneath you!

title: Collins Ave: the main Street in Miami
review: The Collins Park area was land donated to the city by John Collins the first developer of Miami Beach. The stone building in the park was originally the John Collins Memorial Library when it was dedicated in 1930 but is now part of the Bass Museum.

title: Best experience ever
review: This is the best animal encounter I’ve ever experienced. The staff are all very kind and the landscape is beautiful ! I recommend doing the monkey tour! You get to get up close and personal with all the monkeys !

title: Great time and informative
review: The spider monkeys and gibbons will make you just watch in awe. The crab eating/Java macaques are funny and get into quite a few skirmishes. They all except treats that you purchase in the gift shop. The Wings of Love parrots were so much fun, and they also like to interact with you. As I am a huge animal advocate, I felt all the animals were well cared for, enclosures were all super clean and seemed happy. I would definitely return.

title: Loved the monkeys
review: We pad a lot of extra money to go inside the jungle area and feed the monkeys. It was way too expensive we thought, but I wouldn't have gone if we didn't do this as the rest of the place was just okay, not a huge amount to do. The monkeys were very cute, and they come and eat the food right out of your hands.

title: So much fun!!!
review: The place is not huge, but we still spent 4 hours there. We took our 21 yr old granddaughter who was visiting. We didn't do the Rainforest Experience, but we had a great time!  The presentations were not long, but were very informative. King, the Silverback Gorilla was a riot.  He has such an attitude that you can 't help but laugh.  He is quite intelligent and responds to the guides with sign language . The rest of the monkeys were so entertaining. The Gibbons are amazing.  Comment: food offered at the one venue is just hot dogs and pizza, so don't plan on a meal there.   Really a fun afternoon!

title: Loved it.
review: We are in the vet business and one of our techs brother worked here so we wanted to visit. I thought it was nice and the animals were well taken care of.

title: The Convention Center is currently under remodeling.
review: Remodeling should be completed by December 2017. It has been home to Political Party Conventions, Championship Boxing Matches and Art Basel. Its new replacement has been the source of a bit of local controversy over the appropriate size (indeed the appropriateness at all) of a convention center hotel. After 10 years of planning, this issue is still under debate.

title: Convenient
review: There are so many events along the year, one of my favorites is the Boat Show where you can enjoy all the models, sizes and people who come from all USA and other countries.

title: Car show and Art Basel is the only thing important
review: And those are pricey events. The rest of the year it suits smaller events and acts. To be honest the place needs to be re done. It's older and needs a good rehab, not just a fresh coat of paint. Parking is a mess in this area. The gaffes across the street charge an arm and a leg to park during special events.

title: Florida supercon 2016
review: It is awesome! Ir is sold out! The place it is safe to come! I recommend to come without car! Because parking it is expensive! The event is I is until July 4th

title: SUPERCON COULD HAVE BEEN SUPER
review: I went to Supercon 2016 because my son and husband are big comic book fans and I wanted to see what all they hype was about.  First, I felt it was poorly organized.  While they did pull in some well known celebrities, there were some there the younger kids had no idea who they were, which were the early Star Trek actors.  One of the actors sat reading a magazine because no one knew who he was.  Then there was the "No photographs" rule.  I stood by where Henry Winkler was and the fans were not aware you could go and talk to him for free!  The prices for just an autograph were outrageous, at $40-50 each.  Take that with the $40 entry for just one day and you're already at $100.  And if you decide to dress like a character, there's more money involved.  The food prices were a little high as well. Paying $8.00 for a hotdog is highway robbery. Add a drink and chips and you could have had a nice dinner at a steakhouse.  The Cosplay was neat but we had no idea where the competitions were.  Then in the program they listed video games on the 2nd floor.  I "assumed" this meant games for sale.  Instead, they had a bunch of outdated computer monitors set up on a long table for kids to play games.  Pretty lame.  I didn't travel 200 miles and 2=3 hours for my kid to play games on a 1980's monitor.  We arrived on a friday to go to the show on Saturday.  Unfortunately tickets were sold out so we opted to pay for another hotel and go on Sunday.  There was barely anyone there!  That, to me, is not good planning.  Some of the celebs were leaving Sunday night due to the smaller crowds even though the event went on until Monday, the 4th.  The charge for the four day event was like $100.  Personally, after just being there for the day Sunday, I don't know what there would be to do for the entire 4 days.  Hopefully they will get some reviews and improve on some of these areas.Just poorly organized, in my and my family's opinion.  It was more like a glorified flea market

title: LOVE Peter Like photos!
review: Although this gallery shows the same pieces as all of his other galleries, we did not feel accosted when we entered the gallery.  The sales person showed us a few of her favorites and we got to cool off from the 102 degrees outside.

title: Great artist. Nature captured beautifully
review: I very much enjoy Peter Lik photos. The gallery is well located and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable. There are a variety of natural scenes from around the world as well as some aviation. My favorite are the trees that he captures. A definite must see for anyone who likes photography

title: Beautiful
review: Great location among the shops on Lincoln Rd. A welcome break and beautiful photography to inspire adventure.

title: Breathtaking
review: It's no wonder the photographer doesn't identify the location of where the pictures were taken as one can imagine themself in all of the locations. Simply stunning.

title: Don't miss this gallery while walking down Lincoln Road
review: Lincoln Road has terrific shops and restaurants and is well worth the few hours it takes to explore all it has to offer.  During a recent trip, we stopped by Peter Lik's Gallery for the first time.  Amazing photographs, definitely some of the best I've ever seen.  Don't miss this gallery!

title: Shop till you drop
review: Designer, hip and very fashionable.  Were the trendy go to be seen and pick up the latest in fashion.  It's easy to be tempted to buy something very Miami only probably to never wear it again.  Great fun to people watch.

title: Money and time to burn?
review: If you have money and time to burn, you might consider hanging out at the 8th St Designer District during your South Beach vacation. My wife and I went to look for me some cool looking long sleeve button downs. I got most of my shirts from Banana Republic. My wife just had to buy some perfume from Dash to commemorate the Kardashians. I got some new swim shorts and t-shirts at Quicksilver. You can't go wrong with air conditioned stores in the Miami Beach heat!

title: Girls getaway
review: Had an awesome time lying on the beach and Cody with Boucher brothers was super attentive.  Would definitely return!

title: Very fascinating district
review: It is a very safe area also at the night.

title: Well preserved structures
review: Very colorful and well preserved. Lot of people around. You can walk to other streets easily.  Lots of places to eat.  Food is pricey but you can enjoy the place.  Definitely will visit again.

title: Kids love this place
review: A nice place to spend time with your child. lots of interactive activities and games. Price is about $ 7.50 per head if you enter at 5 pm. There is a subway restaurant in the same building. Lots of parking spaces for about $1 per hour.

title: Happy Eid! It was agood experience
review: We went there with a 4 year old boy to please him for the Eid day. We like that it has a plenty of choices to imitate. He loved fishing and sailing tho boats the most. We loved the Gym . It would be great if you have more than one kid to take them to, and don’t worry, they will spend the whole day playing and they won’t get enough. It is not so expendive and it worths coming to, don’t miss it

title: Great outing for children
review: Love this museum. Take my children often. Ages 9, 7, 6, 3. Something for them all. They change up the activities and the displays often although not often enough. Great place. Lots more potential. Good for a full day of fun

title: Good for young kids
review: More eating options please!

title: Worth the visit!
review: This is worth the trip. We stayed in FLL and traveled for the day to the musem. There's enough to do for the entire day with no chance of the kids getting bored.

title: Beautiful space, some gems, but small museum
review: They also have a snack bar and a lovely courtyard. The space itself is very welcoming and there are some gems here. I recommend it for the small museum aficionado.  If you are expecting something like MOMA then you will be disappointed.

title: Love it!!
review: This is the best affordable art museum on Miami beach. Not only is it an awesome place to work but it is a privilege to be in this place to see all different kinds of art from different points of view, I love how the art changes around every few months.

title: always a great visit
review: I hear Miami and I think of the Bass (I know other people think of beach and other stuff), and I wonder what it might have next. Everytime I´ve been there I´ve seen wonderful, interesting and bold exhibits, I love this place its an absolute must!!! and its location is great on South Beach, so you can have beach AND art :)

title: Modern Art Museum
review: If you are one who appreciates modern and interpretive art, this is an excellent museum to visit.  While I am not an avid modern art enthusiast; this museum does have a nice collection of art.  It takes anywhere from 45 minutes to 1 and half hours to visit.

title: Family Day: Elevator Broken
review: I'm the organizer of a photography group in Miami and we have a few Disable folks, last Sunday we went to the museum and we were expecting much more than there was, first there was not much to see and the main elevator was broken, how can you have a family day and not have the elevator working, it makes no sense...this was a free day I can not imagine paying $10 for such a poor place....not worth it,,,don't waste your time on this venue

title: Close to the Hotel and a nice Place
review: Not being from these parts, this was a pleasant oasis within walking distance of our hotel. It offers a nice walk around the harbour. It was a clean well kept area.

title: Very Pretty
review: My daughter was in the process of driving past this park and I asked her to stop and lets take a short stroll. The weather was great, the patrons were friendly and we had a lovely scenic view. I think if anyone is looking for pretty scenery they will like this park.

title: New Year Bash!
review: We brought in the New Year listening to Pitbull on the stage at the park. The atmosphere was great! It is near the mall so there are a bunch of things to experience while in the park area!

title: View of the port of Miami
review: In downtown across the port area of cruise ships which usually are in town during the weekend. Nice place to start walk along the beach.

title: Beautiful park on the water
review: The park is great for walking. It's on the water and you can see cruise ships in the distance, and boats sailing by. Adjacent to Bayside Market Place.

title: Love it
review: Its not Tanglewood, but its great to have to have it here, Go at least an hour earlier to get a decent space. We usually take a pick nick basket.

title: Beautiful, worth a stop
review: This park is not big but is it beautiful, you can walk around and take pictures, and on certain nights nights they play movies for free. People bring chairs, blankets and snacks and enjoy movie time.

title: Enjoyable at any time !
review: Either if you want to enjoy a coffee, a light chat, alone or just chill, this place will suit you.  As a plus, some weekends they offer concerts (wall-cast) of the new world symphony, another plus for the location.

title: Nice little Park next to New World Center
review: Our hotel was near, so we walked couple of times through this nice little Park. Near Convention Center, The Fillmore and next to New World Center. Some restaurants near too, so it was nice to have a lunch and see the Park sametime. Soundscape area of this Park allows visitors experience live, free wallcasts of events throughout the season through the use of visual/audio technology

title: Lights, Cameras & Action!
review: Feel like taking in a movie or a Live Band streaming? Head over to this Fabulous Open Area cinema like park. Don't forget to bring lounging chairs or a spreadsheet to throw on ground like a mini pick-nick! Huge screen panorama offers perfect viewing for all (and i'm talking All! 100 people at any given time will join in for this festivity!). Arrive early for a good spot! GetSome!!

title: Awesome!
review: If you have some extra time while in Miami I would recommend a visit to Calle Ocho. Some great food and coffee in the area. Try a Cuban coffee, you will not be disappointed.

title: Street walking mall
review: It’s up and coming,every month new restaurants and stores open for business, the best located in between 2nd and 17th ave

title: Educational and Fun
review: Both my husband and I enjoyed by bus, the touring throughout Miami districts. Calle Ocho was especially memorable. Muy criolla and rich in culture. We both enjoyed our trip ti Miami and all we had a chance to see.

title: So interesting and great way to get a taste of Havana!
review: Traveled with the Hop on hope off bus and got off here.  Great restaurants and have to see Domino Park

title: Tourist trap
review: I’m sorry,but this street Calle Ocho is tourist trap,nothing to do with Cuba,...if you’re visiting some of the restaurant the food is terrible and service not even better,..visit downtown Miami and you can get better Cuban food,...and cigars? You can buy cigars on South beach less expensive,.../everything it’s overpriced,be careful!/.

title: Great Stadium!
review: We went to see the Peru-Chile game... and our tickets were upgraded to the suites... the restaurant inside... just great... great game... great location....

title: Party Stadium
review: Beautiful Stadium in an up-and-coming community. Many places to shop and grab a quick bite to eat. Walmart is conveniently across the street too.

title: Very disappointing concert venue.
review: We were at this venue to see Jimmy Buffett and the Eagles perform. I attend a lot of music concerts every year and pretty much know what to expect at large venues like the Hard Rock Stadium but this one was extremely ridiculous. Once inside the stadium and past the security checkpoint we had fifteen minutes to make our field seating area. Once we arrived at the field we were told we needed wristbands to go to our seats. We were told to go to isle entry 129-130 to get onto the field. After getting over there we waited in line with about four hundred other people that were also trying to get to their field seats. As it turned out, there were no wristbands there and the Buffett part of the concert had already been underway for ten minutes. We were told that we would have to go back down to the entrance and there we would find someone giving out the wristbands. We did this and had to stand in a single line about a hundred feet long where two people at a table were working feverishly to check tickets and strap on wristbands! Once we stood in that line for fifteen minutes we had to return to isle entry 129/130 and wait there for another twenty minutes before we could get on the field and to our seats. It was eight o’clock before we were seated in our seats and Buffett had already played for an hour which meant that we only got to enjoy the Buffett part of the show for thirty minutes. They have a very pour management group for such a large

title: It's Finally Approaching the Fun of the Old Orange Bowl
review: When the stadium was first built, those of us who are old time Canes and Fins fans lamented its sterility -- the crowd was too far from the field. But the renovations have changed that, and a few years ago, when the Canes trounced Notre Dame, the venue showed it can be AS electric as the Orange Bowl on a Saturday night.

title: A place to spend some time and a lot of money.
review: Beautiful setting, replete with high-end stores, but with a few mid-level places. Great restaurants, too.

title: Gorgeous outdoor shopping center
review: If you are looking to enjoy a beautiful outdoor fall day, Village of Merrick Park is the place to be.  Looking around is fun but the shopping is even better.

title: Merrick Park shopping -Corale Gables
review: Crate and Barrel, Pottery Barn, Nordstrom’s 3 levels

title: Shoppers heaven
review: This is a great shopping g area. There is a wide variety of retail stores in a very beautiful setting. They also have a number of restaurants with outdoor seating so a good place to shop and have lunch.

title: Wallcast Experience Brings Class and Classical Music to South Beach
review: Attended our first Saturday evening Wallcast of the New World Symphony with a program of Tchaikovsky and Stravinsky!  Getting there more than an hour before the concert was a very good idea.  We spread out, enjoyed a picnic, sipped a glass of wine and let the music wash over us as the stars came out.  The incredible surround-sound system transports the music straight to the soul.  Watching this gifted, young orchestra left us with a feeling of hope for the future of classical music in America.  And to think, all of this was free.  Doesn't get any better than this on a beautiful night in Miami Beach.

title: If you love music the New World Wall-Cast offers a FREE outside showing of what the Symphony is playing inside.
review: We attended last Saturday night, November 7th, 2015 and watched and listened to Telemann and Handel music conducted by Paul Goodwin and the evening was magical and FREE for the attendees outside.  Lawn chairs, picnic baskets, children were all a part of the event.  And did I say FREE?  YES.   Do not say you do not like classical music until you try this event.

title: Spectacular place
review: Nice and relaxing place, fantastic sound and amazing screen, next to Lincoln Road, restaurants and cafes . Great experience

title: Oh what a night
review: Thank you New World Symphony and Citi Bank for your sponsorship!

title: Outstanding.
review: Great night. Will definitely come back for another program

title: The most beautiful public pool
review: We spent a hot afternoon here. It is just beautiful. The caves were a big hit with the kids. We went midweek so finding a lounger was not hard but I would imagine at peak times it would pay to be early. Changing rooms, lockers and food was available.

title: Mr and mrs
review: Not open for maintenance. Went on purpose.  No water on pool. Gates locked. Pretty.  Open sometime in February according to signs.

title: Great Treasure in Coral Gables
review: Beautiful pool in residential area of Coral Gables. The water is cold but it is worth it to spend a relaxing day in a beautiful atmosphere. Beware as the pool closes part of the year in the winter. Kids love it and you can bring your books and music and have a great relaxing day!

title: Nothing but just another pool.
review: This place did not live up to its expectations. It is nothing more than a pool, just another pool. Probably your hotel pool would be better than this.

title: Summer Day
review: Was here with the family and still as wonderful as ever. This is a tranquil but unusually beautiful place. The water here is cold but if your here in the middle of summer you will find it refreshing. This is a place you must visit while in Miami during the summer. Enjoy

title: ANOTHER GEM
review: Enjoy.

title: Lame, not worth it
review: Extremely lame and boring, nothing going on there. Many furnishings and decorations from Pottery Barn.

title: Nice place but not worth going out of the way to see
review: The Deering Estate consists of a historic estate and associated grounds. The trails and most of the grounds were closed when we visited. There are some great views looking out towards the water. The house itself is nice, but nothing that is a "must see" attraction. For the holidays, various sponsors like Pottery Barn decorated the place to showcase their merchandise. While the decorations worked and matched the house, a lot of the displays felt like extended ads for the sponsors. If you are going to only see one historic estate and grounds, go to Vizcaya instead.

title: The view was just amazing!
review: We did a crusie and it nice! The weather was perfect, the tour guide really knew his history and was very entertaining. I would recommend adding this to your list if you are in Miami. The place was amazing!

title: Prohibition Era Cellar Series Distillery Old St Pete
review: What a great time we had at this special speakeasy event. It was so unique to dress the part and try the different drinks and paired with the little bites all in the estates hidden vault. Can’t wait to do another one. Thanks for being so creative in producing this wonderful series.

title: SOBE at it's nicest....
review: I came to miami and explored collins park for a couple training runs. Nice area but the homeless tend to worry me at early morning. It's a great little secret of miami beach that everyone should explore.  It's pretty safe for the most part and very close to alot of the hotels.

title: Interesting.
review: See the sights of South Beach by walking along and through Collins Park.  Be careful of people on bikes!

title: sweet
review: very nice to run or walk while enjoying the Miami beach scenery. the park goes on forever so bring water and prepare for the hot and humid Miami beach weather. recommended

title: A relaxing park when no exhibits are there.
review: I have read some of the reviews and I am not sure they are talking about Collins Park.  This has Collin ave. run thru it and is between 21st and 22nd street.  On the East side of Collins Ave. the park is between hotels north and south and the beach board walk on the east.  This area is just an open park most of the time, but when there are events such as swim week there are usually tents set up for the exhibits.  The west side of Collins park is surrounded by the City Library, condos and the Ballet and The Bass Museum.  This area can just be open, but when events are at the Beach they many times set up exhibits here.  A quick and easy place to see.

title: Relaxing!
review: The Collins Park Neighborhood in Miami Beach sits on the north eastern point of the South Beach Historic District.

title: Not as good as the adverts
review: Would I recommend? No

title: Rainforest Tour is Amazing!
review: The whole Monkey Jungle is cool, but the Rainforest Tour is absolutely amazing! We were covered in monkeys during the entire time we went inside their habitat. One of the coolest things I’ve done. Ever.

title: Expensive but fun
review: We didn’t have kids with us but the kids who were there seemed to be having a ball feeding the monkeys

title: Returned with Kids over 10 years later!
review: My husband and I found Monkey Jungle when we first went to Miami/Key Largo in 2006.  We loved it!  Once we had kids and were able to travel easier, we wanted to take them.  We go to Miami once per year for the boat show now due to work.  Unfortunately, last year they were closed due the hurricane when we wanted to go, but this year they were open.  We and our boys (9,6) loved it again.  This time we did the rainforest tour and really enjoyed it.  Although it is expensive, we highly recommend it.  The monkeys are so sweet.  We did the noon tour, and could tell that later in the day, the monkeys in the regular part of the zoo were not too hungry anymore.  Also, the swimming monkeys were not interested in going after their eggs at the later show.  But, if you stay until later in the day, you can hear and see the gibbons swinging around crazy and singing.    Great experience.

title: Nice wildpark for a day out
review: Despite the showery day we had a fun time at the Wildpark Monkey Jungle. Monkeys enjoy a lot of freedom, where the visitors are the one that are actually caged. Feeding the monkeys using the chained bowls and the plastic tubes added some extra fun. The animals seem to be happy in their jungle-like environment and are fed regularly. At feeding time the rangers are prepared to answer any question and show passion for their job. We really enjoyed the four hours we spend at the park.

title: Versatile Venue
review: I have been to the convention center for the auto show, art and home show and the latest was supercon. This is a very nice space and versatile venue. Supercon this year could've been better organized but my friends and I really enjoyed it either way.

title: Medium Sized conventions
review: Visited the Miami convention centre for an annual food and beverage show. I find movement and from the convention centre simple and easy to understand. There is WI Fi available, lots of rest rooms and easy transportation. It is also relatively safe.

title: on construction since 1971
review: this place is huge on the inside with all kinds of messed up directions. Has been in construction since i can remember. they usually host a lot of marathons event and the car show.

title: It is being renovated
review: When its finished it will be great.

title: Conventional but why not ?
review: Like the proverbial afternoon bridge playing maiden aunt, it is there, it is unexciting, and, yes, like Aunt Lily, you somehow make of it a reference. Our most recent and important contact was at Art Basel and we found the venue a happy mixture between a funhouse and a carefully laid out clinic. Intelligently adapted to the madness of a large art fair, the convention center lets you get just a wee bit lost the time to discover the latest creation of that up and coming Sierra Leone genius whose schtick is painting rhino skin's baby pink and that offshoot of Soho eatery where you can delight in a nettles and organic kale smoothie. OK, I'm laying it on thick, but the point is that the floor plan is adapted for easy circulation and the only negative is the noise, which of course is the wage of popularity. Also, it is not cheap, but there again, there are lots of giveaways and reductions, and well the sort of thing they do in the souks of old. So one can easily fit into one of the many reduced price plans.They have just completed the renovations, interesting ... we'll have a look soon.

title: Different place.
review: Never saw so different photos and quality in one gallery like that. Expenses photos, but they are so beautiful.

title: Exploring...
review: Photography perfection. Pieces are amazing. Prices are more for the high end purchaser however. The piece I loved and would fit my color scheme was a cool $25k

title: Incredible talent
review: Stunning Art work not to be missed if not to purchase then feast your eyes on these amazing pictures?

title: Fascinating Photos
review: Take a few minutes while strolling in the Lincoln Road are to stop by the Gallery, (no charge).  It is clear that Peter Lik is an amazing and talented Photographer.

title: If you like photography - its a must!
review: If you are by lincoln road and love breath taking photography please stop by here. The lighting is spectacular for viewing. The pictures are one of a kind and I love the large canvas style.

title: So much to see
review: One amazing artistic place in this magnificent place is this which opened my eyes and helped me to be more creative. It has fantastic food and small cafeterias. I LOVE IT SO MUCH

title: Artistic Wall Drawings, Designs and Buildings Beyond Belief
review: We did NOT go for the shopping but to see the WALLS and all the magnificent drawings and graffiti scattered throughout the Design District. This used to be an old run down warehouse district that is being rejuvenated with many high end shops, galleries, and restaurants. Delicious food can be found on every corner here. But go to see the walls-they are free, fascinating, and fun. An eye opener

title: Nothing particularly interesting...
review: Go every year 2 times, and the shops are  old...could use some new shops..same shops as in NYC or else, if not same, the shops are not much to see

title: All your favorite designers
review: It was what you would expect from a designer district, plenty of designers you would love to see and then there was Dash, the Kadashians business, nothing special there, more of a photo op for the young

title: Great for a walk!
review: Lots of stores and not all expensive.  There is a big mall as well.  There is a beautiful courtyard with fountains and old Spanish architecture.  Lots of restaurants as well.  Go in the evening too hot in the day!

title: Great place for kids!
review: My daughter loves Miami Children's Museum! Take advantage of the cheaper price as a Dade County resident or if you have a card/account with Bank of America, they offer free museums days here (usually 1st weekend of the month). Fun visit!

title: #1 Family Fun
review: This Museum is a fantastic experience for any family whether a tourist or resident.  14 oermanent newly restored galleries as well as a special area for traveling exhibits.  Love, Love, Love this place!

title: Mostly for little kids, nice to visit
review: Nice place to spend a couple of hours with children.

title: A good option for a rainy day
review: We went to visit Miami Children's Museum on a rainy day. It was the best option to keep our 7 yr old and 1 yr old busy ! They loved all the sections, especially the pet care area. Also, our 7 yr old loved to pretend to work at the seaport. He learned a lot .

title: Good for little children
review: This museum is interesting for little children - maybe those over 6 years won't like it. It's small and attractions are not so educational - the purpose is more to entertain. Our 4-year-old liked it. For us, it was a little bit boring. The museum are is nice and we could se many cruise ships from there.

title: Building up new exhibition
review: The Bass is building up exhibition so there was only Paola Pilvi and Aaron Curry exhibitions open. Those could be seen quite quickly so I suggest visiting when they have all areas open.

title: Great little museum! Take the free tour.
review: This is a great little museum on Miami Beach. We took the free tour with Andy who gave us lots of great context while also letting us explore on our own. When we visited in November 2018, there was a fantastic exhibit by Paola Pivi upstairs. A nice way to infuse a little culture into a day at the beach.

title: Quite a surprise !
review: Small art museum with fresh, inspiring exhibition of contemporary art. We enjoyed a bit of peace and culture after a few miles walking the beachlife. Nice !

title: Such a Fun Gallery
review: Great for the kids, too. Loved the sense of wit and deep humanity in the shows on display. Beautiful physical plant to hold big shows with lots of space around the art. Centrally located near South Beach. Will go back for sure.

title: A rejuvenated art museum
review: Years ago the Bass Museum was home to a collection of medieval artefacts. Recently it was renovated and has taken on the allure of an art gallery like so many others in SoBe. The exhibits we saw and enjoyed were childlike but uplifting and we took many pictures. The benefit of the museum is it's spacious and bright cafe. The pizza is delicous and highly recommendable.

title: Nice park until it rains
review: This is a relaxing park where the locals like to walk their dogs. There is limited shelter so if it starts raining you need to head over to Bayside Marketplace until the storm passes.

title: Nice to sit and watch the world go by
