review: Enjoyed a few trips here, just relaxing with a book or watching the dolphins in the bay.  Nearby to Bayside as well which is nice for shopping.

title: Small but worth a look.
review: Obviously overtaken by the rather garish food and shopping malls so inevitable, but does give a pleasant respite from the city.  Take the riverside walk in the opposite direction and high chance of seeing manatees.

title: A total waste of time
review: It was a total waste of time.

title: Nice spot for a walk
review: As we stayed in an Airbnb right opposite the park, we walked in the park on a few occasions. It was simply nice to get out of the apartment and walk along the ocean. I would not have driven here specifically, but it was convenient for fresh air and a nice view of the ocean.

title: Pack a picnic bag
review: New world symphony and Miami Beach created a great public space to enjoy the arts.  During season you can watch concerts for free outside.  On Wednesdays there is free movies on the wall.

title: Home of New World Symphony Wallcasts
review: The Wallcast experience is not to be missed. Bring a picnic, friends and enjoy the setting and the music.

title: Great Outdoor Concerts
review: Sharing a picnic with family and friends while watching and listening to a New World Symphony with MMT has become my favorite thing to do in Miami Beach.  I recommend this to all.

title: If you’re around Lincoln Rd
review: fins as well the New World Center( Performance Hall).

title: love the design
review: love this place during day time because of its design. You can take great pictures and walk or even take a break. they have benches, I also enjoy this location because it close to restaurants and stores

title: If you love Cuban food, check it out.
review: Lots of great restaurants, and local artisanal ice cream. A lot of tourists, and all the Hop On Hop Off buses stop here. You need to park on a side street and download the parking app to make it easier to pay, although the parking prices are reasonable.

title: Cuban History and Cuisine
review: You want a great Cuban food, then you must pass visit the heart of the Cuban community back in its hey-day.  Here is where it all started with Cubans and later, Cuban-Americans. Although it has changed significantly since the 60s-80s (more Central and South American emigres) this is Cuba and it will always reflect the Cuban influence and culture within this historic district.  By the way, Marlins Park is centrally located with thin the historic district.

title: Really the same as Little Havana
review: But that being said, there is so much to see, experience, eat and drink here while you learn about the Cuban culture.  Will definitely return.

title: Be Careful
review: Unfortunately, we encountered someone who was dressed professionally, and offered to take our pictures in an aggressive, friendly manner on this very street. Although this person was not a threat to us, it felt uncomfortable especially in the end when they turned to my husband and said a donation would be accepted. It should have been said up front, and for all in our group to hear.

title: Food tour a great way to see Calle Ocho Little Havana
review: I finished doing the food tour down CO and feel like I got a great flavor of the culture. Love  the food, the culture, the art, the music. This is great fun for families, friends, for drinks or ice cream

title: Gameday / Event tips
review: The stadium is pretty clean and the staff is very polite, helpful and ready to answer questions. I gave four stars because leaving the venue can be a hassle, but that’s typical of any event with a large crowd. From what I understand the venue is continually working on  parking and egress related issues to find ways to better flow the exiting folks safely. Uber or car service is a good option to get in and out quickly.

title: Beautiful stadium!
review: The hubby and I came for the Dolphins vs. Patriots game.  The stadium was really nice!  Even though it wasn't a complete dome, the temperature wasn't bad at all for a 1:00 pm game.  We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!

title: Excellent stadium
review: We left a bit early as blowout to get Uber but no signs and conflicting information about where the lot really is, we never found it as hit busy road and were able to get a taxi.

title: Nice Stadium, roomy and lots of food options!
review: Awesome stadium, great food, parking is a nightmere though only downside... :(....review is only of an NFL game as well...

title: Watch Valuables in your Car  /  Theft in Valet parking
review: The is supposed to be a reputable place, but apparently not.

title: Beautiful Buildings Nice Place to Stroll
review: Great place to take a walk especially after eating at one of the restaurants near by. The parking is not great really valet only unless you arrive early. There is a garage but it fills up fast. Great window shopping or perhaps shopping. But very pricey!

title: Excellent shopping experience.
review: they all offer excellent customer service and the lastest fashion trends.  Sundays at the place puts you in sensory overload with amazing diplays of smells and states.  Stop by and enjoy!!!!!

title: Relaxed shopping experience
review: This is the antithesis of your everyday mall. It’s a relaxed open aired mall with a great range of stores from Gucci, DVF, Athleta, Victoria Sectret and everything in between. The restaurants are great and a the anchor stores are Nordstrom and Neeiman Marcus which have great sales on occasion.

title: Very Nice architecture
review: Located in a  modern designed park, it is a place to visit. The building is very modern and nice, including a rooftop garden. If you have a chance to take a look inside it is a must.

title: Great visit. Amazing view
review: Definitely recommend this tour.

title: Excellent music, not a bad seat in the house
review: You can also go just for a tour of the building.  The park outside is great for picnics.  Outside wall casts and films are offered often in the winter months.

title: Actually deserves 10 stars
review: Extraordinary building (Garry).  Extraordinary acoustics.  Extraordinary musicianship. Check out their wall cast offering and don't spend a fine.  A true highlight of Miami Beach.

title: Get Inside: It is a must see building
review: 5. You can see a movie show some nights outside.

title: Expensive
review: I was so excited to come here for the last couple years I finally just got the chance. First it is expensive, it’s smaller then I thought it would be, my son is 11 he could only stay in a small area for his size unless he had a life jacket which is fine but I highly suggest bringing your own because I read they had some and they were all way too big so he was unable to go any further. It did really just feel like an outdoor pool. There isn’t much room to sit or put your towels very small area. Lifeguards were very strict with jumping etc. (For safety) but the whistle was always blowing. In all I think we stayed an hour and got bored so we left.

title: Relaxing day out!
review: Lovely outdoor pool, great for all ages, kids were in the pool the whole time playing and discovering. Very relaxing, lots of shady and sunny spots. Cafe on site provides tasty fast food and drink and reasonably priced, which makes up for the very pricey entrance fee ($65 for a family of 4, non residential) but we had a lovely relaxing time all round!

title: Avoid
review: Of all the things to do in Miami this is bottom of the list. Go to any of the beautiful beaches which are free and have a much much better time.

title: Venetian Pool
review: Cave

title: Festival Weekend
review: This is a great place to stay as well as an ideal location. The rooms are all good .Two master bedrooms with kitchen and breakfast bar, dining room and den area with tv. Screened porch as well. Very friendly staff, always willing to assist

title: Interesting tour of historic home
review: We had an interesting tour of a stately home and a cottage attached to it. Beautiful scenery. Our guide Jacob was very informative

title: A must see
review: Accessible by "free" car park and also the "free" trolley bus - this is a view into James Deering's wish to make Vizkaya a splendid, if not garish, demonstration of his wealth.  All rooms are interesting as are the splendid gardens.  Interesting to note how his "boat" docking station has had to accept the rising water levels with photos of its earlier days.

title: Historical and Unique.
review: This very Miami venue is the place to walk, see manatees, enjoy a cup of tea and basically spend an afternoon strolling. Highly recommended.

title: Historical Home - beautiful gardens
review: I truly enjoyed coming here for the first time.  The homes are so historical - which I love - the gardens are so lovely by the water.

title: Why don’t we have gold fixtures?
review: As a child, I went there for a field trip. The Today show was actually filming while we were there. It’s a beautiful place and lovely garden.the bay side with its structure was perfection. Of course when I got home I was disappointed in the plain fixtures in our restrooms.

title: CUTE LITTLE AREA FOR SHOPPING
review: visited here to check out some stores with my boyfriend. we passed collins park and thought it was a very unique area. the stacked, colored, large stones caught our eyes, it was very beautiful. there are some local schools around the area, so during schooldays, the traffic may be hectic and you might find yourself surrounded by high school students. very cute little mom and pop shops as well big brand stores that are only located in Miami. very cool area to walk.

title: A nice quiet little park
review: This is a nice little park surrounded by shopping, condos and a museum which appears to be closed. It's fairly well lit at night, though technically "closed" which seemed odd, only because it actually was empty at night. Not what we expected. The large coloured stone stack/art piece at the Collins Ave end makes a good visual landmark for tourists.

title: Nice
review: Calm and small park after a walk nice to sit down in the shadow, not much more to say actually bit if walking around in the sun some shade is nice and we found this one after a walk.

title: Beautifully manicured park
review: This was a permanent view from our Hotel windows.  Very serene, peaceful and most enjoyable to sit under a Palm tree in the humidity of the day

title: Lovely park
review: We sheltered from the midday sun here.  There are lots of places to sit under cover, and the view is wonderful.

title: Animals well cared for
review: We visited Monkey Jungle and all of us enjoyed the day. We really appreciated how healthy all the animals were. We also loved that we were caged in their habitat instead of the monkeys being in cages. Those that were caged seemed healthy and happy. Playing and interacting with each other. We spent much of the day and stayed to watch King a second time because he was sleeping during our first exhibition.

title: Great way to spend half a day
review: We went here and spent the afternoon with our teenage granddaughter and had a fantastic experience. We did the experience feeding the monkeys and it was well worth the cost. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for something different to do.

title: Prison for animals
review: The price is very high, the guy in the cashier did not accept the discount coupon enclosed to the tourist information booklet that we got from the visitor center of homestead city. Strange. Don’t waste your time. Don’t support this kind of touristic trap.

title: Dated, Dreary and Expensive
review: My suggestion would be to visit the Miami Zoo (Zoo Miami) instead. It's accredited by the Association of Zoos and Aquariums, so you know there are some high professional standards for caring for and exhibiting animals in captivity. There's more to see and it's a better value, at around $19 for kids 3-12 and $23 for adults (+ tax). It's about 10 miles away from the Monkey Jungle.

title: A must visit for any monkey lover!
review: Hours after visiting, we are still debating what spider monkeys favorite food is. Is it the dried Papaya or apple? It's papaya. I was a gymnast for fifteen years and the gibbons have better moves than anything I ever competed. Mad respect.

title: Hideous Building But, Hey, It's Home To Art Basel
review: The title sums it up - there is nothing compelling about this building other than the shows that may be offered there.

title: very nice
review: for graduation ceremony it was so nice to see all the graduates who worked hard for their diplomas!!!

title: Huge & Cool Spaces @ Convention Center!!
review: I have been to Miami Beach Convention Center for many different shows and each time I have been satisfied with the accommodations & facilities!  The Convention Center offers cool nicely air conditioned great big Show rooms for Exhibitions and the restroom facilities are kept clean and well stocked with Toiletries.. the eating options seem to be contracted out when there is a show going on ..There is ample Parking & Valet Parking offered!

title: Event
review: This convention center is undergoing a major expansion but it has been the best convention center and all of Miami Dade County.

title: A very good place to visit
review: It is one of the very best public service places in the state of Florida.

title: Fabulous!
review: We stopped in based on the reviews we saw on Trip Advisor. My husband is a photographer and was very familiar with Peter's talent. The gallery is small and welcoming. One of the docents noticed our particular interest in certain photos and showed us additional prints behind closed doors that offered different lighting. Definitely worth a visit!

title: Go drool at Peter Lik's wonderful photography - purchase if you can afford!
review: Do enjoy & don't blame me if you come out with a lighter wallet!

title: Stunning gallery
review: Inspiring images, truly breathtaking pictures by Peter Lik that take your breath away...you will want to purchase everything!

title: Great gallery to visit to see Peter Lik's work
review: The bonus is that nearby there are two other galleries to visit.

title: Beautiful Photographs
review: It's a small gallery, but the photographs on display are absolutely breathtaking. The staff are also very engaging and do a good job in making you feel special by answering your questions and making conversation with you.

title: Designer Decor District
review: Presenting leading designers, contemporary and traditional, antiques dealers, art galleries and retail spaces.

title: VG
review: I've seen this neighborhood rise from the ashes. It's lost some of its original charm but has some really fine shopping and dining.

title: The Modren area
review: Worth to see. Nice art galleries and restaurants. Interesting architecture. A Huge contrast to some another parts of Miami nearby

title: Art Deco
review: 8th street is a bit different from the rest of South beach. There are new and old buildings in the typical art deco style, fresh clothing stores, casual hotels, a beach and New Cafe. A street to visit when on Miami Beach.

title: Great Architecture
review: The Designer District is Miami Beach's design District of South Beach. It has stunning architecture and great designs.

title: Great for children
review: This museum has a lot of exhibits for kids to interact with. There also seemed to be a lot of different activities going on throughout the day. The exhibits are mostly tied to the local area making it fun for kids to learn about life in South Florida.

title: Very educational
review: Kids will learn a lot from a single visit to this museum. The tour guides are very patient with kids.

title: Discount w/FL Id
review: Discount w/FL Id you must pay for parking a lot of fun 3 hours average time needed they keep the place very clean

title: Great for Kids
review: It was not cheap though, particularly what they charge for children but all in all, a good afternoon.

title: Fun, Fun, Fun for the Kids and adults
review: It's a great place to take children between the years of 4-9, lots to explore and experiment, including the Fireman's room, my grandson didn't want to leave!

title: Stimulating exhibitions of contemporary art
review: We really enjoyed our visit here with art to make you think!

title: Small But Mighty!
review: This is a small museum, easily visited in an hour or so.  But I'm always amazed by its quality!   I'm captivated by the exhibits year after year.  Especially the artists that combine incredible skill with humor and whimsy.  What a treat!

title: Being renovated what is left is not worth the half price
review: When we entered, the front desk told us that the upper floor was being renovated and only the bottom floor was available, so the admission would be just half price.  Don't waste you time.  The exhibits were a disappointment and took about 10 minutes to view appropriately/  The only art I could understand and agree with was a frame with the torn corner of a newspaper that said "I don't get it".  .

title: Wonderful shows this February
review: I expected a stodgy old collection so was quite pleased to find room after room of very contemporary art. We ended up spending several hours visiting all shows. Seems like this museum has some good curators so will come again.

title: Fascinating exhibitions
review: The staff here were the friendliest I have ever met in a museum. Really interesting exhibitions - we saw three - all included in ticket and a nice cafe . Interesting people watching as well

title: Relaxing!!!
review: Sitting in the shade in the park was one of the best parts of our day.  Very relaxing and fun to people watch.  The breeze was a welcome bonus!!!

title: So nice that they preserved this land in a public park!
review: Right in the middle of all these high rises - and it's a large, public park on the water!  Some great forward thinking and planning many years ago.  And if you get hungry there's plenty of restaurants in the open air mall adjacent!

title: Beautiful and relaxing
review: This park has some nice areas to relax and also has grassy areas for play.  It is nice to walk around next to the water.

title: If you are in the area but not worth the detour
review: Bayfront Park is not far from Bayside Marketplace.  A nice park you can come to on a sunny day.  It has large sidewalks to take a nice walk by the water.   There are a number of restaurants and shops with live music in the amphitheatre on some nights.   You may encounter some homeless people sleeping on the benches.

title: Great little park
review: Suitable for young kids, clean and simple to supervise. Recommended for up to ten years old we reckon.

title: Love the architecture
review: This is a beautifully landscaped park with  attractive flower sculptures. We were impressed with the scale and vision.

title: Pass by on Your Way to the Botanical Gardens
review: Catch some shade and enjoy the sculptures that also help guide the plant growth!  This park is also in between the Miami Beach Botanical Gardens and the South Beach/ Lincoln Road area so if you walk you can enjoy this park and the gardens...

title: Unexpected
review: We saw this on our first day - we had walked for miles and were glad of the shade. It has some great sculptures that they trained the climbing plants against. Worth stopping by.

title: A Soothing and Beautiful Oasis
review: Worth at least one visit.

title: sail away
review: This is an amazing landscaped area to enjoy and marvel at the lush growth of beautiful greenery and abundance of flowers. Great for pics.

title: Somewaht anticlimactic
review: We enjoyed our visit to the famed Calle Ocho in Little Havana, but it was nothing spectacular. Perhaps next time we'll do more research and pick out some specific places we want to eat.

title: Nice
review: You can learn salsa for free. very welcoming place in Miami

title: Fun little walk on a Sunday
review: We stopped by here on a Sunday after a morning at the beach. Grabbed some lunch and walked around taking in the atmosphere. Shops are quintessentially NOT MIAMI, in that the Havana influence is huge! A quaint domino park where older patrons would while away the hours (and probably the $$) playing dominoes and we ended up getting ice cream at the famous Azucar Ice cream place. Lots of street art to peruse and generally a fun place to just chill out. Don't forget to check out the 'World most famous Mojito' at La Esquina de la Fama, with the Dry ice trick to keep things fizzy!

title: Good
review: I went with my wife last Friday  for lunch at mojito restaurant calle sw 8 streets   and we order  the big parrillada bring pork chicken  well everything  but it were not happy hour so we order to large of cuban mojito drink with coban coffee  and catalana desert  then I ask the waitress about the show  they had mostly  on Wednesday nite she told its cost 50 dollars  per person just only to see a comedian  show  I told my wife it incredible not even including  a complimentary  a drink to see the show's  I will not even to spend one single cent to see four clown on a stage that made u laugh  at all  the show maybe  will last one hour maybe but really  piss  me up is the 50 dollars  per person  charge  its outrage they want to RIP off  ur money  I guest  i will not going back no more

title: Calle Ocho Day or Night!
review: Miami is Latin and could be nicknamed the "Capital of Latin America!" Calle Ocho and Little Havana are ground zero for la cultura, la comida and la musica! The culture food, music and dance are fantastic if you want to have a Latin experience while you're in Miami! It is similar day and night, but obviously more adult oriented in the evenings. Go and experience the different bars and food offerings, dance salsa, bachata, and meringue most all night! It's great fun and not to be missed.

title: Waste of time
review: Only about five shops and you have to go through a multi storey car par to access shops above street level.

title: Nice little mall
review: it's a nice little mall in the heart of south beach. The publix is big and inexpensive. the petco sells betta fishes and food for a lot of animals. Best buy is a little expensive and the ross which is in the top floor is amazing. Ross sells variety of clothes from different brand for a good price, the lines get way longer than the ross in downtown but you still find pretty much everything

title: Love the TJMAxx in this little mall
review: And this one doesn't disappoint! Found some great deals and the staff was super friendly....

title: Not so impressed
review: Ashame it never had the bourbon I wanted.

title: Beautiful Stadium
review: Bring a clear purse to get through security. Section 223 is at the club level, which is really nice but is in the sun for a 3:30 game and gets really hot, so wear your sunscreen!

title: Great Stadium
review: Saw the Hurricanes on 10/5/19.  Stadium was clean, new, safe, easy to get in and out of and we never stood in line more than 5 min for anything we needed.  West side tailgate scene was great.  It's just a really nice stadium.  Wish the score line was different, but had a great time.

title: Ride sharing difficulties = many drunk drivers
review: Although the stadium is quite modern and full of amenities, the management of Hard Rock Stadium did a huge disservice to it’s patrons by making ride-sharing services a pain in the neck (or rather feet) to partake in. To take an Uber or Lyft, one must walk blocks to a local elementary school. In the meantime, the taxis are located at the SE gate and attempt to cheat passengers with “flat fares”, cash only, and unwillingness to use their meters. Expect to encounter plenty of drunk drivers with the parameters put in place.

title: Best stadium in Collegiate and Professional Athletics
review: Ok, maybe I am a bit biased as I am a die hard Miami Hurricanes and Miami Dolphins fan but this stadium is incredible. From the beauty of it when you first see it appear in the distance to the amenities when you're cheering your team on it's hard to beat. Easily the best food and drink options out of any stadium (though very expensive) and the covered seating is clutch in the brutal South Florida heat. 4 giant big screens around the stadium make missing the action darn near impossible. With new walkways, bridges and tunnels for fans its safer than ever and plenty of merchandise and interactive zones make this the best game day experience.

title: Neighborhood bookstore with nice cafe
review: Whether you visit to purchase a book or have a snack while enjoying the garden seating, B&B will not disappoint.

title: Ritsy & Glitzy
review: No chain stores in site. 2-story, Outside mall with spacious terrace in Coral Gables. Parking is a nightmare! Plus, you pay for every 30mins and it’s not cheap. The stores are high luxuary and not family friendly. Associates in stores seem to have their nose stuck up in the air of your not walking in with a Gucci, Coach or Prada bag.

title: Very nice
review: It is a very nice place. I love it. This place is a beautiful place. You can visit the stores, eat and have a good time in this place.

title: So Nice
review: Second time here, it’s very nice, the whole place is organized, pretty and classy. You will fell tented to shop here, and if you have the bucks, you should as it’s definitely a great place to shop. You can also have a walk and enjoy the surrounding which is fantastic.

title: Nice open shopping mall
review: This mall is small by mega mall standards and has some high end shops. It has nice landscaping and several outdoor restaurants.

title: Marvellous !!!
review: Wonderfull and functional building.Perfect acustic, good theaters and very simpathetic way of showing outside what is going inside by projection

title: Worth a trip by all meansn
review: Frank Gehry designed this auditorium built in 2011 and it is an architectural masterpiece! If you have the time go to one of the many concerts and marvel at the auditorium's arena and its hydrolic wonders.

title: Tour this Gehry building.
review: And hear a concert--buy tickets in advance. The intimate hall only seats 750. Amazing musicianship in wonderful acoustics.

title: Go On The Free Days
review: Beautiful [just for the architecture] - have many freebees, i.e., youth concerts; pre-concert talks, etc.

title: Awesome!
review: Their outdoor space is just as incredible as indoors. Can’t wait to go back!

title: Architectural wonder
review: The pool was very clean, not too crowded despite the heatwave. It is a serious architectural  wonder how they built this pool. Highly recommend to visit, you will have a great time.

title: Truly unique
review: This is a truly unique natural pool located in a nice and quiet residential area. Parking is limited with a few places next to the entrance a several more in a separate parking in a diagonal from the entrance. No fee for parking. Arrive early to be sure to have parking. Admission is 20$ u.s. per person aged 13 and up which is really very pricey. To be sure that you will get your money’s worth, verify on line the water temperature on that day, not everyone is willing to swim in 72 degrees water, so before you pay this much money take the time to verify. While you are in the area, take the time to go for a little drive, Coral Gables is really very nice.

title: Great atmosphere in truly refreshing waters
review: You feel - well, rejuvenated after having taken some strokes in this pool’s pristine water. Let’s put it that way: If I could think of 5 pools worth the air travel I’d think of Blue Lagoon, Iceland; Bad Fischau, Austria; Tabacon, Costa Rica; this one; and: the fifth one I’ll still need to discover. There is a basic cafe, don’t expect anything even close to fancy, however they’ll fix a Hot Dog, burger, or curly fries. And maybe that’s all you need for a successful afternoon between limestone, corals, and palm trees. We truly enjoyed 3 hours at this marvel!

title: Worth at least one visit
review: I loved the history and the room that showed all the old photos.

title: Beautiful house and gardins
review: One of my favorite places and haunts for bike riders to meet on the weekend. Beautiful gardins to walk about. Well kept. Regular activities on the calendar

title: Great Pool Visit
review: I felt the entrance fee was quite expensive considering locker rental is also $5 per locker (which are not very spacious) but overall well worth a visit.

title: Miami History And Music Venue
review: Don't miss going through the house.

title: Great history!
review: Nice to go during the Christmas holiday season. They do a beautiful job of decorating the estate, play outdoor movies for the kids and have different food items available.

title: Beautiful way to spend an afternoon
review: NOTE, become a family member which comes with all kinds of free events; their members only cocktail party which is free is awesome,

title: Lousy experience no refund
review: Showed up 10 minutes prior to opening. Waited for 20 minutes and no employee. Meanwhile eaten up by mosquitos. No tour times posted. Returned half hour later with bug spray. Bought a ticket and attendant never told me tour had already left and next one wasn’t for two hours. It’s very hot and humid and I couldn’t wait in the heat so I requested a refund. Nothing so I left. Poor poor service.

title: Sculpture
review: We took a walk around the area and stopped here to look at some of the sculptures and art in the park.

title: Not worth the detour
review: Quite disappointed but what did I expect ? No charm what else : do not go there if you have nothing to do there!

title: Well hidden but beautiful park
review: A wonderful peaceful haven. Walk alongside the marina to the beach, watch out for dolphins.  Stop for a drink at Smith & Wollensky.  Not to be missed on a trip to South Beach, Miami.

title: Good park
review: Good park, great location, a lot of trees and shadow places . I would enjoy it if I had enough time. Not many opportunities for good  entertainment

title: Collins Park
review: Nice park. We spent a few hours walking here. Easy access to the ocean. This is also a good place for cyclists.

title: Relaxing
review: I really enjoyed my visit here with my family. Aside from the interaction with the monkeys and birds (which was great) I enjoyed the tranquility of walking the beautiful grounds. Even driving around in the rural farm area is a nice break from the hustle of Miami.

title: Private Tour
review: The staff at Monkey Jungle was courteous and honest with my wife and I the day we showed up. Storms were in the area and they offer a rain check for instances such as these. Luckily for us, everything worked out just fine! Bailey was our guide and she provided us (and the monkeys) with a positive experience! She was very knowledgeable about the monkeys and their behaviors/individuality. During the tour the monkeys surround you and you basically get lost in the experience. You also get the feel of being in an actual rain forest with the trees you're surrounded by. Bailey didn't spend time interfering with our interactions, but rather let us take it all in and enjoy it while answering any questions we had and enhancing the experience for us. The tour takes about 45 minutes and with a small group (ours was 4 people) the food lasted every minute of the experience so we were never short on interactions! 10/10 times I would spend the money on this tour. There's very few things I like to do again, but this is at the top of my list to do when we make it back to Florida.

title: Excellent!
review: We typically don't visit zoos but this place seems different.  They have huge areas for the monkeys and a lot of monkey. The Macaques area has 150 monkeys in 7 acres.  Because of the set up, monkeys are able to form social structures, hunt for food, and live very much like they would in the wild.  They have three main areas - the Macaques, the squirrel monkeys, and the gorilla.  There are also a few other animals in smaller cages.  There are three "shows" that allow you to see and learn about the animals and also you can walk around and feed the monkeys raisins.  There is a small snack bar that has very limited selections but there is pizza so if you are there at lunch time you don't have to worry about food.  I highly recommend this place especially with young kids.

title: Worth the drive
review: Although it’s about an hour from Miami, it’s worth the drive. The education about the animals in the park is great and it was fun to feed the monkeys. Our infant daughter loved it too!

title: Dream Come True for Monkey Lovers
review: So keep that in mind when going, but I’m telling you it is worth 100% every penny to do the jungle tour with the monkey encounters! Give these guys support for an awesome environment they are creating for these primates.

title: Still a construction site:(
review: Apparently it is going to be quite good after all of the construction work is done. Right now it is not a prime location to visit in SoBe. The hurricane did’t help at all. Don’t bother.

title: Great events
review: Always hosting great events they know how that is important to bring business to Miami Beach and to miami.

title: under Construction for a long time
review: unfortunately the convention Center is still not ready. They have a big delay and I think this does influence the Traffic in Miami Beach. Hoping it will be done soon and we can enjoy great things coming.

title: Don't bring your car!!!
review: Definitely the Convention Center has undergone a major improvement and it is 4 times bigger than before.  Truly it is very nice and attractive architecturally, even though the Convention Center Drive portion is still under construction.  The MAJOR CON is PARKING.  We went for the Home Show and if you are not somewhat familiar with Miami Beach then parking will cost you an arm and a leg.  The best place to park is in one of the parking garages and they fill quickly, but the one on 17th on Convention Center Drive is your cheapest bet. ($4 for a few hours)  Some parking places were charging $30 to park and finding street parking is like winning the lottery.  Hopefully under ALL THAT CONSTRUCTION they will unveil a parking garage.

title: NEW AND INCREDIBLE!!
review: The above photo doesn't exist any longer. See the WAVE!! Huge and great for conventions and shows. Near Lincoln Road and theatre of the performing arts

title: Wow.
review: Blown away by the artistic talent. The staff were clearly into their job, and loved the work. Wish I could afford to take one of the big ones home!!!

title: Art Studio
review: Lik Miami on Lincoln Road is an amazing Art gallery with very talented pieces. We enjoyed touring the studio.

title: Beautiful Photos in a Beautiful Gallery
review: My wife and I stopped in just to check out the artwork and we fell in love with so many of the images in this gallery. We ended up purchasing a piece and the design and styles offered are luxurious but reasonable (price range is around $4-$6K for newer pieces and $8-10K for the older pieces that have less available of that print). We can't wait for the piece to be delivered and we will definitely be back in the future.

title: great gallery
review: great staff, gallery, product. Perfect delivery for this type of facility and industry. great private rooms for full viewings before pulling the trigger.

title: Amazing photos
review: I love visiting when in Miami or Vegas. Absolutely love the photography. Some pictures really bring out emotions due to the way the light is captured.  The studio is a bit small but plenty of pictures to view. Definitely worth stopping in.

title: A beautiful area along Ocean Blvd directly accross from the water.
review: The old buildings consisting of art deco hotels and little restaurants/clubs is so cool to admire and visit any time but we especially like it in the evening after 8:00 when things start to get a little more lively.  Grab a seat at one of the restaurants and have a drink, listen to music and people watch.

title: A lively area to walk and enjoy
review: This area is very new but has turned into a very nice gathering place. Not many restaurants are active yet.

title: Not yet distinctive.
review: It is possible that the "8th Street Designer District" is too new a designation for a distinctive enclave to have emerged yet.

title: Nice walk
review: This area is a pretty walk with Art Deco buildings and shopping. We would walk the strip along the waterfront before sunset and admire the buildings.

title: Retreat
review: OMG I thought I had died and went to heaven with all of my favorite designers: Louis Vuitton, Tom Ford, Giuseppe, Givenchy, Versace, Chloe, etc. if you don’t have any self control, don’t go

title: A lot of fun
review: The kids had a lot of fun! There is so much to do and the kids can be very creative. We went on a Sunday, right when they opened and it was not busy until a few hours later. Kids were able to try out everything without having to wait. Great place.

title: Fun time for children
review: This is a great museum for young children and families.  There are regular exibits that the whole family can enjoy and changing exhibits that add to the surprise.  Lots of fun things to do in the area for the whole family

title: Overpriced, poorly maintained facility
review: Decided to spend a rainy day at the children’s museum. A lot of the exhibits were broken or not accessible to children. Seemed quite run down and dirty. The only place for food was Subway and the staff there were incredibly rude to us and other customers. We left with the thought we would never be returning to this museum.

title: Fantastic
review: Went with my 3 year old granddaughter.  It was completely interactive!  We stayed 4 hours and probably could have stayed longer.  Be sure to get an activity schedule when you come in.  Military discount is half price!  There is a Subway on site.  The only drawback was parking for which you must pay although it is not expensive.

title: Great time with a toddler
review: On a day too cool for the beach, during a 4-day visit to see my 2 1/2 year old granddaughter in Miami, my daughter and I took advantage of “mini Monday” at the children’s museum. It was our first visit and we were thrilled with the exhibits. There was so much for a very busy toddler to do! From the fishing boat to the art and music games to the model supermarket to the building and construction unit, we were all kept engaged for hours. There is a Subway restaurant for lunch. The souvenir shop was also a big hit with the baby who loves poring over books as my daughter read to her. The next day the baby asked to return to the museum.

title: Limited galleries open when i visited
review: great staff and what I did see was enjoyable. Free admission since not fully open/.Easy to get to on free trolley. Nice grassy area  with benches surrounding the museum.

title: It isn't bad, but if you don't visit it you aren't missing anything.
review: Duration: 30 minutes.

title: It was a free Bank of America weekend
review: The Bass is a smaller modern art museum at the end of Collins Park. Having a BOA credit card enabled me to get in for free. You really have to like very modern, abstract art to fully appreciate this museum.

title: In the Cone of Uncertainty
review: Very stimulating display of contemporary art from Haegue Yang in the wonderful setting of the Bass Art Museum.  It's only on until 5 April 2020 so go while you can.

title: Skip it
review: This is the type of museum you get when rich people don’t know what to do with their money.  Be sure not to miss the toilet paper holders and the group of construction poles.

title: Multi-activity park.
review: A park with lots of activities and people milling around doing their stuff. There is an amphitheater, Tina Hills auditorium, where a yoga practice was going on. Understand a big bash is held on the 4th of July and the New Year's eve. There is also a figure of the Mother of Miami's in one corner. It's also close to the Marketplace where shops & restaurants are aplenty. Hotel Intercontinental is nearby. Lots of benches where one can sit and see ecarts being driven around. All in all, a relaxing, enjoyable place to spend some time.

title: Nice place to have a walk.
review: Between Bayfront Market and the Intercontinental Hotel. Ver well kept gardens. A lot of palm trees. Great for children.

title: Love this venue
review: Small and friendly and so scenic with the skyline.  We always enjoy events here and feel it's safe and well run.

title: Bay front
review: The Bayfront Park in Miami is a pretty patk on the water. It’s currently being decorated for the holiday season. The Christmas tree lighting is this weekend with a Christmas village.

title: Nice park
review: This is a nice park to walk through en route to the bayside area. It’s at the front is you can also look at the nice yachts!

title: Meticulously landscaped
review: We were lucky to visit this park during the blooming seasons, beautiful and tall flowers everywhere you look. It's fascinating!

title: Soundscape Park-Bougainvilleas & morning shade
review: A short walk from Lincoln Rd, we found Soundscape Park on our way back from the Sunday morning farmer’s market.  The sun was already hot, but we found some shade strolling under the bougainvilleas,  and we took a video of a flock of exotic birds preening on the grass nearby.  It was a nice experience on our walk back to our hotel.  Great quiet spot in the middle of busy South Beach!

title: Pretty little nook
review: A nice cool down spot if you need it!

title: Soundscape Park
review: Soundscape Park downtown, street parking, facilities, some bench seating. Some pigeons and birds in park. Restaurants and things to do in area.

title: Beautiful Open Air Musical Venue
review: Soundscape is a lovely park area to walk, sit and enjoy. Lot's of people walking through and just relaxing. We were there on a Saturdau morning when they were trialling the sound system for the evenings classical concert. The speakers are situated in a series of grey pipework around the park. It was a lovely experience to be in the park with this classical music playing (fairly loud!). A great experience. Even without he music the park is well kept and nice to be in.

title: Good for a relaxed afternoon
review: We enjoy browsing in the shops, dining on traditional Cuban food, and drinking Mojitos and Cuban coffee.  Calle Ocho is super casual, but remains one of our favorite ways to spend an afternoon while in Miami.

title: 8th street
review: It's just the name of the street where Little Havana is located. To us it was mostly a place for tourists to spend time and money.

title: Little Havana
review: Calle Ocho is street in little Havana.  It’s the the hub of the area with Shops, restaurants  and the star walk with legendary Cubans having a star on the sidewalk

title: Cute place!
review: Calle Ocho is definitely worth a visit! Lots of bars and restaurants playing Cuban music, men playing dominoes, it’s very Cuba and lots of fun!

title: lively, fun, people watching
review: We came to Little Havana after a day of sightseeing.  We parked, got out and walked up and down the avenue taking it all in, going from store to store, reading menus deciding where to dine.  Great energy and people watching, love the whole scene.

title: Ez-Breezy
review: Finding our ride was easy outside as many hold up signs and once spotted they can come pick you up from the Loading area.

title: Worst experience for debarkation ever.
review: Getting off the Royal Caribbean's Oasis was a complete nightmare. No signs. Employees telling us to go to opposite sides for buses. Took away the relaxation from the cruise. I'm writing this while waiting 2 hours for the bus.

title: Busy
review: All the cruise lines have built their own terminals.

title: Good experience turned bad
review: The facility is absolutely beautiful and the staff were very professional and kept everyone in order. It was a very fast and professional experience. Unfortunately, during our return...my fiance and I were separated because I had a passport and he had a birth certificate. Once he got in the line, which consisted of 20 people...the employee stopped the line and when the people asked why she said because the people who had passports were more important/priority than the people standing in line to verify their birth certificates. Mind you her job was to handle just the people who had birth certificates. I wish I would have witnessed this because I would have got her name off her badge. My fiance said a lot of the people in line were very angry and couldn't believe an unprofessional comment came out of her mouth. We only had that one issue on our disembarkment.

title: Best port experience I have had in 20 years of cruising!
review: We had the opportunity to board a Royal Caribbean ship, the oasis of the seas through Dock A at the Miami port.The new docking area is beautiful, they airlines could learn a lesson from the efficiency done through the security check. We pretty much just walked right on the ship there was no waiting and hordes of people in line which is typical of boarding a large crew ship.

title: Publix 5th & Alton
review: Overall great experience. Usually find everything I need, but based on South Beach location, prices are a bit higher. Staff is super friendly.

title: Not really worth the walk but some good shops here
review: Conclusion: even if you like walking a lot, in summer time only travel via your car

title: Publix, TJ Maxx, Ross, Best Buy
review: We were looking for Best Buy and TJ Maxx and this small building encompassing Publix on top was perfect. Good bargains. 2-hour parking for free. What else ?

title: Cheap Shopping
review: A large TJ Maxx, Ross and a big pet store. Lot's of cheap shopping if you like a 'Rummage Around'. I wouldn't drive here specially, but we were passing while walking around the area so we dropped in.There is a large multi-storey cark park loated within the building.

title: The Good and The Bad
review: Overall it was a decent experience but they could make some improvements.

title: Dolphins v Jets football game
review: So,warning to future attendees, keep your necessary item either in your pockets or in a tiny pouch or else it will be taken from you.

title: Impressive
review: Having never been to a major football stadium, we wanted to have a look at this one.  It was impressive from the outside, but otherwise they don't let you see much.  We did find a place we could drive in, but were given strict instructions that we could only go to the team store.  It would be nice if they had a place you could see more without having to buy something.

title: Dolphins need to control fans
review: I went to the Miami Dolphins Game vs. Philadelphia Eagles game at the Hard Rock Stadium in Miami. We had 10 seats in section 129. Paid about $200.00 per seat. The family came in from Philadelphia for the game so we decided to get good seats. Fans in front of us standing up and holding signs the entire game. Ended up watching the game on the jumbo screens vs the players on the screen......next time will stay home!

title: Great day out
review: Visited on day the Eagles were in town. Great atmosphere in the stadium and a fantastic game. The whole place is geared to giving you a fantastic day out and plenty to eat and drink. Had a fantastic day.

title: Parking Garage Debacle
review: As a frequent visitor of Merrick Mall and Landmark Theatre, I was completely uphauled at the behavior of parking attendants and staff. We had finished watching a movie at the theatre and had payed for the parking and went to our car. We stayed in the car for 12 mins. As we headed out, at the Le Jeune #201 exit, the parking structure would not let us out and told us to pay an additional 3 dollars. We called the parking attendant who repeated to tell us that we had overstayed after paying and that once paying you must leave. We asked to have an attendant sent down, which did not happen. After calling once again, the attendant would not answer my question as to how much time we had to leave. She said between 10-15, I then proceeded to ask whether 13 mins was not in fact in between 10 and 15. She then changed her tune to tell us that we had 10 mins to leave and must pay for the additional 2 hours if we intended to leave. This is incompetence should not be tolerated and tourists and residents be aware that they are trying to take your money. So if you watch a movie at Merrick make sure to book it out of there before you end up spending your entire college tuition on a parking ticket. ;)))

title: High End Retail
review: A good selection of high end retail shops anchored by Nordstrom and Neiman Marcus. Shady three story mall is not air conditioned and is exposed to the outside. Shops are comfortably air conditioned. Good selection of restaurants as well.

title: Carnival Victory Cruise
review: 19 of us was in the group and no one had any complaints.

title: Large cruise port with easy access but congestions
review: This also avoid metered taxi charge until you have a prenegociated price.

title: Futuristic Terminals Make Boarding a Breeze
review: The new Royal Caribbean terminal is beautiful and very futuristic.  The new system of making appointments for checking in made the boarding process a breeze.  We basically went from being dropped off to on the ship in less than half an hour.  Great job!

title: Cruise
review: Easy to get in the roads and signs are awesome. Easy parking. The port has Comfortable seating and rest rooms , has Handicapped access all over with elevators and escalators to access ships in every Building. The Ships are clearly marked and easily seen. Nice and clean and safe with allot of officers around.

title: Confusing parking
review: The signage is not great. Get there early to find where your ship is departing from. Keep in mind that you won’t necessarily be coming back to the same spot, we had to walk a significant distance. I would probably just take a taxi/Uber  next time

title: Not your typical "mall" experience..and not for the better either
review: Super high end shops that if you don't have the money is really not worth the stroll around the mall.  Street parking is hard to find or non existent, and if you do luck out the hourly rates are outrageous.  Most (not all) visitors and even the people that work in the shops are a bit pretentious and outright snooty (tried using a more common folk word instead of arrogant, conceited or haughty).  Restaurants are also extremely expensive and the amount of food you get isn't worth the price.  The mall is outdoors (except the actual stores of course) so if you are there for the summer it'll be an real scorcher, which of course you'll be looked down on if you try to go into a store to cool off without buying anything.  Try the dolphin mall or even dadeland if you are looking for a better experience, indoor mall with reasonably priced stores and plenty of affordable food options.

title: Another open mall
review: I don’t need to come back but the free shuttle is very convenient!

title: Merrick Park Shopping experience
review: Try  the Nordstrom Café, nice place to enjoy a great food while shopping.

title: Fantastic musical experience
review: A night to remember!!!

title: A temple of sound
review: We went to see the St. Olaf choir (don't ask, my partner is Norwegian) and the music was fine, but the venue is impressive. Very beautiful, not too big, and the sound is first-class. I haven't been down to see one of the Wallcasts, but that is next on my list (listen to music for free outside the auditorium, and watch a screencast on the wall.) We drove back on Collins and A1A because it was night and that was lovely. No white knuckles like 95 can be as you approach Miami.

title: Chance passing
review: We dropped in here as we happened to be in the amazing park in front. It’s a world class Symphony hall and ultra modern. Believe some concerts are free.

title: Excellent
review: This Miami Beach venue is a must see. Michael Tilson Thomas has created a destination for lovers of classical music.

title: A night out at the symphony Wallcast is a Beach bargain!
review: On a regular basis, the New World Symphony broadcasts its concerts on the big blank wall of its Frank Gehry-designed performance hall. That means that you can gather up your lawn chairs, your blanket, your picnic and your wine and settle down in the park in front of the concert hall for a free night out at the symphony. We were there with friends last night. We pulled into the parking garage behind the building ($15) about 6:45 and were spreading out our blanket by 7 pm. for the 7:30 concert. Several hundred people were already there, so I'd suggest coming a bit earlier, especially in season. I feel like we grabbed one of the last closer spaces on the right side of the screen area. The view is great; it's really entertaining to see a symphony broadcast with closeups etc rather than just watching from a seat in a hall. And the sound system outside is truly outstanding. Can't say enough about that. Although the audience is right on one of the city's busiest streets, the street noise doesn't interfere with your enjoyment, even when a Ferrari runs through its gears. Most people were sitting in normal-size lawn chairs (as opposed to shorter sand chairs). It was a congenial crowd, bigger than I expected in drowsy November.

title: Nice place!
review: We enjoyed going to this historical pool with the family but the water is just too cold for my taste. I would still recommend for it’s uniqueness and history. I love Coral Gables️

title: Venetial Magic pool
review: It worth it...I liked it a lot...that place, the views are awsome......do not rent a chair, there is a lot of places to sit around magical spots.

title: Vintage Swimming experience
review: Practical details - $15 dollars admission, $5 dollars for locker plus $5 dollars deposit, $10 dollars to rent lounger, and towels can be bought for $8. Posting thus because it was quite difficult to find the info. Great way to spend a morning - you need to be able to swim, not really for lounging as such, no infants . But wonderful old pool

title: Relaxing Pool Day
review: My friends and I went to the Venetian Pool for the afternoon in early November. The pool was beautiful! There is a small waterfall, and the architecture of the area is really pretty. When we were there, it wasn't busy at all, and it was peaceful. We were worried about loud children running around, but it was calm, and there were very few families there. I'd go back again!

title: In & Out
review: Have Used Several Times. Organized- Easy To Catch Uber or Taxi Drop Off Right In Front Of Terminals.

title: Amazing Skyline
review: I had to go to the Port of Miami to take a day trip from the city to Bimini Bay (Bahamas). The area was easy to navigate and once you're on the boat, you have a great skyline view of the city!

title: Dishonest Shuttle Service
review: Beware of the Shuttle that takes you from the Cruise Terminals to Fort Lauderdale.  The one company called Metro Shuttle Service with phone number (954) 600-1562 attached to the side doors. If you ask of they take Credit Cards, they will say yes but the driver will say no. Then he holds your baggage hostage. We had to call the number an give our info over the phone. And he overcharged me. Charged everyone else $30 for two people, but charged us $40 after he agreed to charge only $30. I called him an he said he will take care of, just send him the info on a text. I did what he asked but he still let the transaction go through. So now I really can't trust them. Oh and the driver started assaulting people that were trying to get their bags. This is a shady company. They will rip you off.

title: Great Cruise Port
review: I've grown to like cruising out of Miami.  Beautiful new terminals being completed.  RCI is done and great. Norwegian is under construction.  Two ways to get there, the tunnel or the bridge.  Once all of the construction is done it will be even better.  No entry security check like you have to endure in Fort Lauderdale.  Cabs are plentiful and well organized by the staff.

title: Fast Embartment
review: This was one of the smoother trips to Port of Miami - Shuttle service got us to the port quickly dropping us off at our ship and the Carnival line wait time to get on the ship was less than 40 minutes so no complaints there.   The port in general was not very crowded when we arrived but shortly after we got inside the terminal there was a much  longer line so glad we left when we did

title: Bring your own supplies...
review: A bit of a mixed experience here. This is a truly unique place and you should definitely check it out. I can't believe they allow you to go in the caves and bask on the rock formations - it's so cool. It's fresh water and is cool, clean, and refreshing. On the other hand, they have a nickle-and-dime kind of business model, which I'm not crazy about. Definitely bring your own towel - they will not have towels available unless you choose to purchase one for $8. They also make you pay to rent lounge chairs, which just feels a step too far. You certainly can get by without doing so, but it's not the comfy poolside experience that would be common at a hotel, for example. There is a cafe on site, that we did not try. I also think we had a nice time in part because we came on an off day when it was a little cooler, so it wasn't crowded.

title: Deering Estate
review: The grounds are 420 acres of beautiful park in southwestern Miami. Charles Deering was from Chicago. The land was once were ancient Tequesta Indians buried their dead. In 1920, Deering had a three story Mediterranean House built, he died there in 1927. The land includes the older two story Richmond Cottage built in 1896 ( one of Miami's oldest structures, once an Inn). I went on Sept. 28, for a Ghost Tour, they have tours in Oct. & Nov..

title: Nice 1/2 Day Trip
review: Friends came for visit and decided to go to Deering Estate. Was let down as I wanted to impress my friends. It is historical and needs preserving but is over rated. Wished there was more historical info in guide pamphlet. It is a nice diversion from other sites but will avoid going back.

title: Had a wonderful event here.  It is a must see while in Miami
review: This is a really nice attraction and give you great insite into early Miami days.  It is must see place and worth the time.

title: glorious setting for stylish events
review: Go when a concert is playing there. Nice acoustics ,"gemeutlich' atmosphere , meet other people you would like to know

title: Gates closed
review: I’m sure it is a fascinating place, but we arrived at 4:05 and the gates closed at 4pm an hour before the museum closes, leaving us out of luck! And when we tried to walk to the pier a belligerent guard was blocking the way!!! Foul mouthed and rude!!!

title: Beautiful view
review: Wonderful spot to stop and relax. Greenery right by the water. Great spot to people watch! Beautiful spot

title: Little well developed park
review: Very nice little park that is calm. Trees nicely spaced out and it’s a quite place. Well worth a visit and a few interesting items to see (photos attached).

title: Still a nice place
review: An oasis in the busy city, palm trees within green lawn places.Quiet and cool, less people than at the beach and there is shadow if you need some.

title: PERFECT SPOT IN SoBe
review: This is the best place in Sobe to enjoy a quiet walk with headphones ,people watch and trust me you wont know where to look on weekends or enjoy a pleasant walk during the morning.

title: Great for a Stroll
review: At the top end of Collins Avenue this is a lovely place to stroll or sit and watch the world go by. Beautiful setting with trees and a few sculptures, sit down, relax and chill out. Just what you need.

title: Barrel of fun
review: What a neat place. Anyone that likes wildlife will love this place. Jasmine did a wonderful job w the gorilla exhibit. King is his nameand he's 50 yrs old. Lots of baby monkeys

title: Under construction
review: We did back to back cruises.  Had hoped to be able to walk from RCL to Norwegian - a distance of about 1000 yards.  Nup.  During construction work there are no paths!  'Tram' stops well short of RCL and no way to get through other than by taxi.  So $USD20 for the miles to get from Eurostars Langford to RCL terminal and $USD15 to get the 1000 yards from RCL to Norwegian!  Might be nice when it is all finished.  Hopefully they provide paths!

title: They have made improvements on service
review: Good job.

title: Very easy
review: I have taken 3 cruises out of here in a year and the experience has been great.  Very easy to park and staff has been very friendly.

title: Cruise Boarding Carnival
review: This place is a happening and a busy place! While preparing and boarding for our cruise and so forth this place was like a machine one step to another! The porters were constantly going above and beyond The call of duty, to make every step fun, easy and smooth! Miami Port! Kudos....

title: Cruise
review: Our family of 8 sailed to the Bahamas on Royal Caribbean international on August 4 that sailed from the port of Miami.  The process went smoothly and the signs were well marked.

title: Great family trip
review: What a great experience. It is nice to walk around to feed the monkeys in their little pails, but where the real fun is, is the rain forest adventure. Yes it is pricey, but so worth it. The look on the kid's faces when the monkeys were on their heads was priceless. As soon as you walk in the monkeys are all over you. All of us enjoyed it. Seeing the gorilla was fun too. He seems happy and well taken care of. The trainers are extremely knowledgeable and answered all the questions asked. I would highly recommend a visit to Monkey Jungle!!!

title: Great Time; Rainforest Adventure Tour Totally Worth It
review: All in all, a great visit!

title: So much fun!
review: My wife and I enjoyed everything about the preservation, especially the feeding experience in the forest. Highly recommended!!

title: Awful
review: The park is really small there is nothing intrested in it just couple of monkeys in the cages. We payed a lot for nothing. You cannot feed the monkeys just if you pay extras. I feel myself very miserable because i travelled a lot for nothing. It take 10minutes to walk around. If you read this here is my advice: dont go there!!!

title: Impressive Renovations
review: I came here after the renovations have been completed to see the Miami Int. Auto Show of 2018 after being cancelled in 2017 after Hurricane Irma and the renovations. I am very impressed with the renovations at the convention center. The entrance is a two-story glass lobby that is more than four times the size as the old one. It’s now a great place to go if you want to see the Miami Home Shows, a boat show or most of all, the Miami International Auto Show.

title: Recently renovated center
review: Have been visiting this Miami Beach Convention Center for decades, from many Auto Shows, Home Shows to Art Basel and Graduations. Although they always have food and drinks, it's not what you go to the center for, its for the Event. Happily the new renovations finally have happened and the exterior alone makes quite a statement that this is not the same 1960s Convention Center. From the exterior to the new lobby, very modern clean and sleek looking. Now let's see how the parking area out front ends up looking. Glad to see it all finally happen.

title: Miami Beach Convention Center
review: Renovated since hurricane, looks great, new facilities, great staff, lots of parking. They do lots of shows, July 4-7: Florida Supercon ( a comic book, video game show ), they have celebrities that do Q&A sessions some with films.

title: decent hall
review: we went here for a BIG SHOW convention and the place was really huge and well laid out, perfect place for a convention.

title: VG
review: The rehabilitation to this structure improved the look of the nondescript building that had been there for many years.

title: Beautiful Photo Art
review: This is a free museum, and you might just buy an artwork to take home. Much better than the politically correct-infused National Geographic store nearby.

title: Worth a stroll but do not buy!
review: Stunning photography but prices are way too high. This is not a good investment. Read the reviews on the internet before making a purchasing decision.

title: Worst experience ever
review: Dont waste your vacation and money with them

title: Well organised
review: The port is well set up and seemed easy enough to get around.  Just be cautious of the arrival of ships as there are taxi's, ubers and shuttles everywhere and they just stop with no regard for anyone.  The carparks are easy to access once you know which one is best for you.  Best place to park for a cruise as it's very convenient which you do pay for but worth every cent to me.  It's important to remember that there can be over 5,000 people on one ship so that's a lot of people looking for taxis and shuttles.  The other carparks can't handle the volumes regardless of what they say.  Port is very clean, well kept and very secure.

title: Best experience ever at a cruise port.
review: We started our cruise with Royal Caribbean here and it was a very efficient boarding process.  We checked in on line, dropped our suitcases outside (later delivered to our stateroom door), were directed to an esculator, showed some id's, directed to a large waiting area with chairs, waited just a few minutes, directed to the ship (by group designation), showed our id's and welcomed aboard.  Wow!  The building is stunning, with lots of glass and art!

title: Good cruise port
review: We have used terminal A twice in the past four months. I thought this cruise port was well organized and efficient. We didn’t have any problems checking in for our cruise. It was quick to get on Royal Caribbean’s ships. Getting an Uber at the end of the cruise was a little tedious but what do you expect with so many people exiting the terminal?

title: Great port, easy to board your ship
review: Port of Miami has it down to a science when knowing exactly what to do with its passengers and how to get them on the ship quickly and without any problems.  I'm so impressed by this port that I will be sailing out again in a few months.  Granted the cruise line I was on, the ship was very small so it had a limited number of passengers which made things much easier.  Lines that have ships with 4,000 or more passengers, I can imagine it is longer to get onto the ship and through the various processes to get onboard, but from everything that I saw they know exactly how to keep things moving and regularly do this so its no big deal for them.

title: Beautiful
review: Such a wonderful gallery and the curator was amazing! Ask her to show you what happens to these incredible photographs in different lighting.

title: Beautiful Art - Very Unique
review: This is one of the coolest spots on Lincoln Road to see after dinner. You'll be amazed at some of the pieces. It's just very expensive.

title: Wish I was Rich
review: Gorgeous photos. I want them all. Worth seeing even if you can't afford them. What a special collection! I live down the street and frequently go in to put me in a great mental space.

title: Place must have seen
review: Comparing this side to the one 8 years ago ist unbelievable what has been created since then.designer shops as well as galeries has been set up definitely a place which should be visited when in Miami

title: A place to be and a place to be seen
review: We walked around this place for hours. Lots of very expensive stores. But window shopping is great! You see thinks you enjoy them and your wallet does not suffer. This place is very interesting. Do visit!

title: Magic in the middle of nowhere
review: You will not believe what you will see

title: Conspicuous consumption
review: A nice place to walk, and handy for shopping if you're in to bling. I wouldn't make a special trip just to see it.

title: Nice Area for Window Shopping
review: This is a nice area to walk around an window shop. Plenty of interesting 'Arty' type shops to look in. Nice if you are in the area, but wouldn't go out of my way to get here.

title: Royal Caribbean Terminal A
review: I noticed that the Lyft driver got about half way in the terminal then just disappeared.  Another Lyft driver was automatically requested.  This happened several times.  Then, I got a driver who showed up.  As we walked over the driver cancelled.  Then he picked up the man standing next to me.  I told him he was my driver and he said he was not.  I had his picture, vehicle and license plate on the app.  He refused me, so I had to request another driver.  The same thing happened.  Halfway in the port they disappeared and another driver was requested automatically.  I spoke to this driver and he said he had never heard of Zone 8 and was being sent out of the port.  He finally found me and got me picked up and to the airport after waiting 45 minutes.  Other people were getting Lyft drivers so I don’t know what I did wrong.  I contacted Lyft and they did know either.  They said they were disciplining the driver that cancelled me.  I was told by our driver that where I was standing was brand new.  I really don’t know.

title: Easy process to get through Security and Employees Wonderful!
review: Very easy process, all very organized. I would say leaving a car that you drove to port in one of the parking lots on or off site was the biggest issue. Allow plenty of time to park and wait for a shuttle. Ours had a very long line of people waiting. It took the shuttle bus several trips before it was our turn. This part was a bit stressful with your family waiting at the port. If everyone dropped off the traveling partners at the port. Then parked it would move faster. As many of the delays in getting the shuttle was 6, 8 10 persons traveling together all trying to board the shuttle. If it was one or two persons per family it would be better. Also, upon return there again was a delay that can not be avoided as they need to have more shuttles since whole families ride together to get the car.

title: Easy Port
review: This is simply a port to get on your cruise ship. Not a tourist site to see.  However this port entry is easy to get into and out of.

title: Quick, efficient staff
review: If you're not used to visiting a cruise port, they're huge and have tons of people.  But the staff here was well versed at quickly and efficiently moving everyone along to their destination.

title: Reggae Rhythm & Blues Cruise 2019
review: If you cannot find a sitter

title: Nice facility but embarkation was chaos
review: Our RCCL departure was a mess.  The facility was pleasant enough, but the port staff members, while friendly, were disorganized.  One person would tell us to do one thing and another staff member would come along and tell us to do the opposite.  Perhaps their issues stemmed from our ship arriving late, thus complicating the embarkation process, but things could not have become more chaotic.  The view from the port is certainly great being located so close to the city, but the traffic was challenging as well.  We parked our car with Safe Cruise Parking and found it to be just as advertised.  We'd use them again to save lots of money over the Port of Miami parking garage.  I hope our particular departure from the Port of Miami was unusual.  While I would not avoid a cruise that departed Miami, I won't be in a rush to use this port in the future.

title: One of the better ports
review: This is one of the better embarkation Cruise ports we've been to. The worst part is the traffic getting to the port. Hopefully next year the new building at terminal Be done and help with some of the congestion getting in the building. This is much better experience than the NYC Manhattan Cruise terminal.

title: Love it!
review: The Port of Miami is a few steps away from Bay Side shopping and wonderful restaurants. If you plan on going to Miami this place is a must. The Port itself is very busy. It is where many cruise ships set sail from.

title: A bit choatic yet very efficient
review: You're getting on a cruise ? You will notice the impatience of taxi drivers in line for a drop or pick up... Impatient and pushy with all the other cars... Yet, everything works pretty good with the help of officers directing traffic.

title: Nice building but terrible design and staff
review: I said the hell with this and went over to the Uber area for more gridlock and it took an hour for my driver to get to us due to the gridlock! I’m an experienced cruiser and this was the first and last time using port Miami! I’ll be taking myself back to Everglades or Canaveral!

title: Miami Heat
review: The atmosphere is incredible and I had such a great time.  Even better the Heat won!!

title: Marlins Park
review: The baseball team has Marlins Park, a state of the art ball field. It has great concession stands, facilities, parking, and well maintained.

title: Cruise port parking
review: Good place to leave car. Huge port. Ship docked at different location at cruise return. Had a shuttle bus to go where car was parked. Only problem is that parking employee told me that the credit car did not work so I paid cash to find out that the amount was approved by the credit card company but to the best of my knowledge was never charged to my account. Strongly suggest that if you park there, keep the receipt.

title: Cruise to St Marten, Puerto Rico, Haiti
review: Port of Miami was the Departure and return for our family cruise. Very well organized with a swift process.

title: Can walk to Port from Bayside Marketplace
review: Arrived early for a cruise so went to Bayside Marketplace after dropping off our luggage at port. There is a bridge near the port you can walk across to downtown Miami. Beautiful views from bridge!

title: Great Trip
review: We took shuttle to P.O.M. from FLL airport. Curb service was great! They took our luggage as soon as we pulled in the Port....which was very early.

title: Social hour
review: It was very good, it’s all your personal view, you will be able to visit and see how you like it for yourself

title: Please “Don’t”
review: The tour guide was great and able to place the modern art in historic context, hence 3 stars. The cafe is $$ and space in bad weather is lacking to enjoy some downtime comfortably. The collection I think is limited. If with kids I think the Frost Museum of Science (with whom PAMM shares the paved parking garage at their end), is a way better choice (not personal experience, but hearsay).

title: Very big port
review: Most hotels have free transportation here, if not you can always get a taxi or Uber.

title: Terminal A - Royal Caribbean
review: Have to admit we really did not want to pay the price but our travel agent said it would be worth it and he was right!  After the grueling traffic to get there we had smooth sailing from the moment we pulled in to the port.  Terminal A is amazing!  We pulled up and the porters took our checked bags - found a parking spot - took elevator and walked into the terminal.  Within 15 minutes we were ON THE SHIP!!!  When we came back into port a week later we were off the Symphony of the Seas within 20 minutes - and in our car and heading to our next destination in minutes.  It was so easy!  No waiting for shuttles - nothing.  We had avoided Miami port as much as possible in the past as difficult to find safe parking and hotels are very pricey.  We had stayed night in Dania Beach/Ft Lauderdale and drove in the morning.  It was definitely very easy and made the transition from a trip to a VACATION happen in minutes!  You get what you pay for!

title: Best Parking is the Pits.
review: This is for Best Parking at the Port of Miami.  The check in process was way too slow.  Need at least two people on the 7th floor checking people in.  Waiting on the Can was the worst experience I’ve had.  It took over twenty minutes for the first van to show up then there wasn’t enough room so we had to wait another 20-30 minutes Firth’s next one.  Very poor system with the multiple terminals at the port of Miami.  The pick-up was just as bad.  We were off the ship by 7:30 and didn’t get picked up until 8:20.  Terrible Terr terrible.  The van we rode in had a check engine light on as well as a low tire light.  The van was in terrible condition.  I for one will not be using best parking again.

title: If you park your car
review: Don't use BEST CRUISE PARKING, also known as PARKWAY PARKING.  We recently waited for one hour and 15 minutes for a van to pick us up to return to the parking garage.  After waiting for 45 minutes, I started making a list of the vans who came at least once,  to pick up their customers.  You'll be better off parking with: Miami Prime, EG, Premier (they came by 6 times while we were waiting), Hyatt Place, KSA Tours, Thrifty, Cross Culture Tours, Doral, Rental Car Shuttle, Angel Wings.  Best Cruise Parking.com seems to have only one little bus.  They actually came after 30 minutes, but were full and said they would come right back to get us.  The round trip to the garage must have taken 45 minutes.  We were waiting while it was raining in sheets.

title: Top Drawer Arena for Sports and Music
review: The Heat are making one last run for greatness under Pat Riley. Does he still have it? We'll soon find out. But the AAA is the state's most plush arena -- BB and T in Broward is the poorer cousin. Seen many greats there -- like Springsteen, McCartney, Hall and Oats, and the Who. Great amenities, and you can park far away and get there easily on the People Mover -- which is free, and the best deal in Miami.

title: Best experience in Miami! Many thanks to Fabian and the welcoming staff!
review: Thank you very much, Fabian and Lock & Load Miami!

title: Great service in the rain!
review: Thank you!

title: Quick and organized
review: The terminal check in was very smooth.  We were dropped off in the parking lot and there was someone there to gather our luggage then we were directed to the enterance of the terminal.  From the time of drop off until we stepped on the ship it was approximately 40 minutes which I thought was really great

title: Terminal A - great experience
review: We left on Allure of the Seas and it was a quick, smooth check in.  When we returned, it was very easy off.  The only snag was the pick up by shuttle to pick up our car due to all of the cars and buses coming in.

title: So Much Better
review: We easily got on the ship and upon our return, our daughter met us where she had dropped us off. We got into the port and out of the port in less than 5 minutes. So smooth and much, much less chaotic!! Great job, Port of Miami. Instead of screwing thongs up, as other ports are doing as cruise traffic increases around the nation, you all have figured a way to smooth out the process and make it so much more enjoyable coming and going from your port!! Thanks and keep up the good work!!

title: love pulling up
review: The port is so well organized and orderly for all the ship to embark and disembark. Getting through customs is getting shorter with more efficient employees.

title: Pleasantly surprised
review: Good job!

title: Do it NOW!
