review: EXCELLENT experience ! very easy process to start didn’t even take 15 mins before we were ready to get some target practice. Our instructor “Max” was very patient and great teacher. Overall experience was flawless deff recommend it and try out the “Desert Eagle” you will not regret it

title: Fabulous stadium
review: Brilliant facilities but very expensive food and drinks, compared to the $10 entrance fee. Really impressive stadium.

title: Beautiful Ball Park - Friendly Staff
review: What a beautiful ball park.   Drove over from Tampa and stayed at hotel near the hospital - walking distance.  Great park, too bad nobody goes to games there.  Bobblehead "museum" is a must see!

title: Cruise
review: This port is terrible. There is no organisation just a cop going mad with his whistle. You can’t drop off your baggage for a cruise. We had to park in the car park then lug the cases over the road to be checked in.

title: Holiday family cruise
review: Embarkation on 12/30 was super easy.  Luggage taken as soon as we stopped the car.    Parked in the parking structure.  Walked through all checkpoints without waiting.  All personnel were helpful and courteous.    Returning on 1/6 was a different story.  The baggage claim was super crowded.  Luggage porters were yelling to move out of the way but there was no way to go.  The baggage claim was on the opposite side of the parking structure and we had to walk close to 2 blocks (due to barriers)  with luggage.    Best embarkation port, but not so good for debarkation.

title: New port terminal
review: The new port terminal at the port of Miami is very refreshing and well organized. Was very crowded but we were in and aboard the ship in less than 30 minutes!

title: Very convenient
review: We came here for a Disney cruise trip and found the port to be very convenient from downtown Miami.  No problems at all!

title: wonderful outing with family
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: my 3yr old grandson celebrated part of his bday visiting the museum which thoroughly enjoyed, it was great fun for the adults as well.

title: The name says it all!
review: Located on the second floor, WEAM is all its name indicates. It is chock full of paintings, sculptures, photographs, etc., depicting erotica. The biggest problem I had with the visit was finding parking in Miami Beach. The exhibits cover erotica from all over the world and numerous time periods. If you appreciate this type of art, I wholeheartedly recommend WEAM for you. It is also much larger than it appears from the street.

title: Maybe the cleanest ballpark around
review: On the down side, attendance is poor which detracts from the game day experience.  An enthusiastic home crowd could make this place really special.  On the night I went, the visiting Cubs had more fans.

title: Very nice park, clean. Good place for a ballgame
review: Hotdogs and nachos were on the menu with some adult beverages and water after the 7th.  Two of our party smoke and they were able to find the smoking area quickly and it was well kept.

title: Beautiful Ball Park
review: Marlins Park is beautiful, the seats are comfortable, it doesn’t matter where you seat you will have a nice view of the game, and the standing areas are great. There is a lot of great food options in Marlins Park, I think Marlins Park should be a must go place in Miami!!

title: First visit to Marlins Park was 5-Star!
review: I wasn't sure that I would like Marlins Park, but once there, I was pleasantly surprised.  The roof was wide open and it had the feel of a regular outdoor stadium.  We even had a nice breeze from time to time, of course it was still just April, so I am sure it will be hotter in the summer months.  Also, the Cubs won 3 games in a row.  Maybe not so enjoyable for Marlins fans.

title: Lots of local food, fun to walk around and easy to get to
review: When we lived in Miami, went there all the time, reasonable family fun and really good food choices!

title: A limited museum in a gorgeous building and location
review: Miami had the possibility of having a wonderful museum, but it allowed one developer who gave it his name dictate much of its permanent collection, and alas, the result is a disappointment.  Every once in awhile it gets some interesting pieces in a traveling show, starting with the opening show by Ai Wei-Wei and including a recent pieces by Picasso.  The Lowe Museum at the University of Miami has a far stronger collection, as does the Ft. Lauderdale Museum of Art, and the best art museum in South Florida by far is the Norton in Palm Beach.

title: I the middle of the city
review: very very  humble experience

title: Not easy for an eldery person
review: I decided to take my mother to Andre Boccelli's concert which was spectacular but I did not count on the stairs so narrow and high for my mother. It was ny first and last time going to a concert there, it was very stressful probably my fault since I should have find out before going. In my personal opinion, it is not even secure for attendees if a fire and/or an emergency strikes de arena... God forgives. I do not recommend taking an eldery there unless you have the financial means to pay the ground sites which are located in the most expensive area.

title: Good place for a walk
review: I really liked the PAMM. They have some amazing things to look and feel. The whole place is artistic and cool. Don’t mind taking good pictures when you go there ️

title: Nice ball park but the food vendors are the worst.
review: I am only writing this review because I am hoping somebody in food service reads this. For the most part the people working at the park were nice and helpful. The park is really nice and easy to get around. All this changed when I went to order food. When your waiting in line the workers will hold up a sign to tell you they will take the next person. So when I went over to order the person took off and never came back. I then went to the next person holding the sign and he said I should have stayed where I was but I told him that she took off and never came back. I ordered the Cubin sandwich and after I paid he came back and said that it would be 5 minutes before I could get my sandwich. I waited a whole inning waiting to get my sandwich and missed a couple of runs. If he would have told me they were not available I would have ordered something else. Later in between innings,  I went up to get a pretzel  and 5 people were standing around talking and no one wanted to wait on me. I could not believe that I had to interrupt them to get my food. If someone in customer service sees this Please do something.

title: A must visit while in Miami
review: On our recent trip to Florida we went to Miami for the weekend and had to catch a baseball game - our first ever one! Atmosphere was great, game was great and they won! Nice arena and comfortable seats.

title: Beautiful Park, cheap parking, cheap seats
review: I loved the stadium, parked right across the street for $20. $40 seat was first row second deck right at first base. (Too bad the on field product was bad)..easy in/out.

title: Great experience
review: A great experience for anyone visit8ng the US.  Lots of crowd interaction.  Food not great - mainly burgers or hot dogs

title: Great place to see a ball game
review: Go see the Marlins or your home team.   Worth the visit

title: Emotionally Moving...
review: Amazing memorial, this one really makes you feel what it was like for the Jewish people, and reminds us how lucky we are to be alive and live in a free country. The walk down to the center island with the hand was the most moving experience I have ever had at a memorial, and I don’t have any personal Jewish connection. Just the humanity of it all...amazing piece of art!

title: Miami Heat or El Heat
review: We had the chance to visit one of the games, or better basketball events. They are always worth a visit especially if you are not familiar with sport events in the USA like us as we are from Europe. But be prepared to consider extra time for getting back to your place. Traffic around the arena after the game is chaotic and impossible. Take a stroll 2 or 3 blocks down and call the Uber right then.

title: Nobody Home
review: The Perez Museum is a stunning structure, with innovative tropical landscaping and a great location on the Bay. What a shame that there's nothing inside. The temporary Christo exhibition about wrapping Miami's islands in 1983 was mildly interesting, but Hew Locke's colorful suspended boat collection was the only bright spot in the museum's abysmal permanent collection. I was very impressed by the building but going inside was a waste of time.

title: love it
review: I've only been here twice, but i'm a big fan. It's a fairly small museum, so it's easy to see everything. Even if you're not loving the art on display, their outdoor areas are cool and fun. Great museum shop, too.

title: Great Park. Lousy team.
review: Not too big and not too small. Hardly a seat that has an awful view. Airconditioned for those excruciating Miami summer nights. Now if only there was an exciting team to watch.

title: Beautiful Ballpark!
review: This is one of the nicest ballparks in the States. Too bad the team in a mess. Try not to go to a game in the dead of Summer. It gets hot out there!

title: Marlins 2018
review: Marlins Park is cool and fun to see baseball games. Despite falling down, the Marlins staff checked me out and made sure I didn't suffer any long-tern injuries.

title: Ballgame with the Guys
review: Marlins Park is very comfortable place to watch a ballgame. The restaurants and the Clevelander Bar is pretty nice. I know the team is not great, but the Park has plenty to see and do while at the Park. Come and enjoy the Park.

title: Reminder of history
review: Thought provoking especially during nationalistic times in USA. The statues were amazing and the words on the plaque quite sad

title: Wonderful, interactive facility!
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Kids and adults will enjoy this venue. It is open air, but with cover so you can visit in inclement weather, no problem.  The views over the water are incredible! There are many wonderful exhibits, a planetarium with several shows, a good cafe, and MetroMover station on site. Purchase tickets on line at least 2 days prior and save a few dollars per ticket. Enjoyed!

title: Architecture Tour at 11am
review: There is an architecture tour at 11am, and it was excellent. We learned about the history of the museum and the inspiration for the design. In addition, we learned about the materials and the cobaix building process that allowed for the expansive galleries. The permanent collection is manageable, and we enjoyed the Christo exhibit.

title: Wonderful location and great installations
review: We visited in mid-November and it was easy to see everything, two school kids tours, and a lot of overseas visitors but no crushes. The hanging gardens, the model boats, the Christo pink island display and the wonderful “when the dew is still on the roses” all kept us busy. The only down side was the restaurant where getting a cup of coffee and a snack is a nightmarish experience. One other piece of advice to the management is to hook up with the science museum and discount double tickets.

title: baseball fun!
review: what a nice intimate stadium. very good tickets available at great prices. we paid $22 per ticket row 9 1st baseline. drinks were expensive like every sporting event. note not really any bars around stadium.

title: Good game, so so food
review: The Marlins don't draw much of a crowd and I think dining at this park suffers from that. We did enjoy the way over-staffed game with a probable attendance of 6000 (several hundred workers doing nothing). Good sightlines. Concessions was a bust though. My Beer tasted like it came from Aprils Keg and the hot dogs tasted a week old. Pop Corn not much better. It felt like food was used until it was gone. And in the Marlins case, that might take a month!

title: NYY @ Tampa Bay
review: Love to go to the games NYY/Tampa Bay in St Pete Florida.  We stay at a hotel near the Park and do tourism always.

title: Take Me Out To The Ballgame
Boring!  Like an over-rated high school game!
review: We’ve visited many many baseball parks around the country. This park is one of the worst in terms of excitement, fan participation and energy. The park looks well maintained but I felt like I was watching a bad high school game. The team and the fans had low energy and no pride. I’m surprised that they had cheerleaders at the game!  I’ve never seen cheerleaders at any baseball game.  But the cheerleaders weren’t good at all - they seemed like second rate performers. This stadium also plays a lot of Latin music.

title: First rate Activity Park
review: This park has it all . Central location ,first rate facilities , whether that is to take a swim , play a game of tennis or just study the talent of the many games that America has to offer

title: Spectacular Place to Learn while Having FUN!
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: I was blown away with the scope of this Science Museum. At the very start of our day, a movie in the wonderful Planetarium, The Dynamic Earth (one of four movies they offer), we were brought from outer space thru our solar system, to the earth, thru the atmosphere in the rush of a falling meteor to Miami and utlimately to our seats! And that was just the opening.!  I found the entire place to be wonderfully laid out to edu-tain the young and older. We started on the rooftop and worked our way down. The centerpiece is definitely the 6 story tank that affords views on every level of the wonders of our sealife. But equally great were the smaller tanks that represented, coral reefs and the inhabitants as well as other habitats like Mangroves.  There were 'petting' tanks for stingrays, and starfish.  The displays of Jellyfish alone were worth a visit. Birds and gators and all things that fly in the south Fla area were also nicely represented. The DiVinci museum was inspiring. There is an 80 million yr old fish fossil and many other examples of the wonders of this planet.  There were some areas that were not available to view, but even with that, I would allow at least 4 hrs to enjoy this museum.

title: Montreal Bachelor Party
review: We ended our bachelor party weekend at the gun range with an amazing experience. This is a must do to all those groups of people celebrating their bachelor party in Miami. Nick took care of the group and did an amazing job explaining the rules and safety protocol. He broke down every gun we were using with history and facts.  He went above and beyond for the bachelor and definitely added the cherry on top for our weekend. Highly recommend him and he's hilarious!

title: Lunch at Verde Bistro Capped Art  Museum Visit
review: Christo and Jeanne-Claude: Surrounded Islands is the featured exhibit and presentation at the museum until February 17, 2019. I was impressed with the bistro and had an enjoyable lunch with my sisters who were visiting from out of town.

title: Beautifully designed
review: This museum has unique art collections. There is some variety. The buildings architecture and furnishings are beautiful. Not sure if you get a lot of value for the price solely on the exhibits. There are few descriptions of th art itself although good artist biographies. There are also detailed panphlets but too much to read in a visit. I certainly would not benefit from a membership. Small children would not get much out of it although the environment is suitable for kids.  the gift shop has one of the best selections I’ve seen in the area!  To me that’s the most enticing part of the museum.

title: A very interesting stadium...
review: Another weird but positive is all the standing room. There is an ample amount and honestly, I wish I would have known this and paid for the cheapest ticket because it offers some of the best views.

title: Nice ballpark
review: Cons: No public transit to get to the park, and not many bars/restaurants around; lack of attendance makes it feel empty.

title: Fantastic Experience
review: We made our own way there on the bus but got the shuttle back to the metro on the way home to get back to Miami Beach.

title: Good day for the entire Family
review: Nice place to pass a good time with family. I recommend to reserve the parking ahead, better than park outside. Easy access to bathroom, food and other services.

title: Outstanding
review: Went to Marlins Park for the first time since it opened and it was well worth it got my ticket for the clevelander  level right at the front of left field, and believe me it was worth it.  It’s a must to go and watch a game.

title: So moving - powerful landmark
review: This has to be on your list of places to visit if you are in Miami.  The soundtracks being played add to the overall experience of the place. The 'hand' can be seen from far away and as you venture past the well known statues you enter into a breath-taking arena depicting the horrors of what took place, in statue form.   There is information on the walls and a sense of quiet and calm as visitors make their way around the openair exhibits.  It is breathtaking in the extreme.  The only problem I had was negotiating the puddles and rainfall which does not seem to drain away.  Take your time to read as much of the information as you can.

title: Unbelievable collection of 'art', for a little Jewish lady
review: I came out with two weird sensations - the fact I appeared to be the only man visiting - the second what would be thought of me as I emerged from the semi darkness with a sticker on my chest excelling erotic art. You might find it a little repetitive as you look around, but I concluded the human mind is not governed to take in so much in one go. I spent over an hour and breezed past the last few exhibits as I was beginning to feel as the only visible guest, that some of the things were staring back at me. I can guarantee you won't see another exhibit like it.

title: Huge collection!
review: Very happy we checked this place out. Worth the money as there's tonnes to see.

title: Amazing experience
review: We came to lock and load Miami having never shot a gun before and Will was so kind and understanding with us explaining everything to us so that we had as much fun as possible! This was a once in a lifetime experience I would definitely recommend this to anyone! Thanks for everything Will!

title: Amazing Experience
review: If you have never done this, it really is worth the time and money.   We will be going back.

title: Visual Delight
review: Treat yourself and treat your family to the wonder of this special museum in the heart of Miami.  Register online to learn about various events and activities, many of which are specific for children.

title: Museum a good home for modern art
review: George Perez, a Miami real estate developer, endowed this fine museum. It has a very good collection of modern and contemporary art. It has a Picasso on display which is worth in excess of $100 million. You may not like some of the exhibits, but give it a try. By the way, leave your car at home and take the Omni Line (gratis) and get off at the Museum Station. You can also go to the Science Museum.

title: PAMM
review: Modern facilites. Part of Blue Star Museums. Nice shop, Football exhibition was nice and some work by Picasso

title: Nice Park
review: Here to see NY Yankees.  Place was pretty crowded.  Had fun of course.  We had box seats first base.  Seats were great.  Would have cost a fortune at Yankee Stadium so good to have reasonable priced good seats here.  Roof was on so that was a plus with the heat.  My phone died so we couldn't get uber ride home.  They had a special uber lot but without using app would not let us ride.  Before my phone died ride would have been $2.79 to hotel.  They had a row of uber cars there too.  Ended up getting a taxi for $20 to go 1 mile.  We had walked there from hotel but not very safe at night to walk back.  But a terrific stadium to go to. Lots of beer stations and food.

title: Great stadium, warm atmosphere
review: Even if baseball is not my favourite sport, we had a great time.

title: Baseball fun
review: Marlins park is a great place to catch a game. We sat on the left field side in sections 26 and 28.  Our seats were great. You can even see home plate. My husband caught a foul ball and was on tv!  The music is very upbeat and entertaining. It is a beautiful park in a not so great section of town. We used Uber service there and back.  The only issue is the Uber lines were very unorganized at the park after the game.

title: A great ballpark
review: Marlins Park is a great place, easy to get to, lots of things to do, it even has a bar with a swimming pool in the left field, the Clevelander! Shame the team is not doing very well...

title: Impressed ...
review: Did visit yesterday , i was really impressed by the work they have done with the stadium , and plus with the area as well... Nice

title: Little Local Park
review: There are multiple tennis courts here and I have yet to learn how to sign up and use them. I usually walk through the park on my way to Lincoln Road.During the daytime I always feel safe and it is a large green area in the city. You could picnic here however it is too hot! There are trees.

title: Must see!
review: This I cant even begin how to describe. It was a beautiful memorial and although it left me feeling sad it was a must see! Parking is a bit tricky but well worth it.

title: It's worth a half hour walk thru
review: The memorial is all out doors but most of it is shaded.  The memorial tells the story of the Holocaust on marble panels with photos and engravings.  One of the highlights is the hand sculpture.  It's worth seeing no matter if you are a Christian or Jew.

title: A day at the Museum
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Finally made it to the Frost Museum of Science in Miami! Cool planetarium great architecture stunning views of the City and the Port of Miami. In some ways more of an Aquarium than a Museum I think the Frost will only get bigger and better as new exhibits are unveiled. A great day with family!

title: Outstanding Museum
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: We visited with three grandchildren ages 10, 8 and 5. We spent nearly four hours and left with lots of things left to do. This is an exceptional museum with many unique exhibits and hands on activities. You could spend an hour in just the engineering lab. The admission fee includes a planetarium show and we saw Dynamic Earth and it was great. Children enjoyed the aquarium but I think they liked the MeLab best. Food is expensive and you might want to consider bringing your own especially if you have a lot of children.

title: Heat vs Rockets
review: Got the chance to see James Harden tear it up and Heat come away with the win!! Vice Nights!

title: The Heat
review: Went to watch Heat vs Timberwolves. Great experience, fantastic food and drink choices wish British arenas/sports grounds were the same!  It was loud and in your face but brilliant fun.

title: Miami Heat vs Cavaliers
review: Entrance was too slow and started to rain outside. But once pass the security is well guided and service everywhere. Clean and great amenities... Love it!

title: Great Arena!
review: Whether you are here for a concert or a game there are very few bad seats in the house. The acoustics are very good too!

title: NBA Match
review: If you are in Miami, don’t miss the chance to see the Miami Heats playing!!!

title: The building...
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: ...is very attractive and a nice addition to the PMMA. We decided to only enjoy it from outside as it seemed to be mainly for children or people with limited „scientific“ education. Anyway - we have been wrong but avoided the noise and overentertainment.

title: Kids will have fun
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Worth for a single time visit if you have kids. Not too extra ordinary but the kids had fun in the first buidling.We have to pay extra for the shows which is  a ding and so we didn't go to those. Purchased an explorer- Go miami card

title: Wow! Fantastic Museum!
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: What an incredible museum! We absolutely loved the exhibits. We were lucky to visit when the DaVinci exhibit was still running. It was fantastic. We loved all the hands-on activities. The planetarium show was also phenomenal. I learned after the fact that I could have received a discount on my admission because I'm an educator (even though I teach in a state other than Florida). So teachers- bring your ID if you visit this museum for an admission discount.

title: Must see for all religious and non religious alike
review: There is beauty and sadness at the memorial. A true tribute to the holocaust

title: very impressive
review: A very impressive monument. The large concrete blocks with a top surface as large as a grave's make you feel small when you walk among them. Especially in the middle where the stones tower far above you. At night some of the paths are illuminated and several paths are also wheelchair acc

title: Powerful memorial
review: Though the memorial is outdoors, a great deal of the area is shaded. It is well worth at least 30 minutes of your time while in Miami.

title: lovely park
review: Centrally located park with lots of green space. Nice fresh water pool. Diverse activities. Nice place to drop off or pick up a rental bike too. Quieter than beach side parks but a short walk or bike ride from anywhere you could want to go in SoBe.

title: Local park
review: Great to experience locals. Great to cool off in the shade on a hot day. Enjoy the vegetation, the space, play sports, just be there on a day  when locals come home from work

title: For locals only
review: The park provides sports fields so good for locals but not much to see for tourists even if it is pleasant to cross a park in the middle of the city.

title: Great find!
review: Very large park with lots to do, was only about a 15 minute walk from our hotel at Collins/7th. We did not go in the pool, though it looked awesome, and my kids really enjoyed the playground equipment as it was more geared to older kids, which you don't find much. Lots of shady areas and places to sit, tennis courts, soccer field, clean bathrooms

title: Amazing Futbol Exhbit
review: Also, the dumbest photo policy ever... you can take all the photos you want with a cell phone, but you cannot use a simple point & shoot with the flash off? I understand not using a DSLR or a professional camera, but this is a little bizarre.

title: A highlight of my trip to Miami
review: I love to go to art galleries and museums based on the arts, and I was not disappointed here at all.  It is mainly modern art and contemporary art in a building set in Biscayne Boulevard.  It was given to Miami by George Perez, a real estate developer, and the worth and value of this building and its contents has just grown and grown.  Miami is so lucky!  Some of the exhibits are enormous and some are exceptionally valuable - but the works of art have been laid out in a creative way that makes you want to look around again.  Highly recommended.

title: Max was great
review: Thanks for great time Max and Vanessa. We visited on a whim and the service, hospitality and concern for safety were evident. We will be back.

title: Fun Fun Fun!
review: I rate this 5 stars because we had a wonderful time! We learned a lot about guns from Fabian who was awesome!!!! We really enjoyed our time here. We highly recommend it!!

title: Welcome to the Gunshine State
review: Lock & Load is great if you’re looking for something other than the beach or alligators in the FL Everglades. One of the best ranges in terms of customer service, and FABIAN stands out as an instructor. Definitely going back!

title: Good hilarious fun!
review: totally enjoyed it, it's a lot bigger than what it look like on the outside- cool mix of very memorable contemporary and antique pieces. LOL!!! A fun way to spend an hour or so, the appendages are everywhere!!!

title: Interesting arrangement of Erotic Art
review: Spent a good couple of hours walking around, larger than we though but some beautiful art work. Many different styles and genres. Thoroughly enjoyable would recommend!

title: Well Worth the Time and Money for a Memorable Trip
review: This had such an extensive collection of art. My friend and I came upon it by chance and had to see what it was all about. I am glad we went. It was quite the experience. Most of the art was interesting, some tasteful, some not so much. It was definitely worth the price. You see ancient and modern art from all over the world, in the form of photography, sculpture, paintings, and more.

title: Miami Heat!!!
review: If you’re in the area and Heat are playing it’s worth going to see.

title: Great place for a concert
review: What we like about the American Airlines Arena was that we are able to get in and out of the parking very quickly.  Once the concert is over, you are home in thirty minutes and we live in West Kendall.  We saw six concerts there last year.

title: Miami Heat
review: What an experience NBA at its best I attended the HEAT v LAKERS with my family and friends it was a great! The areana had everything!

title: Nice arena
review: Its the main arena in miami, located in downtown next to the bayside mall. The heat games take place over there and lots of other events.

title: Where's the signage
review: First time to arena to watch Heat v Bulls. Only thing hot was us after standing in queue for 30 mins only to find it was queue for checking in bags. No signage saying gate numbers. Others were confused too. Also seating plan showed our seats going thru gate 7 however when we got inside our seats were on other side of stadium ... and yes we first checked with staff. Very frustrating. Otherwise great stadium for viewing

title: Fun Days @ Frost
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: I’m a member & been to the Frost museum 4-5 times.  It’s always a great time.  Recently, I took my 2 year old nephew who loved it.  He loved the aquariums and also the water tables- just beware, he loved it so much we had to make a visit to the museum shop to get a new T-shirt. (Consider bringing a change of clothes) .  I also recently went with 3 teenage boys for the “Sports & Science Day.”  We weren’t sure what to expect but we were a little underwhelmed - all activities were geared toward 6-8 year old kids.  The exception was the soccer table where some fun facts were shared.  I think a lot could be done to link spirts with the existing exhibits to appeal to all ages.  Fortunately, there was more than enough from the regular exhibits to keep the teens busy.  When you visit Frost, I highly recommend taking the Metro & getting there early, parking is expensive & afternoons get really packed.

title: Not a fan
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Take the kids / grand kids and have a great time!

title: Frost Museum
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Very enjoyable day.  Great for all ages.  Beautiful views of the Miami skyline and the water.  Great food in the cafe located on site.

title: Some nice exhibits, great views, but please hire more ticket staff!
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: I am glad we went and the kids had a good time, but I am sure glad that we didn't have to pay full price.

title: Amazing !!!!
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: This is a very nice museum for children of all ages. The exibits are very well organized and explained, and the planetarium shows are amazing. The aquarium is beautiful, not very large but the experience of looking at it from the bottom is so relaxing and incredible!

title: Excellent memorial
review: This is a gut wrenching memorial to the jewish victims of the holocaust.  We went at sunset and the memorial was empty and well lit.  The statues are haunting and the information is very informative and does an excellent job of explaining the holocaust.

title: An emotionally moving depiction of the holocaust
review: I suggest combining this visit with a trip to the Miami Botanic Gardens, as the two attractions are literally next to each other. You also can simply pay for parking one time.

title: Great memorial
review: The memorial itself is well done, and the area is very nice.  Take some time to walk around it and see the memorial.

title: Awesome
review: Extremely moving. A fitting tribute to the 6 million Jews murdered by the Nazis. No memorial can ever tell the whole story of the Holocaust but this memorial is there so that we will never forget

title: Fantastic
review: A lot os options a few blocks from south beach Miami. You can walk, run, play basketball. You have restrooms, playground, it is complete!

title: Very public park
review: This park is very big and has lots to do. It is also very packed and probably a top destination for families with children. It was to crowded for my comfort and I actually enjoyed lummus park playground, which is much smaller, more for the fact that there were only a few families there.

title: Great tennis!
review: Flamingo Park is new and improved, the facilities and pros are great and for long term visits the beat deal for tennis anywhere.

title: No flamingos here
review: We walked all the way there expecting to find some flamingos but they do not exist. There is a ball park and sports facilities. However the walk there was worth it as you see a lot of Art Deco buildings.

title: Another great place to exercise or relax
review: Away from the twenty years olds looking for party.  Quiet and a great place to exercise or watch sports.  Swimming pool open to the public (with a price unless you are a resident) lots of green space and no large groups of 20 year olds with coolers full of beer

title: Spectacular 😎
review: Spectacular setting for amazing museum of modern art. Outdoor art installations are interactive - incorporating the waterfront setting into the ambiance of the venue. Children and particularly teenagers  will enjoy this museum because of the interactive nature of some of the exhibits and the venue.

title: Amazing building and setting
review: I went on a Thursday evening and there is a bar that’s open on outside podium with some music playing so you can absorb the views or perhaps just sit and relax in the swings.

title: Perez Museum
review: It is always a pleasure to spend a couple of hours wondering through the halls and exhibition rooms of this museum. It seems that every exhibit is expertly curated to caress your feelings and emotions in a very fulfilling way. Bravo!

title: 2nd amendment experience.
review: First of all, Thank you Fabian and the "RED" shirts for your service. The professionalism of the experience is top notch, the safety training, the weapon handling training, and the over all knowledge of the  weapons is top  notch.The video is awesome, it is totally worth to get the gopro camera.The packages are great and so many choices. If you like guns this is a major bucket item, i did mine. Now i'm just waiting for WW II weapon experience which is coming soon. One  thing that could be improved on...they need to get some 3XL t-shirts with panda with guns, they only had 2XL. The gun museum is awesome . ( I prefer to shoot them)

title: AMAZING!
review: And when I arrived everyone was very welcoming and most of all FABIAN. This guy got a lot of patience with the Frenchie that I am. He explained me all the technics, the history of each gun, and giving me self confidence. Thanks again for everything Fabian, I can’t wait to do it again!

title: Dream come true
review: Really good time there so if you are interested in guns this is the place for you.

title: Very fun and intense
review: We both had a very good moment. Our monitor (A.K.A Max) was always by our side to give us tips about how to use the weapons which helped us a lot. He even gave my friend a new T-Shirt for free!! He do not regret our decision and press you to go to and try this place !!

title: We loved it
review: We found this museum by chance, so thought we would go in for a bit of fun, well it was really good fun but also really interesting. It's fascinating seeing other cultures view on sex and how the celebrated the human body. This in my view is a must see and well priced at $15, the lady working there was lovely and so helpful, have fun xxxx

title: Something different
review: I saw this museum pop up on Google Maps, and I couldn't help but go visit.  If you're expecting some sort of voyeuristic experience then this isn't the place for you.  The exhibits are informative and very interesting.  There are a variety of displays, from print to sculpture.

title: Very Interesting
review: There are a lot of museums devoted to all kinds of Art this was unexpected but really captured sex thru many different cultures and forms of art. It was incredibly interesting to see all the different art forms that it was translated into. I would definitely recommend this to people traveling in the area. An experience you won't soon forget.

title: Definitely Interesting!!
review: We enjoyed our awkward visit through the museum. It is pretty diverse in variety and I believe the collectors did a very good job. A lot of giggles were had and many head tilting and question marks :)

title: Loved it
review: This is a fun place! A hidden gem, you could walk right past it if you weren't looking for it. Reasonably priced for such a different museum and the collection is huge! Definitely worth the trip! Take your significant other and be prepared to giggle.

title: Just Another Arena
review: This venue may be OK for basketball...but for concerts it is too big and has poor sight view from upper stand seats ... especially the side seats when trying to see the rear of the stage and video screens.

title: Friendly staff
review: The staff at the arena was extremely pleasant, however the security staff Was something to be desired years. Not all the security staff disrespectful seemed as though they could give it to you.

title: Disney show and Marvel superhero show
review: It's a great organized building, great security when entering, parking are underneath the building, and all around so no issues there. Plenty of restrooms.

title: Basketball visit
review: Views from the seating were clear and there was plenty of leg room that made it enjoyable. Crowds were sparse up until the end of the second period, but no idea why. The only negative was the food and food service. The food was over cooked and inedible, and the servers were - to put it politely pedestrian. But overall a good night out.

title: Parking
review: Went to see Andrea Bocelli in Concert at the Arena on Valentines Day and the show was wonderful... however, I have to comment on the parking...$50 bucks for 3 hours was a bit exorbitant on any ones standards. Its kind of funny because I was low on cash (don't carry much anyway) and I stopped by a Publix and picked up a $Fifty. WOW! That went pretty quick!

title: Science museum/aquarium/children's museum all in one! Great place to visit!
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: We loved our visit here! Not going to lie though, the admission prices are crazy high but we luckily had a reciprocal program pass. There was a huge line to get tickets which seemed crazy so get them in advance online if you can (can't with the reciprocal ones). Definitely pay attention if you have annual passes to another museum if it is in the reciprocal program cause it is a really nice benefit! It doesn't, however, include the planetarium tickets which were about $5 extra I believe she said but we didn't do it cause wasn't sure our toddler would sit through it anyways but I heard wonderful things about it. The set up was a little confusing as it is all outdoor based and then you go up to the exhibits on different levels and on different ends. Didn't feel like it "flowed" great but it ultimately didn't impede our visit cause we still really loved all the exhibits. If you have a younger kid (toddler aged) the exhibit with the interactive wall/floor where the kids shine flashlights to see animals and can interact with everything was a huge hit with our three year old. And right outside of it there are really neat water table features that my son could have spent all day at! So many different things you can do to manipulate the water it was really awesome. They also have a full blown aquarium with an amazing shark tank with a huge viewing area that was so neat to see. Another favorite was the dance floor area that creates light ripples when you go on it! My son was obsessed! Everything here is very interactive and we learned a lot and really had fun! Exactly what a science museum should do! They do need to work on their café... we went over thinking we would grab lunch only to see an insane line that was not moving for fairly high priced lunch type items. It was colder and rainy out cause it looks like there is usually a food truck open outside but perhaps cause of the weather it was not. So just a suggestion to eat before or after from our experience.

title: great interactive museum
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: great and interesting place to spend some time while in Miami, many interactive displays and an Imax theater

title: World of amazement
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Great place filled with exciting and unforgettable activities. Much to learn and experience on any day.

title: Superficial, very low-level.
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Annoyingly superficial.  Not worth visiting.  I have been to science museums in a bunch of cities in the USA and Europe without ever seeing anything else so low-level.  Even the planetarium show was devoid of the kind of information that interests smart people of any age.

title: Not enough people know about it
review: What a surprise we were not aware it existed and too see it and havebthe background explained was historical , miami beach has abhigh population of jewish people andbthey have truly honoured the fallen.It is a must see andbrespect.

title: Heartbreaking
review: It's a nice memorial, but it's truly heartbreaking to see everything. The statues faces are so lifelike in some you can almost feel their terror.

title: Devastating
review: Statue is worth the drive to see and check out the history.  Very moving and tragic event.  The monument is beautiful.  The history behind is very educational to walk around and read the events.  If your even close to area check it out.  Parking is kinda scarce due to construction.

title: Beautiful, Sobering Tribute - Truly A Must See
review: My wife and I made a slight detour to view this memorial on a recent trip … hard to describe the memorial in words.  The statue is incredibly impactful.  The reproduced photos and descriptions of the horrible events that inspired this tribute are beyond sobering.  Cannot recommend this highly enough - traffic issues, delaying beach arrival, inconveniencing yourself a bit - whatever it takes is more than worth it.  This is definitely a MUST SEE item.

title: Very Moving
review: Beautiful monument to the horror of the Holocaust. Wall with names of those murdered in the Holocaust. A very tall sculpture of human figures reaching to the top of a helping hand. Worth seeing.

title: big and beautiful park
review: the park is lovely, pretty, full of birds and animals. it is not just for kids or animal lovers, it is a pretty cool place to just walk around with a few friends, snap some pictures, feed a super friendly giraffe.

title: Green Space
review: There is not much green space or unbuilt land in Miami Beach, this is more or less an oasis in the middle of the island.  There is still enough green to call it a park, although much of the land has been developed with various sports facilities, including a modest-sized baseball stadium.  There is some limited on street parking available.  You can walk here from Lincoln Road (multiple parking structures), its only about four blocks and one of them is very short.

title: Nice!
review: Very easy to get to

title: excellent conditions
review: they have done a good job keeping the facilities in good conditions. the tennis courts are still top flight while the park remains clean.

title: Gay paradise
review: Everyone welcomed.

title: Beautiful beach
review: Great beach!  Perfect weather, beautiful people.  The blue ocean water is so refreshing and this time of year a little cold.

title: My favorite beach in South Beach
review: This is my favorite beach in South Beach.  It's a fun crowd and everyone enjoys themselves.  It's mainly a gay beach but the crowd has straight people too like myself and my guy.  Had no issue going topless.

title: Big and wide, kept clean, easy access from town
review: As with all the beaches on the island, this is patrolled and well maintained. Clean and easy access to the water.

title: Beautiful beach
review: We went to the beach in February and there were a good amount of people but not too crowded. The sand is nice and the water is beautiful. There is also a boardwalk to walk and explore.

title: Go!
review: Excellent contemporary art. Exhibits change often. You're charged for entrance, and parking, but it's well worth it.

title: Amazing Museum!
review: The setting of this museum is worth a visit. The design is incredible. Brilliant! It is a contemporary wonder, so clever- magnificent place to showcase art! The building is an exhibit in itself!

title: Nice museum.
review: I would consider this a modern art museum as opposed to a contemporary. They were showing an anniversary show and had some very nice pieces. Some classics like Stella, Badessari etc. and some more contemporary pieces. There are 2 large floors and it is well laid out. I found it to be a worthwhile experience. Allow an hour to two unless you're  eating there also. Nice location on the water. Admission is a steep $16, $12 for seniors.

title: Amazing experience! Thank you Brian!
review: Many thanks, from the UK, Vernon A

title: Great experience
review: First time at The Lock and Load Museum and it will certainly not be my last! The instructor, Fabian, was a professional and he made the experience worth every penny from beginning to end. Each staff member was friendly and surpassed expectations. The variety machinery was impressive and I will be sure to return!

title: So amazing!!
review: The man who helped us was absolutely amazing, providing my sons and i with context of each weapon as well as ensuring our safety throughout the lesson with detailed training and safety briefings. We had so much fun. Our helper was named Fabian, a really knowledgeable guy who was great with our 2 boys. Would definitely recommend :)

title: Amazing Experience
review: For sure we will return!

title: Saudi Arabia
review: The location and the parking is very good.

title: Interesting!!! :-)
review: When I saw the name of the museum I was hesitant on going in however me and my husband gave it a go and actually liked it...at the end there's a video that I feel like should have been at the beginning...I liked the video so much it made me want to take another trip through the museum....good time passer for the curious!

title: A very funny place to visit
review: It looks like a hole in the wall from the outside but they have an old, but fun exhibit inside. All kinds of sexual pictures, art and statues. Have a few drinks before going and enjoy.

title: It is NOT pornography
review: Plenty of merchandise for purchase and artifacts to view.  Don't judge by the exterior or strange entrance by elevator, it is worth the visit.

title: Great place!
review: The place is great. It's not very large and you can have the self guided tour completed in 45 minutes. There is a lot of art exposed, some of them really impressive. Recommended.

title: Lovely beach, full of friendly and beautiful people!
review: I really enjoyed the 12th Street Beach. It was relaxed, and the people were friendly (and beautiful). I didn't feel the need to constantly watch my valuables and people felt comfortable leaving their items and going in the water. The beach was bustling but not overly busy and it was easy to get a spot at lunch that wasn't on top of another sun worshipper. Great LGBT visibility, which is a plus for us when travelling.

title: nice place to visit
review: If you like watching the surfers… I recommend the beach for kids. I found the beach quiet and clean.

title: Relax
review: Really just part of miles of sandy beach at Miami. Lie back, watch the fun and soak up the sun. Plenty of cheeky birds around. Watch kite flying in windy weather and light aircraft advertising.

title: The Gai Beach
review: The Tides Hotel is next door and has a more upscale menu but yet 3m from the Palace action.  Parking is tough as this is a very central area. Park the car.  Take UBER... walk or take a CitiBike....

title: Beautiful pristine beach
review: Very popular public beach suitable for all ages. Beautiful white sand and blue water. Tide and rip current can be strong at times. Observe all notices, warnings and recommendations regarding swimming.

title: If you are in Miami Beach, Why not....
review: Interesting display of all kinds of things.  Not sure what I was expecting but wow.  All kinds of art and sculptures.

title: Beautiful facilities, great service, poor products
review: They are just decreasing the amount or cutting on budget just like most companies,  but they are great thou

title: Home of Miami Heat
review: Very quick and easy access.

title: Excellent
review: Excellent location, easy access and parking including train/people mover.  Beautiful sounds quality and spacious

title: First Basketball Game
review: Nice arena but the staff was no where around to show us where our seats were and we ended up having to find them for ourselves.

title: Safe, entertainment and clean
review: Very easy access, good for children, clean, with a good variety of things to eat and drink. Went to a NBA game, and it was amazing!

title: Very Disappointed
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Overall - very underwhelming experience :(

title: Planetarium is a must
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: We came one afternoon and saw one of the shows in the planetarium. It was absolutely the highlight of this visit. Narrated by Liam Neeson it was very informative and captivating. The other exhibits were just as good and interactive. My friend wasn't keen on any of the aquarium as she said they were kept in too small a tanks and there was even the chance to handle a starfish which she thought was animal cruelty. If you go up to the top floor you get great views of Miami from both sides. Quite expensive for what it was.

title: Great planetarium- great museum
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: We had a 6 hour layover in Miami after reading reviews this was best suited to my 10 year olds interest.  We only brought backpacks and checked our luggage so we could enjoy the museum.  I’d recommend taking an Uber vs taxi as the cost is about half the price. Entrance fee was typical to other museums that also offer a planetarium show.  Timing wise we started with the planetarium and then worked our way up the floors.  We had lunch here on the patio the pizza and the tater tots were great!  We would recommend this museum to travelers.  There is something for everyone of all ages.

title: Get the membership
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: I have visited the museum several times and always enjoy it. It’s very good for kids but also for adults. They also have different exhibitions throughout the year. I think the admission prices are expensive, and if you’re planning to visit more than once you should get the membership.

title: Poignant
review: We stopped off here on a day trip.  Although it was physically smaller area than we had expected there was lots of information on the holocaust to remind or bring you up to speed on this shocking terribly sad part of history.  May we all never forget.

title: nice time at beach.
review: this is where i entered the beach. there are pathways onto the beach. we got lounge chairs included in the hotel charges, but needed to pay an extra $15 for an umbrella. make sure to use sunscreen and reapply, even with sunscreen and umbrella my daughter got a little burnt cause the sunscreen came off in the water. get there early for a chair closer to the water.

title: Excellent !
review: Between 8th st and 12nd st you Will find the best place. If you want to be more quiet go to Tahiti beach which is a very nice place as well.

title: The world of diversity in one SoBe spot
review: The whole world of diversity in one wide expanse of a beach. Typically the place where the gay and lesbian sun-worshippers hang out in SoBe. Busiest on Saturday and Sunday afternoons. In the event of a sudden downpour don't worry! The Palace Bar is only a minute away, on Ocean Drive, and welcomes everyone until the sun comes back out again.

title: BEACH!!!
review: Excellent beach, great water for wading, swimming, playing, etc.   The sands are clean, and plenty of room for beach-goers.

title: Turquoise goes well with white...
review: Just the same as the South Beach review really: 12th Street Beach was our closest beach from our apartment on Collins Ave. it harbours warm, turquoise waters and soft, white sand. It's easy to see why people rave about Miam - there's an innate tranquility here. The beach was clean, so it's obvious the locals take a lot of pride in keeping the area pristine. Beware of the cheeky prices for beach chair and umbrella hire. Not joking.

title: An important visit
review: I suggest to take a 15 minute walk there and not missing it.

title: So well done.
review: When we were at the (free) bottanical gardens, the phone kept telling us we were at The Holocaust Memorial, which turned out to be right around the corner. WOW. So gut wrenching and emotional. Bring tissues.

title: nice decoration for Hannukah
review: in the middle of busy Lincoln Road stands this memorial for the 6 million killed Jews in Germany during WWII and should also talk to american conscience, as many of them could have been saved, if the would not have been rejected when they tried to immigrate to the US.

title: How skimpy is your bikini/speedos?
review: I'm not one to shy away from a little bit of skin and it's certainly on show here at the 12th Street Beach. The "body beautifuls" come here not just to soak up the sun, but to soak up the atmosphere and get an eyeful of the other stunning people out at the beach. At certain times of the year there are party events and other performances here. When I'm in Miami Beach, you can be sure I'll be here in my speedos.

title: Great people watching
review: The beach offers great views of the ocean as well as the local color. It is a very interesting and varied crowd of people.

title: Gorgeous
review: Beautiful beach, the water  is unbelievable, crystal clear and really sets off the clean white sand. I've travelled all over Spain and Greece and seen some incredible beaches but this place really is one of kind. Very clean, and an excellent spot for people watching the wonderfully eccentric visitors to and residents of Miami. All in a perfect place to spend an afternoon (or five minutes if you're Scottish like me and used to more arctic climates!)

title: I WORKED AS A LIFEGUARD HERE IN THE 1960's !!!
review: Boy do I have memories of this beach or what !!! I worked as a lifeguard here for a couple years before moving away to go to college in 1963. We lived on 13th street and Drexel Ave., just a couple blocks from here and spent most of my time here at this beach. This beach is better today than it ever was. It is much wider and better kept now that back when I lived here.

title: White sand
review: A bit crowded but oh so pretty. Gorgeous beach, soft white sand, life guard and chairs for rent. Beautiful surf, warm waters, easy access.

title: quiet in the middle of South Beach
review: Always liked this well maintained park. Older well kept neighborhood, my aunt lives on the next block. Very relaxing

title: sports in good localization
review: great place to play TENNIS,good localization in south beach,beautiful pool.worst thing:place to stop the car

title: Get active!
review: If you live an active lifestyle, you'll be really happy to reside near Flamingo Park. Lap Pool for just US$10/pax., baseball stadium and soccer field. Wow!

title: Miami Flamingo Park
review: Very Well Maintained and Clean with all kinds of sports activities for Kids and adults alike, Miami is simply surprising!!!

title: Go and walk!
review: Beautiful park in the middle of SoBe. Fantastic for running or walking or just enjoy the view of the amazing trees araound.

title: Worse stadium I have been to
review: Games here are boring, hardly anyone goes.  The food choices are sub-par and very expensive.  Stadium itself is tacky with that ridiculous home run sculpture which thankfully is going to be removed.   Traffic is horrible to get to the games, especially on a weekday.

title: Parking rates keeping me from visiting
review: The outrageously expensive parking keeps me from renewing my membership. The site around the museum is magnificent.

title: Wonderful option
review: Great outdoor space for family and kids.

title: Small for a museum, but good short visit
review: Definitely a very small museum with only a handful of galleries. However, the art is very interesting and provides a much needed distraction from the boring beach days, or gives you an alternative activity on a rainy and windy days in Miami.

title: Great experience!
review: We had an amazing experience at L&L. We were guided by Max who was fun and knowledgeable about all guns. Would definitely recommend it, specially with Max as a guide.

title: Expensive, but great
review: my son wanted to come here to shoot "the big guns".  The guide helped him learned proper gun care, kept him safe and helped him have a great time.  the full staff was friendly.   Definitely recommend

title: Loads of fun
review: Had a blast. Our instructor was Will. He was extremely informative and explained everything in full detail. I was scared to shoot at first but he made me comfortable. 10/10 would definitely recommend.

title: Fabian is a fabulous instructor
review: Thank you

title: Great experience
review: Loved every minute, would highly recommend.

title: Extraordinary
review: Do not miss it! You will never see anything like it anywhere. Not for perverts but for people who are genuinely into art & history & doing something different.

title: Great chance to explore the world of eroticism throughout the ages.
review: This collection by a nice old Jewish lady is a testament to the adage that sex never goes out of style. It, at times, goes on behind closed doors, closed eyes, closed minds, and even in the dark. But here, it is exposed for all to explore. Don't be embarrassed to go. After all, you wouldn't even be reading this if it wasn't for s-e-x.....

title: Out of the ordinary art museum
review: The front desk lady was very pleasant, commited to the  mission of the owner. Eroticism as an artistic expression. Not presented in a pornographic or sensationalistic way. Very nice pieces, my favorites Egon Schiele and Gustav Klimpt represented by nice works. Nice collection of antique and classic eros. Took almost two hours to tour. Very easy to find in South Beach.

title: Awesome place if you love Art.
review: Initially we were thinking the museum would've been full of pornography, and feeling a little prudish, I thought it will be too much to see all at once. However, we were pleasantly surprised by the detail in every piece of art the owner collected. It was really interesting to see sex culturally. The section on Japanese culture was especially eye opening; the women were expected to drop what ever they were doing to tend to their mates needs. Even if it meant doing it while feeding your child... that was gross, selfish and inconsiderate, but interesting nonetheless. They have some really funny pieces. The owner was someone you would never think would be into these things. You end up respecting her for her foresight by the time you leave. 15$ for entry for something out of the ordinary and only 2 blocks from south beach's entry way.

title: Worth a visit
review: We enjoyed our visit , it was fun and no crowds . We spent about 1.5 hrs there , staff were very friendly and helpful

title: Pleasantly suprised
review: For such a huge place and huge numbers of people, attending a HEAT game here was a pleasant surprise.  All attendants were helpful and polite and crowd control was done well.  Plenty of eating places once the arena opens (1 hr before the event) ...elevators and escalators available at different levels.

title: Travelzoo deal heat vs hornets
review: If you have any questions, please call us at 786-777-3865(DUNK).

title: Miami Heat Games and Concerts
review: Excellent arena, really self close parking, can be a little price the drinks inside, but overall is a Great place to cheer your favorite team, in my case The Miami Heat!

title: We attended the basketball match between Miami Heats and Brooklyn Nets
review: The place was grandiose and the match was exciting. I was amazed at the extent of the area before arriving at the actual Arena. In spite of the thousands of people present everyone moved swiftly to take their seats. I loved the atmosphere and will go back again for another match when next I visit Miami.

title: Great afternoon out
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: An architecturally interesting building in a lovely park setting overlooking the city.  I thought the ticket price was good value for the planetareum, aquarium and other interesting and informative displays.  The cafe is pretty basic, but fine for a light lunch or coffee break.  Getting there by the MMO from downtown was easy once you understood the loop system!

title: Interesting Attraction for All Ages
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: We have been interested in visiting this new science museum since it was under construction. A visit by our son's family, including grandchildren ages 4 years and 18 months provided the proper motivation. Quite literally, there is something here for everyone. A highlight was the "River of Grass", a multimedia experience aimed at children up to age 6. Both of the grandchildren were absolutely mesmerized; in fairness, the adults thought it was pretty neat as well. Another major attraction is the multi-faceted aquariums. While we spent several hours there, one (without easily distracted young children) could spend much more time there.

title: VeryGood for Children
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: The exhibits, planetarium and aquarium are interesting.  There were many hands on areas throughout this museum.  I believe children would find many exhibits interesting because of the interactive nature of them.  Some of the exhibits are set up so parents/grandparents can sit (and rest!) and watch while their children/grandchildren interact with the exhibits.  However, my wife and I felt that there was not much for adults to glean from the exhibits.

title: Daddy daughter time
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Was a beautiful visit, we enjoyed all the interactive exhibits. Had a great learning experience. Will be visiting again soon.

title: Disappointed
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: I had been very hesitant about going here since it opened, I generally like Museums but for what ever reason I just had a gut feeling not to go. One day I just said lets see if I will be impressed by this place and I planed to spend at least half a day there, however after being there only 1 hour I was very bored and ready to leave. I categorize the layout as Kid Friendly, The exibits that house marine animals are nice but that was it for me. The menu in the cafeteria style eatery is very Generic, Pizza, Hot Dogs eat. Also the parking and entrance fee to the museum is very expensive. Not worth the price. I will Not be returning here.

title: Beautiful & Moving
review: A very poignant and thought provoking memorial. Beautifully done. A great reminder of how lucky we all are.

title: Very Moving - A Must-See if You Visit Miami
review: This memorial is extremely tastefully done. The sculptures are incredibly life-like and realistic, and give a strong visual impact about what those poor people had to suffer. If you visit Miami please go. If you don’t intend to go to Miami you should go for this memorial alone.

title: Great reminder of the horrors of the Holocaust
review: We took our two older teenage children and am glad they had the opportunity to learn more about the atrocities of the Holocaust.  We walked to the memorial at night - glad it stayed open into the evening.  Just as impactful at night as it would have been during the day.

title: Impressive memorial
review: Great activity away from the beach.  Real close to the convention center and the Botanical Gardens.  Details on the statues are amazing.  Highly recommend!

title: Wonderful water, great sand...
review: Excellent sand well maintained and packed,  with wide vistas.  Small rollers coming in lapping up maybe 10, 20 feet of sand.  I was there about 7:30 in the morning when the maintenance tractor just rolled by.  Sunny blue skies with big puffs  of clouds.  I had to roll up my trousers to wade a bit in that water... wonderful, maybe 70 degrees?  Next time I must stay an extra day with leisure!

title: Stayed Across from this Gem
review: Ashamed to say that for the first four days of our holiday apart from going to look at it once, we didn't spend any time on this beach even though we were staying just across the road, preferring to do tours. Then we started to spend time there and it is a great beach. The sand is beautiful, the sea can be rough, but there are lifeguard stations all along the beach, both restored art deco ones and modern ones so you feel quite safe. There are rental stations where you can rent chairs and beds but at a total of $55 per day - $20 per bed and $15 per umbrella - it makes sense unless you have money to burn or are just there for a day to buy the little chairs and umbrellas at Walgreens. We had these provided by our condo and can honestly say these are really comfortable. Everyone seemed comfortable enough to leave their valuables on the beach but we chose to buy some waterproof phone holders at a discount dept store and just popped our phones round our necks when we went into the water.

title: Sun and Fun
review: What can you say about the beach on south Beach. Wonderful. The beach at 12th street. There are chairs and umbrellas to rent. Food stands to get food.  And of course beautiful sand and the crystal clear warm waters of the beach.  This part of the beach can have a larger gay population but not always. Most times the water is completely calm and you can just stand in the water and relax. and of course the water is always warm. Of course you can walk up form the beach here to the Palace Bar and take in the Drag show that is always a big draw and entertaining.  There are showers as you leave the beach to wash off and bathroom at 10th street.  A good part of the beach to visit.

title: Beautiful Beach
review: The water was a beautiful blue. There was a large beach so that you can be as near to or as far from the water as you would like.   There were also a lot of shells to collect. Beach was very clean.

title: Eye Candy
review: Just an awesome beach.  Lots of people great sand and much eye candy. It's right in the middle of all the action on South Beach.

title: Great park for children and adults
review: During our recent vacation, my wife and I took our children to the park frequently.  Our daughters, age 4.5 and 2.5, enjoyed the great variety of attractions in a fenced in location.  The grounds contain both soft surfaces and grass.  There are jungle gyms, climbing walls, and other attractions at a children's playground.  The other parents at the park included a good number of local parents and grandparents, as well as tourists.  While we did not get the chance, I was told that the public swimming pool is also very nice.  The park also contains numerous tennis courts, trails, and basketball courts.

title: Nice place to chill
review: I love going there once in a while and see basketball games. Also they have other games and activities too. I wish the park was bigger though.

title: Wonderful place but THE POOL IS CLOSED FOR A FEW MONTHS
review: Everything about Flamingo Park is excellent... good staff, great facilities, safe and well lit... tennis, running track, dog parks, children's park... BUT the pool is closed indefinitely as of mid-January for repairs and we are told that the repairs may take 2-3 months. The next closest pool is Normandy pool about 30 minutes north of Flamingo. However once the pool reopens you can be sure that we will be there once again every day for laps and sun!

title: Flamingo Park
review: Tropical with all kinds of trees, in fact it has shaded areas. The main theme is activities. The high light is the pool, which is under repair for the next month. For the kids you still have a fenced in area with climbing walls, and jungle gyms. There is a dog park. The Tennis courts and Basketball courts are very popular. The restrooms are clean.

title: Beautiful Urban Park, Swimming & Tennis
review: Well groomed, conveniently located, Flamingo Park is a great place to play tennis on the hard-tru courts; they have tennis clinics daily for $25 pp for 1 1/2 hour session. Very nice locker room, tennis clothes and shoes for sale on site. The pool is good for lap swimming. Nice place to walk around.

title: Beautiful building with random quality art work
review: If you have a Bank of America ATM card then entrance is free on the first Saturday

title: Top Class!!
review: We’ve been to many Modern Art Museums & always come away lost for words and confused about many of the exhibits. Clary, our Tour Guide’s introduction & explanations opened our eyes and minds in a way that will stay with us forever. We were so impressed-arriving at 11.30 & not leaving until 4.30pm!!!!   The Christo Film and exhibition was amazing. Thank you!

title: Good For First Dates
review: This falls into the category of "trendy hip provocative" which means it's great for adults who are either knowledgeable about contemporary art or are looking for something to spark conversation between themselves and a new acquaintance. With a $13 per adult admission it's not for the casual museum-goer.  If you are lucky tou'll spend 90 minutes looking at quirky art. No major masterpieces.

title: Fun Museum, Beautiful Surroundings
review: The gardens and surrounding buildings look very beautiful, even though we were not able to see them perfectly since we only went there by night. There's a big parking lot and a nice restaurant.

title: Great experience
review: What a great experience. Max gave us all the safety brief and guided us through the whole experience with great help and lots of information on each gun and how to use it. Great to experience actual automatic guns and the respect you need to give them . We will go again as best day out for ages

title: Well worth the 2hr drive
review: Took my 2 teenage Sons. The staff were friendly and very helpful, which makes the difference,nice area to sit down or look around the Museum while you wait on your turn on the range.Weapons Instructor Max was very helpful. look forward to returning again GOOD DRILLS !!

title: Great time!
review: This place is spectacular. It is completely safe and well supervised. This is something my 13 yr old grandson wanted to do, as did I. It isn't cheap but it is an incomparable experience; they provide a video of your shooting too! Absolutely unmissable! We had Will, and he made our experience there most memorable. You can pick from a wonderful selection of automatic weapons. It is interesting to learn all about each gun too! There is an excellent display of armament you can handle and take pics too! Casual dress/shorts are fine. Nothing loose like a necktie.

title: One-of-a-kind Experience!
review: I recommend closed toed shoes and a shirt that isn't too low cut since hot brass will be flying around and you don't want to burn yourself. Also note, handguns are NOT able to be rented while solo so be in a group if you want to try those out.

title: Amazing first shooting experience!
review: Brian was my shooting and arm trainer. He explained so many things, was super informative, friendly and had a lot of patirnce! Everyone at Lock & Load was so nice. I can only recommend it! Thanks for everything guts! You made my day!

title: Interesting!
review: This museum was very interesting! It was pretty intriguing to look at all of the ancient items from back in the 1900s. We learned a lot about the different types of art. It's worth a shot to check it out!

title: Very interesting Spot (no pun intended
review: If you like unusual adventurous museums, this is a must see.  We spent about an hour walking through but could have stayed much longer. An amazing collection of sexual everything owned by a very interesting woman.

title: Detailed and Dense Collection of Erotic Art
review: Bottom line: I've been to a few sex museums in my day, and most are prurient and pull their customers due to shock value.  This place is exactly the opposite, very intelligent and tasteful, presented for the appreciative and mature.  This place is a winner, and am already looking forward to returning.

title: Incredible collection and a must see.....leave the kids on the beach
review: What a great and interesting collection of everything from erotic art to soft porn. This collection gives you a million photo ops that aren't appropiate for FB...lol. Well worth the cost of admission and open later than most!

title: Just what the name says it is
review: Interesting to say the least - leave the kids behind though. The history of the curator is fascinating - one can not tell a book by its cover!! there are items from Shiele and Rembrandt to hugely phallic creations dating from the ancients to the moderns i.e. Clockwork Orange’s white sculpture. Take it as an interesting venture into how cultures represent their sexuality and goes what, its all the same!

title: American airlines Arena
review: Catch a Heat game or any other event playing. Location is great in the heart of downtown Miami. Modern Arena with great seating. Parking at the bottom for members or across the street in empty lot. Also throughtout biscayne Blvd. The Arena is on the water overlooking the bay and next to Miamis bayside, and the frost museum of science and Perez arts museum. Food at the Arena can be pricey a beer with chicken renders and fries 35.00 - 45.00 parking another 25.00-30.00 you can also walk next door to bayside a dine in one of many restaurants also free live entertainment in the evening main entrance stage enjoy the game!

title: Miami Heat v Orlando Magic
review: Great experience (we loved this visit)

title: NBA Game
review: I visited this arena a few years ago with my daughter. We had a great time watching Dwayne Wade and Lebron play.

title: Miami Heat vs Dallas Mavericks
review: This was my first NBA experience and it was amazing. The arena itself is huge, a bit bigger from what am I used to in Europe. The thing that also amazed me was the food selections which is far bigger than in Europe. You can see on the basketball court from any sector of the arena, even the most far away one. The only smaller complaint that I have is that the security screenings should be under the roof as well because when the gates opened the rain started to fall really hard so we all ended up being soaked a bit.

title: Great Science Interactive Museum
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Great to visit with the family. Lots of kids playing around while learning. All ages are welcome. The team is ready to explain all the questions you’ll have.

title: This place is fantastic!
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: It's such a cool layout-- various buildings on each level and amazing views of Miami. Beautiful illustrations of aquatic creatures decorating the buildings...

title: Worth the pricey admission...but there are ways to save.
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Visited museum w/ 4 girls: 17, 15, 11.  All thoroughly enjoyed the various exhibits throughout the museum especially the marine life.  Parking was expensive: $8 1st hour, $4 after that (park at american airlines for $5 and walk the 2 blocks) or use public transportation.  Also Food@Science (the only dining on-site) was somewhat pricey and took 45-60 min.  Best to bring a bagged lunch and snacks.  We felt the free 25 min.  show on planets, sun and stars was just OK.  Tips: Check to see if your local museum has some sort of free admission reciprocation.  Save $2/ticket by buying tickets on-line the day before.  Skip the long line by buying same day tickets on-line anytime. If staying in Miami for a few days, by the city pass and get multiple attractions for one prices.

title: worth your time and $
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Good place to take your family.

title: It's...okay
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: I think this museum is especially aimed at children, specifically the MeLab section, so its very interactive, but also almost everything is broken (understandable (?)). I think its a bit overpriced considering it's about $30 per person, and parking is like $20. The planetarium show is really nice, and the flight exhibits and aquarium are a good size and interesting.

title: Holocaust memorial
review: Very poignant & heart wrenching but worth it. Little known even by locals but should be a must by all visitors to Miami. Amazing sculpture in itself but very informative display of facts on the holocaust. Take some time out of the usual sights for this one, you owe it to all those who lost their lives & to humanity in general.

title: Sobering
review: The memorial is dramatic but tastefully done and very sobering. There is no charge for admission and we spent 15 minutes absorbing it. The tunnel down to the centre of the memorial is particularly effective.

title: Deeply Affecting -- Do Not Miss
review: Understandably Miami Beach is a place where people go for fun or relaxation. However, while you are there, do not miss the Holocaust Memorial. It is an incredibly powerful and important presentation that is moving beyond words. On the walls, a history of the atrocities of the concentration camps is chronicled, and the statues evoke the emotion matching the horrors they reflect.
