There is no charge, and it is a block from the Botanical Garden (also free). In my opinion, everyone should make time to stop here and reflect on what was and can never be allowed to be again.

title: Very sobering memorial - worth visiting
review: Very moving sculpture and setting for this memorial to the Holocaust. Its scale and emotional impact put the apparent frivolity of Miami Beach into context. Very sobering.

title: Great Beach and Surrounding Area
review: Walk the beach. Explore the Art Deco neighborhood. Gawk at the amazing cars new and old. Swim and sun and stroll.

title: White sand
review: Clean, white sandy beach with a unique back drop of Art Deco buildings. It was peaceful to relax by the water on a beautiful, sunny day.

title: Fantastic Beach..
review: Probably the most beautiful beach in town. Clear sand and water, nice people, beautiful landscape, is definitely a must, and for free!!!!.

title: Warm days, cool nights
review: The beach was family friendly and was nice to find a place to sit. It was three of us woman and I felt mostly safe because we sat near the life guards.

title: Nice, clean, good for children
review: This is a very nice beach, where you can choose to either rent a bed and umbrella, or take something from your hotel. We were in the Leslie Hotel, which is at Ocean Drive and quite near. The water is warm, the waves are small but great to play in with the children. It's quite a long way to go before the water becomes deeper, so ideal to play with children. The beach is clean, the sand is soft and sea is blue... very enjoyable!

title: Great neighborhood park
review: My guy and I stayed in an apartment nearby for vacation.  This is a great park to do walking and exercise.  There is a great track to either walk or run.

title: A WOW in the middle of South Beach!
review: The pool is large, has a smaller pool for the young, and is very well kept, supervised, and attended

title: Good and safe park.
review: Good vibes in this park, really close to all the facilities, is the oly place where you can chill in South beach if you don't want to spend time on the beach this is a great alternative.

title: Loved it!
review: It was so much fun visiting the birds & animals. It was mating season for the peacocks, so it was very noisy also. We had a wonderful time and we will go back during our next visit to Miami.

title: Urban park
review: This is a nice urban park used mainly by locals but good to drop by just to people watch. It is not usually visited by tourists and we saw people at all hours playing basketball, jogging and keeping fit.

title: Superb Modern Art museum
review: This was one of the best modern art museums in the U.S.  The art was very thought-provoking and very well explained.  Many of the major artists had written information in both Spanish and English to take home.  The building itself is very modern, but the hanging gardens and the wood make it feel warm rather than the cold cement found in other art museums.  Food in the restaurant was also excellent.

title: Good, but didn't seem to have the sparkle of previous visits
review: The other downside is the high cost of parking - $12 for 2 hours.

title: Absolutely fantastic
review: A wide range of art from a wide range of artists. There is something for everyone here and I could easily spend hours here. I found a lot of it very thought provoking with some of the art based around Black History Month. They have a small shop and cafe round the back.

title: Some real interesting exhibits
review: Very varied exhibits which are designed to provoke The "island wrapping" feature from Christo was on display and that in it self was worth the trip.  "All in the same boat" makes you think.  There are guided tours available.

title: Fantastic experience
review: We visited yesterday and wow, what an experience. Max was extremely polite, knowledgeable, funny and really helpful. Our 2 boys did the cadet package and I quote “the best thing ever!” . Husband did the special forces package. Absolutely amazing experience, throughly recommend

title: awesome!!
review: We visited lock & load on Monday this would be my second time going. Bought friends with me this time around. Max was our instructor and let me tell you he knows his firearms. I always feel nerves at first but once you get shooting it all goes away. shout out to the lock & loaded family from Bermuda!! we be back in the near future.

title: Simply great
review: Would definitly recommend it.

title: Happy Customer
review: Overall a must visit for those who respect and appreciate fine machinery.

title: A great experience
review: We had a really nice experience at lock and load miami. Found it a tad bit expensive but enjoyed the experience. Max our instructor was very friendly and ensured that we had a safe and fun time while shooting!

title: Educational
review: Very educational, warm and friendly welcome from the staff, will definitely recommend going if your around the area

title: Amazing
review: A stunning, fascinating collection of erotica. Lovely! Had a nice time walking through this cool little museum. Naomi Wilzig knows how to pick them. Would definitely recommend to anyone who isn't afraid of an artful display of human anatomy.

title: Interesting
review: Fun and entertaining. Not everything has a description by it. If you have the time and it’s your thing, I’d drop by. It’s not very big, so it won’t take up your whole day. Only complaint is the building has an overwhelming mold/musty smell. Definitely hard on the sinuses.

title: Fun and weird!
review: A great thing do to off the beaten path - fascinating in both its contents and its own history. Open later than most museums and much more extensive than you would think - a little bit of everything and considering the content extremely tasteful!

title: Concerts & basketball
review: Located in an east to get to spot in Miami City. Public transport available. Great venue and home of the Miami Heat.

title: Convention
review: Went here for our yearly convention in Feb, Market America, had a great time, we couldn't me here yearly,close to the restaurants in the area, walking distance.

title: A+ Staff
review: First time here. Attended a concert. Everyone involved was friendly and helpful.  Food and beverages were overpriced,  by tasty.

title: The best Arena EVER!
review: I am a huge Heat fan and have been to 6 arenas in the States including American Airline arena in Miami. I think American Airline arena in Miami was the best arena I've ever been so far. Staffs were nice and it was easy to access. I was even able to take a photo with players!

title: Florence + The Machine 6/9/2019
review: Great venue - every seat is a good seat!

title: Everything was GREAT!
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: The parking was easy.  The museum of science has a zillion nice exhibits, most with parts my little grand children just loved (hands on).  The people we talked to that worked there were over the top nice.  From the museum to the cafe to the gift shop, everyone was great.  Even the view of the cruise ships on the ocean from the top floor was beautiful.  I cannot say enought nice things about this place and the good people who work there.  Take you little ones here, they will have a blast!

title: Varied and well displayed
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: The variety of different things to see is great but the planetarium is really excellent. If we had had our grandchildren with us we could have spent all day there.

title: Lovely aquarium and excellent views
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Came here for three hours and thoroughly enjoyed the Aquarium with the variety of animals and special mention goes to the most amazing panoramic views of Miami, definitely worth visiting. You can even touch some of the animals!!

title: Not worth the money and time
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: We visited this attraction on a Friday morning. Many (Most!) of the exhibits, science experiments, displays, etc. are broken or don’t work properly. It also seemed very unclean. I find it ironic that there’s an exhibit here about microbes and bacteria yet they are lacking hand washing stations. The planetarium was the best part of the museum and you only get to pick one show to watch. It would have been nice just to go in and view the planetarium shows since the rest of the museum wasn’t worth our time.

title: Worth a visit
review: The memorial is located in an easily accessible part of town. It was smaller than I had imagined, but it was beautiful. The sculptures were well-detailed and very moving. Staff was very friendly. Definitely worh going

title: Holocaust Memorial
review: This is one of the most heart-rending memorials I've ever seen. At close range, one can see the people clinging to the arm and the tatooed numbers on their arms are visable. It brought tears to my eyes and is a must-see when visiting Miami Beach because we must never forget!

title: Moving reminder of horror
review: Love the quote from Anne Frank “then in spite of everything, I still believe tahr people are still really good at heart.”

title: Impressive
review: Overwhelming monument as a memorial for the 6M Jews that perished during the Holocaust. All these names ...

title: Powerful
review: Found this by accident and were very impressed. Combine with trip to Botanic Gardens. Hard to locate

title: The best beach
review: What I say simple the best time we stayed at the Washington park hotel so we had are own section of beach so we had are sun beds free all day  it's a amazing beach very clean a great place

title: After work
review: Nice, clean beach with every service. I don't think it is a gay beach. Personnel is very friendly and helpful.

title: Rainbow Beach
review: Like a lot of things ( Hotels, Bars ,Restaurants, Bookstores etc ) this Beach is very gay and lesbian friendly.There are also Special Gay and Lesbian Partys during the year

title: It's a beah
review: There is really nothing special about Miami beach,  it's a beach hanging on to the side of a huge city, fairly commercial with chairs and umbrellas for rent.  Crowd watching, however, is really interesting

title: Huge Beautiful Beach
review: Great expansive beach, so great that it seldom seems crowded.  Huge amounts of sand and sea, great for taking the sun and swimming.  Easy access from the city.

title: A good place to relax, exercise and unwind
review: If you like to play tennis, basketball, outdoors, swimming, or just want to chill, this place will be good for you, the tennis courts are fairly new (clay), basketball courts well kept, open areas, you can practice any sport you like, as all the facilities are there, you just need some water and refreshment, as summer if pretty humid, specially if you go before 5 pm.

title: Kids & Families Will Love This Park!
review: The park also has tennis courts, handball courts, basketball court, big dog and little dog fenced park, soccer and baseball field.  If nothing else a great place to sit under a tree to meditate or read a book.

title: Iconic Park
review: Just a great place to go for a game of baseball, basketball, tennis or simply running.  It is a beautifully landscaped urban retreat.

title: Best Park in Miami
review: Words can not describe this park. It is so beautiful that you will not believe it's a park. They have a swimming pool for a small fee with lifeguards on duty. Handball,Tennis and Basketball Courts are surrounded by beautiful palm trees and benches for sitting and enjoy the breeze. Let's not forget our four legged friends. Two dog parks are on the property with easy access to all of the action. I will come again and have some fun when I visit Miami.

title: Local
review: this park is for locals pretty much, it has everything basketball,tennis,soccer, and baseball field and also a swimming pool. very big and good place to spend time with your family or pets, there's also parks for the little kids to play at.

title: Cruise days are busy days
review: It is amazingly efficient given the number of people departing and arriving in a single day.

title: Nice ball park to visit
review: Parking was easy and the park is very clean and well laid out. The seats were pretty spacious and comfortable.

title: indoor baseball?
review: I went to 3 games 2 with the roof open at night and one day game with the roof closed.It's a nice park, I ubered to the game they have a drop off and a pick up area. I sat 3 different locations and felt all the sight lines were good. as in all sports parks these day, parking (you can do it online and save $4), food, drinks expensive

title: St. Louis/Marlins game
review: Very nice stadium.  Fans friendly.  Felt very safe, police had roads blocked for easy access to the stadium.  Nice and cool with the roof closed.

title: Not even worth the parking fee
review: There was the seemingly obligatory mirror image geometric painting in two colors and the painting of straight colored lines, both of which almost anyone could have painted. I think the artists on display had become famous somehow in the past, and now are able to create something facile and call it art. I thought this was a waste of time.  The parking lot is shared with the Frost Science Museum, a much better use of your time and money.

title: A facility in search of a collection
review: When I went back to the Wolfsohnian Museum on Miami Beach after the Pérez it was a relief to see their stellar collection of deco and modern work and it’s surehanded curating. Visit the Wolfsohnian instead.

title: Rainy Day event
review: Last minute plans changes and Museum  did not disappoint. The entire place is wonderful and engaging. A bit on the small side but great.

title: Avant-Garde Provocative Collections
review: I love this museum! If you enjoy modern provocative diverse art then the Perez calls your name! In addition they offer multimedia and visual sensory exhibitions such as short films and light shows. Also the exhibitions reflect the Miami community with Cuban, Haitian and South American influences!

title: World class museum
review: Do yourself a favor and GO to the Pérez Museum! Fantastic art! World class collection.  Fun and educational for children, teens and adults. This would also make a wonderful date. The restaurant is also delicious. I loved visiting and will come back!

title: Celebrated Our 30th Anniversary with a BANG
review: My husband and I celebrated 30th wedding anniversary at Lock and Load Miami and it was AMAZING!  L&LM was easy to find, parking was convenient and we were greeted with smiling faces.  We were both first time shooters, so we had no idea how it worked.  The manager assisted us right away, showed the packages, gave no pressure to buy or upgrade our packages and because it was a special occasions, we each also received a special add on to our packages.  I had the 007 package and my husband had the Special Forces Eastern Bloc package. Will was our instructor, he covered with detail all safety matters, proper handling, it was well balanced....not rushed or dragging on. . Will was ex-military, his knowledge and professionalism made us feel secure.  He gave us step by step instructions on how to load and fire and then we proceeded on our own. It was a JAW-DROPPING experience and an adventure we will never forget.

title: Amazing
review: This place is amazing and we loved every minute..bought a t shirt as well

title: Amazing experience
review: My instructor Fabian was very calm and focus the whole time and able to answer any questions while still having fun on the job, and the guns were great to shoot if your new to this like I was this is the place to start

title: What a experience!!!
review: We had absolutely blast with "scarface pack". Fabian was great and get us thru all guns history we were shooting. I highly recommend this place if you are visiting Miami. Thank you again Fabian.

title: interesting but somewhat amateurish
review: Interesting pieces and worth the visit, but the organization and layout needs some professional curating. Pieces are placed too high so it's hard to see and impossible to read the information cards. Organization is also somewhat confusing - by era, places, chronology, topics, media...

title: Bizzare
review: Not  worth the high price of admissions. Strange assortment of items. Most have to labels or explanations.

title: Different, but not worth $15 administration price
review: I doubt anyone these days is shocked by displays of erotic art. Whilst I see some cultural merit in the museum, the ticket price is too high. I recommend skipping World Erotic Art Museum.

title: Ehhh....
review: Not sure what I was expecting but this was probably not it. It definitely had a lot to see--rooms of it. Lots of artifacts and pictures and bizarre sex things. Some were very interesting and some I wasn't sure why they factored in the museum. It was all kind of hodge-podge in there and at times I felt like I was in an antique store or warehouse. It's worth a gander if you like erotica....but don't expect to learn a lot.

title: Good collection , but not worth the $20 admission
review: The ‘museum’ is a collection of articles. I was expecting more than just collected pieces. They should charge less for entrance.

title: J Lo Concert
review: A great night, wonderful show. She is a wonderful entertainer and the Arena was packed. But very organized, we had great seats smack in the middle..

title: A must for a basketball player!
review: This is a great place to visit if you're a basketball fan, especially for teenagers. Exciting! And if the weather is decent, you can walk there from the Bayside Marketplace.

title: Miami Heat Game, THE BEST!!!!!
review: The best basketball games in the world!!!! Flames, music, hosted by an enthusiastic and charismatic speaker, the best cheerleaders and choreographies ever, the public!!!! Amazing spectacular  We loved it!!!! The merchandising team was kind and lovely and we ended buying the Miami Heat art deco t-shirts for all of us!

title: Concert goer
review: Place was good and had tons of food stands. The only issue was parking so get there in time or Uber it and you will be fine.

title: Great Afternoon at the Frost Museum
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: A fantastic family outing on a rainy South Florida weekend. The price of admission is not too expensive and if you are a resident of Miami-Dade County, there's a cheaper add-on as well. We had a wonderful time with our children. The museum and aquarium are well worth it, and the IMAX theater had an excellent variety of films staggered throughout the day.

title: Scam. Expensive and not worth the money at all.
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: The aquarium is nice, and that's All. The entrance is $60 dollars and you get nothing out of it. There are 4 floors full of nonsense expositions so in the end if you want to pay $60 dollars to see an aquarium, go ahead and be happy. I expected MUCH more considering this exorbitant price. But... I guess it's Miami quality?

title: An architectural wonder but seriously lacking in visitor engagement and exhibit interpretation
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: I should preface this review with a disclosure that I grew up in Miami during the 1970s and 1980s, and so my review may be tinged by a sentimental attachment to the old Miami Museum of Science and Space Transit Planetarium. Notwithstanding my love for the old museum, its undeniable that the Frost is a world class facility and a major architectural upgrade. My teenage daughter and I had a pleasant enough time there, and we learned a couple of things about the earth's climate and materials science. It was also gratfiying to see the place full of young summer campers, scampering around and interacting with the hands-on exhibits. The Frost has done a good job of making its exhibits fun and accessible to the younger set. The aquarium, with its signature "Oculus"  is marvelous, and the view from the 6th floor observation deck is breathtaking (I'll have more to say about the observation deck in a minute). However, the experience overall left me feeling as if important elements of a world class science museum experience were missing. Namely, almost no staff were assigned to engage visitors and provide interpretation. During our three-hour visit, we were engaged by only one staff member who was tending to a species classification pop-up.  Over the course of three hours, I saw no other staff tending to pop-ups or otherwise providing any type of exhibit interpretation. Meanwhile, we were approached by two staff members trying to get us to take goofy photos for sale. This is not, in my opinion, an optimum use of human resources in a science museum. A second source of disappointment has to do with some of the programming that the old museum strove, in its modest way, to provide that the new museum does not. Namely, the old museum had a broader mandate to display exhibits on the cultural anthropology of South Florida and the peoples that inhabited the region. This is completely missing from the new museum. This gap is a missed opportunity to connect the new museum to the place it resides in and the indigenous people who inhabited the very spot the facility sits on. The gaps in science coverage at the Frost felt more and more glaring the longer I ambled through its four buildings. Zoology and evolutionary science, genomics, meteorology, geology, physics--where were they?  Even the tiny selection of planetarium shows was a disappointment. And perhaps here is were my sentimentality really weighs in. The old Museum of Science and Space Transit Planetarium was one of the leading US institutions in providing astronomy outreach to the public. We cannot bring back the great Jack Horkheimer, but there is no shortage of outstanding educators who could have been hired to restore the Frost's former glory days of astronomy outreach,  that is--if the facility had been equipped with an outreach observatory. As I walked the perimeter of the expansive 6th floor observation deck, surveying all the empty space up there and the broad horizons, I thought of what could have been. Downtown Miami may be as light polluted as you can get, but light pollution has no effect on views of the moon, the planets, and double stars. Even a modest outreach observatory--like the one the old museum had--would have been a great resource for the community and a fine opportunity for public engagement. Hopefully, the Frost's finances will allow for consideration of an observatory as a future add-on.

title: Amazing place!
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: The museum is awesome, super organized and staff is very kind and helpful. The kids loved it!!! It is definitely worth visiting the museum.

title: Frost Museum of Science
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Beautiful architecture, great facilities, super modern, planetarium, museum and aquarium. They have a very good staff, I enjoyed all four floors.

title: Very moving
review: We stumbled upon this memorial when we were wandering around looking for a supermarket and it happened to be on the way. It's very impressive and the area around it with all the sculptures of people in various situations were very poignant. The music playing on the way to the centre of the memorial really sets the scene/mood and it's very moving when you reach the scene inside. It's heat breaking to think what people went through and this memorial definitely gives you a good insight into that.

title: Nicely done
review: I noticed the sculpture from the road. It's a beautiful memorial. Nicely done to pay respect. Check it out

title: Spend Some Time Here
review: This is a very moving and beautiful sight. It is worth spending some time here, recollecting on the tragedy of the holocaust and the ability of humans to treat each other horribly. Excelelnt informative panels located outside.

title: Very impressive and very moving tribute
review: A very impressive and incredibly poignant tribute to the 6 million Jews who lost their lives in WWII. Make sure you actually go inside, and read all the story boards and see the figures at the bottom of the main sculpture. Everyone should come here to be reminded of the lessons from the past.

title: Not to be forgotten
review: It’s absolutely fantastic and really moving. It’s stark and a real reminder of the horrific tragedy that occurred.

title: Lovely Beach!
review: Great view, very clean for an urban beach. The bathroom is nearby - but the one at the Starbucks is closer. Buy something and get the code of the day. Lots of gulls - and they can be aggressive.

title: Beautiful Stretch Of Beach
review: We found this stretch of beach close to our hotel to be perfectly located with lots of places nearby to eat and drink!

title: Gay Beach
review: The best spot for gay and friendly people!!! Very relaxing, nice person, nice atmosphere for a perfect day on the beach close to someone like you.

title: Nice beach with lifeguard station
review: Water was too cold for me to go in (Feb). Many others went in.Nice beach with facilities. No seaweed on this visit.

title: Predominantly Gay Area of South Beach
review: A lovely section of south Beach where the gay men tend to congregate so predominantly males.  Here and the beach sections either side are where you are more likely to encounter the "racier" swimwear of both male and female.  It is a popular section so can get quite busy even on a weekday.

title: Falmingo Park
review: It is a very good park to go to. It has its own public pool. It is one of the parks North of Fifth Street in South Beach.

title: Swimming, workout and tennis
review: Numerous activities to choose from...quite a few tennis courts, large swimming pool and an area dedicated to working out.  Worth visiting!

title: Tennis
review: We played Tennis here on three days, the staff were friendly and helpful . The courts are well maintained and they have a knock up wall.

title: Park ?
review: Skip it. Lots of construction going on around it too

title: Flamingo Park
review: This is a great recration area. With a nice park, water park, playground for kids and tennis. The bathroom facilities at the water park could need some refurbishment. But the small kids loved it. Easy to park just nearby.

title: Art Deco.
review: Worth visiting.

title: Ken
review: We inquired about bus tour information on Wednesday Feb 20 and Beverly provided us with everything we needed. A very friendly and informative visit

title: Surprising South Beach find--best deal in town!
review: Tip: I would recommend you pay the $5 museum entrance fee. There is a nice, indoor, restroom only available to museum clients.

title: MUST BE YOUR 1ST STOP WHEN YOU ARRIVE
review: Well ... maybe not your first stop, since you'll likely need to check-in your hotel first.  Your second stop, however, upon arriving in South Beach certainly should be the Art Deco Welcome Center!  If you are as lucky as my wife and I were when we visited the Art Deco Welcome Center (yes, it was our second stop), Danielle will be working at the information desk.  She is worth her weight in gold.  A vast library of useful information, Danielle gave us a fantastic "lay of the land," recommending excellent restaurants, tours, stores, and transportation options, as well as a explanation of how the various neighborhoods comprising South Beach are laid out.  While visiting South Beach, make stopping by the Art Deco Welcome Center a very early, high priority on your to-do list.  It is well worth the time and please tell Danielle "Hello" for us!

title: Easy access from Beach and friendly staff
review: Enthusiastic staffers are great at sharing tour ideas and providing directions. Regualr tours start at this local. There's a gift shop and drinks available for purchase too.

title: The best one
review: One of the most busy US ports. Miami is a capital of cruising industry and the port of Miami is one of the most efficient one I’ve seen. On some days as many as 52 thousands guests go through the port embarking/disembarking their vacation. The traffic can get a little rough between 10 and 1pm, but everybody working very fast and efficient

title: ⚾️ MARLIN’S WIN⚾️⚾️⚾️
review: Great family fun and good bang for our buck that night.

title: Great Hangout Spot!
review: I love the way that they updated the food service and seating/standing areas. Fans deserve to have such options.

title: Ballpark tour
review: It was Nicaraguan hertitage night when we went to Marlins Park. It made for a great atmosphere and the game was  great (4-3 win over the Pirates). The firework show at the end of the game was great! The Grand Finale is by far the best I've seen at any firework show at any ballpark/event. Visit the bobblehead museum! Concessions weren't all that great, but being in Little Havana, you can definitely find some great food surrounding the stadium. This is not a knock on  the stadium, but Uber and Lyft have got to get better drivers to pick you up after the game. So many frustrated people who kept getting their rides cancelled after minutes of waiting. Drivers could not seem to understand where to pick up their riders. Just a heads up if you're using those companies. There isn't a bad seat in this stadium so sit wherever and enjoy a pretty personal stadium.

title: Cool MLB Park
review: Went on a Cuban Heritage night.  The ticket prices were very reasonable compared to some other parks.  The sightlines were great from our seats.  The stadim itself is quite an amazing piece of architecture compared to our home park (Rogers Centre).  Overall, a great Friday night out!

title: With My Girl
review: This museum it is so beautiful, modern, complete and impeccable. Their staff are very attentive and willing to give you all the information and indications you need. They are very organized and most of them are bilingual. They have variety of exhibitions and they offer tours to get more information on them. PAMM is good for all ages and when I went they even had a school field trip.  This museum also has a restaurant which I can't wait to go to. On Thursdays night they have happy hours with DJ. See you soon on a Thursday PAMM!!!

title: Your overall appreciation level may depend on special exhibit on view
review: Archtecturally interesting museum with a nice natural setting & gardens, near people mover.  Pleasant place to relax in and of itself.  I thoughly enjoyed the vist, but much of that may have been the Beatriz Gonzalez retrospective.  Not just her art but the history & politics behind it.  There are other rotating exhibits; one almost feels the permenant collection must be small - until you read otherwise.  This is not a showstopper museum where you get lost for several hours, but you do (again perhaps depending on what's on offer) leave satisfied after perhaps 2 hours.

title: Excellent architecture and some nice art work
review: Finally Miami gets more interesting for museum lovers!

title: Art museum in bay front park
review: To me the museum is to modern. After visiting other great museums around the world this one rates at the lower end for my taste.  However,  there is a day out of the month that admission is free. If you happen to be in Miami I believe it's the first or last Thursday of the month. You can visit for free and make your own judgment.  I prefer the frost  museum of science next to this one. With a planetarium.  The museum is on the water with great view of the port of Miami and its cruise ships. There is also a cafe with out side sitting over looking the water live entertainment on weekends at night.

title: Pleasant visit (but a bit expensive)
review: Enjoyed the exhibits here, but found it to be expensive for the two hours time spent.  We had lunch at the cafe outdoors, which was pleasant but also very pricey for the quality of food.

title: Awesome Experience!!!
review: Had a Team Building event here and everyone loved it. Brian and Will took their time to explain everything in detail. Have to check out the museum as well!

title: Went in on a whim and thoroughly enjoyed it
review: The little museum is interesting in itself, but once you've looked around, you kinda want to try the firearms. We did the cheapest package, which is still $100+ each, but worth it if you've never done anything like this before. It's a truly unique experience and it all felt very safe. I was a little nervous, but was put at ease by Fabian, who talked us through everything, guided us and was generally super helpful and friendly throughout. We got to keep our targets too and a got little something extra, which I'll leave as a surprise. Really great experience, would definitely recommend.

title: Looking for something to do?
review: The Hamel’s from Maine.

title: Great resource and gift shop
review: This is a great place to find out more about the history of Art Deco conservation and revival in South Miami Beach. They organize tours and you can buy a nice map with self-guided tour. Great gift shop. Only downside, no tours on Thansgiving day.

title: Enjoyed it!
review: Enjoyed talking to Beverly about tours and places of interests.  She saved us time and money with her recommendations.

title: Soooo Helpful!!
review: Also it is important to check out these kinds of centres in places you visit since often Google and Travel Books will not offer the full details that an actual person living in an area can tell you.

title: a must-do: art deco area
review: This was a very good experience to discover an interesting area. Audioguides provide a good overview of technics and hotels which survive since 1920

title: Great place, recommended!
review: Great service! Awesome place with amazing guns! Good help with both picking the weapons and shooting with them

title: Adrenalin rush to make your heart beat
review: Really worth a stop if your in the area!

title: Clumsy Display of Kitschy, Tasteless Objects
review: I feel I must state that in no way would I consider myself a prude, nor and I rating this place badly because I was somehow shocked or offended. However, I had high expectations when we paid $18 to enter that simply were not met. There is no rhyme or reason for where objects are placed. Sometimes the museum tried to place them based on type of medium, or culture, or time period, but overall it made very little curatorial sense. There were hardly any signs about anything so in general I had no idea what anything was. There were far too many objects on display leading to a cultured warehouse look, and the museum itself had a terrible flow of rooms with dingy lighting (if the lights were even working at all). Furthermore, while there were some excellent examples of art, including works by Rembrandt and relics from Ancient Greece, many pieces were tacky pieces of Kitsch that honestly have very little business calling themselves art. Other museums do a much better job of telling the story of Erotica in Art, so this one can definitely be skipped.

title: Education
review: The only thing i missed was that sometimes there was no information at all about some of the art. Overall it was a fun experience and really interesting

title: Checked off my bucket list
review: So, we arrived about 30 minutes before closing.  It is a musty building.  There was no one else there.  An interesting museum :-)  When we came downstairs the staff had already left and the lights were off -- weird

title: A tasteless waste of time and money
review: Total waste of my time and money.  I don’t know what I was expecting, but it was all pretty dumb.  IMO nothing in this museum was sexy or erotic.  Just brash in-your-face full nudity mixed with strangeness.  Maybe that’s your thing.  If so, go.  But most of it’s pretty weird.  Regardless, $20 per person is WAY too much for what you get here.  I totally agree with the other reviewer that I am nowhere near a prude, but the stuff is all pretty tasteless.  Many things aren’t “art” at all.

title: Bachelorette Trip!
review: Myself and a group of 4 other ladies visited the muesuem maybe with our hopes up way too high. The gentlemen at the front desk that sold the tickets was really nice and welcoming. The enterance fee was $20 USD, you then have the option of going up the stairs or elevator to where the muesuem begins. We started off walking from exhibit to exihibit and there were mostly very old school erotica pictures. There were some erotic statues and pieces but not as many as they made it out to be. It’s definitely an experience, but I wouldn’t pay $20 for this muesuem at all.

title: Huge and beautiful landmark!
review: Went to check out the American Airlines arena at evening. It was already dark and the arena was lighten up. It looked amazing. Really loved it's design and some architectural solutions. Well done Miami!

title: LOVED IT!
review: This may not be fair, but I love going and watching the Heat. A basketball game can be just the pick me up you need to continue enjoying the energy of Miami.

title: NBA GAME
review: Try to reconcile your trip to Miami with a game day.

title: Visit for a Miami Heat game. It's awesome!
review: The food is not healthy and a bit pricey. I would recommend eating before you get to the game and just go for beer and popcorn while there.

title: One of the earliest museums.
review: no matter how many times you visit. Different take away each time. Very poignant, heart wrenching, but a Must See of iconic history. All True!!!

title: Simply a Must!
review: If you've got an hour to spare head here, shell out $5 and learn a lot.  We enjoyed the small museum and accompanying gift shop.  It really opened our eyes to the different styles of architecture we were taking for granted before.  Miami Beach has done a great job of differentiating itself from so many other places by preserving lots from this period.  Highly recommend!

title: Art Deco Guided Tour
review: We found The Art Deco Preservation League on Ocean Drive very easily. They provided all of the information that we needed to join a very informative and entertaining tour that wove history and culture through architecture; this in large due to the guidance of long time resident Julie. Happily the admission includes the Museum and Gift Shop and goes to pay for the work of MDPL.

title: Walking art deco tour
review: Great walking tour with Julie. Highly knowledgeable and able to adjust tour when rain started. Definitely recommend.

title: A very good point of call if in Miami
review: These people are passionate about their city, and rightly so.  They offer advice, information and plenty of good ideas about the art deco side of Miami.  The admission price is very reasonable for the tour, which also includes the museum.  You are treated to local knowledge and history.  The gift shop is extremely good and there is no pressure to buy.  Well worth a visit.

title: planning our days
review: friendly staff lots of information about different things to see or do while vacationing in the area. has a gift shop next door.

title: Incredibly moving
review: Have visited many holocaust museums and memorials, in Israel, Amsterdam, Berlin etc and they are all different. This one doesn’t leave much to the imagination. It’s quite brutal, but meantime very moving and atmospheric. It’s beautifully laid out in a nice setting, and gives you time to process as you walk through. I would say an unmissable stop in a visit to Miami

title: Impressive!
review: A nice, quiet place to contemplate and remember the holocaust. Statues are very impressive. I’m glad I’ve paid a visit.

title: A Moving Experience
review: A small, yet moving memorial to the holocaust. Located just a couple of blocks north of Lincoln Road and by the Convention Center. Incredibly torturous statues surround the main sculpture of a huge arm with its hand reaching for the sky as hundreds of bodies cling to it in agony. The wall surrounding is filled with thousands of names, as well as many photos and writing in the circular plant covered walkway. The tunnel that leads to the main central area is very moving. I've visited holocaust memorials and museums in Berlin, Amsterdam and Paris; while some might be larger, this one is special on its own. Visit if you're anywhere near if only for a few minutes.

title: Such a touching display!!
review: I went to see this, not knowing too much about the memorial itself. I’ve always known about the Holocaust but to see this memorial up close and learn in detail about what these families had went through and the millions of lives lost, their names written on the walls, made it such an overwhelming experience.....one I won’t soon forget!! If you have a chance, stop by and see for yourself!

title: What a waste of time and money
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: I’m guessing they got rid of the old Museum because it was in that valuable south of Brickell area and no doubt it will soon be shops restaurants and more condominiums - what a pity.

title: Miami vacay
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: My family and I had a great time at the Museum. There was a wealth of knowledge to take in for every member of the family. My daughter enjoyed building the avatar and planet planetarium.A must visit when traveling with your kids in Miami. Was definitely worth it.

title: What a great place to visit an excellent Science Museum in USA without having to travel to Washington , DC
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Having lived in the Washington area for many years, I am used to great museums (and free). We took 4 grand-kids (ages 8-18; 2 of them from Washington, DC) to the museum to show them around Miami. What a great place to visit! This is a first class institution and very nicely designed to enjoy the great exhibits and show and in an excellent architectural-worthy building. For those living in or visiting the Miami area, this Science Museum is excellent and a great way to spend a few hours without having to travel to Washington, DC. Highly recommended. The views of the exciting Miami downtown architecture and the Miami Beach skyline and bay views are also worth spending some time while visiting

title: Fun for kids!
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: It has a planetarium, aquarium and interactive displays for little kids. But not much exhibits for older kids so my son got bored quickly. He only enjoyed the aquarium and the view on the 4th floor.

title: Field trip with the grandkids!
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: My husband and I took our two grand daughters to the Frost Museum and we all had a terrific time. The girls (6) and (3) loved the interactive attractions throughout the museum, they enjoyed seeing the live animals like birds, alligators, snakes, turtles, sharks, beautiful aquariums filled with colorful fish. They got to touch sting rays, sea urchins and starfish. They loved the area of building bridges and buildings. They loved playing with the water exhibits and didn't want to leave the lighted musical dance floor. Our day was filled with laughter and fun and we even learned some lessons along the way. I would definitely recommend this museum for children under the age of 12. I bought the annual membership!

title: Enjoyment!
review: This was by far the best scenic view I ever experienced.  The ocean was perfect and the amenities were right at my fingertips.

title: The 12th Street Beach is very beautiful.
review: The 12th Street Beach was very scenic and we had a marvelous day with the family. If you walk 1 block down to 11th street- it is a side street between Collins and Washington Ave- you go to a local liquor store "Tuto's Liquors" at 211 11th Street on Miami Beach and be able to buy sodas/waters, wine coolers, beers, rum, tequila, or other and meet some real friendly locals. We bought liquor and sodas and the prices were very good and affordable. The onderful beach, some drinks, and a beautiful day.. what else is needed.

title: Some Practical Tour Info
review: The tour is great if you want to learn about the Art Deco period. But, I’ll let the other folks tell you about the tour. Here is some practical information. The welcome Center is located at 10th and Ocean Drive. Parking on the street is random and hard to find, though there may be easier parking on Washington. Nothing is free, you will pay a general meter wherever you park and put the ticket on your dash. There are good parking garages around but I suggest you Google search your options ahead of time. I parked at Washington and 7th for $4 for 5.5 hours. The tour costs $25 and includes the Art Deco Museum.....there are senior (age 65+ and children rates). The museum is not much to get excited about but it gives you something to do while you wait for the 10:30 AM departure. Plus, the clean bathrooms are a bonus. They are prompt so give yourself time, 10:30 comes and they are off! No announcement is made in the museum, just the small lobby. The walk is 90 minutes almost completely outdoors, a mile walking and no place to sit. If you have problems walking, not only is this tour not for you, but seeing anything in South Beach isn’t for you. You must walk everywhere. It will get hot, bring water and be thankful this tour is in the morning. There will be a couple stops where you do get inside and it’s a little cooler.  Guides expect (oh I mean they say they accept) tips. They are volunteers, $5 per family is fine if you choose to tip. Stop into the gift shop before you leave. Some unusual items for sale.

title: Excellent advice for using limited time...Ask for Beverly!
review: Hope this helps!

title: A wonderful resource
review: The people who work here are knowledgeable and very helpful and welcoming.  Basically, you have three choices for a tour of the fabulous Art Deco buildings of South Beach:  on your own with a printed guide, an audio tour, or a guided tour.   I wish we could’ve done the latter, but our rushed schedule did not permit.  Instead we chose the audio guide.  Again we were very rushed, only having about 45 minutes for a tour that should be an hour and a half or so; there were bunch of buildings we didn’t have time to go into, etc.   I really regret this, and would do it differently if I had the chance, as for me, the Art Deco buildings are one of the two things I absolutely wanted to see in Miami (the other being Vizcaya).   There’s a great deal to learn about the various design styles.  The hotels and other buildings — there’s even a post office! — are fabulous and beautifully preserved, thanks to a groups of locals such as the Miami Design Preservation League who’ve worked hard to see that they’re maintained.  This is an absolutely unique area which is well worth your while to visit!

title: Excellent First Class Service
review: Thank you Beverly for a first class, professional service.

title: Ocean Drive, Miami Beach
review: Very convenient location. The visitor information centre is located on Ocean Drive opposite 10th Street. The building is very nice. They have some good information. However, the service was lacklustre. Unusual for a visitor information centre.

title: One of the most beautiful beaches in the US
review: What more could you want?

title: Not sure why this gets separate recognition.....
review: It is basically same old, same old all the way down the beach fronting Lummus Beach Park and Beach.... the sand is the same, the degree of the water being not-that-inviting does not change till you get to South Pointe Park...  and viewed from space, you wouldn't be able to find it.

title: local gem !
review: Love this location because it is kind of a locals gem, or so I would like to think so. there is not that much tourist around and there is always space to choose where you want to lay and enjoy the sun and beach

title: The Best
review: Any type of ball can be played at the Park. Fantastic location, safe and secure. Grew up 2 blocks from the Park. Love it.

title: where is the flamingos??
review: Totally disappointed, just courts, basket, tennis, soccer, baseball..But I just wanted to watch some flamingos..

title: Nice place for everyone
review: We ventured off the strip and on our way back found this park. They have plenty to do for a kid plus basketball courts, tennis courts, and bars to work out. Pretty big.

title: Warm wanderings in Flamingo Park
review: walk the loop and back.

title: LOVELY FRIENDLY PARK
review: This park has a long wonderful history. It is the place where all the kids would meet,ride their bikes, swim, take tennis lessons, play football and just hang out. It did not matter what color or religion you were everyone played together. Today it is still a wonderful place to hang out and relax. The grounds are lovely and it is in the heart of south beach. If you want to stroll it is a wonderful place to just relax

title: Great advice and amazing tours.
review: We strolled down the beautiful waterfront and stumbled across the beautiful Art Deco Welcome Centre. On entering we were met by the wonderful Betsy whom had an amazing amount of knowledge about the local area and gave us some amazing tips on places to go and things to see. It really made our holiday much more enjoyable. The tour is also amazing and ideal for those whom love Art Deco design and architecture.

title: Very helpful ladies :)
review: Thank you very much to all 3 workers we met when we went to the visitor center. Thanks for the information, explanations and phone calls! You helped us in our trip in Florida :)

title: Small, but interesting.
review: You want to see this and purchase the tickets along with the walking tour.  Helping educate about this area makes it well worth the price.

title: Go there, you won't regret it
review: If you have the chance to chat with Betsy, use it. She has lots of knowledge on the place :)

title: Informative
review: Good location and had plenty of information of attractions / art deco buildings in the surrounding area.

title: Really friendly and helpful staff
review: This was the meeting point for the art deco tour. The tour was very informative and great fun. The guide really enjoyed his job. Definitely worth taking.

title: Stop Here First
review: This is a must for new visitors to South Beach. Beverly gave us recommendations that made this a vacation to remember. Stop here first and save yourself money and a lot of guesswork. This is a real Welcome Center with suggestions about tours, transporttion, and how to get the most out of your South Beach vacation.

title: Great Information and Funky Shop
review: Stumbled upon this location while walking Ocean Drive. Picked up lots of great pamphlets and browsed through the shop. Definitely a must do when you arrive in South Beach. Very friendly and helpful staff.

title: Head right here.
review: Your walking tour ticket includes admission to their offbeat but interesting Art Deco museum. Without the ticket, you can still take advantage of the restrooms, purchase bottled water and get general tourist info.

title: So much knowledge!
review: A good starting point for your visit to South Beach.

title: Why Are They Yelling At Me?
review: Just drove up to Terminal B. While driving up to unload out luggage five different porters were yelling five different directions. And believe me on this - they don’t move your luggage to the ship till they receive their tip! Unpleasant way to start a cruise

title: Horrid Location
review: I am not questing the stadium itself but when the Marlins use to play Pro Player stadium there were a lot more fans. Example the St Louis Cardinals triple A in Jupiter sells more tickets than the Marlins. They made a huge mistake moving the team all the way down in Miami because the majority of the paying ticket holders were from Palm Beach County so put on an extra 30 minutes of driving. They should of moved the stadium closer north than south like in Pompano Beach. Yet who wants drive from WPB or Delray just to go to a bad part of Miami just to watch the Marlins? It's the location not the stadium. Move the stadium further north and your fan base will grow

title: GREAT Venue but Food/Beverages are EXPENSIVE
review: The stadium is really fabulous.  Can't imagine there's a bad seat!  You can also walk around the entire stadium (360 degrees) on Level 1. Beware though, hot dogs are $8, can of beer is $12.

title: Dirtiest Bathrooms on Earth
review: The stadium is great, we had a great time watching the Marlins win. But... THE BATHROOMS WERE EXTREMELY DIRTY! Toilets did not flush, at least they did have water and soap to wash our hands.

title: Great Stadium
review: The stadium was really nice.  It was clean.  Ticket prices were very reasonable!  Food was a bit pricey.  Parking was easy, finding our way back to the highway not as easy. Too bad there is not a bigger fan base to support the team.

title: Marlins Park
review: The fans are very enthusiastic and the park was great, it is too bad more of Maimi doesn't support the team. We had a great time, appreciated the dome due to the heat and loved the fact the ceiling was grey and not white, like in Tampa, as the ball is lost in the white ceiling. We really enjoyed the game and the crowd and don't understand why baseball isn't supported by the locals more.

title: Good option to go with kids
review: This is one of the museums that you can visit for free taking advantage of the museum program that have the libraries at Miami Dade. The place is beautiful, attractive and you can enjoy a great view of Miami. You can make it in two hours. I could not see any presentation in the theatre. We had a table in the restaurant for lunch but we left after waiting for ten minutes and nobody paid attention to us. The parking is expensive but you can park in a public parking close to Biscayne Boulevard and walk. There is an special event for kids one Saturday a month.

title: Art and a view...
review: Miami's premier art space.  Not an impressive permanent collection but some great temporary exhibits and one of the best views of the intracoastal waterway.  The building itself is a beautiful work of architecture.  Do not miss the café area and relax just watching the downtown skyline and the cruise ships.

title: Very nice museum, right by the bay
review: You have to take in the whole building and property as a whole, not just the art inside. The gardens and sculptures outside the building are impressive and make some very nice photo ops right by the bay. Inside you will see some very impressive and not so impressive art. Frankly I probably wouldn't hang 90% of the pieces in my home but still very fun to look at and figure out "why is this in a museum??". Take your time and watch the films also. Afterwards enjoy a nice meal in the restaurant under the "hanging gardens", very good food!!

title: Free museum Saturday 2nd
review: The museum is free only Saturday 2nd of each month. It’s an opportunity to discover this ! Guided visit are available at different hours. It’s possible to walk around the museum alone if you want. Caution, the museum don’t accept big bag and camera (only smartphone!)

title: Going Back in Time
review: A fascinating exhibition of furniture, stories, clothing and history of the area. Some interesting recollections. A pity the video wasn't working.

title: Guided walking tour! A Must Do!
review: Thank you, Preservation League, and thank you, Paula!  Bravo!

title: A TOTAL MUST ON OCEAN DR
review: This has to be the best ever gift shop and vintage store .... everything south beach and Art Deco is here. It is at the visitors centre on ocean dr. You can spend a good hour wandering through the store and looking at all the retro items and new items they offer. I bought a fantastic poster to frame and a fantastic sun hat both very reasonably priced. $12 & $34 respectively. The beautiful young lady helping us was Karen. Thanks Karen for your help, cheerful disposition and charming smile. It was so much fun visiting here on our self guided walking tour of the Art Deco district.

title: An absolute must!
review: Great staff, super helpful and extrememly knowledgable. Next time would hop on a guided tour.

title: Tour de force
review: We took a very good 90 minute tour of the Art Deco area, preceeded by a few minutes at the exhibition in the Center and followed by a shrt visit to the excellent tourist shop the next morning.

title: Amazing fun!!!
review: Fabian was a fantastic ranger that made my birthday even better!  The entire team could not have been nicer. I highly recommend firing of the AMERICA package of machine guns. It will make your heart rate go up with joy!!!

title: Guns!
review: Super fun shooting the older guns!  Brian was very knowledgeable and friendly.  I have never seen such a wide collection of guns!

title: Have a fun and great Experience
review: Thank you Lock &  Museum

title: Fun, but overpriced!
review: All in all a fun experience if you have some cash to burn!.

title: Arguably the best of my trip
review: Such a fun experience. @Fabian was such a pro and nice guy. He even told me the stories behind each gun. Loved it

title: Excelent! Beautiful pictures and sculptures
review: I separate one hour for the tour but I end up staying more cause there are so many interesting stuff from all over the world. I did the tour from room to room and at the end I came back to look once again for the one´s I like the most.

title: A Unique Experience Like No Other! (Have an open mind)
review: This is an experience indeed and one we will enjoy over and over.

title: Quite disturbing
review: My friends really wanted to visit this place. It is definitely something different, but I didn't like it too much. You should go here when you are very open-minded and want to experience something new. The statues and paintings are very interesting, but to me some of them were quite disturbing as well. Not my cup of tea and in my opinion overpriced for what you get to see.

title: A bit small
review: The collection is good. But, I found the one floor of exhibits to be rather limited. It is nicely arranged and well done. The price is high for the limited items on display.

title: Erotic, humorous, and intriguing
review: This museum has many different types of artwork that you wouldn't normally find in a museum. As others have posted, keep an open mind. There are many artistic portrayals of the human body in numerous positions. My only complaint is that it feels like it could be laid out better. It doesn't flow well as you are walking through it.

title: Highlight of our holiday
review: They could just do with a bigger merchandise store.

title: Art Deco at its finest!
review: It's truly Miami! How could you NOT want to do this tour and meet people in the process?! Art Deco is simply fabulous and you need to partake in it as you wander around Miami Beach and absorb the colors, the architecture and the grandeur of these amazing buildings and sites! The people are amazing and so helpful and its a great way to see the City!

title: Good place for an unusual gift
review: The welcome center is both a small exhibit space and a shop. The shop specializes in Miami Beach memorabilia and art deco themed stuff.  Prices are pretty mixed.

title: Lovely self guided tour
review: It was super hot (98° F) and we were on scooters, yet managed to have fun. Plan for August sun if walking in the day time.

title: Good local info'
review: My wife likes Art Deco architecture so this was a must-do. The displays and posters are well arranged and the docent was friendly and informative. She and my wife had a good conversation about places to dance in Miami too! If you want to know why Ocean Drive looks as it does, a visit to this Center is worth it.

title: Excellent!
review: Paid 20$ and was the only one who came. So my self guided tour transformed into personal tour. Rick was very good guide. Showed a lot of interesting places not only on Ocean drive, but also on Collins avenue. Highly recommend this tours to everyone who is interested in Art deco, history of Miami beach and architecture

title: Miami Heat basket ball arena
review: The team is not so great but seems to at last have a young and interesting team . We were spoiled with the Lebaron Wade Bosh years . The place to bring your touriste friends

title: They have a huge Miami heat shop on site.
review: Wasn't a game day when we were there but the staff allowed were friendly. Located near downtown and easily accessible by the city trams.

title: Full of life
review: One of the “must see” areas in Miami , a place full fun and young people. Offer a wide variety of options. Nice even to stay out and chat with your friends, meeting new people after a sport competition. Nice experience for those who love to chat talking about sport and other activities. Highly recommend. Nice stuff members also active and available for any questions.

title: Enchanting and terrifyingly beautiful
review: I think the most terrifying part was when we walked behind it and the music that was playing, the lighting used for the images below the monument, combined it scared us and we didn't even go under it. now I laugh but at this moment I was saying to myself "they did a very good job at making this place feel like a memorial, a cemetery and for all it stands for".

title: It's a hidden gem
review: This is a beautiful hidden gem but very sad. It might be overwhelming for those impacted by the past.

title: Amazing
review: I have visited this memorial many times and can say that it is well done. The sculptures are amazing, the music playing when walking down the hallway into where the hand is, it’s very emotional. It is a great place to take your kids and learn about the Holocaust. Also it’s free!

title: Clickbain in real life
review: This is not a holocaust memorial, this is a hebrew memorial, and should be called like that. There was no mention of any other victims races / religions / beliefs / orientations. Double standards much?

title: Chance encounter
review: Came across this by accident and so glad I went in for a look. This is a truly beautiful place and so moving. I found it very peaceful but seeing all these names almost had me in tears. The sculptures are wonderful too and add to the poignancy . A fitting tribute to the millions who paid the ultimate price.

title: Nice experience
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Very good museum with great animals! The price to enter the museum $29.00 for adults which also includes free admission to a cool show. If you like aquariums you should definitely visit.

title: So Dissapointing!
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: We took a group of school chilren from West Palm Beach to the museum on July 25, 2019. Our group was so dissapointed in the whole museum. The "hand-on" activities were either broken or didn't work properly. The aquarium was so poorly lit that we couldn't see more than 15 feet and the water looked murky, nothing like the billboards and advertisments. They have all small unimpressive animals. Then because of bad weather the kids couldn't do any of the rooftop activities, like pet the stinkrays. This is South Florida! Why would you make outdoor activities based on weather. Also, most of the lunch seating is outside and since it was pouring, well you get the picture. We were very unhappy with our visit. It was just not you would expect from a museum with this kind of adversting in the middle of downtown Miami.

title: Surprised by the science museum in miami -
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: I think the only one missing is a restaurant in the building where u can rest. :) this way u can be fresh for saving more information and not getting tired to much.

title: interesting fun visit
review: be nice. Went nuts at gift shop next door great assortment of Art Deco items.

title: 'Feeling Ignored at the Welcome Center'
review: Wow, if these folks are the 'Welcome Ambassadors' for Miami Beach, just pass on by. Two employees and not a peep. Minimal literature and absolutely no energy from the staff. If this is what it is like on a Tuesday at 3 PM, I can only speculate what it is like on a Friday at 3 PM. There is some sort of exhibit that they want you to pay $5.00 to enter but, given what we experienced in that building, we took a pass. I would suggest that you dedicate your time to something that might actually be interesting or beneficial in ANY  way.

title: Creative accessories and materials
review: I always find something to buy here. There are creative, interesting designed mousepads to necklaces, silk scarves to paintings....

title: Small but charming
review: The museum is both educational and pleasurable venue. Wish I had more time to explore it more and read all the information. We also took a walk-in tour.

title: Art Deco Walking Tour
review: Recently undertook an evening 90 minute walking tour around the Art Deco area of Miami. Our guide was Rick, and he was amazing- very enthusiastic, a bit irreverent- loved that, and his passion for and knowledge of the architecture and area was catching! We loved it. We were in a group of mainly older people some of whom had trouble keeping up and one of who kept asking for restaurant recommendations - Rick managed it all superbly- would do it again in a heartbeat if we return to Miami Beach.

title: Whole family loved it here.
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: 5 of us including kids aged 6, 9, and 17 loved it here. We spent about 3 hours, but we wished we could stay bit longer. We arrived little after 10am on Monday and it was not crowded.

title: Science in Miami !
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: The 3 Level Aquarium is so unique compared to other aquariums - since the underneath view is so different than other aquariums.  Our son spent a good amount of time just admiring the many types of fish.  The Exhibits feature South Florida Nature at its best.  The Planetaruim is great for all ages...come and enjoy and family day with a bonus of great coastal and city views from the 4th Floor!

title: It's a beach
review: What can you say?  Sand, water, it's a beach.  Price gouging chair and umbrella prices plus snacks.  The beach guy was very friendly and helpful though.

title: Beautiful big, wide ocean beach
review: We were walking the length of South Beach from about 1st  to about 15th.   On the way north , we decided to walk barefoot along the water edge and enjoy the ocean waves and water,   The beach  was lovely, wide and spacious.   It was also fairly clean.   The old fashioned life guard station made an interesting photo op with the Miami Beach higher hotels in the background.   There were nice shower water stations to wash the sand off ones feet before going back onto the Ocean Drive.

title: Gay Beach in the art deco district
review: If you need you can rent towels, lying chairs and umbrella.

title: Majority alternative lifestyle
review: If you are not offended with alternative lifestyle this part of the whole beautiful south beach area seems to attract that lifestyle more than other parts of the beach.  There is a beautiful hotel, "The Tides" that looks over this are and has telescopes in most of the oceanfront rooms.  We enjoyed ourselves while there.

title: Wide & flat beach
review: What a wonderful stretch of flat sandy beach. Great area and really close to most of the hotels. Recommended.

title: Flamingo overload
review: What a treat. Take the tram around the park and the drivers commentary is excellent. After the tram ride take a walk through the park where you will see Peacocks and other birds roaming free. The highlight was the flamingo enclosure where they come right up to the fence to greet you. Incredible. There are all manner of birds and animals. The food is really good on site but beware of the pesky birds who like to steal your food. A must do attraction.

title: Pleasant afternoon
review: It's a lovely place to while away the hours. I like the fact that it's a rescue centre. You can see many different birds. We were chased and screamed at by a peacock as we stupidly took a picture and the flash went off. The otters were in their element using their slide and diving into the water. The bear was asleep and the panther only came to the glass when she heard the sound of children which was bizarre.

title: Flamingo park is a good place to spend time.
review: Flamingo park has lots of fun things to do: there is a pool, tennis courts, racquet ball areas, basketball court, baseball field, a running track, and a children's playground which has slides, tunnels, rock climbing, etc. We sat on the bench while the children ran around and played. there was a breeze and plenty of shade to enjoy a soda while we discuss where to go for lunch. The children had so much fun at Flamingo Park that we spent 3 hours and did not even notice the time go by.

title: NO FLAMINGOS!
review: Wonderful sports park,; tennis Go on line for schedule),tournaments, baseball, walking. I remember when the beautiful trees were small. See the rich and famous.Serina and sister practiced here in their beginning. Se the forthcoming players.

title: No, there are no flamingos here...
review: A great outdoor arena for running, playing tennis and swimming. If you’re visiting, you can rent rackets at the center.

title: The best tourist information in town
review: The best tourist information in town. Fantastic visitor centre right in heart of Ocean Drive. Lovely exhibitions on art deco Miami and home to the brilliant art deco walking tours. Excellent and really well informed residents as staff who also advise on other where to go, what to do, trips and sell tickets - we got our Big Bus tickets here. Also has a very cool shop which is probably (and sadly) the last place standing in this part of South Beach to buy an interesting card or imaginative souvenir.

title: Art Deco welcome center
review: Betsy was super helpful and so friendly! She helped answer our questions about what to do while visiting and even suggested her local faves!

title: Lots to see and buy
review: They also do tours of the Art Deco District

title: Very helpful!
review: Staff was very helpful and professional! I only had a few hours to spend in Miami Beach and they mapped out the highlights for me. Next time, I will stay longer! Plus, the one dollar water at the gift shop ( which is donated to Art Deco historic preservation) is a plus!

title: Great team, great museum, great tours, great Team...
review: Thanks to all of them.

title: Cruise terminal (Royal Caribbean)
review: Pro tip: take a taxi. There is a flat rate from the airport (Miami) to the port of $27. To take a chartered bus by the cruise company (we were on royal Caribbean) was $16 per person. Coming off the ship, there is a huge line of taxis. Again, flat rate of $27. Save yourself the hassle and take a taxi.

title: Great venue
review: Once you navigate the side streets and traffic you safe at home. $20 for regular parking. Dozens of food options at ballpark prices although if you look you can find a$3 dog and $5 beer. It’s air conditioned and a comfortable stadium

title: Lovely ball park!
review: What a nice ball park! Great view of downtown, new, clean and bright. Can find inexpensive food, although it is small servings.

title: AN  UNUSUAL  NIGHT  AT  THE  BALLPARK
review: Being  used  to  the  open,  comfortable  environment  afforded  to  fans  at  Citizens  Bank  Park  in  Phila.,  this  place  was MUCH  more  like  a  fortress  than  a ballpark.  Yes,  I  am  sending  a  "  constructive  criticism "  letter  to  Marlins  management........Additionally,  buy your  parking  passes  BEFORE  getting  to  the  ballpark.  The Marlins  gouge  you  for  an  additional  $  5.00  ($ 25.00  in  total)  to  park  if  you  pay  night  of  game).   I  am  glad  we  went,  but  won't  go  sprinting  back  to  Marlins  Park  any  time  soon.

title: Interesting venue
review: Cons: food- despite reading about the efforts to bring Miami to the stadium, I found the food options lacking and sparse. I have celiac and there was no dedicated gluten free food stand, like many parks, or readily accessible information. It also seemed like ice cream was sold in only one stand. Entering- you enter at field level and have to walk up ramps to get to the main concourse level. At 6 months pregnant I was not prepared for this and there seemed to be no other option, at least from the gate we entered. I was exhausted in the Miami heat after essentially climbing two/ three stories.

title: great experience
review: I enjoyed my visit to this museum, you'll find enticing international art collections on display, one of my favorites was the "for those in peril on the sea" by Hew Locke. Bright and airy building with an outdoor park, museum sits on the water with a spacious terrace where you can sit, watch the ships, while you sip an iced tea or any beverage of your liking.

title: Admire the beautiful exterior; skip the museum
review: I REALLY wanted to love this museum, but honestly I can't give a recommendation to visit.  Outside, the building itself is gorgeous with the hanging gardens, views of the water, and great architecture.  Parking was very easy and shaded (obviously, as it is underground).  However, the art itself was lacking.  My initial impression was that the majority of pieces chosen for exhibition were perhaps from budding middle and high school programs in the area -which would be fantastic if it were offset with more quality pieces.  However, I've seen better collections housed in universities and even boutique hotels throughout the US.  Perhaps we visited the Perez during an 'off' season.

title: Miami
review: Stayed at the AC Hotel at Miami Beach. Beautiful and great service. Only 1 minute walk across the street to the beach. Washington Ave (or ot might be street) is a great spot for dinner and walking and shopping. A 30 minute walk along the beautiful beach to get there or down the street or a 10 minute bike ride. Lots of good food and people watching. Went on a food tour in little Havana and rode jet skins. Awesome trip  cant wait to go back!

title: Art on Saturday's
review: Since its inauguration I did not have the opportunity to visit the PAMM Museum. I went with a group of friends to see an exhibit from Beatriz Gonzalez, a Colombian artist. Great retrospective!! We also went on the second saturday of the month and it happened to be free. So, make sure you go on a Saturday, no lines, light crowd and the museum always has something to show. Spaces are large. Nice to walk around, a wonderful art store and a great restaurant where we had a delicious variety of plates. Underground parking is convenient and affordable. Definitely a nice museum to visit.

title: Worst art in Miami
review: Travelling to Miami I was very impressed with its iconic art galleries and districts, with the great exception of the Perez museum. The art itself was childish and soulless and the exhibits (the ones that were open) were lazily curated. For such a impressive space the museum itself was just another commercial trap. If you are looking for art in Miami do yourself a favour and visit Margulies Collection at the Warehouse.

title: Great Experience!
review: The showroom/museum is impressive, with a large variety of assault riffles. They offer multiple shooting experience packages. I went with the "Scarface" Package which includes 4 different weapons for a total of 85 rounds (90 minute experience for a group of 5). Our instructor, Fabian, made the whole experience even better by giving us a brief history of the weapons we were shooting + tricks to improve curacy. Awesome experience, thank you L&L Miami!

title: Great
review: I had a great experience at Lock & Load I learned a lot of things I didn’t know from my instructor Fabian and it was my birthday I got to fire the BARRETT M95.

title: A great experience and staff very helpful
review: I shot before during my army service in my country, but bow I was able to shoot different weapons that are not available in my country and the Instructor Fabian (who served the US Army) gave me a good explanation about the weapons I shot thinking in safety on the first place. I really recommend it.

title: A MUST GO!
review: If you are in need of great stress relief or just want to live out a dream of firing off some exotic weapons, this is the place! They also have a collection of guns in the museum you won't find anywhere else, AND some are available to purchase....for the right price.

title: Machine Gun Experience
review: Really nice people, good prices and a big thanks do will for showing me how to shoot for the first time!

title: OK but not that exciting
review: This museum has an eclectic and odd blend ranging from ordinary nude paintings to bizarre, somewhat grotesque erotic art to everything in between.  It’s a relatively small collection - won’t take you more than 20-30 minutes.  It’s $20, which is an ok value for what you get.

title: Worth checking out
review: The collection in about 25 min. It was open to 10pm on weeknights and photos are allowed without flash.

title: Not the average museum...
review: We found it extremely fun and hilarious to visit this museum. Tons of unexpected art from BC to modern day. The collection was impressive and something you won't see anywhere else!

title: Interesting Museum
review: I love art. This art just happened to be all about sexuality. There were some really beautiful pieces, some humorous pieces and some really obnoxious pieces. Walking through the museum gave me many feelings. I was very amused but the current exhibit was not at all uncomfortable. I have been to the Sex Museum in NY and WEAM was mild in comparison. I still very much enjoyed the experience though. If you want to do something a little different on South Beach, I recommend this to take up a little over an hour if you like to spend a couple moments with a piece. There are some interesting photo opportunities as well.

title: Random visit
review: Was at bar across street saw they were open still and decided what the hell check it out. Was actually very interesting. Gave a great understanding to sex over the years and decades and different societies interests and interpretations of sexuality. Very well out together collection and what better location than south beach for a museum of its kind. If you have interest in the human sexuality and want a nice break from the heat check it out. Stroll thru at your own pace.

title: Huge Disappointment
review: This has to be the worst zoo we've ever visited!  After paying $25pp admission, you absolutely must splurge on the Safari Cycle ($26 for 2 hours for a small cart) or there is no way you're going to make it thru the entire zoo.  Sadly, we were unaware of this and there is no other location to rent the cycles except at the front gate.  There is minimal signage and the map stinks.  So forget trying to navigate to any particular place at any particular time.  We literally could not find the bear exhibit until the presentation was over!  The exhibits are spaced so far apart and half the Africa loop has absolutely nothing to see.  Then half the animals on the Asian loop are African animals!!  Most of the beverage stands were closed and when we finally found one that was open, the Icee machines weren't ready at 12:30pm!
