We barely got to see any animals at all and many seemed to be in enclosures that weren't appropriate. Of the 3000 animals they claim to have, I'd be surprised if we saw 30. The Oasis Grill served mediocre food.  The burger was as cold as the lettuce and tomato on top.  Two sodas, burger, chicken tenders and 2 fries cost nearly $30.

title: Breathtaking
review: Had family over from abroad and decided to spend our early July vacation in Miami before heading off to England. The zoo is a must visit. My kids and my niece absolutely adored watching the animals and learning facts about most of them. Would visit again.

title: Lots of fun
review: Loved our visit, we hired a bike and enjoyed cruising round. The animals all looked really Healthy with nice habitats

title: Good mission
review: It's a beautiful place to go, not to many animals but is clean, family oriented, average food but ,what else? Specially cool for kids under 10 years old

title: The Best Zoo!  Feed the Giraffes! 🦒
review: Food and drinks are expensive so beware.

title: Great Fun
review: Went to watch a Heat game, it was great fun, even the cheap seats provided a great view of the game.

title: American airlines Arena concert of Marco Antonio Solis
review: I'm a fan of Marco Antonio Solis travel all the way from Aruba to see his concert it was amazing and i highly recommend this place.

title: Miami Heat game
review: Definitely worth experiencing a real NBA game if you are a tourist..but jesus, its expensive especially if you were planning on having a beer.

title: Arena great (with reservations), Heat game dire
review: Our objective was to get inside just once what looks like a great arena and to watch a basketball game. The positives: fantastic space, good sightlines, friendly and helpful staff. The negatives: food disgusting, in terms of both quality and price; and the basketball game turned out to be very boring, with too many fouls, stops, starts and "dance entertainment acts". You have to question any sport that has to exhort its spectators repeatedly to "Scream" or "Make Some Noise" or "Clap Your Hands" and replays "We Will Rock You" riffs endlessly. Most spectators chose to talk and eat and drink rather than focus on the game, so not much atmosphere!

title: Nice Memorial
review: You can find This memorial right beside the Miami Botanical Garden. It is a fine place to get a history lesson. You can read on the wall about Holocaust, and get a picture about what happened with the millions of people involved. Sad thing, but interesting.

title: A place of sorrow, a place of hope
review: This is a stunning memorial which also shares a message of peach and hope. The raised hand is the perfect symbol of the hope for peace in the world.

title: A fitting tribute
review: Fortunately there weren’t many people at the site in the morning. The sculptures were very moving. It is worth visiting, a very sober experience.

title: Remember the holocaust!
review: Great place to reflect back on the Holocaust.  It is free to visit but there are rules of ediquate.  There is a Memorial Wall to reflect upon.

title: Visit to Memorial
review: Went 2 years ago when my son was 7 and didn't really get to experience it because he was afraid of it. Can be overwhelming for young children. Went again today and was able to go through the entire memorial. So moving and heartbreaking. Very good reminder and lesson to think about leaders and where they are trying to lead you to instead of blindly following along. My son was reading through it and even though he hasn't learned about it in school yet, was moved by the images and captions. Very symbolic hand reaching up and some sculptures that were very well made. Huge well done to those that created.

title: Very Well Done Museum -- Can't Wait to Take Grandkids
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: During a Staycation, my wife and I took the People Mover from my Brickell office and checked the place out. The acquaria were awesome, and the exhibits top notch. The planetarium was fine, and I understand they have started evening laser shows, in homage to the Space Transit Planetarium that was a favorite of many of us children of the 70s...If we're blessed with grandkids, this will be a MUST SEE...

title: A fun en educational experience! Not only for kids!
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: We spent a day at the museum and we had a great experience, the show was beautiful and we thoroughly enjoyed our visit. I do recommend planning a visit on a weekday if you want to avoid a crowd!

title: Enjoyable visit & giraffe feeding!
review: Lots of animals to see, the zoo is very large and there are lots of water fountains and shaded areas around which was perfect for a hot day. Really enjoyed the giraffe feeding!

title: So much to see
review: There was so much to see that we hardly had time to take it all in ,my favorites were the crocodiles such beautiful creatures.

title: Zoo Miami  just marvelous!
review: Worth the trip especially if you have children.

title: Awesome Zoo
review: It took us 4,5h and ~11km to walk throgh the whole Zoo, but it was totally worth it!

title: Nice Zoo
review: Spent a few hours here while in Miami.  Nice zoo, well designed  easy to get around and no cages all open exhibits. Lots of Animals from all over the world.

title: WOW! so much fun!!
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: We really enjoyed the bird sanctuary and owls as well. It's 100% worth the trip if you're in Miami and looking for something fun to do.

title: Great planetarium.
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: My only issue is that I don’t mind paying $30 each for entry but then why is the gift shop so expensive to get a souvenir, shame.

title: Very educative
place: Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science
review: Nice place to learn and take students.  The aquarium is beautiful. Im a science teacher and love it.  The planetarium is nice to.

title: Nice sand, large beach.
review: Our hotel had arranged for complimentary beach chairs which were set up for us where we wanted them.  The water was clear, the sand well-groomed and the beach was not crowded.

title: Great beach area
review: We found the beach to be very clean and inviting. No problem with other visitors or loud music. Sand is easy to walk on and the water and waves were refreshing

title: Brief beach visit
review: It was "cold" (74) they day we visited the beach. Had a decent crowd and nice sand. As the "#1 rated gay beach in Miami" we had high hopes for the caliber of people there. We were disappointed, but perhaps being a week day and cooler weather deterred the trophy boys. The beach was very clean with no seaweed!

title: The beach
review: It was a gorgeous day and we rented beach chairs and enjoyed a day at the beach here. We brought Cuban sandwiches and ate them at the shoreline. There are bathrooms and outdoor showers.

title: You can't get near it because of commercial tent cities
review: Horrible.  And once you find your way to the surf, the have a 180 degree view behind you of commercialism out-of-control. You have to run a gauntlet of construction crews during erection and dismantling of huge tents, and then thousands of "convention/show" participants during nearly every week of the winter season.

title: Nice family park w large playground
review: For a little play time off the beach! Lap pool, tennis & racquetball courts. Pool parties can be arranged w advance planning as well as birthday parties for children or other private events. The park boasts 36 acres of grounds including a nice large playground. Beautiful meticulously maintained family park in South Beach.

title: awesome for families
review: shaded playground area, pool for adults and kids, well run, clean, fun.  large fields for organized sports as well

title: Quick swim
review: We were after somewhere for a quick dip as our hotel had a microscopic pool and we went to Flamingo Park. It was perfectly nice, the place was clean, you don't have to hire loungers and there was plenty of space when we went. It was a bit pricey for a quick swim and we only spent a couple of hours there.

title: Get some activity in your Holiday.
review: Loved this park. Here you can have fun in the water, you can rund on the track and field court, you can play soccer and alot more. Very nice in the midle of Miami Beach, in walking distance from all over South Beach.

title: Top ZOO -> in our top 3
review: Tip: just 45 min outside Miami downtown; arrive early in the morning because we needed at least 5 hours to visit in order to have decent time to watch the animals

title: Lovely experience
review: What a wonderful afternoon!! A spur of the moment decision and no regrets!!! Absolutely loved our visit to the zoo. We rented a safari cycle and ambled along the beautiful clean pathways stopping along the way to view the wild life. From young to old we had a load of fun. So nice to see how well maintained the park is and especially how healthy the animals look. To all the staff -great job - keep up the good work!

title: BIG
review: All in all, it was a very good experience. We had fun.

title: Prepare to walk
review: Zoo Miami is a large zoo with quite a bit of walking between major exhibit as areas.  Tandem bike rentals and a pay Monorail do help.  It took me 2.5 hours to cover most of the exhibits at a good clip.  The large size of the zoo allows for some of the exhibits to give roaming room for the animals.  It also allows for almost barrier free viewing and pictures.  Several animal groups had juveniles.  The 10:00 opening allowed for most of the turnpike traffic to be avoided (I came from 50 minutes away).  The zoo had plenty of water fountains, misters, shaded play and rest areas to help deal with the heat.

title: LOVE IT!
review: We loved this zoo.  It is very big so I recommend renting the bike thing and taking the day to see everything.  It has lots of shade and the exhibits are good.  We go to a lot of zoos and this is one of the best we have visited.

title: Perfect for kids between 2 to 6 years old.
review: Perfect for kids between 2 to 6 years old. its clean, fun, bathrooms are presentable and they have persons attending on the kids at the pool all the time

title: Great interest on the area
review: This is a collection of Art Deco items and history of this interesting area.  There is a minimal admission charge.  Great clock outside with a day clock built into a monument for photos.

title: Art Deco Center is a great place!
review: I would recommend this place for all of u who are visiting Miami Beach for the first time! Such a classy place with great people working there! Excellent service! Would come back for sure!

title: Not Exactly Impressive
review: Stopped in at this building to see what their museum had to offer.  The woman at the front desk was only interested in selling tours.  I wasn't going to be here for the next day's walking tour, so I asked about a brochure for a self-guided walk. She said something about being able to get some information if I arrived too late for the next day's tour.  Huh?  Having a self-guided itinerary seemed to me to be a no-brainer at the HQ of the Miami Design Preservation League.  The woman at the museum cashier desk was much nicer.  The video about the early days of local preservation efforts (70s - early 80s) was quite informative.  The exhibits themselves were less than stellar.  They mostly consisted of informational posters, many of which were repetitive.  The exception, however, was the wooden models of some of the old hotels, one of which had been torn down.  It's always good to know something about those buildings you WON'T be able to actually see because of misguided attempts at "renewal" . There were very few actual artifacts, and those they did have looked as if they had come from a vintage store rather than a gallery.  Save your money for the Wolfsonian, which has amazing artifacts from the area, many of which have a local provenance.

title: So glad we went!
review: The first time I was at South Beach I did not go into this little museum because of the $5 entry fee, but instead stopped into the next door gift shop that benefits the work. This time we did go in and found it was completely worth our time and money. I loved the manageable size of the museum, seeing the film, learning history of South Beach, etc. There are interesting displays and relics.

title: Advise and shopping
review: Fantastic, a wealth of knowledge and information enthusiastically shared. Great selection of historical and current deco posters which make great souvenirs. Highly recommended.

title: Very nice ballpark
review: Marlins don’t draw a lot of fans, so concession lines don’t exist.

title: Good game
review: Went to add to bucket list completion of MLB stadiums.  Good game, good food. Purchased parking with ticket so had easy in and out for the game too.

title: The full Amercian Baseball experience!
review: Whenever I visit the States, I like to see go to Baseball, and visiting friends in the Keys meant that this time it was the Marlins! Tickets easy to buy online, as was the nearby parking. Our fears of heavy rain (the Hurricane was not too far away) were calmed by the knowledge that this new stadium could be protected from the wind and the rain by an adaptable roof cover (all bets are off in a actual hurricane, of course). Great seats, and plenty of empty spaces in the stadium as the Marlins not winning much this year. My friends bought me the traditional beer and popcorn, and I later bought a really tasty Hot Dog. To round off the experience, the Marlins won in the 11th Inning - a great and memorable All American evening!

title: nice but
review: Really cool stadium super big, I was having a great time until some guy hit me with a ball. It was not very nice.

title: Marlins
review: The Marlins Park Stadium is the home stadium for The Florida Marlins baseball team. The state of the art stadium has a retractable ceiling so it can be closed for rain.

title: Amazing!
review: So glad I had time to come here! Exhibits were wonderful, I’m also coming from nyc where museums are beyond packed and this was so quiet. Also all the staff said hello to me in every room. Architecture of the museum is also gorgeous

title: Wonderful
review: thought out collection. Great facilities, very relaxed, a bit out of the way but worth it.

title: Best Zoo ever!!
review: Animals with no cage, great photo opportunity-we just loved it... It was a promotion for entrance, but it would worth the normal price. Plan at least 3-4 hours, rent a bringo and go:-

title: You have to visit the zoo!
review: If you like nature, you have to visit this zoo, you can go solo or with friends and family. Plenty of space to enjoy nature and to learn from this experience.

title: Nice zoo, rent a bike
review: Spent three hours in the park and walked the first two hours. Nice zoo and plenty to see. The animals had good amount of space and the zoo is nicely kept. Decided to rent the family bike for last hour and that was a good decision.

title: Awesome place
review: Haven’t been to a zoo in a couple years and decided to go to the one in Miami very friendly staff very awesome zoo experience would deathly recommend for people with families and kids you will love it

title: Large Zoo
review: The Zoo is close to my home so I have visited often and have celebrated birthday parties of my grandchildren. Very nice ambience, great zoo keepers, friendly staff. Animals look very happy, it has a lot of facilities, nice souvenir shops and eatery and a trolly to make your visit less tiring. The Zoo is very big and need good walking shoes and a good bottle of sunscreen, Florida Sun could kill you. They are building a Water Park next to the Miami Zoo which promise to be a delight for all ages, the Miami Zoo will own it, so probably they will make a bridge or walking path between the two parks. Enjoy!

title: Beautiful art
review: Was there when they open and they didn't disappoint  me. Planning another trip soon with my son and now my granddaughter. Can wait to show her art and beauty.

title: Perez Art Museum
review: The Perez Art Museum Miami is an awesome art experience. I really enjoyed and appreciated the variety and many different displays that they had available. The building is beautiful and I like the architecture and how everything is organized and later out. The art made me think and I like doing that. I also really like the outdoor area overlooking the water with swings. This is one of the best art museum experiences I have ever had.

title: Love this museum
review: This is a great museum, not so big that it is overwhelming.  Terrific gift shop, too.  Went to see a specific exhibit but it's all so available.

title: The Best Shooting Experience
review: Overall this visit really was the icing on the cake of our vacation. Thank you Nick for making it such a special day!

title: It was great
review: It was my first time shooting and it was amazing! The People were really nice and my guide Will explained everything very good and clearly. The money was worth it!!!

title: State of the art shooting range 👍
review: Highly recommended was very professional had a brilliant time.max was very helpful in guiding an inexperienced person like myself his knowledge with the firearms was brilliant well worth the visit il be going again next time I’m in Miami.

title: Best activities in midtown MIAMI
review: Max took care of us and ran our packages. He was very knowledgeable and professional. I learned a lot and had a lot of fun.

title: Bachelor Party
review: Went on my Stag Do (or Bachelor Party) in October and this was the last activity we did and also the best!! Had Nick as an instructor who was incredibly knowledgeable, informative, funny, interesting and put up with us even though we were far from at our best that day! Can’t wait to go back

title: Erotic Art Museum
review: increase the collection or decrease the enterance fees.

title: Surprising find
review: It was actually a really great museum that holds a rather large collection. Some of the pieces are missing labels/explanations but it was a great experience! It is somewhat pricey so be warned but my husband and I felt like it was worth it. It was a nicely spent hour and a half.

title: Good but not great
review: We went here on a Friday afternoon and only one other person was there. There is a lot to look at, but a lot of it was statues of penises and vaginas. I guess I was expecting more artwork. There is a decent amount of artwork though and it had a really cool prop from a movie I love.

title: A Natural Space Zoo
review: A Must See.

title: Fun day
review: Came here after cruise with kids for the day. Super fun place. So much to do we didn’t get it all in. Can’t wait to come back and see it all.

title: Amazing Behind the Scenes Experience
review: While our original Behind the Scenes Experience was cancelled due to issues with the animals, I can't thank the Tours Department, and especially Sebastian for making our trip absolutely amazing.  The lengths that you went through to make my wife happy, is very appreciated.  Say hi to Toshi for us, as we'll definitely be back.  Good luck on your school Sebastian.

title: All Day Adventure
review: Thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the zoo. Loved the ability to refill my soda bottle at the water fountains to reuse the bottle over and over. I also really enjoyed the plastic molding souveniers. However, my favorite spot was with all the otters. A child sadly left their sippy cup and the otters really enjoyed playing with me and following the cup. They sure did like the bright colors of the cup. Be sure to get there right at open. We spent the entire day and almost didn't make it to all the exhibits.

title: Wonderful, interactive experience
review: We were so pleasantly surprised by the inviting feel of the Zoo! We loved how many attractions were interactive, like feedings and crawl spaces with the alligators, bears, and Otters. We definitely recommend Zoo Miami to all of our friends who come to visit, especially those with young kids. Every employee we had interactions with was wonderful and kind.

title: Just ok
review: This museum used to be interesting and really fun, but now boring. There is also no gift shop. Do not waste your time.

title: Eye opener
review: Never been to an erotic art museum before, but this one is brilliant.  A wonderful collection of items from all over the world and all through time.  Tastefully presented and suitable for all adults.

title: Beautiful zoo
review: DO NOT EAT at the restaurant nourish by the main entrance. It was disgusting. Kids pizza was inedible even to a 5 year old. The fruit cups were rotten. They only have 2 high chairs!! It’s a zoo where kids go! 2 high chairs is not enough. Flatbread sandwich was gross. Sister in law had a wrap n thought that was good.

title: Big Zoo, but many of the same animals
review: We went to this Zoo today, and it is a huge and good loking Zoo. The animals was much the same just from different areas off the world. Soo a little more animals could have been better. The rest was OK.

title: Our favorite activity
review: Once a year, on our family vacation to Miami, we always come and visit this place. Nice place and great for kids. Various animals from different continents. We can walk or taking bicycle to go around. And there is a monorail too. It’s very crowded on holiday seasons but this place is very good for family gathering too. My kids love to come here all time.

title: Amazingly adventure!
review: An impressively large zoo.  The enclosures were large and the animals appeared to be healthy.  There were more than ample opportunities for refreshments, restrooms and information.  We arrived early and had no issues with crowds.

title: A wonderful family experience!
review: We rented a safari bicycle and found it to be too strenuous for us.  Tina, in security, went out of her way to accomodate us to in dropping off the bicycle and having security pick us up in a golf cart to return to the entrance.  Christopher was also kind and considerate.

title: People watching
review: A place full of character that I would recommend visiting.

title: Aging but good zoo
review: Theres a lot of walking in this zoo. The tram does help out but with a 3 year old its still a hike. April isnt super hot yet but still we were sweating and needed shade. The displays are nice and the animal well taken care of. The main cafe was close to entrance and was clean and reasonably priced with good selection. Bathrooms are spread apart so factor that in for older folks and young kids. Staff were nice but clistered around certain displays and additional cost venues like feed the giraffe. That was fun but was easily a 20 min wait in off peak season.

title: Worst system ever to purchase tickets.
review: So I bought two tickets from this TripAdvisor site for a offer to go to zoo miami with my daughter. First the Email from TripAdvisor don’t reach my email to print out my tickets (double checked email and it is correct ) So I emails TripAdvisor and zoo miami 3/27/19. Today 4/8/19 haven’t received my tickets or a response. TripAdvisor is no where to be reached and zoo miami couldn’t do anything without the tickets because of third party purchase. So I don’t get to go and also haven’t gotten a refund because nobody I can’t reached anyone to start the process. Totally unprofessional with Coustmer service. Will never purchase from this site again.

title: Great zoo
review: We went with a soon to be one year old and he loved it. I really enjoyed the giraffe feeding. The zoo was a lot of fun. We did the whole thing by foot. It took us about 4 hours to leisurely do. We went on a Monday and got there when it opened we basically had the zoo to ourselves.

title: Fab day out
review: This zoo is amazing, lots of incredible animals. It includes the opportunity to feed giraffe, parrots, giant tortoise and the rhino. You can include this in your ticket or it is only $5pp. I did this and it was worth it.  You can hire bicycle buggies but we thought they were overpriced at $25for 2 hours. The zoo is clean and has friendly volunteers dotted about with information. It also provides plenty of water stops, shade and mist fountains.

title: Beautiful Old Buildings
review: they don't make them like they used to.  This Art Deco preserved building are just beautiful.  The colors and the style, the windows and the curves, South Beach is a unique area of Miami.  Even the Post office has the Art Deco vibe to it.  There are shops and restaurants all keeping the area alive and fun.

title: Shopping and restaurants
review: If in south beach you can’t miss this . Walk traffic free and see the art , restaurants , and stores .

title: Careless environment for the animals
review: I actually took a class called FIU at the zoo. We were able to walk on the White tiger area and was amazed at the distance to where visitors stand. It looks so much closer from the visitor side. There’s a train that gives you an overview of the zoo, including riding through the aviary. The island of monkeys is very entertaining. A must visit for sure!

title: Great family experience
review: We had a great experience at zoo miami. The appearance of the animals seemed well kept and zoo keepers were very attentive of the well being of the animals. Clean area plenty of parking space and ticketing line moved pretty fast. Rent the bike, please do it you will move much quicker through the park and if you have kids (like me) they will have a blast. Be prepared for food pricing inside the park it is pretty expensive a lunch for 2 adults and 1 child came about $60 to $80 depending on the items selected. A little confused though at the monorail situation we paid a little more to have 3 feedings and unlimited monorail usage at the end of the day we decided to ride the monorail, we were told we had to wear wristbands to id us, however I did not see other passenger uyilizing these bands so I wonder if we were ripped off on the monorail usage. Giraffe feedjng was an amazing experience extremely dissappointed at the rhino feeding, this one is scheduled for 12pm and 3pm on that particular Sunday, at 2:45pm we got in line. Around 2:50pm the crew working that feeding open the gate to whulich the rhino immediately came to be fed. The crew took more than 10 minutes to set up while they hugged each other and spoke between them like they were on lunch break, so eventually the rhino left. Obviously the rules specify that the animal feeds voluntarily so to me the crew lost the interest of the rhino to feed from the public. We were left without this experience thanks to the waste of time of these crew members. Other than this particular event the zoo is highly recommended

title: Nice Zoo - Lots of Space for Animals
review: One of the nicer zoos I've visited. Very attractive grounds and plantings. My teenage son really enjoyed the animals and natural history presented and the information on ecosystems. Many unique animals that aren't seen at other zoos too.

title: Great Family Fun
review: We spent a lot of time at this attraction about 5 hours. There is a ton to see and do for kids. I liked how the zoo was arranged into continent sections to see the different animals! There were lots of different animal species to explore. Also different pit stops for water entertainment, restaurants, concessions, and little activities a long the way for kids to enjoy. A big win was taking a family sized bike out and riding around all day so you don’t have to walk the whole way! A great experience with many unique animals to take pictures of!

title: South Beach and Art Deco
review: Love visiting this part of Miami Florida. The colorful Art Deco buildings are so beautiful. Such a vibrant atmosphere.

title: Was nice but needs updating
review: Visited Miami beach with my son and nephew over the summer and found the Art Deco district very run down.  The buildings are still nice to see but most need to be painted and cleaned up.   If you have an hour to spare its worth the time to walk through the Historic District.

title: Zoo
review: Love the Zoo. Amazing animals, beautiful grounds. Spent hours walking around on a beautiful day. Well kept and the animals are taken very good care off.

title: Great Zoo in the Miami Burbs
review: Many different animals and several sections to the zoo. It's worth the drive and you can spend at least a half of a day here. They also have special tours and offerings if you call ahead. Would recommend.

title: Great family Entertainment
review: Zoo Miami is wonderful for a wekend getaway.  There is lots to do and to see at Zoo Miami.  Plan to spend an entire day at the zoo.  Zoo Miami is part of the MIami Dade County Park and Recreation park systems.  The parking is free and there is plenty.   There are new part of the zoo that have benn built with a water ride. A few water play areas for the kids.  Plenty of places to eat.  The food is a little expensive, but not to bad.  There are aquatic boats to rent.  Animal shows.  Its ideal to get there early when the Zoo open that will leave you plenty of time to do all the things.  The animals shows are about 30 minutes long.  There are several shows through out the park.  There is also bicycle rentals, you can feed the Giraffe.  Nice spots for pictures.  Very exotic animals.  You can see the Zoo keepers feeding the animals through out the day.  In the same area to the right side of the parking lots you will also find aTrain museum.  This entrance is seperate from the Zoo, but the history behind each train is expectacular.  The presidental train of Ronald Reagan is displayed  in the museum.  You can go inside each train and their is even train rides.  Enjoy a fantastic day of fun, food, animals, water play, and trains. happy days at Zoo Miami and at the train museum.

title: Unfortunately a little disappointing
review: However the monorail was very slow and it was not meant to see the exhibits from  (just alot of trees and maintenance sheds).  It is just meant to get from one section to the other.

title: Not my style
review: It was interesting to stop and take a look around, but to be honest the art is not my style. I enjoyed watching a few of the artists work and wished I could have stayed a little longer for that.

title: Great walk
review: Great place for an early morning (sunrise) walk, lots of plants and palm trees, plenty of shaded areas.  Be careful of the bicycles and skateboards.

title: Nice place to relax
review: Plenty of walkways and lots of shade as well as clean grass lawns make this a pleasant place to stop and rest. Nice place to take a break from the beach.  Nice for a stroll in the evening. Playground area, too. A pier juts out along the main shipping channel to the Port of Miami, so you can view everything from small watercraft to large cruise ships going by. The park appeared clean and well maintained.

title: All you need in resturants and Shops
review: Lincoln Road have it all. Victoria Secret, Nike store, Sunglass Hut, Hawaiianas+++ and good resturants. Try the Cuban, really good food and som nice people. There is alot of other food also, 7 spiecis had very good food, and there is Sushi, pizza, pasta+++ On satyrday nd sunday there was different markeds there, thy sold hommade fodd and drinks, really good, and for less money.

title: Zoo visit
review: Definitely splurge and pay to feed the animals! It was so cool being close to the rhino. We also fed the giraffe and camels.

title: A top zoo in country
review: Great variety with expansive location. A long history of being active in the community. Some must do programs like spending a night at the zoo,  etc.

title: Great zoo with lots of animals and activities
review: Zoo Miami is undoubtedly one of the best Miami attractions and , aside from the heat during summer months, we personally think it’s one of the best zoos in Florida!

title: Time to kill
review: This zoo is huge! Was a great day at the zoo but I think timing is everything here. Most of the residents where not out. It wasn’t that hot out but I think is was nap time.  I would suggest start at Asia and work your way around. We started the other way and had to rush through the good parts at the end because we had to catch a flight.  I must say that they are very close.  Some were under weight looking but who’s counting calories there. A lot of walking if you don’t rent the bikes but they were costly. I rather walk.  I could only image the traffic jam with those things when it’s really busy.  Overall at good day at the zoo. Zoo Miami

title: A must see!
review: Very interesting and worth the visit.  Good shops around the walls. Take photos and just stroll around.

title: Beautiful
review: Loved South Pointe Park! The views are great, especially if you walk down to the end of the pier. There is also a marina with many beautiful boats. I recommend stopping at one of the restaurants for waterfrtont dining. I could spend hours at the park, admiring the ocean, eating and waving to those aboard the cruise ships passing by.

title: The Best Way to See Art Deco!
review: The absolutely best way to see it all is on a segway! No walking, a guide knowing the history and you can see soo much in 2.5 hours.

title: Very nice place to visit
review: It's a very nice to visit with kids. But it's dirty and the sinalization of the places is not good. We went there during the rabies alert, and I think they aren't able to deal with the problem.

title: Really nice Zoo!
review: Food is OK but a bit expensive. The gift shop is good.  Plenty of parking and easy access from major roads.

title: Total Dissappointment!
review: With all the beautiful things to see in Florida, I feel I wasted a day here.

title: Disappointing
review: Yes, it was cold so a number of animals weren't able to be seen. However, there were many areas where there were no animal even inside buildings. A big turnoff was the lack of colorful greenery. Also, there needs to be many more signposts showing where the different exhibits are. The Miami Zoo management should go to  Bronx Zoo in NYC to see how a zoo should look like.

title: A very nice zoo
review: This zoo is quite extensive and you can do a lot of walking.  It is arranged by geographic area - Australia, Africa, Asia and so on.  The grounds are very pretty and the animals have adequate room to roam.  There is a tram you can get and bike rentals, also.

title: Amazing Art
review: We had the pleasure of going to Wynwood this past week for the first time and were incredibly surprised that you have access to view such diverse and amazing art with no cost to the public.  It's a must see. The graffiti art in the area is impressive as well.

title: Lovely walk
review: The views and the walk alongside the beach was really relaxing- perfect during the week as you can avoid the weekend crowd.

title: A Great Saturday Night
review: To me, this is definitely the place to be on a Saturday night.  There are endless venues for entertainment, dining, drinking, and music.

title: Lovely stretch for a stroll
review: The Art Deco district is a beautiful piece of history and fun to walk around. A must-see in South Beach. There are lots of charming hotels and restaurants. Delightful!

title: Open Air Mall
review: The Uber GPS doesn't work well and no one we encountered knew where the Alton Rd Cinema was. Our driver saved us. (If this happens to you, it's around the corner from the Nike Store.)

title: Birthday Celebration
review: Great a many stores to shop and sidewalk restaurant.  Love the art galleries too.  I do wish there were children stores to shop on Lincoln Road,

title: Was expecting more!!
review: Pedestrian road with top end shops but just lacked the buzz we found elsewhere in Miami.  Maybe it's better later in the day or in the evening.

title: Outdoor shopping and dining
review: A one-mile long shopping and dining experience.  Even though it's outside, they do a good job of keeping it shady.

title: Lost it’s appeal and crowd
review: The crown is much smaller the places did not change much with the times

title: Managing Director
review: Waiting over 1 Year for my refund. Never received pair of shorts.  Tried calling many times - won’t pick up phone.

title: Warning!!!  Car Broken into
review: We drove into the Wynwood area and parked 30 yards away from the Bakan Restaurant in a paid public lot.  We were in the restaurant no more than 40 mins.  Our car was broken into and all our luggage taken!!   Called Miami PD, who said it would take at least an hour to get a police car there but we were welcome to drive to station to file report.  When we got to the station, others were there filling break in reports.  Seems like it happens a LOT in that area.     AVOID parking with any valuables in your car.  Not a safe area!!

title: Lights, Color, Action!
review: If you love the Miami Art Deco colors and vibes this is the spot for you, more historical with the style but does not disappoint good eats and nightlife.

title: Worth a drive or a walk through
review: Love the way they have preserved this historical architecture in this area.  The buildings were mostly 3 stories, which probably seemed high at the time.  But you can just imagine all the invasive sky scrapers that would be here, if this area had no preservation rules.

title: Best of retail and restaurant of South Bch
review: There is something for everyone here.  Most notable retail including high end designers.  Many dining options.

title: Shopping
review: The outside Mall is amazing.  Very good stores. Very good restaurants. Always busy.  Lot of people visit it.  Specially during weekend,

title: Window shopping and dining
review: Enjoyed my vegetarian lunch at Spris. Loved both the Nike store and Apple store. Found some possible outfits for 9 year old grandson next time he visits at Zara.

title: Shopping eating and some more stuff...
review: I absolutely love Lincoln Road here in Miami. It has just about anything you want restaurants bars hookah bars shopping Apple Store. If you do visit Lincoln Road try NEXXT café. and visit the little shops along the sidelines. You won’t be disappointed it’s always a good time sometimes there’s even entertainment. Enjoy.

title: A weekend stroll.
review: This a great place to spend a Saturday and Sunday strolling the street mall with something for everyone with restaurants galore.

title: Good Location for choosing a Hotel =7/10
review: - FREE Trolley (06-24:00) ride in & around ... Also Public bus transportation (Ticket = 2.25 $) to AirPort + D.T. + Ft. Lauderdale + ... in /Close

title: Wynwood arts district
review: My husband and I spent about four hours exploring.  The artwork was original, artistic and refined.  It was so much more than we anticipated.

title: Worth a trip but street art is edgy...daring...original...often a social commentary: not here
review: I packed my opinion into the heading. The street art here is well executed but lacks bite or vigour. Yes it is worth a look if you are in the area but don't expect too much. If you want vibrant, provocative and challenging there are other places in the world...Orgosolo in Sardinia, the East End of London, Belfast...loads of places...most big cities.

title: Interesting architecture
review: It's nice that the city has preserved these buildings for historical purposes and many looked well preserved. So it's worth walking around and taking in this unique site.

title: Ok
review: Worth a look but do not expect much. Especially is you are living in europe. It shows that this was not build to last

title: Miami's Icon
review: Simply a must see if you are visiting Miami

title: 30% shops are closed...
review: Maybe it just was too expensive. The remaining restaurants are super high priced!

title: Great Outdoor Shopping Area
review: Great outdoor shopping area with a variety of stores, view of palm trees and other greenery in the middle, with several restaurants and cafes with outdoor patios! They are also all dog friendly! Coming from a place where dogs are not allowed on outdoor patios, I find Miami a very dog friendly city.

title: enjoyable
review: there are a lot of big stores although there was no sale. we enjoed fresh street fruits. there are a lot of cafees

title: They have everything.
review: Great places to eat and shop. Near everything. A nice street and things to see. I think lincoln road is better than the malls.

title: Best service
review: Byron Julio and jazzman were wonderful today The best beach I’ve been to by far. The staff is friendly and it’s a lot of space

title: Unique hip spot for a day trip
review: My husband and I did a day trip to Wynwood. We found parking pretty easily, and then walked around and checked out the graffiti on the sidewalk and walls that is all over the city. We stopped in a couple of very cute boutiques and had some delicious Asian fusion lunch at KYU. There were a ton of restaurants and shops and a lot to see and do for a nice daytrip out of Miami. It's a really unique and hip area, worth a visit!

title: Great graffiti
review: We loved our tour around this area seeing all the great graffiti wall art work covering all walls and outside areas

title: Great views
review: Fun place to visit in Miami Beach as the views are awesome and the sunsets are beautiful.  Watching the cruise ships depart is a kick.  Easy place to walk and seems safe.

title: Entertaining
review: Our hotel was in this area and features as much of the original old buildings and art deco designs that are now protected from being altered.  We took  a walking tour of the area, and because of the talents of the tour guide, we had a very entertaining and enlightening experience.  Worth a visit if you are not staying in the area, which will also give a chance to visit the ocean and park and experience the main entertainment drag across the street.

title: Run Down
review: Art Deco is not my style. That being said a fresh coat of paint and updated furnishings could turn this run down area from looking like 3rd world latin america to a great icon of the past. There is vintage and then there is run down...

title: Loved Lincoln road , people watching , food , shopping
review: Lincoln Road has it all , loved it . Lots of great shops  , food stalls , music artists , pedestrianized so great for strolling up and down . Lots of restaurants to have a nice meal under the fairy lights and stars at night , perfect place to relax and people watch .

title: Really awesome place to walk
review: I had no idea about this place before coming to South Beach. Such a nice escape from the craziness of Ocean Drive.

title: Lincoln road
review: It’s right down the block from ocean drive I wanted a tattoo I found it on Lincoln road amazing spot empire tattoo they have little cafe restaurants and this is mostly where the club seen is

title: Worst service
review: We went for lunch and the service was so bad that even we was so hungry we ask for check and left the place.  So disappointed I use yo come yo this restaurant.

title: Busy and loud
review: Lots of stores and restaurants to visit but it is loud and every restaurant has staff urging you to take a seat and taste their menu. Lively and fun but you have to be in a festive mood to enjoy.

title: A Must See for Architectural History
review: We drove down Collins Ave to observe and enjoy the architecture of the Art Deco buildings.  They are colorful, beautiful and mostly restored.  Its fun watching people from all over the world driving and walking, biking, scootering and generally having a great time.

title: An hour of fun!
review: We had a great time at the Wynwood Walls. The murals are extraordinary pieces of art that are perfect to pose in front of and take selfies with. A fun hour to spend in Miami.

title: Beautiful Park
review: We stumbled upon this Park looking for Joe's Stone Crab and found it to be a walker's and dog lover's paradise.  Clean and on the water.

title: Betsy's
review: You must see this hotel, art deco at it's best. Go inside to the bar as inside it is a delight. It runs through to Collins Avenue with a huge ball connecting the two buildings.

title: A thing not to miss in Miami
review: This place is beautiful. I really enjoyed walking down the block. It is right on ocean drive so do not go to where google maps take you (it will take you to a residential neighborhood). It can get crowded but I enjoyed it.

title: Shopping & Food (especially fast food!)
review: We strolled down their a couple of times during our time in Miami Beach. Most of the buses stop their, also the free trolley, and most of the tours, for example Duck Tours (would highly recommend, it's great!) or the Big Red Double Decker Bus.

title: Dinner with a very good friend
review: A great place for me and my good friend to have dinner and catch up. Our preferred destination because if the diversity of restaurants and people

title: Great walk
review: One of the best streets in Miami. We took s stroll down rhe road and enjoyed scenery. It has everything for everyone; food, shops, art and many more.

title: Nice outdoor shopping, DO NOT VISIT MIXX shoe store on Lincoln Road
review: The stores and restaurants are quite nice. One store, however, had such awful staff that it deflates the whole value of the shopping strip. MIXX shoe store needs a closer look at who they hire. Go somewhere else so that this store’s staff won’t sour your day. Unhappy old, Hispanic woman manning the store who clearly doesn’t want to be there. Lazy, rude, and unhelpful, she should be lucky that she hasn’t been fired. Hopefully management will recognize that customer service is just as important as your product before the staff ruin the business and it goes into closure. Please visit this store if you like being treated like less than a human.

title: Lovely place
review: Great restaurants- you can even eat al fresco in the center of Lincoln Road!

title: Vaca
review: Charles has been nothing but accommodating to us! He has made our experience here at Miami Beach fun and enjoyable! Thank you Charles! <3

title: Charles
review: Charles Thank you so much for being so helpful and giving us a great experience at the beach . Definitely will be asking for you in the future!

title: A quieter vibe than Ocean Drive
review: Another main street of South beach but has a bit calmer vibe than the eccentric Ocean Drive. Plenty of cool shops and restaurants to check out for a change of pace.

title: Not my favorite street in Miami-Dade!
review: This is a commercial boulevard by all standards.  It is FL State highway A1A and as such, the traffic is fast, reckless and rude.  The stores and hotels are all a little shoddier than anything else in South Beach and one serious word of caution.  OBEY the walk or do not walk lights!  And, look around the corner as you cross.  If you are going to get hit by a car, truck or BIKE, it will be at the corner of Collins and (fill in any street).

title: Street art at its best...a must-do when in Miami
review: This neighbourhood is clearly going through significant regeneration and has attracted a lot of media due to its urban art scene. Strolling around the area, we found some great little galleries, restaurants and interesting shops, and witnessed some impressive graffiti murals. Best place to start is probably Wynwood Walls which is the epicentre for street artists and features some inspiring and thought-provoking works. You can also get up close to some of the artists as well. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Miami.

title: Lovely route for a walk
review: The Miami Beach Boardwalk is wide and clean, a lovely space for a long walk. There are numerous access points to get to the sand, and there are public restrooms every so often. You probably won’t go to Miami Beach specifically for the boardwalk, but while you’re there, take a little time, preferably at sunrise or sunset, to wander and appreciate the natural beauty of the ocean and dunes contrasted against all the lush tropical planting of the hotels that line the beach.

title: Great walk
review: I would have liked to walk more of the boardwalk but it was so hot I had to stop for a swim and then couldn't handle the heat anymore. There are signs everywhere that you cannot cycle on the boardwalk but of course there are people doing it. I assume these people cannot read and cannot recognise the sign No Cycling... Be ready with sunglasses, hat and suncream as there is not much shade

title: This I liked.....
review: Great place for a bike ride or holding hands, catching rays or even snorkeling.

title: Miami beach
review: Miami beach is the place you want to be. There is for everybody something and besides you can imagine the  atmosphere of the Art Deco life from 1930s. Different generation same fun.

title: A "Must See" Area
review: At night when the lights come on this is a must see area of SOBE.  The restaurants glitter, and the people are glamourous, or funky, or just plain fascinating.

title: Stunning
review: Stunning buildings so glad the history is preserved, the combination of low buildings with deco architecture the ocean and palm trees is wonderful. Must experience at least once.

title: Nice to visit but
review: Not a young kid so the loud techno after dark from every store front on Ocean dr wasnt my thing. Beautiful area, nice beaches. barkers everywhere halking wears. High prices.  Nice for short trip to say Ive been there but wouldnt go back for seconds

title: Lots to see and eat!
review: We had a ton of fun exploring on Lincoln Road. Our bachelorette party shopped, ate great Mexican food, and loved the overall vibe of what feels like a mix between cool nightlife and an outlet mall.

title: Nothing special
review: It depends what your baseline is and where you are coming from and what you like.  My preference is small creative boutiques and years ago  that could be found on Lincoln Road.  Like many things due to growth in the area and real estates' upward bound costs we are doomed to large box stores and restaurants with bases elsewhere.  Its too much like everything else.

title: all id there
review: everything you can find here, foos and shoppings, all in one street, we eat at roalaia and food was good.

title: Nice area of Miami beach
review: There are plenty of shops, restaurants and bars here. A good variety of food and clean area to relax and eat.

title: Average shopping
review: The shopping and boutiques on this strip are no better than your standard mall. Some of them clearly do not belong there. I loved all the outdoor cafes, but they were overpriced for what you get (service overall sucked, seemed run down, food quality poor)

title: Love love love the architecture
review: I cannot recommend this district highly enough. If in Florida you have to visit it.

title: Beautiful
review: What a great beach to visit. Crystal clear water and nice powdery beaches. Can't wait to come back for another visit!

title: A beautiful park for the public
review: I love this beautiful public park, with its lush greenery and trees.  A great place to relax and watch all the boat activity.

title: Awesome view
review: This is a gem in south beach. You can see beautiful sunsets and watch ships sail away from here. There’s a running path, beach access and kids play areas.

title: Out for a walk
review: I imagine it would be a great place to watch the cruise ships leave from.

title: Great walkway
review: Amazing walks along this walkway. Felt safe and well lit up at night. Be carefull when wet wuite slippery x

title: Good for a walk
review: Was very hot and humid when we walked along and there aren’t good views of the sea . You pass the back of lots of hotels so it could be better

title: Excellent place to exercise
review: We walked and rode bikes here. Perfect spot to exercise. Flat, shady in parts and wild enough for lots of people to use.

title: Beautiful art everywhere you look at!
review: Definitely make a trip to Wynwood when you visit Miami - there is amazing pieces of art in every direction you look!

title: Quintessential Miami
review: Okay, so I'm not generally a fan of urban street art, but if you're in Miami, you really shouldn't miss an opportunity to wander the streets of Wynwood.  There is amazing artistry around every corner... unbelievable what people can do with spray paint.  It's free (except for a few bucks of parking) and yes, it is a great place for selfies.

title: Wynwood-Great Art, cool neighborhood
review: Skip the paid tour and just stroll through the neighborhood.  Parking is easy, plenty of paid street parking.  Take your time maybe stop for brunch or wine along the way

title: Walking along
review: This is a fantastic neighborhood for people all ages to enjoy the artwork and good food combined. Set out around 10a, get lost around the art and stores then enjoy lunch at many incredible restaurants walk a little more and enjoy a nice coffee and dessert.

title: A Shopping Walk
review: Collin’s Avenue is a great place for hotels, restaurants, and shopping. We walked for a couple miles stopping in store and enjoying the warm weather. As we were heading back to our hotel it rained, warm and refreshing.

title: Art Deco
review: This is a good street to walk along to admire Art Deco buildings, particularly at the South Beach end.

title: Restaurants Galore
review: Lots of boutique hotels and restaurants to eat from. Great variety of cuisines. Central Miami where all the action is.

title: great customer service!
review: their service was excellent and they really took the time to help us out! Charles was wonderful and had such great energy. Recommend highly.

title: Lovely
review: Very enjoyable visit.

title: Ashley and Ashanti 8th
review: Ashley was so helpful and let us know everything we needed to know and Ashanti helped us out and he adjusted our umbrellas how we wanted. They are efficient and worth coming to see if you need anything. I definitely recommend them both.

title: best art show in the world
review: best place to see some of the best artist in the world and lots of famous people and beautiful people from all over the world

title: Historic District
review: Is I is a gorgeous city. The beautiful buildings from the Art Deco era create that charm and warmth. The concentration of amazing buildings in this district is impressive.

title: Glad there are people working to save it from developers
review: A unique neighborhood, well worth preserving.  Especially good in the evening when all the neon and pastal lights are lighting up each unique property.

title: Peaceful!
review: I love the walks at the South Pointe Park. U can enjoy the sunset here, or do some yoga, walk a dog, let the kids to play... Amazing view from all sides!

title: Beautiful sunsets
review: Excellent place for exercising! Biking walking or running paradise! Next to the ocean and beach . Beautiful views . Delicious food options around. Kids friendly,  pet friendly , dog designated trail , it's great for family, romance , business any type of occasion. Sunsets and full moons are gorgeous at this spot.

title: Best spot in Miami Beach
review: South Pointe is very peaceful. It is great to go for a walk, bike around of just sit on the grass / on the beach. If you go early on: it is a beautiful spot to see the sunrise and start the day off great!

title: Great Place to Kill Time
review: We went here midway through our trip then went back the day of our departure, since we had a late flight. It's a great place to people watch, but also has spectacular views of the water and cruise ships as they sail out since the port is very close by. The time flew by while we were there. Very serene and all you pay for is parking. Speaking of, it is a pain to find parking. Public parking was completely full, so the second time around, we had to circle around a few times to find a parking spot, but it was well worth it.

title: Miami Beach Boardwalkdo not
review: Miami Beach boardwalk .Is nice area to walk in Miami beach.It is in the middle beach.It is not crowded like South beach.There are many resturant conected with Miami Beach boardwalk.This area is very large.Moreover, you can cycle in this area. There was a severe lack of amenities such as sale of bottled water or availablity of water. do not miss.

title: Run, walk or ride
review: The Miami beach boardwalk is terrific. A combination of pavers and boardwalk it is convenient for a stroll run or ride. Situated between hotels, apartments etc. and the beach it is great anytime of the day. Don't miss it

title: Nice Walk
review: Nice walkalong the boardwalk - only problem we had was that the streets off the beach werent numbered so got off beach at wrong place and had to walk further than necessary in the heat which wasnt a very nice experience.

title: Nobu Hotel Boardwalk Access
review: Just steps from the beach access of Nobu hotel was this wonderful boardwalk to explore and excersize our morning walks on! Loved having this amenity!

title: Lovely Boardwalk
review: Loved walking down the boardwalk peaking into other hotels. So nice to have a boardwalk to walk down Miami Beach. We took some great photos here as well.

title: Cool to see
review: Was worth driving around and checking out all the fun paintings and murals. Would Recommend when in Miami.

title: Nice place to walk by
review: Great place with some graffiti on the walls. It looked pretty safe to me during the daytime. It is pretty small, you would need no more than 20 minutes there.

title: Street Art
review: The street which Wynwood Walls sits on felt very safe but if you walk away from there be mindful of your surroundings .

title: Wynwood is a world class destination!
review: Wynwood made famous by their murals and walls is now the home to world class bars and restaurants.  Walk into Alter to see what the buzz is about in this gorgeous restaurant.  Stop into the legendary, Gramps Bar, for well made cocktails and live music.  A couple steps more and there are donut shops, boutique shopping and more in an urban yet artsy setting.

title: Main street through South Beach
review: Contains multiple hotels, on both sides of the Avenue, and runs through South Beach to Middle Beach and North Beach.

title: Free trolley buses
review: Collins is beautiful. Art Deco buildings, art galleries, eateries, hotels, shops, but it’s a far walk from the foubtainbleu (44th Street) to Lincoln Road (17th) so take a free trolley bus. They run every 15 minutes. Remember it’s the trolley, not the buses!  That would cost $4.30

title: Nice strip
review: Strip is nice with plenty of hotels,  clubs,  bars,  attractions and it's one block from the beach.  Very busy area with a whole lot of action. Very nice area.

title: Shopping is 5 star
review: Love this place, I come at least once a year! The shops on Lincoln Ave are amazing and and I love the walk along south beach, it gives me a warm fuzzy feeling when I am here. It’s very laid back and feels safe enough. My favourite hotel is the Loews and the restaurants are really good too.

title: Ashley, Marcus and Jace
review: Ashley, Marcus and Jace were wonderful with customer service and gave us a great experience on the beach. There was a bit of confusion with the number of people we had per room, but Ashley dealt with it quickly and made sure to accommodate our needs. Awesome time on South Beach!

title: Miami Beach Park
review: A nice active place, buzzing heaps of people, outdoor fitness gyms, children's playgrounds,volleyball courts,  shelters, walking and biking paths and more well laid out.

title: Ashley & dimitri
review: These two ppl were awesome they took time to listen to our needs and made sure we was tooken care of

title: Ashley and Dimitri
review: Ashley was giving us the best service and made sure we were accommodated as well as dimitri. Dimitri and Ashley were the best most def recommend

title: Great and convenient
review: Julio Bryan jazz min Thank you was wonderful experience thank you for the umbrellas top notch! Very kind people.

title: Interesting architecture
review: We had the half day bus tour passing by the district and learned history about the Art Deco architectural style. It’s pretty interesting and good to know. If you’re into classic architecture then you’ll like the historic style.

title: No No No
review: How is it possible that you ruin such a wonderful place within a few years. If this is America, than it's going down fast .....

title: A definate must see
review: Nice to see all the old buildings being refurbished.  You should even take a tour to learn about the area. I would recommend it. Even if you are from florida

title: Run, bike, chill, swim
review: Peaceful place to visit 24/7 with cool lights at night and a beautiful sunset! Hang your hammocks and watch slack linners and hula hoopers. Great for picnics, riding bikes, running, etc. Trail is always clean and there's even a playground for kids.

title: Take in South Beach and the cruise ship channel
review: Beautiful spot to visit and take in the southern end of Miami Beach and the main ship channel going into Miami’s harbor.  You definitely want to be there in late afternoon to watch the cruise ships leave.  Finally, be sure to go out on the breakwater pier.  Lots of fishing and even better views.

title: Watching the cruise ships depart
review: This is the perfect place to spend an evening watching the cruise ships leave Miami. They come right past you

title: Great place to see the sun go down
review: Great place to just walk around, even have a picnic. Lots of people. But take note, the gate to the pier closes quite early in the evening.

title: Rode bikes from south beach.
review: Very nice area. Check sections where bikes are not allowed to in. Beach is very nice. Para sailing and surfing with sails in this area

title: Goes for miles
review: I wouldn’t recommend walking at night. It appeared this could be a place for transients and some places are very dark.

title: Good for a run and for people watching
review: I took the opportunity to have a run along much of the boardwalk. There are sections of wooded boardwalk where bikes are not allowed, and sections of path. Essentially the boardwalk runs along the beach and connects a lot of hotels. It’s pleasant and lined with lots of foliage. Certainly seemed safe in the daytime. Not sure after dark.

title: Beautiful view and entertainment
review: It’s a great way to pass a few hours in Miami Beach!

title: Brilliant way for exercise in the morning or biking in the afenoon / evening.
review: Well set right in front of the beach and connected to the City through regular small side ways. You are not alone whetehr in the morning for Jogging or afternoon Biking - it is fun. Plenty of People around and here and there performaing artists. It is a great way to get to know Miami Beach from north to south!

title: What happens when you integrate ideas, people and individuality
review: Our Lift driver told us about this place, I did not originally see this as a "site" of interest, maybe I was being too touristy.   What an area, one again the origins of this area speaks loads to the personality and inclusiveness of Miami.  Here the paint and brush strokes beam as brightly as the vibrant colors of some of the graffiti and various other artists.  Both indoor and outdoor pieces covering several blocks.  Just awesome.  It was surprisingly busy, the great thing is its easy to walk to food, but definitely a cool location to peep some good artistic expression.

title: Vibrant district
review: A must visit when in Miami. Certainly safe during the day, we found it to be friendly and very busy. Something interesting to see on every street, including the excellent 'Walls'. Buzzing, quirky a great experience to enjoy. We got there on the free Trolley bus from Biscayne Boulevard which stops in the heart of Wynwood.

title: Relatively New Trendy/Artsy Area
review: Wynwood has lots of art galleries, trendy restaurants and murals on many of the walls, especially the little enclave called Wynwood Walls. It is very crowded on weekends and traffic/parking can be difficult, especially on the second Saturday of each month called Art Walk Miami with large crowds and lots going on. Parking is by Pay By Phone app on the streets or you can valet your car at many restaurants for about $10... but if you are not too far away, take an Uber or Lyft (usually cheaper than Uber-compare prices)

title: Great street
review: A good street to walk down either during the day or at night. It is always busy with lots of shops, restaurants and bars to choose from and at night it comes alive with the same opportunities to shop, eat or drink but the street is filled with lights and music. There are lots of hotels lining the street - possibly because of its location being so close to the beach.

title: Walk walk & walk some more
review: So much to see & get into

title: Stroll along Collins
review: Interesting walk crammed with people..lots of cool Art Deco buildings with a mix of shops and restaurants.  We ate street tacos at Taquiza.  Beach is one block east.  Extra parking up 14th about two blocks.

title: Miami Beach scene
review: Nice place for a stroll and people watching.

title: Two Collins South Beach.
review: Had spent our first trip at Blanc Kara. South of 5th. Very chill. Quiet. Second trip - north of 5th. Entirely different place. Like switching on a light. Crowds - jubilant boarding on more than that. Age difference is noticeable. Collins - a street that offers more than one vibe. Choose accordingly.

title: Beautiful
review: The beach is nice to swim land hang out. I also like to walk along the boardwalk there or go for a run.

title: Very nice to walk the park right on the ocean front
review: Very nice to walk the park right on the ocean front.  Bike rental and public restrooms.  Not enough benches but really beautiful.

title: Richardson domers was amazing !
review: Came to the beach with my girlfriend and couldn’t find chairs and Richardson came to our rescue ! He was so nice and kind and helpful and found us two chairs right away...5 stars for Richardson !

title: Richardson Dormeus
review: This young man made our trip to the beach so comfortable and relaxing. He set up our cabana with ease. He was attentive and very helpful with our questions. And when we asked for suggestions for local fun he confirmed some great places we had looked up before that we were unsure about, but that didn't stop him from helping other people when he needed to. When you talk about friendly customer service this is what I as a tourist look for.

title: Shoppingstreet...
review: it is a street, pedestrians only, with plenty of shops, stores and restaurants. ideally if you want to have a short walk and at the end you are awarded with the beach.

title: A must see for art lovers and beyond....
review: Nothing like this district to witness the consistent growth of artists- new and old. Some pictures are priceless, others are worth taking a risk. Sparkling galleries mixed with the tradition. Birthplace of the Art Deco Period. This area is one of a kind.

title: Super buildings
review: However, the whole area is a bit run down and tacky, and needs transforming as a whole to make the visit worthwhile.

title: For a walk
review: Very nice park to visit by the marina. it's very quiet.It is an upscale neighborhood of South Beach but you can find small restaurants not too expensive

title: Absolutely lovely.
review: Lovely and great for dogs.

title: Favorite Local Hangout
review: I was pleasantly surprised by this large and beautiful park. I was greeted with impressive views of South Beach high-rises, the Miami skyline, and huge condos on Fisher Island.  It was obviously the place to be on a Saturday afternoon.  It was busy, but not at all packed, with people enjoying birthday parties on the grass, fishing on the pier, or cruising by on boats and jet skiis. The only place to eat I noticed in the park was the reknowned and upscale Smith and Wollensky steakhouse, which was doing a brisk business. The park is only steps away from the end of the boardwalk and Loomis beach.  It is also handy to a number of popular and historic restaurants, all south of 5th.

title: Nice place for a Miami Sunset
review: South Pointe Park on the edge of the South Beach deco row was a great place to enjoy the beautiful Miami sunset.  Friendly people gather to enjoy the close of the day.  Lovely place.

title: Nice park
review: A nice park, great for cycling and walking. You can walk to the pier to have a great view of the city.

title: Miami embrace
review: Love it! It’s embracing the whole Miami Beach and the views are devastating at night and daytime!!!!!

title: Very pleasant walk
review: Great for walking in the mornings to start your day, there are places you can stop along the way for a rest. There are a couple of beer gardens operated by the hotels that welcome foot traffic to stop in.

title: Vacation
review: Along the Atlantic Coast.  Beautiful scenery. I felt safe.

title: Lovely
review: No amenities - just a wooden walk surrounded by shrubbery and sand.  Not Coney Island or Wildwood boardwalks.

title: Excellent space along south beach for moonlight strolls
review: Just looking out at night or even during the day at the lovely white sands was breath taking highly reccomend it!!

title: Very interesting art
review: We enjoyed the art.  It was very interesting and unique.  Each wall was different and I understand they change artist often.  Some of it was very impressive.  It is crowded but not so much that you can't get a good view of each wall.

title: Block Party with Wonderful Art
review: Love the murals, they change each time we go.  Wonderful shops, delicious restaurants & drink specials.  A lot to look at, the colorful people & art.  It becomes a block party after dark.  SuViche and Wynwood Kitchen have been our favorite restaurants but I don't think you could go wrong here.

title: Proves art is everywhere
review: Street artists have combined with graffiti artists to revitalize the  neighborhood. Almost every building is decorated with art. Lots of small galleries, coffee shops, and food joints. So grab a coffee, hold someone’s hand, and stroll around the Wynwood area.

title: Oh the buildings
review: I like to walk around and look at the architecture. It's a very busy road but plenty of places to stop for a drink or eat

title: Delightful Avenue
review: With easy access to places in North, Mid, and South Beach, this avenue is quite convenient. Nice to see the high rises, and access to the bay.

title: Walk along Collins
review: I took a walk day and night. Mixed bag of experience. Great shopping, then tourist shops. Great restaurants then poor restaurants. Be patient and you'll find what your looking for...

title: Sun and Fun in South Beach Miami
review: when we visit South Beach we stay on Collins Avenue by 17th Street at the Hotel Marseilles - middle of everything and you can walk almost everywhere on the strip...restaurants are pricey but the food is great wherever you decide to dine! Go and have fun...lots to do on the strip!

title: Ahhh. Salt water in my hair
review: Clean, well groomed beach. Lovely ocean breeze. Hotel provided chairs and towels. Lifeguarded and raked often.

title: The Beat Ever
review: Charles was such a great help. He worked with me and even helped me even tho I was in a rush. I’ll be sure to always look for him when I come to Miami and I’ll be sure to tell all my friends about him. Thank you so much ️

title: Buzzing park by the beach
review: What a great park with so much to do and see. Walking, cycling, dog walking, music, rollerblading and the beach and volleyball etc. fantastic place to relax and get some sun.

title: Very nice beach and employees!
review: Went to the beach and rent some chairs etc at 12 ST. Charles and Desiray are very helpful and made our trip here very comfortable and nice. Great people!

title: Good review from worker
review: Was in vacation in Miami Beach and Charles did an amazing job helping me and my friend . We appreciate him very much .

title: a must go place if you coming to miami!!!
review: I am in South Beach pretty much every weekend now that I live here... The ocean is beautiful, there's a great vibe and happy people all over the place... One place to see for sure if you come visit!!!

title: Beautiful, well-kept beach
review: This is a great beach to spend the day at. No issues finding shaded seating and the water was crystal clear! They serve lunch, drinks, and rent towels all right there by the water. It definitely gives Hawai’i’s beaches a run for their money!

title: Stretches as far as the eye can see
review: It is convenient if you are staying close by though.

title: Don't Miss!
review: A beautiful place with photo opps all over the place!  Put this on your to do list.  Plenty of places to rent lounges and umbrellas!

title: Amazing beach
review: Beautiful beach, clean and lot nice people, beautiful women’s clear water, surf, sky surfing and more

title: Cool tour!
review: We took the walking tour and it was very good.  The tour guide was  well versed in all aspects of the architecture.  It was very hot, but worth the effort to get the behind the sceens information about these wonderful buildings.

title: Interesting buildings. Fun to imagine how it used to be in more elegant times.
review: Miami is a fun and colorful and has art deco history that makes it unique. Take a walk or bike tour. Juxataposed with new construction it makes you appreciate the way things were in the past.

title: Walking tour from guide book
review: Great walking tour - starting in the interesting Art Deco museum and taking in some fabulous landmarks . Well worth a trip

title: Gorgeous views, park love!!!
review: This place is really nice to spend a few hours walking. Beautiful views of downtown Miami, the bay and beaches. Very dog, kid, people friendly. I believe you can take the Miami Beach Boardwalk straight into this park which is the southern most point of Miami Beach.  Great restaurant located right in the park. Smith and Wollensky. On Sunday around 430-5 you can watch all the cruises depart out to the Caribbean.

title: Great Green Space and Views of Beach, Islands and Cruise Ships
review: We walked down to the point, which is itself fun if you see all the Art Deco buildings along the way.  The point itself has a pier reaching out along the waterway where boats leave the Miami harbor, including gigantic cruise ships if you time it right.  Good views north up the beach and of Fisher's Islands and down the coast also.  Nice that no building close by so some open space, hard to come by in Miami Beach.

title: South Beach Tranquility
review: We visited South Point Park in January 2019 while staying in South Beach. We reached the park by walking along the paved Beach Promenade down from about 16th Street to 5th Street and then continuing past South Point Drive to the southernmost point of Miami Beach. The reward is a beautiful park with a pier and great views of Miami Beach and the docked cruise ships, as well as a calmer beach scene. There are also several really nice restaurants in that area.

title: Beautiful and Serene.
review: Beautiful spot to visit. Great walk from central South Beach.  Great to see the Charter cruises coming and going as well as the Cargo ships.

title: Sunset Spectacular
review: Love going down to South Point Park to watch the Cruise Ships set out to sea & the sunset is always spectacular very relaxing & an enjoyable walk to the pier at the end. Come early since its hard to park & ships set out before sunset. Usually there is a turnover of parking spaces between 3:30pm to 4:30pm with people leaving the beach.

title: A must for muscles, music, and movement
review: My husband and I took a bike ride along Miami Beach in the early evening, and I would definitely recommend! We did on an early Friday evening, and although it was very busy, the pathways were large enough to comfortably ride and still leave enough room others. Walkers, runners, and even a woman on roller skates pushing a stroller, it is accessible to everyone! Don't forget to stop by Muscle beach to check out the almost full outdoor gym and gymnasts!

title: Love it
review: Great for get some workout, walking or bicycling, a combination of walkway and wooden decking, it's perfect for a stroll also.

title: Very long and clean seashore
review: It's a must to visit place if you are in Miami. Very clean and has many connections to the shore. On the shore you can rent umbrellas and seats also for about 20 bucks. If you forget your sun guard cream they have some free for you.

title: So relaxing!
review: Great place to spend the evenings wondering around and people watching. There are sometimes people selling little trinkets where you can pick up little souvenirs.

title: Break away
review: Spent one of days here on the beach. The wind was very strong so the waves where high. The loungers are available for $20 each and another $20 if you want an umbrella. There is booths on the beach the sell snacks and soft drinks. Most families had their own picnics. The beach becomes very full around midday. Watersports are available not sure of the cost. Lifeguard was available and very busy due to the wind and high waves

title: Beautiful beach
review: South beach is a beautiful clean beach especially if one is visiting with family.The weather in November was also awesome.

title: Spectacular wide stretch of white sand beach !
review: Awsome beach !  the water was warm and aqua blue.  Our hotel offered lounger chairs and wait staff who delivered our drinks right to the chair !!  I would come back again for sure

title: Terrible
review: First and last visit to Miami if your thinking of driving the 3-4 hours it takes from Orlando think again we lasted one hour before everyone agreed to get the hell out of there

title: Clean and welcoming
review: Gently sloping sand lead you to a warm welcoming sea to cool down.

title: The perfect walk
review: While staying at the Fontainblu hotel, every morning I took the boardwalk down to South Beach. Walk is well maintained and is a popular attraction. Once you get to South Beach it’s back in time to Miami Vice. Then I would back to the hotel up Collins Avenue. I waiting to see Sinatra in one of the bars

title: A must see in Miami
review: I have been living in South Florida for 2 years and had not hit up Wynwood yet til last week! It was a bit hot but loved going and checking out the walls and market place. There are so many options for food and things to do. And of course, bring your camera.

title: Nice Night
review: Went with my wife at night and got to see some of the wall art. The few places to eat and clubs around it make a nice ambient. Its a must go when visiting Miami.

title: Amazing place
review: To think that these amazing pieces of art are all put down every year to create some new is absolutely insane. Incredible place, incredible art and this is a place that either you see it or you miss it, as this pieces of street art celebrate the constant reinventing of art

title: walking and watching
review: i loved walking and watching the people along this beautiful strip.  I could spend every day and night in this magnificent area.

title: Tourist haven
