review: This spot is popping especially at night. The nightlife with nearly infinite bars and restaurants to choose from while people watching and seeing the expensive cars drive by.  There is something to do until the wee hours of the morning.

title: Fabulous cars and stunning architecture
review: We walked the full length of ocean drive and ended up at south beach park pier. I’d recommend it if you like the quieter aspects of a city.

title: Double Husband Bestfriend Bday
review: What can I say, I mean the weekday night vibes the weekend all day vibes were lit. We had a blast especially at voodoo lounge and wet willies. Learned some new interesting things, saw crazy cars, the views were amazing, and the people were awesome. I can't wait to go back. I loved all the different cultures, tried new things, experienced new styles. We even made friends and business ventures. Networking is important and building relationships is important. The strip had a lot to offer. Plenty of hotels, lounges, clubs, bars, resturants, and photo shoot opportunities.

title: Main drag
review: Our hotel was on Collins Avenue so we spent a good deal of time walking around. It is a vital street in Miami full of famous hotels, restaurants and businesses.

title: Lots of action on the Avenue.
review: Collins is quite a stretch across Miami Beach. From north to South there’s tons to do. There are many restaurants and shops and beach front access at certain points. Parking can be difficult. There’s a public bus running along the Ave.

title: Beautiful Avenue
review: It was neat and clean,well connected with Linchon street with free trollies ,which was a great asset to toursists as we saved money on transport. Large number of hotels are located in this avenue.

title: Lovely beach
review: Not crowded, wide, clean and lovely beach. Easy to access all the way from the boardwalk. Restrooms available several places along the beach.

title: Clean beach
review: We visited in November during the weekdays. It was not crowded at all, the beach was very clean. The water was warm. Nice walkways near the beach for a stroll.

title: Wonderful Beach !
review: Don't miss to pay a visit to this wonderful when you are in Miami.

title: Always great
review: Great place to visit and to sightsee (people watch). The beach is beautiful and all the activity makes it fun.

title: One of the best beach in the world..
review: South Beach is magical, We stayed there for 8 nights. It was my best days of my life.. If you can, book a hotel in South Beach and enjoy your stay.

title: Beautiful Hotels, Shops and Places To Eat
review: Collins is miles and miles of endless things to do. It has affordable dining all the way to fine dining. Affordable hotels all the way to to 5 star resorts. Collins has it all, in Miami you're going to spend alot of time on it!

title: Nothing special
review: There is a supermarket which is worth a visit.

title: Beach visit
review: Charles and Kayla were delightful!!lots of ice crean options! Definitely recommend if you're coming for the day

title: South beach!
review: Had some great accommodations with Alieana & Charles A as they helped me with a nice tent & great customer service. They made things a lot easier & worth coming to the beach.

title: Ocean Drive
review: Ocen Drive is the main street in Miami Beach across from South Beach. It is lined with many restaurants, shops and hotels. Be sure to read reviews on the restaurants as it seems some take advantage of their location and use it as an excuse to overcharge for their food while not caring much about the quality.

title: Worth Only Five Minutes to See
review: Overrun with tourists and the restaurants all just try to grab you from the streets. Go there for five minutes just to see it and then leave.

title: Great placeforvac
review: We love ocean dr great place for vacation very fun nice beach great hotel and restaurant we come bavk soon

title: Ocean drive the place to be!
review: If you stay in a hotel on the strip you will be on ocean drive everything you need is right there! Drinks beach clubs ‍️

title: Surprisingly Annoying
review: Here's a tip - if you want to walk down Ocean Drive at night, walk on the Ocean Side, otherwise you have to weave your way through sidewalk restaurants while you're hustled to come in and eat, with employees shoving menus in your face.  Honestly, kind of left a bad taste in my entire Miami experience.

title: Unique items for sale in tents/booths on Sunday beginning in the morning!!
review: I loved the shopping they had in the park on the Sunday we were there in May.  I am not sure if this is every Sunday or not.  I purchased some very nice and unique jewelry pieces for a great price.  They had things for purchase like art, cellphone cases, clothing, shoes and jewelry.

title: Family vacation
review: Nice service , amazing compliment to my vacation Charles was very helpful and friendly went over an beyond to make sure we had everything we needed thank you Charles!!

title: Fun but expensive
review: We had a great time and would highly recommend especially in the evening.  BUT it is very expensive, even one of our group who as American felt the prices were expensive and the  taxes, gratuities and service charges were over the top.

title: Halloween week break
review: Went to south beach Miami for the sun and relaxation and it didn’t disappoint. Every day was sunny and temperatures in the high 20s

title: Such a cool beach.
review: Such a cool beach area,  full of vibrancy and great place to people watch.  The beach itself is very clean and very well kept.  Would definitely visit again

title: Real beach
review: They provide chairs and towels from the hotel but without umbrella you have to pay for it.

title: Loved it!
review: The beach is HUGE! Acres of white sand, colourful umbrellas and fabulous lifeguard stations. There are even suncream dispensers! We absolutely loved it.

title: Really great service!!
review: Came out to chill on the beach for a bit and ran into 3 young gentlemen who made my experience way better than I expected. Machine ashanti and richard

title: Miles of beach
review: Miles of sandy beach.  Great boardwalk for walking or biking.  You can just sit and relax and watch all the volleyball games.  Great place to sit and people watch.

title: Miami Nights
review: We had such an amazing time in Miami... LOVE THE NIGHT LIFE. There's so much to do, so many places to eat and dance.

title: It was a really great experience - we enjoyed our drinks and liked it very much. You should definitely come here and dri
review: It was a really great experience - we enjoyed our drinks and liked it very much. You should definitely come here and dri

title: Vibrant scene
review: Ocean Drive is a very busy and eclectic area of South Beach. Matter of fact, one shouldn't visit south beach and not go on Ocean Drive. Lots of places to eat and shop and at night the street come alive. Just be prepared to be in traffic, that's just Ocean Drive.

title: Too much of everything 😊
review: We went down the road, but it was too loud for us. You cant sit down and just talk, because the music comer from all around. It is great for party, but if you want a dinner and talk, you shoul go up the street.

title: Nice enjoyable walk
review: As you walk along the promenade you can image the early days when the deco style hotels where in there peak. Still lovely and busy with tourist spots

title: It's a ZOO!
review: Very disappointed in the restaurant scene.  They have people stationed on the sidewalks to grab you and try to talk you into eating at their restaurants - all along Ocean Drive.  There is no dress code for the restaurants and we felt some people were very inappropriately dressed or more like not dressed!  Seriously, no matter how liberal you may be, you would lose your apetite!  Eat at the restaurants that are off of Ocean Drive!

title: Nice to walk but the drive......
review: Driving this can be tricky.  The walk is nice but it is a bit busy and if you walk the water side it is more enjoyable.

title: Amazing place!
review: This was a unique experience! Great and very clean beaches, friendly people! So many things to see! I would recommend this place for sure!

title: Seaweed?
review: With all the articles from this summer showing pictures and videos of the seaweed at Miami Beach we were worried about what we would find. I am happy to say there was NO SEAWEED AT ALL. Bravo Miami, whatever you did to clean it up worked. Beaches were beautiful!

title: Loved window shopping and getting fruit at the outdoor stands
review: In addition to all the shops there was a wonderful pizza place-Rustica Pizza was a bargain at $11 for a generous size persona pizza with salad and a drink. Great service,too.

title: Beautiful
review: South beach was perfect for relaxing and fun. Nice clear water. sand soft and chairs available for purchase if you didn’t pack your own.

title: Férias
review: Amazing place to be alone, with friends or family. Safety place to stay e enjoy the sea and the view.

title: Beautiful beach
review: Absolutely loved spending time on this stretch of beach. I would recommend going at sunrise, the colours are stunning

title: Clean bustling beach
review: Great place to immerse yourself in all of the cultures that flock to Miami. The water is blue, the beach is clean but restroom facilities are scarce.

title: Great beach.
review: Beautiful beach.  Some mention it as being dirty but not what I saw.  Really nice and not too crowded.  Long and big.  A must visit.

title: Cascade of Pastels
review: Such a beautiful area. Can’t get enough of the beautifully preserved Art Deco Hotels. It’s so amazing to look at the architecture and the colours. The names are all so interesting.

title: Lovely   Area
review: The Miami Beach Architectural District is a U.S. historic district located in the South Beach neighborhood of Miami Beach, Florida.The Art Deco district is a beautiful area in Miami beach and the area famous in Italian fashion designer Gianni Versace resided, in a mansion on Ocean Drive.There are cool resturants in this area.fun to walk around.must-see in South Beach. There are lots of activites.

title: lots of nice old buildings
review: lots of lovely art deco buildings with lots of restaurants.  unfortunately there is a lot of construction work going on at the moment so doesnt have the same appeal

title: bike path along South Miami Beach
review: lovely views and places to sit after enjoying a 2 hour bike ride along the beach path.The City Bike rental stops offer comfortable bikes at a reasonable rental rate of 10.00$ .

title: Nice Art Deco Buildings with Hotels, Bars and Restaurants
review: I have been to South Beach many times and each time it’s a different experience; it honestly depends when during the year you visit or which day of the week.  On a Friday or Saturday the crowd is younger and louder.   If you come during the beginning of the week I find it more pleasant because it’s less rowdy.    Ocean Street is a must when you are in this area.   There are popular bars and restaurants.  If you like to see shows then try the Mango Tropical Café, different type of shows and performances.   There is also a nice outside dancing bar called the Clevelander which is very popular.  You will find Ocean Street a very busy street with people and lots of nice cars sometimes too.

title: Expensive but entertaining
review: Our hotel was located on the Ocean Drive, and the street is very busy with a lot of restaurants and bars, which is very nice. Though the location and popularity also brings up the prices and it was really expensive here compared to the streets just one block away from the beach. Nice strolling area.

title: Beautiful views!
review: Walked up and down Ocean Drive with hubby and enjoyed all the shops and restaurants. A little crowded but still a must do when coming to Miami.

title: Over rated crowded and looking like the NYC village in days gone by
review: The food is awful and expensive  It is crowded.  I would rather walk up into the old Miami Beach area and spend time with authentic Floridians

title: Brilliant
review: Any time, but specially at night thanks to all the colors from the neon lights. Amazing, not to be missed.

title: Best place in a sunny day
review: I friend of mine who lives in Miami took me to this awesome area. Lots of people hanging around, taking pictures or just watching the beautiful landscape. Really nice place.

title: Awesome view
review: This place is absolutely stunning. While walking down the beach, it's a big plus to make a stop here to view the huge yachts, houses and a beautiful view of the clear blue ocean. Mind that it's more or less a viewing point rather than an actual park.

title: Lovely park
review: Lovely park at the tip of south beach. Nice walking trails, the pier is relatively new & very nice, great place for a walk.

title: Fab park with beautiful views and tons to do
review: Also walking distance up Ocean Dr. to Art Deco district where all the action is (7-14th).

title: Love
review: I love this boardwalk.  You could literally take a walk along ocean drive while on the boardwalk.  I’ve done it from the 3900 block of Collins to South beach.  It was a very nice walk.

title: Incredible place
review: So nice ...

title: Miami Beach Boardwalk it fantastic!
review: The boardwalk goes from one end of Miami Beach to the other. It is great for running, and for leisurely activities.

title: Beautiful
review: Beutiful walk in a garden trail by the beach, recommended during sunset. Its not a must, but if you fancy a nice walk, that's the place

title: great walls!
review: amazing walls, and everything is amazing! once you go in all you see is great paint and walls here! very interestring

title: Amazing graffiti
review: Very interesting place to visit. The "Walls" place itself is very small, takes 15 minutes to review, instead I advise to circle around the whole neighborhood in a vehicle, and see all the buildings, they are amazing

title: A MUST SEE
review: This is art.  The canvas is many many city blocks.  The art is AMAZING.  I have seen alot of street art around the world and this display tops them all.  My favorite part of Miami and in my opinion the #1 site to see.  So unique, you will not see a better display of free form street art in the world.

title: Cool area
review: Good area, but I expected it to be bigger than it actually was. It was a big parking just a few blocks up the street.

title: Little Havana
review: Feels like your in Cuba! Excellent food and always a great band to see. Beach in always near by. Take a stroll a nigh for sure!

title: Bit of a let down
review: The architecture is stunning but the area feels seedy - it’s a bit like a Magalluf. We walked the drive on a Sunday afternoon which I think was a mistake - go to see the buildings but go on a weekday when it’s less club 18-30 - unless you want that!

title: Nice experience
review: Spoilt for choice in restaurants. A nice stroll too. I would take a walk first, see the menus of all the different restaurants and then pick. all of them (or the majority) have giant cocktails (Not for the light hearted).

title: mini NYC tons of food, drinks and exotic cars
review: you will go crazy over all the restaurants, dance clubs, cafes and all the scenes of Ocean Drive.  The beach is right there so you can get away from the noise and crowds. There are lots of exotic cars passing by all the time and it caught me cause I am a car guy.  We took a stop in an outside bar and I had one of the best Pina colada ever. A must must when you ever visit Miami. Trust me you will enjoy and you can thank me later.

title: busy
review: busy road full of art deco buildings, clubs and restaurants.  Lots of building work going on at the moment/

title: You have to visit Ocean Drive...
review: The atmosphere is great, the sights (and there are some of those) the sounds, and just people wondering around, seems to be the place is you want to see or have a fancy car too, everyone having fun

title: Its Ocean Drive. Enough said.
review: Amazing, could happily spend hours sitting at a street cafe/bar watching the world go by. If you love cars, you will love Ocean Drive.

title: Beautiful Architecture, restaurants and bars right on the beach.
review: Ocean Drive is such a beautiful street with many bars and restaurants to choose from, there is always a party going on and is quite loud throughout the night. Very safe area.

title: Night out
review: This was my 7th time there, and it never ceases to amaze me. In love

title: Trashy and Expensive
review: Won’t be back.

title: Shopping on Collins ave
review: Allens Avenue is a pretty long and busy street.  On the south end there is some shopping. Zara H&M Armani Exchange Adidas etc. hotels restaurants etc.  I normally stay on 39th and Collins where it’s quiet  located a block. Away from the actual ocean.

title: Hip Hotels , history and hot people
review: We love stopping in the fabulous hotels when on Collins. Collins Avenue, also known as State Road A1A, is the main hotel strip and shopping area in Miami Beach and runs parallel to the beach. The Delano is worth a stroll through especially at night with all the white curtains, lobby, lighting and Art deco style. This street is different during the day and is a must see trip at night too.

title: Down memory lane!
review: Came here has a kid and remains pretty much the same. Great varied stores.  Now multi lingual and a melting pot of different countries. Lively and colorful with pretty good pricing. Fun day trip and close to most too hotels.

title: Loved it!
review: Our hotel was on Collins Avenue and we literally did not have to drive anywhere! Are hotel had a restaurant on the first floor but we we also surrounded by several dining options. There were clothing stores nearby as well as the beautiful beach!

title: Walking around
review: There are a few bars and restaurants near our hotel! Good area. Beach access! We checked out the turtle nests on the beach, and had a walk on the boardwalk.

title: Lummus beach
review: Marcus is amazing!! He providing great service and was always helpful. Really enjoyed the stay. Definitely recommend!!

title: Josue is the BEST!
review: Had a great time at the beach. Josue was so helpful, and made our day at the beach even better! Great company... give Josue a raise!!

title: Vacation
review: Hello i was more then gladly to be assisted by Jose and marcus on 8th street today in the afternoon they did the most to make me and my wife feel great and enjoy. JOSE AND MARCUS ARE GREAT MEN

title: Boucher Brothers
review: Tim & Jaylene

title: Comments
review: Josue was the best beach service we have had! We love Miami! We look forward to returning soon. We can’t wait!

title: Family meal
review: Thanks we will certainly return here on our next visit!!  I highly recommend to both couples and large groups alike!

title: Couples trip to South Beach
review: Me and my husband spent  5 days in South Beach on a mini vacay away from the kids. The beaches were beautiful, shopping close by, dancing, nightlife, lots of culture and many activities! Highly recommended for anyone wanting to get away and having a lot of options on the beach to keep you busy, and having fun!

title: Beautiful beach
review: It’s a Long Beach but there are many lifeguards. Also good is the access to rental pedal bikes nearby.

title: Amazing beach
review: Spent only a short time but what a crystal clear blue water , not very cold and also drinks and stuff available. Problem is expensive

title: Fabulous tour of history, art, architecture ...splendid deco masterpieces.
review: Kudos Julie! Thank you for a memorable tour...and great restaurant suggestion: Stiltsville! It was yummy.

title: If your into shopping place to go
review: This is one of the larger shopping areas in miami beach.Big names and small shops cover every need.Their is also a market on some days a very vibrant area lots of restaurants plus traffic free.

title: Everything tourists need
review: On this road, it has all of shopping amenities anyone could ask for. My husband and I saw two lemurs riding in a bike basket. Interesting to say the least.

title: Over hyped.
review: Over hyped.  Not as good as I thought.  Shopping was OK.  Standard restaurants and bars.  Big road.  Wide avenue.

title: Pedestrian area
review: Good selection of shops, bars, restaurants and cafes. At the weekend there are stall selling  arts and crafts as well as food

title: When on SoBe take a stroll down Lincoln Rd
review: Lincoln Road is a great spot to eat, drink, shop and people watch. Yes, it is over rated, but it's an area that you should visit while visiting  SoBE; day or night. It's really entertainment for the entire family; enjoy and listen to some live music, dance to the Latin beats or smooth sounds, gaze at the wide variety of street performers or blow giant bubbles with the kids. Have no expectations and you'll be happy that you took a stroll donw the road.

title: A step back in time
review: A walk or a drive down Collins Avenue offers shops, cafés, and a little touch of history. Several locations have been movie sets and you never know who you’ll run into.

title: Beautiful architecture and Beach
review: Beautiful architecture, the beach is a few steps away, beautiful cars and one of the best places in Miami.

title: Unique Place with great food
review: The place with a difference - plenty of art and enthusiastic People enjoying it. The Restaurants have truly authentic cuisine and friendly Service - Prices very reasonable. A fun night out from the beach.

title: nice walk on Ocean drive
review: Especially if you can make the movie connections with some of these places, it is very nice to walk on Ocean drive, between the beach area and the hotels. A bit price but well worth it at least once...  and some art deco is worth the detour.

title: Worth a walk through, absolutely
review: This park is at the end of the beach and has excellent views of the water and harbor and all of Miami Beach.  It is particularly fun to watch the cruise ships heading in and out with all the other boats moving around them!  You have no idea how truly large they are until they pass you by.  Great walking paths, good green spaces, a very nice restaurant, super fun dog park, iguanas in the trees (!) and a long pier to walk.  Nice marina at the end.  Absolutely worth a visit.

title: Beautiful pier
review: Great views of the beach and ocean from the pier. It's a quiet beautiful place to walk and take pictures.

title: Walking & relaxing
review: This is an area that is well worth seeing and truly relaxing. Very well kept gardens. Fantastic boats and boardwalk. Little quieter than the South Beach area.

title: City Treasure
review: So I stayed at the Palms and was a little confused by this at first, but then I loved it. Miamians were walking, running, biking down it as I crossed over to enjoy an early morning coffee on the beach. More cities should do this, but everywhere aint Miami

title: Beautiful walk!
review: This is a great way to get around and see the beautiful beaches of Miami Beach! You can also stop at some of the hotels for a meal! But, beware, even though there are signs about no bicycles, some people will fly by you! Parts of the boardwalk are shaded...so it’s a nice walk!

title: Great way to comfortably get around at your own pace
review: Plenty of runners and people just strolling. Super fun!

title: Lovely way to get to 10,000 steps
review: I enjoyed the walk but I was surprised no WC along the way and only one pricey snack bar...I started around 28th street

title: Love it
review: What a great boardwalk very active friendly and clean place to enjoy walking skating bike riding or whatever your pleasure

title: Love the walls!
review: A visit to Miami  is not complete without a visit to Wynwood Walls. Amazing murals in an up and coming neighborhood. Joey's Italian restaurant and a visit to Parker Warnby (eye glasses) are good add is

title: Urban Art is Everywhere - the walls, the streets, the signs...
review: See this spot before it gets paved over and gentrified.  Get your camera out and walk around.  There is so much to see.  It's safe and friendly with small galleries, boutiques and cafes everywhere.  Spent what I consider the perfect afternoon wandering about.

title: Wynwood Factory Club
review: If you want to find a place with great music And amazing ambiance- then your place to go is Wynwood Factory - Music starts around 3pm - wear comfortable clothing and shoes because you won’t stop dancing .

title: the street art is amazing
review: wonderful place to walk around, have a drink or something to eat.  True bohemian flavor of this hip neighborhood.

title: Great
review: So much to do lots of people, traffic is a bit crazy but we had lots of fun and met lot of nice locals

title: Fall break
review: Close to our hotel. Great biking and walking trail. Parks, bathroom and public parking. Road construction going on in front so the traffic is a bit congested.

title: Ocean Drive is awesome!
review: Visiting Ocean Drive is a must when in Miami. It's like being in a movie. It offers the opportunity for great pictures and a nice stroll along South Beach. There's also a Muscle Beach outdoor gym for those who want to keep they're fitness levels up.

title: Beautiful
review: Seeing Miami on Ocean Drive, quite an experience!   Restaurants lined up along the way, with Cuban cuisine being the main fare along with burgers and more.

title: Old folks alley replaced by trendy shops, restaurants and niche hotels.
review: Drive the ten blocks plus for an interesting look of trendy changes. People watching is a favorite. Interesting myriad of YOUNG people dressed in coloque of style, color, dress (and undress). Drive will take 50 minutes in season, but a must see.

title: Good for shopping and eating
review: We strolled along Collins Street many times whilst visiting Miami, South Beach. Lots of shops and restaurants along the way. So many cool Art Deco buildings on this street. Make sure you travel up here at night to see the hotels all lit up.

title: Will be back for sure
review: We walked this strip a few times while visiting and it's just a fun place.  You meet and see some fun people.  Did a little shopping too.  Of course I did.

title: Great walking
review: Busy area. Great for people watching. Lots of hotels, restaurants and bars. It might be noisy if you are on the southern end of collins.

title: A Very safe place
review: I felt very safe walking down this street and although it is full of hotels and shops it still offers a nice walk. also the Free Trolley passes from here making it convenient if you get tired.

title: Great walking
review: It safe area,There are many resturants ,shops and hotels in this area.It might be noisy if you are on the southern end of collins.You must see in Miami beach.

title: Beautiful!
review: This park is beautiful! The area around the park is beautifully landscaped with palm trees, outdoor showers, and a bathroom. The beach is every better. The white sand is easy to walk on and has small sea shells in it. Depending on the day the water is clear and a beautiful blue. There are umbrellas and seating available everywhere (you have to rent them) and plenty of spots for you if you just have a towel. The are many lifeguard towers. There are also a lot of trash cans. Right outside the park is Ocean Drive an Art Deco historical street lined with expensive hotels, bars, and restaurants. There is also a boardwalk that goes all the way up or down to other areas and beaches. It's great to walk on and a quick way to get around. The only down side to this park is you need to watch your stuff, as there are homeless people wandering the beach and streets.

title: Beach exp
review: Tim and jawena were awesome and very helpful and informative. Due to them we had a very good experience. Thanks guys!!

title: Beach trip
review: Charles from 6th Street and Rashied were extremely helpful. They made sure that all was well with our Cabana and made sure we had towels to go with them. We had an awesome time. Thanks Boucher Brothers

title: About G and Rich
review: They’ve been working out in this heat for a long time and making sure ppl weren’t just taking the items that needed to be paid for! They were ON it and again working in this extreme hotness STILL doing their jobs and such

title: Fourth of July Weekend
review: Me and my cousin had a great time thanks to G and Rich Boucher Brothers Staff. Nice cabanas, clean towels, good service

title: Beach Days
review: South Beach was clean and very pretty. We enjoyed several afternoons during our vacation here. Such great views, and very walkable.

title: Narrow beach with very limited parking, difficult to access
review: Like much of Florida, this beach falls between the Atlantic and a brief nature buffer designed to protect the over-developed waterfront.  The area between the strand and the nature buffer was relatively narrow compared to many other beaches we've been on; winter storms remove much of the sand, and Miami Beach has struggled with beach replenishment.  Umbrellas and lounges are available, but the cost is excessive.  There is a boardwalk (covered in a separate review), but it does not have view of nor is it within view of the beach.  Access to this beach is via the beachfront hotel you are staying in, or via foot at passthroughs from A1A.  Street parking here is very limited and very expensive, so access to this beach is defacto limited to those who stay in the local hotels.  If your primary interest is surf and sand, there are much better beaches to visit.  I will say it was clean, although there were no trash cans in evidence.

title: South Beach, Miami
review: South Beach Miami is one of the main beaches of Miami, Florida. It is a long and wide beach with gorgeous clean white sand. The waves are not surf waves and the sea can be choppy. There is a long walking path next to the beach that makes moving from one part to another easy. The beach is often very crowded and there is a lot of activity, volleyball etc. Along the beach are areas where you can hire a deck chair and an umbrella. I loved watching the afternoon fleet of cruise ships leave the harbour from the south end of the beach - starts about 5pm.

title: great beach!
review: very nice beach, very popular.  great place to people-watch or enjoy the sand.   be sure to explore the boardwalk too.

title: Delightful beach
review: I lived in Rio for 20 years, so I know beaches. Don't know if we hit exceptional weather, but the water was delightful: almost warm, gentle waters, nice sandy bottom. In certain spots, it's shallow for many yards out. Clean beach. Went on a Monday, so there were no crowds.

title: Good to spend a day
review: I am not a fan of zoos but came here to see what it had to offer. Prices should be lower considering what they offer. I have to admit that there’s plenty of space for the animals and many different places to rest as you have to walk a lot. Bring your snacks and spend your day doing something different!

title: Great place to shop and hang
review: Definitely a must see when in South Beach!  Great shopping and restaurants. Happy hours at many of the bars throughout the day so you can always take a shopping break and hav a couple cocktails.

title: Lincoln Road ROCKS!
review: Lincoln Road rocks! Tons of great places to eat, inside or outside on the mall, tons of shopping, and even better people watching. If you're in Miami Beach it is a MUST DO!

title: It’s still nice
review: Lincoln Road is not what it used to be with Artist Studios and boutiques, However it’s still very pleasant to stroll on the Avenue

title: Halloween on Lincoln
review: Best place to people/costume watch in sobe. We got a pre-fix table for dinner with the kids from 7p-10p to watch the Halloween procession march by. Great fun and food. Incredible original costumes. Be advised, The later it gets the crazier and skimpier the costumes get.

title: nice
review: nice place to visit a lot of nice coloured buildings. It is a joy for all the family members to enjoy.

title: It’s a must see
review: We walked the full length of south beach. The architecture along ocean drive especially is just amazing and wonderful that much of it has been preserved. It’s an absolutely must see if you’re in the area, whether you like architecture or not I’m sure you’ll be impressed.

title: A must see area
review: If you are in the vicinity of this area then you need to pay it a visit, really impressive art deco architecture, showcasing some briliiant hotels, restaurants and bars.

title: A Good Thing Ruined
review: My wife and I have been going to South Beach since we met in the 80's. When we first visited it was before the trendy fashion model crowd and Miami Vice made the area popular again. In the 80's the place was on the cusp and was inhabited by older Jewish retirees and gays. Over the years it has become somewhat of a tourist trap. The photo at the top of the page says it all. The canopies and umbrellas were not part of the original art deco look. Under each canopy is a bar and restaurant. They are a way of the hotels maximizing their income in addition to renting rooms. And you get bombarded with menus in your face as you walk down the street. I usually end up crossing Ocean Drive and walking on the other side as to not get mugged by hostesses. At night the place is beautiful with the neon aglow. But with tourists come the thugs and rift raft associated. Lots of pot smoke and kids just walking around. Maybe I'm just getting old.

title: love it so cool
review: this area of Miami is one of my faves Lots of cool peeps hanging and chillin and lotsa sweet rides being shown off by all the car buffs. It is in a lot of ways like going back in time. Way cool

title: Neat spot for views
review: The short pier at the end of the park looks new and is in a neat place right on the corner of the ocean and the shipping channel into Miami Port. Excellent for views of downtown Miami, for people watching those on South Beach, or watching fishing from the pier. Great spot to relax for 15 minutes or so taking in the views.

title: Beautiful Beach
review: Great energy, lots of fun. Beautiful beaches, geared towards the high energy of Miami. This place is rocking from morning til night!

title: Views are Great
review: This is where the channel for the port of Miami starts and ends for the big ships, mostly cruiselines.  The point is well developed with grass and very wide walking pathways.  Since most cruises depart the port in the evening, it is a great location to see the ship(s) depart.

title: Relaxing day, come waters, nice views
review: Great beach, great water temps, nice relaxing crowd, relaxing atmosphere. You can also watch cruise liner exiting atlantic ocean. D

title: Great Place to Walk, Stroll or Run
review: If you do not feel like walking on sand but wish to see the sand and sea - then definitely go for a walk on the boardwalk. There is ample shade and you can still get sun too if you wish. The boardwalk is well kept and it is wide enough for multiple walkers. There are no biking signs but there seems to be tourists or perhaps locals leisurely riding bikes on the boardwalk - best to stay somewhat alert during a morning stroll or afternoon walk just in case the bike riders are not paying attention.

title: Nice place for beach strolling !
review: The Miami Beach Boardwalk is a nice place for strolling along the beach, surrounded  by palmes and flowers, perfect walking both in daytime a in the evening.

title: Boardwalk with Beautiful Views!
review: Always nice to go for a walk on the boardwalk, along this famous beach.  It’s almost always very hot and humid, so plan accordingly and hydrate yourself.  Watch out for birds pooping on you from the trees as you pass under them. Nice views of the pools and backs of all the hotels and resorts and clear, beautiful views of the beach and ocean.  Something we do each time we come to Miami!

title: Beach and city access
review: An easy and relaxing way to migrate through town, all with an eye on the beach and ocean. Keep alert for wheeled devices.

title: Miami Nice
review: Wynwood is the place to visit if you're looking for a hip place.  The neighborhood attracts artists and has plenty of galleries, showrooms, boutiques, cafes and restaurants.  Go and enjoy its laid back, counter-culture vibe before gentrification takes over.  It gets humming during Art Basel in early December, but then you'll have to put up with the crowds specially in the evenings.

title: Mesmerizing
review: When in Miami don't miss this open air museum. Famous international artists show their  masterpieces here. Awesome huge artworks. Free entrance

title: Really interesting area in Miami - have a walk
review: Wynwood has been transfering into an open air museum; street art around everywhere, not always equally beautiful, but many highlights around. Don't forget to visit Wynwood Walls.

title: Cool part of Miami to visit
review: Heard that Wynwood was worth checking out so went there for an afternoon, whilst in Miami on honeymoon. Liked it for its interesting choice of shops and places to eat - not mainstream, much for independents and amazing wall art. A nice contrast to the glitz of downtown or south beach. Worth a trip! Ps - noticed, we couldn’t get an uber back from here but fortunately a regular taxi passed us by and kindly took us back to SB.

title: Must visit
review: Must see place when in Miami. It is free to see the walls, great for photos and there are lots of good eats in the immediate area.

title: Fountainblea
review: I've always wanted to visit this ICONIC hotel. Such history and elegance. From the staircase to nowhere to the famous pool. Top notch all around

title: This is Miami!
review: You cannot come to Miami without coming here!  Think movies and Miami Vice!  This is Miami.  Ocean Drive.  Art decor, beaches, bars and food.  What more could you want.

title: Really fun area.
review: My husband and I had alot of fun...... BUT if you or your spouse are the jealous type avoid. Lots of restaurants, bars, and almost fully naked people.

title: Beautiful photo op
review: Classic South Beach at night! Beautiful lights, great music as you walk by and great smells from the food.

title: Pretty hotels and fast cars.
review: Ocean Drive was pretty, but noisy. We visited in the eavning, but there was a lot of people there and cars, bikes, police. There was not easy to get a table on a resturant table, but we made it at last on Fridays on the south corner. I am happy that we walked down there ( we lived right beside the Botanical Garden ) It was just like on TV:-)

title: Restaurants/Shops
review: Lots of great restaurants and bars! A lot of action! Great people watching! A little pricey, but that was expected.

title: Rich with hotel
review: Collins Ave. is full of great hotels to chose from and is full of eateries....where should I go? Oh my... choices...choices...choices...all great ones.

title: Beautiful hotels!
review: Great scenery, good shopping!!  Some of the BEST hotels are on Collins Avenue.  Very clean, quite interesting.

title: Best people watching site
review: If you love the hustle and bustle of the city, then this is the street to be on. Our hotel was right on Collins Avenue so we spend countless hours exploring the street and checking out the different places to eat and hang out. If you love people watching, you'll definitely see all types of interesting characters. It was fun.

title: Great for shopping
review: Collins is a great for SoBe shopping and to hang out after the beach or as an alternative to the beach.

title: South Beach Visit
review: Ray

title: Nice weather & excellent service
review: Lummus Beach was great we had a very attentive service from Rashid at Boucher Brothers! He was professional and knowledgeable! The weather was amazing.

title: awesome service - beautiful day
review: a stunning beach - a beautiful day - white sands - and clear water - Jose Larios with Boucher Brothers was a FANTASTIC beach attendant - chatty, helpful, and accommodating.

title: Beach vacation
review: It’s been  a wonderful day so far at the beach it wouldn’t be better if it wasn’t for Jose my beach attendant wonderful service made me feel like I was at home very caring gentleman

title: THE FUN I'VE HAD..................!
review: Well, this beautiful park is on the beach! At night, in particular, just the atmosphere of Ocean, beach, and Ocean Drive, are hypnotique! ALL is possible!

title: Beautiful art
review: This is a must if you are visiting Miami! The art is very see worthy and beautifully made! A lot of people but except for that it was great.

title: Beautiful
review: Wynwood is a beautiful neighborhood. Parking on the street was easy in the morning. We just fed the meter a few dollars. There was light rain, but that did not stop anyone. There is art outdoors and indoors. This is a free activity, no tour guide needed. We enjoyed the art. Would defintiely visit again.

title: Amazing
review: Come early or late! This place is totally exposed to the sun and you’ll sweat/burn whilst looking around. It’s worth a visit - don’t miss it. The art is spectacular and FREE of charge. Lots of photo opportunities and not over crowded.

title: Worth a visit
review: Fantastic Murals. Great  neighborhood. Spent a couple of hours admiring the murals and exploring the eclectic shops.

title: Beautiful south beach
review: An Absolute must

title: Ya gotta love South Beach
review: South Beach is for adults only but my wife and I love it!. If you're a young adult there is nightlife. There is beach for all ages. We love it, except for some weekends that get overcrowded (Memorial Day, etc.).

title: From sunrise to sunset a wonderful place to be
review: Clean and blue water, so warm too (I am more used to sea in the UK!) a place to walk, run and cycle as well to relax in the sun - it is a must see on a visit to Miami.

title: Lively.
review: Lot's of restaurants and bars and the atmosphere is unbelievable but eating here costs almost twice a smuch as anywhere alse.

title: Great place to experience the best Cviche in Miami
review: The food is amazing. The decor reminds me Miami Beach of the 50's. Elegant, formal, and cozy.

title: It's all happening at the zoo
review: Our milestone for zoos is Singapore, Miami is not as good but close. Our one complaint is the maps of the site, which only provide a hint of routes. They could really be better.

title: A day visit for shopping
review: Lincoln road is more of an experience and very well worth a visit (in fact I would say its a must!). If we go to Miami again it will be first on my list of "to do's"

title: A pleasure to stroll down the road
review: Interesting statues by Botero abound. Not my style, but they are amusing.

title: Winter break
review: Loved this part of Miami, lots of nice shops and lovely restaurants. We spent an evening and a leisurely day at Ballans. Friendly place

title: Food
review: Loved this area. It was a really diverse area and had every type of restaurant you could look for and even better, it was surrounded by shops! The only downside to eating out is the expense. We got 2 cones out of Haagen-Dazs which were advertised as $6.70 each but when we got to the till it came to $20.71 for them. It turned out the 2 scoops of ice cream were $6.70, the cones were then $1.50 each and the sauce on top was $1.30. After this they add tax and service. We were the same in a Mexican restaurant. We stopped for 2 burgers advertised as $18 each and 2 draught beers which in the end totalled $63. It is a lovely place to visit but when you go to America you have to remember that the tax and service is not included in the prices you see and servers still look for an additional tip before you leave. Apart from this Miami was a wonderful area to visit and the people were very friendly. I would definitely recommend a visit to Lincoln Rd.

title: An entire street of shops, restaurants and bars
review: This was a stop on the Hop On-Hop Off bus tour.  Initially, the bus stopped on Lincoln for about 20 min. but we went back the next day and had drinks and snacks after a couple hours of shopping.  There is no traffic on this road, so it is safe for shoppers and party people to have a good time.  An unexpected shopping area in the middle of Miami Beach.

title: We took a tour and it was great
review: We took a tour and it was great.  Learned about the history.  Also learned about Miami Vice.  Will appreciate Miami Beach even more.

title: Beautiful Area for a Stroll
review: We spent a few days in a hotel on Collins Avenue. If you like beautiful architecture and have the time as we did to have a walk around this district you have a great time. The old buildings are lovely, if you ignore the BMW i8's, the Mustangs and other flashy cars this place takes you back in time. You can just imagine what it was like nearly 100 years ago. If you take the time to look you'll find some great gems like The Betsy Orb and the Betsy Poetry Rail. We loved this district.

title: Graffiti Galore
review: Interesting place and local area to visit. Fascinating to see the artists at work seeing how deftly they bring the pieces to life. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Beautiful!
review: Wynwood walls is a must visit. The murals are gorgeous and one just marvels at the skill of the artists. Plenty of photo opportunities and people are polite to let eachotherr take turns and take photos. There are also a couple of food options around so you can spend the day there. Security later came and closed one of the sections we visited for a private event so clearly the walls are very popular, even for hosting events. I highly recommend visiting this part of Miami.

title: Fun half day trip
review: The area is hipster and artsy. The murals are gorgeous and free. You can walk around the area and there are some cool shops and some murals to explore. Highly recommend to check out Coyo Taco and Panther coffee nearby! It would take 1-2 to explore the area. The trolley does not come too often.

title: Mind blowing wall art
review: So beautiful wall art! Very detailed and diverse and one of a kind thing to do in Miami. Plan to spend atleast an hour here to catch the vivid detail in every painting.

title: Amazing wall art!
review: Plan to stay two or three hours and wear comfortable shoes, because you have to walk around the Wynwood walls.

title: A must.
review: Absolute must.  Miami is not just about the beaches and parties.  The art decor is amazing and part of the history!

title: Beautiful views
review: Beautiful and comfortable to walk around,or to sit to look at the sea and enjoy, we usually go to see the cruises going out from the Miami port

title: Beautiful South Beach Point
review: The squirting water feature park is a fun one for kids. Smith & Wollensky has a restaurant here overlooking the bay and there's a snack bar as well. Great place to relax when not crowded.

title: Beautiful Area, family friendly
review: Loved walking around this beautiful park.  Family friendly and lots to do from riding bikes to watching the people on the jet skis.  Food Truck located at entrance for refreshments and small concession stand within the part.

title: Nice park if you are on bike and want to take a rest
review: Not much to do but look out onto water with some boats. Nice place to cool off.   There are some benches and statues but not much else.

title: A stunning place to get some shade
review: Well worth a visit.

title: Easy strolling
review: Very nicely kept, this boardwalk parallels the beach. It offers a stable platform for those not wanting to walk in the sand.  Surrounded by trees the sun is not too imposing. Nothing special but its there for use and not falling apart.

title: A lovely place to walk!
review: The boardwalk is clean and well-maintained. There is adequate lighting at night. I do feel that mayhe the street markers could be a little clearer.

title: Don’t miss the Boardwalk!
review: Stunning views of the ocean, great people watching and there is a good amount of shade. The cyclists ‍️ do zoom by so be careful. I would recommend bringing some water with you if you plan on being out there for a while.

title: Run off all the yummy food in Miami
review: What an amazing trail! Easy to run 5 miles on the flat paved runway. Check out all the hotels you could be staying at too.

title: Gorgeous walk
review: By day or night it is a delight to stroll down the path dodging cyclists, skaters and runners

title: Amazing Graffiti Art
review: What an amazing area of street art!  We had the best time seeing the art on a Pedal Pub tour!  Wynwood is a must-see for anyone visiting the Miami area.

title: Conventional but Attractive Graffiti
review: Nonetheless, Wynwood Walls is a striking display of pieces by various artists that cover the whole range of styles from figurative to abstract in an explosion of colors and shapes. It is certainly a must stop for every visitor to Miami.

title: Long awaited Miami visit
review: I was mesmerized by the very many works of arts. I absolutely recommend a visit to Wynwood Walls.  The talent on display is nothing short of amazing as is the background of the artists themselves. Congratulations to all concerned.

title: Beautiful and inspiring art experience
review: A must if you are in Miami, much more rewarding than buying watered down Margarita in Little Havana tourist traps.

title: Loved it
review: Brilliant day out, something for everyone, amazing art, cute shops, lots of bars and restaurants. Very enjoyable, would definitely go again

title: Art meet Food
review: If you love Art, Music and food Wynwood is for you. You will enjoy walking the street and looking at all the art work. There are many different kind of restaurant to choose from.

title: Art Deco urban street
review: Nice place to take a stroll. Crowds are fairly young so you get a mix of all walks of life. It has plenty of places to eat or drink. Worth a stroll if you want to experience all the wall graffiti art or just an urban part of the city. There are also plenty of ice cream or gelato and coffee shops.

title: Art and Culture Must See!
review: Driving to this area at first is a little tricky if you're not from Miami, however once you get there, it is well worth the visit. There are blocks and blocks of absolutely amazing graffiti artwork. Expect to see everything from political slogans to mind blowing creative masterpieces. Allocate a good 2-3 hours to enjoy this area, it is worth it!

title: A Lovely Neighbourhood
review: Most people visiting Miami have heard of the Wynwood Walls but the neighbourhood of Wynwood is also great! So many great shops, restaurants, bars and coffee shops to choose from!

title: A MUST IF YOU VISIT MIAMI
review: You can't say you visited Miami if you don't see the "Wynwood Walls".   Great place to take pictures. Wynwood is full with restaurants, at all price levels.   It gets packed at night.  The parking will probably be a problem if you go at night.  An Uber from your hotel would be better than driving there especially if you are not familiar with the area.  On the weekends, it is packed with locals visiting the different bars.

title: Blackpool at its worst
review: Ocean drive has beautiful buildings but absolutely nothing else going for it, as you walk down ocean drive you are constantly bombarded with people shoving menus in your face what a shame something that has got such a lovely history is ruined by awful people we drove 3-4 hours to spend the day and evening here but only lasted 1 hour .

title: History of Miami, right in front of me!
review: If you have seen Scarface before and have never been to Miami, this is a must visit.

title: Best place who loves parties
review: It is a real party place. You can enjoy your night here, with an amazing vibe in the historical art deco district.

title: Nice place!
review: Must see! Its pretty busy all the time with restaurants being full and pretty good wait lines at peak times! But its fun to walk around and see so many people and then cross the street to go to the beach...

title: Strolling Ocean Drive
review: Ocean Dr in Miami Beach is where one will find swanky hotels, a trendy restaurant and bar scene and a lot of clean beach along the ocean. This is a place where one comes to see and be seen and it is a delight to sit in any of the numerous cafes and bars for a cold drink.

title: My Birthday Weekend.
review: I went to the beach at the Fountainbleu hotel and I was assisted by a guy named Zebedee, He set everything up for our cabana and not only did he do a great job setting up he came back to check on us and made sure we were okay and asked if we needed anything more than he already provided. Zebedee is very nice and i can tell he’s a hard worker! so if you ever go to the fountainbleu and want a cabana on the beach ask for Zebedee.

title: My Bestfriends Bday
review: Zebedee was such a great help, because of him I really enjoyed my day. He was very helpful and came to check up on me and all my friends! He got everything we needed and was generous. He should most definitely get a raise because how hard he works!

title: Absolutely beautiful
review: We’d heard so much about this and we finally were able to include it in our itinerary during a family visit to Miami. The art in the walls and the small art indoor displays are absolutely beautiful. There are restaurants and cafes with a great ambiance and fun music. I would highly recommend that you don’t leave anything inside your car. Unfortunately one of the vehicles parked in a public parking lot (paid space) where we also parked, was broken into and had their belongings taken. It was about 4 pm and in a very open area, but there isn’t any security or much police presence. Other than that, this is definitely a must see!

title: Great
review: It’s a perfect place to take great pictures for your trip, amazing arts! It’s an open space so if it’s raining bring your umbrella.

title: Evening Stroll
review: This is so amazing, and this part of town is very vibrant.  I plan to return for a strictly shopping and dining experience.

title: Art brought to life by Tour Ambassador Lance
review: Made a last minute trip late in the day to the Wynwood Walls. Was so impressed by the artwork that I decided I’d really like to find out more about the artists and the Wynwood itself. Lance gave me an amazing tour, hugely knowledgeable & with great insight & passion. Thank you so much Lance for your time, giving me a deeper understanding of the works :)

title: Amazing artwork
review: Very cool to visit these amazing wall murals and art shops. Lots of super cute & trendy restaurants. Very hip place to visit.

title: Awesome weekend in Miami Beach
review: On Collins Avenue you will find most of the nicest hotels in Miami Beach, Bars, stores and will be entertained by the people passing by, not to mention that the beach access is super close.

title: Take A Stroll
review: A parallel block to the beach, one block away.  You can find a restaurant with your eyes closed.  Expect to see a wide range of tropical dressed people on the exposed side.  Only two lanes wide.  The budget hotels are on this block.

title: Day visit to Collins Avenue
review: Another great place to see Art Nouveau architecture. Much busier than Ocean Drive as Collins is a main road with many eateries and shops running down it. The northern end has some large 1930's hotels. Probably more varied architecture than Ocean Drive. Look out for Essex House which resembles a cruise ship.

title: Beautiful Beach
review: The Lummus Park Beach is located directly across the street from the Art Deco hotels on Ocean Drive.  It features volley ball nets where you can see people playing sets of volley ball everyday, a bicycle path, a walking path, and entrance onto the beach itself.  You see people exercising and having fun!

title: Beautiful & fun
review: We walked and biked through LPB many times during our week in Miami Beach. It was lively and fun without being too intense. Great for people-watching!

title: Excellent service
review: I am from New Jersey, a few days ago I came to the beach to enjoy the water and unexpectedly a gentleman by the name of Jordan came to me and discussed what you guys had to offer. He really made my time very special in Miami. His customer service was excellent. I highly recommend for people to ask for his services!

title: Beach day
review: Tim was amazing. Very helpful he ensured we’d have an umbrella to enjoy our beach day. Thank you Tim

title: Awesome Beach Day in Miami
review: Thankssss Marcus for taking a picture of me and my friends so we can have to remember this awesome trip to Miami! ️

title: Magical Place lovely street art !
review: Lovely place to visit in Miami. lots of street art in a place that was couple of years ago an area you wouldn't like to visit. I had a very nice visit. would recommended to visit Wynwood during your visit in Miami. a must to do !

title: Amazing place colorful
review: The place is so security you feel free there and the best part is free access, you can see a lot arts.

title: Well worth the visit!
review: We had the pleasure of watching multiple artists working on their masterpieces during our visit. I was told the art work changes every so often so we were lucky to have seen the new and the old before it was removed. Total time spent was roughly 20mins or so but ensure you walk around in area nearby there as there’s plenty more artwork to see in the neighbourhood.

title: Unique graffiti art on display
review: No charge to get in. I would leave small kids at home, but bring your older kids, and let them appreciate the different textures and styles.

title: The murals are breathtakingly beautiful
review: The entire area is full of beautiful large scale murals, but those within the Wynwood Walls exhibition are the beast IMHO. When we visited, there was a exhibition by the artist Kobra, whose work we had marvelled at in Rio de Janeiro a few years back, and it was a truly unexpected and unadulterated delight sure to see more of his work. It's definitely worth a visit, even if you're not a dyed-in-the-wool art lover.

title: Colors and Purpose
review: Miami has changed so much from when I grew up there 30+ years ago. Wynwood is one of those changes that captures the essence of Miami and where it's headed artistically.

title: Really Interesting
review: After travelling through on the bus tour decided to spend an afternoon in Wynwood. Loads of character, walls are amazing and plenty of cafes/bars for a pit-stop. Lovely afternoon and well worth a visit

title: Cool drive while viewing wall murals / graffities
review: We spend a quick hour in this artsy area and many murals at every corner.  Some areas look sketchy but most places look gentrified. Nice little coffee shops and restaurant dot the area.  Neighbouring to some designer shops on the east side.

title: Worth a walk
review: A friend took us here as a place to see whilst in Miami, it was definitely worth a visit which will take less than 2hrs.

title: Definitely worth the trek
review: As a tourist Wynwood was quite difficult to get to on public transport but it's worth a taxi. The fenced gallery is free and features some brilliant pieces but wandering around the surrounding area you will find lots more wonderful walls. Big, brightly coloured and absolutely free, what's not to like?

title: Miami beach
review: It's a sh1tty place full of pretenders and with high prices...with less than 50% money I can go to a better beach and with 3 or 4 times better food and prices in South America...worst place ever

title: Amazing!
review: Wow! What a beautiful beach!! I was pleasantly surprised by the beach although the sign for chair and umbrella rental suggested an outrageous price!! The sea around the beach offers lots for you to see and do!

title: Love It
review: Clean sand, blue water and a quite place to relax is all we wanted and we got it! We will go back. Thank you

title: Best mornings
review: If you haven’t gotten up before work to see the sunrise on south beach then you’re missing something

title: South Beach is special
review: South beach is a world famous special location The beach is beautiful. The boardwalk is wide and comfortable. The people are beautiful.

title: Large variety of animals, most have lots of space to roam..
review: Nicely designed zoo. Most animals have a decent amount of space to roam. We rented the 6 person bike which is a great way to get around since it’s a large zoo and it also helps to avoid the sun since it has a canopy.

title: Great outdoor dining and shopping
review: We enjoy walking around and people watching.

title: Nice day here.
review: Had done a beach day the day before and decided to come here for a few hours which was great. Liked that there were no cars so comfortable to relax and wander around looking at the shops and restaurants and people! Stopped for a meal and also did some shopping. There is also a cinema if you fancy it. Good experience.

title: Miami Beach essential.
review: Constantly in a state of gentrification which brings in some of the more large national retailers rather than mom and pop shops (gentrification is not always a good thing), but it still is the best people watching in the city

title: So much to do on Lincoln Road
review: Quite a few good restaurants and shopping up and down Lincoln road. There is also a great movie theater.

title: Excellent!
review: Really cool art displays. Can do a self walking tour or go with a group. I did my own tour and was left wondering about many of the artwork, so would definitely pay for an organized tour next time. I love that it changes frequently I would not hesitate to return when in Miami again.

title: Interesting and nice to see
review: We’ve parked our car approx 10 mins walking from Wynwood walls, free of charge

title: Great Tour with Lance!
review: Brilliant tour of Wynwood Walls with Lance. We would have missed so many details without him and he brought so much background and stories to the art. It made the visit really special.

title: Not bad.
review: It was not bad, not good, something averaged. Parking was expensive. 10 dollars for 2 hours. We did not find good restorans around as well.

title: A mandatory visit for anyone visiting Miami
review: One of my favorite places as a local to just walk around and think, or get the brain going with new ideas

title: Beautiful Gem - Not to Miss
review: What a beautiful gem in the middle of Miami.  Even the driveway & parking lot are lush and shady.  Veterans get in free and get a 10% discount in the cafe/shop.  Regular admission was $22.  The gardens are lovely and the rooms inside are breathtaking with incredible ceilings, marble, fireplaces, statues, murals, artwork, etc.

title: Peaceful and beauty
review: The house is a big mansion that is must see for tourists. There is a large manicured garden and provides some historical insight into Miami. This is a good place to go walk through gardens and view the bay.

title: luxurious villa in old Europe style
review: This beautiful mansion and the gardens around it are laid out in symmetrical manner.The main entrance opens into central open air courtyard and the view of the ocean beyond. From the courtyard the building splits into two wings, both two story high. Each room is lavishly decorated up the walls and ceilings. Close attention to every detail is evident throughout the mansion. It is had to believe this was just a winter getaway for this wealthy industrialist from Chicago. He had great taste for art and the money to create this wonderful villa we can visit today. A beautiful place to have a wedding reception.

title: Beautiful
review: Beautiful estate.  While it’s owner isn’t someone if widespread fame, still interesting history and learning the way of life from its era.  Enjoyed walking through the house and peaceful gardens.

title: Vizcaya Gardens
review: Well worth the visit.

title: Architectural Delight
review: The Art Deco Historic District runs along Collins Ave and is a place where can stay at the numerous hotels or book a sightseeing tour of the Everglades. There is also a youth hostel in this area for the budget minded traveler.

title: Very nostalgic
review: 2 different areas by day and by night. Many hotels and restaurants in the area as well as South Beach. By day it is easy to walk around and enjoy the area.  At night it changes into a crowded area with outdoor restaurants, music and the hotels are all lit up.

title: Just Amazing
review: Besides all if the great restaurants and shopping, if you enjoy Art Deco architecture this is a spot to see. One after another, these old buildings that have been beautifully restored are eye catching.

title: Beautiful
review: It's well worth a walk around the area and enjoy people living in what is almost a real life museum.

title: Almost a hidden gem
review: Walking most places from our hotel in South Beach, we almost missed this park. Fortunately we saw it on the way back from a day cruise to the Bahamas. We walked through the next day and went back later a biked from end to end. It was lovely, with several activities going on.

title: nice place to visit
review: since it was raining that day, it was good timing to visit this Vizcaya museum and gardens ,had good time and took pictures, plenty parking ,no complaint

title: Well worth the visit
review: After your visit there's just a short walk to the Wynwood brewing company for some locally brewed beer.

title: Street art at its best
review: Free of charge and top of the line for world famous street art and graffiti since 2009. Every couple of months the art is changed, so one can come again and again and always see something new. What a fabulous concept. Highly recommended.

title: Too short!
review: Very beautiful murals but a very short walk.  1 hour max to go around and visit the few galleries.  All arts are un-affordable...Something to do on a late evening or early morning as it gets to be tooooo hot to walk around during at midday or early afternoon.

title: Interesting collection
review: Great collection of street art easy to get to. We used hop on hop off bus to get there. Beware no public toilets.

title: A must see
review: Some of the art work on the street  buildings is amazing. The private gallery is well worth a visit and the art work there is unbelievable.Be prepared to spend some time there.

title: What a wonderfull place to visit.
review: Walking the grounds of this museum takes you back to early Mimai days. It was beutiful.  It looks like you can rent for Weddings and social events.  It was very neet inside, and they have done a fantasitc job of presurveing the buildings and grouds.  It is worth the price of admission.

title: An enchanted world
review: This visit, in summary, was quite magical and very satisfying. It allows to remove oneself from the hustle and bustle of the city center, that is only distant by a few miles. This is a must visit for anyone traveling to the Miami area.

title: Unique insight to old Miami wealth
review: Vizcaya is well worth the visit. It's a little out of the way from Miami and the beaches, but the trip is worthwhile. Vizcaya is probably one of the first summer homes of the ultra wealthy, so very much in keeping with Miami today. It is a serene and beautiful environment inside and out but the house is probably the most spectacular. Of course, it is nothing compared to Old European stately homes but for Miami, it is certainly a sight to see.

title: Vizcaya, Oh maya. Must see.
review: Newport has Marble House, Palm Beach the Flagler and Miami has Vizcaya. One of the  most architecturally dramatic examples of another time and place. It’s hard to imagine, but the magnificent residence is surrounded by a tropical jungle and opens to the vast expanse of Biscayne Bay. A one of a kind experience.

title: Great views but closes early
review: We walked from our hotel Urbanica The Meridian Hotel, Miami Beach, nice walk. the point was breath taking. the only complaint is that they close a little early for my taste. I would have loved to see the sun set from there.

title: Sunsets
review: If you are looking for a beautiful spot to watch the sunset this is the spot . Amazing views! Just breathtaking!

title: Great Views
review: The park and pier was relaxing, clean and areas to relax. The views of ships and boats were nice to see. Great Photos!

title: Relaxed and laid back
review: If you enjoyed my review, please give me a thumbs up. My kids never believe people read them so it’s nice to prove them wrong occasionally.

title: Great
review: If you need a walk or a run this is the place. Lots of people all the time, but theres room for everyone. Remember that bikes are not allowed throughout the whole boardwalk.

title: Good boatdwalk
review: Nice boardwalk to walk around. It is good to see that the boardwalk is in a good shape and it is enough space for pedestrians an bicyclists.

title: Outdoor Art Gallery
review: Really fun visit for people who enjoy art. Just looking at the buildings with amazing murals to the Wyndwood walls and doors exhibit it’s a full day activity that is free to enjoy. Just be ready to walk a lot. There are several rather expensive food trucks around but they are good as well.

title: Artful place
review: You will need about tow hours to really enjoy the area.  Nice trendy restaurants and bars in the area.

title: Incredible art
review: A really colourful, vibrant neighbourhood. Lots of interesting shops and cafes, the bar area was brilliant and lots of fun. The walls are jawdroppingly beautiful.

title: Ephemeral street art
review: There is a big parking nearby (Wynwood parking) a bit pricy but safe and convenient (3$ the first hour then 3$ per 30 minutes).

title: modern  art  in miami
review: togh walking on uneven pavements=people with canes avoid this place

title: Beautiful home and gardens
review: An impressive home and gardens on the Biscayne Bay. There are many beautiful tapestries, rugs, and pieces of antique furniture. The house is great but I would say the gardens are outstanding. There are many places to explore and enjoy. A great place to visit on your trip to Miami.

title: Beautiful Mansion
review: Beautiful Mansion surrounded by stunning gardens. You feel like in Europe! The inside exhibits also explains in great details the life back then. A must-do in the Miami area.

title: Beautiful estate and gardens
review: A beautiful home and gardens. I recommend it to anyone who loves seeing these old estates cared for.

title: Surprisingly lovely house!
review: Gorgeous gardens, old stonework was amazing, as were the lizards. The house was very worth a visit - much better than anticipated, and the gift shop provided a much needed umbrella ️

title: See what it was like to be 1920’s wealthy!
review: A stunning tourist attraction, with a collection that would be near-impossible to gather in the modern era. Walking through the gardens is a must, keep an eye out for the big iguana!!

title: Nothing like in the world
review: Nothing like it in the world. With most greedy ignorant city planners and corporations building revenue producing space right up to the waters edge, Miami Beach is a rare exception. Nestled between the beach, a natural beach erosion prevention area and the hotels lining Collins, this walkway allows the entire area to breathe, and is a must do!

title: Love the boardwalk
review: Nice path with plenty of benches and even water fountains along. We only went from about 18th street to the pier and there were quite a few public bathrooms along the way. A couple play areas, muscle gym, people selling their crafts; it is an enjoyable walk. Well lit at night and very sunny during the day. Not a lot of shade so plan accordingly.

title: Boardwalk
review: The only good thing about the hotel I chose was that it was opposite this place.  Really enjoyed.  Great for walking.

title: Nice to see
review: This is a place in downtown Miami that was in bad shape and they star painting vary nice graphitti. There you have now like six blocks of building painting in a nice way and the palce looks really differnt. Go around in car so you can appreciated the art as a whole.

title: Lovely place
review: Wynwood walls are in an old area of Miami, now very Chic. Walls all around the neighborhood has beautiful graffiti works, there are a lot of good restaurants around.

title: Great addition to our trip
review: We were so glad we found time to stop here on our action packed trip to Miami. We found it very interesting, beautiful, and worth our time! Recommend a visit for sure

title: Great day trip
review: My husband and I took a day trip to Vizcaya. It was a great visit. The house was beautiful. We did the audio tour, which was well worth it. The audio provided extra information that was very helpful. The gardens were beautiful as well.

title: A Miami treasure!
review: This is a cool place to visit and take in the art scene of Miami. Very walkable and lots of cool shops and restaurants. Stays open late for the night scene.

title: Great experience
review: On-site at Wynwood-Walls you will See some exceptional street-art. Also If you have the time and endurance go and explore the neighborhood for some less well known artwork.

title: Festival
review: Awesome paintings.   Good food music.   History and art work. everyone should go.    We all need to learn it will be good time.  Go early to find a parking spot.

title: Don't miss
review: Take time to walk around the neighborhood.  There are murals all over the surrounding area. You have to see these in person to appreciate them.

title: Mind Blown!
review: They did this with a spray can!? I was overwhelmed by the talent shown in these artworks and I'm certain, judging by the crowd, that the rest of the public present were too. Took so many photographs and appreciated the other art forms in the surrounding area. It's well worth the trip to see it, double up and catch the hop on hop off bus that'll take you directly there and grab some lunch from the diners in the area.

title: Italian Renaissance
review: And the house and gardens we're better than that! Statuary deserving of Florence. Lush walkways. AAA discount. And free parking.

title: Piece of heaven in miami
review: A piece of heaven in the heat of Miami.

title: Great mysterious Museum
review: Great trip with wife. traveled with local transportation. a little bit to walk. if you love history and mystery, than I recommend this to do in Miami. What I liked were the secrete passage, the communication system back then in such a big mansion. the pool was also nice , art boat at the back and ofcourse the garden.

title: Interesting
review: Wynnwood Walls is in the old Miami area. It is quite interesting with many forms of art displays. Graffiti is all over the area. Indoor and outdoor displays. Restaurants and food trucks are in the area.

title: Worth a visit, be suprised
review: Did this as part of Miami to the max tour, well worth a look, I even surprised myself by liking what I saw. It's an interesting part of Miami that comes to life with Murals etc on walls that breath life back into this area, very talented artists indeed....

title: A Must on things to do.
review: This small town dedicated to art and artists is a must see. Art everywhere. Surrounded by great shops and food. When the sun goes down this place has some great lounges, outdoor clubs and bars to go to. Food Trucks were Great!!

title: Exactly the evironment you want for a South Beach Vacation.
review: Vibrant, colorful and exciting with the peaceful back drop of the ocean across the street.  Lots of sidewalk seating and lots of restaurants with diverse menu's.  Love the art deco architecture and the cool ocean breezed.

title: Ocean Drive
review: The strip in South Beach. It’s the place to see and be seen. Stroll the Drive or cruise it. Hot cars with loud music and dressed up couples are in attendance at night near the clubs. By day the cafes are full of people enjoying the sunshine and Waterviews

title: Excellent views of the buildings and the beach
review: Ocean Drive runs along the beach in the southern end of Miami Beach.  Easy walking distance to the beach but limited parking.  A nice drive to see the building and people.  A bicycle cab is a nice option if you can find one.  A fun drive with nice looking building and beach views.

title: Magical
review: Had a blast visiting the Vizcaya museum! Art was full of so much detail and it was just so peaceful! It’s also great for photos. If you get a chance to visit Miami this is one of the places you should come and see.

title: Beautiful place to wander and admire
review: A must see for folks who have a few days in Miami and want to admire this Italianate mansion.  Teleport yourself back to the life of the wealthy industrialists from hundred years ago.

title: Now that’s a winter house
review: This is a really amazing house and gardens built by an eccentric rich guy. Let’s do see tour the house I suggest the audio tour for five dollars extra so that you can learn about the artwork the tapestries the furniture and the construction. Then go walk around the Gardens they are amazing the stone ship in the homemade inlet or something to be seen. The trees are beautiful

title: A Treasure
review: I have driven by this place for years when coming to Miami. This time, I decided to visit- it’s a real treasure and an outstanding piece of Miami history. The home, gardens, and view of Biscayne Bay are truly amazing!

title: abit of european style architecture
review: cafeteria pretty decent

title: Great Views!
review: Such a beautiful street to take a long stroll on. Classic Miami/South Beach architecture and colors. Views of the ocean and beaches.

title: Loved visiting
review: Especially moved by seeing where Gianni Versace was murdered. Sad to see that location exploited as a raw fish eatery. But the buzz of Ocean Drive is all I expected. Police on every corner. Rainbow colored cross walks. Art Deco hotels. Many smells of cannabis and fried meat. A great location for visiting the past.

title: You will come here at some point.
review: Shopping, bars and restaurants.  You will come here at some point be it for food, drinks or just walking to get somewhere!

title: Always something going on
review: Collins is one of the main drags with hotels, restaurants and interesting architecture. Free trolleys as well as bus service is available on almost every corner. Good hotel location.

title: Fun Avenue
review: You can find just about anything on Collins Ave.  From expensive ethnic restaurants to fast food, boutiques, ice cream, jewelry, hotels, drug stores and there is a FREE trolley to take along Collins Ave & beyond...oh and wait till you see (and sometimes hear) the exotic cars!

title: Strolling Collins Ave.
review: This is probably one of the more famous streets in Miami Beach the late Arthur Godfrey immortalized. There are many tourist shops here where one can buy postcards and maps as well as noticing the number of retired people who live here.

title: Nice area
review: This road is full of eateries pubs and food place of all nations.Also found Halal Indian food but unbelievably expensive. There were some affordable places also unlike ocean drive

title: Something for Everyone!
