review: The park was clean and relaxing. You can do alot of different activites and/or relax. People watching at the park is very interesting. Enjoyed the time.

title: Ocean front views
review: Yes many of the stopping off points along the way.  It was a hot and breezy October morning, so things were quiet.

title: Great spot!
review: Lummus Park is spectacular. Lots of fun things to do for everyone. Walking, bicycling, enjoying the sun ... and fun people watching! Don’t miss it!

title: SOBE seafood festival.
review: Thank you!!

title: An incredibly beautiful property
review: A true South Florida gem!  When I posted the photos online, nearly all viewers commented that they wanted to go see it!

title: Stunning Museum and Gradens
review: If you have the time, go check this place out.

title: A stunning place to visit
review: It's a stunning place with interesting history.  Make sure that you leave as much time for the beautiful gardens as the house too.

title: Peaceful Place
review: This is a beautiful and peaceful place to visit whether on your own, with family or friends.  Winter or spring is the best time to visit, but we just got back in September and it was fantastic.  The grounds are beautiful and anything near the water is a great experience...this is situated right on the Bay.  Great and inexpensive outing!

title: Vizcaya Museum and Gardens
review: Very nice tour of the home and gardens. Well worth the trip. I’m many ways it reminds me of Hearst Castle. However, I would say that Hearst Castle has more “purchased” European antiquities. It’s amazing that the home is built on a coral reef!

title: Nice Park Area Alongside the Beach
review: This is a nice park area running adjacent to the beach. It is clean and well maintained, has plenty of seating and an exercise area. Lot's of places close by to eat and drink and the ocean just over the brow of the beach front. There was a big entertainment marqee being put up when we were there but we left before the event.

title: Best sightseen in Miami
review: Hot day, hot paintings and good wibe. If you like art, visit Wynwood Walls. If you don’t like art, you should definitily visit Wynwood Walls. There is lot different paintings and other stuff too, and it’s free of charge!

title: Bring a camera, take lots of pictures!
review: This was all during the day. At night time it might be a different story.

title: You can't go wrong here.
review: I appreciate all the pretty art that is on every wall and every door. The entire neighborhood is amazing but some of the most gorgeous walls are collected here. Don't miss this place.

title: Free to visit, impressive graffiti on display
review: Free to walk around, amazing artwork all over the place. Some artists working away as you walk around.

title: Fantastic tour with Lance
review: We were very happy we took the hour long guided tour of Wynwood Walls. And delighted with our guide Lance.  He was knowledgeable, funny and passionate about sharing his insight and admiration of the artists and their works of art.  We got so much more out of our visit with the guided tour. And especially with Lance making it a most wonderful experience!

title: Miami Beach
review: All together a great place.

title: Beach
review: sun rise we picked up so much plastic.  Kind of sad.

title: Swimming and bathing
review: Great beach, enjoyed bathing and swimmIng in exciting waves and natural sand safe in the knowledge that the excellent lifeguards are on hand in the event of need. First class,

title: one of the best beaches in Florida
review: very nice beach - little rocky ocean floor - but beautiful beach and people - the skyline and activity level is nice - and you can spend the whole day here:)

title: Amazing beach!
review: Clean, picturesque, and a highlight of our stay in Miami.  Just beautiful, with warm waters and stunning sunsets.

title: Lovely gardens and very interesting house
review: Something totally different if you are visiting Miami. Stunning gardens, beautifully laid out. Loads of butterflies, iguanas and colourful lizards darting across your path. Areas of steamy mangrove swamps. Right on the ocean. Beautiful place to wander and soak up the views and the sunshine.  Inside the house is equally interesting and a great place to wander. I spent almost the whole day there. Limited cafe facilities but enough choice to suit most people.

title: Beautiful!  If you have been to San Simeon, this is better!
review: What a delightful day, and eye-opening experience!  Take the tour with the docent-they will point out so many things you will miss without a guide!

title: Beautiful!
review: Gorgeous place, well worth seeing. We declined the tour and later regretted it. Definitely worth seeing.

title: A must visit for the east coast if you love history and homes combined.
review: A must see if you have wanted to or have visit Hearst Castle on the west coast and the gilded mansions on the upper east coast.  These home represented the influence of Europe while making their own way as they used their wealth to leave an amazing impact on just a small part of some of our most amazing coastlines in our country.

title: Beautiful oasis
review: Vizcaya is a wonderful historic house with lovely gardens and an excellent view over Biscayne Bay. The contents of the house are fairly interesting, but in certain ways the outdoors area is even more of an attraction. For that reason I wouldn’t visit in a heavy downpour.

title: Awesome Zoo!
review: Really nice zoo to go with family, small kids, etc... nice infra-structure with food, restaurants, etc... rent a 4-seat or 6-seat bike to go, the place is quite big. Try to avoid the hottest summer days.

title: Great bars, restaurants and shopping
review: I love the vibe in Lincoln Road. So many cool bars with outdoor seating. I can leave my husband exploring them while I shop. We have eaten in several different restaurants.  All very casual.

title: Girls trip
review: shopping was great , great selection of shops and some great places to eat .. A great place to eat is the Time Out Market...

title: Great place if you are in South Beach Miami
review: Pedestrian street with a mixture of restaurants, small shops, tattoo parlors, convenience stores and street souvenir vendors. Outdoor tables under umbrellas, Festive atmosphere  and well attended at night. I only walk 2 blocks and had a french brunch at Paul bought a shirt at Zara chose a Spanish restaurant for dinner and view a couple of Botero sculptures.

title: Lots of tacky
review: Sadly Lincoln road was just another street with many of the same shops selling low quality to Americans. Three of the same coffee chain in two blocks - WTF! A few local shops and the atmosphere made it bearable. One visit is more than enough. Enjoy the architecture as that is another redeeming feature.

title: An historic gem
review: My husband and I enjoyed touring this monument to a bygone era when wealthy industrialists built mansions as retreats from the cold and pressures of life in the north and Midwest. Not unlike the Isabel Stewart Gardner house in Boston, Vizcaya was designed as a one-of-a-kind “pleasure dome” and personal vision of its owner and is filled with art and gardens. There is no access for baby strollers so we had to keep close watch on the toddler in our party. It also seems to be a popular spot for weddings. Adjacent to the main building is a small snack bar that sells souvenirs.

title: A must while in Miami
review: Besides it’s beautiful beaches, Miami has much more to offer like Vizcaya. Always amazing and more so during December holidays with all the decorations! In addition, the weather is not to hot at this time of the year, so taking a nice stroll at the gardens is a big plus and nice place for family’s punctures!

title: Better then expected
review: Great tours, beautiful grounds, friendly staff, and very well kept. We were there 3 hours and it flew by so quickly. Well worth the money.

title: Excellent
review: Excellent your guide for $5.  Spent 3.5 hours there. Learned so much about Vizcaya and the owner Mr. Deering. Grounds are beautifully maintained.

title: A Miami gem
review: A must do for any Miami resident or visitor. So many beautiful things to see in the house and around the spacious grounds.

title: Fantastic buildings.
review: Really enjoyed walking round this area where the buildings are gorgeous and mostly well preserved especially at nighttime where the lighting is well used to maximise this distinctive look. My only issue with the area, Ocean drive, is the great looking bars really do take advantage with the prices they charge, maybe best to enjoy the views then head back uptown to actually eat.

title: Amazing getaway from busy Miami.
review: Must see when visiting the area. We stood in FLL before, but this is the first time we found out about Vizcaya. What an amazing place! Could have spend days in the house and gardens. Again: Must See!!!!

title: Wow!
review: If you like living museums and interesting history, this is the place.  A place of wonder and amazing artifacts. As we walked through it, it was hard to imagine compiling such an extensive collection in one place.  Definitely a worthwhile place to stop and spend a few hours.

title: Venice in Miami
review: The Vizcaya estate is an eclectic plethora of European art, decor and architecture. I didn’t do any research before visiting other than a few Google searches and was expecting a bit more of an authentic Spanish estate. The estate is only about 100 years old (if that old) and is a Chicago magnates collection of European artifacts. The grounds and gardens are like little Venice and then you look up to see the Miami skyline. Highly recommend the orchid garden, it was just delightful with types of orchids we’d never seen before and butterflies fluttering about. Very sweet. The grounds are much more interesting than the house. This was a very convenient tour. And a nice way to spend a couple of hours in Miami. It’s definitely off the beaten path and shows you there’s more to Miami then sun and beaches. We went on a Saturday and it was pretty crowded.

title: What a find!
review: We were looking for somewhere to go on a shorty afternoon and found this amazing place. It was the most beautiful house demonstrating all European cultural history in one place. Added bonus was the orchid collection, the man gives, lizards and butterflies. So glad we found it; I never expected anything like this in Miami.

title: Beautiful home
review: We visited while in town with family during the summer. Beautiful gardens, home, an furnishings. The house is a close to Calle Ocho and other great areas in Miami to visit. Definitely worth visiting while in town.

title: Walkable nice area
review: The area gives you the sensation of being in the the past with good hotels and access to the ocean. Aldo you can walk to a variety of nice good restaurants.

title: Art Deco great
review: The art deco area of South Beach Miami is world famous. It has an amazing atmosphere and the architecture is amazing. The beach is nearby. There are lots of restaurants serving dishes frmo all over the world

title: Nice place to go
review: Visit the many things in this area. Many things to see, specially art and architecture. 100% recommended, even if you are not an art fan, the area is very nice

title: Architecture wonders
review: The Art Deco district features some of the finest Art Deco architecture in America. Built at a time when aesthetic mattered, thankfully most building have been preserved. Some greats inns and restaurants (and some very tacky tourist shops) make these fine buildings worth visiting.

title: Another lovly place in Miami Beach.
review: This is as far south you can get on Miami Beach. Here you have a View over to Downtown Miami and you have a view up on Miami Beach. It is a pier yo can walk on and tracks you can take. I will recomend a visit here. Beautiful in the sunset, but also during the daytime.

title: Fun, Chill place to watch cruise ships
review: In my free time, I like to watch cruise ships sail away via online webcams. I was in Miami early for a cruise, so I decided to watch them sail away in person. The park is very clean and very relaxing.

title: Beautiful views
review: Very nice park--we saw many tropical fish swimming around. Very clean and nice that it had public restrooms. There's a wet park with sprinklers to walk or stand in for young and old.

title: Great spot to watch the sunset, cruise ships and people watch
review: So glad we made the trek to this park. Beautiful place for walking, biking and dog walking. Amazing views especially at sunset. Walkways, grassy areas, little nooks and crannies to explore, watch the yachts and cruise ships coming in and out of the port. Beautiful fountains lit up at night. From there we started our journey up Ocean Drive where the neon and nightlife come alive. Great time.

title: nice setup
review: I liked walking on the pathway starting from ocean drive and then following along the beach all the way down to South Pointe, perfect also for a nice and easy jog. The view there is quite spectacular.

title: wonderful ---HOWEVER despite all the signs that say NO BIKES, the bikes are all over
review: would have enjoyed the board walk so much if had not had to be so aware of all the fast bike riders.

title: Wonderful
review: It was a wonderful experience walking along the side walk in Miami Beach. Lot of people skating, biking, running or just walking. Love it!!!

title: Awesome Place
review: You can either do your own tour or get the guided tour at Vizcaya. We chose to walk around ourselves to spend more time looking around. What a place, so much history here. The architecture is amazing and the gardens are unbelievable. I recommend that anyone into history and beautiful architecture to go here.

title: Fabulous
review: I'd heard this was a beautiful house and garden, but was thrilled to experience it in person. We skipped the guided tour and wandered the house followed by the gardens. On a bright, sweaty summer day the gardens are a little intense to explore, but there are shady spots and wonderful surprises to discover. 100 percent recommended for architecture and history enthusiasts. Some areas of the house and gardens will be challenging to access for people with limited mobility.

title: Vizcaya is incredibly beautiful!
review: It has very interesting history; decor from different styles; activities for adults and children alike, great views in the back and a beautiful garden.

title: The museum and gardens have a special charm
review: I visited the Vizcaya museum and gardens a few years ago. I did not expect to find such a beautiful place, set wonderfully on the lake of water. The place offers a fragrance of the past. I cannot forget the orchids and other flowers in the garden (the visit was in May). The whole building has a European charm. I would gladly visit this wonderful place again. Go there !

title: Loved the wild iguanas and lizards roaming in the gardens!
review: We came in early so there’s no line at the ticket counter. The palace itself is awesome and well ventilated. There’s helpful staff everywhere ready to answer questions. The view at the back by the gardens is breathtaking. My son spend an hour in the gardens taking pictures of iguanas and colorful lizards. It is worth visiting.

title: Nice place for walking your pets
review: My hotel has access to the boardwalk with beach umbrellas/chairs for a fee so that was pretty awesome.  The time I visited there was an ongoing construction of what looks like extending the boardwalk

title: Spectacular
review: My hotel in South Beach offered bikes so after 20 years I took a chance at biking again. We biked all along the trails which lead to the board walk in one direction and a pier in the other. I was stunned by the pristine, manicured trails and boardwalk. We went each morning after that which was like a vacation of it’s own.

title: Goes for miles
review: You can walk for miles, with the golden beach only yards away, just the other side of the trees, with lots of gaps with steps to get onto the beech, which goes for miles and miles

title: not quite as charming as it used to be.
review: than it used to be

title: The best part of Miami for a visitor
review: To walk along 2nd Avenue looking at the omnipresent art work, or perhaps stopping at Dr Smood for tasty healthy food and satisfying coffee, then at Zak the Baker if you are not in a big hurry, or Miam if you are, then back to walking the streets

title: Lovely place with gorgeous street art
review: Lovely place with Gorgeous street art. would recommend to have a tour there. you won't regret !!  stay in places where there are people. its safer.

title: Too busy
review: It’s really hard to enjoy this spot because of the crowds . Lots of modern , pop art styles I guess . The streets around are all painted similarly. Maybe if it wasn’t so crowded I would have enjoyed it more. Still worth going to ..

title: RatFink comes back!
review: Awesome everywhere! This is just one example of art-in-perpetual-motion everywhere in Wynwood. Its a visual feast!

title: South Beach -must stay area
review: A vast range of hotels restaurants and cafes. South Beach has a free Trolley ( bus ) service that covers the whole of the South Beach area . If travelling in from Miami international Airport, use the. Mega 150 bus from Airport to South Beach ,express service costing 2 .25 dollars .service every 20 minutes

title: fantastic
review: for all miami visitors a must. great food, art deco architecture, partying, beach, colourful, mutli-culti - a must.

title: Beautiful area.
review: This truly is a beautiful area with fantastic buildings alongside a lovely beach, all very safe feeling and relaxing. However the prices in all the bars and restaurants are extortionate and can’t be justified no matter how nice it is. Great place to walk though .

title: ocean drive
review: It's worth knowing the night.  Full of lights and songs.  Different types of restaurant.  But the smell of marijuana is very strong. But it was worth it anyway.

title: Breathtaking views and amazing history.
review: Vizcaya is just beautiful. The architecture, history and views are amazing. The self guided tour is a perfect way to make your way through the splendor. It’s a must see and worth the drive even if you don’t live close. Romantic and picturesque. I can’t say enough about the magnificent charm. Don’t miss this.

title: Beautiful garden
review: We visited the garder during 3 hours and it’s very very a real time to enjoy the scenery and watch the wildlife. We love gardens with fountain, symmetric lawn and more ! We recommend this tour !

title: Vizcaya Museum
review: If you want to see some true Miami landscape this is the place to go. It has beautiful architecture and landscaping. The inside and outside of the house is just beautiful. Has a great view of the city and some friendly lizards that roam the grounds.

title: Beautiful house and gardens
review: This a beautiful place to go. Architecture is beautiful. Great view of Biscayne Bay. The gardens are beautiful as well. If your active military or veteran you can get free admission.

title: Amazing Venue
review: Walk around the gardens and walk inside the building for the museum part.

title: Great street to walk!
review: Ocean Drive is a very safe street to walk in the day & night with many hotels and restaurants. Very lively at night with lots of people.

title: Collins avenue
review: Very beautiful avenue worth knowing.  With many stores.  Very close to the beach.Bad parking but you can walk in some places.

title: Excellent
review: Lovely area especially seeing the yachts berthed. Lots of shops and eating places which would satisfy any taste.

title: Vacation getaway
review: Shopping, restaurants, people, clubs, energy, and fun. Collins Avenue has lot to see and do in the morning and evening hours. There are many places to eat, and shop for  beach clothing, and souvenirs, or you can just people watch. There are many hotels up and down the avenue. It is must see street if you are in the area.

title: One block off ocean drive
review: Excellent lower prices properties and short walk to free trolleys on washington and one block from ocean. Lots of Art Deco hotels on this street.  Lots of good people watching.  Sad to see so many homeless however.  Never felt unsafe.

title: I love publix
review: The publix on Collins ave is my favorite they are very clean organized staff is super helpful the cake is the best I absolutely love Publix cake Publix has everything your looking for from fresh produce to hot coffee they also sell wine

title: Relaxing Under The Shade
review: Lummus Park Beach is a place to relax from the hot sun and there is a cool breeze that comes from the palm trees. The park is maintained by groundskeepers who make sure the park is well manicured and that water sprinklers keep the grass green. There is always a chance to get a spray from the water sprinklers which is a relief from the humid air.

title: 14th street
review: Yesterday me and my friends went to the beach and Jordan Gave Us Amazing Service For The Boucher Brothers. We first sat down thinking the chairs were free at first, until the gentlemen came by and explain what was to be offered. We settled for two chairs and an umbrella. Jordan kept coming back to check on us. 5 star service!

title: Review of both park and beach
review: So, if you want to visit a famous and great natural beach each winter, South Beach between 16th Street and about 5th street is NOT the place you want to go..

title: great
review: wonderful parksite just along the beach & connecting to the ocean drive with lots of restaurants, bars, hotels, great architecture, partying etc. also the park is great for relaxing.

title: Great Beach!
review: Has long cement boardwalk for biking, running, or strolling.  Newly redone Fitness Center at 9th Street with outdoor equipment including free weights.  Volleyball courts also are great fun.
